23/10/2021.description: Marcus Stoinis believes every member of Australia's squad will likely play at some stage of the T20 World Cup, after Ashton Agar's shock axing for their tournament-opening win over South Africa.
23/10/2021.author: Penny Travers

23/10/2021.headline: Woman dead and man seriously injured in crash between truck and sedan near Maningrida
23/10/2021.description: NT Police say officers responded to the crash Saturday morning about 16 kilometres outside the remote Top End community.
23/10/2021.author: Penny Travers

24/10/2021.headline: Wound 'infested with maggots', harassment and choking death at Darwin aged care home detailed in new report
24/10/2021.description: Instances of suffering, harassment and staffing shortages at Darwin's NT Regis Tiwi aged care home are detailed in a new report. Prior to the report's release, the NT government said it would send additional elderly patients there to free up beds at the Royal Darwin Hospital.
24/10/2021.author: Housnia Shams

24/10/2021.headline: Picasso artworks fetch more than $134 million at Las Vegas auction
24/10/2021.description: Eleven Picasso artworks that helped turn Las Vegas into an unlikely destination for art have been sold at an auction for more than $134 million.
24/10/2021.author: Housnia Shams

24/10/2021.headline: WA Police reveal search for passenger vehicle seen in Blowholes area where Cleo Smith disappeared
24/10/2021.description: WA police reveal they are searching for a passenger vehicle seen in the Blowholes area when four-year-old Cleo Smith disappeared just over a week ago.
24/10/2021.author: Briana Shepherd and Nicolas Perpitch

24/10/2021.headline: Atlanta Braves reach first World Series in 22 years
24/10/2021.description: The Braves advance to a World Series match-up against the Houston Astros after beating the Los Angeles Dodgers in the National League Championship.
24/10/2021.author: Briana Shepherd and Nicolas Perpitch

24/10/2021.headline: Nationals provide in-principle support for net zero 2050 target
24/10/2021.description: Barnaby Joyce confirms the majority of Nationals members have given in-principle support to back a target of net zero emissions by 2050, ending a years-long standoff within the Coalition on climate change policy.
24/10/2021.author: Stephanie Borys

24/10/2021.headline: Year 12 exam result 'integrity' in doubt, SA union claims
24/10/2021.description: Days after the start of school exams in South Australia, doubts have been raised about the reliability of Year 12 results amid upheaval within the state's education assessment agency — but the SACE Board hit back, saying the claims are nothing more than "scaremongering".
24/10/2021.author: Stephanie Borys

24/10/2021.headline: Coffs Harbour battered again as hail slams parts of regional NSW
24/10/2021.description: The SES is busy today responding to up to 500 calls for assistance after hail left a "massive mess" in parts of the state.
24/10/2021.author: Luisa Rubbo and Nick McLaren

24/10/2021.headline: All of Victoria will be on the same COVID restrictions from Friday. Here's what that means for you
24/10/2021.description: Victoria will reach its 80 per cent double dose vaccination milestone almost a week ahead of schedule, granting residents more freedoms, the government announces.
24/10/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

24/10/2021.headline: Italian right-wing leader ridicules calling of actor Richard Gere in migrant ship trial
24/10/2021.description: The leader of Italy's right-wing League Party says a trial in which he is facing kidnapping charges for refusing to let a migrant ship dock in the country is not to be taken seriously after US actor Richard Gere is admitted to testify.
24/10/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

24/10/2021.headline: Darcie Brown hat-trick not enough for Strikers against Heat in WBBL
24/10/2021.description: Not even a rare WBBL hat-trick from Darcie Brown can see the Adelaide Strikers over the line against the Brisbane Heat, who move to the top of the table.
24/10/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

24/10/2021.headline: Colombia's most wanted drug lord captured in jungle raid
24/10/2021.description: Colombia's president says the capture of Dairo Antonio Úsuga is "the biggest blow against drug trafficking in our country this century".
24/10/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

24/10/2021.headline: 'Mackenzie's gift': IVF testing for genetic disorders added to Medicare
24/10/2021.description: From next month, Australians going through IVF will be able to claim a Medicare rebate for pre-implantation genetic testing to help prevent passing serious genetic disorders onto their child.
24/10/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

24/10/2021.headline: NSW launches campaign to lure tourists back with less focus on iconic landmarks
24/10/2021.description: As NSW prepares to open to the rest of the world next month, a multi-million-dollar tourism campaign is launched that focuses less on the iconic landmarks and more on natural experiences.
24/10/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

24/10/2021.headline: Man charged over fatal moped crash that killed two men
24/10/2021.description: A Queensland man is charged with callous disregard of an injured person as part of an investigation into a fatal moped traffic crash in Brisbane that killed two men.
24/10/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

24/10/2021.headline: Experts say it's time Victoria started talking about using recycled water for drinking
24/10/2021.description: An increasingly dry climate poses a challenge for the long-term water supplies of cities and towns, and some experts believe the solution is literally flowing out to sea.
24/10/2021.author: Christopher Testa

24/10/2021.headline: Australian discus great Dani Stevens calls time on decorated career
24/10/2021.description: Twelve years after becoming the youngest-ever discus world champion, Dani Stevens brings her long and decorated athletics career to an end.
24/10/2021.author: Christopher Testa

24/10/2021.headline: 'Stabilise the country': Collapse imminent for Taliban-led Afghanistan, warn observing nations
24/10/2021.description: Afghanistan is likely to collapse "faster than we thought" without the support of the international community, Sweden and Pakistan leaders say.
24/10/2021.author: Christopher Testa

24/10/2021.headline: 'Locked Down Trivia' helps lift spirits while raising funds
24/10/2021.description: Locked Down Trivia involved households across the world and raised more than $285,000 for charity. The final session played out during Melbourne's last night of lockdown.
24/10/2021.author: Madi Chwasta

24/10/2021.headline: Teens arrested over Uber driver assault, pedestrian injured by burnout
24/10/2021.description: During a busy night on the roads for SA Police, five teens were charged with aggravated assault, a woman was hospitalised after being hit by a car doing a burnout, and a man was allegedly detected speeding while more than three times the legal alcohol limit.
24/10/2021.author: Madi Chwasta

24/10/2021.headline: Queensland records zero COVID-19 cases as pop-up vaccine clinics set to open at theme parks, surf clubs
24/10/2021.description: As Queensland hits a new vaccine milestone, authorities announce pop-up vaccine clinics will open at major theme parks and surf life saving clubs over the upcoming long weekend.
24/10/2021.author: Ashleigh Stevenson

24/10/2021.headline: ACT records nine new cases of COVID-19 as the territory leads the way on vaccinations
24/10/2021.description: The ACT records nine new locally acquired cases of COVID-19, as the territory becomes Australia's most vaccinated jurisdiction, moving ahead of NSW.
24/10/2021.author: Penny Travers

24/10/2021.headline: How a songwriting legend helped Terry and others in his bushfire-scarred community heal
24/10/2021.description: A songwriting workshop with Australian music icon John Schumann became the conduit for connection and healing for members of a community scarred by the Long Gully Road fire in 2019.
24/10/2021.author: Leah White

24/10/2021.headline: Children's Hospital among new tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites in Victoria
24/10/2021.description: A waiting room at the Royal Children's Hospital in Parkville is among the new COVID-19 exposure sites listed by Victoria's health department.
24/10/2021.author: Leah White

24/10/2021.headline: 'Sigh of relief': Victorians excited for 'COVID normal' as state plans its reopen
24/10/2021.description: As the Victorian Government fast tracks its roadmap out of lockdown because of high vaccination rates, health experts urge caution and warn freedoms may be rolled back.
24/10/2021.author: Leah White

24/10/2021.headline: Thousands of electric cars and home batteries are being recalled in Australia. This is what's happening to the waste
24/10/2021.description: Australians may have only just started buying electric cars and household batteries – but several product recalls are showing that a national plan for dealing with renewable energy waste may already be needed.
24/10/2021.author: Emilia Terzon

24/10/2021.headline: Nationals keen to be seen on camera but refusing to speak about net zero deal with PM
24/10/2021.description: The Nationals are either walking towards a compromise on net zero or away from what they've been saying in recent months. They're just in no rush to say which it is, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.
24/10/2021.author: Brett Worthington

24/10/2021.headline: Why it's 'happy days' for Australian Story's most popular couple of all time
24/10/2021.description: Over 25 years, Australian Story has told a thousand stories, but there is one that audiences always rate as their favourite. Why did a "normal couple" from the bush capture the public's imagination?
24/10/2021.author: Susan Chenery, Kirstin Murray, and Caitlin Shea

24/10/2021.headline: 'Horrified': Cosmetic surgery patients describe their experiences at Australia's most popular clinic
24/10/2021.description: Patients of one of the country’s most popular network of cosmetic surgery clinics say they were left scarred, and had years of their lives "ruined".
24/10/2021.author: Lauren Day

24/10/2021.headline: Salah scores hat-trick as Liverpool smash Manchester United 5-0
24/10/2021.description: Mohamed Salah hits a hat-trick as Liverpool defeat Manchester United 5-0, romping to a stunning victory at Old Trafford in the Premier League and leaving Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's future in serious doubt.
24/10/2021.author: Lauren Day

24/10/2021.headline: Nurse captures 'confronting' scenes treating some of Melbourne's sickest COVID-19 patients
24/10/2021.description: Alfred Hospital nurse Emma Hall keeps a video diary to show the exhausting, relentless work caring for COVID-19 patients in one of Melbourne's busiest public hospitals.
24/10/2021.author: Jessica Longbottom

24/10/2021.headline: These households are ditching gas, slashing bills and going 'net zero'. Here's how
24/10/2021.description: In the short space of one year, Annabelle and Alex have slashed the money they spend on electricity, gas and petrol to zero. Here's how they did it.
24/10/2021.author: James Purtill

24/10/2021.headline: Fabio Quartararo wins MotoGP world championship after rival crashes at Emilia Romagna Grand Prix
24/10/2021.description: Fabio Quartararo is the first Frenchman to win the MotoGP world championship, after rival Francesco Bagnaia crashed out of the lead.
24/10/2021.author: Michael Doyle

24/10/2021.headline: Former COVID-19 advisor Neville Power charged with breaching WA's coronavirus restrictions
24/10/2021.description: Police allege the former head of the National COVID-19 Commission Advisory Board, and a 36-year-old man, failed to complete G2G passes before flying into WA on October 9.
24/10/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

24/10/2021.headline: Are real guns necessary as props? Film industry mulls question after death on set of Alec Baldwin film
24/10/2021.description: Crew members on set had raised concerns about the safety conditions earlier this month. Members of the film industry are now rethinking safety standards in light of the shooting.
24/10/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

24/10/2021.headline: Self-driving race cars reach blistering speed at inaugural race
24/10/2021.description: A team of computer programmers and engineers from a German university are crowned the inaugural champions of self-driving cars around one of the world's most famous racetracks.
24/10/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

24/10/2021.headline: Jin Young Ko set to become world number one again following Ladies Championship win
24/10/2021.description: Ko is projected to return to the top ranking in women's golf after beating fellow South Korean Hee Jeong Lim in a playoff, while Australia's  Minjee Lee finishes tied for 12th place.
24/10/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

24/10/2021.headline: WA Premier Mark McGowan unveils plan for vaccination clinics at Bunnings stores
24/10/2021.description: West Australians will soon be able to receive COVID-19 vaccinations at some Bunnings stores, as the WA government sets up pop-up clinics across the state.
24/10/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

25/10/2021.headline: COVID breacher attended AFL grand final to support 'close footballer friend', court told
25/10/2021.description: A Melbourne man who breached COVID travel rules to get into the AFL grand final remains behind bars after claiming he attended the game to support a 'close friend', who was one of the players.
25/10/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

25/10/2021.headline: Tasmanian salmon company set for Brazilian ownership
25/10/2021.description: Salmon giant Huon Aquaculture appears almost certain to become foreign controlled, after Australia's Foreign Investment Review Board green-lit a takeover plan from Brazilian meat-processor JBS.
25/10/2021.author: Alexandra Humphries

25/10/2021.headline: Hold on — our new rodeo queen wants to empower rural women
25/10/2021.description: Australia's latest rodeo queen is using her platform to inspire other women, mothers, and young families to get involved in the sport and community of rodeo.
25/10/2021.author: Keely Johnson

25/10/2021.headline: Barossa Fine Foods recalls ham products sold across Australia due to listeria contamination
25/10/2021.description: The prominent South Australian food producer is forced to recall two more of its products because of a second bacteria contamination scare in less than three weeks.
25/10/2021.author: Keely Johnson

25/10/2021.headline: Radar detection useless against small rock falls, mine death inquest told
25/10/2021.description: An inquest into the death of a former British Royal Marine, who was killed at a Tasmanian mine, is told radar meant to warn of rock falls could only pick up objects weighing 250 tonnes or more.
25/10/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

25/10/2021.headline: Split opinions over green credentials of Woodside's new Kwinana hydrogen hub
25/10/2021.description: Gas giant Woodside says a $1 billion hydrogen and ammonia plant will set WA up as a global clean energy powerhouse, as the Conservation Council of WA questions the project's green credentials.
25/10/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

25/10/2021.headline: 'I'm very proud of them all': Jockeys make history with all-female wins
25/10/2021.description: Five female jockeys have made history by winning all seven races on the card at a single meet in Toowoomba.
25/10/2021.author: Lucy Robinson and Belinda Sanders

25/10/2021.headline: NZ reports second-highest daily COVID-19 cases in pandemic
25/10/2021.description: Once the poster child for stamping out COVID-19, New Zealand has been unable to beat a Delta outbreak centred on Auckland.
25/10/2021.author: Lucy Robinson and Belinda Sanders

25/10/2021.headline: 'Victoria is back and open for business': Melbourne Cup Carnival marks return of major events, says Racing Minister
25/10/2021.description: Crowds are returning to racing earlier than expected, with confirmation at the Melbourne Cup Carnival launch that 5,500 people will be able to be at Flemington Racecourse for Derby Day this weekend.
25/10/2021.author: Leanne Wong

25/10/2021.headline: Expert says Alec Baldwin should 'never' have been handed loaded gun that killed Halyna Hutchins
25/10/2021.description: A Hollywood weapons expert and others in the film industry are raising questions about the events leading up to the death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on a film set last week, as court documents reveal more details about the accident.
25/10/2021.author: Leanne Wong

25/10/2021.headline: Canberra bikie convicted over fiery shoot-out has jail sentence reduced again
25/10/2021.description: Canberra man Axel Sidaros could be out of jail by mid-2022 after a further charge against him was dropped today.
25/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

25/10/2021.headline: Facebook dragging its feet on hate speech and misinformation in India, say leaked internal documents
25/10/2021.description: While Facebook acknowledged India as one of the most "at-risk" countries for hate speech and violence, internal records show there were not enough local language moderators in place to review content.
25/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

25/10/2021.headline: NRL investigate Tedesco over alleged racial slur
25/10/2021.description: Sydney Roosters and NSW State of Origin captain James Tedesco is being investigated by the NRL after a complaint was made over an alleged slur.
25/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

25/10/2021.headline: A mother's nightmare — not knowing why your child is suffering
25/10/2021.description: At the beginning of the year, three-year-old Everly started having unexplained seizures, and now her 18-month-old brother is too. Their mother is still waiting for a diagnosis.
25/10/2021.author: Emma Pedler and Georgia Roberts

25/10/2021.headline: Beachside boom to push housing costs higher than Brisbane
25/10/2021.description: Lockdown-fatigued buyers wanting to escape the city are pushing up house prices on the Sunshine and Gold coasts, now forecast to overtake Brisbane prices within three years.
25/10/2021.author: Owen Jacques and Amy Sheehan

25/10/2021.headline: 'Where are you baby?': Mum's heartbreaking plea for Cleo's safe return 10 days after disappearance
25/10/2021.description: The mother of missing WA girl Cleo Smith makes an emotional plea for her safe return as police issue another call-out for people who camped at the Blowholes site on the night of her disappearance to come forward.
25/10/2021.author: Evelyn Manfield

25/10/2021.headline: 'This violence was extreme': Man who used rare defence in wife's killing jailed for 16 years
25/10/2021.description: A Queensland man who was originally handed a life sentence for repeatedly stabbing his wife before bashing her in the head with a concrete bollard is sentenced to 16 years for her manslaughter.
25/10/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

25/10/2021.headline: 'Certain ambition and seriousness' on display as hirsute Germans flock to 'Beard Olympics'
25/10/2021.description: An expert panel of judges in the German town of Eging am See combs through 100 finely sculpted beards and moustaches in a bid to crown their 2021 'Beard Olympics' champion.
25/10/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

25/10/2021.headline: Berejiklian's secret boyfriend a 'pain in the arse', Barilaro tells corruption watchdog
25/10/2021.description: Former NSW deputy premier John Barilaro describes ex-Wagga Wagga MP Daryl Maguire as being like a "dog with a bone"' in pursuit of local projects like the grant proposal for a shooting club, ICAC hears.
25/10/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

25/10/2021.headline: Fashion's kaleidoscope celebrated in colourful and unique catwalk show
25/10/2021.description: A groundbreaking Perth fashion show highlights the rich diversity of talent among designers from a variety of backgrounds in an industry where people of colour have often been overlooked.
25/10/2021.author: Herlyn Kaur

25/10/2021.headline: Queensland contact tracers have identified new COVID-19 exposure sites. See the list
25/10/2021.description: New venues are added to the list of COVID-19 exposure sites by Queensland Health contract tracers, including locations where members of the public are deemed to be close contacts in Brisbane's south.
25/10/2021.author: Herlyn Kaur

25/10/2021.headline: Social media companies could soon be forced to ask for parents' permission before accessing children's data
25/10/2021.description: Laws that could change the way social media companies handle young people's data could be introduced as early as next year, according to the federal government.
25/10/2021.author: Katherine Gregory and Claudia Long

25/10/2021.headline: COVID spike could 'overwhelm' crucial ICU, doctor warns
25/10/2021.description: A specialist says a major Northern Rivers hospital's ICU is operating at "100 per cent capacity all the time". With others tipping COVID cases in the region to run into "at least" the hundreds during summer, she fears the worst.
25/10/2021.author: Bronwyn Herbert and Joanne Shoebridge

25/10/2021.headline: Telstra secures deal to buy largest telecommunications company in the Pacific with Canberra's support
25/10/2021.description: The $2.1 billion deal to acquire and run Digicel Pacific will be largely funded by the Australian government, in a move widely seen as an attempt to counter China's influence in the region.
25/10/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic, Annika Burgess, and Marian Faa

25/10/2021.headline: 'I don't hold Alec Baldwin responsible': Father of cinematographer accidentally killed on set defends actor
25/10/2021.description: Actor Alec Baldwin consoles the husband and son of slain cinematographer Halyna Hutchins, as more reports of troubling on-set practices emerge and investigators focus attention on the film's armourer and assistant director.
25/10/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic, Annika Burgess, and Marian Faa

25/10/2021.headline: Nothing like a roadmap deadline to lift Queensland's COVID-10 vaccinations
25/10/2021.description: It has been just over a week since Queensland's roadmap out of COVID-19 restrictions and border closures was announced and, with the inevitable influx of positive cases, the race to get vaccinated is stepping up.
25/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Cramsie

25/10/2021.headline: Renewables rollout bolstered by system 'shock absorbers' in South Australia
25/10/2021.description: Five years on from South Australia's statewide blackout, technology to further stabilise the energy grid has been successfully installed at two sites in the state's north.
25/10/2021.author: Daniel Keane

25/10/2021.headline: Not enough Indigenous Queenslanders are fully vaccinated, but there is hope
25/10/2021.description: With fewer than half of all Indigenous people in regional areas fully vaccinated, Queensland health officials are rushing to protect lives before the border reopens.
25/10/2021.author: Owen Jacques and Annie Gaffney

25/10/2021.headline: Murder of man that led to decriminalisation of homosexuality to be told in debut Adelaide Festival show
25/10/2021.description: The murder of lecturer George Duncan in 1972 prompted the decriminalisation of homosexuality in South Australia — and later across the country. A debut show, Watershed, at the 2022 Adelaide Festival will tell his story.
25/10/2021.author: Owen Jacques and Annie Gaffney

25/10/2021.headline: Malignant is unhinged, nasty and a little bit stupid – just as a great, camp horror film should be
25/10/2021.description: The latest film from Australian director James Wan (The Conjuring, Aquaman, Saw) will gross you out and make you laugh.
25/10/2021.author: Luke Goodsell

25/10/2021.headline: Walking is about more than getting fit. It helped me process my grief and reach a state of flow
25/10/2021.description: When I headed off on a five-month walk through the Himalayas, I didn't know how the experience would impact me. I learnt that walking literally changes the mind
25/10/2021.author: Luke Goodsell

25/10/2021.headline: Extraterrestrial life? No, say researchers, who find 'weird' radio signal comes from human technology
25/10/2021.description: At the end of last year, the internet was buzzing with leaked reports that a team of astronomers hunting for signs of extraterrestrial life had detected a strange signal. Now the verdict is in.
25/10/2021.author: Genelle Weule

25/10/2021.headline: Heath authorities list new tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites in Victoria
25/10/2021.description: New tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites have been listed in Benalla, Wodonga, Yackandandah, Wangaratta, Mildura, and Shepparton.
25/10/2021.author: Genelle Weule

25/10/2021.headline: Answers desperately needed over how predators were able to roam free
25/10/2021.description: Today marks the first day of an attempt to find answers as to how a well-liked nurse who worked in a children's hospital ward — and others like him — were able to prey on young victims for so long in Tasmania, writes Emily Baker.
25/10/2021.author: Emily Baker

25/10/2021.headline: Here's what we know (and don't) about the Nationals net zero deal
25/10/2021.description: The deal between the Nationals and the Liberals to secure a net zero emissions by 2050 target is mostly under wraps, but this is what we know about it so far and when we'll know more.
25/10/2021.author: Emily Baker

25/10/2021.headline: American-dominated panel advising government on submarines as Defence eyes options for future nuclear fleet
25/10/2021.description: Three senior American shipbuilding executives are being paid to advise Australia on submarines, but the defence department is so far refusing to say what their work involves or how much they’re costing.
25/10/2021.author: Andrew Greene

25/10/2021.headline: Marcus Bontempelli and the Bulldogs grand final loss: 'We can't carry the burden'
25/10/2021.description: Marcus Bontempelli is keen to put the Western Bulldogs' grand final loss in the rear view mirror and while he waits for a chance for his team's next AFL campaign, he's added another string to his bow — children's author.
25/10/2021.author: David Mark

25/10/2021.headline: Victim of serial killer John Wayne Gacy identified 40 years after his death
25/10/2021.description: Authorities in the United States identify the remains one of the victims of serial killer John Wayne Gacy, more than 40 years after he was killed.
25/10/2021.author: David Mark

25/10/2021.headline: The international education crisis will linger long after students return to Australia. Here's why
25/10/2021.description: More than 145,000 international student visa holders are stuck overseas and it is still unclear when and how these students may be able to enter Australia. But even when they do return disruptions to the flow of new students over the past two years will have a long-term impact.
25/10/2021.author: David Mark

25/10/2021.headline: How your beer could lower methane emissions, slow global warming
25/10/2021.description: Young Henrys craft brewery, nestled in the heart of the hip suburb of Newtown, have teamed up with scientists to investigate if micro-algae can be used reduce methane emissions from cattle.
25/10/2021.author: Harriet Tatham

25/10/2021.headline: 'The accessible parking spot was blocked by dumpster bins': The reality of parking when you have a disability
25/10/2021.description: Easy access to parking is desirable in most cases for people wanting to use daily services such as doctors or grocers. For those living with disability however, easy access to accessible parking is not only desirable but essential.
25/10/2021.author: Emma Myers

25/10/2021.headline: Women 'disappearing' from Afghan media as journalists face Taliban threats and beatings
25/10/2021.description: The Taliban promised the Afghan people a "free and independent" media, but the country's once flourishing media sector is now "dying" and women are paying the highest price.
25/10/2021.author: Tracey Shelton

25/10/2021.headline: How quarantines, lockdowns and dissent link Australians in pandemics more than 100 years apart
25/10/2021.description: Australia knew about the threat of the deadly Spanish flu months before it arrived. Much of what happened then, from quarantine policies, federal edicts and state-based border controls, are mirrored in the nation's response to the coronavirus pandemic.
25/10/2021.author: Steve Vivian

25/10/2021.headline: Houston police find malnourished children and skeletal remains in apartment
25/10/2021.description: The skeletal remains of a child, and three surviving siblings who appear to have been abandoned, are found inside an apartment in the Houston area in the United States.
25/10/2021.author: Steve Vivian

25/10/2021.headline: 'We are way off track': Greenhouse gas concentrations hit record high in 2020
25/10/2021.description: A report by the United Nations World Meteorological Organization showed carbon dioxide levels surged in 2020, despite a temporary dip in emissions during COVID-19 lockdowns.
25/10/2021.author: Steve Vivian

25/10/2021.headline: Annabel is deaf. But there are no Auslan interpreters in the NT to assist her
25/10/2021.description: For Darwin local Annabel Bishop, trying to access an Auslan interpreter to assist her with everyday tasks has been frustrating.
25/10/2021.author: Housnia Shams

25/10/2021.headline: Victorian Premier to get 'huge sweep of power' to declare lockdowns under new bill
25/10/2021.description: The Victorian Premier will be given the authority to declare pandemics and have public health orders enforced for three months at a time, under proposed new laws.
25/10/2021.author: Bridget Rollason

25/10/2021.headline: Xi Jinping says China will uphold world peace and international law
25/10/2021.description: China's President is calling for member states of the United Nations to work together to solve international issues.
25/10/2021.author: Bridget Rollason

25/10/2021.headline: Video shows doctors laughing, dancing to 'Jolene' while performing liposuction on unconscious patient
25/10/2021.description: Videos and photos uncovered in an investigation into one of Australia's leading cosmetic surgery clinics show practices that plastic surgeons have described as "dangerous" and "staggering".
25/10/2021.author: Lauren Day

25/10/2021.headline: Amnesty International closes Hong Kong offices citing national security law
25/10/2021.description: Amnesty International says a China-imposed national security law in Hong Kong makes it "effectively impossible" for rights groups to operate.
25/10/2021.author: Lauren Day

26/10/2021.headline: Victoria’s proposed pandemic laws are drawing strong reactions. Here’s what the changes will really mean
26/10/2021.description: Premier Daniel Andrews is defending the proposed pandemic laws, which have drawn the ire of some and been welcomed by others. So how will these proposed laws work? And why are some critics concerned?
26/10/2021.author: Elise Kinsella and Mary Gearin

26/10/2021.headline: Denis Pagan throws his hat into the ring for Melbourne Cup with Johnny Get Angry
26/10/2021.description: A suggestion by a champion jockey helps convince trainer Denis Pagan his Melbourne Cup dream isn't over with Johnny Get Angry.
26/10/2021.author: Tom Maddocks

26/10/2021.headline: Daughter-in-law found not guilty of murder after smart watch case retrial
26/10/2021.description: Adelaide woman Caroline Dela Rose Nilsson, who was accused of murdering her mother-in-law, is acquitted by a Supreme Court jury.
26/10/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

26/10/2021.headline: Reaching net zero carbon emissions to require Herculean effort
26/10/2021.description: Ordinary Australians and impatient business leaders years ago abandoned all hope of any kind of coherent energy and climate policy and went it alone. Now the government is stepping in with its plan to take us to net zero, writes Ian Verrender.
26/10/2021.author: Ian Verrender

26/10/2021.headline: Net zero by 2050? Here's what should be on the government's 'to do' list
26/10/2021.description: Electricity should be a main focus, but big improvements are also needed in transport, industry, agriculture and buildings.
26/10/2021.author: Ian Verrender

26/10/2021.headline: Greens fire up over rocket-launch complex 'bang in the middle' of sensitive site
26/10/2021.description: Senator Sarah Hanson-Young grills SA government officials in a Senate estimates hearing over the location of Southern Launch's controversial blast-off development.
26/10/2021.author: Emma Pedler and Evelyn Leckie

26/10/2021.headline: Japanese Princess Mako marries boyfriend Kei Komuro and renounces her royal status
26/10/2021.description: Princess Mako marries commoner Kei Komuro without a wedding ceremony following a financial dispute that attracted negative media attention.
26/10/2021.author: Emma Pedler and Evelyn Leckie

26/10/2021.headline: Victoria Police to pay quadriplegic man more than $11 million following alleged use of excessive force
26/10/2021.description: Victoria Police will pay $11.75 million to a man left paralysed after police officers allegedly used excessive force while responding to a noise complaint.
26/10/2021.author: Emma Pedler and Evelyn Leckie

26/10/2021.headline: Expect a plan for booster shots soon — here's what we know
26/10/2021.description: The federal government will soon make an announcement on COVID-19 vaccine booster shots, with authorities saying it's likely they'll be offered six months after someone has been double-dosed.
26/10/2021.author: Emma Pedler and Evelyn Leckie

26/10/2021.headline: 'Culture of cover-up': Sex abuse inquiry on a mission to expose predators
26/10/2021.description: The opening day of a new child sexual abuse inquiry is told there may have been an "active culture of cover-up or minimisation to protect reputations and institutional interests" in Tasmania.
26/10/2021.author: Loretta Lohberger

26/10/2021.headline: Aussie summer tennis calendar beginning to take shape
26/10/2021.description: As the vaccination debate rages on, those tennis stars who do travel for the Australian Open are set to be playing lead-up events around the country again.
26/10/2021.author: Loretta Lohberger

26/10/2021.headline: Have astronomers really just discovered an alien planet in another galaxy?
26/10/2021.description: Astronomers say they may have detected a potential planet outside of our galaxy — although no-one will really know for sure for at least another 70 years.
26/10/2021.author: Genelle Weule

26/10/2021.headline: Investigation finds US police officers use harsh tactics on children
26/10/2021.description: From putting handcuffs onto a boy aged eight to leaving a teenage girl frightened, stories from a US investigation find troubling methods used by police on children.
26/10/2021.author: Genelle Weule

26/10/2021.headline: 'Not looking good': Sudan coup leaves Sudanese Australians unable to contact relatives
26/10/2021.description: Telephone and internet blackouts in Sudan leave community members in Australia cut off from relatives, as Monday's coup is widely condemned by international leaders.
26/10/2021.author: Kristian Silva

26/10/2021.headline: Do pets need a COVID vaccine?
26/10/2021.description: Can I give my pet COVID? And do they need to be vaccinated against the virus? We find out how you can protect your pets from COVID-19.
26/10/2021.author: Matilda Marozzi

26/10/2021.headline: Sydney man allegedly cut tracking device off his ankle after being bailed over $270m cocaine plot
26/10/2021.description: NSW Police say they will move to seize the $4 million Sydney home that Mostafa Baluch put up as surety after the 33-year-old went missing days after being bailed over an alleged plot to import cocaine into the state.
26/10/2021.author: Tim Swanston

26/10/2021.headline: Tasmanian alleged COVID quarantine breacher charged
26/10/2021.description: A New South Wales man who caused a three-day snap lockdown in southern Tasmania has been charged over allegedly leaving hotel quarantine without permission as well as breaching a domestic violence order.
26/10/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

26/10/2021.headline: 'A bit of a scary time': South Australia plans to drop border restrictions on November 23
26/10/2021.description: South Australia's COVID-Ready roadmap will include a significant repeal of border restrictions for double-vaccinated people from November 23, while international travellers will have quarantine requirements halved.
26/10/2021.author: Daniel Keane and Jessica Haynes

26/10/2021.headline: What is the government's plan to reach net zero?
26/10/2021.description: The government has committed to reaching net zero by 2050, and says it is on track to beat its 2030 emissions targets. But what will it take to turn Australia green?
26/10/2021.author: Jake Evans

26/10/2021.headline: Massive NSW outback stations turned into national parks to save flora and fauna
26/10/2021.description: The 120,000-hectare Avenel Station north of Broken Hill is the latest in a series of acquisitions by the state government designed to reshape the state's far west.
26/10/2021.author: Bill Ormonde and Callum Marshall

26/10/2021.headline: Former head of Victoria Police's ethics unit used multiple aliases for 'offensive' trolling, IBAC reveals
26/10/2021.description: Victoria's anti-corruption watchdog finds Brett Guerin used pseudonyms to publish dozens of offensive comments on social media, as it urges Victoria Police to ensure its employees understand their duty to behave ethically on and off duty.
26/10/2021.author: Leanne Wong

26/10/2021.headline: Quarantine for domestic and international arrivals to NT could end in January
26/10/2021.description: Yesterday the NT government announced the introduction of a home quarantine program for hotspot arrivals into some parts of the NT by November 23. But that could be abolished for no quarantine at all by January 18.
26/10/2021.author: Steve Vivian

26/10/2021.headline: 'Inconvenient to remain unvaccinated': US reveals COVID-19 travel policy
26/10/2021.description: The US outlines its new international COVID-19 travel policy which — with a limited number of exemptions — make it mandatory for travellers entering the country to be vaccinated against the virus.
26/10/2021.author: Steve Vivian

26/10/2021.headline: In dispute with the ATO over a tax debt? The onus shouldn't be on you to prove it's wrong, federal inquiry finds
26/10/2021.description: A parliamentary inquiry suggests sweeping changes to the law to better protect vulnerable taxpayers, including reversing the onus of proof for cases of fraud and evasion.
26/10/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

26/10/2021.headline: Travel agents 'coming into their own' as Australia set to use $8b of pandemic travel credits
26/10/2021.description: As international borders slowly reopen, Australians are being urged to use a travel agent to rebook their cancelled holidays to ensure they don't lose out.
26/10/2021.author: Lucy Stone

26/10/2021.headline: Ben Stokes' return is a boost, but Australia is a grim destination for fast-bowling all-rounders
26/10/2021.description: Cricket lovers will be delighted with the Ashes comeback of England's Ben Stokes, but history shows that Australia is a tough battleground for Test all-rounders.
26/10/2021.author: Russell Jackson

26/10/2021.headline: Aboriginal AFL star pleads with First Nations people to get vaccinated
26/10/2021.description: Charlie Cameron returns home to north-west Queensland to help break down trust issues stopping some Indigenous people from getting the COVID-19 jab.
26/10/2021.author: Larissa Waterson and Andrew Saunders

26/10/2021.headline: Devastated fishers 'tearing their hair out' over seals as cull calls go national
26/10/2021.description: Pressure mounts on South Australia to consider a seal cull in the Coorong, where the livelihood of fishers has been devastated since the animals arrived in 2007.
26/10/2021.author: Larissa Waterson and Andrew Saunders

26/10/2021.headline: Scott Morrison’s net zero by 2050 plan leaves ‘plenty’ of space for ‘miracles’
26/10/2021.description: Australia has finally joined 130 countries committing to net zero by 2050, but some experts say our plan to get there looks murky, at best.
26/10/2021.author: Michael Slezak

26/10/2021.headline: PNG health services struggling to cope with Delta outbreak
26/10/2021.description: COVID-19 cases are surging across Papua New Guinea, prompting a renewed focus on increasing the country's vaccination rate, which is the lowest in the region.
26/10/2021.author: Natalie Whiting

26/10/2021.headline: After working on the COVID-19 front line, nurse Annie cries at night at prospect of leaving Australia
26/10/2021.description: Annie is one of 11,200 people who have signed a petition urging Australia to introduce a one-off migration policy for temporary visa holders who have helped the country through the pandemic.
26/10/2021.author: Bang Xiao

26/10/2021.headline: 'It fills both our hearts': Romaya, 8, makes it her business to cuddle your pets
26/10/2021.description: Romaya Gilbert had a "lot of love" left to give after the death of her rat, Nibbles. Now the young entrepreneur is making money by caring for other people's pets.
26/10/2021.author: Rick Eaves

26/10/2021.headline: 'You can't just have white bread all the time': OzAsia Festival director pushes for change
26/10/2021.description: Annette Shun Wah, the first Asian Australian to lead Adelaide's OzAsia Festival, has shaped her first program around works by Asian Australian artists, incubating the next generation of talent in the process.
26/10/2021.author: Hannah Story

26/10/2021.headline: Claims soldiers nearly drowned during army training exercise in Queensland pool
26/10/2021.description: A soldier was taken to hospital and others had to be rescued after sinking to the bottom of a pool in heavy gear, in what witnesses described as near-drownings.
26/10/2021.author: Andrew Greene

26/10/2021.headline: Patients return to elective surgery tables — many with conditions deteriorating during COVID lockdowns
26/10/2021.description: Tens of thousands of Australians are on a growing elective surgery waitlist. But as surgeries resume post-lockdown, there are fears the worst backlog hasn't even hit us yet.
26/10/2021.author: Alison Branley

26/10/2021.headline: Crown's conduct was 'illegal, dishonest, unethical and exploitative' but it's still allowed to run a casino
26/10/2021.description: Crown's Melbourne casino licence is effectively on a two-year probation, but the fallout from its wrongdoing could have been so much more severe if it didn't wield such a great deal of power.
26/10/2021.author: Daniel Ziffer

26/10/2021.headline: COVID-19 cases are falling across NSW but new infections emerging in Indigenous communities
26/10/2021.description: Around 30 to 40 cases in New South Wales are being recorded each day among Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, accounting for up to 10 per cent of new cases.
26/10/2021.author: Nakari Thorpe

26/10/2021.headline: Most common COVID-19 offences revealed — from not wearing a mask to leaving your LGA
26/10/2021.description: It's New South Wales's COVID-19 lockdown like you've never seen it before, a story not told by the number of cases, vaccines or venues of concern, but a new metric: fines.
26/10/2021.author: Catherine Hanrahan

26/10/2021.headline: Elgin didn't have permission to take the marbles, says Geoffrey Robertson. It's time to take them back
26/10/2021.description: Many have called for the Parthenon marbles to be returned to Athens. Marc Fennell meets the Greek-Australians pushing for their return, for the ABC RN podcast, Stuff the British Stole.
26/10/2021.author: Catherine Hanrahan

26/10/2021.headline: Forensic police return to Cleo Smith's family home in search for clues
26/10/2021.description: WA Police Minister Paul Papalia says every resource is being utilised in the search to find four-year-old Cleo Smith, who has been missing for 12 days.
26/10/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger and James Carmody

26/10/2021.headline: 'Net zero' is a political win, but it has entrenched a climate policy stalemate
26/10/2021.description: The Prime Minister stared down a multitude of requests for cash and concessions from the Nationals in return for support of a plan to turn the country carbon neutral by 2050. But he has also entrenched a stalemate on climate change.
26/10/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

26/10/2021.headline: The West is running out of magnesium – all because of China’s power crunch
26/10/2021.description: European industry groups fear that the remaining magnesium stocks will run out by the end of November as China's power crisis has affected the global supply.
26/10/2021.author: Samuel Yang

26/10/2021.headline: 'COVID has bought us three weeks': The grim reality of our global warming situation
26/10/2021.description: The world is on track to hit 2.7 degrees Celsius of warming by 2100 despite stronger emissions reduction target, says the United Nations on the eve of global climate talks.
26/10/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

26/10/2021.headline: Sudan's military leader says PM's arrest in coup is to avoid civil war
26/10/2021.description: Sudan's top general Abdel Fattah al-Burhan defends the army's seizure of power, saying he ousted the government of Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok to avoid civil war.
26/10/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

26/10/2021.headline: The Queen cancels plans to travel to Glasgow climate summit on doctors' advice
26/10/2021.description: The announcement comes after The Queen held virtual audiences at Windsor Castle, the first since revelations that her doctors ordered her to rest last week.
26/10/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

26/10/2021.headline: 'Maybe one day we’ll be under water': Pabai and Paul fear they'll be Australia's first climate refugees
26/10/2021.description: In a case never before seen in Australia, Paul Kabai and Pabai Pabai's legal team will argue the Federal Court should require Australia to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to a level that will prevent Torres Strait Islanders from harm.
26/10/2021.author: Bridget Brennan and Kirstie Wellauer

26/10/2021.headline: Proteas star Quinton de Kock refuses team directive to 'take the knee', withdraws from T20 World Cup match
26/10/2021.description: The South African Cricket Board instructed all players they must "take the knee" in a united stand against racism but one of their biggest stars refused and withdrew from their latest match over it.
26/10/2021.author: Michael Doyle

26/10/2021.headline: Australia urged to condemn Israeli designation of Palestinian organisations as 'terrorist' groups
26/10/2021.description: Six Palestinian civil rights groups were outlawed by Israel after it designated them "terrorist organisations". Human rights organisations and unions in Australia say the decision should be condemned.
26/10/2021.author: Nour Haydar

26/10/2021.headline: Singapore to reopen to Australia for travel from November 8
26/10/2021.description: Australians who return a negative COVID-19 test will be able to enter Singapore from November 8 and unvaccinated children aged under 12 years will also be allowed in.
26/10/2021.author: Nour Haydar

27/10/2021.headline: Daughter accused of smothering mother 'can't explain' location of phone
27/10/2021.description: A court hears a woman who has pleaded not guilty to murdering her mother two years ago deny withdrawing thousands of dollars from her mother's account after her death.
27/10/2021.author: Damian McIntyre

27/10/2021.headline: Meet Dennis Kunoth, Central Australian cattleman and Stolen Generations survivor
27/10/2021.description: As a child, Dennis Kunoth didn't think he would ever see the sun rise over his homelands again — but he's since returned to Alice Springs to fulfil his dream to one day run his own cattle on the country his ancestors called home.
27/10/2021.author: Hugo Rikard-Bell

27/10/2021.headline: Government concedes defence ship it promised to build will now be bought from overseas
27/10/2021.description: Defence admits it won't be building a ship promised to be constructed locally, as more details on Australia's nuclear submarine fleet are also revealed
27/10/2021.author: Andrew Greene

27/10/2021.headline: Million-dollar reward for Cleo Smith information attracts bounty hunters to remote campsite
27/10/2021.description: Police say a $1 million reward offered for information to find missing four-year-old Cleo Smith has led to a flurry of activity at the Blowholes campsite, including the arrival of bounty hunters.
27/10/2021.author: Andrea Mayes

27/10/2021.headline: Border closures leave 'gutted' Sixers star locked out of WBBL
27/10/2021.description: Cricket NSW vent their frustrations at state governments after border closures all but rule out former Australian allrounder Erin Burns from the Women's Big Bash League.
27/10/2021.author: Andrea Mayes

27/10/2021.headline: Where you can travel to soon without having to quarantine — if you're fully vaccinated
27/10/2021.description: Seven countries are welcoming fully vaccinated Australian travellers without any need to quarantine, and three more will soon join the list.
27/10/2021.author: Jane Norman

27/10/2021.headline: Atlanta's Charlie Morton throws 16 pitches on a broken leg in World Series opener
27/10/2021.description: Atlanta Braves pitcher Charlie Morton gets hit by a 164kph drive, then goes on to throw another 16 pitches before leaving Game One of the World Series against his former team Houston with a broken leg.
27/10/2021.author: Jane Norman

27/10/2021.headline: SA Premier says he hasn't read all of the COVID modelling, as Health Minister says he didn't understand it
27/10/2021.description: As South Australia prepares to lower the drawbridge to coronavirus cases from the eastern states, the Premier admits that not all of the modelling underpinning the state's COVID-19 roadmap has been "finalised".
27/10/2021.author: Daniel Keane

27/10/2021.headline: Where you can buy at-home COVID-19 tests from next week
27/10/2021.description: Some Australians will be able test themselves for COVID-19 at home from next week as rapid antigen tests are allowed onto store shelves. Here's what we know.
27/10/2021.author: Daniel Keane

27/10/2021.headline: Brazilian Senate approves call for President Jair Bolsonaro to be indicted over pandemic's handling
27/10/2021.description: Senate committee approves 1,300-page report calling for Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro to be indicted for nine crimes relating to his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic — including crimes against humanity — but it is unlikely he will face formal charges.
27/10/2021.author: Daniel Keane

27/10/2021.headline: May's Panthers career hangs in the balance after being issued with show-cause notice
27/10/2021.description: Tyrone May is set to face the Penrith board next week in a bid to save his Panthers career, following his conduct on social media in the wake of the club's NRL grand-final win.
27/10/2021.author: Daniel Keane

27/10/2021.headline: Nadia Mitsopoulos pays tribute to 'bear hugging friend to all' and 'outrageously talented' ABC colleague Russell Woolf
27/10/2021.description: ABC Radio Perth's Mornings presenter Nadia Mitsopoulos pays tribute to 'outrageously talented colleague and supremely loyal friend' Russell Woolf.
27/10/2021.author: Nadia Mitsopoulos

27/10/2021.headline: 'We will get him soon': Photos provide breakthrough in hunt for alleged Sydney drug smuggler
27/10/2021.description: NSW Police say photos of Mostafa Baluch apparently showing him hiding in the back of a black Range Rover with a Queensland licence plate have provided a "welcome breakthrough" in the hunt for the alleged drug smuggler.
27/10/2021.author: Mark Reddie

27/10/2021.headline: More changes to ACT COVID restrictions, including eased quarantine requirements for people who are fully vaccinated
27/10/2021.description: The ACT government announces further changes to COVID-19 restrictions which will come into effect in the coming days, including changes to quarantine requirements for vaccinated people, and restrictions for unvaccinated visitors entering the ACT.
27/10/2021.author: Kate Midena

27/10/2021.headline: Treasury officials had little input on the economic modelling behind the government's net zero by 2050 plan
27/10/2021.description: Treasury secretary Steven Kennedy says his department had very little input into the modelling underpinning the federal government's plan to achieve net zero emissions by 2050.
27/10/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

27/10/2021.headline: Ballarat hits vaccination milestone as it braces for tourist influx
27/10/2021.description: Most of the Ballarat and south-west region has passed the 80 per cent full vaccination target, days before regional Victoria and Melbourne become reunite.
27/10/2021.author: Matt Neal

27/10/2021.headline: Adelaide United midfielder Josh Cavallo publicly announces he's gay in emotional video
27/10/2021.description: Adelaide United's Josh Cavallo publicly announces he is gay, becoming the first footballer to open up about their sexuality while playing in the A-League Men competition.
27/10/2021.author: Matt Neal

27/10/2021.headline: Man charged over Bridgewater stabbing of woman, 18yo man and with breaching family violence orders
27/10/2021.description: A man who allegedly stabbed a 42-year-old woman and an 18-year-old man after entering a house north of Hobart yesterday breached a family violence order against him 18 times, police say.
27/10/2021.author: James Dunlevie

27/10/2021.headline: Legal action possible after fatal shooting on Baldwin set, lawyers say
27/10/2021.description: US lawyers say criminal charges cannot be ruled out as investigations into a fatal accidental shooting involving actor Alec Baldwin continue.
27/10/2021.author: James Dunlevie

27/10/2021.headline: Can you get a Pfizer vaccine after AstraZeneca? When can you get boosters? Your questions answered
27/10/2021.description: When can you get your booster shot, can you get Pfizer if you've already had AstraZeneca or Moderna, and will you need more boosters down the track? Here's what we know.
27/10/2021.author: Penny Timms and Lori Youmshajekian

27/10/2021.headline: Storm drenches Perth as October rainfall records tumble
27/10/2021.description: Perth records its wettest October in more than 50 years after heavy downfalls and hail bucket the south-west of the state.
27/10/2021.author: Tyne Logan

27/10/2021.headline: Missing COVID records causing delays with vaccine certificates
27/10/2021.description: As Victoria reopens and many venues and workplaces require proof of vaccination to operate in the new "vaccinated economy", some people are being locked out due to inaccurate immunisation records.
27/10/2021.author: Rhiannon Stevens

27/10/2021.headline: Halloween 'zombie' in NSW backyard taken down after multiple calls to police
27/10/2021.description: Renée Ryan says she "completely understands" that some people were "unintentionally triggered" by the decoration she made with her son. Warning: This story contains an image readers may find distressing.
27/10/2021.author: Arianna Levy

27/10/2021.headline: Homicide investigation launched after toddler's death deemed 'inconsistent with drowning'
27/10/2021.description: Queensland police say they are now treating the death of four-year-old Tarrin-Macen O’Sullivan, who was initially reported to have drowned, as suspicious.
27/10/2021.author: Angel Parsons

27/10/2021.headline: Hobart cracks million-dollar median house price barrier
27/10/2021.description: The median house price of Hobart's innermost suburbs has surpassed $1 million for the first time, with one real estate agent saying seven-figure price tags are on the way to "becoming the new normal" in Tasmania.
27/10/2021.author: Kate Ainsworth

27/10/2021.headline: Received a large electricity bill during Canberra's lockdown? It might not be due to the costs of working from home
27/10/2021.description: The ACT's lockdown led to an increase in the number of electricity usage estimations, but some Canberrans are reporting their initial invoices were significantly different to their actual energy usage.
27/10/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

27/10/2021.headline: Dozens of stolen cars unlawfully registered, sold for several years without police realising
27/10/2021.description: Compensation claims from unwitting buyers are expected over a situation Queensland police blame on "issues" involving the state's records and the National Vehicles of Interest register.
27/10/2021.author: Rory Callinan

27/10/2021.headline: In search of a home fit for Princess, a Surfers Paradise 'icon'
27/10/2021.description: Princess is a well-known homeless person who lives around the Gold Coast's famous Cavill Avenue. Now a Facebook campaign aims to find a secure home for the 61-year-old.
27/10/2021.author: Rory Callinan

27/10/2021.headline: Meet a family at the centre of the homelessness crisis in Queensland's fastest growing region
27/10/2021.description: One of Queensland's fastest growing council areas has just one person working with locals to combat a growing homelessness crisis that leaves thousands feeling hopeless and shut out.
27/10/2021.author: Baz Ruddick

27/10/2021.headline: Meat industry seeks booster shot priority for workers to keep supply chains running
27/10/2021.description: Meatworkers were eligible for their first dose under Phase 1B of the vaccine rollout, and the peak body wants them at the front of the queue for their third jab.
27/10/2021.author: Jane McNaughton

27/10/2021.headline: Halloween Kills, the latest in the Halloween franchise, nails the comedy rather than the scares
27/10/2021.description: Jamie Lee Curtis and director David Gordon Green re-team for sequel about mob violence.
27/10/2021.author: Luke Goodsell

27/10/2021.headline: Soils can't hold enough carbon to offset Australian emissions, experts say
27/10/2021.description: Australia's plan for net zero includes "dangerous" soil carbon assumptions, relies on farmers to "bail out the fossil fuel industry", and could be too expensive, experts say.
27/10/2021.author: Michael Condon and Joshua Becker

27/10/2021.headline: I don't want to believe: Defence declines to investigate UFO sightings
27/10/2021.description: The truth may be out there, but Australia's Department of Defence is not interested in following its US counterpart in trying to discover what's behind unexplained UFO sightings.
27/10/2021.author: Andrew Greene

27/10/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: Daryl Maguire fronts ICAC
27/10/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Disgraced ex-MP for Wagga Wagga Daryl Maguire will today front the corruption inquiry into whether Gladys Berejiklian breached public trust.
27/10/2021.author: Andrew Greene

27/10/2021.headline: 'I made the mistake of trusting my employer because the superannuation was on my pay slip'
27/10/2021.description: Thousands of employers are failing to pay their staff superannuation, and it's costing workers billions of dollars every year.
27/10/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

27/10/2021.headline: The tourist rush is coming — but is Tasmania ready for them?
27/10/2021.description: Bookings are going "ballistic" ahead of the reopening of Tasmania's borders, but as hospitality venues prepare for the influx it could be a case of "be careful what you wish for", with staff shortages causing problems.
27/10/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald and Fiona Blackwood

27/10/2021.headline: Confusion is rife over Victoria's vaccinated economy. Here are answers to some common questions
27/10/2021.description: If you've got some questions about what the next phase of Victoria's COVID-19 roadmap will look like, we've tried to simplify some of the issues sparking the most queries.
27/10/2021.author: Sian Johnson

27/10/2021.headline: Not so long ago the PM was skewering Labor's carbon credits for Kazakhstan. Now, he has a net zero 'plan'
27/10/2021.description: This week's long-anticipated net zero "plan" may be slender on new policy ideas, but still represents a significant departure from the Coalition's pre-election posture, writes David Speers.
27/10/2021.author: David Speers

27/10/2021.headline: How opening a window can stop COVID spreading in classrooms
27/10/2021.description: New South Wales students have gone back to school this week with the wind blowing through open classroom windows in a bid to contain the spread of COVID-19. And, these experts say that's a crucial step.
27/10/2021.author: David Speers

27/10/2021.headline: 'Our opinion was never considered at that table as a valued opinion': Wilcannia speaks out
27/10/2021.description: Leaked documents reveal a litany of failures in the system to protect Aboriginal communities, which left the remote town of Wilcannia exposed despite high-level warnings stretching back up to 18 months.
27/10/2021.author: Sean Rubinsztein-Dunlop, John Stewart, Tynan King, Clare Blumer, and Jack Fisher

27/10/2021.headline: Forensics officers return to remote Blowholes campsite in search for Cleo Smith
27/10/2021.description: WA Police forensics officers return to the remote Blowholes campsite where four-year-old Cleo Smith was last seen.
27/10/2021.author: David Weber

27/10/2021.headline: 'There was some complacency on this set': Police speak on fatal shooting on Alec Baldwin film Rust
27/10/2021.description: Santa Fe's sheriff casts further doubt on safety standards on the film set of Alec Baldwin film Rust as the District Attorney says it is too early to say if the actor will face any criminal charges.
27/10/2021.author: David Weber

27/10/2021.headline: England tune up for Australia by belting Bangladesh at Twenty20 World Cup
27/10/2021.description: England cruise to an emphatic Twenty20 World Cup victory over Bangladesh that serves as a warning shot to Australia.
27/10/2021.author: David Weber

27/10/2021.headline: US government lawyers say Assange could serve sentence in Australia if extradited
27/10/2021.description: Lawyers for the United States say any sentence imposed on WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange could be served in an Australian prison if he is extradited to the US to face charges.
27/10/2021.author: Jack Hawke

27/10/2021.headline: Fair Work Commission deputy president who likened vaccine mandates to 'medical apartheid' on restricted duties
27/10/2021.description: Lyndall Dean will be excluded from full bench work until she completes training after likening vaccine mandates to "medical apartheid".
27/10/2021.author: Nour Haydar

27/10/2021.headline: Taiwan has no right to join the United Nations, China says
27/10/2021.description: China says Taiwan has no right to join the United Nations, after calls from the United States for the island to have greater involvement in the world body.
27/10/2021.author: Nour Haydar

27/10/2021.headline: Mother and boyfriend charged after police find eight-year-old dead in Texas
27/10/2021.description: Following an autopsy, investigators say the boy was killed by "multiple blunt force injuries".
27/10/2021.author: Nour Haydar

27/10/2021.headline: Sudan arrests three activists as pressure mounts on military after coup
27/10/2021.description: Arrests in the capital Khartoum are reported by family members and pro-democracy groups as tens of thousands of Sudanese take to the streets to demand the return of the democratically elected government.
27/10/2021.author: Nour Haydar

28/10/2021.headline: NT Police charge man with attempted murder over alleged assault of a woman
28/10/2021.description: Northern Territory Police have charged a 33-year-old man with attempted murder after an alleged assault in Mataranka, 420 kilometres south-east of Darwin.
28/10/2021.author: Samantha Dick

28/10/2021.headline: De Kock issues apology, says he'll take a knee in future
28/10/2021.description: Quinton de Kock apologises for rejecting a Cricket South Africa directive that players must "take a knee" in support of the Black Lives Matter movement.
28/10/2021.author: Samantha Dick

28/10/2021.headline: Gynaecologist invents the world's first unisex condom using wound-dressing material
28/10/2021.description: The inventor of a unisex condom hopes it will empower people to take control of their sexual health, regardless of their sex or sexual orientation.
28/10/2021.author: Samantha Dick

28/10/2021.headline: 'Drug-addled negligence': Cairns mother sentenced over death of infant son who ate her meth
28/10/2021.description: The mother of a 13-month-old boy who died after eating methamphetamine left in his bedroom has been sentenced to eight years' jail.
28/10/2021.author: Jemima Burt

28/10/2021.headline: Electric car taxes 'inevitable' in Australia as SA joins the charge
28/10/2021.description: Buyers of electric cars in South Australia will soon be charged for every kilometre they drive, after an electric vehicle tax was passed.
28/10/2021.author: Nick Harmsen

28/10/2021.headline: One of Australia's worst drink drivers jailed after two-hour trial
28/10/2021.description: WA man Paul Anthony Hepworth, who's been labelled a "risk to the public", is jailed for his 11th drink-driving conviction.
28/10/2021.author: Kyle Pauletto

28/10/2021.headline: How mother-of-pearl could be a game-changer for bone surgery
28/10/2021.description: The abundance of pearl shells off WA's Kimberley coast may have some life-changing medical applications, as researchers investigate mother-of-pearl's potential as a synthetic bone substitute.
28/10/2021.author: Courtney Fowler

28/10/2021.headline: Court hears details of how former Canberra football coach groomed and molested boy
28/10/2021.description: The ACT Supreme Court hears graphic details of how former junior Ainslie Football Club coach Stephen Porter groomed and later molested a young boy.
28/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

28/10/2021.headline: Labor shocked by size of golden handshakes for power execs
28/10/2021.description: Golden handshakes worth almost $2.4 million for departing Tasmanian power company executives are defended as being "reflective of the nature and tenure of these senior roles".
28/10/2021.author: Alexandra Humphries

28/10/2021.headline: Fake rideshare driver 'targeting' young women charged with sexual assault
28/10/2021.description: Police say the man has been acting alone and targeting young women clearly waiting for a rideshare pick-up. Officers believe he was intending to hit the road again this weekend.
28/10/2021.author: Alex Brewster

28/10/2021.headline: Filmmaker and 'true hero' who exposed Indonesian atrocities in Timor-Leste dies after illness
28/10/2021.description: Max Stahl, the filmmaker and war correspondent who risked his life to film Indonesian soldiers firing on a crowd of mourners in Timor-Leste in 1991, dies in Brisbane, aged 66.
28/10/2021.author: Alex Brewster

28/10/2021.headline: Future of Crown Perth up in the air as James Packer prepares to testify at royal commission
28/10/2021.description: Billionaire James Packer once viewed his Perth casino as the jewel in his plans for a global Crown empire — but his reputation is now in tatters as he prepares to testify at the WA royal commission tomorrow.
28/10/2021.author: Rebecca Turner

28/10/2021.headline: The US, Russia, North Korea and now China – why are nuclear powers vying for hypersonic capability?
28/10/2021.description: The latest test of a hypersonic nuclear-capable weapon has been by China, but recent months have seen an arms race for stealthier long-range weapons.
28/10/2021.author: Rebecca Turner

28/10/2021.headline: Marise Payne labels alleged censorship at OzAsia Festival 'unacceptable' after canning of Hong Kong group's performance
28/10/2021.description: The future of government funding for Adelaide's OzAsia Festival is under threat, after claims that Hong Kong's strict national security laws have extended to Australia's biggest Asian festival.
28/10/2021.author: Sara Tomevska

28/10/2021.headline: Anyone with a mortgage warned to brace for faster rising interest rates
28/10/2021.description: There are warnings the cost of borrowing is marching upwards, and much faster than many experts had been forecasting.
28/10/2021.author: David Taylor

28/10/2021.headline: Giddey fires in shock Oklahoma win over Lakers
28/10/2021.description: Australia's number six draft pick Josh Giddey makes history as Oklahoma City secures their first win of the NBA season by beating LeBron James' Los Angeles Lakers.
28/10/2021.author: David Taylor

28/10/2021.headline: Fugitive who escaped prison 30 years ago facing deportation after turning himself in
28/10/2021.description: Darko Desic, who was at large for nearly three decades, is facing deportation after being sentenced to two months in jail for his historical escape from a NSW prison.
28/10/2021.author: Mridula Amin

28/10/2021.headline: Doctors warn of horror eye risks in ghastly Halloween trend
28/10/2021.description: Trick-or-treat enthusiasts are being warned to do their research before attempting cosmetic trends that could lead to blindness overnight.
28/10/2021.author: Zilla Gordon

28/10/2021.headline: Fiji welcomes Australia's net zero by 2050 target, but other Pacific countries are sceptical
28/10/2021.description: Fiji's Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama says he does not want any more excuses on climate action from big emitters, including Australia, when they gather for talks at COP26.
28/10/2021.author: Evan Wasuka, Tahlea Aualiitia, and Caroline Tiriman

28/10/2021.headline: Former lawyer who ripped off elderly clients walks from court after defrauding WWII refugee
28/10/2021.description: Tracey-Anne Smith has been struck off as a lawyer in two states for defrauding elderly clients of a total of $175,000. A magistrate gives her a suspended jail sentence, saying her declining mental health meant she had an "altered level of moral culpability".
28/10/2021.author: Paula Doneman and Heidi Sheehan

28/10/2021.headline: Protesters voice frustration after police officer cleared of Yamatji woman's murder in Geraldton
28/10/2021.description: Red hands are daubed on the steps of WA Parliament House days after a police officer was cleared of murder for shooting dead an Aboriginal woman in Geraldt
28/10/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger and Natasha Harradine

28/10/2021.headline: Doctor selected as Queensland's next chief health officer declines job days before taking over
28/10/2021.description: Dr Krispin Hajkowicz tells the Queensland government he cannot accept the job of chief health officer for personal reasons. Jeannette Young is finishing up in the job this Sunday and her deputy Peter Aitken will act in the role until a replacement is found.
28/10/2021.author: Rachel Riga

28/10/2021.headline: Minnie Alex Pullin makes her entrance, as Olympian's widow welcomes 'a little piece of Chumpy'
28/10/2021.description: Ellidy Pullin gives birth to Alex "Chumpy" Pullin's daughter 15 months after he died, following successful IVF treatment using the snowboarding champion's sperm.
28/10/2021.author: Kimberley Bernard

28/10/2021.headline: Voter ID laws could be in place before the next federal election. Here's why it's controversial
28/10/2021.description: You don't need to prove your identity to vote in federal elections. Here's why the government wants to change that, and why Labor thinks it's "racist and discriminatory".
28/10/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

28/10/2021.headline: Dam site better: farmers hail increase to harvestable water limit
28/10/2021.description: Coastal farmers in NSW will soon be able to capture 30 per cent of the rain that falls on their properties, in what the state government is calling a "historic step".
28/10/2021.author: Keely Johnson and Kim Honan

28/10/2021.headline: Liberal politician pushes for Australia to drop 'One China' policy and recognise Taiwan
28/10/2021.description: The head of the Senate’s foreign affairs committee says Australia should break its longstanding 'One China' policy, by establishing full diplomatic relations with Taiwan.
28/10/2021.author: Andrew Greene

28/10/2021.headline: $300 million 'free' water windfall for Murray-Darling irrigators
28/10/2021.description: The water has been saved from irrigation system upgrades dating back to 2007 and is being gifted to irrigators to keep and use or sell on the open market.
28/10/2021.author: Warwick Long

28/10/2021.headline: She walked out of prison and three weeks later was shot dead. What happened to JC?
28/10/2021.description: About three weeks after leaving prison, a 29-year-old woman is shot dead by a police officer, sparking a historic trial for her murder. What took her from the prison gates to lying dead on a suburban street?
28/10/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger, Bridget Brennan, and Kirsten Robb

28/10/2021.headline: When Ambulance Victoria didn't answer this woman's calls, this is the box that saved her life
28/10/2021.description: Diana Schumacher reached out to the emergency services for help. Then she had to treat herself.
28/10/2021.author: Dana Morse and Margaret Paul

28/10/2021.headline: How Sydney woman 'Gabz' created a black market for unproven COVID treatments sourced from India
28/10/2021.description: An ABC investigation has uncovered a black market trade for Ivermectin on encrypted social media platform Telegram.
28/10/2021.author: Ahmed Yussuf and Pat McGrath

28/10/2021.headline: Canberrans can now take masks off outside as most COVID-19 restrictions ease
28/10/2021.description: The lockdown caused by the Delta outbreak is effectively over, but ACT life isn't quite returning to what it was like before the pandemic. Here's what you can and can't do from today.
28/10/2021.author: Markus Mannheim

28/10/2021.headline: 'You feel like you can live again': New Parkinson's treatment lets doctors manipulate brains remotely
28/10/2021.description: Parkinson's patient Clive Couperthwaite routinely travelled for hours to Brisbane for a simple and quick tweak to a life-changing device implanted in his brain, but now new technology means those adjustments can be made remotely, opening new doors for him and thousands of Australians living with the disease.
28/10/2021.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis

28/10/2021.headline: Researchers develop glass to make phone screens 'unbreakable' and devices self-recharging
28/10/2021.description: Researchers at the University of Queensland join with scientists across the world to develop a new form of composite glass that is virtually unbreakable, and could even turn phone screens into mini solar panels.
28/10/2021.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

28/10/2021.headline: 'We're one country after all': Why can some Australians fly overseas but not drive to Queensland?
28/10/2021.description: In just a few days, many Australians living in NSW or Victoria will be able to fly to London or Los Angeles – but not drive across the Queensland border. Here's how the state's COVID-19 travel rules will work.
28/10/2021.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

28/10/2021.headline: It's going to be another day of whack-a-mole weather warnings as storm risk moves north
28/10/2021.description: A trough and complex low are expected to bring supercell storms to northern NSW and southern Queensland today, after SA and Victoria got a battering yesterday.
28/10/2021.author: Kate Doyle and Cassandra Hough

28/10/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: Trains slow for industrial strike
28/10/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Sydney trains are running slow on purpose this morning, as industrial action continues for the second week.
28/10/2021.author: Kate Doyle and Cassandra Hough

28/10/2021.headline: Facebook rebrands as Meta as it chases 'metaverse' vision
28/10/2021.description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg says his company is rebranding itself as Meta in an effort to encompass its virtual-reality vision for the future.
28/10/2021.author: Kate Doyle and Cassandra Hough

28/10/2021.headline: Most workers can't just borrow cash from their employer's till. Why can bosses get away with doing it to employees' super?
28/10/2021.description: Millions of Australians are counting on tougher action against employers who don't pay their workers' superannuation, writes Nassim Khadem.
28/10/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

28/10/2021.headline: Australians keen to set sail as government suggests cruises could return this summer
28/10/2021.description: Cruises were linked to serious COVID-19 outbreaks early in the pandemic, but that has not dampened enthusiasm of some Australians who are keen to get back to sea.
28/10/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin

28/10/2021.headline: Quinton de Kock's  apology a mirror to us all
28/10/2021.description: The Quinton de Kock story which was portrayed never added up and the aftermath has shown many were far too quick to judge, writes Tracey Holmes.
28/10/2021.author: Tracey Holmes

28/10/2021.headline: Why has Beijing censored an Australian's song about glass hearts, pink costumes and pineapples?
28/10/2021.description: Australian singer Kimberley Chen, who has millions of fans in China, has been censored on Chinese social media and music streaming platforms after releasing a song mocking Beijing's controversial policies.
28/10/2021.author: Bang Xiao

28/10/2021.headline: How Japan reduced its daily COVID cases from 26,000 to hundreds in six weeks
28/10/2021.description: Japan experiences a sharp decline in coronavirus cases after the Olympic host country suffers its most severe outbreak of the pandemic. Health experts say public compliance, mask wearing and vaccine uptake have helped flatten the curve.
28/10/2021.author: Joshua Boscaini

28/10/2021.headline: Xi Jinping is bingeing coal and avoiding a climate summit. Is he giving up on the green China dream?
28/10/2021.description: China's president Xi Jinping must somehow fuel the nation's economic growth, keep the lights on, and break its addiction to coal before it's too late.
28/10/2021.author: Bill Birtles

28/10/2021.headline: Macron delivers precise torpedo strike to Morrison
28/10/2021.description: The French President's fury does not seem to have cooled with the Australian government, writes Andrew Probyn.
28/10/2021.author: Andrew Probyn

28/10/2021.headline: 'For Chinese Australians, it's really our origin story in many ways': New show breaks ground
28/10/2021.description: SBS's ambitious Gold Rush murder mystery New Gold Mountain brings an important part of Australian history to the screen, with a steely Chinese cowboy as the protagonist.
28/10/2021.author: Hannah Reich

28/10/2021.headline: The missing puzzle piece in the global supply chain crisis is large, metallic and lost at sea
28/10/2021.description: Almost every product in our daily lives travels in a shipping container. But now there's a shortage, partly thanks to Covid, which has contributed to supply chain issues.
28/10/2021.author: Nick Baker

28/10/2021.headline: The ins and outs of the Novavax COVID vaccine
28/10/2021.description: When is the Novavax COVID vaccine coming to Australia, and how does it work? Here's what we know.
28/10/2021.author: Olivia Willis

28/10/2021.headline: New COVID hotspot emerges in NSW — and it's not in Sydney
28/10/2021.description: After months of soaring case numbers in south-west Sydney, the hotspot mantle has now been passed to regional New South Wales.
28/10/2021.author: Catherine Hanrahan

28/10/2021.headline: Police seize 55 million meth pills smuggled in beer truck, in Asia's largest ever drug bust
28/10/2021.description: More than 55 million methamphetamine tablets and over 1.5 tonnes of crystal methamphetamine are intercepted by Lao police, who stopped a truck carrying beer crates.
28/10/2021.author: Catherine Hanrahan

28/10/2021.headline: 'I didn't want to exist': Nakkiah Lui reveals hurt in wake of social media abuse
