28/10/2021.description: Nakkiah Lui says she never imagined the level of abuse she would receive for suggesting Jessica Rowe might want to review a podcast she did with Pauline Hanson, as the Q+A panel discuss cancel culture and comedian Dave Chapelle.
28/10/2021.author: Paul Johnson

29/10/2021.headline: NAIF boss resigns hours before Senate Estimates hearing
29/10/2021.description: The head of the Northern Australia Infrastructure Facility resigns less than 24 hours before he was due to appear before the Senate Estimates Committee.
29/10/2021.author: Daniel Fitzgerald and Matt Brann

29/10/2021.headline: Alice Springs financial advisor found guilty of drug trafficking
29/10/2021.description: High profile Alice Springs financial advisor Harris Shortland has been found guilty smuggling cocaine into Alice Springs.
29/10/2021.author: Saskia Mabin

29/10/2021.headline: Disgraced WA politician likened to Walter Mitty after lying about police and military service
29/10/2021.description: Former Labor MP Barry Urban is likened to fictional character Walter Mitty after misleading parliament about his education and police service. He remains behind bars as he awaits sentencing.
29/10/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

29/10/2021.headline: 'They could be taping our conversation right now': Three crucial ICAC calls explained
29/10/2021.description: The NSW corruption watchdog has played several tapped several calls between former premier Gladys Berejiklian and her ex-boyfriend Daryl Maguire. Here are three it highlighted.
29/10/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

29/10/2021.headline: Concerns raised over quality of care at SA childcare centres operating below staff ratios
29/10/2021.description: The state opposition says more than a fifth of South Australia's childcare centres have been granted exemptions to staffing ratio rules, raising concerns about the level of care.
29/10/2021.author: Leah MacLennan

29/10/2021.headline: Minutes after this SES volunteer set out to help others, a tree crushed his home, trapping his family
29/10/2021.description: Ben Owen had gone to check on his neighbours in the Dandenongs this morning when his wife rang and told him an enormous pine tree had come crashing down on their home.
29/10/2021.author: Leah MacLennan

29/10/2021.headline: BlueScope Steel and Rio Tinto announce 'green steel' partnership
29/10/2021.description: Australia's largest steel producer unites with mining giant Rio Tinto to explore decarbonising the steel-making process, signalling a move away from coal.
29/10/2021.author: Tim Fernandez

29/10/2021.headline: 'What happens to the people out here?': Pastoralists concerned by massive national parks property purchase
29/10/2021.description: Far West graziers say an enormous land acquisition by the NSW government is turfing out generations of families who have called the land home.
29/10/2021.author: Jonathon Poulson, Bill Ormonde, and Callum Marshall

29/10/2021.headline: 'Monitor their reactions': School warns parents of children who've seen Squid Game
29/10/2021.description: The Netflix hit show may have captured the attention of millions, but its lurid depictions of death and dissection prompt an Adelaide primary school to write to parents, suggesting they "monitor" the reactions of children who have seen it.
29/10/2021.author: Daniel Keane and Matthew Smith

29/10/2021.headline: Police searching for Cleo Smith examine reports of predatory behaviour dating back 10 years
29/10/2021.description: The WA detective tasked with finding missing four-year-old Cleo Smith says investigators are reviewing reports of past approaches to children in the area where she disappeared from her family's tent a fortnight ago.
29/10/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

29/10/2021.headline: US woman who helped kill her mother in Bali is released from prison
29/10/2021.description: Heather Mack is released from an Indonesian jail after serving seven years of her 10-year sentence for helping kill her mother, Sheila von Wiese-Mack, alongside her then-boyfriend Tommy Schaefer.
29/10/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

29/10/2021.headline: Why is Facebook changing its name, and what does meta mean?
29/10/2021.description: Mark Zuckerberg says the rebranding is part of the company's plan to develop a virtual world but critics argue it's an attempt to shift focus from recent controversies. Here's what we know about Facebook going Meta.
29/10/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

29/10/2021.headline: Packer tells royal commission he should have 'resigned or attended' Burswood board meetings
29/10/2021.description: Australian billionaire James Packer tells a royal commission that he did not attend board meetings of Burswood Limited — the company overseeing Crown Perth — between 2013 and 2016, despite being its chair.
29/10/2021.author: Rebecca Turner

29/10/2021.headline: 'Great for ducks': Tasmania gets a bucketing, but spared damaging winds
29/10/2021.description: It has been a very wet day in Tasmania, with authorities watching river catchments closely — but the threat of damaging winds has passed.
29/10/2021.author: Adam Langenberg

29/10/2021.headline: Vegetable growers count the cost of damaged glasshouses and crops after hailstorm
29/10/2021.description: Lettuces, tomatoes, cucumbers and zucchinis are among the crops badly damaged in storms that swung through South Australia yesterday.
29/10/2021.author: Adam Langenberg

29/10/2021.headline: Inside the 'historic' tunnels under Sydney Harbour which will slash travel times for commuters
29/10/2021.description: Work is completed on tunnels that will allow commuters to travel deep under Sydney Harbour, with NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet saying the project will "transform the way we travel around our great city".
29/10/2021.author: Maryanne Taouk

29/10/2021.headline: Former ABC camera operator sentenced for historical sex offences in Alice Springs
29/10/2021.description: Former ABC camera operator Alan Dowler has been sentenced in the Northern Territory Supreme Court to four years and six months in prison for historical sex offences against two girls under the age of 14.
29/10/2021.author: Isaac Nowroozi

29/10/2021.headline: The Reserve Bank delivered a 'significant surprise' and it could affect your mortgage
29/10/2021.description: The Reserve Bank again fails to defend its 0.1 per cent bond yield target and that means official interest rates, as well as variable mortgage rates, could be rising sooner than previously expected.
29/10/2021.author: Michael Janda

29/10/2021.headline: 'Keeping this species going': Largest ever NSW release of critically endangered birds
29/10/2021.description: There are only about 300 regent honeyeaters left in the wild and, in a bid to save them from extinction, a large number of captive-bred birds have just been released on Wonnarua Country in the Hunter Valley.
29/10/2021.author: Emma Siossian

29/10/2021.headline: Jupiter's Great Red Spot not just wide but surprisingly deep
29/10/2021.description: Jupiter's Great Red Spot, a storm so big it could swallow Earth, extends deep beneath the planet's cloud tops.
29/10/2021.author: Emma Siossian

29/10/2021.headline: Australians are facing record petrol prices and a decision by John Howard 43 years ago begins the story
29/10/2021.description: Why are Australian petrol prices hitting record highs? Part of the reason has to do with a government decision made in the 1970s.
29/10/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

29/10/2021.headline: Man and woman allegedly caught in same room of COVID-19 medi-hotel arrested
29/10/2021.description: Police arrest an 18-year-old woman and 22-year-old man at an Adelaide COVID-19 quarantine hotel, after being caught in the same room.
29/10/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

29/10/2021.headline: Doctors being abused for refusing to give COVID vaccine exemptions
29/10/2021.description: Rural Doctors and the AMA are encouraging people to 'have an open conversation' with their GPs as they are most likely not medically exempt from getting the vaccine.
29/10/2021.author: Guy Williams

29/10/2021.headline: Wallabies game plan to change as Japan-based trio pulls out of spring tour
29/10/2021.description: The Wallabies will have to adjust their strategy for their upcoming three Tests, following the withdrawal of key personnel — Samu Kerevi, Quade Cooper and Sean McMahon — from their squad, writes Brett McKay.
29/10/2021.author: Brett McKay

29/10/2021.headline: ACT records 10 new COVID-19 cases as Canberrans enjoy significantly eased restrictions
29/10/2021.description: The ACT records 10 new cases of COVID-19 as Canberrans enjoy new freedoms. Most ACT businesses can reopen today, and residents no longer have to wear masks while outside.
29/10/2021.author: Charlotte Gore

29/10/2021.headline: How Gladys Berejiklian's ICAC media blitz backfired
29/10/2021.description: Painful questions about the status of Gladys Berejiklian's relationship with Daryl Maguire bordered on the Shakespearean, as the former premier remains defiant.
29/10/2021.author: Paul Farrell and Alex McDonald

29/10/2021.headline: Experts examine who could be held legally responsible for the death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins
29/10/2021.description: Alec Baldwin is unlikely to face charges for holding the gun that fired the fatal shot into cinematographer Halyna Hutchins while filming a scene, but he may have to front court as one of the producers of the movie, according to legal experts.
29/10/2021.author: Paul Farrell and Alex McDonald

29/10/2021.headline: Tiger King 2 is coming. This will help you get up to speed
29/10/2021.description: The sequel to the 2020 Netflix series will premiere in November. Here's what has happened in the real lives of the key characters over the past 18 months.
29/10/2021.author: Paul Donoughue

29/10/2021.headline: We'll live with COVID for years to come. But Israel's tactics show how we can tame the virus
29/10/2021.description: Just six weeks after the peak of its worst wave of COVID yet, life in Israel is returning to normal thanks to a combination of booster shots, vaccine passports and mask-wearing. Their turnaround could offer a way forward for Australia.
29/10/2021.author: Tom Joyner

29/10/2021.headline: China's male idols are undergoing masculine makeovers
29/10/2021.description: After Beijing's call to put an end to 'sissy' men, a number of China's most popular male idols have undergone conspicuous image makeovers to adopt a more masculine look. However, not everyone is as willing to take Beijing's fashion advice.
29/10/2021.author: Joyce Cheng, Jordyn Butler, and Will Jackson

29/10/2021.headline: As COP26 tries to shape the future, Australians are dealing with climate change now
29/10/2021.description: Summer temperatures are soaring, those burnt out in the Black Summer are rebuilding, and water flows have been down for decades. As leaders gather in Glasgow, Australians are already dealing with the impacts of a warming planet.
29/10/2021.author: Ben Deacon, Kate Doyle, Jarrod Lucas, Ruslan Kulski, and Daniel Franklin

29/10/2021.headline: The pandemic inspired Tara to redesign her life and she's never been happier
29/10/2021.description: Workers all over the world are increasingly retreating from pre-pandemic work patterns and pursuing new passions – or just a slower, more sustainable pace. So, what does the Great Resignation look like in Australia?
29/10/2021.author: Ben Deacon, Kate Doyle, Jarrod Lucas, Ruslan Kulski, and Daniel Franklin

29/10/2021.headline: Skin in the game: Needle-free COVID vaccine patches a step closer
29/10/2021.description: Australian biotech firm Vaxxas will start clinical trials of its tiny vaccine-administering patches next year — which is good news for kids and people with a fear of needles.
29/10/2021.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

29/10/2021.headline: So let's talk about another plan that was released this week but received very little attention
29/10/2021.description: The government is to be applauded for having a national strategy for preventing and responding to child sexual abuse. As with all such things, though, the question is how effectively it addresses the problem, writes Laura Tingle.
29/10/2021.author: Laura Tingle

29/10/2021.headline: Thinking about learning a language? Here are some reasons to consider studying Bahasa Indonesia
29/10/2021.description: There is a shrinking cohort of Australian students choosing to learn Indonesian at high school. That's why academics have renewed calls for more students to study Bahasa Indonesia.
29/10/2021.author: Mariah Papadopoulos

29/10/2021.headline: The Queen told to rest for 'at least the next two weeks'
29/10/2021.description: Buckingham Palace says the Queen is advised by her doctors to rest for at least the next fortnight.
29/10/2021.author: Mariah Papadopoulos

29/10/2021.headline: Spotlight falls on home and mystery car as search for Cleo Smith continues
29/10/2021.description: Little Cleo Smith has been missing for more than two weeks now and with few leads to go on, the detectives putting together the puzzle revisit the locations which are central to her disappearance.
29/10/2021.author: James Carmody

29/10/2021.headline: Biden tells Macron he thought French knew about 'clumsy' AUKUS deal
29/10/2021.description: US President Joe Biden tells French President Emmanuel Macron he was "under the impression" France had been informed about the AUKUS submarine deal long before it was announced.
29/10/2021.author: James Carmody

29/10/2021.headline: Heroics from big guns Holder, Russell and Pooran keep West Indies alive at T20 World Cup
29/10/2021.description: Winning doesn't always have to be pretty and for the West Indies it was not but their biggest guns fired when it mattered most to see them defeat Bangladesh in dramatic fashion at the T20 World Cup.
29/10/2021.author: James Carmody

29/10/2021.headline: Armourer on Alec Baldwin film breaks her silence after fatal shooting on set
29/10/2021.description: Lawyers for the 24-year-old Hannah Gutierrez Reed say she doesn't know where the live rounds found there came from, and blamed producers for unsafe working conditions.
29/10/2021.author: James Carmody

29/10/2021.headline: This idyllic Pacific nation has just now recorded its first COVID case
29/10/2021.description: Tonga is among the few remaining nations in the world that have avoided outbreaks of the virus.
29/10/2021.author: James Carmody

29/10/2021.headline: Trump's business empire slumps after years of divisive politics, figures show
29/10/2021.description: The slashing rhetorical style and divisive politics that inspired fierce political loyalty for Donald Trump are undermining a business built around real estate development and branding deals.
29/10/2021.author: James Carmody

29/10/2021.headline: Victoria's COVID cases and hospitalisations are stabilising. But the rollercoaster ride is not over
29/10/2021.description: As Victorians enjoy a weekend of emotional reunions and further eased restrictions, hopeful trends are firming up on several fronts in the state's battle against COVID-19. These are the figures to watch in the next few months.
29/10/2021.author: Joseph Dunstan

29/10/2021.headline: Sweden acted too slowly on COVID pandemic, commission finds
29/10/2021.description: Sweden's early strategy, shunning lockdowns and measures such as face masks and only gradually tightening curbs, made the country an outlier in the first year of the pandemic.
29/10/2021.author: Joseph Dunstan

29/10/2021.headline: Australian Test great Ashley Mallett dies aged 76
29/10/2021.description: Australian spin bowling great Ashley Mallett, who played 38 Tests and took 132 wickets at an average of 29.84, dies aged 76 after battling cancer.
29/10/2021.author: Joseph Dunstan

29/10/2021.headline: Senior aide to Aung San Suu Kyi sentenced to 20 years' jail in Myanmar
29/10/2021.description: Myanmar's military junta has sentenced Win Htein — a close aide of ousted civilian leader Aung San Suu Kyi — to 20 years in prison for treason, according to his lawyer.
29/10/2021.author: Joseph Dunstan

29/10/2021.headline: In Denmark's capital, a social experiment that started as a prank has been running for 50 years
29/10/2021.description: After a half-century, the "flower-power" aura of Copenhagen's semi-autonomous Christiania neighbourhood hasn't wilted.
29/10/2021.author: Joseph Dunstan

29/10/2021.headline: 'Complete' Harris shines in Ashes audition, Labuschagne continues solid form
29/10/2021.description: Incumbent Test opener Marcus Harris scores a ton for Victoria to put his name in front of national selectors, while Marnus Labuschagne adds a Sheffield Shield half-century to his tally for Queensland.
29/10/2021.author: Joseph Dunstan

29/10/2021.headline: Pope tells world leaders 'radical' action on climate change needed
29/10/2021.description: Ahead of the COP26 climate conference in Glasgow, Pope Francis says world leaders must give hope to future generations.
29/10/2021.author: Joseph Dunstan

29/10/2021.headline: Regions brace for COVID spike as Melburnians escape for long weekend
29/10/2021.description: While regional businesses nervously look forward to a boom in trade as Melbourne visitors arrive for the long weekend, hospitals prepare for a surge in COVID cases.
29/10/2021.author: Sarah Lawrence, Katherine Smyrk, Rosanne Maloney, and Daniel Miles

29/10/2021.headline: Victorians warned they could remain without power into next week after violent storms
29/10/2021.description: More than 100,000 Victorian homes and businesses spend a cold night without power after severe storms ripped through the state.
29/10/2021.author: Adele Ferguson and Lauren Day

30/10/2021.headline: WA to require travellers from states with COVID transmission to be fully vaccinated
30/10/2021.description: The WA government has announced a major change to its border rules, effectively requiring travellers from states with COVID-19 transmission to be fully vaccinated in order to enter.
30/10/2021.author: Keane Bourke

30/10/2021.headline: The field for the Melbourne Cup is out. Can they beat racing's rising star?
30/10/2021.description: Incentivise is set to run a hot favourite in Tuesday's great race, but who will be the toughest to beat? Explore our interactive form guide to the horses set to line up in the 161st Melbourne Cup.
30/10/2021.author: Daniel Franklin

30/10/2021.headline: Severe storms heading towards Brisbane's CBD, expected to bring damaging winds and hail
30/10/2021.description: A number of severe storm cells have formed in southern and south-east Queensland, with half a dozen regions warned they could be hit by damaging winds and large hailstones.
30/10/2021.author: Daniel Franklin

30/10/2021.headline: Ancient Mayan canoe found in Mexican freshwater pool
30/10/2021.description: A wooden, almost completely intact canoe used by ancient Mayans and believed to be more than 1,000 years old has turned up in the southern Mexico state of Yucatán.
30/10/2021.author: Daniel Franklin

30/10/2021.headline: Not spooked by Halloween ghost stories? You may have aphantasia
30/10/2021.description: When some people listen to a story they automatically conjure up the scene in their mind’s eye, while a small proportion cannot visualise images at all. This inability to visualise is known as aphantasia.
30/10/2021.author: Daniel Franklin

30/10/2021.headline: From ‘unknown’ to ‘ancestor’: Indigenous artists honoured in groundbreaking new exhibition
30/10/2021.description: WILAM BIIK - or ‘Home Country’ - at TarraWarra Museum of Art, puts Wurundjeri people in full control of the curatorial process, breaking down centuries of museum protocol.
30/10/2021.author: Maddee Clark

30/10/2021.headline: Scuba diver drowns in Sydney's south despite efforts of bystanders and paramedics
30/10/2021.description: Just after noon today, paramedics responded to reports a scuba diver had been pulled from the water unconscious near Cape Solander at Kurnell.
30/10/2021.author: Maddee Clark

30/10/2021.headline: Twelve Republican-led US states sue Biden administration over vaccine mandate
30/10/2021.description: US states launch a legal challenge against US President Joe Biden's executive orders requiring federal contractors to be vaccinated, describing the mandate as "unconstitutional and unlawful".
30/10/2021.author: Maddee Clark

30/10/2021.headline: 'Extremely unlikely' missing man could have survived, police say, as boat search ends
30/10/2021.description: The search for a man missing in waters off Tasmania's north-west is called off 11 days after he was last seen and more than week after the bodies of two of his friends washed ashore.
30/10/2021.author: Maddee Clark

30/10/2021.headline: 'A colossal figure': Australian cricket mourns death of Alan Davidson
30/10/2021.description: Regarded as one of Australia's greatest all-rounders, Alan Davidson — who played in the famous tied Test against West Indies — has died at age 92.
30/10/2021.author: Maddee Clark

30/10/2021.headline: Man arrested over cocaine bust is 'co-conspirator' of fugitive Mostafa Baluch, police allege
30/10/2021.description: Police link a man arrested over large quantities of cocaine,  heroin and methamphetamine brought in by air cargo to alleged drug smuggler Mostafa Baluch, who is being sought by police.
30/10/2021.author: Sue Daniel and Harriet Tatham

30/10/2021.headline: Kyle Chalmers breaks 13-year-old world record
30/10/2021.description: The Australian adds a world record to his lengthy list of accomplishments in the pool, setting a new mark in the men's 100 metres freestyle short-course event in Russia.
30/10/2021.author: Sue Daniel and Harriet Tatham

30/10/2021.headline: Mass of pumice pebbles cover beaches, damage boats in Japan
30/10/2021.description: Massive amounts of volcanic pumice pebbles spewed from an undersea volcano in the Pacific Ocean have been piling up on southern Japanese coasts.
30/10/2021.author: Sue Daniel and Harriet Tatham

30/10/2021.headline: WA's largest mango orchard on track for best season in years
30/10/2021.description: Despite severe labour shortages plaguing Australia's agriculture sector, WA's largest mango packing shed springs back to life in the Ord and is on target to pack up to 200,000 trays of fruit this season.
30/10/2021.author: Courtney Fowler

30/10/2021.headline: How a water-ski show became a theme park that's 'part of our fabric'
30/10/2021.description: One of the Gold Coast's best known theme parks celebrates a major milestone — turning 50.
30/10/2021.author: Courtney Fowler

30/10/2021.headline: Christian Eriksen banned from football in Italy due to pacemaker
30/10/2021.description: Christian Eriksen, who collapsed on the pitch at Euro 2020, can no longer play football in Italy due to his pacemaking device.
30/10/2021.author: Courtney Fowler

30/10/2021.headline: Live: Hitotsu wins Victoria Derby following storming finish, field finalised for the Melbourne Cup
30/10/2021.description: Jockey John Allen guides Hitotsu to an outstanding win in the Victoria Derby at Flemington Racecourse, and Incentivise will race from barrier 16 as the final field is set for Tuesday's Melbourne Cup. Follow all the action live.
30/10/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

30/10/2021.headline: Police search for man after hold-up east of Adelaide, as three teens arrested over alleged Range Rover theft
30/10/2021.description: Police are searching for a man following an attempted hold-up east of Adelaide on Saturday morning. Three teenage boys were also arrested following a police pursuit of a stolen car overnight.
30/10/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

30/10/2021.headline: Can I still go trick-or-treating this year? Here's how to have a COVID-safe Halloween in your state
30/10/2021.description: Whether you're gathering at a haunted house for a monster mash, or taking to the streets to trick-or-treat, here are the COVID-safe Halloween rules for your state.
30/10/2021.author: Jessica Riga

30/10/2021.headline: The price of 'the Australian Dream': What these skilled migrants gave up for life down under
30/10/2021.description: Vietnam's former foreign press officer Uyen Vu talks about stepping out of her comfort zone and the challenges she faced in migrating to Australia.
30/10/2021.author: Michael Luu

30/10/2021.headline: 'Delightful' find of tiny marsupial that sucks out prey's brains, but is itself threatened
30/10/2021.description: A group of rangers, researchers and schoolkids were thrilled to discover a threatened brush-tailed mulgara during a fauna survey at Uluru Kata-Tjuta National Park in the heart of Australia.
30/10/2021.author: Eliza Goetze

30/10/2021.headline: Queensland authorities expecting 'hundreds' of daily cases once borders open
30/10/2021.description: On what the government is calling "last-chance weekend", Queensland sees another day with no new coronavirus cases detected.
30/10/2021.author: Nibir Khan

30/10/2021.headline: The ACT has recorded nine new COVID-19 cases
30/10/2021.description: The ACT has recorded nine new locally acquired COVID-19 cases.
30/10/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

30/10/2021.headline: Cosmetic surgeon Daniel Lanzer agrees to stop practising medicine, days after Four Corners investigation
30/10/2021.description: The shock announcement comes days after an investigation uncovered allegations of disturbing practices at the dermatologist's clinics including hygiene and safety breaches and procedures that had left patients with ongoing physical and psychological issues.
30/10/2021.author: Adele Ferguson and Lauren Day

30/10/2021.headline: The new Japanese PM is facing an early election test, but will voters even turn up?
30/10/2021.description: Just 53.7 per cent of eligible voters took part in the last Japanese general election, with turnout particularly low among people in their 20s. Here are four things to look out for in today's vote.
30/10/2021.author: Liam Butterworth

30/10/2021.headline: How phone taps shed light on Berejiklian and Maguire's undeclared relationship
30/10/2021.description: On her first day in the witness box at the Independent Commission Against Corruption's inquiry into her conduct, former premier Gladys Berejiklian has been confronted with an extraordinary catalogue of intercepted calls between her and her former secret boyfriend, Daryl Maguire.
30/10/2021.author: Liam Butterworth

30/10/2021.headline: Afghan girls learning to code 'underground' to bypass Taliban curbs on education
30/10/2021.description: Some Afghan girls and women log on to secret online lessons each day, but there are fears of increased surveillance by the Taliban.
30/10/2021.author: Liam Butterworth

30/10/2021.headline: Our best chance to stop global warming is approaching. Here's what it means if it fails
30/10/2021.description: On our current trajectory, we will heat the world by 1.5C in less than a decade, the United Nation's climate change panel has found. And if we don't act now, cooling the world will be increasingly hard.
30/10/2021.author: Michael Slezak

30/10/2021.headline: 'Best feeling in the world': Australians returning home after being locked out for 20 months
30/10/2021.description: Australians describe the feeling of being able to travel again as "surreal" but those who spoke to the ABC say they remain uneasy about changing rules and regulations as international borders to NSW and Victoria reopen.
30/10/2021.author: Sarah Gerathy and Kevin Nguyen

30/10/2021.headline: Morrison on the defensive over French subs deal, after brief tête-à-tête with Macron
30/10/2021.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison and French President Emmanuel Macron cross paths for the first time since Australia tore up its $90 billion submarine contract with French shipbuilder Naval Group.
30/10/2021.author: Andrew Probyn and Matthew Doran

30/10/2021.headline: Two serial killers struck fear in a traumatised nation. But was one woman the real target of their crimes?
30/10/2021.description: They were the two serial killers who plagued America's capital in a post-911 world. But terror fears and racism in the case of the Beltway snipers have confused their place in history.
30/10/2021.author: Lucia Stein and Rebecca Armitage

30/10/2021.headline: This Icelandic priestess practises a Viking-era religion, and it's on the rise
30/10/2021.description: Iceland's parliament tried to ban the nation's "first religion" 1000 years ago. But this pagan belief system is making a comeback.
30/10/2021.author: Siobhan Marin

30/10/2021.headline: Should we judge Shakespeare by today's standards? These questions are not easily answered
30/10/2021.description: Does pluralism, liberalism, democracy, freedom of expression and rule of law shine a way forward or obscure a dark past that still haunts us today, asks Stan Grant.
30/10/2021.author: Stan Grant

30/10/2021.headline: Cleo Smith's anguished parents face court of public opinion
30/10/2021.description: The shocking disappearance of a vivacious four-year-old in the Australian outback is an ongoing source of trauma for her anguished parents, writes Andrea Mayes, and being subject to social media commentary isn't helping.
30/10/2021.author: Andrea Mayes

30/10/2021.headline: After a year of darkness, Australia's Hindu community prepares to celebrate its 'festival of lights'
30/10/2021.description: After a difficult year, Australia's Hindu community is preparing to observe Diwali, the "festival of lights" that celebrates new beginnings and the triumph of light over darkness.
30/10/2021.author: Dong Xing

30/10/2021.headline: Xiaohe went through China's hotel quarantine system. Here's what that looked like
30/10/2021.description: China is adhering to its COVID-zero policy and that could leave many Chinese Australians who are eager to go back facing a tough choice.
30/10/2021.author: Kai Feng

30/10/2021.headline: From coal hero to net zero: How does a leader do it?
30/10/2021.description: Scott Morrison's climate 'plan' reveals a spectacular new model of political leadership in Australia — and our next election is going to look very different from the last, writes Annabel Crabb.
30/10/2021.author: Annabel Crabb

30/10/2021.headline: Two demonstrators shot dead as thousands protest military takeover in Sudan
30/10/2021.description: Protesters carried Sudanese flags and chanted "military rule can't be praised" and "this country is ours, and our government is civilian" as they marched in neighbourhoods across Khartoum.
30/10/2021.author: Annabel Crabb

30/10/2021.headline: 'On very good form': UK PM Johnson looks to allay fears about Queen's health
30/10/2021.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson says despite doctor's orders to rest, the Queen is "on good form" amid concerns about her health.
30/10/2021.author: Annabel Crabb

30/10/2021.headline: England hand Australia humiliating Twenty20 World Cup loss
30/10/2021.description: England give Australia a lesson in Twenty20 cricket at the World Cup as a top order collapse triggers a loss that could have lasting implications on Australia's tournament.
30/10/2021.author: Paul Johnson

30/10/2021.headline: Bert Newton's wedding to Patti was so popular police had to hold back the crowds
30/10/2021.description: It was Melbourne's own Berti-mania as television personalities Bert Newton and Patti McGrath tied the knot in Camberwell on November 9, 1974.
30/10/2021.author: Sarah Motherwell

30/10/2021.headline: Tributes flow for 'ultimate entertainer' Bert Newton
30/10/2021.description: Television icon Bert Newton is being remembered as a "giant of the industry" and the "ultimate entertainer" after he died in Melbourne on Saturday at the age of 83.
30/10/2021.author: Dan Smith and Jason Dasey

30/10/2021.headline: Bert Newton, Gold Logie-winning entertainer and television star, dead at 83
30/10/2021.description: Bert Newton, the colourful mainstay of Australian television who graced the nation's screens for more than 50 years, is dead aged 83.
30/10/2021.author: Dan Smith and Jason Dasey

30/10/2021.headline: Green helps WA to Shield triumph as Qld, Victoria also post wins
30/10/2021.description: Cameron Green is again amongst the runs in Western Australia's Sheffield Shield win over South Australia, as the men's Ashes fast approach.
30/10/2021.author: Dan Smith and Jason Dasey

30/10/2021.headline: Incoming Paralympics Australia boss targets top spot on Brisbane 2032 medal tally
30/10/2021.description: Catherine Clark won't begin as Paralympics Australia chief executive until January, but she has already set the organisation's sights on preparing for the Brisbane Paralympic Games.
30/10/2021.author: Daniela Intili

30/10/2021.headline: Brisbane pummelled with hail as 'mini-cyclone' lashes Muckadilla
30/10/2021.description: Brisbane is pummelled by hail and hit with winds of up to 100 kilometres per hour as a fast-moving storm barrels through, while a "mini-cyclone" hits the small town of Muckadilla.
30/10/2021.author: Daniel Franklin

30/10/2021.headline: ACT records another seven COVID-19 cases, with nine people in hospital with the virus
30/10/2021.description: The ACT records nine new locally acquired cases of COVID-19, with five people in intensive care requiring ventilation.
30/10/2021.author: Penny Travers

30/10/2021.headline: Bert Newton will be farewelled in Victorian state funeral
30/10/2021.description: Television icon Bert Newton will receive a state funeral, Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews confirms, calling the personality "an icon, a larrikin and a born entertainer".
30/10/2021.author: Penny Travers

30/10/2021.headline: Fowl play after egg farmer adopts rescue dogs to protect flock
30/10/2021.description: Four Maremmas have left their city homes to get to work in the country, where they earn their keep guarding chickens from predators.
30/10/2021.author: Jane McNaughton

30/10/2021.headline: 'She was my friend': Alec Baldwin breaks silence on death of Halyna Hutchins for first time on camera
30/10/2021.description: Actor Alec Baldwin speaks publicly for the first time on camera about the accidental shooting that killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins, in a video released by TMZ.
30/10/2021.author: Jane McNaughton

31/10/2021.headline: Two Canberra men jailed for confining, attacking man owing $75 drug debt
31/10/2021.description: One of the men filmed the other bashing the victim with a tyre iron in the boot of a stolen car, before leaving him stranded with no shoes or phone.
31/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

31/10/2021.headline: G20 endorses global corporate minimum tax at Rome summit
31/10/2021.description: The agreement aims to discourage multinationals from stashing profits in countries where they pay little or no taxes, but a critic says the rate is only "a little more" than those in tax havens.
31/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

31/10/2021.headline: 'I've got one last request': Outgoing CHO's final message as Queensland records zero new cases of COVID-19
31/10/2021.description: Queensland has recorded no new cases of COVID-19 as the deadline looms to be fully vaccinated by the time the state's borders reopen.
31/10/2021.author: Ashleigh Stevenson

31/10/2021.headline: Horse euthanased after falling from float on Adelaide's South Eastern Freeway
31/10/2021.description: Adelaide's South Eastern Freeway was closed to outbound traffic after a horse fell off its float onto the road on Sunday afternoon.
31/10/2021.author: Ashleigh Stevenson

31/10/2021.headline: McGowan says COVID-19 booster vaccines available in Western Australia from Monday
31/10/2021.description: West Australian Premier Mark McGowan says booster shots of COVID-19 vaccines will be available from Monday, with no requirement to book an appointment.
31/10/2021.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

31/10/2021.headline: Tim Smith MP resigns from Victorian shadow cabinet after drink driving car crash
31/10/2021.description: Tim Smith apologises for the "serious error of judgement" after his licence was suspended for crashing his car while more than twice over the legal blood-alcohol limit.
31/10/2021.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

31/10/2021.headline: Vaxxed families in NSW no longer need to isolate if their child is a COVID close contact at school
31/10/2021.description: Parents and siblings will no longer need to stay at home for a fortnight if a child is identified as a close contact of a COVID case a school, the education minister has announced.
31/10/2021.author: Cecilia Connell

31/10/2021.headline: Angus Taylor refuses to detail cost to taxpayers of 2050 climate plan
31/10/2021.description: The federal Energy Minister says funding for the government's plan for net zero emissions by 2050 only stretches as far as 2030, saying what future governments do in the 2040s "is a matter for them".
31/10/2021.author: Matthew Doran and Nour Haydar

31/10/2021.headline: Ash Gentle wins Noosa Tri, puts Olympic disappointment behind her
31/10/2021.description: Ashleigh Gentle secures an eighth Noosa Triathlon title, putting a tough Olympics behind her to extend her dominance at the event, while Luke Willian won it for the first time.
31/10/2021.author: Matthew Doran and Nour Haydar

31/10/2021.headline: 'I just threw up': Severe weather triggers terrified residents
31/10/2021.description: When Luise Manning heard what sounded like her new roofing rattle during a recent storm, she found herself hunched over, vomiting, and dry retching from stress.
31/10/2021.author: Edwina Seselja and Craig Zonca

31/10/2021.headline: Dev Patel is a reluctant knight pitted against a supernatural foe in the Green Knight
31/10/2021.description: This subversive take on the Arthurian ‘quest’ skewers any romantic notions and instead probes at the cost of ‘great deeds’.
31/10/2021.author: Keva York

31/10/2021.headline: Tasmania starts standing aside health workers as 99pc meet COVID vaccine mandate
31/10/2021.description: A total of 170 health staff in Tasmania fail to provide the required vaccination evidence by the deadline, with almost 40 permanent nurses being stood aside.
31/10/2021.author: Kate Ainsworth

31/10/2021.headline: Barcelona star Sergio Agüero sent to hospital after suffering chest pains
31/10/2021.description: Barcelona star Sergio Agüero is sent to hospital after suffering chest pains in his side's 1-1 LaLiga draw with Alavés.
31/10/2021.author: Kate Ainsworth

31/10/2021.headline: One person dead, three in critical condition after boat accident off Wollongong coast
31/10/2021.description: Emergency crews raced to Sandon Point Beach, near Bulli, about 10:20am today after reports of a boat with seven males onboard had capsized.
31/10/2021.author: Kate Ainsworth

31/10/2021.headline: Meet the millions of people who aren't employed, who aren't considered 'unemployed'
31/10/2021.description: These are the reasons why hundreds of thousands of people who want to work, don't actively look for work.
31/10/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

31/10/2021.headline: Gold Coast police probe bikie links after weekend shooting, multiple stabbings
31/10/2021.description: Gold Coast police are investigating possible bikie links after two men suffered critical injuries during a fight near a popular beachside restaurant precinct.
31/10/2021.author: Sarah Cumming

31/10/2021.headline: How vets decide whether a horse is fit enough to run in the Cup
31/10/2021.description: As Australia's most famous race approaches, the focus is on equine safety and the processes to make sure horses are fit. Check out what vets look for when deciding if racehorses can be cleared to race in the Melbourne Cup.
31/10/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

31/10/2021.headline: It's not too late to have your COVID-19 vaccine in Queensland
31/10/2021.description: As the days tick over towards December 17, a key vaccination milestone for family and friends entering the state in time for Christmas, pressure is mounting to get Queenslanders fully vaccinated.
31/10/2021.author: Alex Brewster

31/10/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: Former NSW premier Gladys Berejiklian faces a second day of questioning at the state's anti-corruption watchdog
31/10/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING:  Ms Berejiklian returns to the stand for a second day of evidence as the anti-corruption commission examines whether she breached the ministerial code by failing to declare her relationship with fellow MP Daryl Maguire.
31/10/2021.author: Alex Brewster

31/10/2021.headline: This week is Diwali. Here's how you can celebrate The Festival of Lights
31/10/2021.description: The five days of Diwali are celebrated as faith, food, fireworks, family and charity come together during the festive season.
31/10/2021.author: Widia Jalal

31/10/2021.headline: Do I need a mask, how many visitors can I have? Here are the rules this Melbourne Cup Day
31/10/2021.description: However you're planning to enjoy the public holiday, here's a quick reminder of what you will and will not be able to do as life in Victoria slowly begins to resemble pre-COVID times.
31/10/2021.author: Widia Jalal

31/10/2021.headline: 'Humanity faces stark but clear choices': COP26 climate kicks off in Glasgow
31/10/2021.description: China, Russia and Brazil – three of the world's biggest carbon emitters – are not attending, but senior officials from those countries are expected to participate.
31/10/2021.author: Widia Jalal

31/10/2021.headline: 'Why can't young couples buy homes?' asked a newspaper in the 1960s. The clue is in the fine print
31/10/2021.description: A nation that once prided itself on its egalitarianism and its high levels of home ownership is experiencing rising inequality, due to a growing chasm of wealth between those who own homes, and those who never will, writes Stephen Long.
31/10/2021.author: Stephen Long

31/10/2021.headline: Beetle mania alive and well as young Queenslanders bond over love of bugs
31/10/2021.description: When Izaac Boyan unearthed "Herbie" it was love at first sight — but little did the shy Central Queenslander know that his passion would be shared by others his age.
31/10/2021.author: Erin Semmler and Jasmine Hines

31/10/2021.headline: Once known as 'Drama Jana', now Dr Pittman continues to surprise
31/10/2021.description: Jana Pittman was once the "next big hope" for Australian athletics, but by the time the 2004 Olympics were done, she was "Drama Jana". This is how the world champion hurdler went from pariah to "queen".
31/10/2021.author: Susan Chenery and Ben Cheshire

31/10/2021.headline: French president accuses PM of lying about submarine contract
31/10/2021.description: French President Emmanuel Macron has accused Scott Morrison of lying about the $90 billion submarine contract that was cancelled six weeks ago.
31/10/2021.author: Andrew Probyn and Matthew Doran

31/10/2021.headline: As America tries to kickstart its economy, it has one big problem — workers are walking off the job
31/10/2021.description: From factories to the front lines of the pandemic, American workers are fed up with dangerous conditions, stagnant wages and rising inequality. Now, they're making it known.
31/10/2021.author: Joanna Robin and Kathryn Diss

31/10/2021.headline: How Australia came to be known as a climate change 'laggard'
31/10/2021.description: Over time, Australia's international reputation on climate change has been mixed, with ups and downs along the road. But one thing is for sure — Australia goes to Glasgow with a lot of baggage, writes Michael Slezak.
31/10/2021.author: Michael Slezak

31/10/2021.headline: How the RBA allowed Australia to become a servant to property prices in a $9 trillion market
31/10/2021.description: Having created the biggest real estate bubble in history, our very own Reserve Bank now has its hands tied ahead of its November meeting, writes business editor Ian Verrender.
31/10/2021.author: Ian Verrender

31/10/2021.headline: International borders are reopening with quarantine-free travel, but not everyone is happy
31/10/2021.description: While borders are reopening for quarantine-free international travel for Australian citizens and residents, uncertainty remains for more than 1.6 million visa holders in Australia who have so far been left out of the government's plans.
31/10/2021.author: Hellena Souisa

31/10/2021.headline: Kris hasn't seen her partner in WA for months. Now she's been approved for travel to Europe
31/10/2021.description: Australians will be free to travel overseas from this week for the first time in 18 months, but back home, state border closures are still keeping many families apart.
31/10/2021.author: Maani Truu

31/10/2021.headline: Eve was the 'shy' kid at school. Then one night she disappeared without a trace
31/10/2021.description: Eve Askew was 14 years old when, one night, she disappeared from her bedroom and was never seen again. Her brother thinks she met with foul play and that the killer "will strike again".
31/10/2021.author: April McLennan

31/10/2021.headline: Membership changes to Victoria's peak medical body labelled 'disastrous'
31/10/2021.description: A new budget membership option introduced by the Victorian AMA has baffled medical professionals, who are criticising it as a damaging move for the industry.
31/10/2021.author: April McLennan

31/10/2021.headline: McDonald's franchisee accused of deliberately denying young workers paid breaks
31/10/2021.description: Ben Wescombe was 15 when he started work at McDonald's and says he never received a paid rest break. His union says young workers were exploited and it is taking legal action against the franchisee.
31/10/2021.author: Jessica Longbottom

31/10/2021.headline: G20 commits to carbon neutrality by around 2050, Prince Charles says trillions needed to fight climate change
31/10/2021.description: Member countries also agreed to end public financing for coal power abroad, but not domestically. Speaking in Rome, Prince Charles urged leaders to listen to the "despairing voices" of young people on climate change.
31/10/2021.author: Jessica Longbottom

31/10/2021.headline: Family and friends share memories of Australian television icon Bert Newton
31/10/2021.description: Tributes for the late Bert Newton pour in from around the country, as those who knew him best reflect on the laughs, the memories and the man behind the scenes.
31/10/2021.author: Jessica Longbottom

31/10/2021.headline: Australian Test player Peter Philpott dies aged 86
31/10/2021.description: Australian Test leg spinner and highly accomplished coach Peter Philpott has died after complications from a fall, aged 86.
31/10/2021.author: Jessica Longbottom

31/10/2021.headline: Warne challenges Smith's selection in Aussie T20 World Cup line-up
31/10/2021.description: After the disappointing loss to England, Shane Warne questions whether Steve Smith deserves to be in Australia's XI at the men's T20 World Cup.
31/10/2021.author: Jessica Longbottom

31/10/2021.headline: Kankurang initiation rite teaches boys discipline and respect in Gambia
31/10/2021.description: Young children run at the fearsome sight of the Kankurang, but in Gambia the figure symbolises a spirit that provides order and justice and is considered a protector against evil.
31/10/2021.author: Jessica Longbottom

31/10/2021.headline: 'What's wrong with saying that?': Some of Bert Newton's most memorable (and controversial) moments
31/10/2021.description: Bert Newton had decades of memorable on-screen moments, many of which delighted and entertained audiences in their thousands. Some were a little more awkward than others.
31/10/2021.author: Jessica Longbottom

01/11/2021.headline: Cute but not cuddly: Dingo pups emerge from their dens on K'gari-Fraser Island
01/11/2021.description: They may look like they'd be happy to be patted, but these dingo pups are apex predators, so it's best to keep your distance. See them exploring the wild on K'gari-Fraser Island.
01/11/2021.author: Johanna Marie

01/11/2021.headline: Beach handball officials scrap bikini rule after outcry
01/11/2021.description: A campaign that brought together the Norwegian women's beach handball team, thousands of supporters around the world and pop superstar Pink has a win, with officials scrapping requirements for female players to wear bikini bottoms.
01/11/2021.author: Johanna Marie

01/11/2021.headline: Police sift through roadside bins to leave 'no stone unturned' in search for Cleo Smith
01/11/2021.description: Police search through rubbish collected from roadside bins and declare they will 'never give up hope' of finding Cleo Smith as they continue their investigation into the four-year-old's disappearance.
01/11/2021.author: Evelyn Manfield

01/11/2021.headline: 'Gone further than we expected': Hongkongers in Australia offered new pathway to permanent residency
01/11/2021.description: The Australian government opens a pathway to permanent residency for Hongkongers, including temporary skilled, temporary graduate and student visa holders.
01/11/2021.author: Joshua Boscaini and Stephen Dziedzic

01/11/2021.headline: Person behind wheel of this 4WD holds key to Queensland murder mystery, police say
01/11/2021.description: Two new images of a Toyota LandCruiser seen leaving the property where the body of 31-year-old mother Rene Latimore was found could be crucial in identifying her killer, police say.
01/11/2021.author: Tobi Loftus

01/11/2021.headline: In search of a stable life: Plan to rehome hundreds of brumbies from Victorian Alps
01/11/2021.description: Parks Victoria will remove all the Bogong High Plains brumbies, and increase the removal rate of feral horses from the eastern Alps, under a plan to protect vulnerable species.
01/11/2021.author: Erin Somerville

01/11/2021.headline: Liberal MPs who quit party should pay back campaign money: proposal
01/11/2021.description: South Australia's Liberal Party is considering punishing party defectors by making them pay back some of the money spent on their election campaigns, after Adelaide Hills MP Dan Cregan quit the party last month.
01/11/2021.author: Stacey Lee

01/11/2021.headline: 'I don't want to be in care, I want to be with you Mum': Coronial inquest begins into suicide of boy in state care
01/11/2021.description: A coronial inquest into the death of a 13-year-old boy who committed suicide while in state care has heard South Australia's Department for Child Protection made critical failures.
01/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

01/11/2021.headline: Excited Broken Hill residents drive 250km only to discover SA border shut
01/11/2021.description: The decision to bar New South Wales residents from entering the state was announced online 90 minutes after the rule came into effect.
01/11/2021.author: Callum Marshall, Bill Ormonde, and Andrew Schmidt

01/11/2021.headline: WA country football player sentenced for umpire assault
01/11/2021.description: The court heard former AFL-listed ruckman/forward Daniel Murray chased and assaulted an umpire after receiving a red card at the match in July.
01/11/2021.author: Sean Tarek Goodwin

01/11/2021.headline: Big business 'sniffs' the green dollar at COP26
01/11/2021.description: Climate change conferences were once the domain of scientists and bureaucrats. Now, they are increasingly attended by big business delegations eyeing off the 'green dollar'.
01/11/2021.author: Andy Park

01/11/2021.headline: 1,000-kilometre Bibbulmun Track record smashed in gruelling 'run, crawl and scramble'
01/11/2021.description: Erika Lori blitzes one of the world's longest walking trails, from Perth to Albany, in just 10 and a half days — shaving half a day off the record set by her coach.
01/11/2021.author: John Dobson

01/11/2021.headline: The Melbourne Cup explained: When is it, how to watch, favourites, prize money and more
01/11/2021.description: It's nearly the first Tuesday in November, so that means it's Melbourne Cup time — but when does it start, how long will the race take, how big a crowd will be there and what is the prize money? Here's your guide to Australia's most famous race.
01/11/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

01/11/2021.headline: 'Extremely angry': Opposition Leader 'bitterly disappointed' over MP's drink-driving incident
01/11/2021.description: Victorian Liberal Leader Matthew Guy says he is "extremely angry and disappointed" about MP Tim Smith's weekend drink-driving incident, while federal Treasurer Josh Frydenberg says it is "clearly unacceptable".
01/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

01/11/2021.headline: Just the beginning for the Parkes Dish, six decades on
01/11/2021.description: The Parkes Dish will help NASA return to the moon, 60 years after the radio telescope helped broadcast the first time humans stepped foot on the lunar surface.
01/11/2021.author: Tim Fookes

01/11/2021.headline: Tasmanian farmland returns to Australian ownership in $120m deal
01/11/2021.description: Farmland in Tasmania's north-west is back in Australian hands for the first time in almost 200 years, as a family-led operation moves in.
01/11/2021.author: Lachlan Bennett and Alexandra Humphries

01/11/2021.headline: 'We are the guinea pigs': Albury-Wodonga fears outbreak will worsen as Sydneysiders return
01/11/2021.description: Regional Victoria welcomes back vaccinated Sydneysiders from today, but one border community worries it could be "bad news".
01/11/2021.author: Charmayne Allison and Sandra Moon

01/11/2021.headline: Jacinda Ardern relaxes NZ restrictions despite record number of cases
01/11/2021.description: Despite New Zealand recording 162 new cases of COVID-19, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern announces some restrictions in Auckland will be relaxed next week.
01/11/2021.author: Emily Clark

01/11/2021.headline: G20 was a win for those opposed to strong action on climate change, but the fight’s not over yet
01/11/2021.description: The crucial COP26 climate conference in Glasgow has been declared to be dead by some before it even starts after the G20 nations failed to deliver any strong commitments at their Rome meeting. But such pronouncements may be premature, Michael Slezak writes.
01/11/2021.author: Michael Slezak

01/11/2021.headline: Jeannette Young sworn in as Queensland's Governor
01/11/2021.description: In a letter to Queenslanders, Jeannette Young said it had been an "absolute honour" to be the state's chief health officer and described the journey as challenging, rewarding and, at times, stressful.
01/11/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

01/11/2021.headline: Australia to recognise more international vaccines for travel, restrictions
01/11/2021.description: More vaccines used overseas but not in Australia are formally recognised by the national medical regulator, paving the way for international visitors in the coming months.
01/11/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

01/11/2021.headline: The 10,000m rule, the 'hit-and-run' or something in between — what does a horse's Melbourne Cup prep look like?
01/11/2021.description: On the eve of the Melbourne Cup, we look at how past winners have prepared for the big race, and how the approach trainers take for the lead-up to Flemington has changed.
01/11/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

01/11/2021.headline: 18yo jockey in induced coma after Kalgoorlie racecourse fall
01/11/2021.description: Apprentice jockey Hannah Fitzgerald remains in a critical condition at Royal Perth Hospital after a tragic incident at Kalgoorlie racecourse on Saturday.
01/11/2021.author: Amelia Searson

01/11/2021.headline: What will life be like for South Australia once borders are open?
01/11/2021.description: Modelling by the University of Adelaide looking at the number of hospitalisations and deaths from COVID is released to South Australians, but what does it all mean?
01/11/2021.author: Sara Garcia

01/11/2021.headline: Japan's newly minted PM defies expectation in big election victory
01/11/2021.description: Despite taking some notable hits, Japan's newly elected Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and his long-ruling Liberal Democratic Party defied expectations to retain a majority.
01/11/2021.author: Sara Garcia

01/11/2021.headline: Cattle and real estate markets are bullish. So would you buy a house or a cow?
01/11/2021.description: While house prices have climbed, beef prices have exploded. Loxton stud breeder Alizah Fogden and her partner decided to use some of the money they had saved for a house deposit to buy more cows.
01/11/2021.author: Eliza Berlage

01/11/2021.headline: Daughter of woman missing for 43 years just wants 'continual nightmare' to end
01/11/2021.description: Kathryn Gray was eight years old when she last saw her mum and, while the memories have begun to fade, the pain of not knowing what happened to her remains.
01/11/2021.author: April McLennan

01/11/2021.headline: Texas anti-abortion bounty hunter law a work of 'sinister genius' proving hard to challenge
01/11/2021.description: The US Supreme Court is facing hearings on abortion laws that promise to set the parameters for the most dramatic month for reproductive rights in three decades.
01/11/2021.author: Kathryn Diss

01/11/2021.headline: ANU college denies it failed in its duty of care over former student's sexual assault
01/11/2021.description: The Australian National University's John XXIII College is appealing the ACT Supreme Court's finding that it failed in its duty of care after a former student was sexually assaulted.
01/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

01/11/2021.headline: 'Organoids' could take the guesswork out of finding the most-effective neurological drugs
01/11/2021.description: About a third of people with epilepsy never achieve effective seizure control, but University of Queensland researchers hope they can soon end the trial and error of treatment and better predict the drug combinations for individual patients.
01/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

01/11/2021.headline: From last in Toowoomba to Melbourne Cup favourite. This is the rise of Incentivise
01/11/2021.description: The five-year-old goes into the Cup on the back of nine straight wins, a streak that began with his maiden victory in April. But his career hasn't always been glorious wins and big pay cheques.
01/11/2021.author: Anthea Moodie

01/11/2021.headline: Families will be forced to isolate for 14 days at home if just one member gets COVID-19 in Queensland
01/11/2021.description: Queensland Health Minister Yvette D'Ath says "opening up" will only work if the state continued to test, trace, isolate and quarantine.
01/11/2021.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

01/11/2021.headline: Queensland's unvaxxed workers could be a legal timebomb, lawyer warns
01/11/2021.description: One of Australia's top employment lawyers says Queensland businesses could be at risk of costly legal headaches if their unvaccinated workers spread COVID-19.
01/11/2021.author: Owen Jacques

01/11/2021.headline: 'It's unfair': The millionaires who want to pay more tax
01/11/2021.description: House prices and the share market have ballooned, but wages are barely growing — a combination widening the gap between those who make money from assets and those who make it from labour.
01/11/2021.author: Daniel Ziffer

01/11/2021.headline: From neglected child to takeover target, what a mega deal says about aquaculture
01/11/2021.description: Moves by a global meat processing giant to take over a local salmon-farming champion suggests Australia's fledgling aquaculture industry is finally growing up.
01/11/2021.author: Daniel Mercer

01/11/2021.headline: Tasmania has been racing to the 80pc fully vaccinated target. Will it cross the finish line today?
01/11/2021.description: In September, Tasmanian Premier Peter Gutwein declared the state was in a race to reach 80 per cent fully vaccinated against COVID by Melbourne Cup day. Is the state likely to reach that milestone today?
01/11/2021.author: Kate Ainsworth

01/11/2021.headline: Sophia loved the high she got from buy now, pay later services — until she couldn't make repayments
01/11/2021.description: Popular buy now, pay later services — two of the biggest players being Afterpay and Zip — are continuing to grow in popularity. However, if you're toying with the idea of opening an account, or multiple accounts, read on to find out the risks first.
01/11/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

01/11/2021.headline: Online subscription services for the pill providing convenient alternative, but doctors warn of risks
01/11/2021.description: For some women, seeing a doctor to renew their script for the contraceptive pill can be costly, inconvenient and in some instances, just straight out stressful, but new online subscription services are providing an alternative.
01/11/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

01/11/2021.headline: 'I can literally never forget': Prachi and Hai lost their loved ones to COVID but their fight isn't over
01/11/2021.description: The ABC spoke to five people from around the world about the toll COVID-19 has taken, both on their communities and on them personally.
01/11/2021.author: Erin Handley, Som Patidar, Sastra Wijaya, Catherine Graue, and Bang Xiao

01/11/2021.headline: Sunshine forecast, roses in bloom as crowds return to Flemington for the 2021 Melbourne Cup
01/11/2021.description: For the first time since the COVID-19 pandemic began, thousands of Melbourne Cup fans will descend on Flemington today to watch in person the race that stops a nation.
01/11/2021.author: Melissa Brown

01/11/2021.headline: She lived to 104 but Moi-Yo Miller's adventures included performing magic in Berlin when World War II began
01/11/2021.description: The world of stage magic in Australia was a male affair, until Esme Levante, Myrtle Roberts and Moi-Yo Miller came along.
01/11/2021.author: Nick Baker and Sacha Payne

01/11/2021.headline: Boris Johnson tells Glasgow climate summit world is facing 'doomsday'
01/11/2021.description: The planet will face "doomsday" if world leaders do not pull off a "James Bond" victory, UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson says at the official opening ceremony of the climate summit in Glasgow.
01/11/2021.author: Isabella Higgins

01/11/2021.headline: 'I have no regrets': Hong Kong activists go on trial over banned Tiananmen Square vigil
01/11/2021.description: Media tycoon Jimmy Lai and the seven others face charges over their roles in an unauthorised vigil marking the Tiananmen Square massacre in Beijing.
01/11/2021.author: Isabella Higgins

01/11/2021.headline: 'I'm not going to cop sledging': Morrison rejects French criticism over submarine deal
01/11/2021.description: Scott Morrison takes aim at what he describes as the French government's "sledging" of Australia, rejecting President Emmanuel Macron's assertion he lied to him about the $90 billion submarine contract.
01/11/2021.author: Andrew Probyn and Matthew Doran

01/11/2021.headline: Biden tests negative for COVID following press secretary's positive result
01/11/2021.description: US President Joe Biden returns a negative COVID test after being tested on his way to the COP26 climate talks in Glasgow.
01/11/2021.author: Andrew Probyn and Matthew Doran

01/11/2021.headline: Indigenous justice advocate named NT Australian of the Year in moving ceremony
01/11/2021.description: The woman described as the "driving force" behind an agreement aimed at reducing Indigenous incarceration rates and improving justice outcomes in the Northern Territory has been named the 2022 NT Australian of the Year.
01/11/2021.author: Myles Houlbrook-Walk

01/11/2021.headline: British bank boss steps down over report into Epstein links
01/11/2021.description: Barclays chief executive Jes Staley steps down following a report by UK regulators into his ties with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
01/11/2021.author: Myles Houlbrook-Walk

01/11/2021.headline: Perth mother jailed after eight-year-old almost died from sexually transmitted infection given to her by stepfather
01/11/2021.description: A Perth mother will spend at least three years behind bars after failing to protect her eight-year-old daughter, who almost died from a sexually transmitted infection after being molested by her stepfather.
01/11/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

01/11/2021.headline: 44yo accused of murdering lifelong best friend with samurai sword faces trial
01/11/2021.description: The court heard Damian Beckerleg and James Reimers had been close mates since they were five, but an afternoon of fishing and drinking earlier this year ended with what the defence called an "extraordinary and tragic" death.
01/11/2021.author: Georgia Loney

01/11/2021.headline: 5 million people have officially died from COVID-19. But who's not being counted?
01/11/2021.description: Five million people — or the equivalent of New Zealand's entire population — have succumbed to COVID-19 worldwide. But that's only the official tally, with the real death toll likely to be as much as four times higher, writes Casey Briggs.
01/11/2021.author: Casey Briggs and Maani Truu

02/11/2021.headline: Unexplained gas funding timeline a 'very dark day for the Commonwealth', Federal Court judge says
02/11/2021.description: Lawyers for environmental advocates question whether the federal government fast-tracked an agreement to provide funding to a gas company in a bid to hinder legal action challenging the grant.
02/11/2021.author: Jesse Thompson

02/11/2021.headline: Attorney-General owns land 'across the road' from forest impacted by port decision, committee hears
02/11/2021.description: A former managing director of the company behind a proposed port on Kangaroo Island tells a parliamentary inquiry Attorney-General Vickie Chapman should have excused herself from the decision-making process.
02/11/2021.author: Stacey Lee

02/11/2021.headline: Elon Musk says he'll donate billions to fight world hunger, but only if a UN agency meets his conditions
02/11/2021.description: Elon Musk, the world's richest person, says he will donate $US6 billion to the UN's initiative to address world hunger if the global body can meet his terms around transparency and accounting.
02/11/2021.author: Stacey Lee

02/11/2021.headline: Former NT police officer found not guilty of aggravated assault
02/11/2021.description: The Alice Springs Local Court heard Chris Tencate was using his taser to create a light show for his infant son during his lunch break and he denied using the weapon to scare his wife.
02/11/2021.author: Samantha Jonscher

02/11/2021.headline: Man charged with attempted murder over violent fight in Darwin suburb
02/11/2021.description: Police charge three men — one of them with attempted murder — after a Karama fight that allegedly involved a number of people armed with poles and edged weapons.
02/11/2021.author: Samantha Jonscher

02/11/2021.headline: PM makes each-way bet on climate change at COP26
02/11/2021.description: While Australians put their money on horses today, Scott Morrison had a wager of his own: An each-way bet that $20 billion in technological investments will either fix the climate crisis, or at least convince other nations Australia is doing enough.
02/11/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

02/11/2021.headline: Man shocked at process to get through WA hard border as he arrives in Perth to see sick mother
02/11/2021.description: A man who made it through WA's hard border to see his sick mother commends the WA Government for wanting to keep people safe, but says he's shocked at the process he had to go through to make it home to Perth.
02/11/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

02/11/2021.headline: 'Shocked and saddened': Alec Baldwin's assistant director calls for reform
02/11/2021.description: Rust assistant director David Halls releases a statement to the New York Post,  saying he is shocked and saddened by the October 21 death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins in New Mexico and the industry must "reevaluate its values and practices".
02/11/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

02/11/2021.headline: World leaders agree to stop deforestation by 2030
02/11/2021.description: More than 100 leaders representing more than 85 per cent of the world's forests agree to end logging but environmental activists are calling for swifter action.
02/11/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

02/11/2021.headline: Vax named 2021's word of the year by Oxford dictionary
02/11/2021.description: The explanation for this word's vast expansion is simply viral. No word better captures the atmosphere of the past year than vax.
02/11/2021.author: Sarah Motherwell

02/11/2021.headline: 'Some of the biggest waste in the nation's history': Questions over $38b in JobKeeper handouts
02/11/2021.description: Analysis by the federal Parliamentary Budget Office found that $38 billion in JobKeeper payments went to employers that did not suffer sustained downturns below threshold levels.
02/11/2021.author: Dan Conifer

02/11/2021.headline: Foster carer details financial troubles in 13yo SA boy's suicide coronial inquest
02/11/2021.description: The former foster carer of a 13-year-old boy who took his own life while in state care tells a coronial inquest that he was unable to care for him because he could not make ends meet.
02/11/2021.author: Mahalia Carter and Claire Campbell

02/11/2021.headline: France's President is calling Scott Morrison a liar. How did we get here?
02/11/2021.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has been called a liar by French President Emmanuel Macron while on the international stage. But did Mr Morrison mislead the French over his intentions on the submarine deal, or was the arrangement already dead in the water?
02/11/2021.author: Mahalia Carter and Claire Campbell

02/11/2021.headline: Women's and Children's Hospital reveals number of unvaccinated staff, protesters gather in Adelaide CBD
02/11/2021.description: The CEO of Adelaide's Women's and Children's Hospital reveals 133 staff have refused to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and have been forced to take leave. Meanwhile, dozens of anti-mandatory vaccination protesters rally in the CBD.
02/11/2021.author: Sarah Mullins

02/11/2021.headline: What caused Hobart's spooky Halloween sunset?
02/11/2021.description: Trick or treaters across Hobart on Sunday saw an eerie sight in the evening sky that mirrored the spooky streets below. But the answer to what caused the strange clouds is fairly straightforward.
02/11/2021.author: Will Murray

02/11/2021.headline: Australia's most decorated Olympian Emma McKeon's message to world leaders gathering in Glasgow
02/11/2021.description: Five-time Olympic gold medallist Emma McKeon joins Olympic and Paralympic champions with a message for world leaders gathering at the COP26 Summit in Glasgow.
02/11/2021.author: Brittney Kleyn

02/11/2021.headline: Where every horse finished in the Melbourne Cup
02/11/2021.description: The Melbourne Cup has been run and won at Flemington - here's where every one of the 23 horses finished.
02/11/2021.author: Brittney Kleyn

02/11/2021.headline: Researcher refuses vaccines because he's had a dose of his own COVID-19 jab
02/11/2021.description: An Adelaide medical researcher who has developed and been administered with his own COVID-19 vaccine says he is facing the sack because of his refusal to get one of the TGA-approved jabs.
02/11/2021.author: Daniel Keane

02/11/2021.headline: Man who allegedly set ex-partner on fire likely used accelerant, court told
02/11/2021.description: Medical experts have given evidence in the attempted murder trial of a man who allegedly set his partner alight, saying the pattern of her burns indicates an accelerant was used.
02/11/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

02/11/2021.headline: Verry Elleegant secures the biggest win of her career, winning the Melbourne Cup
02/11/2021.description: Despite never winning beyond 2,400m going into the race, Verry Elleegant has secured the biggest win of her career with Melbourne Cup glory at Flemington.
02/11/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

02/11/2021.headline: Ho ho ho turns to no no no as Queensland restrictions slay Santa bookings
02/11/2021.description: A Santa hire business has copped a near 80 per cent drop in bookings as Queensland's COVID restrictions cast a pall over the holiday season.
02/11/2021.author: Cathy Border and Kimberley Bernard

02/11/2021.headline: Councillor calls for review of children's books about racism, gender identity
02/11/2021.description: Anti-racism and LGBTQIA+ campaigners reject a Toowoomba councillor's calls to remove children's books discussing discrimination from library shelves.
02/11/2021.author: David Chen

02/11/2021.headline: Why the most important part of Berejiklian ICAC hearings is actually a little boring
02/11/2021.description: The ICAC hearings into Gladys Berejiklian's conduct weren't as explosive as previous probes, but they shone an important light on process, writes state political reporter Ashleigh Raper.
02/11/2021.author: Ashleigh Raper

02/11/2021.headline: Cleo snatched in ‘opportunistic attack’, police believe, as phone footage places her at camp on night in question
02/11/2021.description: Police believe missing four-year-old Cleo Smith was snatched by an opportunistic offender as they work to eliminate from the investigation more than 110 people who were camping nearby at the time.
02/11/2021.author: James Carmody

02/11/2021.headline: Reserve Bank may be pressured to lift interest rates as early as 2022
02/11/2021.description: Markets are betting the Reserve Bank will be forced to lift interest rates sooner than expected in order to contain higher inflation, despite a slow pick-up in wages.
02/11/2021.author: David Chau

02/11/2021.headline: Australian dollar tumbles after RBA decision, ASX to follow Wall Street higher
02/11/2021.description: The Australian dollar fell to 74.3 US cents as the market regarded the Reserve Bank's decision as "dovish", while Wall Street is on track to end its day at record highs.
02/11/2021.author: David Chau

02/11/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: Doctor's association backs delayed freedoms for unvaccinated
02/11/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: The AMA says the NSW government's decision to delay freedoms for unvaccinated residents might be the push some people need to get their first jab.
02/11/2021.author: David Chau

02/11/2021.headline: 'Our most vulnerable group of people': COVID-19 vaccination mandate needed for aged care visitors, peak body says
02/11/2021.description: The peak body for aged care centres wants a mandate brought in for visitors to be vaccinated against COVID-19 but experts are divided.
02/11/2021.author: David Chau

02/11/2021.headline: Here we go again: Another wet, stormy trough on the way
02/11/2021.description: A trough extending from the Great Australian Bight all the way to the tropics is set to bring another soggy few days and the chance of storms as it sweeps across the country.
02/11/2021.author: Kate Doyle

02/11/2021.headline: Australia refuses to join global pledge to cut methane emissions
02/11/2021.description: Australia snubs one of the key global actions to come out of the UN climate change conference by bowing out of an international pledge to reduce methane emissions.
02/11/2021.author: Isabella Higgins

02/11/2021.headline: 'Not unusual it never gets seen again': Boat missing in Tasmania may not be found, says expert
02/11/2021.description: The body of missing Tasmanian man Thomas Courto and the boat he was travelling in are still missing. So how does a boat just vanish in Bass Strait without a trace?
02/11/2021.author: Isabella Higgins

02/11/2021.headline: Foreign Minister to visit South-East Asia to ease fears over nuclear submarine plan
02/11/2021.description: Marise Payne is expected to visit Indonesia, Malaysia, Cambodia and Vietnam in the coming days to calm anxieties about Australia's nuclear submarine program and bed down a new strategic partnership with ASEAN.
02/11/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

02/11/2021.headline: Who's hot, who's not at WBBL halfway mark?
02/11/2021.description: It's the halfway mark in the WBBL regular season, so who's hot, who's not and who's just starting to warm up? Which teams are likely to make a move in the second half of the competition?
02/11/2021.author: Duncan Huntsdale

02/11/2021.headline: 'Clean up our own backyard': Australian miners ramp up plans to cut carbon emissions
02/11/2021.description: Fossil fuels are fast losing favour in Australia as some of the country's biggest miners shift to a greener business model.
02/11/2021.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

02/11/2021.headline: The Australian bushfire survivor taking on Scott Morrison at the Glasgow climate summit
02/11/2021.description: Jo Dodds knows what it is like to be on the climate change frontline, so she went to COP26 to pressure governments into doing more about the crisis.
02/11/2021.author: Ashleigh Barraclough

02/11/2021.headline: Vaccines for children are coming. These are the frontrunners
02/11/2021.description: As vaccination rates across the world creep higher, children are about to get their turn, with the United States due to green-light Pfizer for five year olds.
02/11/2021.author: Ashleigh Barraclough

02/11/2021.headline: Frydenberg warned less than three months into JobKeeper that millions were going to firms with rising turnovers
02/11/2021.description: The ABC confirms the federal Treasurer was alerted less than three months into JobKeeper that businesses were getting taxpayer support for six months while increasing their turnovers.
02/11/2021.author: Dan Conifer

02/11/2021.headline: Australia looks like a climate laggard, as other countries ramp-up efforts
02/11/2021.description: The government is confident Australia will cut emissions by more than 26 per cent below 2005 levels by 2030, but data shows our ambition is insufficient by almost any measure.
02/11/2021.author: Michael Slezak

02/11/2021.headline: 'He needs help, not kicked when he's down': Mum's fight for son's mental health
02/11/2021.description: A Tasmanian mother describes the state's Child and Adolescent Mental Health Service as "a joke" after being told there was no psychologist on staff in the region to help her son.
02/11/2021.author: Emily Baker

02/11/2021.headline: 'You're going to feel seen': New movie puts Western Sydney on the map
02/11/2021.description: A new film which intertwines the stories of eight Western Sydney writers seeks to capture the richness of life in a sometimes forgotten and misunderstood part of Australia.
02/11/2021.author: Rani Hayman

02/11/2021.headline: 'Leave it a better place': How tourism can help combat climate change
02/11/2021.description: Tourism operators might be hoping for a return to normal but a sustainable tourism expert says there is an even better option.
02/11/2021.author: Simon Leo Brown and Victoria Pengilley

02/11/2021.headline: The EU is about to put Australia back on the emissions hook with a carbon tariff
02/11/2021.description: A carbon tariff is a carbon tax applied to exports from countries like Australia that don't have one. And Europe is planning to impose one, whether our politicians like it or not, writes Peter Martin.
02/11/2021.author: Simon Leo Brown and Victoria Pengilley

02/11/2021.headline: 'Made in China' might be cheap, but it comes with a human cost
02/11/2021.description: Heavy consumption in the world's largest economies could be responsible for nearly 2 million premature deaths globally from air pollution every year, according to new modelling.
02/11/2021.author: Olivia Willis

02/11/2021.headline: At least 25 killed as blasts, gunfire hit Kabul hospital
02/11/2021.description: The explosions happened at the entrance of the 400-bed Sardar Mohammad Daud Khan hospital, according to a Taliban spokesperson, who says four of the attackers were killed by security forces.
02/11/2021.author: Olivia Willis

02/11/2021.headline: New figures reveal almost 400 healthcare workers across SA are refusing to be vaccinated against COVID-19
