02/11/2021.description: Almost 400 South Australian health sector workers have been forced to take leave after refusing to be vaccinated against COVID-19, according to figures released by SA Health.
02/11/2021.author: Rebecca Opie

02/11/2021.headline: Beds and medical services cut as Queensland hospital workers defy COVID-19 vaccination mandate
02/11/2021.description: Of the state's 108,000 Hospital and Health Services workers, 3,830 — or 3.54 per cent — have provided no evidence of a COVID-19 vaccination and are not on leave, forcing cuts to surgical, medical and mental health beds, Queensland Health data obtained by the ABC shows.
02/11/2021.author: Rebecca Opie

02/11/2021.headline: Search underway after fisherman falls out of tinnie into Queensland dam
02/11/2021.description: Specialist divers have been dispatched to help look for the man, who fell out of his boat earlier today.
02/11/2021.author: Rebecca Opie

02/11/2021.headline: How will Macron's 'liar' claim play out with Morrison's voters?
02/11/2021.description: Scott Morrison's spat with the French President is bad for his international reputation. But on the home front, the PM will reckon on neutralising Emmanuel Macron's allegation,  writes Michelle Grattan.
02/11/2021.author: Michelle Grattan

03/11/2021.headline: Meet the high-ranking Indigenous soldier blazing a trail in the military
03/11/2021.description: Lieutenant Colonel Eileen Hall, who's been honoured at a ceremony attended by the top brass at her home country in far north Queensland, wants to inspire not only First Nations people but all women to consider a military career.
03/11/2021.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath

03/11/2021.headline: Cleo Smith case 'breaks all the rules' of child abduction, criminologist says
03/11/2021.description: A criminology expert says old-fashioned police work and a million-dollar reward helped find Cleo Smith, whose 18-day disappearance broke "all the rules" of a typical child abduction case.
03/11/2021.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath

03/11/2021.headline: 'Everyone just had tears of joy': Carnarvon locals celebrate Cleo Smith's return
03/11/2021.description: Celebrations are in full swing in Carnarvon as locals breathe a collective sigh of relief over the safe return of Cleo Smith, who was found alive this morning after vanishing from the Blowholes campgrounds more than two weeks ago.
03/11/2021.author: Jessica Warriner

03/11/2021.headline: Expat races to see dying mum after receiving 11th-hour quarantine exemption
03/11/2021.description: Paul Stewart's journey from London to reunite with his dying mother has not been an easy one due to the NT's strict border rules.
03/11/2021.author: Jedda Costa

03/11/2021.headline: 'We're going to take you to see your mummy and daddy': Heartwarming video of moment Cleo is rescued released by police
03/11/2021.description: Police release a heart-warming video of the moment officers rescued four-year-old Cleo Smith, who had been missing for 18 days.
03/11/2021.author: Andrea Mayes

03/11/2021.headline: Las Vegas Raiders release NFL player after fatal car crash
03/11/2021.description: Henry Ruggs III — a rising star in the NFL — is let go by the Raiders following his involvement in a fatal motor vehicle accident in Las Vegas.
03/11/2021.author: Andrea Mayes

03/11/2021.headline: Attorney-General denies conflict of interest around Kangaroo Island house near plantation
03/11/2021.description: South Australian Attorney-General Vickie Chapman tells a parliamentary committee she received rental income from a property that would have been affected by a major port development which she subsequently blocked.
03/11/2021.author: Stacey Lee and Eric Tlozek

03/11/2021.headline: South Australian mother who tried to kill autistic son released into community
03/11/2021.description: A South Australian single mother who was "having great difficulty in coping" when she tried to kill herself and her son is released into the community on licence.
03/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

03/11/2021.headline: Probe finds 'poor leadership', lack of enthusiasm for safety at Caboolture hospital
03/11/2021.description: Empathy training is recommended for all staff at Caboolture Hospital after a probe finds there was poor leadership and a lack of enthusiasm for safety and quality.
03/11/2021.author: Kate McKenna

03/11/2021.headline: Videos of high school student brawl sparks investigation
03/11/2021.description: Tasmania Police are investigating after footage emerged of a fight involving a large number of students at a Hobart high school, with a cyber-bullying expert warning the videos being circulated will only add to the harm.
03/11/2021.author: Will Murray

03/11/2021.headline: Scott Morrison may want to 'move on', but leaking Macron’s private texts only ensures French fury will linger
03/11/2021.description: The Prime Minister may have felt justifiably injured after being branded a liar on the world stage, but this was the time for a cool head, not a hot one, writes Andrew Probyn.
03/11/2021.author: Andrew Probyn

03/11/2021.headline: Police release hospital photo of Cleo Smith as officer recounts 'best moment of his career'
03/11/2021.description: Police post a photo of a smiling Cleo Smith in hospital as the officer who found her in a house in Carnarvon recounts the incredible story of her rescue.
03/11/2021.author: Gian De Poloni

03/11/2021.headline: Darwin shooter apologises in court, explains why he pleaded guilty
03/11/2021.description: Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann, who has pleaded guilty to murder and manslaughter, says there are two key reasons why he changed his plea from not guilty to guilty mid-trial.
03/11/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

03/11/2021.headline: Changes to Queensland's border rules flagged as $1m stimulus comes into play
03/11/2021.description: Motorists may be waved through Queensland's southern border when the state opens up next month. Meanwhile, struggling business owners are cheering a timely new round of discount vouchers.
03/11/2021.author: Heidi Sheehan, Tara Cassidy, and Alexandria Utting

03/11/2021.headline: House where Cleo Smith was found unremarkable, but today it's the nation's focus
03/11/2021.description: The house where missing four-year-old Cleo Smith was found is unremarkable in every way, yet today it is the centre of one of the biggest police investigations in West Australian history.
03/11/2021.author: Andrea Mayes and Joanna Menagh

03/11/2021.headline: 'Move on, frankly': PM says he has no intention of apologising to French President over sub decision
03/11/2021.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says he will not apologise to France after President Emmanuel Macron accused the PM of lies and deceit over a cancelled submarine deal.
03/11/2021.author: Jake Evans

03/11/2021.headline: Penrith Panthers sack NRL premiership winner Tyrone May
03/11/2021.description: The NRL premiers cut ties with May, saying his conduct on social media after the club's grand-final victory "constituted a serious breach of his contractual obligations".
03/11/2021.author: Jake Evans

03/11/2021.headline: Man who used cattle prod to inflict 'sadistic' violence against partner jailed
03/11/2021.description: A man who assaulted his former partner with a cattle prod, threatened her with a gun and forced her to sleep outside has been found guilty of 12 counts of rape and three counts of aggravated assault.
03/11/2021.author: Samantha Jonscher

03/11/2021.headline: Aussie batting star Pucovski 'unlikely' to play first Ashes Test
03/11/2021.description: Will Pucovski is ruled out of Victoria's next Sheffield Shield match as he continues his recovery from concussion, putting the Test batter in doubt for the men's Ashes opener next month at the Gabba.
03/11/2021.author: Samantha Jonscher

03/11/2021.headline: Atlanta Braves win World Series to snap 26-year drought
03/11/2021.description: For the first time since 1995, the Atlanta Braves are crowned World Series champions, after thrashing the Houston Astros in game six in Houston.
03/11/2021.author: Samantha Jonscher

03/11/2021.headline: WA's COVID roadmap to be released on Friday, on the eve of NSW border rules easing
03/11/2021.description: The WA government will release a roadmap on Friday for transitioning to living with COVID-19, a day before it downgrades New South Wales from an "extreme risk" state to "high risk".
03/11/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine and Tom Wildie

03/11/2021.headline: Former minister spent more than $18k in one year paying for Labor memberships, IBAC hears
03/11/2021.description: An electorate officer of former Victorian Labor minister Marlene Kairouz tells a corruption hearing the member for Kororoit would spend thousands of dollars a year on branch stacking by paying for other people's party memberships.
03/11/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine and Tom Wildie

03/11/2021.headline: Federal Court slams criminal case against ANZ as a 'complete shemozzle'
03/11/2021.description: Prosecutors ditch a long-running criminal case against ANZ and one of its senior executives after the Federal Court describes the matter as a "complete shemozzle" and "fairly pointless".
03/11/2021.author: David Chau

03/11/2021.headline: 'Abysmal job of running health': Outback doctor has had enough
03/11/2021.description: A doctor on the Eyre Peninsula says he can no longer tolerate working in a system which he says has little respect for frontline medical and nursing staff.
03/11/2021.author: Evelyn Leckie

03/11/2021.headline: Resources Minister not required to consider climate change when awarding gas grant, lawyers argue
03/11/2021.description: Lawyers for the federal government are arguing the Resources Minister was not required to consider the risks of climate change when determining whether to award $21 million in grants to a gas company.
03/11/2021.author: Jesse Thompson

03/11/2021.headline: The journey to Cleo Smith being found
03/11/2021.description: Police spent 18 days trying to find little Cleo Smith after she disappeared from the remote Blowholes campsite. Here's how the search unfolded.
03/11/2021.author: Sarah Motherwell and James Carmody

03/11/2021.headline: Today's forecast: Cloudy with a strong chance of confusion
03/11/2021.description: Have you ever changed social plans due to a prediction of rain that never came? It might be that you misinterpreted the forecast. So, as outdoor socialising returns, we ask the Bureau of Meteorology, how can we tell if it's really going to rain?
03/11/2021.author: Matilda Marozzi

03/11/2021.headline: Eight million Australian homes aren't energy efficient. Many occupants are battling change
03/11/2021.description: Eight million Australian homes contribute to 18 per cent of Australia's carbon emissions, a new report shows. Enacting any major change is especially hard for renters and people in low-income households.
03/11/2021.author: Emilia Terzon

03/11/2021.headline: Maria James's family calls for a priest's exhumation, if DNA testing doesn't offer answers
03/11/2021.description: At a fresh coronial inquest into the death of a Victorian woman, the coroner warns the family of Maria James they may not get the answers they hope for, however, the answers may be found in a laboratory.
03/11/2021.author: Rachael Brown

03/11/2021.headline: Australia has a submarine-shaped hole in its defences, and few options to fill it
03/11/2021.description: The navy faces a looming headache on how to replace its ageing submarine fleet, one that a hurt French ambassador warns could create a 20-year hole in Australia's defences.
03/11/2021.author: Andrew Greene

03/11/2021.headline: An important detail Morrison omits when he says Australia barely contributes to global warming
03/11/2021.description: China's President was a no show at the Glasgow climate summit. It didn't go unnoticed by world leaders, but pointing the blame at China conveniently leaves out an important detail when it comes to global emissions.
03/11/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

03/11/2021.headline: Australia was planning to phase out caged eggs by 2036, but one state is threatening to derail that
03/11/2021.description: Australia's long-awaited plan to phase out battery hens may be in doubt because of a so-called "captain's call" by a state minister, documents obtained under FOI laws reveal.
03/11/2021.author: Amy Bainbridge and Alison Branley

03/11/2021.headline: Carnarvon residents describe man taken into police custody over Cleo Smith disapperance
03/11/2021.description: Local residents give details about the man living in the house where Western Australia Police found Cleo Smith.
03/11/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

03/11/2021.headline: How can one side of an island get far more rain than the other?
03/11/2021.description: Meteorologists tend to refer to stream weather quite frequently in Tasmania — but what is it? And how does it makes the west wet, and the east dry?
03/11/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

03/11/2021.headline: Launceston's GroWaverley food charity shutting down, unable to keep up with demand
03/11/2021.description: A popular community run food co-op has been providing much needed relief to those unable to afford fresh food, filling a gap in vital community services. However, the volunteers running the co-op can no longer keep it running.
03/11/2021.author: April McLennan

03/11/2021.headline: Everything you need to know about ICUs and the battle to keep COVID-19 patients alive
03/11/2021.description: It's the part of the hospital where health professionals provide specialised and critical care to those who need it most. If you're a COVID-19 patient, it's the last place you want to end up.
03/11/2021.author: Ruby Cornish

03/11/2021.headline: Hope burns a little brighter as Diwali arrives for pandemic-weary Australian family
03/11/2021.description: The COVID-19 travel ban separated Parteek Mittal and Kanu Aggarwal from their youngest child. Now that Diwali has arrived, it's time to put the darkness behind.
03/11/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

03/11/2021.headline: 'It's the best news the town could have asked for': Despair turns to joy for Carnarvon
03/11/2021.description: Searchers head to the local to pub to celebrate after four-year-old Cleo Smith found alive and well.
03/11/2021.author: James Carmody

03/11/2021.headline: What a palliative care doctor has learnt about delivering bad news
03/11/2021.description: After having a painful experience as a junior doctor, Kathryn Mannix learnt how to handle important or 'tender' conversations more successfully.
03/11/2021.author: Sophie Kesteven

03/11/2021.headline: As Australia's border restrictions lift, I'm nervous about returning home. Here's why
03/11/2021.description: Australia may be starting to reopen its borders, but after months of yearning to come home, I find myself nervous about the prospect of returning. I wonder how I can sit at Christmas or Easter lunch knowing the person passing the salt thought it was reasonable to leave me in the wilderness during an international crisis, writes Rebekah Ison.
03/11/2021.author: Sophie Kesteven

03/11/2021.headline: It turns out whales eat a lot more than we thought — but that's a good thing
03/11/2021.description: Whales consume three times more food than previously thought, and their role in ocean ecosystems and the impact of whaling may have been vastly underestimated.
03/11/2021.author: Genelle Weule

03/11/2021.headline: It's hard to remember a PM's trip running off the rails so spectacularly
03/11/2021.description: The Prime Minister was yesterday imploring everyone to "move on" from Australia's diplomatic row with France over the submarine deal. Perhaps they soon will. But it's difficult to see much prospect of repair in the relationship while Morrison and Macron are both in power, writes David Speers.
03/11/2021.author: David Speers

03/11/2021.headline: Meet the detective who found Cleo Smith
03/11/2021.description: Cameron Blaine has worked on some of WA's most high-profile murders, and his appearance in a heartwarming police video of the moments after Cleo Smith was found has endeared him to many.
03/11/2021.author: Andrea Mayes

03/11/2021.headline: How police discovered the 'needle in the haystack' that led them to Cleo Smith
03/11/2021.description: Meticulous police work — rather than an accidental sighting or pure chance — led officers to a home in Carnarvon where they discovered missing WA girl Cleo Smith.
03/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

03/11/2021.headline: Scandinavian nations to confront past crimes against Indigenous people
03/11/2021.description: The governments of Sweden and Finland are setting up truth commissions to examine the countries' past treatment of and abuses against the region's Sami minority.
03/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

03/11/2021.headline: Israeli court halts auction of Auschwitz tattoo kit
03/11/2021.description: An Israeli court suspends the auction of a partial tattoo kit billed as having been used on inmates at the Auschwitz death camp, following an outcry from Holocaust survivors.
03/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

03/11/2021.headline: Thai police chief 'Joe Ferrari' charged with murder over suspect's death
03/11/2021.description: A Thai police colonel known for his extravagant collection of luxury cars and famous girlfriend is charged with killing a suspected drug dealer while trying to extort him for money.
03/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

03/11/2021.headline: 'Read this': Alec Baldwin hits back at claims of 'chaos' on Rust set
03/11/2021.description: Actor Alec Baldwin shares a message on social media disputing reports of chaos and a lax attitude toward safety on the set of Western movie Rust, where he accidentally shot and killed a cinematographer.
03/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

03/11/2021.headline: Mooney scores breathtaking century in Scorchers' WBBL win over Renegades
03/11/2021.description: Opener Beth Mooney smashes an unbeaten 101 off just 63 deliveries, as the Perth Scorchers record a comfortable 40-run win over the Melbourne Renegades.
03/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

03/11/2021.headline: China officials attempt to soothe fears after issuing notice urging families to stockpile necessities
03/11/2021.description: Chinese officials back-pedal after warning families to stockpile food in case of emergencies, after panic spread on social media.
03/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

04/11/2021.headline: Families 'floored' as pair of Secret Santas pay off 82 Christmas lay-bys at toyshop
04/11/2021.description: The couple, who wish to remain anonymous, told the manager of the store that they had vowed to perform such an act of kindness after struggling to pay the bills during their younger years.
04/11/2021.author: Sarah Lawrence

04/11/2021.headline: What this jockey overcame to ride in the Cup has 'amazed' his supporters
04/11/2021.description: Harry Coffey says he's never had so much support for finishing third last in a horse race. The jockey, who rode in this week's Melbourne Cup, hopes his ride inspires others with cystic fibrosis to chase their dreams.
04/11/2021.author: Richard Crabtree

04/11/2021.headline: Department of Justice fined over attacks on staff, including infamous guitar 'scalping'
04/11/2021.description: The Department of Justice and Community Safety has  been convicted and fined $100,000, for failing to provide a safe workplace at its youth justice facilities
04/11/2021.author: Shannon Schubert and Josie Taylor

04/11/2021.headline: Oliver wins record-equalling seventh Oaks after guiding Willowy to thrilling victory
04/11/2021.description: Veteran jockey Damien Oliver triumphs once again in the VRC Oaks, as the James Cummings-trained Willowy pips Douceur in a pulsating finish at Flemington.
04/11/2021.author: Shannon Schubert and Josie Taylor

04/11/2021.headline: Women who planned genital mutilation of newborn baby saw procedure as a 'gift to God', Perth court is told
04/11/2021.description: A mother and grandmother avoid jail after a Perth court is told they planned the genital mutilation of a two-week-old baby because, in their culture, the procedure was seen as 'a gift to God'.
04/11/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

04/11/2021.headline: Fisherman charged with stealing shark detection tag from great white
04/11/2021.description: A West Australian man accused of stealing a detection tag from a white pointer he caught off the state's south coast has denied the charge.
04/11/2021.author: Kyle Pauletto

04/11/2021.headline: Parents of 'luckiest town in the world' welcome Cleo Smith's 'miracle' rescue
04/11/2021.description: Some parents at Cleo Smith's school had to figure out how to tell their kids about Cleo Smith's disappearance and rescue, while others had the good news broken to them by their children.
04/11/2021.author: Kyle Pauletto

04/11/2021.headline: 22 yo Perth quarantine breacher caught on train to Kalgoorlie avoids jail
04/11/2021.description: Bobbie-Lee Coombs, who skipped out on hotel quarantine after returning to WA from Victoria in September and was arrested after catching a train from Perth to Kalgoorlie, has avoided a prison term.
04/11/2021.author: Jarrod Lucas and Amelia Searson

04/11/2021.headline: 'I feel ashamed': Former Afghan interpreter fears for his family still stuck in Afghanistan
04/11/2021.description: Since the fall of Kabul, more than 100,000 Afghans have applied for humanitarian visas. While thousands were evacuated in August, many more remain stuck in Afghanistan.
04/11/2021.author: Alison Xiao

04/11/2021.headline: Melbourne Renegades achieve BBL first after signing Indian batter
04/11/2021.description: Unmukt Chand becomes the first Indian male Big Bash League player after signing with the Renegades for the upcoming season.
04/11/2021.author: Alison Xiao

04/11/2021.headline: Discovery of new breeding pairs gives hope to Granite Island little penguin colony
04/11/2021.description: Their numbers crashed from 1,600 to 16 in recent years and foxes almost finished the job. Now scientists are celebrating a discovery in a little penguin colony clinging to life on a South Australian island.
04/11/2021.author: Malcolm Sutton

04/11/2021.headline: Hackers access mySA GOV digital licence accounts, prompting warning from government
04/11/2021.description: Some South Australians are being urged to change their driver's licence number after hackers using stolen passwords gained access to some users' accounts on SA's digital licence platform, mySA GOV.
04/11/2021.author: Malcolm Sutton

04/11/2021.headline: Former Big Bash player used cricket to build trust with child grooming victims, court hears
04/11/2021.description: Former professional cricketer Aaron Summers pleads guilty to possessing and sending child abuse material and grooming young boys using Snapchat and Instagram.
04/11/2021.author: Kate Ashton

04/11/2021.headline: 'What I said, I stand by': Victorian Opposition Leader reiterates stance on drink-driving MP Tim Smith
04/11/2021.description: Victorian Opposition Leader Matthew Guy is standing by his public demand that embattled Kew MP Tim Smith not contest next year's state election.
04/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham and Yara Murray-Atfield

04/11/2021.headline: Pentagon warns China is growing its nuclear weapons arsenal faster than predicted
04/11/2021.description: A Pentagon report indicates China is expanding its nuclear arsenal much faster than anticipated, saying Beijing could have 700 warheads by 2027 and possibly 1,000 by 20
04/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham and Yara Murray-Atfield

04/11/2021.headline: 'Flying cars' drag race in outback SA as testing for planned aerial grand prix continues
04/11/2021.description: The drones hit speeds in excess of 100 kilometres per hour during the contest.
04/11/2021.author: Declan Gooch

04/11/2021.headline: Hunter New England Health District COVID cases surge past 100
04/11/2021.description: Thirty-six of the new cases were in the Hunter region, with the majority recorded further north.
04/11/2021.author: Madeline Lewis

04/11/2021.headline: Melbourne Cup-winning owner fined for COVID-19 breach during Flemington celebrations
04/11/2021.description: One of Verry Elleegant's owners is fined $10,000 after jumping a fence while celebrating Tuesday's victory at Flemington Racecourse.
04/11/2021.author: Madeline Lewis

04/11/2021.headline: Takeaway coffee cup DNA 'breakthrough' proves crucial in Adelaide cold case probe
04/11/2021.description: The trial in the cold case killing of Adelaide woman Suzanne Poll has heard a takeaway coffee cup proved crucial in the investigation.
04/11/2021.author: Tom Fedorowytsch

04/11/2021.headline: 'We've got her': Police release emotional audio recording of moment little girl found
04/11/2021.description: Police release an emotional audio recording of the moment they burst into a house in the WA coastal town of Carnarvon and found missing four-year-old Cleo Smith.
04/11/2021.author: Andrea Mayes

04/11/2021.headline: Ex-Labor staffer accused of child sex offences claims to have 'no interest in children'
04/11/2021.description: A former SA Labor staffer who admitted to child abuse offences made an "incredible" claim that he was under "duress" and has no sexual interest in children, a court hears.
04/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

04/11/2021.headline: As Victoria's COVID vaccination rate gathers pace, how is your suburb faring?
04/11/2021.description: As Victoria's COVID-19 case numbers stabilise and the vaccination rate climbs, updated data shows how suburbs are faring against the state's targets.
04/11/2021.author: Mark Doman and Katia Shatoba

04/11/2021.headline: Tennis star Peng Shuai accuses former senior Chinese official of sexual assault
04/11/2021.description: The Chinese tennis star accuses a former senior official of forcing her into sex in a social media post that was later deleted.
04/11/2021.author: Mark Doman and Katia Shatoba

04/11/2021.headline: NSW Premier shrugs off questions over future of 'dud' dam projects
04/11/2021.description: Dominic Perrottet has told a budget estimates hearing that reports the government will walk away from the Wyangala and Mole River Dam projects are not true.
04/11/2021.author: Patrick Bell and Hugh Hogan

04/11/2021.headline: Did someone tell you QR codes were illegal? Here's all the information you need to debunk that
04/11/2021.description: A bevy of posts across social media platforms have claimed QR codes and proof-of-vaccination requirements contravene various sections of Australian law. But experts say the claims don't reflect reality.
04/11/2021.author: Ellen McCutchan

04/11/2021.headline: Australia is preparing for COVID-19 vaccines for young children — but how urgent is the need?
04/11/2021.description: As state leaders push for all children to be vaccinated by the year's end, National Cabinet mulls vaccines for younger kids. But the regulator is still waiting for details on safety and efficacy.
04/11/2021.author: Claudia Long

04/11/2021.headline: Uber drivers suspended after raising COVID-19 concerns, Senate inquiry hears
04/11/2021.description: An Uber driver who raised concerns about her passengers' compliance with COVID-19 restrictions found that her account was "deactivated" by the company shortly afterwards, a Senate inquiry has heard.
04/11/2021.author: David Chau

04/11/2021.headline: OCD rates have surged during pandemic — but it's harder to spot
04/11/2021.description: An increase in rates of obsessive compulsive disorder has been seen in both adults and children, with one Queensland clinic recording a nearly 50 per cent increase in enquiries.
04/11/2021.author: Tara Cassidy

04/11/2021.headline: 'Enough is enough': have Collingwood and the AFL acted too late on violence against women?
04/11/2021.description: Jordan De Goey has faced several charges of violence against women during his AFL career, but was not stood down by his club until last weekend.
04/11/2021.author: Kate O'Halloran

04/11/2021.headline: 'Totally mentally draining': Stranded Queenslanders struggle as they wait for state's border to open
04/11/2021.description: The wait continues for the thousands of Queenslanders locked out of the state due to ongoing COVID-19 border restrictions, as some warn of a mental health crisis.
04/11/2021.author: Stephanie Zillman

04/11/2021.headline: The people here were meant to be near the front of the vaccination queue. What went wrong?
04/11/2021.description: As Sydney's vaccination rate soared over 70 per cent, in Yarrabah it was still 24 per cent. How did this town get left behind?
04/11/2021.author: Mayeta Clark

04/11/2021.headline: Australia's largest bank is getting into cryptocurrency. Here's why its competitors aren't
04/11/2021.description: As more younger Australia's choose crypto investments to fast-track their savings, Australia's largest bank now wants a slice of the crypto investment pie. But there's a reason others are trending carefully.
04/11/2021.author: David Taylor

04/11/2021.headline: Drawing from super early and falling through the gaps: These are Australia's 'hidden' guardians
04/11/2021.description: Raising six grandchildren on her own is not how Jill picturing things going as she approached her late fifties. But she is far from alone.
04/11/2021.author: Norman Hermant and Lori Youmshajekian

04/11/2021.headline: 'Good as it gets': Despite COVID-19 respite, Australian hospitals 'overwhelmed' as states prepare for Delta influx
04/11/2021.description: Australian hospitals are already overwhelmed and falling behind, even with the "once-in-a-generation" slowdown in patient numbers that came with COVID-19, an AMA report finds.
04/11/2021.author: Nick Sas

04/11/2021.headline: Can Australia untangle its climate mess? You decide
04/11/2021.description: Here's how Australia could become a renewable superpower by 2030. Sounds too good to be true? You tell us.
04/11/2021.author: Tim Leslie, Ben Spraggon, Joshua Byrd, and Annika Blau

04/11/2021.headline: Sad decline of 'athletic, talented' child detailed in coroner's report
04/11/2021.description: Tasmania's coroner reveals the harrowing story of a man who began life as an "athletic and talented child" but who died, aged 36, from complications of morbid obesity after suffering a long battle with mental illness.
04/11/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

04/11/2021.headline: Kylie was against getting vaccinated. But something changed her mind.
04/11/2021.description: Tasmania is about to reach a significant COVID-19 vaccination milestone, with 90 per cent of the state's population over 16 having had at least one dose. But as the state moves closer to opening, vaccination rates for a vulnerable section of the population is lagging.
04/11/2021.author: Ellen Coulter

04/11/2021.headline: It took authorities months to act when part of an iconic Great Ocean Road town's surf club washed away
04/11/2021.description: The Wye River Surf Life Saving Club lost a $150,000 ramp when the river diverted and water lapped at the building, and locals are frustrated by how slow authorities were to respond.
04/11/2021.author: Ellen Coulter

04/11/2021.headline: Victorian government to 'make illegal logging legal' after tweak to laws
04/11/2021.description: Victoria's water catchments will now have fewer protections against logging, after a change to the legislation by the Andrews government which will allow the practice in previously off-limits areas.
04/11/2021.author: Michael Slezak

04/11/2021.headline: After two years of pandemic pain, hope is shining for these year 12 students
04/11/2021.description: Many of them have weathered one of the longest periods of lockdown in the world. Now, Victoria's class of 2021 is graduating, with some hard-earned wisdom from their extraordinary final years at school.
04/11/2021.author: Joseph Dunstan

04/11/2021.headline: 'A greater awareness of our fragility': John Bell on the role of cultural leaders and the arts after COVID
04/11/2021.description: It's six years since Bell stepped down from the company he co-founded, but the octogenarian actor is showing no signs of slowing down.
04/11/2021.author: Simon Leo Brown

04/11/2021.headline: When missing children return: How can we avoid adding to Cleo Smith's trauma?
04/11/2021.description: The miraculous rescue of four-year-old Cleo Smith prompted a nationwide sigh of relief this week. Now it's time to ensure the aftermath of the ordeal doesn't add to her trauma, writes Louise Newman.
04/11/2021.author: Simon Leo Brown

04/11/2021.headline: Tiger King's Joe Exotic says he has 'aggressive cancer'
04/11/2021.description: Joseph "Joe Exotic" Maldonado-Passage, who gained fame in the Netflix documentary Tiger King, posts a message to social media saying he has been diagnosed with "aggressive" prostate cancer.
04/11/2021.author: Simon Leo Brown

04/11/2021.headline: Detectives face long road ahead to piece together Cleo Smith abduction puzzle
04/11/2021.description: WA police achieved a major milestone when they laid charges against Cleo Smith's kidnapper, but their work is far from over as they painstakingly unravel the events that led to her being held captive in a Carnarvon house.
04/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

04/11/2021.headline: Eternals review: Star power and celestial ambition can't save dull, formulaic Marvel blockbuster
04/11/2021.description: Oscar-winning Nomadland director Chloe Zhao wrangles Marvel's most diverse cast to date, but cannot escape the superhero-movie straitjacket.
04/11/2021.author: Luke Goodsell

04/11/2021.headline: Coalition member hits out at PM over Macron, climate change on Q+A
04/11/2021.description: Greens leader Adam Bandt compares the Prime Minister's appearance at the COP26 summit to a "cigarette salesman in a cancer ward" as Scott Morrison's stoush with the French President is questioned by a fellow Coalition member.
04/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

04/11/2021.headline: 'Trajectory's not good': Great Barrier Reef bleaching study returns worrying results
04/11/2021.description: Repeated bleaching events are reducing the Great Barrier Reef's ability to recover and scientists say the events must be viewed as interconnected.
04/11/2021.author: Holly Richardson

04/11/2021.headline: UK approves Merck's antiviral COVID pill in world first
04/11/2021.description: Britain becomes the first country in the world to approve Merck's COVID-19 antiviral pill, molnupiravir.
04/11/2021.author: Holly Richardson

05/11/2021.headline: Football great and Port Adelaide veteran Russell Ebert dies at age 72
05/11/2021.description: Port Adelaide Football Club veteran and football great Russell Ebert has died from leukemia at the age of 72.
05/11/2021.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Rebecca Opie

05/11/2021.headline: Man charged with sexual assault of a young child in a remote NT community
05/11/2021.description: Northern Territory Police charge a man over an alleged sexual assault of a young child in East Arnhem.
05/11/2021.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Rebecca Opie

05/11/2021.headline: ABBA releases new comeback album Voyage after 40-year hiatus
05/11/2021.description: Swedish pop sensation ABBA has made a comeback with their new album Voyage, nearly 40 years after they split up, with a digital avatar concert eventually planned in London.
05/11/2021.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Rebecca Opie

05/11/2021.headline: Lost moose leaps through classroom window in Canada
05/11/2021.description: Students in the Canadian province of Saskatchewan got an up-close lesson on the animal kingdom yesterday, when a moose crashed through the window of their school.
05/11/2021.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Rebecca Opie

05/11/2021.headline: Geelong signs former Adelaide Crows forward on two-year deal
05/11/2021.description: The Cats are looking to revive Tyson Stengle's AFL career, following his sacking from the Crows earlier this year.
05/11/2021.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Rebecca Opie

05/11/2021.headline: 'I didn't sleep last night': Residents devastated by compulsory acquisition of homes for North-South Corridor
05/11/2021.description: The state government has sent letters to residents whose properties will be compulsorily acquired as part of the last installment of the North-South Corridor.
05/11/2021.author: Rebecca Opie and Stacey Pestrin

05/11/2021.headline: 'Game on': Tourism critical of WA's roadmap while business calls on community to get vaccinated
05/11/2021.description: There's a mixed reaction to the government's roadmap to opening WA's borders, with tourism operators expressing disappointment and the business lobby urging the community to get vaccinated.
05/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

05/11/2021.headline: Scott Morrison COP26 gaffe goes viral on Chinese social media
05/11/2021.description: Scott Morrison's cops a backlash on Chinese social media after referring to "global momentum to tackle China" instead of "climate change" during a COP26 speech.
05/11/2021.author: Joshua Boscaini and Iris Zhao

05/11/2021.headline: Reserve Bank sees wage growth hitting fastest pace in years — by 2023
05/11/2021.description: The RBA says Australia's economy is recovering strongly from recent lockdowns, which bodes well for employment and wages growth.
05/11/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

05/11/2021.headline: The big game George R R Martin is working on just got a trailer. Here's what you need to know
05/11/2021.description: Elden Ring, the big new game that Game of Thrones creator Geroge R R Martin is working on, got a new trailer today. Here's what you need to know about it.
05/11/2021.author: Peter Marsh

05/11/2021.headline: 'Hospitals can't cope already': AMAQ warns of border opening's impact on health services
05/11/2021.description: Cancer diagnoses will be delayed and routine elective surgery will "almost certainly" be cancelled in public hospitals when the Queensland border reopens and COVID-19 cases rapidly surge, the AMAQ warns.
05/11/2021.author: Peter Marsh

05/11/2021.headline: Farmers 'cautiously joyous' after Queensland food bowl is deemed no place for 'big, dirty coal mine'
05/11/2021.description: After years of anti-mine lobbying, the Minister for Resources finds there is no place in Bundaberg for a coking coal mine. But already, farmers are vowing to fight any appeal by exploration company Fox Resources.
05/11/2021.author: Lucy Loram

05/11/2021.headline: Sydney's inner-west light rail shut down for up to 18 months due to cracks
05/11/2021.description: NSW Transport Minister Rob Stokes says all 12 light rail vehicles used on the inner-west service will be out of action following the discovery of cracks last month.
05/11/2021.author: Lucy Loram

05/11/2021.headline: New York mayor-elect Eric Adams says he wants to be paid in bitcoin
05/11/2021.description: Eric Adams says he wants his first three pay cheques as New York mayor to be paid in bitcoin and he will work to make the city the "centre of the cryptocurrency industry".
05/11/2021.author: Lucy Loram

05/11/2021.headline: A multimillion-dollar Canberra arts precinct has been delayed as the government drops developer
05/11/2021.description: A multi-million dollar investment in the arts across the ACT has been delayed, after the government dropped the developer on the project.
05/11/2021.author: Antoinette Radford and Harry Frost

05/11/2021.headline: A US nuclear-powered attack submarine hit something underwater – now its two senior officers have been fired
05/11/2021.description: The USS Connecticut, a nuclear-powered fast-attack submarine, was reported to have struck an "object" underwater in early October under the busy shipping lanes of the South China Sea.
05/11/2021.author: Antoinette Radford and Harry Frost

05/11/2021.headline: Gold Coast must lift jab 'game', Palaszczuk says, as schoolies vax hubs considered
05/11/2021.description: The Premier has taken aim at flagging rates on the border as the government prepares a social media campaign to target young people who haven't been immunised.
05/11/2021.author: Dominic Cansdale and Julie Clift

05/11/2021.headline: Jordan De Goey to 'vigorously defend himself' after being charged in the US
05/11/2021.description: The Collingwood AFL player releases a statement via his lawyer after being charged in the United States last weekend.
05/11/2021.author: Dominic Cansdale and Julie Clift

05/11/2021.headline: 'Tears of joy' in High Court as Johnson & Johnson loses bid to take pelvic mesh appeal further
05/11/2021.description: Pharmaceutical giant Johnson & Johnson has its bid for an appeal to a Federal Court ruling thrown out of the High Court. Lawyers for thousands of women who are part of a class action for compensation say they hope the company takes steps to end drawn-out legal proceedings.
05/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne and Phoebe Hosier

05/11/2021.headline: NT government pulls vaccination stats from website, admits remote region data was inflated
05/11/2021.description: The Northern Territory government removes regional vaccine data from its website after being asked why there was a discrepancy of more than 50 per cent compared to the federal government's figures.
05/11/2021.author: Jesse Thompson

05/11/2021.headline: House with window to the stars wins top architectural prize
05/11/2021.description: An accessible custom-designed home in the NSW Blue Mountains, whose roof opens to a view of the Milky Way, wins a top prize as one of the nation's best designed homes — the Robin Boyd Award for Residential Architecture.
05/11/2021.author: Jesse Thompson

05/11/2021.headline: ABC announces more jobs, funding for regional and rural journalism
05/11/2021.description: Managing director David Anderson says the cash injection will allow bureaus to deliver more local content across platforms.
05/11/2021.author: Joanna Woodburn

05/11/2021.headline: NASA unveils asteroid-fighting spacecraft as it prepares for Armageddon-style mission test
05/11/2021.description: The spacecraft will be launched later this month on a test mission to determine whether crashing into an asteroid can change its trajectory.
05/11/2021.author: Joanna Woodburn

05/11/2021.headline: Father-of-three handed five-year jail term over $500k tax fraud
05/11/2021.description: An Adelaide man who made up employers and income to defraud the Australian Tax Office out of half a million dollars has been jailed for five years.
05/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

05/11/2021.headline: Tasmania hopeful of hosting Ashes Test if Perth is ruled out
05/11/2021.description: Tasmanian cricket officials are expecting the fifth men's Ashes Test to be staged in Hobart should it be moved from Perth because of COVID-19 border restrictions.
05/11/2021.author: Chris Rowbottom

05/11/2021.headline: Net run rate to give cricket fans sore heads tonight, but a better tie breaker may be just over the rope
05/11/2021.description: It may determine the T20 World Cup semi-finalists tonight, but fans can be forgiven for asking: How does net run rate work again?
05/11/2021.author: Jack Snape

05/11/2021.headline: Lockdowns have ended in Sydney and Melbourne so why are many businesses still struggling?
05/11/2021.description: The scarcity of international students has a significant impact on hospitality and other industries in Australia, with some forced to reduce operating hours while others struggle with understaffing.
05/11/2021.author: Farid M Ibrahim and Dong Xing

05/11/2021.headline: 'Wellness warriors' and misinformation blamed for vaccine lag in wealthy suburbs
05/11/2021.description: Some of Melbourne's richest areas are among the least vaccinated in Victoria, figures show, with the trend leaving local doctors concerned about what is to come.
05/11/2021.author: Kristian Silva

05/11/2021.headline: It's a 'priority' technology in Australia's net zero plan. Critics say it's a 'scam'
05/11/2021.description: Part of Australia's net zero by 2050 plan is to use carbon capture and storage to help get emissions down from burning coal and gas. But is it a realistic option?
05/11/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

05/11/2021.headline: 'Oratory can affect the course of history': What Shakespeare's words have taught John Bell over the years
05/11/2021.description: Shakespeare's work has become a secular Bible for actor and director John Bell. Over the past 60 years, it's taught him about empathy, ambition, leadership and the power of language.
05/11/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

05/11/2021.headline: 'COP26 is a failure': Thunberg leads youth from round the globe in Glasgow protests
05/11/2021.description: Students skip school to join teenage activist Greta Thunberg in a youth-led rally outside the COP26 climate change conference, with thousands demanding greater action from world leaders.
05/11/2021.author: Isabella Higgins

05/11/2021.headline: Morrison returns from Glasgow a significantly reduced figure at home and abroad
05/11/2021.description: Somewhere along the way, the idea that Scott Morrison and his government should be judged on how they are protecting the national interest rather than playing the political game seems to have been well and truly lost, writes Laura Tingle.
05/11/2021.author: Laura Tingle

05/11/2021.headline: The weight of a nation's relief hangs heavily on Cleo and her family
05/11/2021.description: No one wants to be that helicopter parent. But then little Cleo is snatched and your carefully constructed, self-confident world falls in, writes Virginia Trioli.
05/11/2021.author: Virginia Trioli

05/11/2021.headline: Nuvali will turn 30 just before 2050. Here's what her world could look like
05/11/2021.description: Summer hibernation, sweltering days, more natural disasters. As the world watches Glasgow, is this the future for Australia’s children?
05/11/2021.author: Maani Truu

05/11/2021.headline: Rise of a superpower: How politics, COVID and the birth of an industry will shape Beijing 2022
05/11/2021.description: In 2008, the world watched as China announced itself on the Olympic stage as a power on the rise. Now 14 years on, the ascension has been swift — and it has ramifications for Beijing 2022, writes Tracey Holmes.
05/11/2021.author: Tracey Holmes

05/11/2021.headline: Remote WA town steamrolled by media attention as Cleo Smith rescued
05/11/2021.description: Usually the small, banana-growing town of Carnarvon is barely worth a pit stop on the 15-hour drive from Perth to the glorious Ningaloo Reef, but the miraculous discovery of little Cleo Smith suddenly attracted the attention of the whole world.
05/11/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

05/11/2021.headline: As many Vietnamese scrape by, a government minister eats $1,000 steak wrapped in gold leaf in London
05/11/2021.description: A video showing Salt Bae feeding a powerful Vietnamese official morsels of steak smothered in gold leaf at a luxury London restaurant sparks anger in the South-East Asian country, where the average person earns a few dollars a day.
05/11/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

05/11/2021.headline: Injured SA workers to receive higher compensation payouts thanks to High Court ruling
05/11/2021.description: Injured South Australian workers will be entitled to hundreds of millions of dollars' worth of additional compensation following a High Court ruling against ReturnToWorkSA.
05/11/2021.author: Candice Prosser

05/11/2021.headline: If you support Taiwan's independence, China won't let you into the mainland, Hong Kong, or Macau
05/11/2021.description: The Chinese government says it has drawn up a list of people who support Taiwan's independence. It's the first time it has articulated punishment for this view.
05/11/2021.author: Candice Prosser

05/11/2021.headline: Floods kill at least six people in Indonesia as thick mud hampers relief efforts
05/11/2021.description: Flash flooding caused by torrential rains on Indonesia's main island of Java have killed at least six people, with three others missing.
05/11/2021.author: Candice Prosser

05/11/2021.headline: Kangaroo Island Mayor storms out of parliamentary inquiry after refusing to answer lawyer's questions
05/11/2021.description: Describing it as a "complete circus", Michael Pengilly storms out of a parliamentary committee looking into Vickie Chapman's refusal of a port on Kangaroo Island.
05/11/2021.author: Stacey Lee

05/11/2021.headline: Death row inmates sue Japan, saying same-day notification of executions is 'inhumane'
05/11/2021.description: In what is believed to be a first, two prisoners facing the death penalty say the practice of being told they will be executed that day is illegal.
05/11/2021.author: Stacey Lee

05/11/2021.headline: 'We can almost hear the grass growing': Outback NT gets a drenching
05/11/2021.description: Some stations surpass their highest daily November rainfall, coming as a welcome relief for many after the Territory's third-warmest October on record.
05/11/2021.author: Stacey Lee

05/11/2021.headline: 'Our family is whole again': Cleo's parents speak for the first time since her rescue
05/11/2021.description: Cleo Smith's parents speak out for the first time since the four-year-old was rescued, saying they are "so thankful that our little girl is back within our arms".
05/11/2021.author: Kate Christian

05/11/2021.headline: Man charged with historical rape of young girl, adding to charges for more than 20 alleged stalking offences
05/11/2021.description: An Adelaide man who allegedly stalked women he met through dating apps and social media is in custody after being charged with sexually assaulting an underage girl.
05/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

05/11/2021.headline: Cambage escapes fine, suspension following Nigerian team incident
05/11/2021.description: Opals star Liz Cambage is handed a formal reprimand after an independent review finds she "brought Basketball Australia into censure" during a pre-Olympic clash with Nigeria.
05/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

05/11/2021.headline: Fence falls on patrol car as man tries to escape police in Adelaide
05/11/2021.description: Police are searching for a man who damaged a patrol car and fence before a pursuit in Adelaide's north early this morning.
05/11/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

06/11/2021.headline: NT police use pepper spray on protestors at anti-vaccine rally in Darwin
06/11/2021.description: Hundreds of protesters demonstrating against mandatory vaccines clash with NT police, who use capsicum spray to disperse them during a standoff in Darwin.
06/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

06/11/2021.headline: Renegades beat the Heat in record WBBL run-fest
06/11/2021.description: The Melbourne Renegades post a team total of 4-207 against the Brisbane Heat — the second-highest in WBBL history — to secure a 15-run victory.
06/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

06/11/2021.headline: Champion sprinter Nature Strip cruises to victory in the VRC Sprint Classic at Flemington
06/11/2021.description: Jockey James McDonald has been the star of the final day of the Melbourne Cup Carnival, riding Nature Strip to victory in the VRC Sprint Classic and winning the Mackinnon Stakes on Zaaki.
06/11/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

06/11/2021.headline: Western Bulldogs AFLW players, staff in isolation following positive COVID-19 case
06/11/2021.description: A confirmed positive COVID-19 case in the Western Bulldogs' AFLW ranks forces the entire program into isolation, two months out from the start of the season.
06/11/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

06/11/2021.headline: London 'Million Mask March' protesters burn effigy of Boris Johnson, set off fireworks
06/11/2021.description: The anti-capitalist event coincides with Guy Fawkes celebrations in the UK, with many of the protesters wearing masks bearing the face of the man behind the gunpowder plot of 1605.
06/11/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

06/11/2021.headline: Aussie Parker wins gold at World Triathlon Para Championships
06/11/2021.description: Paralympic silver medallist Lauren Parker becomes just the fifth Australian to successfully defend a world paratriathlon championship, with a stunning victory in Abu Dhabi.
06/11/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

06/11/2021.headline: Man missing after shark attack at Port Beach in Fremantle
06/11/2021.description: Water police and rescue helicopters are searching for a man after a shark attack off Port Beach in Fremantle.
06/11/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

06/11/2021.headline: Images reveal a slow-motion burial in Canary Islands volcano no-go zone
06/11/2021.description: As residents of La Palma flee their destroyed communities, one photographer captures the final moments of some homes before they are engulfed with volcanic ash and lava.
06/11/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

06/11/2021.headline: 'I refuse to believe': Brazilian singer's death in plane crash met with shock
06/11/2021.description: Marília Mendonça dies in a plane crash on her way to a concert, triggering an outpouring of sadness and shock on social media from Brazilian sport stars, fans and politicians.
06/11/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

06/11/2021.headline: England players arrive in Australia for Ashes series
06/11/2021.description: England players and staff will spend two weeks in a Gold Coast resort with exemptions to train at Carrara after landing in Australia for the Ashes.
06/11/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

06/11/2021.headline: Search for clues in the investigation into Cleo Smith's abduction far from over
06/11/2021.description: Forensic police officers at the centre of the investigation into Cleo Smith's abduction are expected to spend at least the next week at the Carnarvon house where she was found.
06/11/2021.author: James Carmody

06/11/2021.headline: Pfizer says its antiviral pill cuts severe risk of COVID by nearly 90 per cent
06/11/2021.description: Pfizer will ask regulators for the pill to be made available for global use as soon as possible after clinical trials suggested it was 89 per cent effective in cutting the risk of hospitalisation and death from COVID-19.
06/11/2021.author: James Carmody

06/11/2021.headline: NT records one new COVID case as source of current outbreak remains unknown
06/11/2021.description: The Northern Territory records one new case of coronavirus, a 21-year old woman who recently arrived in Darwin from Cairns, on day two of lockdown restrictions in Katherine and a lockout in Greater Darwin.
06/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

06/11/2021.headline: Family breaks down as video of Ahmaud Arbery's last minutes shown at trial of men accused of murdering black jogger
06/11/2021.description: On the opening day of arguments, prosecutors reveal footage of the 25-year-old's fatal shooting, saying he was "under attack" when three white men in pickup trucks chased him through a neighbourhood in Georgia.
06/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

06/11/2021.headline: Richard Williams was in a dark place. Then he found adaptive mountain bikes
06/11/2021.description: The bikes are typically three-wheeled and low to the ground, meaning that not all trails can cater for the riders with a disability. But in WA that's starting to change.
06/11/2021.author: Kate Stephens

06/11/2021.headline: Woman charged with starting six fires on South Australia's Yorke Peninsula
06/11/2021.description: A 48-year old Minlaton woman is charged with six counts of starting a bushfire after the Country Fire Service responded to the blazes near Maitland yesterday.
06/11/2021.author: Kate Stephens

06/11/2021.headline: Step back in time when the 'romantically adventurous' ventured underground
06/11/2021.description: From adventurous honeymooners trekking by candlelight to a feminist discovering the fossil of a seven-foot-six megafauna kangaroo during a sit-in, Ngilgi Cave in Western Australia's South West is rich in history.
06/11/2021.author: Zachary Bruce

06/11/2021.headline: The Brookes family did things the old-fashioned way right to the end
06/11/2021.description: When the Brookes family decided to sell their Port Fairy hardware store of 45 years, they refused countless lucrative offers until they found a buyer who would keep the 100-year-old business alive.
06/11/2021.author: Emily Bissland

06/11/2021.headline: War on viruses over for Victoria's sentinel chickens after decades of bloody service
06/11/2021.description: After almost half a century on the front line in the battle against mosquito-borne viruses, the feathery guardians of Robinvale are being re-roosted to start from scratch.
06/11/2021.author: Kellie Hollingworth

06/11/2021.headline: Come for a selfie, stay for a drink: WA's state art gallery reopens
06/11/2021.description: A new gold lift, a rooftop with 360-degree views of Perth's city skyline and more than 100 new artworks are just some of the changes aimed at creating a more welcoming space.
06/11/2021.author: Emma Wynne and Joanna Trilling

06/11/2021.headline: Queensland records a fourth community case of COVID-19 in Goondiwindi cluster
06/11/2021.description: The unvaccinated woman is the fourth person in the Queensland border town to test positive this week. All cases have been linked to a woman from the NSW town of Moree who had crossed the border to go shopping.
06/11/2021.author: Emma Wynne and Joanna Trilling

06/11/2021.headline: Australia reaches 80pc double-dose vaccination target
06/11/2021.description: Eighty per cent of eligible Australians aged 16 and over have now received two doses of a COVID-19 vaccine, Scott Morrison says.
06/11/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

06/11/2021.headline: Cleo Smith's case touched the nation. But not all missing children's cases will have the same outcome
06/11/2021.description: When Cleo Smith was found, a collective sigh of relief was felt across the country. Sadly, not all who are searching for their missing children will experience the same outcome. Warning: This story contains the name and image of a deceased Indigenous person.
06/11/2021.author: Shahni Wellington and Kirstie Wellauer

06/11/2021.headline: Archaeologists find 'slaves' room' in Pompeii villa
06/11/2021.description: Italy's culture minister, Dario Franceschini, says the find is an "important discovery" that enriches knowledge of "the level of society still little known".
06/11/2021.author: Shahni Wellington and Kirstie Wellauer

06/11/2021.headline: 'Slow-motion car accident on repeat': Diplomats uneasy as France-Australia relationship takes a nosedive
06/11/2021.description: While some diplomats sympathise with France's position, others worry there are much bigger concerns at play — like regional security in the Indo-Pacific.
06/11/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

06/11/2021.headline: Biden finally seals the deal on $1 trillion infrastructure package
06/11/2021.description: US President Joe Biden hails the passage of his trillion-dollar infrastructure package as a "monumental step forward for the nation" after fellow Democrats resolved a months-long standoff in their ranks to finally seal the deal.
06/11/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

06/11/2021.headline: 'Master of my own destiny': Why this conservative town is embracing a radical renewables program
06/11/2021.description: The historic wheat and sheep farming town of Katanning is embarking on a community energy project to change not just how it gets electricity, but who gets the money.
06/11/2021.author: James Purtill

06/11/2021.headline: A powerful symbol of history holds a warning for Australia
06/11/2021.description: The Angel of History is a warning to Australia that we cannot look to the future when our eyes are fixed so deadly on the past, writes Stan Grant.
06/11/2021.author: Stan Grant

06/11/2021.headline: US Secretary of State orders probe into 'Havana Syndrome'
06/11/2021.description: The US State Department has named a new coordinator for its investigation into cases of so-called Havana Syndrome, responding to increased pressure to investigate and respond to hundreds of brain injuries reported by diplomats and intelligence officers.
06/11/2021.author: Stan Grant

06/11/2021.headline: More than 98 people killed by fuel truck explosion in Sierra Leone
06/11/2021.description: A fuel tanker explodes near Sierra Leone's capital, killing at least 98 people and severely injuring dozens of others, after large crowds gathered to collect leaking fuel.
06/11/2021.author: Stan Grant

06/11/2021.headline: Flash flooding and hail as dangerous storms lash South Australia
06/11/2021.description: The worst of the thunderstorms developed around Whyalla before tracking across the state's Mid North and into the Riverland, causing blackouts to large parts of the state.
06/11/2021.author: Gabriella Marchant

06/11/2021.headline: Driver in hospital after allegedly breaching COVID checkpoints, sparking police pursuit in Northern Territory
06/11/2021.description: A driver has been left with minor injuries after crashing his car in an early morning incident that sparked two police pursuits amid a three-day COVID lockdown in the Northern Territory.
06/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

06/11/2021.headline: Australia thrashes West Indies to reach Men's T20 World Cup semis
06/11/2021.description: Australia qualifies for the T20 World Cup semi-finals as opening batsman David Warner scores an unbeaten 89 to secure victory with 22 balls to spare in Abu Dhabi.
06/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

06/11/2021.headline: At least eight dead after stadium crush at Texas music festival
06/11/2021.description: At least eight people are dead and several others injured after a crowd surge at the Astroworld Festival in the US state of Texas.
06/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

06/11/2021.headline: Light rail suspension adds 'one more challenge' to Sydney students as images of cracks emerge
06/11/2021.description: Just weeks after returning to the classroom due to COVID-19, several Sydney schools have copped another blow with the decommissioning of the inner-west light rail due to cracking.
06/11/2021.author: Harriet Tatham

06/11/2021.headline: Victorian quick presses Ashes selection claims in Shield clash against NSW
06/11/2021.description: Australia's pace attack for the men's Ashes appears settled, but a Victorian fast bowler is making sure his name is mentioned at the selection table should injury or poor form affect the hosts.
06/11/2021.author: Harriet Tatham

06/11/2021.headline: Victorian fire services prepare for milder bushfire season with record funding boost
06/11/2021.description: Heavier than usual rainfall suggest Victoria will have a milder bushfire season than previous years, but fire authorities have warned residents to remain vigilant.
06/11/2021.author: Harriet Tatham

06/11/2021.headline: NT police suffer chemical burns amid anti-vaccine protest in Darwin, as crowd pepper-sprayed
06/11/2021.description: NT police use capsicum spray on anti-vaccine protesters in Darwin's CBD, with a commanding officer saying water with "some sort of chemical" was thrown at them.
06/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

06/11/2021.headline: Teens witness shark attack off WA beach, search for victim continues
06/11/2021.description: WA police praise the actions of a group of teenagers for alerting emergency services, after a 57-year-old man is attacked by a shark at a Fremantle beach.
06/11/2021.author: David Weber and Keane Bourke

06/11/2021.headline: Syphilis contact tracers overwhelmed as infection spreads
06/11/2021.description: While attention remains fixed on COVID-19, another, much older disease has been making a rapid resurgence, especially in remote Western Australia.
06/11/2021.author: Ted O'Connor

06/11/2021.headline: Still cool in summer: How passive solar ideas inspired a 1950s builder ahead of his time
06/11/2021.description: This suburban home in Perth's northern suburb of Yokine doesn't look much different from others on the street, but it was built in 1955 using solar design principles that have stood the test of time.
06/11/2021.author: Emma Wynne

06/11/2021.headline: Rallies in Glasgow and Sydney call for 'survival of humanity' in face of climate change
06/11/2021.description: Tens of thousands gather in Scotland's largest city and around the world calling for greater action on climate change as the COP26 conference continues.
06/11/2021.author: Emma Wynne

06/11/2021.headline: Mercedes in the box seat as Bottas and Hamilton lock out the front row in Mexico
06/11/2021.description: Valtteri Bottas takes a surprise pole position ahead of seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton as Mercedes lock out the front row for the Mexico City Grand Prix.
06/11/2021.author: Emma Wynne

06/11/2021.headline: Smile back on face of Redbacks cricketer who 'headbutted' propeller in fishing accident
06/11/2021.description: Tim Oakley knew with "half his face hanging off" he was in trouble as he swam for help off the Adelaide coast on a winter's day. He would end up getting 55 stitches.
06/11/2021.author: Matthew Smith

06/11/2021.headline: 'A big step backwards': United outclassed by City in dismal Manchester derby defeat
06/11/2021.description: Manchester United are soundly beaten 2-0 by local rivals Manchester City as pressure again swells around struggling manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.
06/11/2021.author: Matthew Smith

06/11/2021.headline: Christmas ‘extravaganza’ planned for Melbourne as part of COVID lockdown recovery
06/11/2021.description: There are concerns signs of strain are showing in Victoria's health system as the state records 1,173 new cases and nine deaths, and as the state government tries to restart Melbourne's economy.
06/11/2021.author: Matthew Smith

06/11/2021.headline: Teachers withdraw as vaccination deadline looms
06/11/2021.description: A school in New South Wales' Byron Bay region is bracing for the loss of a third of its staff, as a government-imposed vaccination deadline looms.
06/11/2021.author: Bronwyn Herbert, Bruce MacKenzie, and Miranda Saunders

07/11/2021.headline: NT records no new COVID cases as lockout restrictions extended in Greater Darwin, announced for Katherine
07/11/2021.description: The NT records no new cases of coronavirus overnight, but Greater Darwin's lockout will be extended until midnight tomorrow. From 3pm, Katherine's lockdown will become a lockout, also until tomorrow night.
07/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

07/11/2021.headline: Exposure site list grows in NT as Territorians await decision on lockdown and lockout
07/11/2021.description: More venues are added to the NT government's public exposure site list, with residents in Katherine and Greater Darwin expected to today find out whether lockdown and lockout restrictions will end at midnight as scheduled.
07/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

07/11/2021.headline: Only two COVID patients in Western Sydney hospitals as major vaccination clinic shuts
07/11/2021.description: A vaccine hub in Western Sydney will close today as the government focuses on the rollout of booster shots which it expects most people to get at GPs and pharmacies.
07/11/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

07/11/2021.headline: Iraq's PM survives assassination bid by 'explosives-laden' drone
07/11/2021.description: Iraqi officials say seven security guards were injured in the attack at the PM's home in Baghdad's heavily fortified Green Zone.
07/11/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

07/11/2021.headline: Avocados dumped amid glut in domestic supply and imports from overseas
07/11/2021.description: West Australian avocado growers are dumping fruit because it's not worth the cost of packing and sending it to market.
07/11/2021.author: Jessica Hayes and Lucinda Jose

07/11/2021.headline: Cairns, Mission beach on alert as woman COVID-19 positive after travelling through Queensland
07/11/2021.description: Queensland issues contact tracing alerts for locations in Cairns and Mission Beach after a person tested positive for COVID-19 in the Northern Territory after transiting through the region.
07/11/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

07/11/2021.headline: How many weeks does it take to find a job near you? Search this table and see
07/11/2021.description: The number of weeks it's taking to find a job is the statistic politicians should be competing over, writes Gareth Hutchens.
07/11/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

07/11/2021.headline: Four-year-old twin sisters die in house fire near Byron Bay
07/11/2021.description: Investigators are working to determine the cause of a fatal house fire in northern NSW early this morning that claimed the lives of two young sisters.
07/11/2021.author: Jean Kennedy

07/11/2021.headline: Search for man after shark attack uncovers pair of goggles, but little else
07/11/2021.description: A search for a man believed taken by a shark off a Fremantle beach so far uncovers just a pair of goggles, with authorities unsure if they belong to the swimmer.
07/11/2021.author: Keane Bourke

07/11/2021.headline: Five more schools exposed to COVID-19 as ACT records 13 new cases, reaches 95 per cent full vaccination
07/11/2021.description: The ACT records 13 new cases of COVID-19 with five more schools exposed to the virus. Meanwhile, the territory becomes the first Australian jurisdiction to reach 95 per cent full vaccination.
07/11/2021.author: Penny Travers

07/11/2021.headline: Police investigate apparent needle spiking in Astroworld concert crush
07/11/2021.description: Eyewitnesses describe the pandemonium that unfolded in the crowd of rapper Travis Scott's Astroworld concert as at least eight people were killed in a sudden crushing incident.
07/11/2021.author: Penny Travers

07/11/2021.headline: How Tony Abbott helped build a bridge to net zero
07/11/2021.description: Ironically, given his attitude to climate change, former Prime Minister Tony Abbott inadvertently created the framework for a carbon price when he axed Julia Gillard's carbon tax, writes Ian Verrender.
07/11/2021.author: Ian Verrender

07/11/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: State government joins federal forum to achieve net zero; Western Sydney opens booster shot hub
07/11/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: New South Wales government signals more ambitions to cut greenhouse gas emissions than the federal government, while new vaccination centre opens in Western Sydney, as state turns its attention to booster shots.
07/11/2021.author: Ian Verrender

07/11/2021.headline: Wet and wild weather likely to continue all week for southern Queensland
07/11/2021.description: A wet and stormy week is expected for large parts of Queensland as the Bureau of Meteorology forecasts widespread severe thunderstorms.
07/11/2021.author: Ian Verrender

07/11/2021.headline: Five graphs that show Victoria is on the move again
07/11/2021.description: From the feet hitting the pavement, to the cars on the roads and planes in the sky — these are the graphs that show how Victorians are reclaiming their freedom of movement after weeks of lockdown.
07/11/2021.author: Casey Briggs and Joseph Dunstan

07/11/2021.headline: 'My future is at stake': What it's like growing up in the Pacific, on the frontline of climate change
07/11/2021.description: Children and young people in the Pacific have grown up in the shadow of climate change, watching rising sea levels swallow landscapes and waiting in fear for the next natural disaster to strike.
07/11/2021.author: Jordan Fennell, Tahlea Aualiitia, and Edwina Seselja

07/11/2021.headline: Representation, equality and respect: Being queer in politics
07/11/2021.description: While every pollie's time in office is different, for Chansey Paech, Dr Kerryn Phelps and Tim Wilson there are a few similarities between their experiences and the way they've approached public life.
07/11/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

07/11/2021.headline: COVID-19 restrictions are being eased in NSW today — this is what's changing
07/11/2021.description: New freedoms for those who are fully vaccinated come into effect after the NSW government moves its COVID-19 roadmap forward. Here's what's changed.
07/11/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

07/11/2021.headline: The mystery backers of a divisive multi-million dollar beachside development have shocked locals
07/11/2021.description: Untouched beaches and native wildlife are why Hawks Nest residents love their home. All of that could change if the Obeid family get their way.
07/11/2021.author: Laura Gartry, Nick Wiggins, Lucy Carter, and Jeanavive McGregor

07/11/2021.headline: Justine’s Ruszczyk’s family says killer cop’s reduced sentence not enough for ‘obscene’ shooting
07/11/2021.description: This is how an Australian family challenged a US policing system and its use of brutal force. But for Justine’s Ruszczyk's family there is more to be done to ensure their daughter’s "obscene" death was not in vain.
07/11/2021.author: Susan Chenery, Rebecca Latham, and Jennifer Feller

07/11/2021.headline: New Zealand advances to T20 World Cup semi-finals at expense of India
07/11/2021.description: Captain Kane Williamson guides New Zealand to an eight-wicket victory at the Zayed Cricket Stadium in Abu Dhabi in a result that eliminates India ahead of its match against Namibia on Monday.
07/11/2021.author: Susan Chenery, Rebecca Latham, and Jennifer Feller

07/11/2021.headline: Allegations of Liberal Party branch stacking involving Assistant Treasurer Michael Sukkar aired in defamation case
07/11/2021.description: The allegations against the federal MP are detailed in documents filed in the Federal Court as part of defamation proceedings brought by a former Liberal Party factional figure.
07/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

07/11/2021.headline: 'Bit of a weird one to celebrate': Jamie Whincup wins Sydney Supernight in Eastern Creek deluge
07/11/2021.description: Race officials call all cars in with seven laps remaining as conditions worsen around Sydney Motorsport Park, giving Whincup his second victory of the season and the 124th of his career.
07/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

07/11/2021.headline: Indian village marks end of Diwali with massive cow poo fight
07/11/2021.description: Joyful crowds pelt each other with fistfuls of cow manure as part of one village's local ritual to mark the end of Diwali, India's most important Hindu festival.
07/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

07/11/2021.headline: Hurricanes rescue innings from potential record low WBBL score, but go down to Scorchers
07/11/2021.description: Hobart Hurricanes fight back to avoid lowest-ever WBBL total, but their target of 97 proves no big challenge for the Perth Scorchers.
07/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

07/11/2021.headline: 'A needless tragedy': NT Police treating woman's death after structure fire in Central Australia as homicide
07/11/2021.description: Police launch an investigation into the death of the woman after emergency services were called to the fire at a residence in the Hidden Valley Town Camp, at 11pm on Friday.
07/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

07/11/2021.headline: How do crowd surges become deadly?
07/11/2021.description: Tragedies like the fatal crowd crush this week at Travis Scott’s Astroworld Music Festival have been happening for a long time. Here's why.
07/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

07/11/2021.headline: At least 19 people dead after truck smashes into toll booth, six vehicles in Mexico
07/11/2021.description: The truck's brakes are believed to have failed as it was nearing a tool booth where it hit other vehicles, igniting a large fire on a highway.
07/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

07/11/2021.headline: Canelo Alvarez the unified super middleweight champ after knocking out Caleb Plant
07/11/2021.description: Mexican fighter Canelo Alvarez becomes the sixth man to hold all four world super middleweight boxing titles at the same time, after his win over American Caleb Plant in Las Vegas.
07/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

07/11/2021.headline: Police Commissioner labels anti-vaccine protesters who clashed with police as 'pretty disgraceful' following arrests
07/11/2021.description: Police say they are continuing to investigate a protest during Greater Darwin's lockout that turned violent on Saturday afternoon and say more arrests could be forthcoming.
07/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

07/11/2021.headline: SA Health says it is 'unlikely' woman who sparked NT COVID-19 lockdown was infectious in state
07/11/2021.description: SA Health says it is unlikely the woman who sparked the NT lockdown was infectious while in the state.
07/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

07/11/2021.headline: Death of pregnant woman ignites debate about abortion ban in Poland
07/11/2021.description: The 30-year-old woman went to hospital after her waters broke but she died on the way to the operating theatre, with critics of Poland's near-total abortion ban blaming her death on laws introduced in January.
07/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

08/11/2021.headline: Conflict of interest declaration was 'likely' in Attorney-General Kangaroo Island port matter, email states
08/11/2021.description: Emails from the SA Attorney-General's ministerial planning adviser show he understood the minister would "likely" declare a conflict of interest before she refused a port on Kangaroo Island.
08/11/2021.author: Stacey Lee

08/11/2021.headline: Father of soldier killed in Afghanistan hits out at Defence for 'intimidation' and 'threats' toward families
08/11/2021.description: The father of an Australian soldier murdered in Afghanistan claims families were threatened and intimidated by the Defence Department against speaking about details of the 2012 attack.
08/11/2021.author: Andrew Greene

08/11/2021.headline: Police say fuel used in alleged domestic violence-related Alice Springs fire that killed woman
08/11/2021.description: Police say more than a dozen witnesses have given statements and investigations are ongoing following an alleged domestic violence-related homicide at Hidden Valley Town Camp on Friday.
08/11/2021.author: Samantha Jonscher

08/11/2021.headline: 'We’re all not the same': Former Don Dale detainees speak in support of $35 million class action
08/11/2021.description: Lawyers are seeking more time to sign up hundreds of former youth justice detainees to the multi-million-dollar compensation claim, while a federal court takes time to consider if the settlement sum is fair and reasonable.
08/11/2021.author: Kate Ashton

08/11/2021.headline: Astronomers catch over a third of all gravitational waves ever found in just five months
08/11/2021.description: The addition of 35 new confirmed observations of these tiny ripples in the fabric of space time takes the tally to 90 detections since 2015.
08/11/2021.author: Genelle Weule

08/11/2021.headline: Man who assaulted two ex-partners seeks to have jail term reduced
08/11/2021.description: The lawyer for the Mildura man argues a "punitive" non-alcohol order was not properly taken into account at his sentencing last year.
08/11/2021.author: Richard Crabtree

08/11/2021.headline: Travis Scott, Astroworld organisers sued for at least $1 million as victims remembered
08/11/2021.description: A clearer picture emerges of the eight victims who died at the Astroworld Festival during a crowd crush as one injured concertgoer sues rapper and event founder Travis Scott for $1 million in damages.
08/11/2021.author: Richard Crabtree

08/11/2021.headline: 'We can no longer be friends': Farmer warns climate change deniers, after storm devastates crop
08/11/2021.description: Storms have devastated more crops in South Australia's mid north, prompting a farmer to publicly declare he was cutting social ties with any climate change deniers.
08/11/2021.author: Gillian Aeria and Lucas Forbes

08/11/2021.headline: Child care provider fined after kids escape and almost run onto busy road
08/11/2021.description: Dashcam footage captured the moment the toddlers were running along the busy Gold Coast street before a woman and school children came to their aid
