12/11/2021.headline: Torrential downpours, raging rivers and blocked roads: Alice Springs' wettest November on record
12/11/2021.description: Torrential downpours, a dry river flooded, a dramatic rescue and city traffic jams in the outback — and it's only halfway through the month.
12/11/2021.author: Saskia Mabin

12/11/2021.headline: Gippsland's wild weather not over yet as rain buckets down
12/11/2021.description: Authorities have issued a major flood warning for the Mitchell River in the east of Victoria, which is expected to peak above 5 metres this afternoon.
12/11/2021.author: Riordan Davis

12/11/2021.headline: Trump ally Steve Bannon accused of contempt of Congress after defying subpoena
12/11/2021.description: Steve Bannon, a long-time ally to former US president Donald Trump, has been indicted on two counts of contempt of Congress after defying a congressional subpoena from the House committee investigating the insurrection at the US Capitol.
12/11/2021.author: Riordan Davis

12/11/2021.headline: The cartoons changing lives: Indigenous group's gender-equity campaign success
12/11/2021.description: A social media campaign challenges gender stereotypes, creates positive images of Indigenous children, and aims to stop the violence against women.
12/11/2021.author: Samantha Jonscher

13/11/2021.headline: Katherine face mask mandate extended until Monday afternoon
13/11/2021.description: Katherine residents must continue wearing face masks for a further 48 hours as authorities continue to test wastewater samples for COVID-19.
13/11/2021.author: Samantha Dick

13/11/2021.headline: Fringe Test quick's Ashes stocks rise in WA's Sheffield Shield victory
13/11/2021.description: Jhye Richardson may be the next in line if one of Australia's fast bowlers falters in the men's Ashes, after his eight-wicket haul helps propel Western Australia to a comfortable win over Queensland.
13/11/2021.author: Samantha Dick

13/11/2021.headline: Taylor Swift's heartbreak anthem has been re-recorded with revealing extra lyrics
13/11/2021.description: All Too Well was never released as a single, but it quickly became a fan favourite. Now it's 10 minutes long and has its own short film.
13/11/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

13/11/2021.headline: Lawsuits filed by more than 200 people who claim to have been injured in Astroworld crowd surge
13/11/2021.description: Lawyers representing more than 200 people claiming they were injured in last week's Astroworld Festival stampede are filing another 90 lawsuits against the promoters of the event in which at least nine people died.
13/11/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

13/11/2021.headline: US high jumper awarded 2012 Olympic gold medal nine years after London Games
13/11/2021.description: Erik Kynard is upgraded from silver to gold, following the International Olympic Committee's decision to reallocate medals from 2012 because of doping cases.
13/11/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

13/11/2021.headline: Charles Perkins Oration: Why truth-telling and treaties are needed to reconcile Australia's past
13/11/2021.description: Tony McAvoy SC has used the 2021 Charles Perkins Memorial Oration to advocate for the establishment of truth commissions and treaties with Australia's First Peoples, labelling the often-used assertion that Aboriginal people should 'stop living in the past' as "not possible".
13/11/2021.author: Jai McAllister

13/11/2021.headline: 'Pingu' the lost Antarctic penguin swims 3,000 kilometres to New Zealand
13/11/2021.description: An Adélie penguin swims to the shores of New Zealand, at least 3,000 kilometres from its natural habitat of Antarctica.
13/11/2021.author: Jai McAllister

13/11/2021.headline: French authorities investigate alleged rape of soldier at Elysee Palace
13/11/2021.description: Both soldiers were stationed at the Elysee Palace, where French President Emmanuel Macron resides, but the accused man has since been moved away from his post.
13/11/2021.author: Jai McAllister

13/11/2021.headline: 'It's about choice': The people at the heart of the NSW euthanasia law debate
13/11/2021.description: As NSW politicians continue debating the proposed voluntary assisted dying bill, the people it affects remain in limbo.
13/11/2021.author: Nick Parmeter and Luisa Rubbo

13/11/2021.headline: 'I think they're going to sit it out': Family bogged in desert likely to be there all weekend
13/11/2021.description: Rescue authorities are currently working on a plan to retrieve a family from Perth who are trapped in outback South Australia because of torrential downpours.
13/11/2021.author: Daniel Keane

13/11/2021.headline: Man killed in plane crash weeks after Blue Origin flight into space
13/11/2021.description: Glen de Vries, a tech company founder who travelled to space with TV star William Shatner on a rocket owned by Jeff Bezos's company last month, is among two people killed in a small plane crash in New Jersey.
13/11/2021.author: Daniel Keane

13/11/2021.headline: Netherlands enters three-week partial lockdown amid COVID surge
13/11/2021.description: The lockdown is the first to start in western Europe since a new wave of infections began surging across parts of the continent.
13/11/2021.author: Daniel Keane

13/11/2021.headline: The automotive plant that helped shift gears on equality
13/11/2021.description: A new exhibition in Albury is celebrating the history of a manufacturing plant that helped smooth the road for greater gender equality in Australia's workforce.
13/11/2021.author: Allison Jess

13/11/2021.headline: Could older workers help WA through its worst-ever staff shortage?
13/11/2021.description: The hospitality industry says more can be done to entice older workers, retirees, pensioners or anyone in between to help alleviate a labour crisis that's largely a result of continued border closures.
13/11/2021.author: Georgia Loney

13/11/2021.headline: Are Australia's hawksbill turtles safe from the deadly tortoiseshell trade?
13/11/2021.description: As the illegal trade in tortoiseshell items expands in Asia, scientists track the critically endangered hawksbill turtles off the Western Australian coast to see if they are safe.
13/11/2021.author: Laura Birch

13/11/2021.headline: 'It lifts my spirits': An embattled community picks up the threads
13/11/2021.description: They call themselves the Bobin Sew 'n' Sews, and they meet each week to sew and most importantly, talk. The group, formed in the aftermath of devastating bushfires, is helping a community heal.
13/11/2021.author: Emma Siossian

13/11/2021.headline: PSG player released from custody after teammate attacked
13/11/2021.description: PSG midfielder Aminata Diallo has denied being involved in an alleged assault on her teammate Kheira Hamraoui, who was pulled out of a car and attacked by two masked men.
13/11/2021.author: Emma Siossian

13/11/2021.headline: When COVID and burnout led Fred back home, he found unexpected happiness
13/11/2021.description: Growing up, Fred Porter was desperate to leave his remote family farm for a far-flung place. But facing burnout and lockdowns, the marketing consultant returned home, finding happiness combining city work with country living.
13/11/2021.author: Samille Mitchell

13/11/2021.headline: Queensland records zero locally acquired COVID-19 cases as state inches towards 70pc double dose vaccine target
13/11/2021.description: Queensland records zero locally acquired cases of COVID-19 as residents on the Gold Coast are urged to continue coming forward for testing following unknown cases earlier this week.
13/11/2021.author: Ciara Jones

13/11/2021.headline: Harry Kane as good as sends England to 2022 World Cup
13/11/2021.description: England have made short work of Albania, all but booking their place in Qatar, but European Champions Italy have been held against Switzerland and must now beat Northern Ireland well on Monday to be certain of progressing.
13/11/2021.author: Ciara Jones

13/11/2021.headline: Marc lost a military career and had PTSD. He never thought bees would be what saved him
13/11/2021.description: The Air Force veteran struggled to leave his house in Adelaide, years after a serious incident in Afghanistan left him traumatised. He came across beekeeping by chance and is sharing their healing power with other veterans, first responders and their famili
13/11/2021.author: Bec Whetham and Daniel Franklin

13/11/2021.headline: 'You can't enter the stadiums': Cameron Smith issues blunt warning to unvaccinated NRL players
13/11/2021.description: Speaking at the City of Logan Sports Awards near Brisbane, Smith says NRL players who refuse to be vaccinated against COVID-19 will find it almost impossible to fulfil the requirements of their contracts.
13/11/2021.author: Jason Dasey

13/11/2021.headline: 'You can't be Aboriginal': Winner of the Dr Charles Perkins Prize says don't let others define who you are
13/11/2021.description: Benjamin Wilson dismissed slurs he was told at school and instead focused on storytelling and learning – which now sees him named a recipient of the Dr Charles Perkins Memorial Prize.
13/11/2021.author: Dan Bourchier

13/11/2021.headline: The Amazon could cover three quarters of Australia. It's 'in danger of becoming a savannah'
13/11/2021.description: For 55 million years, heavy rain has brought life and splendour to the Amazon rainforest. But we're approaching a tipping point.
13/11/2021.author: Zoe Kean

13/11/2021.headline: The many faces of Greg Norman's Saudi-backed golf revolution
13/11/2021.description: Greg Norman says he wants to awaken a sleeping giant of the golf world. The Asian Tour simply wants to stay alive. Saudi Arabia's intentions are altogether more questionable — these strange bedfellows could be about to change the game.
13/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

13/11/2021.headline: 'I slid headfirst for about 70 metres': Britt Cox is glad she can't remember the crash that almost ended her career
13/11/2021.description: Moguls skier Britt Cox was taking on the world and winning, until she broke her collarbone and six ribs in a crash. Determined to get back into form, she's now eyeing a fourth Winter Olympics.
13/11/2021.author: Daniela Intili

13/11/2021.headline: Why is a country led by a Peace Prize winner on the brink of all-out civil war?
13/11/2021.description: Rebels are closing in on the Ethiopian capital as millions face "catastrophic famine conditions" and alleged "ethnic cleansing" in the Tigray region.
13/11/2021.author: Daniela Intili

13/11/2021.headline: 'I felt like a prisoner': Here's what it's like to live under a conservatorship like Britney Spears
13/11/2021.description: Jenny Hatch is among more than a million Americans who've lived under strict legal arrangements where their every move was controlled by someone else. Now that the Britney Spears case has shone the spotlight on conservatorships, advocates are pushing for change.
13/11/2021.author: Barbara Miller

13/11/2021.headline: The West is staring down Chinese power — but do we know what's worth fighting for?
13/11/2021.description: To talk about notions of honour or society can seem hopelessly conservative today, even reactionary. But the question remains: what to we replace them with, asks Stan Grant.
13/11/2021.author: Stan Grant

13/11/2021.headline: Two billion vaccines, a lofty goal and unmet promises: How rich nations have failed the world
13/11/2021.description: More booster shots have now been administered in high income countries than the total number of doses given in low income countries since the pandemic began.
13/11/2021.author: Casey Briggs

13/11/2021.headline: Sara Duterte is running for vice-president of the Philippines, and she may have to take her father on
13/11/2021.description: The popular longtime mayor's candidacy for vice-president comes as a surprise because opinion polls show her ahead in the race for preferred presidential candidate.
13/11/2021.author: Casey Briggs

13/11/2021.headline: Third COP26 draft ensures rich nations deliver climate promises
13/11/2021.description: The new COP26 draft agreement also maintains a core demand for countries to set more ambitious plans to tackle global warming and asked them to phase out inefficient subsidies for the fossil fuels heating the planet.
13/11/2021.author: Casey Briggs

13/11/2021.headline: De Pasquale claims another Sydney win in Supercars Championship
13/11/2021.description: Anton De Pasquale continues to dominate the Sydney Motorsport Park circuit, securing his fifth win of 2021 and fourth in three weekends.
13/11/2021.author: Casey Briggs

13/11/2021.headline: 'Like a giant tin can hitting the water': Two men escape serious injury after light plane crashes off Perth beach
13/11/2021.description: Two men escape serious injury after a light plane crashes into the ocean off a popular Perth beach.
13/11/2021.author: Casey Briggs

13/11/2021.headline: Aussies bracing for Black Caps to 'fight and scrap' in T20 World Cup decider
13/11/2021.description: Australia knows the challenge they will face from New Zealand in the men's T20 World Cup final, especially after the Black Caps knocked England out of the tournament in the semis.
13/11/2021.author: Casey Briggs

14/11/2021.headline: Tasmania records new COVID case after man arrives on flight from Brisbane
14/11/2021.description: The Victorian man was meant to travel to Melbourne via Hobart without leaving the airport. But after his arrival, Tasmanian authorities were notified by their counterparts in Queensland he had returned a positive test.
14/11/2021.author: Alexandra Alvaro

14/11/2021.headline: Holloway outlasts Rodriguez in one of UFC's 'best fights'
14/11/2021.description: A bloodied and swollen Max Holloway defeats Yair Rodriguez in a featherweight slugfest, taking the bout by unanimous decision at UFC Fight Night in Las Vegas.
14/11/2021.author: Alexandra Alvaro

14/11/2021.headline: Attempts to decapitate Mahatma Gandhi statue a day after being unveiled by the Prime Minister
14/11/2021.description: Police appeal for witnesses after attempts to decapitate a newly unveiled statue of Mahatma Gandhi at the Australian Indian Community Centre in Rowville.
14/11/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

14/11/2021.headline: Carlton's Liam Jones announces AFL retirement after reportedly refusing COVID-19 vaccination
14/11/2021.description: The Blues confirmed Jones's retirement effective immediately, with the veteran defender saying it is for "personal reasons".
14/11/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

14/11/2021.headline: Japan's former princess leaves for US with commoner husband
14/11/2021.description: Princess Mako will build a new life in New York, after being forced to exit the royal family due to her marriage to a commoner.
14/11/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

14/11/2021.headline: Third boat capsize in four weeks prompts warning from Tasmania Police
14/11/2021.description: Police issue a warning about water safety after three men are forced to swim ashore when their dinghy capsizes on Tasmania's west coast, the third boating incident in recent weeks.
14/11/2021.author: April McLennan

14/11/2021.headline: Ita Buttrose accuses government of political interference over complaints inquiry
14/11/2021.description: Ita Buttrose calls for the Senate to stop an inquiry into the way the ABC handles complaints, describing the probe as a "an act of political interference designed to intimidate" the public broadcaster.
14/11/2021.author: April McLennan

14/11/2021.headline: Hancock makes history with 'proudest' Coolangatta Gold victory
14/11/2021.description: Courtney Hancock writes her name into the record books with a fourth win on the Gold Coast, while Ali Day adds a seventh men's title to his collection.
14/11/2021.author: April McLennan

14/11/2021.headline: Plumes of black smoke billow into sky from factory blaze at Kurri Kurri
14/11/2021.description: A factory fire at Kurri Kurri in the NSW Hunter is sending massive plumes of smoke into the air, fuelled by hand sanitiser stored on the site.
14/11/2021.author: April McLennan

14/11/2021.headline: Eddie Jones claims Wallabies are 'going in the right direction' despite another loss to England
14/11/2021.description: Jones's England team has now won eight straight Tests against Australia, but he believes there are positive signs on the horizon for the Wallabies in the build-up to the 2023 Rugby World Cup.
14/11/2021.author: April McLennan

14/11/2021.headline: A 'Kangaroo court' over a Kangaroo Island port: How SA's Deputy Premier is caught in an unwelcome spotlight
14/11/2021.description: SA Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman is embroiled in a conflict-of-interest saga which is soaking up political oxygen for the government as it tries to reopen borders and prepare for next March's election.
14/11/2021.author: Rory McClaren

14/11/2021.headline: How will net zero shape the future? With job gains and losses. It's inevitable
14/11/2021.description: The history of the Holden car company shows how technology and politics shapes the fortunes of workers.
14/11/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

14/11/2021.headline: 'They've just ditched in the water': Audio captures moment light plane hits ocean off Perth
14/11/2021.description: Air traffic control audio captures the moment a light plane ditches into the ocean at a popular Perth beach after the pilot reports engine trouble.
14/11/2021.author: Keane Bourke

14/11/2021.headline: Medi-hotel escapee who used fire escape allegedly entered SA with stolen driver's licence
14/11/2021.description: Police are are seeking public assistance to locate a woman who allegedly travelled from Darwin and entered South Australia on a stolen driver's licence, and then escaped from the Pullman medi-hotel in Adelaide's CBD.
14/11/2021.author: Daniel Keane

14/11/2021.headline: Veteran teacher to face off with Angus Taylor in 2022 federal election
14/11/2021.description: The Voices of Hume campaign has selected Penny Ackery to take on the Energy Minister in the seat of Hume when Australia votes next year.
14/11/2021.author: Daniel Keane

14/11/2021.headline: 68 prisoners killed after Ecuador prison erupts with gang violence
14/11/2021.description: Authorities say a power struggle between gangs in the Penitenciaria del Litoral prison led to 68 deaths and many more injuries.
14/11/2021.author: Daniel Keane

14/11/2021.headline: Young children unlikely to be vaccinated against COVID until next year, Health Minister says
14/11/2021.description: Australian children aged between five and 11 are unlikely to be vaccinated against COVID-19 before January, as the TGA is still reviewing the health and safety data for the age group.
14/11/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

14/11/2021.headline: It may be incremental, but at least the COP26 climate pact mentions fossil fuels, unlike Paris
14/11/2021.description: Some were quick to declare the COP26 climate talks a failure before they even started. Now, after weeks of negotiations, Michael Slezak takes a look at what they have achieved.
14/11/2021.author: Michael Slezak

14/11/2021.headline: Honouring the forgotten faces of the ANZAC legend
14/11/2021.description: For the past ten years, Wiradjuri Elder Ruth Carney has gone to her community's ANZAC day service knowing the memory of her father and uncles are recognised.
14/11/2021.author: Olivia Ralph

14/11/2021.headline: Victorian mum wages war on waste, one lunch box at a time
14/11/2021.description: No Packet November has gone online this year, but for the nutritionist behind the campaign, the message is still the same — get your kids eating better food with less waste and we all stand to benefit.
14/11/2021.author: Sarah Lawrence

14/11/2021.headline: 'We had confidence': Mum of Perth man stranded with family in SA outback tells of fear turning to relief
14/11/2021.description: The parents of a Perth man stranded with his wife and children in South Australia's remote outback have expressed deep relief after finding out their family is safe — but the travelling group is still facing a potentially lengthy wait for floodwaters to drain away.
14/11/2021.author: Daniel Keane

14/11/2021.headline: Man dies from burns sustained in fire allegedly related to domestic violence
14/11/2021.description: A man who suffered serious burns in an Alice Springs house fire that killed his partner, and that police were investigating as a homicide, has died.
14/11/2021.author: Daniel Keane

14/11/2021.headline: Wilbur Smith, bestselling author, dies in South Africa aged 88
14/11/2021.description: The acclaimed author of 49 titles dies at his home in Cape Town, having sold more than 140 million copies of his books over the course of his career.
14/11/2021.author: Daniel Keane

14/11/2021.headline: National job vacancies are up by almost 50pc, but don't blame the 'great resignation'
14/11/2021.description: As a registered nurse, Irene McInerney's skill set is one of the most in demand in the nation. But like millions of other workers, she's feeling the strain of the labour shortage, which has left experts reeling.
14/11/2021.author: Eliza Borrello

14/11/2021.headline: Queensland set to loosen COVID border restrictions, with 1.6m people unvaccinated in the state
14/11/2021.description: As the state prepares to relax some border rules after reaching a vaccine milestone yesterday, one expert warns there is a "very real risk of chains of transmission kicking off and spreading dangerously" with so many people still to get a single COVID jab.
14/11/2021.author: Eliza Borrello

14/11/2021.headline: 'Never stop fighting': Hamilton drives from 10th to first to keep F1 title hopes alive
14/11/2021.description: Lewis Hamilton defies history in Brazil to win the Sao Paulo Grand Prix and close his deficit in the Formula 1 drivers' championship to Max Verstappen.
14/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

14/11/2021.headline: Why are NSW bureaucrats calling for a radical surge in immigration? Here's their economic logic
14/11/2021.description: What would happen to our standard of living if our immigration intake surged by 2 million in five years? Some economists believe it could help the economy bounce back from COVID.
14/11/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

14/11/2021.headline: Want to leave Tasmania this Christmas? Here's what you need to know
14/11/2021.description: So you're a Tasmanian itching to travel this Christmas but what are the rules for each state, and do I need a COVID test to go there and get back in?
14/11/2021.author: Laura Beavis

14/11/2021.headline: How China's hard landing could expose Australia as a one-trick export pony
14/11/2021.description: While jubilation flowed through Asian markets last week after China Evergrande narrowly stayed afloat, other Chinese developers are in major distress, spelling trouble for countries like Australia, writes Ian Verrender.
14/11/2021.author: Ian Verrender

14/11/2021.headline: Julie in France is getting $16,000 to switch to an EV. Spoiler: You're not
14/11/2021.description: Governments around the world are offering juicy purchase incentives to speed car ownership to EVs. Here's what they're offering and how it compares with Australia.
14/11/2021.author: James Purtill

14/11/2021.headline: Pfizer's pill is the latest COVID-19 treatment to show promise. Here are some more
14/11/2021.description: There is a growing portfolio of potential treatments to directly target SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19, and to treat COVID symptoms.
14/11/2021.author: James Purtill

14/11/2021.headline: Conservative approach to net zero would still benefit economy, modelling shows
14/11/2021.description: New economic modelling shows most Victorian regions will see strong employment and economic growth if Australia transitions to a fully net zero economy.
14/11/2021.author: Laura Mayers, Daniel Miles, and Riordan Davis

14/11/2021.headline: Australia wins its first ever World T20 title as Mitch Marsh leads biggest-ever chase in a final
14/11/2021.description: Superb knocks from Mitch Marsh and David Warner hand Australia their first Twenty20 World Cup title, after New Zealand set them a mammoth target.
14/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

14/11/2021.headline: Another Gaddafi in Libya? Muammar's son pitches for power as presidential election draws near
14/11/2021.description: Saif al-Islam al-Gaddafi has registered himself as a presidential candidate for the December elections. He has rarely been seen publicly for almost a decade.
14/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

14/11/2021.headline: Liberal backbenchers call for more ambitious 2035 emission reduction target
14/11/2021.description: A group of Liberal backbenchers facing election challenges from independent candidates renew calls for a more ambitious 2035 emissions reduction target in the wake of the COP26 summit.
14/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

14/11/2021.headline: Al Jazeera demands the Sudanese military release arrested bureau chief
14/11/2021.description: Al Jazeera says its bureau chief's house was raided on Friday by Sudan's security forces. The country has been rocked by nationwide protests since the military seized power last month.
14/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

14/11/2021.headline: As it happened: Australia defeat New Zealand to win maiden Twenty20 World Cup
14/11/2021.description: Early in the tournament it would have been hard to see this coming but Australia have managed to claim their first-ever Twenty20 World Cup title. As it happened.
14/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

14/11/2021.headline: ‘This is what keeps hope alive’: $60,000 Sydney Film Prize goes to censored Iranian filmmaker
14/11/2021.description: Mohammad Rasoulof’s drama There Is No Evil, a commentary on capital punishment in Iran, won Sydney Film Festival’s prize for ‘audacious, cutting-edge and courageous’ film.
14/11/2021.author: Dee Jefferson

14/11/2021.headline: Queen Elizabeth sprains her back and misses Remembrance Sunday service
14/11/2021.description: The Queen is forced to miss the Remembrance Sunday service in London, pulling out just hours before what was set to be her first public appearance in weeks.
14/11/2021.author: Dee Jefferson

14/11/2021.headline: Body found in septic tank at Pallara in Brisbane's south
14/11/2021.description: Police say the body was found in a septic tank in the yard of the home, set on a large block in Pallara.
14/11/2021.author: Dee Jefferson

14/11/2021.headline: Now silent under the Taliban, a Kabul cinema awaits its fate
14/11/2021.description: For decades, this historic cinema has entertained Afghans and borne witness to Afghanistan's wars, hopes and cultural shifts. Now, its gates are closed.
14/11/2021.author: Dee Jefferson

14/11/2021.headline: Travellers, states and territories told to 'pay up' millions owed to NSW in quarantine fees
14/11/2021.description: NSW ministers say the state opened its doors to returned travellers from across Australia and kept them safe in hotel quarantine and it was only fair to taxpayers these bills be paid.
14/11/2021.author: Dee Jefferson

14/11/2021.headline: Vaccination drive at multicultural event as SA health authorities aim for 80 per cent
14/11/2021.description: Nine days ahead of South Australia's deadline to significantly relax border restrictions, health authorities are continuing to seize opportunities to boost vaccination rates.
14/11/2021.author: Dee Jefferson

14/11/2021.headline: Carlton's Liam Jones announces AFL retirement after reportedly refusing COVID-19 vaccine
14/11/2021.description: The Blues confirmed Jones's retirement effective immediately, with the veteran defender saying it is for "personal reasons".
14/11/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

15/11/2021.headline: Fears dross will explode as plant crammed with sanitiser, medical waste goes up in smoke
15/11/2021.description: It will take several days to extinguish the blaze at the NSW factory, which has hundreds of tonnes of potentially volatile aluminium waste inside.
15/11/2021.author: Ben Millington and Anthony Scully

15/11/2021.headline: Positive COVID case recorded in remote Northern Territory community
15/11/2021.description: The first case of coronavirus in a remote Northern Territory community has been recorded in Robinson River, days after lockout restrictions were lifted following an outbreak in the Top End.
15/11/2021.author: Ben Millington and Anthony Scully

15/11/2021.headline: Journalist loses court appeal to keep confidential source a secret, could be jailed for up to five years
15/11/2021.description: A journalist could be forced to reveal a confidential source, or face jail time, after Queensland's Court of Appeal finds there is no protection under the law and that public interest immunity could not be applied to a rare legal case.
15/11/2021.author: Allyson Horn

15/11/2021.headline: SA businesses welcome relaxation of COVID-19 contact rules but areas with low vaccination worrying
15/11/2021.description: Business owners say they are worried that the inevitable COVID-19 cases once the state's borders will lead to shutdowns, but at least the reduction in quarantine time for vaccinated people will reduce their extent.
15/11/2021.author: Eugene Boisvert

15/11/2021.headline: Driver admits to ramming police vehicle at Adelaide car wash
15/11/2021.description: A 46-year-old man pleads guilty after a police car was rammed in Adelaide's south in August — but prosecutors drop two charges of endangering life.
15/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

15/11/2021.headline: Police investigated 23 sexual harassment claims from WA mine sites in the past two years
15/11/2021.description: WA Police reveal the number of sexual harassment claims they investigated stemming from mine sites across the state.
15/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

15/11/2021.headline: Estranged husband found guilty of killing Gold Coast woman Kym Cobby
15/11/2021.description: A Gold Coast man accused of brutally killing his estranged wife, 51-year-old Kym Cobby, in November 2017 is found guilty of murder.
15/11/2021.author: Jessica Stewart

15/11/2021.headline: 'Most properties we visited were underquoted': How Alannah tried to beat the system
15/11/2021.description: After having several offers on homes knocked back, Alannah Edyvane says she came up with a way to gauge which houses were being underquoted.
15/11/2021.author: Elias Clure

15/11/2021.headline: Death toll from Houston concert crush rises to 10 with death of child
15/11/2021.description: Ezra Blount, a nine-year-old trampled at a concert in Houston earlier this month and placed on life support, has died, announces his family's lawyer, while planning a $1.36 million lawsuit.
15/11/2021.author: Elias Clure

15/11/2021.headline: COVID is coming to SA, so what will an outbreak mean for the state?
15/11/2021.description: Twenty months to the day since SA Premier Steven Marshall declared a public health emergency in the state with the words "these are uncharted waters for our nation", he today outlined a plan to manage incoming COVID-19 cases once border restrictions are repealed. Here's a look at what that plan will mean for SA residents.
15/11/2021.author: Daniel Keane and Eric Tlozek

15/11/2021.headline: Construction company found guilty over death of teenager in Perth CBD workplace fall
15/11/2021.description: The construction company that employed a 17-year-old who died in a workplace fall in Perth's CBD is found guilty of failing to provide a safe workplace, but the teenager's family struggles to find closure amid "protracted" legal proceedings.
15/11/2021.author: David Weber

15/11/2021.headline: Five days before the Glory's season starts, Daniel Sturridge has given a brutally honest assessment of his fitness
15/11/2021.description: Star recruit Daniel Sturridge will likely come off the bench at best for Perth Glory's A-League season opener on Saturday night, with the former English Premier League striker battling to be fit after a long stint on the sidelines.
15/11/2021.author: Blake Kagi

15/11/2021.headline: GC Suns strategic delisting of Hugh Greenwood backfires as North Melbourne pounce
15/11/2021.description: Gold Coast Suns deliberately de-listed Hugh Greenwood to help with their list strategy, with a promise to re-sign him. However, North Melbourne came in and lured him to Arden Street.
15/11/2021.author: Blake Kagi

15/11/2021.headline: Australia's T20 World Cup win might make people care about the game's shortest format
15/11/2021.description: Mitchell Marsh and the Australian team found their slice of heaven in the T20 World Cup final in Dubai — and the resurgence of the much-maligned all-rounder matches Australia's rise to the top, writes Paul Kennedy.
15/11/2021.author: Paul Kennedy

15/11/2021.headline: Canberra man accused of trying to import child sex doll faces court
15/11/2021.description: Jeffrey Scott Deacon appears in the ACT Supreme Court, facing a charge of trying to import a prohibited item.
15/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

15/11/2021.headline: Former NSW transport boss considered resigning over rail safety concerns, inquiry hears
15/11/2021.description: Rodd Staples, who was sacked as transport secretary last November, tells a NSW parliamentary inquiry he had serious concerns about rail safety compromises resulting from a state-owned corporation's focus on turning a profit.
15/11/2021.author: Ashleigh Raper

15/11/2021.headline: 'A wonderful future ahead of him': Coronial report into four-year-old's death calls for tougher health screening for truck drivers
15/11/2021.description: Blake Corney died of catastrophic head injuries when a truck ploughed into his family's car as they waited at the lights in July 2018. Today, a coroner handed down recommendations to stop the same accident from happening again.
15/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

15/11/2021.headline: Why Australia's T20 World Cup victors were wearing ski goggles during their celebrations
15/11/2021.description: Australia's victorious T20 World Cup team parties in Dubai wearing ski goggles as the cricket world reacts to the historic win.
15/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

15/11/2021.headline: Third extension for Katherine mask mandate amid concern about low testing numbers
15/11/2021.description: A mask mandate in Katherine has been extended for another two days as authorities remain concerned about low COVID-19 testing rates and positive wastewater results in the town, following last week's COVID cluster.
15/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

15/11/2021.headline: Suspicious fires tear through Cape York wildlife reserve, cattle station
15/11/2021.description: An arson investigation has been launched after fires burned tens of thousands of hectares of grazing land and wildlife habitat in Cape York.
15/11/2021.author: Tanya Murphy

15/11/2021.headline: One of the biggest new deals on climate action happened in the last hours of COP26
15/11/2021.description: From ministers knee-deep in seawater to China and US teaming up to tackle climate change — here is what happened at the UN COP26 Climate Change Conference.
15/11/2021.author: Tanya Murphy

15/11/2021.headline: Over 98 per cent of police, teachers and health staff vaccinated after NT mandate deadline, government says
15/11/2021.description: Releasing new vaccination data among public servants, the NT government says unvaccinated staff impacted by the government's vaccine mandate will not be paid beyond Tuesday 5pm after they were stood down on Friday afternoon.
15/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

15/11/2021.headline: Taliban forces hold Kabul military parade showcasing captured US weapons
15/11/2021.description: American-made armoured vehicles and weapons, as well as Russian helicopters are on display during a Taliban military parade in Kabul.
15/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

15/11/2021.headline: Flying doctors had to administer COVID vaccines to this Indigenous township but they've defied the odds
15/11/2021.description: A tiny Aboriginal community in South Australia's Flinders Ranges reaches a double vaccination rate of 80 per cent well ahead of the rest of the state.
15/11/2021.author: Declan Gooch

15/11/2021.headline: Unions slam 'utopian' ad campaign spruiking SA's health system as ramping data shows grim reality
15/11/2021.description: Representatives from various unions representing healthcare professionals condemn the state government's ad campaign spruiking the health system as new ramping data shows hospitals continue to struggle.
15/11/2021.author: Rebecca Opie

15/11/2021.headline: Queensland's impending restrictions for the unvaccinated saw a boost in people taking up the jab, but will it last?
15/11/2021.description: Tough new COVID restrictions for unvaccinated Queenslanders coming into effect next month gave the state's slowing vaccination rate a much-needed boost, says an infectious diseases expert.
15/11/2021.author: Rachel Riga

15/11/2021.headline: The Torres Strait Islanders combatting vaccine misinformation
15/11/2021.description: With just a month left before Queensland borders open, community leaders in Cape York and the Torres Strait are fighting both a pandemic and a torrent of misinformation.
15/11/2021.author: Jemima Burt

15/11/2021.headline: After 'Miss M Roberts' sat for an Archibald portrait almost 90 years ago, her story was forgotten — until recently
15/11/2021.description: Usually, the mystery of a painting is in who painted it, but this time it was the model in a Great Depression-era masterpiece that eluded experts until a father and daughter team figured it out.
15/11/2021.author: Rachel Clayton

15/11/2021.headline: What does a sperm donor shortage mean for children not yet born?
15/11/2021.description: More and more couples are turning to IVF to have children, prompting a surge in demand for donor sperm. New mum Lauren Burns says there’s another side to the baby boom that leaves donor-conceived people desperate to know their biological background.
15/11/2021.author: Belinda Hawkins and Cheryl Hall

15/11/2021.headline: 'I sense a tsunami coming': Some Tasmanians are concerned about border reopening as Premier says 'get ready'
15/11/2021.description: With a month to go before Tasmania's border reopens and the predicted arrival of COVID-19 to the state, there are growing concerns among vulnerable Tasmanians.
15/11/2021.author: Fiona Blackwood and Damian McIntyre

15/11/2021.headline: Rare parcel of land in inner Sydney for sale, but there's a catch
15/11/2021.description: A large parcel of land in a sought-after Sydney suburb is scheduled to go on sale after being stuck in a bureaucratic logjam for nearly two decades, but a local councillor says prospective buyers are "probably going to be disappointed".
15/11/2021.author: Tony Ibrahim

15/11/2021.headline: After seven years, police hope for William Tyrrell breakthrough within two weeks
15/11/2021.description: Police hope using  a "different type of search method" at "new locations" will help them find the body of William Tyrrell who went missing from the NSW Mid-North Coast more than seven years ago.
15/11/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

15/11/2021.headline: Gemma was in line for a promotion. But everything changed when she fell pregnant
15/11/2021.description: Construction is one of the most male-dominated industries in Australia, with some advocates saying it's time for gender mandates.
15/11/2021.author: Nick Baker and Paul Barclay

15/11/2021.headline: 'Bait and switch', 357 offers and the fine print: What I learnt from switching electricity retailers
15/11/2021.description: I sifted through 30 power retailers' offers to save on my home bills. Then I checked and discovered I'd been switched to a more expensive plan, writes Bruce Mountain.
15/11/2021.author: Nick Baker and Paul Barclay

15/11/2021.headline: A hospital program is supporting women to give birth in their own homes, and the results are positive
15/11/2021.description: If you'd told Camilla Kennedy five years ago that she would one day give birth at home, she says she probably would have laughed. But, just a few weeks ago, the 33-year-old did just that.
15/11/2021.author: Olivia Willis

15/11/2021.headline: After 18 months of 'Fortress Australia', we have some answers about whether mass migration lowers wage growth
15/11/2021.description: When COVID-19 forced Australia to shut international borders, it started a test that might kill off the idea that boosting migration keeps wage growth lower for the whole community.
15/11/2021.author: Daniel Ziffer and Samuel Yang

15/11/2021.headline: 'Saved by coal': Why India refuses to give up an ecosystem that gives life to millions
15/11/2021.description: India fought for a watered-down final deal at COP26 because coal remains its biggest source of fuel for electric power, tied to millions of jobs and livelihoods, with no viable alternative in sight.
15/11/2021.author: Daniel Ziffer and Samuel Yang

15/11/2021.headline: Former Trump adviser Steve Bannon turns himself in to US authorities
15/11/2021.description: Surrendering to US authorities to face contempt charges in relation to the January 6 Capitol riot, Steve Bannon vows to take down US President Joe Biden.
15/11/2021.author: Daniel Ziffer and Samuel Yang

15/11/2021.headline: Serious concerns about forced labour in solar industry raised by Australian senators
15/11/2021.description: A group of senators, human rights experts and lawyers call on the government to assure Australian consumers that the solar industry is not exposed to grave human rights abuses in China's Xinjiang province.
15/11/2021.author: Henry Belot

15/11/2021.headline: Philippines President Duterte will not run against daughter, opting instead for Senate
15/11/2021.description: Mr Duterte previously said he would run for the vice-presidency, until his daughter announced her intentions to do the same.
15/11/2021.author: Henry Belot

15/11/2021.headline: Victorian government agrees to changed proposed pandemic bill
15/11/2021.description: The Victorian government agrees to make significant amendments to its pandemic bill after discussions with crossbenchers.
15/11/2021.author: Henry Belot

15/11/2021.headline: UK raises terror threat level to severe in wake of Liverpool explosion
15/11/2021.description: Police say the taxi explosion outside Liverpool Women and Children's Hospital was an act of terror, as the UK changes its threat level to severe, meaning an attack is "highly likely".
15/11/2021.author: Jack Hawke

15/11/2021.headline: Myanmar frees jailed American journalist Danny Fenster three days after 11-year jail sentence
15/11/2021.description: His release was confirmed by his employer, Sonny Swe, the publisher of Frontier Myanmar, and former US ambassador Bill Richardson, who says Mr Fenster will fly home via Qatar.
15/11/2021.author: Jack Hawke

15/11/2021.headline: Perth family surrounded by flooded roads now facing extreme heat in Simpson Desert
15/11/2021.description: After being forced to contend with the effects of torrential rain, Ori and Lindsey Zavros and their two young children are now facing time stuck in the Simpson Desert amid a blast of hot weather.
15/11/2021.author: Daniel Keane

15/11/2021.headline: NT re-approves controversial water licence with new conditions
15/11/2021.description: A Chinese-backed agribusiness has its right to extract a record amount of groundwater from arid Central Australia upheld, following a review prompted by concerns from traditional owners and environment groups.
15/11/2021.author: Samantha Jonscher

15/11/2021.headline: 'Use a different haka': Māori tribe tells anti-vaccine protesters to stop using its heritage
15/11/2021.description: A Māori tribe that claims New Zealand's most famous haka as its heritage tells anti-vaccine protesters to stop using the traditional performance to promote their message.
15/11/2021.author: Samantha Jonscher

15/11/2021.headline: State and territory border rules have changed yet again — here's where you can travel
15/11/2021.description: Interstate border rules are once again changing, so we've put together this simple guide to what each state requires for people entering.
15/11/2021.author: Samantha Jonscher

15/11/2021.headline: Adelaide Hills man pleads guilty to firearms offences after more than 200 weapons seized
15/11/2021.description: An Adelaide Hills man has pleaded guilty to more than 80 firearms offences after police seized more than 200 weapons, including an assault rifle, from his rural property.
15/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

15/11/2021.headline: NT Chief Minister threatens public sector job cuts after wage freeze voted down
15/11/2021.description: Chief Minister Michael Gunner says the public service will either need to agree to a four-year wage freeze or face the possibility of job losses after public servants overwhelmingly rejected a wage policy.
15/11/2021.author: Jesse Thompson

15/11/2021.headline: Small-town plant crammed with sanitiser, 'extremely volatile' waste will burn for days
15/11/2021.description: It will take several days to extinguish the blaze at the NSW factory, which has hundreds of tonnes of potentially explosive aluminium waste inside.
15/11/2021.author: Ben Millington and Anthony Scully

16/11/2021.headline: NASA is outraged by an anti-satellite missile test. Russia's downplaying the whole thing
16/11/2021.description: The head of Russia's space agency is due to meet with NASA representatives over the incident, which put International Space Station astronauts on alert.
16/11/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

16/11/2021.headline: Two global superpowers, one Zoom call and four hours: Did the Biden-Xi summit avert catastrophe?
16/11/2021.description: Tensions between the US and China are simmering. But one of the few areas Joe Biden and Xi Jinping agree on is that letting relations deteriorate further would be a mistake of historic proportions, writes Kathryn Diss.
16/11/2021.author: Kathryn Diss

16/11/2021.headline: The Loop: NT's COVID situation escalates, William Tyrrell search continues, Adele helps man propose
16/11/2021.description: Here's a quick wrap-up of news from today to keep you in the loop.
16/11/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

16/11/2021.headline: Russia has been building its military on the Ukraine border, raising fears of another conflict in Europe
16/11/2021.description: Fears of a Russian military attack on neighbouring Ukraine are growing amongst the international community, as the Kremlin continues its build-up of troops on the border.
16/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

16/11/2021.headline: 'I'm ready': Rising Aussie star moves a step closer to Formula 1 dream
16/11/2021.description: Australian Oscar Piastri continues his rise up the ranks after being named as a reserve driver for one of the Formula 1 teams in 2022.
16/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

16/11/2021.headline: Potential corruption risks in draft legislation for 2032 Olympic Games organising committee, CCC warns
16/11/2021.description: Provisions to exempt elected officials from declaring conflicts of interest if they are also a director on the 2032 Olympic Games organising committee presents corruption risks, the head of Queensland's corruption watchdog warns.
16/11/2021.author: Rachel Riga

16/11/2021.headline: 'A serious escalation' in the NT's COVID situation has sparked lockdowns and mask mandates. Here's what we know
16/11/2021.description: Katherine has been in and out of lockdown for two weeks, and now the remote Robinson River community is too. So how did it get to the point in the NT and what do we know about the latest COVID cluster?
16/11/2021.author: Rachel Riga

16/11/2021.headline: AFL fans who allegedly faked documents, breached COVID rules to watch grand final will plead guilty to NT border breaches
16/11/2021.description: Hayden Burbank and Mark Babbage are already serving time in jail for breaching Western Australia's strict COVID-19 border rules to go to the grand final. Now they will also plead guilty in the Northern Territory for similar offences.
16/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

16/11/2021.headline: After her fiancé was killed by a train, Maddie is determined to improve rail crossing safety
16/11/2021.description: Maddie and Ethan were due to marry in March and looked forward to starting a family. But in February, Ethan was killed at a rail crossing which had no lights or boom gates.
16/11/2021.author: Dan Conifer

16/11/2021.headline: After a decade on the run, former WA tourism operator jailed for nine years for abusing girls
16/11/2021.description: Convicted paedophile and former international fugitive Charles Batham is sentenced to almost a decade behind bars for abusing two girls in Broome in WA's Kimberley, after fleeing Australia in 2011.
16/11/2021.author: Erin Parke

16/11/2021.headline: Essendon boss isolating after testing positive to COVID-19
16/11/2021.description: Bombers chief executive Xavier Campbell — who is fully vaccinated — began experiencing symptoms on Monday, but has not had direct contact with members of the club's football program.
16/11/2021.author: Erin Parke

16/11/2021.headline: Social distancing, PPE not used until first case emerged during St Basil's aged care outbreak, inquest hears
16/11/2021.description: A coronial inquest into the outbreak at St Basil's in Melbourne's north that led to the deaths of 50 people has heard a staff member who spread COVID to the facility was permitted to come to work after reporting flu-like symptoms.
16/11/2021.author: Danny Tran

16/11/2021.headline: 'Best present I've ever asked for': Families reunite at airports as COVID-19 rules ease in Queensland
16/11/2021.description: Elated families reunite across Queensland's airports today as COVID-19 restrictions ease in the state, but there are others waiting to drive across the border — still locked out and at the "end of their tether".
16/11/2021.author: Nibir Khan

16/11/2021.headline: 'Extreme body modification artist' guilty of manslaughter after botched implant surgery
16/11/2021.description: Self-proclaimed extreme body modification artist Brendan Russell is found guilty of manslaughter over the death of a NSW woman he discouraged from seeking medical help for an infected implant.
16/11/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

16/11/2021.headline: Ernie Dingo joins vaccination fight in bid to boost lagging jab rates in WA Indigenous communities
16/11/2021.description: TV personality Ernie Dingo will drive from Perth to the Pilbara this week as part of a federal government campaign to tackle vaccine hesitancy among Indigenous communities in remote WA.
16/11/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

16/11/2021.headline: Paralympian Katie Kelly crosses the line into retirement
16/11/2021.description: Katie Kelly's Paralympic career may be over, but the retiring Aussie para-triathlete has another challenge out of competition — her passion for helping people with a disability in sport and in the workplace.
16/11/2021.author: Paul Kennedy

16/11/2021.headline: Chinese President Xi Jinping warns US President Joe Biden over Taiwan in 'frank' meeting
16/11/2021.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping tells US President Joe Biden his country will take "decisive measures" if "pro-Taiwan independence" forces cross a "red line," Chinese state media reports.
16/11/2021.author: Paul Kennedy

16/11/2021.headline: Aussie great confirmed as Hockeyroos coach through to Paris Olympics
16/11/2021.description: Katrina Powell — a two-time Olympic gold medallist as a player — is locked in as the Hockeyroos' permanent coach, after serving in the role on an interim basis at the Tokyo Games.
16/11/2021.author: Paul Kennedy

16/11/2021.headline: Reserve Bank boss delivers good and bad news for borrowers with jobs
16/11/2021.description: The Reserve Bank boss delivers a combination of good news and bad news for workers who have mortgages in his latest message on inflation, wages and interest rates.
16/11/2021.author: Michael Janda

16/11/2021.headline: Scrap the Australian Open 'for the people', says Nick Kyrgios
16/11/2021.description: Nick Kyrgios calls for the Australian Open to be cancelled, but Victoria sports minister Martin Pakula says he could not follow the logic of his comments and that Aussies "are absolutely gagging for major events".
16/11/2021.author: Michael Janda

16/11/2021.headline: SA imposes mandatory vaccination policy for teachers and early childhood workers
16/11/2021.description: Teachers and volunteers at South Australian schools, preschools and early childhood facilities have been told they will need to be double-vaccinated for COVID-19 before the start of the 2022 school year.
16/11/2021.author: Eugene Boisvert

16/11/2021.headline: Police search for stolen car after mysterious outback disappearance
16/11/2021.description: Queensland Police hope identifying the occupants of a stolen white Ford Focus could help solve the suspicious disappearance of Jeremiah Rivers near Noccundra last month.
16/11/2021.author: Danielle O'Neal and Ellie Grounds

16/11/2021.headline: Shark feeding frenzy near shore at Rottnest Island as whale carcass attracts hungry predators
16/11/2021.description: A huge whale carcass floating just off Perth's holiday playground of Rottnest Island attracts a large group of sharks, prompting authorities to close the island's beaches.
16/11/2021.author: James Carmody

16/11/2021.headline: Adele talks divorce and helps a couple get engaged in her new special
16/11/2021.description: The singer sat down for an interview with Oprah before giving her first concert since her split from her husband in 2019.
16/11/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

16/11/2021.headline: Being Bluey's dad for one day busted some big parenting myths for me
16/11/2021.description: In the interest of family experimentation and likely award-winning-journalism, I decided to spend an entire day trying to match Bandit's legendary dad energy by agreeing to do whatever my kids wanted, for as long as they wanted.
16/11/2021.author: Dan Colasimone

16/11/2021.headline: We're very poor at judging risks — sometimes, we need to see them to understand them
16/11/2021.description: Numerical truths count for little when it comes to our perceptions of things like diseases and vaccines — we're more affected by the views of our peers.
16/11/2021.author: Markus Mannheim

16/11/2021.headline: Cyber attack affects Federal Group payroll system but staff will still be paid
16/11/2021.description: Tasmania's largest private sector employer, gaming and hospitality giant Federal Group, has been affected by a cyber attack for the second this year. This time it it has hit the company's payroll software.
16/11/2021.author: Adam Langenberg

16/11/2021.headline: How an arson attack forged Australia's new Organic Farmer of the Year
16/11/2021.description: A blaze that destroyed their Sunshine Coast store was the catalyst for Mick Dan and Kelly Burton to start farming genuine organic food. Now they have three farms and 20 staff.
16/11/2021.author: Jennifer Nichols

16/11/2021.headline: 'So much love': How the queer skateboarding community helped Poppy Olsen come out
16/11/2021.description: Australia's Poppy Olsen speaks about being one of several openly LGBTQI+ skateboarders at the Tokyo Olympics, and coming out to her mum.
16/11/2021.author: Kate O'Halloran

16/11/2021.headline: Debate around Victoria's COVID-19 pandemic bill has turned ugly. Here's what you need to know
16/11/2021.description: As protesters use violent imagery to demonstrate on the steps of Victorian Parliament, legal groups are sounding the alarm on pandemic laws being debated inside. Here's your quick guide to the controversial bill at the centre.
16/11/2021.author: Elise Kinsella and Joseph Dunstan

16/11/2021.headline: Australia to donate Pfizer and Moderna vaccines in Indo-Pacific
16/11/2021.description: The federal government will expand its vaccine donation program to include Pfizer and Moderna doses, with a focus on the Indo-Pacific region and nations in desperate need of doses.
16/11/2021.author: Henry Belot

16/11/2021.headline: How advice to a domestic violence survivor was compared to a restaurant recommendation
16/11/2021.description: When Emma disclosed domestic violence to a team leader at work, they responded by recommending a personal growth course. Emma says that advice, instead of getting appropriate domestic violence support, cost her financially and emotionally.
16/11/2021.author: Sally Brooks

16/11/2021.headline: Bookstores facing supply chain crisis ahead of Christmas rush
16/11/2021.description: Australia's independent bookstores are facing a critical supply crunch heading into their busiest period, with smaller booksellers worried they will not have copies of in-demand titles ahead of Christmas.
16/11/2021.author: Madeleine Morris

16/11/2021.headline: 'We had just about given up hope': Ancient assassin spider survived Kangaroo Island bushfires
16/11/2021.description: A pair of assassin spiders — a species feared extinct after the Kangaroo Island bushfires — have been found outside their known range on the island.
16/11/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

16/11/2021.headline: 'Are we alone in the universe?': How a telescope custom-designed in Sydney could unlock the answer
16/11/2021.description: The TOLIMAN project is aiming its finely-tuned lense across a 40-trillion kilometre expanse to find habitable planets in the neighbouring star system, Alpha Centauri.
16/11/2021.author: Ruby Cornish

16/11/2021.headline: Police seize car in Sydney as part of renewed search for William Tyrrell's remains
16/11/2021.description: A car from Sydney's south has been seized and will undergo weeks of forensic examination. It comes as police begin their third day of searching around the house William Tyrrell disappeared from seven years ago.
16/11/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen, Emma Siossian, and Paige Cockburn

16/11/2021.headline: Royal watchers are worried about the Queen, but could she really abdicate?
16/11/2021.description: The Queen's trip to hospital and extended rest has raised a question royal watchers don't want to contemplate: Will the 95-year-old Queen continue as monarch? Could she step further away from public life, or even abdicate?
16/11/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

16/11/2021.headline: Sarah Baartman endured horrific injustices in her life. Centuries on, they have not been forgotten
16/11/2021.description: Not even her early death could put an end to the abuse she endured in life. It took a president's lobbying and the fight of her people to finally lay her to rest.
16/11/2021.author: Anna Kelsey-Sugg and Marc Fennell

16/11/2021.headline: Most of the world is ahead of Australia. This is what COVID experts from four countries say we could learn
16/11/2021.description: We asked leading experts in four countries — Canada, Singapore, the US and the UK— about "living with COVID". This is what they said.
16/11/2021.author: Nick Sas

16/11/2021.headline: Australia's Human Rights Commission takes fight against racism to a new level
16/11/2021.description: The Australian Human Rights Commission flips the onus in tackling crowd-based racism to encourage the sports themselves, and the venues they are played in, to be proactive in calling out poor behaviour.
16/11/2021.author: Tracey Holmes

16/11/2021.headline: Would-be homebuyers ‘stuck in a dead-end road’ and renewed migration is likely to push prices even higher
16/11/2021.description: When Australia opens its borders to migrants to help in the post-COVID recovery, already skyrocketing house prices could further lift. One economist predicts the cost of buying a home will jump 5 per cent and rents will rise 7 per cent.
16/11/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

16/11/2021.headline: James Jeggo handball costs Socceroos in draw with China
16/11/2021.description: A penalty given against James Jeggo leaves Australia with a disappointing draw against China and drops them below Japan in their World Cup qualifying campaign.
16/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

16/11/2021.headline: Polish forces use water cannons on migrants at Belarus border after stones thrown at guards
16/11/2021.description: Polish border forces on Wednesday said they were attacked with stones by migrants at the border with Belarus and responded by using water cannons against them.
16/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

16/11/2021.headline: Russia rejects accusations it endangered astronauts with missile test
16/11/2021.description: Russia says it did conduct a weapons test targeting an old satellite but rejects US claims its actions put the lives of astronauts at risk.
16/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

16/11/2021.headline: Labor announces NBN pitch ahead of next federal election
16/11/2021.description: The federal opposition promises to give 1.5 million homes and businesses access to higher speed internet if Labor wins the next federal election.
16/11/2021.author: Claudia Long

16/11/2021.headline: Triple suicide bombers in Uganda capital kill three civilians, wound dozens
16/11/2021.description: The blasts occurred at the police station and near parliament, leaving at least five people in critical condition.
16/11/2021.author: Claudia Long

16/11/2021.headline: 'We feel safe now': Perth family tells of their relief after five days stranded in Simpson Desert
16/11/2021.description: A young Perth family who had to be rescued from the Simpson Desert after their campervan became bogged have spoken to the ABC about their experience.
16/11/2021.author: Rebecca Opie and Gabriella Marchant

16/11/2021.headline: Property developer's art collection sells for $921m, including highest price paid for Pollock
16/11/2021.description: The art collection belonging to Harry Macklowe and ex-wife Linda Burg goes under the hammer, after a New York judge ordered them to sell it after their divorce and split the profits 50/50.
16/11/2021.author: Rebecca Opie and Gabriella Marchant

16/11/2021.headline: Stonemasonry pleads guilty after workers exposed to the risk of silicosis
16/11/2021.description: A Hobart stonemasonry business pleads guilty to health and safety breaches that exposed workers to the risk of developing the incurable lung disease.
16/11/2021.author: Laura Beavis

17/11/2021.headline: Teen revealed violent thoughts to mother before she killed 10yo, court documents show
17/11/2021.description: A 15-year-old was waiting for a referral to a Sydney psychiatrist before she killed a 10-year-old girl, but her mother did not get a call before the incident despite a GP describing her behaviour as concerning, court documents reveal.
17/11/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

17/11/2021.headline: Tiny fraction of WA healthcare workers quit in protest over jab mandate, new figures show
17/11/2021.description: Just 0.1 per cent of WA healthcare workers resign or are sacked over their protest of the COVID vaccination mandate, but the nurses union says the figures don't tell the whole story.
17/11/2021.author: Kate Christian

17/11/2021.headline: Jail for Melbourne man who flew around world to groom and abuse underage girls
17/11/2021.description: The County Court heard the 43-year-old groomed five vulnerable teenage girls online, with one victim saying the abuse has left her feeling "completely alone".
17/11/2021.author: Shannon Schubert

17/11/2021.headline: Live: Undercard underway ahead of Tim Tszyu vs Takeshi Inoue in Sydney
17/11/2021.description: Tim Tszyu meets Takeshi Inoue in a high-risk super welterweight contest at Sydney's Qudos Bank Arena. Follow all the action in our live blog.
17/11/2021.author: Simon Smale

17/11/2021.headline: With half its staff in isolation, Katherine's only major supermarket has slashed opening hours during lockdown
17/11/2021.description: Katherine's Woolworths — the town's only major supermarket — is struggling to keep its doors open, with half its staff in isolation as the COVID crisis in the town continues.
17/11/2021.author: Samantha Dick

17/11/2021.headline: The Loop: Baby among NT COVID cases, human remains found in NZ mine and the Word of the Year is...
17/11/2021.description: Get in the loop with a speedy wrap of today's news.
17/11/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

17/11/2021.headline: Move to make Christmas Day a public holiday in SA passes Lower House but unlikely to proceed
17/11/2021.description: Christmas Day would become a public holiday but the Christmas Eve half-day public holiday would be scrapped under a move that has passed South Australia's House of Assembly.
17/11/2021.author: Leah MacLennan and Stacey Lee

17/11/2021.headline: Where do the Socceroos go from here in World Cup qualifying?
17/11/2021.description: The Socceroos' hopes of direct qualification for the World Cup are in the balance with four games left in their qualifying group. What do they have to do to make next year's tournament, and what happens if they don't clinch an automatic spot?
17/11/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

17/11/2021.headline: The NBN has been 'fully operational' for almost a year, but some Australians still don't have reliable internet
17/11/2021.description: Fixed wireless connections are typically used in regional and rural areas, but many Australians are still struggling with access and reliability issues.
17/11/2021.author: Ellen Coulter

17/11/2021.headline: Court hears differing stories about why Adelaide man took so long to get help after child consumed GHB
17/11/2021.description: A man failed to seek immediate medical help for a toddler who had consumed a club drug in order to concoct a narrative for authorities and avoid getting into trouble, an Adelaide court hears.
17/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

17/11/2021.headline: 'Abhorrent' paedophile's prison bashing, COVID infection should shave time off sentence, lawyer says
17/11/2021.description: Bret Anthony Chesworth was a member of a global child abuse network that was busted by the AFP last year and is facing sentencing. Prosecutors say his crimes were "particularly depraved".
17/11/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

17/11/2021.headline: Human remains found in New Zealand mine, 11 years after explosion killed 29 workers
17/11/2021.description: Human remains are discovered for the first time in New Zealand's Pike River mine, more than a decade on from the disaster that killed 29 workers.
17/11/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

17/11/2021.headline: Gastro outbreak sends Coffin Bay oyster region into trading freeze
17/11/2021.description: One of South Australia's premium oyster-growing operations has been closed for business, and all oysters banned from sale, as authorities investigate food-poisoning cases caused by a type of seaborne bacteria.
17/11/2021.author: Brooke Neindorf

17/11/2021.headline: 'Once the truck started to sink down I knew we were in trouble': Family grateful after Simpson Desert rescue
17/11/2021.description: The Perth family rescued from South Australia's outback say they are grateful for all of the help and support they have received during a "roller-coaster" week.
17/11/2021.author: Gabriella Marchant and Stacey Pestrin

17/11/2021.headline: Victim of Broome paedophile Charles Batham speaks out
17/11/2021.description: With the 77-year-old sex offender and fugitive now behind bars, a woman who survived his abuse says she's disappointed by his nine-year jail term.
17/11/2021.author: Erin Parke

17/11/2021.headline: Australian baseball team to pay players and staff in Bitcoin
17/11/2021.description: The Perth Heat say they will accept Bitcoin as payment for merchandise and even ballpark concessions as they move away from dollars to cryptocurrency.
17/11/2021.author: Erin Parke

17/11/2021.headline: Potholed highway causing near-death caravanning crash reignites debate over country roads
17/11/2021.description: Debbie is lucky to be alive after her caravan flipped when it hit a pothole. Now she wants make sure it doesn't happen to others.
17/11/2021.author: Daniel Miles and Nicole Chvastek

17/11/2021.headline: Man arrested, woman facing extradition over alleged murder of toddler 30 years ago
17/11/2021.description: A Porters Retreat man is arrested and a New Zealand woman is facing extradition over the alleged 1987 murder of a toddler in the NSW Central Tablelands.
17/11/2021.author: Madeline Austin

17/11/2021.headline: Inside the forensic tools police are using to try and find William Tyrrell
17/11/2021.description: Officers are using a combination of technologies to try and make a breakthrough in one of Australia's most high-profile police investigations — the disappearance of the little boy in a Spider-Man suit.
17/11/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

17/11/2021.headline: 'I wasn't sure if I was going to come home with him or bury him': Premature birth risks PTSD
17/11/2021.description: Queensland mother Ebony Wells wants to raise awareness on World Prematurity Day about the possible trauma and risks to parents' mental health after having a baby born too early.
17/11/2021.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

17/11/2021.headline: At America's busiest seaport, thousands of empty containers pile up
17/11/2021.description: US ports have been inundated with cargo since the COVID-19 pandemic shifted spending patterns.
17/11/2021.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

17/11/2021.headline: Why this farmer won't be counting any chickens once the vaccine mandate hits
17/11/2021.description: Jeff Pow will have to close his poultry business in regional WA because none of his staff will get COVID jabs. He isn't the only small business owner facing an uncertain future.
17/11/2021.author: Jacqueline Lynch

17/11/2021.headline: 2021's Word of the Year alludes to a uniquely Australian problem
17/11/2021.description: The Word of the Year, decided by the ANU's Australian National Dictionary Centre, illustrates the unique predicament the nation found itself in as it worked to vaccinate the population against COVID-19.
17/11/2021.author: Niki Burnside

17/11/2021.headline: What do we know about COVID-19 vaccines for kids under 12?
17/11/2021.description: With almost 60 per cent of Australian children aged 12 to 15 now fully vaccinated against COVID-19, focus is turning to younger age groups. But approving vaccines for them is more complex.
17/11/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

17/11/2021.headline: Macarthur FC determined to prove they're a heavyweight in A-League Men's 2021/22 season
17/11/2021.description: After falling just short of making the grand final in their foundation campaign, the Bulls want to show they are among the title contenders in the upcoming season.
17/11/2021.author: Chloe Hart

17/11/2021.headline: 'It's now your turn to be uncomfortable': Australian beer's moment of reckoning
17/11/2021.description: Amid reports of harassment and abuse in the Australian beer industry, a group of female leaders has banded together to force change.
17/11/2021.author: Jeremy Story Carter

17/11/2021.headline: Noel loves vintage cars — but his EV now takes pride of place in his garage
17/11/2021.description: A growing number of Australian car lovers are turning to electric vehicles — but experts and industry figures say more can be done to encourage uptake and lower prices.
17/11/2021.author: Jeremy Story Carter

17/11/2021.headline: This town has been a 'wonderful cocoon' during COVID, but its elderly locals are bracing for that to change
17/11/2021.description: With a median age of just over 58, residents in one of South Australia's "oldest" towns are "extremely apprehensive" for COVID-19 to be circulating throughout the community when state borders open on November 23.
17/11/2021.author: Alice Dempster

17/11/2021.headline: US Capitol rioter 'QAnon Shaman' sentenced to over three years in prison
17/11/2021.description: Jacob Chansley, the so-called "Qanon Shaman", is sentenced to almost three and a half years in prison for his role in the US Capitol riots in January 6.
17/11/2021.author: Alice Dempster

17/11/2021.headline: Borders are reopening and COVID is coming. What can Tasmanians expect?
17/11/2021.description: It's a message Tasmania's Premier Peter Gutwein has been driving home: COVID will enter Tasmania when borders open next month. So when and where is the state likely to have an outbreak?
17/11/2021.author: Monte Bovill

17/11/2021.headline: The cleanest jet fuel has an explosive history. Would you board a hydrogen plane?
17/11/2021.description: As the world looks for new ways to combat climate change, hydrogen has emerged as a potential saviour for polluting industries like aviation. But will it work?
17/11/2021.author: Nick Dole

17/11/2021.headline: Childcare 'crisis situation' as vaccine mandates force some workers out
17/11/2021.description: Childcare centre operators say fee hikes at some centres are inevitable as mandates for COVID-19 vaccinations around the country force them to terminate some staff and put others on leave.
17/11/2021.author: Alison Branley and Conor Duffy

17/11/2021.headline: Kate's abusive ex racked up almost $86k of debt in her name. This is how she got help
17/11/2021.description: Shortly after domestic violence survivor Kate left her husband, the banks started chasing her to repay debts in her name. It was not until she got help from a lawyer and financial counsellor that she realised there was a way out.
17/11/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

17/11/2021.headline: Sam is trapped in Katherine as COVID cases grow. And he's not the only one
17/11/2021.description: As Katherine grapples with the NT's biggest COVID-19 outbreak to date, Sam Ashley has been sleeping on a patch of grass near the river.
17/11/2021.author: Lauren Roberts and Kate Ashton

17/11/2021.headline: Private security could soon guard secretive naval communications base instead of AFP
17/11/2021.description: One of the country's most secretive and important military facilities, which helps support Australian and US naval operations, could soon be guarded by private security personnel, rather than federal police.
17/11/2021.author: Andrew Greene

17/11/2021.headline: Cash hoarders stuffed record amounts under mattresses during pandemic
17/11/2021.description: Before the pandemic, there were about $80 billion in notes circulating in Australia. Now there's $100 billion — but it's not in cash registers.
17/11/2021.author: Henry Belot

17/11/2021.headline: Endangered curlews feed here at the end of their epic migration, but a retirement village may be built next door
17/11/2021.description: Critics say a plan to develop a retirement village next to endangered bird habitat will further jeopardise a species in decline, but the developers say they're being made scapegoats.
17/11/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

17/11/2021.headline: Court only avenue for alleged victims to prove claims against nurse James Griffin
17/11/2021.description: The Tasmanian Health Service has not admitted to the abuse by Launceston nurse James Griffin claimed by the three plaintiffs, as court documents detail new information about concerns raised at the hospital about his conduct.
17/11/2021.author: Loretta Lohberger

17/11/2021.headline: William Tyrrell strategy 'lacking in early days' but valuable lessons helped find Cleo Smith, expert says
17/11/2021.description: A leading criminologist says some of the reasons William Tyrrell hasn't been found in seven years helped police in Western Australia locate missing girl Cleo Smith after 18 days.
17/11/2021.author: Mark Reddie

17/11/2021.headline: In the suburbs of Melbourne, Logan felt a void in his life. He filled it with fire
17/11/2021.description: Leaving the beaches of Samoa for the suburbs of Melbourne created a void in Logan’s life, one that could only be filled by returning to his roots.
17/11/2021.author: Jacqueline Howard

17/11/2021.headline: With a federal election looming, the Great Resignation presents politicians with big opportunities
17/11/2021.description: For employers trying to keep and attract the best staff, COVID-inspired upheaval in Australia's job market presents enormous challenges. For politicians facing a looming election, it presents opportunities, writes David Speers.
17/11/2021.author: David Speers

17/11/2021.headline: The same places keep appearing in most-disadvantaged lists. COVID means it could be getting worse
17/11/2021.description: The most comprehensive report into disadvantage in Australia reveals disadvantage is not only entrenched in some communities, it also impacts a wide range of factors.
17/11/2021.author: Norman Hermant and Josie Taylor

17/11/2021.headline: As the NT's COVID outbreak grows, so are questions about why this at-risk community isn't in lockdown
17/11/2021.description: Pressure is growing on the NT government to declare a lockdown in Borroloola, a large remote community with strong links to Robinson River where six Aboriginal people have so far tested positive to COVID amid a Territory cluster.
17/11/2021.author: Norman Hermant and Josie Taylor

17/11/2021.headline: Drug crisis, corruption and COVID-19 on voters' minds as Tonga heads to the polls
17/11/2021.description: While climate change and COVID-19 have dominated the news cycle, Tonga's battle with corruption and drug use are also front of mind for voters as they head to the polls.
17/11/2021.author: Catherine Graue, Liam Fox, and Edwina Seselja

17/11/2021.headline: 'She's alright': Queen makes first in-person engagement since hospitalisation last month
17/11/2021.description: The 95-year-old monarch was forced to pull out of Remembrance Sunday services last weekend after suffering a sprained back, Buckingham Palace said.
17/11/2021.author: Catherine Graue, Liam Fox, and Edwina Seselja

17/11/2021.headline: Senior cleric linked to terror network behind the Bali nightclub bombings charged over alleged sham charity
17/11/2021.description: The charity used the cover of social and educational motives to collect funds and divert some of them to terror group Jemaah Islamiyah, which is regrouping after its spiritual leader Abu Bakar Bashir was released from prison this year.
17/11/2021.author: Catherine Graue, Liam Fox, and Edwina Seselja

17/11/2021.headline: Restrictions may lift earlier as Victoria kicks vaccination goals, but health workers urge more protection
17/11/2021.description: Mask use will be scaled down in Victoria, and venues will be able to operate at greater capacity as part of a further easing of restrictions that could be in place for the weekend.
17/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

17/11/2021.headline: Push to get businesses, banks to help end scam text messages
17/11/2021.description: The pandemic is providing fertile ground for an uptick in cybercrime, with scammers targeting Australians with dodgy texts and robocalls — something the federal Opposition wants to stop.
17/11/2021.author: Claudia Long

17/11/2021.headline: US and China announce easing of restrictions on each other's journalists
17/11/2021.description: All details are yet to be firmed up and made public and there is yet to be a timeline for bringing the changes in, even after a year of tense discussions over the new arrangements.
17/11/2021.author: Claudia Long

18/11/2021.headline: Collapse of major building group leaves hundreds in limbo amid building boom
18/11/2021.description: The collapse of a Brisbane-based construction company leaves hundreds of homes unbuilt across Australia and one Queensland family's first home dreams in limbo.
18/11/2021.author: Nibir Khan

18/11/2021.headline: Remote community at heart of NT COVID outbreak set to reach 100 per cent vaccination rate
18/11/2021.description: Every resident in Robinson River has now been tested for COVID. And although only 15 are yet to receive their first vaccine, authorities say all want to roll up their sleeves.
18/11/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

18/11/2021.headline: Adelaide man arrested over alleged witness intimidation
