23/11/2021.description: Woodside CEO Meg O'Neill says the Scarborough gas project is important to meet the world's energy needs as protesters gather outside the company's Perth offices.
23/11/2021.author: Evelyn Manfield

23/11/2021.headline: Court blocks bid to release secret Ben Roberts-Smith report
23/11/2021.description: A secret Channel Seven legal report that "summarises all of the known rumours and allegations" about war veteran Ben Roberts-Smith will remain private after a court ruling today.
23/11/2021.author: Harriet Tatham

23/11/2021.headline: 'Implausible' that father tripped and fell on daughter while sweeping floor
23/11/2021.description: An Adelaide man is found guilty of causing injuries and life-threatening harm to his daughter at their northern suburbs home in 2018. WARNING: This story contains graphic content that readers may find distressing.
23/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

23/11/2021.headline: William Tyrrell's foster-parents to enter plea over alleged assault
23/11/2021.description: William Tyrrell's foster-parents will enter a plea to assault charges against them in two weeks, a Sydney court hears.
23/11/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

23/11/2021.headline: British cycling legend suffers broken ribs, collapsed lung in race crash
23/11/2021.description: Mark Cavendish admits he's "in a bit of pain", having been hospitalised following a crash in a track cycling event in Belgium.
23/11/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

23/11/2021.headline: Another Port River dolphin found dead as interim report struggles to identify cause
23/11/2021.description: A third dolphin is found dead inside the Adelaide Dolphin Sanctuary with all showing similar symptoms of illness before they died, but an interim investigation is no closer to finding the cause.
23/11/2021.author: Malcolm Sutton

23/11/2021.headline: 'Testament to resilience, strength and unity': Yuwaalaraay/Euahlayi win native title
23/11/2021.description: The Federal Court of Australia has granted the Yuwaalaraay/Euahlayi people native title rights to nearly 13,000 hectares of land in south west Queensland.
23/11/2021.author: David Iliffe

23/11/2021.headline: Are bosses liable for compo if you catch COVID-19 at work?
23/11/2021.description: Businesses could face workers' compensation claims from staff if they can prove they caught COVID-19 in the workplace, lawyers say.
23/11/2021.author: Owen Jacques and Alex Easton

23/11/2021.headline: University leaders calls for an end date to COVID-19 quarantine requirement for international students
23/11/2021.description: Fully vaccinated international arrivals will not have to quarantine once the state reaches 90 per cent vaccination, but Griffith University executives say the state stands to lose students to other states without a concrete timeframe.
23/11/2021.author: Owen Jacques and Alex Easton

23/11/2021.headline: Singer MAY-A on being nominated for an ARIA Award at age 20
23/11/2021.description: Her five top songs have been streamed more than 18 million times.
23/11/2021.author: Owen Jacques and Alex Easton

23/11/2021.headline: 'I've never been more motivated': Shyla Heal's inspiring message after devastating WNBA axing
23/11/2021.description: Shyla Heal gears up for WNBL season with the Sydney Fames and is more motivated than ever to prove herself after the devastating and unexpected axing from the WNBA.
23/11/2021.author: Chloe Hart

23/11/2021.headline: 'There's a buzz in the air': Five Christmas gift ideas that will make you feel super woke
23/11/2021.description: For many of us, the idea of spoiling those we care about in the wake of long lockdowns (and a very long year indeed) feels like the perfect solution to a rather torturous year.
23/11/2021.author: Gemma Breen

23/11/2021.headline: Beth and Larry spent almost $700 on COVID-19 travel insurance. It won't cover them for lockdowns, border closures
23/11/2021.description: Australians travelling overseas for the first time since international borders reopened are paying hundreds of dollars for travel insurance — but the fine print reveals some very big COVID-related exclusions.
23/11/2021.author: Emilia Terzon

23/11/2021.headline: Do you think there's a gender pay gap at your work? That info could one day be made public
23/11/2021.description: More businesses may be forced to report things, such as whether they pay superannuation on parental leave, how much their chief executive is paid and provide a clearer breakdown of wages, if recommendations to a government review of the Workplace Gender Equality Act are taken up.
23/11/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

23/11/2021.headline: After caring for her mother for 12 years, Leonora realised she would have to start working again at 74
23/11/2021.description: Leonora Brown cared for her ailing mother for 12 years — and after her death, the 74-year-old realised she would have to return to workforce.
23/11/2021.author: Niki Burnside

23/11/2021.headline: Tourism industry says clarity on COVID-19 test funding a 'Christmas gift for consumers'
23/11/2021.description: Tourism operators are rejoicing after federal Health Minister Greg Hunt confirmed PCR tests required for anyone travelling in to and out of Queensland, would be funded in a 50–50 arrangement between the federal and state governments.
23/11/2021.author: Niki Burnside

23/11/2021.headline: Explosions tear through Serbian munitions factory, killing two and injuring 16
23/11/2021.description: The blasts reportedly shattered windows in nearby homes and could be heard in the centre of the Serbian capital 15 kilometres away.
23/11/2021.author: Niki Burnside

23/11/2021.headline: Mystery surrounds the death of missing campers. Could police be close to finding the answers?
23/11/2021.description: It's been a long 18 months for the family of Russell Hill and Carol Clay as they wait to find out exactly what happened out in the remote high country where they disappeared.
23/11/2021.author: Elise Kinsella

23/11/2021.headline: Foreign stem cells saved Shelley's life, but doctors say they should be available at home
23/11/2021.description: Stem cells made the difference for Shelley Garvie, but experts say Australia is a long way behind where it needs to be in finding donors for the treatment and are calling for reform.
23/11/2021.author: Catherine Heuzenroeder

23/11/2021.headline: SA's border is open. How are businesses responding?
23/11/2021.description: With the border open, South Australian businesses are having to adapt quickly. Some are imposing their own vaccine mandates, while others are calling for more clarity.
23/11/2021.author: Rebecca Opie and Matthew Smith

23/11/2021.headline: 'I would be a statistic if it wasn't for football': First Indigenous Matilda Karen Menzies
23/11/2021.description: Karen Menzies didn't know she was Indigenous until she was 16. As she struggled to come to terms with her identity, football provided her safety, purpose and joy. In many ways, it saved her life.
23/11/2021.author: Samantha Lewis

23/11/2021.headline: Royal Commissioner acknowledges potential conflict of interest over friendship with RSL president, who co-owned vineyard with brother
23/11/2021.description: Royal commissioner James Douglas QC — whose brother once co-owned a vineyard with the president of the RSL — has acknowledged a potential conflict of interest just days out from the start of the royal commission into veteran suicides.
23/11/2021.author: Andrew Greene

23/11/2021.headline: See the incredibly detailed data sparking allegations of 'widespread' illegal logging in Australian forests
23/11/2021.description: High-resolution spatial data and information obtained as part of an ABC investigation sparks allegations of widespread and systemic illegal logging in protected Victorian water catchments.
23/11/2021.author: Michael Slezak, Mark Doman, Katia Shatoba, Nathanael Scott, Alex Palmer, and Laura Kewley

23/11/2021.headline: Could you really jump from a plane into a storm, holding 9 kilos of stolen cash, and survive?
23/11/2021.description: For 50 years, DB Cooper has occupied a special place in American mythology: The well-dressed stranger who committed the perfect crime, fell from the sky and maybe, just maybe, got away with it.
23/11/2021.author: Rebecca Armitage and Lucia Stein

23/11/2021.headline: Pushing ahead with Marinus Link would result in 'Snowy 2.0' like loss, report finds
23/11/2021.description: A proposed undersea power cable and electricity storage project in Tasmania would not be able to compete with cheaper battery storage in Victoria, a report has found.
23/11/2021.author: Laura Beavis

23/11/2021.headline: Global hackers tried to break into Tasmania Police accounts 800 times
23/11/2021.description: An internal report from Tasmania's Department of Police, Fire and Emergency Management has warned the agency is vulnerable to attack from cyber criminals without extra resourcing.
23/11/2021.author: Emily Baker

23/11/2021.headline: Meet the five women trying to unseat one of Australia's most popular politicians
23/11/2021.description: Five women are vying to unseat Clover Moore, but all know it will take a miracle to beat the hugely popular Sydney Lord Mayor. This is why they're standing anyway.
23/11/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

23/11/2021.headline: How a Chinese tennis star's mysterious 'disappearance' tells the bigger story of a fragile superpower
23/11/2021.description: Xi wants to return China to the apex of global power. Yet right now the 'disappearance' of a female tennis player is revealing the folly of China's claim to greatness, writes Stan Grant.
23/11/2021.author: Stan Grant

23/11/2021.headline: 'Can-do capitalism' is delivering less than it used to. Here are 3 reasons why
23/11/2021.description: Before the pandemic Australia's economy was disturbingly and unusually weak. Can-do capitalism didn't do what it should then, and there's no reason to believe it can do now, writes Peter Martin.
23/11/2021.author: Stan Grant

23/11/2021.headline: Inside NASA's real-life Armageddon mission — minus Bruce Willis and a nuclear bomb
23/11/2021.description: The Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART) is set to begin its 10-month journey to nudge a space rock out of its orbit. Here's what we know about the mission.
23/11/2021.author: Genelle Weule

23/11/2021.headline: Defence 'torture' video victim says he still has 'night terrors'
23/11/2021.description: Former ADF trainee Alister French says he still has nightmares after he was bound and gagged and assaulted at an army barracks in Victoria last year.
23/11/2021.author: Michael Vincent

23/11/2021.headline: Renewed calls to delay NT border reopening until Indigenous vaccination rates increase
23/11/2021.description: Aboriginal health groups appeal to the NT government to ease back on border reopening plans, saying the Territory's hospital system could be overwhelmed as Indigenous vaccination rates continue to lag.
23/11/2021.author: Jane Bardon

24/11/2021.headline: Marrakesh the goat now the GOAT, fetching Australian record $21,000 price at sale
24/11/2021.description: A couple from Cobar have rewritten the record books by paying the new top national price for a goat, a 79-kilogram breeding buck who's also "a very nice goat".
24/11/2021.author: Hugh Hogan and Lucy Thackray

24/11/2021.headline: Mark McGowan could intervene if conservationists prevail in Woodside Supreme Court fight
24/11/2021.description: Mark McGowan says a move to overturn environmental approvals for Woodside's $16.5 billion Scarborough project could put other projects at risk.
24/11/2021.author: Evelyn Manfield

24/11/2021.headline: WBBL finals live: Brisbane Heat take on Adelaide Strikers in elimination clash
24/11/2021.description: The Heat and Strikers face off in the opening match of the WBBL07 finals series. Check out the live scores and stats in our ScoreCentre.
24/11/2021.author: Evelyn Manfield

24/11/2021.headline: Carlton AFL boss returns positive COVID test
24/11/2021.description: Blues chief executive Brian Cook is self-isolating, with his positive case forcing key staff members to miss this evening's AFL national draft in Melbourne.
24/11/2021.author: Evelyn Manfield

24/11/2021.headline: 'To use us as props is disgusting': Aboriginal health worker with COVID-19 slams anti-vaxxers, defends NT response
24/11/2021.description: Luke Ellis was the first health worker in the NT to contract COVID-19. As he continues to battle the disease, he's taken to social media to dispel misinformation and defended the government's handling of the outbreak in remote communities.
24/11/2021.author: Jacqueline Breen

24/11/2021.headline: The Loop: MP likens COVID-19 restrictions to Nazi Germany, the ARIAs are on tonight, excitement over coral spawning
24/11/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
24/11/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

24/11/2021.headline: World's first planetary defence spacecraft lifts off
24/11/2021.description: NASA's one-way mission to crash a spacecraft into an asteroid blasts off from California. The mission is to demonstrate the world's first planetary defence system by deflecting an asteroid from a potential doomsday collision with Earth.
24/11/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

24/11/2021.headline: Boy, 7, who drowned in neighbour's pool remembered as 'lovely, affectionate and caring' child
24/11/2021.description: A boy, 7, who drowned in his neighbour's pool north of Adelaide has been remembered by his grieving family as a "lovely" child.
24/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

24/11/2021.headline: Rising star Sophie Dwyer earns call-up to Australian squad
24/11/2021.description: Sophie Dwyer has had a breakout year in Super Netball, where she was largely expected to come off the bench. Now the sharp shooter has her sights set on an Australian debut.
24/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

24/11/2021.headline: Protesters teargassed as they call for Solomon Islands PM to step down
24/11/2021.description: Police in Solomon Islands use tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse large crowds that turned out in the capital Honiara this afternoon, demanding the country's Prime Minister step down.
24/11/2021.author: Max Walden, Edwina Seselja, and Catherine Graue

24/11/2021.headline: NSW man charged with using social media to advocate violence against politicians
24/11/2021.description: The ABC understands the Prime Minister Scott Morrison and Victorian Premier Dan Andrews were among those targeted by 37-year-old farmhand Wade Homewood.
24/11/2021.author: Ursula Malone

24/11/2021.headline: Teens behind 'horrendous' killing of 14 kangaroos weep in court
24/11/2021.description: The magistrate said the boys, both 17, carried out the act "without any real rationale other than a brain explosion".
24/11/2021.author: Adriane Reardon

24/11/2021.headline: Mining managers grilled in challenge to mandatory COVID-19 vaccines
24/11/2021.description: A workplace COVID-19 vaccination mandate is being fought in court after unvaccinated mineworkers were stood down.
24/11/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

24/11/2021.headline: Live: The AFL draft is here — join the discussion as we count down to the first pick
24/11/2021.description: The AFL draft is here, as some of best young players in the country launch their journeys with new clubs. Follow all the discussion and every pick in our live blog.
24/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

24/11/2021.headline: George Christensen likens COVID-19 restrictions to Hitler, Pol Pot regimes
24/11/2021.description: Outspoken Coalition backbencher George Christensen has used a speech in federal parliament to liken state and territory COVID-19 restrictions to the despotic regimes of Nazi Germany and Cambodia, calling for civil disobedience as a response.
24/11/2021.author: Matthew Doran

24/11/2021.headline: Bad week gets worse for Paine after team mate hits car with massive six
24/11/2021.description: Current and past cricket stars back Tim Paine to stay in the Australian Test team — but a tough week on the pitch gets worse as a massive six from a teammate leaves a costly dent in the former skipper's car.
24/11/2021.author: Chris Rowbottom

24/11/2021.headline: Three 'cowards' who beat a fellow prisoner to death given 17-year jail terms
24/11/2021.description: Three men described as "cowards" are given 17-year jail terms for killing a fellow Hakea Prison inmate, while another man who had been coerced into the attack, is also jailed.
24/11/2021.author: David Weber

24/11/2021.headline: COVID-19 PCR test confusion about 'singling out Queensland' ahead of looming federal election, Palaszczuk says
24/11/2021.description: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says she was unaware until yesterday that people coming to Queensland would not have to pay for a COVID-19 test to enter the state, despite the cost being covered by an inter-governmental deal since the pandemic began.
24/11/2021.author: Phoebe Hosier and Rachel Riga

24/11/2021.headline: Recording paints St Basil's aged care home as 'place of neglect' during deadly COVID-19 outbreak
24/11/2021.description: A woman — who lost both her parents during a COVID-19 outbreak at an aged care home in Melbourne's north that killed 50 people — gives evidence that her father wasn't provided food as the crisis engulfed the facility.
24/11/2021.author: Danny Morgan

24/11/2021.headline: Before Richard Ludwig's company went bust, he and his advisers smuggled more than $740,000 out of the business
24/11/2021.description: On the surface, it appeared to be another business going to the wall after failing to pay its mounting bills. But the reality was very different.
24/11/2021.author: Michael Atkin

24/11/2021.headline: Sydney-Hobart organisers 'confident' race will return in 2021
24/11/2021.description: The host club of the Sydney-Hobart Yacht Race is confident the blue water classic will proceed this year after it was cancelled in 2020 due to COVID-19 concerns.
24/11/2021.author: Michael Atkin

24/11/2021.headline: Sydney removalists sentenced over COVID trip days before family tragedy
24/11/2021.description: The three men were en route to the Central West when one of their COVID tests came back positive. Days later, the mother of two of the men died of the virus.
24/11/2021.author: Mollie Gorman

24/11/2021.headline: NT senator says she may cross floor over the government's proposed voter ID laws
24/11/2021.description: Coalition senator Sam McMahon says she's concerned the laws could negatively impact already low voter turnout in remote parts of the Northern Territory.
24/11/2021.author: Samantha Dick

24/11/2021.headline: Manly NRL player's positive COVID test forces cancellation of Gallen boxing bout
24/11/2021.description: Sea Eagles prop Josh Aloiai — who is fully vaccinated — was due to fight NRL great Paul Gallen in Newcastle next month.
24/11/2021.author: Samantha Dick

24/11/2021.headline: 'Most highly cited immunologist in Australia' faces allegations of misconduct after 'a number of complaints'
24/11/2021.description: An external investigation found Professor Mark Smyth "seriously breached codes relating to responsible research conduct".
24/11/2021.author: Samantha Dick

24/11/2021.headline: Students playing key role in long-awaited CBD rebuild to make themselves more employable
24/11/2021.description: A Queensland high school and a local council partner up to get students building hands-on projects that will revitalise a tired city centre, keep kids in school and help solve a rising unemployment problem.
24/11/2021.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis

24/11/2021.headline: Quarantine hub contract's 'cloak of secrecy' exposed
24/11/2021.description: The Queensland government is under fire for signing a confidentiality clause in the contract to build the 1,000-bed Wellcamp quarantine facility in the state's south.
24/11/2021.author: David Chen

24/11/2021.headline: COVID's fog of confusion over border testing — where it takes days to confirm nothing has changed
24/11/2021.description: Instead of being nipped in the bud at the earliest opportunity, concerns over incoming travellers having to fork out up to $150 for a PCR test festered in the news cycle — and swelled — until a breakthrough on Tuesday afternoon, writes Kate McKenna.
24/11/2021.author: Kate McKenna

24/11/2021.headline: How a former Diamond plans to see more Indigenous netballers at the elite level
24/11/2021.description: Former Australian Diamond, Sharon Finnan-White, creates a Queensland-based netball program as a pathway to the Super Netball competition for young Indigenous talent.
24/11/2021.author: Brittney Kleyn

24/11/2021.headline: Three men found guilty of murder of unarmed black man Ahmaud Arbery in US
24/11/2021.description: A jury has found three men guilty of the murder of black man Ahmaud Arbery, who was shot while jogging in the US state of Georgia in February 2020.
24/11/2021.author: Brittney Kleyn

24/11/2021.headline: 'I bawled my eyes out': When 11 friends were diagnosed with COVID, they banded together to overcome the stigma
24/11/2021.description: A group of 13 fully vaccinated friends went out for a post-lockdown dinner in Melbourne's CBD. Three days later, 11 of them tested positive to COVID.
24/11/2021.author: Sian Johnson

24/11/2021.headline: Why Black Friday is becoming the most wonderful time of the year for retailers
24/11/2021.description: November has now outpaced December as the biggest retail trading month of the year and shoppers are planning to spend even more this Black Friday and Cyber Monday in an effort to get gifts in time for Christmas.
24/11/2021.author: Stephanie Chalmers

24/11/2021.headline: Veterans encouraged to use new legal service ahead of military suicides royal commission
24/11/2021.description: Free legal advice is being offered to veterans and relatives wishing to give evidence to the highly anticipated royal commission examining Australia's spiralling rates of military suicide.
24/11/2021.author: Andrew Greene

24/11/2021.headline: South Australian deputy premier vote to be held today, with two MPs vying for the title
24/11/2021.description: South Australia will have a new deputy premier in place by the end of the day, with Lower House Liberal MPs to cast a vote in a secret ballot. So, who is in the running?
24/11/2021.author: Stacey Lee

24/11/2021.headline: Dinghy capsizes on English Channel, leaving at least 31 dead
24/11/2021.description: A dinghy filled with people has capsized in the English Channel, leaving at least 31 dead, in what officials have described as the worst disaster involving migrants to occur on the waterway.
24/11/2021.author: Stacey Lee

24/11/2021.headline: Every morning Andrew woke to the sound of his cellmate on the toilet
24/11/2021.description: Prisoners are forced to use the toilet in front of cellmates, a new report says, because the Tasmanian government is dealing with growing numbers by adding beds to single cells not designed for them.
24/11/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

24/11/2021.headline: Former person of interest in Willam Tyrrell case says new search brought back painful memories
24/11/2021.description: The pensioner says he was "humiliated" by detectives investigating the disappearance of William Tyrrell and is considering suing police over his treatment.
24/11/2021.author: Mark Reddie

24/11/2021.headline: With one ill-fated answer, Morrison managed a double own goal
24/11/2021.description: For prime ministers, parliamentary sitting weeks are often a bit like a visit to the dentist — something that must be endured. But this one has been particularly painful for Scott Morrison, writes David Speers.
24/11/2021.author: David Speers

24/11/2021.headline: Indoor air quality is a 'regulatory no-man's-land'. And that matters with COVID
24/11/2021.description: There's lots of talk about fixing ventilation to stop COVID, but bad indoor air has been a problem for decades. How will this change, and what can we do in the meantime?
24/11/2021.author: Anna Salleh

24/11/2021.headline: 'Lines get blurred between carer and family': why families of those with mental health issues need support
24/11/2021.description: More than 45 per cent of Australians experience mental illness in their lifetimes, but there's often a shortage of services and support for their families.
24/11/2021.author: Sophie Kesteven and Isabelle Summerson

24/11/2021.headline: China's students are getting new school textbooks — and they reveal a lot about where China is headed
24/11/2021.description: Xi Jinping's growing cultivation of a personality cult is reminiscent of the days of Mao Zedong, write Shih-Wen Sue Chen and Sin Wen Lau.
24/11/2021.author: Sophie Kesteven and Isabelle Summerson

24/11/2021.headline: The controversial COVID posts fuelling a little known senator's popularity online
24/11/2021.description: Liberal Senator Gerard Rennick has rapidly become the federal parliamentarian with the busiest Facebook page, thanks to his frequent posts about vaccines and COVID-19 lockdowns.
24/11/2021.author: Casey Briggs

24/11/2021.headline: Sarah was a prominent conservationist. Then a private investigator says he was told to find 'dirt' on her
24/11/2021.description: The ABC can reveal VicForests hired a private investigator to conduct surveillance on conservationists and, more recently, conducted what some have called "digital surveillance" on people the agency argues are trying to "discredit" it.
24/11/2021.author: Michael Slezak and Laura Kewley

24/11/2021.headline: German coalition parties sign agreement deal to end Angela Merkel's 16-year grip on power
24/11/2021.description: The three-party coalition agreement is a departure from Ms Merkel's conservative-led government's agenda, with a push towards renewable energy and a plan to phase out coal by 2030.
24/11/2021.author: Jack Hawke

24/11/2021.headline: Stunning day in Swedish politics sees nation's first female prime minister resign within hours
24/11/2021.description: Magdalena Andersson, the leader of Sweden's Social Democrats, briefly becomes the nation's first female prime minister before resigning due to losing the support of the minor party in her coalition.
24/11/2021.author: Jack Hawke

24/11/2021.headline: COVID leaves Cyprus stockpiling millions of kilograms of halloumi
24/11/2021.description: For many it's a staple of a BBQ but in Cyprus right now they have halloumi stockpiled in the millions of kilograms as the pandemic impacts exports badly.
24/11/2021.author: Jack Hawke

24/11/2021.headline: Ethiopia's PM heads to front lines to personally direct fight against Tigray forces
24/11/2021.description: The government says Abiy Ahmed has gone to take charge in a yearlong war,  leaving daily work of running the country to his deputy, as rival fighters approach the capital Addis Ababa.
24/11/2021.author: Jack Hawke

24/11/2021.headline: National energy market report reveals expected price drops for power bills across country
24/11/2021.description: Household power bills are predicted to continue falling across Australia in the coming years, a new report says, despite the closure of major sites such as the Liddell power station in NSW.
24/11/2021.author: Alina Eacott

24/11/2021.headline: More than 80 guests in lockdown at Byron Bay backpackers after confirmed COVID case
24/11/2021.description: The Member for Ballina says a Byron Bay hostel is going into a lockdown due to a positive COVID case at the venue.
24/11/2021.author: Jean Kennedy

24/11/2021.headline: Former champion says amateur snooker players should not play pro tournaments, after losing to 19-year-old
24/11/2021.description: After losing in the first-round of one of snooker's biggest tournaments to a 19-year-old amateur, former World Champion Shaun Murphy began criticising the governing body for allowing non-professionals to play big tournaments.
24/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

25/11/2021.headline: Child protection department 'largely ignored' Aboriginal placement policy before suicide of girl, 9, coroner says
25/11/2021.description: In her inquest findings, the Northern Territory coroner Elisabeth Armitage says Territory Families did not provide a nine-year-old girl, "Sammy", adequate therapeutic treatment and ignored its responsibility to find her kinship care.
25/11/2021.author: Jano Gibson

25/11/2021.headline: New Zealand Opposition Leader ousted hours after demoting rival
25/11/2021.description: A year after suffering a huge election loss, New Zealand's conservative Opposition Leader Judith Collins is ousted by her colleagues.
25/11/2021.author: Jano Gibson

25/11/2021.headline: 'Huge milestone' as Danny Hodgson leaves ICU, but long, 'gruelling' road to recovery still ahead
25/11/2021.description: Perth soccer player Danny Hodgson is moved out of the intensive care unit at Royal Perth Hospital almost three months after he was attacked on a night out.
25/11/2021.author: Lucy Martin

25/11/2021.headline: Giddey joins elite NBA company, 'unbelievable' Mills stars in Nets' win
25/11/2021.description: Josh Giddey enters the record books alongside LeBron James and LaMelo Ball, while Boomers legend Patty Mills plays a key role in the Nets' triumph over the Celtics.
25/11/2021.author: Lucy Martin

25/11/2021.headline: Dreams DJ and singer in feud over credit for ARIA-nominated track
25/11/2021.description: As Australia's night of nights for the music industry got underway, discontent was brewing behind the scen
25/11/2021.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

25/11/2021.headline: 'Hello, conspiracy theorists. Please, get a life': NT chief's big swipe at 'international trolls' spreading COVID-19 misinformation
25/11/2021.description: The Northern Territory Chief Minister has delivered a spray against "tinfoil hat-wearing tossers sitting in their parent's basement" who he says are spreading conspiracy theories about the Territory's current COVID-19 outbreak.
25/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

25/11/2021.headline: 'Hopefully it'll get more Sudanese kids to play footy': These top AFL draft picks are taking it all in their stride
25/11/2021.description: For the first time ever a South Sudanese player has been chosen in the top five of the AFL national draft.
25/11/2021.author: Sarah Cumming

25/11/2021.headline: Australia to send troops and police to Solomon Islands amid unrest
25/11/2021.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says Australian troops and police will be sent to Solomon Islands to help stabilise the island nation amid growing violence and unrest.
25/11/2021.author: Sarah Cumming

25/11/2021.headline: 'We've been made visible': Aboriginal Tasmanians celebrate first steps to treaty
25/11/2021.description: A report plotting a pathway to a treaty with Aboriginal Tasmanians recommends the creation of a truth-telling commission to establish an official record of the past and heal divisions.
25/11/2021.author: Emily Baker

25/11/2021.headline: Fire threat rises for parts of WA as hot summer ahead
25/11/2021.description: Parts of Western Australia, including Perth, are being tipped for heightened fire potential this year, as a hot summer is forecast for the state.
25/11/2021.author: Tyne Logan

25/11/2021.headline: Usman Khawaja's captaincy may cost him an Ashes spot after Travis Head tons up
25/11/2021.description: Queensland captain Usman Khawaja hands Travis Head another opportunity to prove his worth for a spot in the first Test team by enforcing the follow-on in the Sheffield Shield clash with South Australia.
25/11/2021.author: Tyne Logan

25/11/2021.headline: Energy Minister Dan van Holst Pellekaan confirmed as SA's new Deputy Premier
25/11/2021.description: Dan van Holst Pellekaan is officially South Australia's new Deputy Premier, after a vote of Lower House Liberal MPs this afternoon.
25/11/2021.author: Leah MacLennan and Sara Tomevska

25/11/2021.headline: 'No more fat to cut': Why this small business owner is boycotting Black Friday
25/11/2021.description: Regional NSW milliner Laura Hall says after years of drought and the pandemic, small businesses like hers can't afford to cut prices for Black Friday.
25/11/2021.author: Amelia Bernasconi and Bridget Murphy

25/11/2021.headline: Live: AFL draft continues with clubs ready to pounce on bargains — join the discussion
25/11/2021.description: After some surprises on night one, the AFL draft continues with a number of highly regarded players still on the board. Follow every pick in our live blog.
25/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

25/11/2021.headline: Robert Friscic took on the Catholic Church over historical sexual abuse and won. Lawyers say his case has set a precedent
25/11/2021.description: A Melbourne man has been awarded a record settlement by the Catholic Church of $3.7 million for historical sexual abuse, after the Archdiocese of Melbourne admitted a former Archbishop breached his duty of care.
25/11/2021.author: Rachael Brown

25/11/2021.headline: Larkham feels more 'developed' as a coach ahead of Brumbies return
25/11/2021.description: Wallabies great Stephen Larkham will return to Canberra to take charge of the Brumbies ahead of the 2023 Super Rugby Pacific season, believing he has improved as a coach during his stint in Ireland.
25/11/2021.author: Rachael Brown

25/11/2021.headline: Mark McGowan quick to dismiss WA Vaccine Commander's January border reopening claim
25/11/2021.description: WA Premier Mark McGowan was quick to correct his Vaccine Commander Chris Dawson's claim the WA border would drop in January.
25/11/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

25/11/2021.headline: Australian farmers just as productive with borders closed, study finds
25/11/2021.description: New data shows Australia's fruit and vegetable grower output remained steady despite border closures reducing worker numbers.
25/11/2021.author: Kath Sullivan

25/11/2021.headline: Gunshots allegedly fired in remote NT community
25/11/2021.description: Police are responding to reports of serious unrest and gunshots being fired in the community of Peppimenarti, south-west of Darwin, which has been struggling with reports of violence for months.
25/11/2021.author: Kath Sullivan

25/11/2021.headline: 'Slap on the wrist': Farmers fume as Whitehaven Coal fined $200,000 for taking water
25/11/2021.description: Farmers say they are outraged by the size of the fine handed to Whitehaven for unlawfully taking 1,000 megalitres of water between 2016 and 2019, during what one farmer calls "the worst drought in living memory".
25/11/2021.author: Patrick Bell

25/11/2021.headline: Do you know this man? Search for owner of GoPro found on tropical island six years after it went missing
25/11/2021.description: The video camera was found in a nook on boulders during a clean-up at Orpheus Island, half way between Cairns and Townsville.
25/11/2021.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath and Adam Stephen

25/11/2021.headline: Russian military warns debris from one of its rockets could fall into Tasmanian waters
25/11/2021.description: A blunt warning from the Russian military that rocket debris may fall close to Tasmania came as quite the surprise to the island's aviation industry, with one pilot saying it made a change from the usual messages about "boring things, like the runway is closed because it's wet".
25/11/2021.author: Rebecca Hewett

25/11/2021.headline: SA records three new cases of COVID-19, three Qantas flights listed as exposure sites
25/11/2021.description: South Australia records three new cases of COVID-19, with three flights now listed as exposure locations.
25/11/2021.author: Sara Garcia

25/11/2021.headline: Something unusual happened to stillbirth rates during the Melbourne lockdown
25/11/2021.description: A new study finds the rate of stillbirth in Melbourne during the lockdown period increased from one in 400 births to one in 300.
25/11/2021.author: Sara Garcia

25/11/2021.headline: How a Canberra program is saving lives by empowering the loved ones of opioid users
25/11/2021.description: After combating his own addiction, one Canberra man is empowering the families of those with opioid addictions — and his program is saving lives.
25/11/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

25/11/2021.headline: There are ten goats in this photo and ten questions in this quiz. Can you get 'em all right?
25/11/2021.description: It's getting towards the end of the year, and many of us are getting a little weary. Are you still keeping up with all things news?
25/11/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

25/11/2021.headline: Phil witnessed China tourism boom in Australia. But now that's over and many like him have moved on
25/11/2021.description: China's new official report says the majority of its citizens choose to travel domestically, which poses 'great uncertainty' about when, and whether, Chinese tourists will return to Australia in pre-pandemic numbers.
25/11/2021.author: Samuel Yang

25/11/2021.headline: When will international travel in Queensland return to normal?
25/11/2021.description: Airlines cannot commit to reinstating or establishing international flights in and out of Brisbane due to ongoing uncertainty about border closures, quarantine and COVID-19 testing requirements, travel industry advocates say.
25/11/2021.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

25/11/2021.headline: Germany COVID-19 death toll passes 100,000 as fourth wave rages
25/11/2021.description: Germany's outgoing Chancellor Angela Merkel urges her successor to impose new measures to slow the spread of the virus as the nation marks a grim milestone.
25/11/2021.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

25/11/2021.headline: Fight for vaccine mandates heats up ahead of South Australia's festival season
25/11/2021.description: As a statutory authority, the Adelaide Festival needs a directive from SA Health to bring in compulsory double-vaccination rules — but Premier Steven Marshall says that's not coming anytime soon.
25/11/2021.author: Matthew Smith

25/11/2021.headline: The world is asking 'Where is Peng Shuai?', but Chinese tennis fans don't even know she's missing
25/11/2021.description: Even China's biggest tennis fans haven't heard about Peng Shuai's alleged disappearance, which is causing alarm among international tennis players and human rights groups.
25/11/2021.author: Iris Zhao

25/11/2021.headline: It’s been called 'the devil's machine’. Macquarie Bank used a more technical name for it
25/11/2021.description: Internal documents show how Australia's largest investment bank took part in a controversial German tax scheme despite warnings of reputational damage and legal risk.
25/11/2021.author: Mario Christodoulou and Raveen Hunjan

25/11/2021.headline: Efat couldn't say goodbye to her family when she fled Kabul. Now she doesn't know if she'll see them again
25/11/2021.description: Recently evacuated Afghans are pleading with the federal government to prioritise their families' visa applications because of their connections to Australia, amid concerns they could be targeted by the Taliban.
25/11/2021.author: Joshua Boscaini

25/11/2021.headline: 'I couldn't find a job to save my life': Prue spent three years looking for work before starting her own law firm
25/11/2021.description: Australians with a disability have a much lower level of workforce participation than those without, with many locked out of job opportunities by prejudice. There's a growing body of evidence that suggests this is not just bad for them, but bad for business profits and the economy.
25/11/2021.author: Joshua Boscaini

25/11/2021.headline: How First Nations footballer Kyah Simon found her voice
25/11/2021.description: The Indigenous Matilda only learned about the extent of her family history as an adult, but is now using her knowledge and the wider Black Lives Matter movement to speak out on issues of racism and discrimination.
25/11/2021.author: Samantha Lewis

25/11/2021.headline: 'They stop women from having dreams': Arezo is speaking out, something forbidden in her homeland
25/11/2021.description: Exam pressure in Year 12 can be hard enough, but Hobart student Arezo Hami has had the added layer of negotiating help for Afghan family members coping with life under the Taliban.
25/11/2021.author: Georgie Burgess

25/11/2021.headline: A new generation challenges Morrison amid a chaotic week full of revolts
25/11/2021.description: Within the shambles, there has actually been one encouraging sign. We're seeing a new generation of Liberal moderates belatedly raise their voices, writes Michelle Grattan.
25/11/2021.author: Michelle Grattan

25/11/2021.headline: Solomon Islands Prime Minister blames foreign powers for civil unrest that prompted call to Australia for help
25/11/2021.description: Protests in the capital Honiara quickly spiralled out of the control of local police, with arson and looting in the Chinatown district and the city centre, and crowds threatening to disrupt Parliament.
25/11/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

25/11/2021.headline: Live music to return in a 'major way' next year after summer shortage, peak body says
25/11/2021.description: Australia is facing a shortage of live music this summer with concerts and festivals unlikely to return in "a major way" until the end of 2022, the industry's peak body says.
25/11/2021.author: Harriet Tatham

25/11/2021.headline: These slivers of carved mammoth tusk may be ancient jewellery — or something else entirely
25/11/2021.description: A beautiful ivory artefact is the oldest example of decorated jewellery in Eurasia,  international archaeologists say. But could it be something even more intriguing?
25/11/2021.author: Genelle Weule

25/11/2021.headline: Happiness is being able to afford a surprise vet bill
25/11/2021.description: Money may not be able to buy happiness but recent research shows it helps. But the income needed for a happy life is increasingly out-of-reach for ordinary Australians.
25/11/2021.author: Simon Leo Brown and Bec Zajac

25/11/2021.headline: 'Tis the season for those tricky vaccine convos with your family. Here's how to go about it
25/11/2021.description: Conversations about vaccination can be really hard, especially when you don't see eye to eye with someone you love. We asked the experts for tips on how to negotiate COVID over Christmas.
25/11/2021.author: Olivia Willis

25/11/2021.headline: Schools can still expel LGBTQ+ kids. The Religious Discrimination Bill only makes it worse
25/11/2021.description: The Religious Discrimination Bill, in its third iteration, does nothing to protect LGBTQ+ students and teachers. It allows more, not less, discrimination by religious schools.
25/11/2021.author: Olivia Willis

25/11/2021.headline: 'They fired me because I'm gay': Religious teacher airs claim on Q+A
25/11/2021.description: With Scott Morrison's religious discrimination bill in the spotlight, a school teacher tells Q+A she was fired by a religious school for coming out, but a pastor defends the right of religious schools to do so.
25/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

25/11/2021.headline: Rescuers suspend search after deadly Russian mine fire, with dozens still trapped underground
25/11/2021.description: Coal dust catches fire in a ventilation shaft at the Listvyazhnaya mine in the snowbound Kemerovo region, filling the underground workplace with smoke, according to authorities.
25/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

25/11/2021.headline: Solomon Islands unrest jolts Australia's 'Pacific Step-up'
25/11/2021.description: The great geopolitical contest of the 21st century is playing out on Australia’s doorstep, writes defence correspondent Andrew Greene.
25/11/2021.author: Andrew Greene

25/11/2021.headline: Seven accused drug traffickers arrested in Adelaide's south
25/11/2021.description: Police have seized kilograms of illicit drugs, cash and drug paraphernalia allegedly linked to a southern suburbs drug syndicate.
25/11/2021.author: Andrew Greene

25/11/2021.headline: Company fined $320,000 after teen worker falls to his death at Perth construction site
25/11/2021.description: A company which failed to provide a safe workplace for a teenage boy which resulted in him falling 12 metres to his death at the old Perth post office building is fined $320,000.
25/11/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

26/11/2021.headline: No injuries or arrests in Peppimenarti, police investigating after reports of gunshots
26/11/2021.description: Police say specialist investigators have joined the extra officers sent to the community south-west of Darwin, where the health clinic has closed but the school remains open for now.
26/11/2021.author: Kate Ashton

26/11/2021.headline: Mother of hit-and-run victim tells court she's 'empty without him' as two defendants plead guilty
26/11/2021.description: Raelene Powell has told an Alice Springs court her family has struggled with her son Shane's loss ever since he was killed riding his motorcycle home from his job as a disability support worker.
26/11/2021.author: Mitchell Abram

26/11/2021.headline: The Loop: Police fear for baby's welfare, Aussie men's cricket captain confirmed and watch out for Black Friday tricks
26/11/2021.description: Get in The Loop with a quick wrap-up of the news you need to know about.
26/11/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

26/11/2021.headline: Communities 'rooted in this soil' face a managed retreat from climate change and rising waters
26/11/2021.description: Communities in coastal areas of the United States are having to consider a "managed retreat" from climate change as rising waters and destructive storms threaten their ways of life.
26/11/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

26/11/2021.headline: SA announces 'grand initiative' to create Australia's largest national park
26/11/2021.description: The Munga-Thirri—Simpson Desert National Park in far northern South Australia becomes Australia's newest and largest national park.
26/11/2021.author: Declan Gooch

26/11/2021.headline: A new COVID-19 variant has been detected in South Africa. This is what we know
26/11/2021.description: After a new COVID-19 variant emerged in southern Africa, scientists, health officials and the public are concerned, and the World Health Organization is monitoring the situation closely. Here is what we know.
26/11/2021.author: Mary Lloyd and Leonie Thorne

26/11/2021.headline: Victorian CHO Brett Sutton defends decision to stand staff down during deadly aged care COVID-19 outbreak
26/11/2021.description: Professor Brett Sutton tells a coronial inquest his decision to direct all staff at St Basil's aged care home into quarantine in July 2020 was made in an attempt to save lives.
26/11/2021.author: Leanne Wong

26/11/2021.headline: Solomon Islands PM's compound targeted by rioters, one building damaged by fire and looters
26/11/2021.description: Prime Minister Sogavare's residence is under heavy police watch as protests continue for a third day, with more Australian police and troops to arrive in the capital, Honiara, later today.
26/11/2021.author: Leanne Wong

26/11/2021.headline: What are the rules in Tasmania if you are unvaxed when the borders open?
26/11/2021.description: Tasmania's borders are opening and COVID-19 is coming, so what are the rules if you get infected and you are unvaccinated?
26/11/2021.author: Emily Baker

26/11/2021.headline: Iconic Chinese photographer apologises after controversy over 'insulting' image
26/11/2021.description: A renowned Chinese fashion photographer apologises for her past work after online critics called it insulting to the Chinese people and fashion house Dior removed one of her photos from a show in Shanghai.
26/11/2021.author: Emily Baker

26/11/2021.headline: 'Including Kentucky Fried Chicken': Call for vaccine passports for all Central Australian venues
26/11/2021.description: "Covid will be here soon", warns Dr John Boffa, ahead of the Northern Territory opening borders in December.
26/11/2021.author: Saskia Mabin and Stewart Brash

26/11/2021.headline: Melbourne Storm NRL player charged by Queensland Police over alleged incident outside hotel
26/11/2021.description: Tui Kamikamica has been stood down by the Melbourne Storm after being charged over an alleged incident involving a woman outside a Brisbane hotel.
26/11/2021.author: Saskia Mabin and Stewart Brash

26/11/2021.headline: 'My son's the police minister. I'm pissed': Kenneth Grant found guilty of deadly 'sleepwalking' hit-run
26/11/2021.description: The former police officer's defence over the hit-and-run death of a man was that he was sleepwalking and not conscious of his actions at the time. Today, a judge rejected that argument.
26/11/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

26/11/2021.headline: SA records two new cases of COVID-19 as 80 per cent vaccination milestone reached
26/11/2021.description: South Australia records two new cases of COVID-19, as Premier Steven Marshall announces the state has reached 80 per cent double vaccination.
26/11/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin and Eric Tlozek

26/11/2021.headline: Two men and a woman arrested in SA over alleged drug trafficking on the dark web
26/11/2021.description: SA Police have charged three people and seized more than $2 million worth of cash, cryptocurrency and property connected to alleged drug trafficking on the dark web.
26/11/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin and Eric Tlozek

26/11/2021.headline: Egypt unveils 3,000-year-old renovated Avenue of the Sphinxes in Luxor
26/11/2021.description: Egyptian authorities unveil renovated ancient promenade in the city of Luxor that dates back 3,000 years.
26/11/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin and Eric Tlozek

26/11/2021.headline: Senior Rebels bikie arrested after alleged drug bust at his inner-city apartment
26/11/2021.description: One of Canberra's most senior outlaw motorcycle gang members faces court after being arrested by police in the city's inner-north on Thursday night.
26/11/2021.author: Gordon Taylor

26/11/2021.headline: 17yo charged with murder of Central Queensland woman Rene Latimore
26/11/2021.description: Police have charged a teenager with one count of murder, but have not yet revealed whether he was known to Ms Latimore.
26/11/2021.author: Angel Parsons and Hannah Walsh

26/11/2021.headline: Close Ashes selection call looms for 'good mates' Khawaja and Head
26/11/2021.description: The Queensland and South Australian captains have made their cases for Ashes selection, with similar form lines this Sheffield Shield season.
26/11/2021.author: Angel Parsons and Hannah Walsh

26/11/2021.headline: Defence Minister says China 'sees us as a tributary state' that should submit to its power
26/11/2021.description: The Defence Minister says China sees Australia and other countries in the region as subordinate states that should be submissive to it, as he warns Beijing would quickly dominate Asia if it succeeds in invading Taiwan.
26/11/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

26/11/2021.headline: Every pick made in the 2021 AFL rookie draft
26/11/2021.description: Some young recruits and more experienced figures earn AFL lifelines via the rookie draft. Get the full list of every player selected.
26/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

26/11/2021.headline: Here's why Australia is stepping in to help the Solomon Islands government
26/11/2021.description: Here's why Australia is stepping in on the unrest in Solomon Islands, and what our servicemen and women will be doing in the Pacific nation.
26/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

26/11/2021.headline: Chinese official gets Interpol post despite opposition from Australian MPs
26/11/2021.description: Interpol's member countries vote to appoint a Chinese public security official to the international law enforcement body's executive committee, despite objections from a group of Australian MPs and international human rights organisations.
26/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

26/11/2021.headline: 'A piece of meat purely for his pleasure': Victim of sexual abuse by 'cult' leader tells court of her suffering
26/11/2021.description: A woman sexually abused by a "cult" leader when she was a girl has told an Adelaide court she was made to feel like "a piece of meat purely for his pleasure".
26/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

26/11/2021.headline: Be careful if you're planning to shop Black Friday, Cyber Monday sales, warns Choice
26/11/2021.description: Black Friday and Cyber Monday are now firmly entrenched in the Australian sales calendar, rivalling more traditional sale events such as Boxing Day, but this November may not be the time to get the best deal.
26/11/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

26/11/2021.headline: Food, fuel and cash in short supply as Solomon Islands civil unrest leaves trail of destruction
26/11/2021.description: Riots, arson attacks and looting over three straight days of civil unrest leave the capital of Honiara short on food and essential services. This is what the crisis looks like on the ground.
26/11/2021.author: Edwina Seselja

26/11/2021.headline: As new COVID-19 variant hits South Africa, some locals listen to preachers doing research 'from the internet'
26/11/2021.description: Experts say vaccination rates need to pick up to prevent the new variant spreading in South Africa, as some of its citizens take their lead from preachers relying on misinformation from the internet.
26/11/2021.author: Edwina Seselja

26/11/2021.headline: Pat Cummins isn't perfect and he's happy that way
26/11/2021.description: Australia's new men's Test captain is not afraid to admit he has flaws, a characteristic that may help him thrive in the role, writes David Mark.
26/11/2021.author: David Mark

26/11/2021.headline: Engines tested and take-off imminent for replica of one of Australia's most famous aeroplanes
26/11/2021.description: A replica of Sir Charles Kingsford Smith's Southern Cross aeroplane is just months away from flying again after a 10 year restoration.
26/11/2021.author: Justin Huntsdale

26/11/2021.headline: What powers and immunity will Australian forces have while they are deployed in Solomon Islands?
26/11/2021.description: Australia is putting troops on the ground in Solomon Islands after violent protests erupted in the Pacific nation. What powers and immunity will they have?
26/11/2021.author: Erin Handley

26/11/2021.headline: House of Gucci is inspired by a true story of scandal, betrayal, ambition and ... murder
26/11/2021.description: House of Gucci weaves the tale of how Patrizia Reggiani managed to muscle her way into one of fashion's most powerful families and threaten its legacy, setting off a "reckless spiral of betrayal, decadence and revenge". The true story behind it is almost unbelievable. Warning: spoilers for House of Gucci ahead.
26/11/2021.author: Lucy Sweeney

26/11/2021.headline: For one former amateur footballer, standing tall for a teammate means speaking about childhood sexual abuse
26/11/2021.description: Glen Fearnett had kept a dark secret his entire life, but when an ex-teammate had the bravery to speak up about sexual abuse, he knew it was time to shine a light on his own experiences.
26/11/2021.author: Russell Jackson

26/11/2021.headline: COVID gave us as the chance for a 'life-changing' economic experiment, but we've turned our backs on it
26/11/2021.description: The glaring lesson of the pandemic, which our political discourse is not yet to really deal with, is the need for all sorts of government interventions in our economy, writes Laura Tingle.
26/11/2021.author: Laura Tingle

26/11/2021.headline: Ethiopia's Prime Minister appears at battlefront of Tigray war vowing to 'bury the enemy'
26/11/2021.description: Ahmed Abiy appears in a video aired by state media, purportedly showing the Nobel Peace Prize winner on the frontline of the country's yearlong war against Tigray forces.
26/11/2021.author: Laura Tingle

26/11/2021.headline: European Union nations slam borders shut to southern African countries with new COVID variant
26/11/2021.description: All 27 European nations agree to shut their borders to African nations with the new COVID variant in a bid to keep it out, as the WHO caution nations against panicking.
26/11/2021.author: Laura Tingle

26/11/2021.headline: Survivor hauled out of Russian coal mine but six more deaths recorded
26/11/2021.description: Rescuers have found a survivor in a Siberian coal mine where dozens of workers are presumed dead after a devastating methane explosion.
26/11/2021.author: Laura Tingle

26/11/2021.headline: Wallabies coach apologises for spray at referees after Wales loss
26/11/2021.description: World Rugby issues Dave Rennie with a written warning after his comments after the Wallabies last-gasp loss to Wales in Cardiff.
26/11/2021.author: Laura Tingle

26/11/2021.headline: Wenzel-Halls goal gives John Aloisi first win as Western United manager
26/11/2021.description: The Victorian club snaps a nine-match losing streak in the A-League Men with their 1-0 win over Perth Glory at home.
26/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

26/11/2021.headline: France excludes UK from Channel migrants crisis meeting after criticism from British Prime Minister
26/11/2021.description: France tells UK Home Secretary Priti Patel she is no longer invited to a meeting over the Channel migration crisis after British Prime Minister criticised Paris's handling of the situation.
26/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

26/11/2021.headline: More Black Summers ahead as climate change increases risk of megafires: CSIRO
26/11/2021.description: Research shows climate change has increased the frequency and extent of megafires in Australia, with scientists warning the year following a La Niña is the most treacherous.
26/11/2021.author: Jess Davis

26/11/2021.headline: Coastal development allegedly linked to Obeid family interests rejected
26/11/2021.description: A Port Macquarie development proposal, scrutinised in an ABC Four Corners report examining the Obeid family's coastal property interests, has been knocked back.
26/11/2021.author: Luisa Rubbo

26/11/2021.headline: Investors hold their breath as new COVID variant throws back to the early days of the pandemic
26/11/2021.description: At some point on Friday afternoon, news flashed up on trading terminals across the globe indicating the new strain of COVID-19 found in South Africa  — and markets reacted, writes David Taylor.
26/11/2021.author: David Taylor

26/11/2021.headline: NSW teachers vote to strike for first time in 10 years after 'exhausting' all options
26/11/2021.description: Teachers in public schools across New South Wales vote to go on strike next month over what they say are "unsustainable" workloads and "uncompetitive" salaries.
26/11/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

27/11/2021.headline: Photographs capture extent of floods in north-west NSW
27/11/2021.description: These images show the impact of floodwaters inundating the saturated plains of the NSW north-west, cutting off towns and submerging crops.
27/11/2021.author: Lani Oataway

27/11/2021.headline: 50-50 chance: Doubts growing about Perth hosting Ashes Test match
27/11/2021.description: Hopes of Perth hosting the fifth and final Ashes Test have faded, with Cricket Australia chief Christina Matthews saying there is a 50:50 chance of the match being hosted in Western Australia.
27/11/2021.author: Tom Wildie

27/11/2021.headline: SA opened its borders to COVID-19 this week. Here's what we've learned
27/11/2021.description: After enjoying months without a single case of local transmission, SA opened up to COVID-19 on Tuesday and the cases have started popping up.
27/11/2021.author: Isabel Dayman

27/11/2021.headline: Police presence boosted in Northbridge following fatal stabbing
27/11/2021.description: A 28-year-old man is dead and two men are in custody following a fatal stabbing in Northbridge, where the police presence has been ramped up and streets cordoned off.
27/11/2021.author: Kate Christian

27/11/2021.headline: Man charged with murder, another arrested, over shooting death of woman who answered her door
27/11/2021.description: A man has been charged with murder, and NSW Police are seeking the extradition of a second man, after Newcastle woman Stacey Klimovitch was shot dead at her front door almost six months ago.
27/11/2021.author: Carly Cook and Elizabeth Byrne

27/11/2021.headline: More weekend protests against vaccine mandates across the nation
27/11/2021.description: Thousands of protesters gather in Melbourne's CBD to oppose the Victorian government's vaccination policies and proposed pandemic laws.
27/11/2021.author: Carly Cook and Elizabeth Byrne

27/11/2021.headline: USA claim 3-0 win over Australia in the first of two friendlies
27/11/2021.description: The Matildas have lost 3-0 to world champions USA in the first of two friendlies on home soil.
27/11/2021.author: Samantha Lewis

27/11/2021.headline: Tasmania pays out record $1.4m to child abuse survivor of paedophile teacher
27/11/2021.description: The Tasmanian government settles a group of six historical child sexual abuse cases, with one of the survivors receiving what is thought to be the state's largest child abuse settlement to date.
27/11/2021.author: Loretta Lohberger

27/11/2021.headline: Australia's most 'dangerous' country race meet ends after 169 years
27/11/2021.description: Five weeks from the running of the 170th Wallabadah Cup, Racing NSW officials recommend it ends with the "rollercoaster" track ruled too dangerous.
27/11/2021.author: Jennifer Ingall

27/11/2021.headline: 'Everything that is happening is expected': SA records three new COVID cases
27/11/2021.description: South Australia records three new cases of COVID-19, as authorities say they are concerned about exposure sites in the state's south-east.
27/11/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin

27/11/2021.headline: NSW changes travel advice for southern Africa in response to new COVID variant
27/11/2021.description: Travellers arriving in NSW from southern Africa are now required to get tested for COVID-19 and isolate as health officials move to stop the spread of the new Omicron variant.
27/11/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin

27/11/2021.headline: 'The bulk of this savaging, I deserve': Reporter issues on-air apology for botched Adele interview
27/11/2021.description: The Australian TV reporter who was widely criticised for flying to the UK to interview singer Adele without listening to her new album issues an on-air apology, admitting he made a "terrible mistake".
27/11/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin

27/11/2021.headline: 'We don't know a lot about it': Health bosses monitoring Omicron outbreak as new travel ban comes into force
27/11/2021.description: The federal government announces travel bans and new quarantine rules amid concerns about the new Omicron COVID-19 variant circulating in southern Africa.
27/11/2021.author: Stephanie Borys

27/11/2021.headline: South African traveller in NT quarantine tested for new Omicron COVID variant
27/11/2021.description: As Katherine moves out of lockdown and into a lockout, Northern Territory authorities are racing to determine if a new positive case at Howard Springs has the Omicron variant of concern.
27/11/2021.author: Stephanie Borys

27/11/2021.headline: First fatalities of Solomon Islands unrest discovered in burnt-out Chinatown store
27/11/2021.description: Charred bodies are discovered in a building in the capital Honiara as more Australians make their way to the Pacific nation to restore order and protect critical infrastructure.
27/11/2021.author: Stephanie Borys

27/11/2021.headline: Doctors were ready to let Tristan 'cark it' after a terrible accident. He just graduated from high school
27/11/2021.description: A Queensland mother says she never imagined what her son would achieve when she ignored doctors' advice to turn off his life support four years ago.
27/11/2021.author: Jacqui Street

27/11/2021.headline: Ukraine's President claims Russia and a local oligarch are plotting to overthrow him next week
27/11/2021.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claims his country's intelligence service has uncovered plans for a Russia-backed coup d'etat in the country next week that allegedly involves one of Ukraine's richest oligarchs.
27/11/2021.author: Jacqui Street

27/11/2021.headline: Protesting Indian farmers won't budge until new laws revoked
27/11/2021.description: Controversial agriculture laws have triggered some of the largest protests that India has ever seen. India's PM has promised to reverse the laws but local farmers remain wary.
27/11/2021.author: Hugo Rikard-Bell

27/11/2021.headline: Woman launches civil action against Canberra prison authorities for alleged breach of human rights
27/11/2021.description: A woman strip searched in an "inhuman and degrading way" in Canberra prison launches a civil action against prison authorities, claiming denial of procedural fairness and breaches of the human rights act.
27/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

27/11/2021.headline: Only nine farms remain in local hands in Tasmania's dairy country but a farmer group wants to turn the tables
27/11/2021.description: In a region with one of the highest levels of corporate and foreign-owned farmland in Australia, a farmer investment group has sprung up in Tasmania's north-west to keep local farmers on the land.
27/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

27/11/2021.headline: Man escapes quarantine and heads to Darwin's party strip before being located by police
27/11/2021.description: A man who allegedly snuck out of the Howard Springs quarantine facility is found by police almost six hours later at a licensed venue in the Darwin CBD.
27/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

27/11/2021.headline: One new COVID case detected in Queensland as state tracks a week ahead for vaccination target
27/11/2021.description: Queensland records one new case of coronavirus as the state tracks towards hitting the 80 per cent double vaccination milestone on December 10.
27/11/2021.author: Kym Agius

27/11/2021.headline: Get Back: Peter Jackson's epic Beatles documentary dispels myths about the band's final year
27/11/2021.description: Peter Jackson’s epic eight-hour series shows the band's camaraderie and creative genius even in their death throes.
27/11/2021.author: Luke Goodsell

27/11/2021.headline: A stranger told Jennelle she shouldn't have children. Now she's a proud mum
27/11/2021.description: One of the biggest challenges for parents with blindness or low vision can be negative attitudes from others. But with support from peers and a bit of planning, these women have navigated motherhood and found immense love and joy.
27/11/2021.author: Celina Edmonds and Nas Campanella

27/11/2021.headline: 2023 Women's World Cup is already changing the game for First Nations communities
27/11/2021.description: The 2023 Women's World Cup is the first to use Indigenous languages in its official identity, hinting at work beneath the surface to further embrace and support First Nations communities.
27/11/2021.author: Samantha Lewis

27/11/2021.headline: ‘You’re not bouncy enough to have ADHD’: Australian school kids say ADHD is severely misunderstood
27/11/2021.description: ADHD affects one in 20 Australian children, which means, statistically, there is a child with ADHD in every single classroom in the country. But a recent study shows 55 per cent of teachers do not have adequate training on managing ADHD in the classroom.
27/11/2021.author: Jacqueline Howard

27/11/2021.headline: House prices depend on interest rates: As one goes up, the other will fall
27/11/2021.description: House price falls are all but baked in as interest rates start rising over the next couple of years. How much prices fall mainly depends on how high and quickly borrowing costs end up rising, writes Michael Janda.
27/11/2021.author: Michael Janda

27/11/2021.headline: Omicron 'may already be here in Australia'. Experts say there's more we can do to stop COVID
27/11/2021.description: The emergence of the Omicron variant of coronavirus shows Africa needs greater access to vaccines, experts say. There are also warnings we shouldn't give up masks, social distancing or contact tracing in Australia.
27/11/2021.author: Max Walden

27/11/2021.headline: 'There have been rumours': Why the next two years could decide the fate of Kim Jong Un
27/11/2021.description: North Korea claims to have been COVID-free for the duration of the pandemic. But recent events south of the border could have major implications for the secretive nation and its enigmatic ruler.
27/11/2021.author: Carrington Clarke

27/11/2021.headline: Michael never told anyone about the thoughts in his head until they landed him in prison
27/11/2021.description: All Michael wanted as a kid was for the bad thoughts to go away. And one day they did, but the reason why led him down a dark path.
27/11/2021.author: Rachel Clayton

27/11/2021.headline: What do Australia's great novels have in common?
27/11/2021.description: A new three-part documentary series puts Australian literature firmly in the spotlight, and asks the question: can books help us understand our country?
27/11/2021.author: Maani Truu

27/11/2021.headline: Why Adele's imperfect voice sets her apart
27/11/2021.description: Adele's voice is soulful, rich and powerful – but it is in her vulnerability we can really see what an incredible artist she is, writes Narelle Yeo.
27/11/2021.author: Maani Truu

27/11/2021.headline: How an ancient message shows the path to protecting Aboriginal communities from COVID-19
27/11/2021.description: If the urgent problems fuelling COVID-19 outbreaks in Indigenous communities aren't addressed, things will continue to go poorly for First Nations people across Australia, writes Tynan King.
27/11/2021.author: Tynan King

27/11/2021.headline: Australia is at the crosshairs of a big shift, as the tussle with China over the Pacific steps up a level
27/11/2021.description: The Pacific Islands are in the front line of Xi Jinping's vision of the China Dream: China as the unrivalled regional power. Unrest in the Solomon Islands shows us what happens when the balance of power shifts and security and order can no longer be guaranteed, writes Stan Grant.
27/11/2021.author: Stan Grant

27/11/2021.headline: UK and Germany confirm first Omicron cases as Europe prepares for spread of new COVID variant
27/11/2021.description: The world is on high alert as the UK and Germany both record two cases of the new variant, while the Czech Republic finds suspected infections and borders slam shut.
27/11/2021.author: Stan Grant

27/11/2021.headline: All international arrivals into NSW and Victoria to quarantine under reimposed border rules
27/11/2021.description: New South Wales and Victoria reimpose quarantine requirements for international arrivals as South Australia and Western Australia tighten their border rules.
27/11/2021.author: Yara Murray-Atfield

27/11/2021.headline: Western Australia tightens border with South Australia after new COVID cases
27/11/2021.description: Western Australia will force all arrivals from South Australia to isolate for 14 days under the new rules, with Premier Mark McGowan saying the decision was linked to concerns about the new Omicron variant.
27/11/2021.author: Jacob Kagi

27/11/2021.headline: Police charge longest-serving Queensland mayor with assaulting women
27/11/2021.description: Charges arise from alleged incident during the annual racing event in the tiny north Queensland town in August.
27/11/2021.author: Larissa Waterson

27/11/2021.headline: Tears and prayers at funeral of four children who died in Werribee house fire
27/11/2021.description: Mourners cried as the tiny coffins were carried overhead of family and friends before being laid to rest.
27/11/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

27/11/2021.headline: Perth Scorchers beat Adelaide Strikers to win their first WBBL title
27/11/2021.description: Perth Scorchers defeat Adelaide Strikers by 12 runs to become the new WBBL champions, with South African allrounder Marizanne Kapp starring with bat and ball in the final.
27/11/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

27/11/2021.headline: Masked gunman fired 'random shots' at passing pedestrians before taking hostage, police say
27/11/2021.description: Clad all in black and carrying two rifles, a masked gunman who fired shots on a shopping strip on the NSW South Coast is now in custody, with police saying they don't yet know why he did it.
27/11/2021.author: Alison Xiao, Kevin Nguyen, and Tim Fernandez

27/11/2021.headline: Secrecy, confusion and chaos – the week that was in SA politics
27/11/2021.description: Last week started with the resignation of a defiant Deputy Premier and ended with a visit from the Prime Minister. Here's how it all played out.
27/11/2021.author: Stacey Lee

27/11/2021.headline: Three dead as Storm Arwen batters UK
27/11/2021.description: Three people are killed by falling trees across the United Kingdom as winter storm Arwen brings high winds and snow to the country.
27/11/2021.author: Stacey Lee

27/11/2021.headline: Woman charged with arson after blaze guts rooms at Cairns quarantine hotel
27/11/2021.description: A 31-year-old woman is charged with arson and wilful damage after allegedly lighting a fire under a bed at a Cairns quarantine hotel, forcing the evacuation of more than 160 people.
27/11/2021.author: Nibir Khan

27/11/2021.headline: Nicole lost her son to mitochondrial disease when he was nine days old. Now, she's walking for change.
27/11/2021.description: Nicole Baldry's son Henry died from mitochondrial disease when he was just nine days old. She hopes proposed changes to donation laws will mean other parents avoid the grief she has endured.
27/11/2021.author: Charlotte Gore

27/11/2021.headline: NT COVID outbreak spreads hundreds of kilometres to Lajamanu, community sent into lockdown
27/11/2021.description: Positive wastewater results prompt a snap lockdown in the community of Lajamanu, 560 kilometres from the centre of the current outbreak in Katherine.
27/11/2021.author: Charlotte Gore

27/11/2021.headline: Five people charged over Siberian coal mine disaster that killed 51
27/11/2021.description: The five mining officials will remain in pre-trial detention for two months pending an investigation into Russia's deadliest tragedy since 2010.
27/11/2021.author: Charlotte Gore

28/11/2021.headline: Plans unveiled for largest road infrastructure project in SA's history
28/11/2021.description: Plans have been released showing the final design for South Australia's biggest infrastructure project.
28/11/2021.author: Eric Tlozek

28/11/2021.headline: 'It's devastating': Tearful Cairns mother learns she'll be sent to the Gold Coast after COVID hotel fire
28/11/2021.description: Dozens of people evacuated after a hotel quarantine fire in Cairns say they've been told they'll be flown thousands of kilometres away to complete the rest of their isolation.
28/11/2021.author: Allyson Horn

28/11/2021.headline: China study warns of 'colossal' COVID outbreak if it opens up, with daily cases forecast to exceed 630,000
28/11/2021.description: A study by Peking University mathematicians shows China could not afford to lift travel restrictions without more efficient vaccinations or specific treatments.
28/11/2021.author: Allyson Horn

28/11/2021.headline: Australia's first cases of Omicron COVID-19 strain detected in Sydney travellers
28/11/2021.description: NSW Health confirms two returned travellers have tested positive for the new Omicron COVID-19 variant in Sydney, making them the first known cases in the country.
28/11/2021.author: Allyson Horn

28/11/2021.headline: Alex Carey boosts his Test debut chances with a century for SA
28/11/2021.description: Alex Carey blasts a century for South Australia as Gurinder Sandhu claims a hat-trick for Queensland in their one-day cup clash.
28/11/2021.author: Allyson Horn

28/11/2021.headline: Australia out of Davis Cup despite win
28/11/2021.description: Australia's bid to lift the Davis Cup is over before the knockout stages despite Alex de Minaur inspiring a 2-1 victory over Hungary in Turin.
28/11/2021.author: Allyson Horn

28/11/2021.headline: Seasonal farm worker dies after lightning strike on farm south of Darwin
28/11/2021.description: A 34-year-old man has died overnight in hospital after being struck by lightning earlier last week, while working on a mango farm in Berry Springs.
28/11/2021.author: Myles Houlbrook-Walk

28/11/2021.headline: Anti-troll laws could force social media companies to give out names and contact details
28/11/2021.description: In an attempt to crack down on trolls, the federal government proposes new social media laws that could force companies to reveal names of anonymous users.
28/11/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

28/11/2021.headline: No new cases of COVID-19 in SA
28/11/2021.description: South Australia has recorded no new cases today as border rules tighten, less than a week after opening up to vaccinated travellers.
28/11/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin and Candice Prosser

28/11/2021.headline: Some businesses start to reopen in Solomon Islands as Morrison says more support being sent from Australia
28/11/2021.description: The Prime Minister says Australian military and federal police personnel are in Solomon Islands "to provide a stable and safe environment" as tensions begin to ease after days of rioting and looting that left three people dead.
28/11/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin and Candice Prosser

28/11/2021.headline: Residents told to stay indoors as fire engulfs linen factory in Perth's east
28/11/2021.description: Residents living near a factory fire in Perth's east are advised to stay indoors to avoid plumes of smoke and fumes filling the sky.
28/11/2021.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

28/11/2021.headline: NT records three more local COVID cases linked to Katherine cluster, as remote community enters lockdown
28/11/2021.description: Three more local COVID-19 cases are recorded in the NT overnight, as the remote community of Lajamanu enters lockdown and testing continues of a South African traveller who may be carrying the new Omicron variant.
28/11/2021.author: Samantha Dick

28/11/2021.headline: Israel to ban entry of foreigners from every country over Omicron variant
28/11/2021.description: Israel will ban the entry of all foreigners into the country, making it the first country to shut its borders completely in response to a new and potentially more contagious coronavirus variant.
28/11/2021.author: Samantha Dick

28/11/2021.headline: Fraud risk with Queensland check-in app not a flaw, minister says
28/11/2021.description: A function that allows other people's vaccination certificates to be uploaded to the Check In Qld app is not a flaw and would be "incredibly difficult" to carry out fraudulently, says Queensland Digital Economy Minister Leeanne Enoch.
28/11/2021.author: Samantha Dick

28/11/2021.headline: Man arrested over stabbing outside Adelaide nightclub
28/11/2021.description: A man is arrested over a stabbing outside an Adelaide nightclub in the early hours of this morning.
28/11/2021.author: Samantha Dick

28/11/2021.headline: How much would it cost to reforest Australian farmland for carbon credits?
28/11/2021.description: Offsetting agricultural emissions through reforestation would cost a fair chunk of farm profits, new research suggests. So what's the best way to tackle agricultural emissions?
28/11/2021.author: Angus Mackintosh

28/11/2021.headline: A COVID-hit Portuguese football team could only field nine players. They conceded seven goals in a half
28/11/2021.description: Portuguese team Belenenses is only able to field a team of nine players — including two goalkeepers — due to a COVID outbreak, and finds itself 7-0 down against Benfica before the match is abandoned.
28/11/2021.author: Angus Mackintosh

28/11/2021.headline: George Kambosos Jr crowned world unified lightweight champion after defeating Teófimo López
