03/12/2021.description: The extent of the financial hit to Tennis Australia's finances from the COVID-19 pandemic is revealed, with TA's annual report showing a $100 million loss due to lower crowds and the cost of player quarantine.
03/12/2021.author: Joanna Woodburn

03/12/2021.headline: Federal funding to save hours of at-risk footage of Australian life in the 20th century
03/12/2021.description: The federal government pledges $47 million to help Australia's national institutions digitise at-risk audio-visual files held on magnetic tape.
03/12/2021.author: Selby Stewart

03/12/2021.headline: Lin-Manuel Miranda blends Broadway theatrics with vibrant Colombian music in Disney’s Encanto
03/12/2021.description: A misfit teen from a magical family finds her own rhythm in this sweet-natured coming-of-age movie, which represents Disney’s first serious engagement with modern Latin American culture.
03/12/2021.author: Luke Goodsell

03/12/2021.headline: Convicted terrorist sentenced to more jail time for 'cold blooded' attack on inmate
03/12/2021.description: Momena Shoma could be locked up until 2066 after after being slugged with more jail  time for trying to drive a pair of garden shears into a fellow inmate's neck.
03/12/2021.author: Danny Tran

03/12/2021.headline: Why Victoria's still recording hundreds more daily COVID-19 cases than NSW
03/12/2021.description: While Victoria and New South Wales's daily tallies are still hundreds of cases apart, those watching the numbers closely say the shape of their infection curve largely tells the same story.
03/12/2021.author: Joseph Dunstan

03/12/2021.headline: People assume Helen is Joel's carer but the reality couldn't be more different
03/12/2021.description: People sometimes stare at Helen and her husband Joel, who uses a wheelchair, but after a decade together the couple has come to enjoy challenging stereotypes about relationships and disability.
03/12/2021.author: Marian Faa

03/12/2021.headline: Why tradeswomen are still the 'exception to the rule'
03/12/2021.description: Women make up just 3 per cent of Australia's skilled trades sector. Those who have made it in the industry say change is happening, but slowly.
03/12/2021.author: Claudia Jambor, Sarah Scopelianos, and Daniel Franklin

03/12/2021.headline: Why do I grind my teeth and clench my jaw? And what can I do about it?
03/12/2021.description: Dentists have reported an increase in teeth clenching and grinding since the pandemic began. Here's what you need to know about clenching and grinding your teeth — and how to stop, write Alexander Holden and Dale Howes.
03/12/2021.author: Claudia Jambor, Sarah Scopelianos, and Daniel Franklin

03/12/2021.headline: There are three theories for where Omicron came from, and they're all still on the table
03/12/2021.description: While the emergence of new COVID variants is expected, the new, highly mutated Omicron variant has taken many experts by surprise.
03/12/2021.author: Olivia Willis

03/12/2021.headline: Why aren't more people predicting a Coalition election loss?
03/12/2021.description: The Opposition's climate offering includes the sorts of tangible policies that voters can easily grasp, and limits obvious opportunities for political attack from the Coalition, writes Laura Tingle.
03/12/2021.author: Laura Tingle

03/12/2021.headline: Omicron's earliest clues: A scientist growing it in his lab and the GP who discovered it weigh in
03/12/2021.description: While the world was busy making other plans, Omicron had already begun its quiet evolution. Now scientists are frantically studying the mysterious new variant so we can understand what we're fighting.
03/12/2021.author: Tom Joyner

03/12/2021.headline: The song on Radio Australia that changed former Chinese soldier Jian Guo's life
03/12/2021.description: When Chinese-Australian artist Jian Guo joined the People's Liberation Army during the peak of the Sino-Vietnamese War, he and his comrades used to listen to Radio Australia illegally. That's how he heard the song that changed his life.
03/12/2021.author: Kai Feng

03/12/2021.headline: 'I was oblivious to the magnitude of this s**t': What it’s like to face terrorism charges
03/12/2021.description: When Imran was swept up in a dawn terror raid, he thought he knew who the police were after. He had "no idea" it was him.
03/12/2021.author: Kai Feng

03/12/2021.headline: Tiny flamethrowers, real growing trees and 53,000 Swarovski crystals: Secrets of hit stage shows
03/12/2021.description: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, Come from Away, Moulin Rouge! and Frozen the Musical have captured the hearts of audiences everywhere. One key element? Their design.
03/12/2021.author: Kai Feng

03/12/2021.headline: England's 'day of shame': Ticketless England fans endangered lives at 2020 final, report finds
03/12/2021.description: A review into violent clashes at the European Championship in July blames "collective failure" for the violence that endangered lives.
03/12/2021.author: Kai Feng

03/12/2021.headline: ISIS attack kills 13 in Iraq's autonomous Kurdish region
03/12/2021.description: Three villagers and 10 Kurdish soldiers are killed in the Islamic State attack in northern Syria, a region which still sees regular attacks by militants.
03/12/2021.author: Kai Feng

03/12/2021.headline: Tasmanian JackJumpers claim thrilling win over Brisbane Bullets in NBL debut
03/12/2021.description: The Tasmania JackJumpers score a thrilling nine-point overtime win over the Brisbane Bullets in their maiden NBL match in Hobart.
03/12/2021.author: Kai Feng

03/12/2021.headline: France signs $26 billion warplane deal with the United Arab Emirates
03/12/2021.description: The deal will provide the UAE with new Rafale warplanes, in France's largest-ever export weapons contract.
03/12/2021.author: Kai Feng

03/12/2021.headline: 'A great way to start 2022': ABC to employ over 50 regional journalists after Facebook, Google deal
03/12/2021.description: The ABC announces plans to hire more than 50 journalists to report from over 20 regional locations, following deals it struck with Facebook and Google.
03/12/2021.author: Kai Feng

03/12/2021.headline: Philippine journalist allowed to travel to Norway to collect Nobel Peace Prize despite being on bail
03/12/2021.description: The prominent journalist and Rappler CEO shared the Peace Prize with Russian investigative journalist Dmitry Muratov, and despite facing legal cases at home, a court found she was not a flight risk.
03/12/2021.author: Kai Feng

03/12/2021.headline: Broad not expecting Warner to be his Ashes bunny on Australian soil
03/12/2021.description: Stuart Broad dominated David Warner during the 2019 Ashes series in England, but the veteran quick doesn't think the Australian opener will be a pushover this time around.
03/12/2021.author: Kai Feng

03/12/2021.headline: New Zealand's Chris Cairns not sure he will walk again after spinal stroke
03/12/2021.description: Former New Zealand all-rounder Chris Cairns is not sure if he will walk again, but says he's lucky to be alive after suffering a spinal stroke following life-saving treatment for a torn artery in August.
03/12/2021.author: Kai Feng

03/12/2021.headline: Diesel crisis threatens to grind Australia to a halt, transport industry warns
03/12/2021.description: The transport industry is warning of a potential crisis that could stall the nation's diesel trucking fleet, as a key chemical used to remove pollution from their exhausts is running out.
03/12/2021.author: David Sparkes

03/12/2021.headline: NSW announces Hunter-Central coast renewable energy zone, eyes $32b investment
03/12/2021.description: NSW is pinning its hopes on renewable technologies to turn the Hunter and Central Coast into an "energy superpower".
03/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama and Anthony Scully

03/12/2021.headline: Phoenix draw in A-League Women debut against Wanderers
03/12/2021.description: The A-League Women newcomers make an encouraging start, with their young outfit playing out a 0-0 draw with Western Sydney Wanderers in the season opener.
03/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama and Anthony Scully

03/12/2021.headline: The Loop: Labor's climate change plan, BHP's COVID-19 vaccine mandate ruled unlawful and Australia declared the drunkest country
03/12/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
03/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

03/12/2021.headline: 'They just give up'. Gap in services results in decline in veteran mental health, commission hears
03/12/2021.description: A lack of hearing-loss care for former soldiers and mental health issues for young female personnel among issues raised at the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran’s Suicide in Brisbane.
03/12/2021.author: Rory Callinan

03/12/2021.headline: NT Police search for man who escaped Alice Springs quarantine facility
03/12/2021.description: The 27-year-old is the fifth person to have absconded from a NT quarantine facility in the past week.
03/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

03/12/2021.headline: Supercars legend misses out on Bathurst 1000 shootout
03/12/2021.description: Jamie Whincup will not take part in Saturday's top-10 shootout after a dramatic first qualifying session at Mount Panorama.
03/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

04/12/2021.headline: Polls closed in NSW council elections as vote counting begins
04/12/2021.description: Vote counting is underway after people in 124 council areas across NSW chose their new local leaders on Saturday.
04/12/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

04/12/2021.headline: Four new Queensland COVID cases spent time in the community: Check the latest exposure list
04/12/2021.description: A couple from the Gold Coast were out and about for up to 13 days before testing positive, and a woman from Capalaba passed the virus onto her partner. Check the Queensland Health contact tracing list for exposure sites.
04/12/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

04/12/2021.headline: Boggabilla breathes easy as town avoids flooding
04/12/2021.description: Residents of the New South Wales town of Boggabilla are breathing a sigh of relief as the Macintyre River steadies and floodwaters stop short of the town, with no significant rainfall early Saturday morning.
04/12/2021.author: Cassandra Power

04/12/2021.headline: Cook Islands reports its first ever case of COVID-19 in the country
04/12/2021.description: The island nation of about 17,000 people records its first case of COVID-19 since the pandemic began, as it edges toward reopening its borders to tourists.
04/12/2021.author: Cassandra Power

04/12/2021.headline: Man drowns at Murray Mouth, son taken to hospital, after pair swept off beach
04/12/2021.description: A man drowns near the Murray Mouth in South Australia after being swept off a sandbar while fishing.
04/12/2021.author: Cassandra Power

04/12/2021.headline: BHP's COVID vaccine mandate at a NSW mine has been found unlawful. Will it have national implications?
04/12/2021.description: The Fair Work Commission says BHP's vaccine mandate at its Mt Arthur Coal mine was unlawful because workers weren't consulted properly, not because mandates are illegal.
04/12/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

04/12/2021.headline: To specialise or not: The sporting conundrum facing parents and children
04/12/2021.description: There's increasing pressure for children to specialise in a single sport, but rugby and soccer star Sammie Wood represents the opposite.
04/12/2021.author: Jack Snape

04/12/2021.headline: Man arrested after another man killed in Canberra's city centre
04/12/2021.description: A young Indigenous man is dead after an altercation in broad daylight in Canberra's city centre.
04/12/2021.author: Selby Stewart

04/12/2021.headline: Cosmetic surgeon Dr Lanzer resigns as investigation into conduct and performance continues
04/12/2021.description: Celebrity cosmetic surgeon and social media star Daniel Lanzer retires amid an investigation into his conduct and performance by the national medical regulator.
04/12/2021.author: Lauren Day

04/12/2021.headline: After 136 moves, Magnus Carlsen wins the longest game in World Chess Championship history
04/12/2021.description: Norway's Magnus Carlsen takes a big step towards retaining the World Chess Championship after a marathon victory over his Russian challenger in game six of their title match.
04/12/2021.author: James Coventry

04/12/2021.headline: Man charged with killing 10 in Colorado shooting deemed unfit to stand trial
04/12/2021.description: A Colorado judge says a man accused of killing 10 people in a supermarket shooting in March is incompetent to stand trial.
04/12/2021.author: James Coventry

04/12/2021.headline: Victorian 'footy festival' expected to draw hundreds of thousands for AFL season launch
04/12/2021.description: All Victorian teams will start round one of the 2022 AFL season in their home state, joining all seven games of the AFLW's round 10 in the "footy festival".
04/12/2021.author: James Coventry

04/12/2021.headline: NT records no new COVID-19 cases overnight; infected man in 50s taken to ICU
04/12/2021.description: The Northern Territory records no new cases of COVID-19, the government says, a day after recording its first death from the disease.
04/12/2021.author: James Coventry

04/12/2021.headline: Ghislaine Maxwell trial shown Epstein's massage table, photo of sex toys
04/12/2021.description: Prosecutors say many of Jeffrey Epstein's encounters with teenagers began as massages before escalating, calling the term "massage" a "ruse" to get girls to touch Epstein.
04/12/2021.author: James Coventry

04/12/2021.headline: Omicron cluster grows as health authorities investigate Western Sydney indoor gym
04/12/2021.description: Health authorities are conducting urgent genomic sequencing on 10 cases, part of a cluster at a western Sydney school. Three of the 13 cases are confirmed as the Omicron strain.
04/12/2021.author: James Coventry

04/12/2021.headline: ACT records seven new COVID-19 cases, one a close contact of Omicron infection
04/12/2021.description: The ACT records seven new COVID-19 cases, including one which is confirmed as a close contact of Canberra's first Omicron infection.
04/12/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

04/12/2021.headline: Space-inspired stone fruit coming to a supermarket near you
04/12/2021.description: Australia's largest family-run stone fruit grower, packer and marketer goes firm on its Galaxy Fruits range, which it launched last summer.
04/12/2021.author: Kellie Hollingworth

04/12/2021.headline: How an apartment building for young people is changing lives
04/12/2021.description: Foyer Oxford offers young people facing homelessness secure, affordable housing with personalised support to help them get into work and study.
04/12/2021.author: Emma Wynne

04/12/2021.headline: Rust film set death could result in charges, says New Mexico district attorney
04/12/2021.description: Some people on the Rust film set who were handling prop guns may face criminal charges in the fatal shooting of a cinematographer.
04/12/2021.author: Emma Wynne

04/12/2021.headline: Have COVID-19 and streaming services killed the small-town cinema?
04/12/2021.description: Crippled by the pandemic, film distribution deals and the online streaming boom, a "conga line" of regional cinemas are shutting their doors. But could there be a way to reverse the trend?
04/12/2021.author: Lily Nothling

04/12/2021.headline: Farmers find unexpected joy in Black Summer fire recovery
04/12/2021.description: East Gippsland farmers lost their homes and livelihoods in the Black Summer fires. Rebuilding is tough. But some say unexpected positives have come from the ashes.
04/12/2021.author: Peter Somerville

04/12/2021.headline: 'The virus is here earlier than we'd hoped': Seven new COVID cases in Queensland
04/12/2021.description: Queensland records seven new cases of COVID-19, four of which have been active in the community.
04/12/2021.author: Peter Somerville

04/12/2021.headline: Enhanced protection for gulf neighbouring Ningaloo Reef
04/12/2021.description: Environmentalists hope the WA government's new safeguards for the Exmouth Gulf will signal an end to "industrial threats", but developers say they are not deterred.
04/12/2021.author: Verity Gorman

04/12/2021.headline: Sydneysiders share their stories of the yum cha icon Marigold
04/12/2021.description: Sydney's iconic yum cha restaurant, Marigold, will close its doors today after being battered by the pandemic and lockdowns. Sydneysiders are commemorating the beloved institution by sharing their memories with us.
04/12/2021.author: Dong Xing

04/12/2021.headline: Debbie and her elderly mother are stranded in Zimbabwe, with no path home to Australia
04/12/2021.description: Australians stranded overseas after the government's snap ban on flights from countries in southern Africa are calling for repatriation flights to be arranged to bring them home.
04/12/2021.author: Erin Handley

04/12/2021.headline: 'You would think we were in the middle of nowhere': In this fast-growing suburb, locals struggle to make a phone call
04/12/2021.description: It's a 15-minute drive to world-class coastline, attractive to first home buyers, and one of Victoria's fastest-growing suburbs. But there's one issue that families are so fed up with, and they're breaking leases to move out.
04/12/2021.author: Rachel Clayton

04/12/2021.headline: Why Meghan Markle ripped up the 'invisible contract' between the royals and the British tabloids
04/12/2021.description: In recent weeks, insiders have exposed the behind-the-scenes tactics used by both royals and reporters to own the narrative of what really goes on behind palace walls. Is this a sign that the invisible contract between the royal family and the press has changed?
04/12/2021.author: Isabella Higgins

04/12/2021.headline: Dwan Price says gender bias drove her out of medical research — and she's not alone
04/12/2021.description: Damning new analysis suggests gender bias in Australia's funding system may be forcing skilled medical scientists out of research.
04/12/2021.author: Natasha Mitchell

04/12/2021.headline: 'That's when I saw the power of making a complaint': How Heike is using technology to change lives
04/12/2021.description: Heike Fabig and her family experienced discrimination even in the most unexpected circumstances. Now she's using the latest technology to help others complain better
04/12/2021.author: Natasha Mitchell

04/12/2021.headline: Former soldier and aspiring politician sold porn online while fundraising for veterans charity
04/12/2021.description: Australian Values Party founder Heston Russell lied to the charity about his use of the website OnlyFans and handed over less than a third of the money he claimed to have raised, according to the charity's staff.
04/12/2021.author: Josh Robertson

04/12/2021.headline: Parents of alleged Michigan school shooter Ethan Crumbley plead not guilty to manslaughter
04/12/2021.description: James and Jennifer Crumbley are caught hiding in the basement of a Detroit commercial building before entering not guilty pleas for involuntary manslaughter counts against them.
04/12/2021.author: Josh Robertson

04/12/2021.headline: Australia's great wound is unhealed — but that's never the full story
04/12/2021.description: David Gulpilil's trials and personal issues are well documented, but they did not stop him from creating among the most profound, enduring, and influential bodies of work in Australian culture, writes Stan Grant.
04/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

04/12/2021.headline: Go home, 46th Parliament. You're drunk — and you've missed the point, again
04/12/2021.description: The federal parliament spent its last fortnight generating eye-rolls from all and sundry. For the rest of Australia, it's a spectacle that confirms the institution's shocking disconnect from real life, writes Annabel Crabb.
04/12/2021.author: Annabel Crabb

04/12/2021.headline: 'We're very, very concerned': The surprising Australian theory about Omicron
04/12/2021.description: As the world rushes to understand how Omicron will impact global control of COVID-19 new research suggests the virus may be changing shape again.
04/12/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

04/12/2021.headline: One killed and dozens burned as volcanic eruption leaves Indonesian villages in darkness
04/12/2021.description: One of Indonesia's largest volcanoes erupts and spews thick columns of ash into the sky, leaving surrounding towns and villages covered in volcanic dust.
04/12/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

04/12/2021.headline: Queensland man vanishes off Sunshine Coast beach, police divers face treacherous conditions
04/12/2021.description: Two swimmers run into trouble at Shelly Beach at Caloundra, with only one of them rescued. Police divers are hampered in their search by what they describe as "washing machine" conditions.
04/12/2021.author: Jacqui Street

04/12/2021.headline: Free TAFE and more uni places: Labor's $1.2 billion election promise
04/12/2021.description: Leader Anthony Albanese will outline a plan to create more than 60,000 new university and TAFE places if Labor wins next year's federal election, with a bold promise of covering the fees of half a million TAFE students over the next four years.
04/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

04/12/2021.headline: 'I'm so happy that the town is safe': Goondiwindi avoids flooding, but surrounding areas are under water
04/12/2021.description: Residents in Goondiwindi are breathing a sigh of relief after floodwaters stopped short of the 65-year-old levee that's once again saved them from catastrophic floods.
04/12/2021.author: Baz Ruddick and Allyson Horn

04/12/2021.headline: New Zealand's Ajaz Patel takes all 10 wickets in first innings against India
04/12/2021.description: New Zealand spinner Ajaz Patel becomes only the third player in history to take all 10 wickets in an innings, single-handedly bowling India out in the first innings of the second Test.
04/12/2021.author: Baz Ruddick and Allyson Horn

04/12/2021.headline: Seagull patrols at Opera House extended for two years after eateries hail success
04/12/2021.description: Businesses and diners come out in defence of the initiative to hire dogs to scare away seagulls on the forecourt of Sydney's biggest attraction as Labor brands it an "extravagant expenditure".
04/12/2021.author: Maryanne Taouk

04/12/2021.headline: Twitter got a new picture permissions policy, but it's being used by the far-right to escape scrutiny
04/12/2021.description: Activists warned when the change was announced that it could be susceptible to misuse. That's exactly what's happening.
04/12/2021.author: Maryanne Taouk

04/12/2021.headline: Chaz Mostert smashes Bathurst lap record to earn pole position
04/12/2021.description: Chaz Mostert has produced the fastest-ever time around the famed Mount Panorama circuit in a Top 10 Shootout to secure pole position for the Bathurst 1000.
04/12/2021.author: Maryanne Taouk

04/12/2021.headline: 'We back up our mates': Justin Langer stands up for 'our friend' Tim Paine
04/12/2021.description: Justin Langer speaks about his trip to Tasmania to visit a "shattered" Tim Paine and why he is pleased to see Steve Smith back in a leadership role on the eve of the Ashes.
04/12/2021.author: Maryanne Taouk

04/12/2021.headline: Clover Moore on track to be 'comfortably' re-elected as Sydney Lord Mayor, despite early swing against her
04/12/2021.description: Clover Moore is on track to extend her 17-year reign at the helm of the City of Sydney after NSW Saturday's local council elections on Saturday.
04/12/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

04/12/2021.headline: Six new COVID-19 cases reported in SA as exposure sites linked with former premier announced
04/12/2021.description: Six new COVID-19 cases are reported in South Australia, including one whose source is being investigated. SA Health also lists six new exposure sites in the Adelaide CBD and Glenelg.
04/12/2021.author: Simon Smale

05/12/2021.headline: Doctors push for children over five to be vaccinated before WA's hard border comes down
05/12/2021.description: Doctors are pushing for Western Australia's hard border to stay in place until 90 per cent of the population over five is fully vaccinated, but Premier Mark McGowan is not keen.
05/12/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

05/12/2021.headline: Peter Cundall, long-time Gardening Australia host, dies aged 94
05/12/2021.description: Much-loved Tasmanian broadcasting and gardening identity Peter Cundall has died after a short illness, with his family releasing a statement saying he died surrounded by loved ones.
05/12/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

05/12/2021.headline: Fire shuts world's largest gas vessel off WA coast, staff evacuation underway
05/12/2021.description: The $12-17 billion, half-kilometre-long Prelude only resumed operations in February this year after an 11-month shutdown due to electrical and safety issues.
05/12/2021.author: Madison Snow

05/12/2021.headline: Ultralight plane crashes in Perth, in second such incident in under a month
05/12/2021.description: An ultralight plane crashes on the outskirts of Perth, leaving two people in hospital with what are believed to be non-life-threatening injuries.
05/12/2021.author: Madison Snow

05/12/2021.headline: Head in, Khawaja misses out — Australia names its XI for the first Ashes Test
05/12/2021.description: Australia finalises its Test team for the opening match of the Ashes series at the Gabba, with Travis Head getting the nod ahead of Usman Khawaja to bat at number five against England.
05/12/2021.author: Madison Snow

05/12/2021.headline: Demons fans gather at MCG for premiership celebration
05/12/2021.description: It takes more than two months, but Demons fans finally get to celebrate their long-awaited flag with their heroes, with a grand final replay viewing with the players at the MCG.
05/12/2021.author: Tom Maddocks

05/12/2021.headline: Here's what we know about the provisional approval for younger kids to get the COVID vaccine
05/12/2021.description: When can kids get Pfizer? Is it the same vaccine adults receive? And should all kids be getting it? Here are the details of the rollout of vaccines for children aged five to 11.
05/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

05/12/2021.headline: 'It's a tragedy': Police pull body of missing man Travis Davis from Sunshine Coast beach
05/12/2021.description: The body of missing man Travis Davis is pulled from surf on Queensland's Sunshine Coast.
05/12/2021.author: Owen Jacques

05/12/2021.headline: Victorian Opposition Leader says 2022 election is winnable due to 'arrogance' of Daniel Andrews
05/12/2021.description: In a speech to the Liberal Party State Council, Matthew Guy unveils a $2.5 billion plan to boost manufacturing and says he wants his party to be a "contrast to the nastiness, the arrogance of our opponents".
05/12/2021.author: Yara Murray-Atfield

05/12/2021.headline: Liz Cambage has 'zero' interest in Opals ahead of Women's World Cup
05/12/2021.description: The Opals will almost certainly enter next year's Women's World Cup in Sydney without superstar Liz Cambage.
05/12/2021.author: Yara Murray-Atfield

05/12/2021.headline: Woman rescued from roof of ute on flooded road in Western Downs
05/12/2021.description: A Springvale grazier says he spotted the woman while he was using a jet ski to check on his cattle in the flood. More rain is expected in parts of southern Queensland later this week.
05/12/2021.author: Jon Daly and Baz Ruddick

05/12/2021.headline: ACT records six new COVID-19 cases, confirms second Omicron infection
05/12/2021.description: The ACT records six new COVID-19 cases as authorities confirm its second case of the Omicron variant. The ACT's first Omicron case has also been linked to a Sydney climbing gym.
05/12/2021.author: Penny Travers

05/12/2021.headline: Body pulled from water north of Perth thought to be that of missing diver Matthew Phillips
05/12/2021.description: A man's body, thought to be that of missing man Matthew Phillips, is recovered from the ocean off Lancelin after being noticed by a diver in the area.
05/12/2021.author: Penny Travers

05/12/2021.headline: Deputy PM says apology issued over ‘incident’ at Nationals Christmas party involving NT Senator
05/12/2021.description: The office of Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce confirms an apology has been received after an incident at a Canberra pub where one witness told the ABC that Senator McMahon threw several punches towards Nationals federal director Jonathan Hawkes.
05/12/2021.author: Isaac Nowroozi and Steve Vivian

05/12/2021.headline: Charging the parents after a US school shooting is unusual, but it has happened before
05/12/2021.description: Guns used in United States school shootings have often come from the homes of young perpetrators but parents are rarely charged for the violence that occurs, experts say.
05/12/2021.author: Isaac Nowroozi and Steve Vivian

05/12/2021.headline: SA Premier puts speed bump in front of Omicron variant as election crunch approaches
05/12/2021.description: While announced as a way to stop the Omicron variant getting into South Australia, increased testing requirements will have the added bonus of stopping Delta cases as Steven Marshall heads towards a state election he is not assured at all of winning.
05/12/2021.author: Rory McClaren

05/12/2021.headline: Bathurst 1000 is more than just a great race for diehard fans
05/12/2021.description: The Bathurst 1000 is more than just a 161-lap race around Mount Panorama. It's about the gathering of people, year on year, and the new connections they build across a weekend of jam-packed action.
05/12/2021.author: Chloe Hart

05/12/2021.headline: No new community COVID cases in Queensland, six in quarantine
05/12/2021.description: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says the cases in quarantine are not a risk to the community, but again urges people on the Gold Coast to get tested following a number of cases emerging there in recent days.
05/12/2021.author: Chloe Hart

05/12/2021.headline: Five Omicron cases linked to indoor gym, Western Sydney schools
05/12/2021.description: There are now five Omicron cases connected to a cluster at an indoor climbing gym and two Western Sydney schools, bringing to 15 the total number of confirmed cases of the  COVID-19 variant across the state.
05/12/2021.author: Chloe Hart

05/12/2021.headline: 'I don't accept anybody's red lines': Biden and Putin to talk about Ukraine in video call
05/12/2021.description: US President Joe Biden and Russian President Vladimir Putin they will hold a video call on Tuesday, with the two leaders set to discuss the tense situation in Ukraine.
05/12/2021.author: Chloe Hart

05/12/2021.headline: 'Today your dad is going to kill me': Family violence victim's heartbreaking text to daughter before she was killed
05/12/2021.description: The Northern Territory's top cop says police have to get better at combating spiralling rates of family violence as the murder of a woman by her partner is described as "about as horrific as it gets".
05/12/2021.author: Samantha Jonscher and Saskia Mabin

05/12/2021.headline: Live: Chaz Mostert wins second Bathurst 1000 as tyre problems end Shane Van Gisbergen's hopes
05/12/2021.description: Shane Van Gisbergen's charge for back-to-back Bathurst titles ends with tyre problems in the final laps, as Chaz Mostert holds on for his second win alongside first-time winner Lee Holdsworth. Follow all the action in our live blog.
05/12/2021.author: Simon Smale

05/12/2021.headline: Man charged with manslaughter and endangerment over death of 3yo girl found in drain
05/12/2021.description: Police in North Queensland say they were called to a house where two young children were reported missing. A two-year-old was found safe and well, wandering in a street, while the three-year-old girl was found in a stormwater drain at about 8:20pm.
05/12/2021.author: Simon Smale

05/12/2021.headline: CNN fires anchor Chris Cuomo over adviser role during brother's sex scandal as New York governor
05/12/2021.description: Mr Cuomo admitted in May that he had broken some of the news network's rules in advising his brother how to handle the allegations from a public relations perspective.
05/12/2021.author: Simon Smale

05/12/2021.headline: For almost a decade, Joanne has been followed and filmed. But what happened last year 'really rattled' her
05/12/2021.description: One of the nation's largest racing bodies is under investigation for what injured workers say is its aggressive and unfair handling of workers compensation clai
05/12/2021.author: Pat McGrath and John Stewart

05/12/2021.headline: Central Australian tourist accommodation, experiences close for summer season
05/12/2021.description: Northern Territory residents might be left wondering what to spend their tourism vouchers on after popular accommodation venues and attractions close for upgrades.
05/12/2021.author: Emma Haskin

05/12/2021.headline: Kathryn put high school on hold for chemo. Years later, she's graduating medicine with a Rhodes scholarship
05/12/2021.description: A young woman is about to graduate with medicine at Griffith University after battling lymphoma at the young age of 15. She wants her story to inspire change.
05/12/2021.author: Emma Haskin

05/12/2021.headline: 'We need to keep things out of landfill': Redcliffe Repair Cafe joins push for right to repair
05/12/2021.description: A community project to fix items that would otherwise be thrown into landfill has had major success. It comes as the Productivity Commission releases a report pushing for Australian consumer law changes.
05/12/2021.author: Lucy Stone

05/12/2021.headline: Sam lives in Tasmania but has to fly to Melbourne to get the ADHD help he needs
05/12/2021.description: With only one specialised clinic and a limited choice of psychiatrists, getting ADHD support in Tasmania as an adult is all but impossible.
05/12/2021.author: Lucie Cutting

05/12/2021.headline: 'Turbid, silted-up': As people flock to Victoria's Surf Coast, a construction boom is killing off green spaces
05/12/2021.description: It's one of Victoria's most sought-after places to live along the coast, but locals say the mismanagement of urban wetlands is destroying the very beauty that draws people to the region.
05/12/2021.author: Rachel Clayton

05/12/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: More Omicron cases expected; bus strikes to begin
05/12/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Bus drivers are walking off the job across Sydney's inner west for the whole day as part of industrial action.
05/12/2021.author: Rachel Clayton

05/12/2021.headline: It's a lucrative market worth billions, but it equates to just 18 cents a shirt for workers
05/12/2021.description: You've found the perfect dress. You've tried it on before and you know it looks great. Now it's on sale, a discount so large the store is practically giving it away. Should you buy it?
05/12/2021.author: Rachel Clayton

05/12/2021.headline: 'This is a new era for us': Tasmanian healthcare workers prepare to live and work with COVID
05/12/2021.description: Tasmania is preparing to manage inevitable COVID cases when borders open next week — but healthcare workers are concerned about the resilience of a system already under strain.
05/12/2021.author: Piia Wirsu

05/12/2021.headline: The Earth is getting a black box recorder, and it's already started listening
05/12/2021.description: A giant steel box is about to begin recording everything we say and do about climate change, for the benefit of our and future civilisations.
05/12/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

05/12/2021.headline: What if everything we think we know about the origins of the Omicron variant is wrong?
05/12/2021.description: When two flights from South Africa landed in Amsterdam last week, authorities scrambled to prevent the import of a new COVID-19 variant. But Omicron had already been lurking in the Netherlands for days.
05/12/2021.author: Nick Dole, Rebecca Armitage, Lucia Stein, and Lucy Sweeney

05/12/2021.headline: Beware the buy now, pay later 'debt spiral'. Experts warn it'll be haunting us long after Christmas
05/12/2021.description: Are you using buy now, pay later services to buy your Christmas gifts this year? You could be in for a bad debt hangover, financial counsellors warn.
05/12/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

05/12/2021.headline: Bob Dole, former US senator and Republican presidential nominee, dies aged 98
05/12/2021.description: The former US presidential nominee was diagnosed with advanced lung cancer in February and died in his sleep.
05/12/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

05/12/2021.headline: Live: Hamilton beats Verstappen after crazy race with two red flags
05/12/2021.description: Max Verstappen and Lewis Hamilton are going into the final race of the season level on world championship points after Mercedes reign supreme in Jeddah.
05/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

05/12/2021.headline: Sam Kerr the hero for Chelsea as they lift Women's FA Cup
05/12/2021.description: Sam Kerr scores a double including one ridiculous chipped finish to lead Chelsea to Women's FA Cup glory and a domestic treble.
05/12/2021.author: Paul Johnson

05/12/2021.headline: Homes buried under thick volcanic ash as Indonesian rescuers search for survivors of volcanic eruption
05/12/2021.description: Thick volcanic ash buries homes and blankets villages after Mount Semeru erupts, as lava reaches rivers and the death toll rises to 14 people.
05/12/2021.author: Paul Johnson

05/12/2021.headline: China military spending 50pc larger than India, Japan, Taiwan, South-East Asia combined
05/12/2021.description: The Lowy Institute's Asia Power Index shows US power has grown under the Biden administration while the COVID-19 pandemic has dampened China's rise regionally.
05/12/2021.author: Max Walden and Stephen Dziedzic

05/12/2021.headline: India's military kills 15 villagers in north-east region, mistaking them for insurgents
05/12/2021.description: Local community leaders say the soldiers killed coal miners, who they thought were militants, after receiving intelligence about the movement of insurgents in the area.
05/12/2021.author: Max Walden and Stephen Dziedzic

05/12/2021.headline: Whincup inducted to Hall of Fame, but no fairytale ending at Bathurst
05/12/2021.description: Jamie Whincup finishes his full-time driving career without a fairytale fifth Bathurst 1000 triumph, but the newest member of the Supercars Hall of Fame overcomes pitlane collisions — and the odd echidna — for a fourth-place finish.
05/12/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

05/12/2021.headline: 'Renewal, not revolution': Labor sharpens campaign message in western Sydney
05/12/2021.description: Labor leader Anthony Albanese uses a campaign-style rally in Sydney's inner-west to detail a $1.2b education and skills policy, sharpening their message ahead of the 2022 election.
05/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

05/12/2021.headline: Sydney Sixers open BBL season by humiliating Melbourne Stars
05/12/2021.description: Josh Philippe makes a statement to start the BBL season, blasting the Sydney Sixers to the biggest win in the competition's history with a 152-run flogging of the Melbourne Stars at the SCG.
05/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

06/12/2021.headline: 'Shocker': $455K road works on major freight route 'melts away'
06/12/2021.description: The condition of a South Australian road that was resealed earlier this year has motorists concerned - and a local MP has labelled the department explanation 'ridiculous'.
06/12/2021.author: Sam Bradbrook and Matt Stephens

06/12/2021.headline: Theo Hayez inquest told data access reform could save lives
06/12/2021.description: Authorities face significant barriers to accessing data that could make all the difference the search for a missing person, the inquest into the disappearance of the Belgian backpacker hea
06/12/2021.author: Leah White

06/12/2021.headline: NT group fined $4,400 for WA quarantine breach
06/12/2021.description: A WA Magistrate acknowledged Aboriginal people do not recognise state borders when travelling on traditional lands, but said COVID-19 travel restrictions must be obeyed to protect remote communities.
06/12/2021.author: Jarrod Lucas

06/12/2021.headline: Former Canberra football coach sends himself to jail for child sex abuse
06/12/2021.description: Stephen Porter asked the ACT Supreme Court to send him to jail immediately, even though he hasn't yet been sentenced for his child abuse crimes.
06/12/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

06/12/2021.headline: Illawarra coal mine deemed of 'state significance'
06/12/2021.description: The fate of the Dendrobium coal mine expansion is in the hands of the NSW Planning Minister after new declaration means the Independent Planning Commission's initial objection could be ignored.
06/12/2021.author: Kelly Fuller

06/12/2021.headline: Queensland's reopening and border bubble rules explained
06/12/2021.description: Queensland is bringing forward its much-awaited reopening, dropping border restrictions for all interstate travellers from December 13, four days earlier than predicted — and opening up the NSW border zone for residents.
06/12/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

06/12/2021.headline: Solomon Islands Prime Minister survives vote of no confidence after deadly anti-government riots
06/12/2021.description: Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare has survived a motion of no confidence in Solomon Island's Parliament after the majority of MPs backed the leader at the centre of recent civil unrest.
06/12/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

06/12/2021.headline: Myanmar court sentences ousted leader Suu Kyi to four years in prison
06/12/2021.description: A court in Myanmar sentences the country's ousted leader, Aung San Suu Kyi, to four years in prison after finding her guilty of incitement and violating coronavirus restrictions.
06/12/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

06/12/2021.headline: Child dead, several injured in multi-vehicle crash at Diggers Rest
06/12/2021.description: A child dies and three other members of their family are in serious to critical condition after a major crash on the Calder Freeway, north-west of Melbourne.
06/12/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

06/12/2021.headline: Julia Gillard among international flight passengers into Adelaide sent to hotel quarantine over Omicron concern
06/12/2021.description: Former prime minister Julia Gillard is one of many overseas arrivals sent to hotel quarantine in Adelaide despite having prior approval to isolate at home.
06/12/2021.author: Patrick Martin

06/12/2021.headline: Perth loses fifth Ashes Test due to WA quarantine rules, no decision on replacement venue
06/12/2021.description: Cricket Australia confirms the fifth and final men's Ashes Test will not be held at Perth Stadium, following the WA government's requirement for all players, staff and broadcasters to quarantine for 14 days after arriving in the state.
06/12/2021.author: Patrick Martin

06/12/2021.headline: 'We can nurse it from here to the game': Gabba pitch curator confident ahead of first Ashes Test
06/12/2021.description: Some much-needed sunshine over the weekend has Gabba head curator David Sandurski confident the pitch for the first Ashes Test will be in prime condition.
06/12/2021.author: Patrick Martin

06/12/2021.headline: United States pushes back on New Zealand and allies' hopes of joining AUKUS
06/12/2021.description: One of America's most senior military commanders dismisses suggestions the AUKUS security partnership could soon be expanded to include other allies such as New Zealand or Japan.
06/12/2021.author: Andrew Greene

06/12/2021.headline: Public school teachers in NSW are striking tomorrow — here's everything you need to know
06/12/2021.description: Teachers will join thousands of other public servants taking industrial action tomorrow and parents are being warned they may need to make alternative care plans for the day.
06/12/2021.author: Sue Daniel

06/12/2021.headline: 'Ride on peacefully': Motocross talent Rene Hofer among Austrian avalanche deaths
06/12/2021.description: Rising international motocross star Rene Hofer dies alongside two friends after being caught in an avalanche during an alpine skiing trip in Salzburg, Austria.
06/12/2021.author: Sue Daniel

06/12/2021.headline: DVA admitted liability for soldier's PTSD 18 months after he took his own life, royal commission told
06/12/2021.description: Lance Corporal Ryan Goodwin sought compensation from the Department of Veterans Affairs for his post-traumatic stress disorder in 2018, but by the time the department admitted liability this year he had been dead for 18 months.
06/12/2021.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis

06/12/2021.headline: Why it's a great time to be a Spider-Man fan
06/12/2021.description: A stack of Spider-Man-related movies are set to swing into cinemas, and fans of the web-spinning superhero couldn't be happier.
06/12/2021.author: Matt Neal

06/12/2021.headline: Labor says it won't negotiate its 43 per cent emissions reduction target, as it stares down government attack
06/12/2021.description: Scott Morrison was quick to attack Labor's commitment to reduce emissions by 43 per cent by 2030, calling it an "opening bid" which could be pushed higher if Labor has to negotiate with the Greens to form government. But Labor says that won't happen.
06/12/2021.author: Jake Evans

06/12/2021.headline: The man who sparked a three-day lockdown pleads guilty over quarantine breach
06/12/2021.description: A New South Wales man who caused a snap three-day lockdown in southern Tasmania pleads guilty to lying to authorities and leaving quarantine without permission.
06/12/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

06/12/2021.headline: WA government says no plan to delay border reopening, despite calls to include children in vaccine target
06/12/2021.description: The WA government says its reopening plan remains on track amid calls to include 5 to 11-year-olds in the 90 per cent jab target, as the head of the Telethon Kids Institute welcomes the approval of the COVID-19 vaccine for young children.
06/12/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine and Lana Taranto

06/12/2021.headline: 'Don't ask for our forgiveness': Heartbroken family of Urrbrae crash victims speak in court
06/12/2021.description: Family and friends of two women killed in a high-speed crash in Adelaide's south-east last year tell the District Court they can't forgive the mentally unwell driver responsible.
06/12/2021.author: Claire Campbell

06/12/2021.headline: Queensland sets date for border reopening, announces tweaks to entry requirements
06/12/2021.description: Queensland will open its borders to fully vaccinated travellers from interstate hotspots next Monday, Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk announces.
06/12/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

06/12/2021.headline: St John Ambulance WA 'Looking for Legends', 800 extra volunteers for state's reopening
06/12/2021.description: St John Ambulance WA say they will need more than 800 new volunteers as Western Australia prepares to open its borders next year.
06/12/2021.author: Laura Birch

06/12/2021.headline: Man who fatally beat, dragged wife 70 metres along Darwin's Mindil Beach pleads guilty
06/12/2021.description: The NT Supreme Court hears the man, who pleaded guilty to reckless manslaughter, dragged his wife into shallow water on the popular Darwin beach before running to higher ground and claiming to witnesses that she'd drowned
06/12/2021.author: Matt Garrick

06/12/2021.headline: Mystery Adelaide COVID-19 case turns out to be a false positive as SA records four new infections
06/12/2021.description: South Australia records four new COVID-19 cases, while the source of two mystery infections is confirmed.
06/12/2021.author: Nick Harmsen, Eugene Boisvert, and Leah MacLennan

06/12/2021.headline: What will the opening of Queensland's borders mean for the state's least-vaccinated regions?
06/12/2021.description: With a week until the Queensland border reopens, authorities have warned that the virus will come and "hunt down" the unvaccinated.
06/12/2021.author: Elizabeth Cramsie

06/12/2021.headline: Some cancer patients face higher risks than others. But these women are hoping to change that
06/12/2021.description: Navigating the healthcare system can be tough, and cancer patients from multicultural backgrounds can face more risks and challenges than the general population. But a university project and support from women with lived experience is helping make treatment safer.
06/12/2021.author: Penny Timms

06/12/2021.headline: Gathering and cooking food on Country isn't just about culture, it's about sustainability
06/12/2021.description: The ABC's Rulla Kelly-Mansell travelled to the Top End for his new show Cooking on Country, and hopes it will inspire others to better appreciate and understand native foods and ingredients.
06/12/2021.author: Daniel Keane

06/12/2021.headline: NSW south coast businesses grapple with 'diabolical' staff shortages ahead of predicted bumper summer
06/12/2021.description: Job vacancies across the NSW south coast have skyrocketed by more than 17 per cent in the past month, and businesses are cutting back opening hours and cancelling live music to deal with it.
06/12/2021.author: Keira Proust

06/12/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: Omicron outbreak grows; CCTV released in murder appeal
06/12/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Health experts are calling for a greater take up of vaccines for high school students as Sydney's Omicron outbreak spreads.
06/12/2021.author: Keira Proust

06/12/2021.headline: 'One of his favourites': Second of four women takes stand at Ghislaine Maxwell trial
06/12/2021.description: A woman, testifying under the pseudonym Kate, tells a New York court she massaged Jeffrey Epstein at Ghislaine Maxwell's request and had sexual encounters with him as a teenager.
06/12/2021.author: Keira Proust

06/12/2021.headline: 'They have him': Tim Gunn's quarantine escape and capture seen through government emails
06/12/2021.description: Email exchanges obtained by the ABC show Tasmania's governmental agencies trying to work out how Tim Gunn was able to flee hotel quarantine, with news of him being taken back into custody communicated in a one-line email as "they have him".
06/12/2021.author: James Dunlevie

06/12/2021.headline: Farm production tipped to break record $78b this financial year
06/12/2021.description: The value of all that is farmed in Australia is tipped to break a new record this year.
06/12/2021.author: James Dunlevie

06/12/2021.headline: Cricket match brings Afghan interpreters and ADF veterans together to heal wounds
06/12/2021.description: Afghan interpreters and Australian veterans who served on the front lines in Afghanistan come together over a game of cricket in an effort to acknowledge and heal from their experiences during the decades-long war.
06/12/2021.author: Shamsiya Mohammadi

06/12/2021.headline: What you need to consider if you're planning to travel overseas with your unvaccinated kids
06/12/2021.description: Radhika is travelling to India to visit family and friends after a long time of separation due to border closures. But she's "anxious" about going overseas with her children who are not yet eligible for a COVID-19 vaccine.
06/12/2021.author: Joshua Boscaini

06/12/2021.headline: 'Much more important than Omicron right now': US experts issue a COVID warning
06/12/2021.description: While the world waits anxiously for information about Omicron, experts warn that Delta is still the dominant variant across the globe. An outbreak at an American high school reunion shows the power of the virus — and the potency of vaccines.
06/12/2021.author: Jade Macmillan

06/12/2021.headline: Triple whammy: Day of chaos looms in NSW as train drivers, bus drivers and teachers walk off the job
06/12/2021.description: The state government is facing growing pressure to lift public sector wages as unions warn of a summer of disruption ahead.
06/12/2021.author: Jade Macmillan

06/12/2021.headline: 'We had them cold': Inside the day Australia lost the unlosable Ashes Test
06/12/2021.description: With the home side facing odds of 500-1 to win at Headingley in 1981, two stoic Englishmen stood in the way of Kim Hughes leading his Australians to a famous victory — and it's a string of events the former captain has been trying to forget since.
06/12/2021.author: Duncan Huntsdale

06/12/2021.headline: Vote now: What has been the greatest men's Ashes moment of the past 40 years?
06/12/2021.description: As the men's Ashes series finally returns to Australian shores, ABC Sport is looking back at the 40 greatest moments of the past 40 years. Have your say and vote for your favourite moment.
06/12/2021.author: Dean Bilton, Jon Healy, and Simon Smale

06/12/2021.headline: Concerning levels of heavy metals found in Indigenous people living beside world's biggest manganese-producing mine
06/12/2021.description: Tests on the hair and nails of children and adults living in Angurugu, on Groote Eylandt, have shown "concerning" levels of manganese, according to the local lands council.
06/12/2021.author: Jane Bardon

06/12/2021.headline: Omicron outbreak in South Korea throws President's planned Australia trip into disarray
06/12/2021.description: Plans for the South Korean President to visit Australia for strategic and economic talks are up in the air, with his nation battling an outbreak of the COVID-19 Omicron variant.
06/12/2021.author: Andrew Greene

06/12/2021.headline: Why everyone with a mortgage should be watching the Australian dollar
06/12/2021.description: When the Aussie dollar shows signs of moving significantly one way or the other economists take notice. And it's starting to fall, writes David Taylor.
06/12/2021.author: David Taylor

06/12/2021.headline: Man dies after being shot by police in Brisbane's south
06/12/2021.description: A man dies in hospital following a siege in Brisbane's south where he was shot by police.
06/12/2021.author: David Taylor

06/12/2021.headline: US confirms diplomatic boycott of Beijing Winter Olympics over 'ongoing genocide' in Xinjiang
06/12/2021.description: White House spokeswoman Jen Psaki says the US will not contribute to the fanfare of the Beijing Winter Olympics in light of China's "egregious" human rights abuses.
06/12/2021.author: David Taylor

06/12/2021.headline: PM accused of 'failure of leadership' after George Christensen calls for COVID protests at embassies
06/12/2021.description: Rogue government MP George Christensen urges viewers of a US web series hosted by conspiracy theorist Alex Jones to protest against Australia's COVID-19 restrictions.
06/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell and Claudia Long

06/12/2021.headline: Aung San Suu Kyi has been sentenced, so what led to the former icon of Myanmar's pro-democracy movement being charged?
06/12/2021.description: Aung Sang Suu Kyi is set to spend the next two years behind bars in a case widely seen as contrived and dismissed by critics as a farce.
06/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell and Claudia Long

06/12/2021.headline: Indonesia's Mount Semeru erupts again, causing rescuers to pause the search for survivors
06/12/2021.description: Indonesia's national disaster agency says 27 people are still missing but fresh volcanic activity means search and rescue teams have been pulled out until it's deemed safe for them to resume work.
06/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell and Claudia Long

06/12/2021.headline: 'No evidence' of abuse of office by NT Children's Commissioner, court hears
06/12/2021.description: The Darwin Local Court hears the NT Children's Commissioner did not face internal disciplinary action after she allegedly attempted to intervene in a recruitment process.
06/12/2021.author: Melissa Mackay

06/12/2021.headline: COVID-19 exposure sites named for passengers on Sydney to Cairns flight
06/12/2021.description: A public health alert is issued by Queensland Health relating to passengers who flew from Sydney to Cairns on December 3.
06/12/2021.author: Melissa Mackay

06/12/2021.headline: The balancing act that will define the Dragons in the 2022 NRL season
06/12/2021.description: After missing the finals for a third consecutive season in 2021, St George Illawarra is banking on an old-fashioned mix of youth and experience to turn its fortunes around next year.
06/12/2021.author: Melissa Mackay

07/12/2021.headline: St Basil's operators ask to be excused from giving evidence at coronial inquest into COVID deaths
07/12/2021.description: The operators of the St Basil's nursing home in Melbourne ask the coroner to excuse them from giving evidence at an inquest into the deaths of 50 residents in a COVID-19 outbreak last year on the grounds they might incriminate themselves.
07/12/2021.author: Danny Morgan

07/12/2021.headline: Sydney Opera House illuminates life of acting legend David Gulpilil in posthumous tribute
07/12/2021.description: One of Australia’s greatest ever actors, David Gulpilil, has lit up the sails of the Sydney Opera House as the nation continues to pay tribute to the late Northern Territory movie star’s life and films.
07/12/2021.author: Matt Garrick

07/12/2021.headline: PM denounces comments made by George Christensen on conspiracy theorist's show
07/12/2021.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison denounces comments made by George Christensen on an American conspiracy theorist's online show, which Labor describe as "borderline treasonous".
07/12/2021.author: Matt Garrick

07/12/2021.headline: Daniel Andrews urged to intervene to prevent 'carnage' as state Labor factions face off
07/12/2021.description: A major realignment of factional power within the Victorian ALP is taking shape ahead of the 2022 state election, with a group of MPs at risk of losing their seats during the shake-up.
07/12/2021.author: Richard Willingham

07/12/2021.headline: Wrongly jailed man feared being raped by inmate after being told to shave legs, court told
07/12/2021.description: A man suing a Federal Court judge who wrongly jailed him for contempt during divorce proceedings, says his time in jail has left him traumatised and unable to work.
07/12/2021.author: Jamelle Wells

07/12/2021.headline: 'They are way more united': Australian coach says Opals are preparing for life after Liz
07/12/2021.description: The coach of the Australian women's basketball team says there is a more visible camaraderie among the Opals without Liz Cambage, who made it clear she has zero interest in playing for the national team again.
07/12/2021.author: David Mark

07/12/2021.headline: US ends probe into Emmett Till lynching, unable to prove witness lied
07/12/2021.description: The US government says it has failed to prove a crucial witness lied 66 years ago in the lynching death of black teenager Emmett Till, closing without charges its probe into the killing that helped ign
07/12/2021.author: David Mark

07/12/2021.headline: A Supreme Court storm is brewing for American women
07/12/2021.description: Since 2016 a wave of abortion bans in the US take aim at the landmark 1973 Supreme Court decision that guaranteed abortion as a constitutional right. Now a new case in the US Supreme Court is the most significant threat to abortion rights in the US in decades.
07/12/2021.author: David Mark

07/12/2021.headline: The Loop: Serial conman arrested, Victorian Ombudsman's border closure ruling, 'tis the season for spending
07/12/2021.description: Need a quick catch-up on today's news? Get in The Loop.
07/12/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

07/12/2021.headline: 'We are going to bring every one of them home here': Aboriginal ancestral remains laid to rest as museum says sorry
07/12/2021.description: After decades of pain and anguish for Kaurna people, the first repatriations of Aboriginal ancestral remains have been laid to rest on Country, with the SA Museum apologising for holding 4,600 Aboriginal remains over the past 165 years.
07/12/2021.author: Sarah Mullins

07/12/2021.headline: Industry titans pair up to develop green hydrogen projects at vast steelworks site
07/12/2021.description: BlueScope and Shell have announced they are embarking on a joint venture to build a hydrogen electrolyser at Port Kembla.
07/12/2021.author: Kelly Fuller

07/12/2021.headline: 'The guy was in utter desperation': Former charity worker says he warned police about Logan man they shot dead on Monday
07/12/2021.description: The man shot dead by police in Brisbane last night had been living "in utter desperation" and police had previously been warned he might be dangerous, according to Islamic community leader Ali Kadri.
07/12/2021.author: Jemima Burt

07/12/2021.headline: Prosecutors need to prove lack of contamination at Suzanne Poll murder scene, defence lawyer tells court
07/12/2021.description: No witnesses saw anyone who looked like the accused killer at the scene of an Adelaide cold case murder, and prosecutors need to prove the evidence hasn't been contaminated over the past 30 years, his lawyer has told the court.
07/12/2021.author: Claire Campbell

07/12/2021.headline: Darwin gets back-to-back AFL matches, AFL premiers to play in Alice Springs in 2022
07/12/2021.description: After losing all its Australian Football League fixtures in 2021 due to COVID-19 outbreaks, the Northern Territory will host two games in Darwin and one in Alice Springs during the 2022 season.
07/12/2021.author: Steve Vivian

07/12/2021.headline: Australia dealt blow ahead of upcoming women's Ashes series
07/12/2021.description: Leg-spinner Sophie Molineux is among the key outs for the multi-format series that starts in January 2022.
07/12/2021.author: Steve Vivian

07/12/2021.headline: Multiple concussions force West Coast veteran Brad Sheppard into early retirement
07/12/2021.description: One of the West Coast Eagles' most important players for the past decade — star defender Brad Sheppard — is forced into early retirement following multiple concussions.
07/12/2021.author: Jacob Kagi and James Carmody

07/12/2021.headline: In the US, a boss sacked 900 staff over video call — but could it happen here?
07/12/2021.description: A US mortgage company sacked hundreds of employees over video call just before Christmas, but experts say there are protections against that behaviour in Australia.
07/12/2021.author: Jordan Hayne

07/12/2021.headline: Everything you need to know ahead of the first Ashes Test at the Gabba
07/12/2021.description: The first Ashes Test gets underway at the Gabba on Wednesday. Here's everything you need to know.
07/12/2021.author: Jordan Hayne

07/12/2021.headline: Four new COVID-19 cases recorded in South Australia, school reunion cluster grows to 27
07/12/2021.description: South Australia has recorded four new cases of COVID-19. Two acquired their infections interstate, while the other two are linked to the Norwood cluster.
07/12/2021.author: Jordan Hayne

07/12/2021.headline: No 'broad community support' for national nuclear waste dump site, traditional owners say
07/12/2021.description: Traditional owners on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula prepare to challenge the decision to build a nuclear waste dump on their land.
07/12/2021.author: Declan Gooch

07/12/2021.headline: Sydney FC player tests positive for COVID-19
07/12/2021.description: Sydney FC says no other members of its squad have been affected, with Wednesday's FFA Cup game against Macarthur FC set to proceed.
07/12/2021.author: Declan Gooch

07/12/2021.headline: 'Fuelled by hate, division, and misinformation': Persecuted refugees suing Facebook for $US150 billion
07/12/2021.description: Rohingya refugees are seeking more than $200 billion in a lawsuit against Facebook for allegedly failing to stem hate speech on its platform and exacerbating violence against the vulnerable Myanmar minority.
07/12/2021.author: Declan Gooch

07/12/2021.headline: Farmers still face higher rates of suicide with one death every 10 days in Australia
07/12/2021.description: Drought, relationship breakdown, underlying depression, and easy access to guns are found to be key risk factors in a suicide rate 60 per cent higher than rates among non-farmers.
07/12/2021.author: Michael Condon

07/12/2021.headline: 'I was slightly horrified': Mother recounts seven-week-old baby's COVID swab amid SA hotel quarantine saga
07/12/2021.description: A new mother and her baby have been bundled into a medi-hotel, despite having a permit to quarantine at home after landing in Adelaide, as questions mount about the systems in place for travellers returning to SA.
07/12/2021.author: Patrick Martin, Gabriella Marchant, and Alina Eacott

07/12/2021.headline: 'Eye-watering levels of debt' mean the Reserve Bank will have to be careful when it starts lifting rates, analysts warn
07/12/2021.description: The Reserve Bank keeps interest rates at a record low and maintains its current stimulus, re-emphasising its patience to see inflation and wages growth increase more sustainably before considering a rate rise.
07/12/2021.author: Michael Janda

07/12/2021.headline: Canberra family unknowingly buys asbestos-filled home for $1.8 million
07/12/2021.description: Dean Papas, a builder, knew well the ACT's dark history of "Mr Fluffy" housing, but must now watch his new home be demolished.
07/12/2021.author: Susan McDonald

07/12/2021.headline: Why will interstate arrivals need a COVID test on day five in Queensland?
07/12/2021.description: Queensland will open up to interstate COVID hotspots from next Monday with no quarantine requirement, but the latest health directive will require all visitors to be tested for COVID on the fifth day of their visit. Here's why that's required.
07/12/2021.author: Susan McDonald

07/12/2021.headline: 'Proud grinch': Why some people are not in the mood for Christmas
07/12/2021.description: It's supposed to be the "most wonderful time of the year", but two years of a pandemic means not everyone is in good cheer as Christmas nears.
07/12/2021.author: Michael Luu

07/12/2021.headline: Nearly 25 years after an appalling murder, this couple is keeping a promise from a world away
07/12/2021.description: After Japanese student Michiko Okuyama was killed in Cairns in 1997, Luiza and John Grave promised her family they would maintain her memorial garden. A quarter of a century later, they're still as good as their word.
07/12/2021.author: Phil Brandel

07/12/2021.headline: On the upside the drought map is finally clear. On the downside more flooding is expected this week
07/12/2021.description: More rain and renewed flooding are expected for the east this week as many catchments are already at capacity.
07/12/2021.author: Kate Doyle

07/12/2021.headline: Two years after a protected species was found in remote bushland, the patch of land was listed for logging
07/12/2021.description: When 19 greater gliders were found in 2018, environmentalists thought their patch of forest would be protected. They are baffled by what has happened since, and fear the area will soon be logged.
07/12/2021.author: Kate Doyle

07/12/2021.headline: 'My mental health struggles have no connection with my worth as a Muslim'
07/12/2021.description: When Lina faced mental health problems, she says some in her community told her she "wasn't praying enough", and was an "ungrateful, un-Islamic person". She wants that to change.
07/12/2021.author: Kate Doyle

07/12/2021.headline: 'Ask me about my missing colon': Life, health and dating with ulcerative colitis
07/12/2021.description: Amelia shares her experience of living with severe ulcerative colitis and how she's found being open about her condition has helped her get back to living her best life. A sense of humour helps too.
07/12/2021.author: Kate Doyle

07/12/2021.headline: Finding you're a bit COVID-19 anxious ahead of Tasmania's border reopening? These tips may help
07/12/2021.description: Life in Tasmania has been relatively normal and lockdown-free this year, so it's no wonder some people are feeling a little anxious about the state's border reopening in a week's time. So what can you do to ease the concern?
07/12/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

07/12/2021.headline: When fear and misinformation struck this Pacific community, their youth took a stand
07/12/2021.description: When vaccine anxiety swept through Australia's diverse communities, local "heroes" were on-call to offer support. Meet the volunteers who helped overcome "panic and anxiety" during COVID-19.
07/12/2021.author: Annika Burgess

07/12/2021.headline: Is Bellerive really on the nose? It's just not cricket
07/12/2021.description: With Hobart now forced into a race to secure the fifth Ashes Test against mainland rivals, Chris Rowbottom asks why it wasn't awarded outright — is the game in such brittle condition that playing one Ashes test in Tasmania will see it crumble?
07/12/2021.author: Chris Rowbottom

07/12/2021.headline: 'It's confusing for parents': NSW Premier says it makes sense for states to run childcare
07/12/2021.description: Dominic Perrottet will today call for a dramatic overhaul of the way the national childcare system is run, handing responsibility over from the Commonwealth to the states.
07/12/2021.author: Ashleigh Raper

07/12/2021.headline: 'A cry for help': Olympian Maddie Groves says she was molested as a teenage swimmer
07/12/2021.description: Australian Olympic swimmer Madeline Groves says she was sexually abused by a man who still works in swimming and says there is a culture of "misogyny” and “perversion" in the sport.
07/12/2021.author: Ashleigh Raper

07/12/2021.headline: 'We have to filter out the crispy bits': How leftover chip oil will keep EV owners moving across the Nullarbor
07/12/2021.description: EV owners are crowdfunding a fast charger in the middle of the Nullarbor — and it will run on leftover chip oil from the local roadhouse.
07/12/2021.author: James Purtill

07/12/2021.headline: The surprising architect behind Labor's climate plans? A retiring Coalition minister
07/12/2021.description: Before he became Health Minister, Greg Hunt spent years thinking about mechanisms for getting emissions down – and if elected, Labor plans to road test the one he introduced, writes Peter Martin.
07/12/2021.author: James Purtill

07/12/2021.headline: Do you believe a foam roller helps with muscle pain after exercise? Here's what science says
07/12/2021.description: Many people swear by foam rollers to reduce muscle pain and increase flexibility after exercise. But does the science support anecdotal evidence that encourages their use?
07/12/2021.author: James Purtill

07/12/2021.headline: One step from a sporting revolution: How Usman Khawaja is changing the face of Australian cricket
07/12/2021.description: Trailblazer Usman Khawaja talks about racism in cricket and urges Cricket Australia to diversify for the sake of the game.
07/12/2021.author: Paul Kennedy

07/12/2021.headline: Australians have lost at least $109 million in cryptocurrency scams this year. These three know all about it
07/12/2021.description: Australian police say cryptocurrency scams have "exploded" during the pandemic. These three families were sucked in.
07/12/2021.author: Amy Bainbridge and Lucy Kent

07/12/2021.headline: Saudi agent suspected of Jamal Khashoggi killing arrested at French airport
07/12/2021.description: The man, a former Royal Guard of Saudi Arabia, was reportedly arrested by authorities at Charles de Gaulle airport near Paris as he was about to board a flight to Saudi capital Riyadh.
07/12/2021.author: Amy Bainbridge and Lucy Kent

07/12/2021.headline: Five test positive to COVID-19 after boat cruise on Sydney Harbour, concerns two are Omicron variant
07/12/2021.description: NSW Health is urgently contacting around 140 people who were on the boat and directing them and members of their households to immediately get tested, isolate and await further public advice.
07/12/2021.author: Jean Kennedy

07/12/2021.headline: Biden to warn Putin Russia will face toughest sanctions yet if Kremlin invades Ukraine
07/12/2021.description: In a meeting with his Russian counterpart, Joe Biden will warn Vladimir Putin against using tens of thousands of troops massed near its border to attack Ukraine.
07/12/2021.author: Jean Kennedy

07/12/2021.headline: Nationals MP James Hayward fronts parliament for first time since child sex charges laid
07/12/2021.description: Former Nationals MP James Hayward, who has been charged with child sex abuse, briefly attends parliament, allowing him to keep his seat and salary.
07/12/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

07/12/2021.headline: Would you work in the bush if the government paid your university debt?
07/12/2021.description: Under a new scheme designed to lure health professionals to rural, regional and remote areas, the government will wipe or reduce the university debt of doctors and nurses heading bush.
07/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell and Claudia Long

07/12/2021.headline: Emails reveal Pfizer was 'enthusiastic' to engage with Australia about COVID-19 vaccine
07/12/2021.description: Documents obtained under freedom of information laws shed new light on Pfizer and the government's dealings at a critical time for negotiations last year.
07/12/2021.author: Dan Conifer

08/12/2021.headline: 'I will kill you': Instructors' behaviour against defence force recruits reached 'disgusting' lows, royal commission told
08/12/2021.description: A military veteran who witnessed and experienced abuse and hazing in Australia's armed forces says he was forced to stop taking anti-depressant and anti-anxiety medication to keep his job, .
08/12/2021.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis

08/12/2021.headline: 'Don't be fearful': New Treaty Commissioner says NT must confront its history
08/12/2021.description: Newly-minted acting Northern Territory Treaty Commissioner Tony McAvoy says Territorians shouldn't fear a treaty — but they should be willing to confront injustices in the NT's past.
08/12/2021.author: Matt Garrick

08/12/2021.headline: Two strains of Omicron have been detected in Queensland, so what are they and how worried should we be?
08/12/2021.description: Queensland detects not one strain of the Omicron COVID-19 variant but two. So how did we get here and how infectious are they? Your questions answered.
08/12/2021.author: Phoebe Hosier

08/12/2021.headline: Coroner to decide if Indigenous car crash victims died in police custody
08/12/2021.description: The NT Coroner has been asked to declare a car crash that claimed three lives as a case of Indigenous deaths in custody, despite police not using their sirens or lights to try to stop the vehicle.
08/12/2021.author: Steven Schubert

08/12/2021.headline: 'I just killed my parents': Son of unsound mind when he bludgeoned father and mother, court told
08/12/2021.description: A man accused of murdering his parents with a geologist's pick hammer was mentally impaired at the time, the WA Supreme Court is told.
08/12/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

08/12/2021.headline: Adelaide Crows chairman defends vaccine mandate after board member quits
08/12/2021.description: The Adelaide Crows chairman says the club has a duty of care to protect its people, after a board director resigns over the organisation's vaccine mandate.
08/12/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

08/12/2021.headline: Two shot dead in Moscow by man reportedly told by security guard to put on a face mask
08/12/2021.description: A gunman opens fire in a Moscow government services centre, killing two people, reportedly after being told to put on a face mask, authorities and Russia media say.
08/12/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

08/12/2021.headline: AFLW targets nine female coaches by 2030
08/12/2021.description: From no female coaches this year to nine by 2030 — that is the AFLW's aim as the league seeks to solidify female leadership in the competition.
08/12/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

08/12/2021.headline: Blaze forces closure of campground, winery and tourist attractions in Margaret River region
08/12/2021.description: A campground, winery and tourist attractions are evacuated as a bushfire threatens lives and homes around the Boranup Forest near Margaret River in WA's South West.
08/12/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

08/12/2021.headline: Serena Williams to miss Australian Open
08/12/2021.description: The seven-time women's singles champion confirms she will not contest the season-opening major, saying she is "not where I need to be physically to compete".
08/12/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

08/12/2021.headline: Peak Aboriginal medical group lobbies NT government to keep borders closed for Christmas
08/12/2021.description: Aboriginal Medical Services of the Northern Territory is calling on the Northern Territory government to keep the borders closed until next year to give low vaccinated regions time to reach at least 90 per cent jab rate.
08/12/2021.author: Stewart Brash and Emma Haskin

08/12/2021.headline: One million turtles released at Bolivia-Brazil border
08/12/2021.description: One million turtles have been released into a river at the Amazon border between Bolivia and Brazil in an attempt to preserve the species.
08/12/2021.author: Stewart Brash and Emma Haskin

08/12/2021.headline: No evidence of foul play in Theo Hayez's disappearance, inquest hears
08/12/2021.description: The police officer in charge of the investigation into the Belgian backpacker's disappearance tells the court there is nothing to suggest that the 18-year-old was harmed by another person.
08/12/2021.author: Leah White and Bruce Mackenzie

08/12/2021.headline: More mental health staff to be sent to APY Lands following critical report
08/12/2021.description: A review of children's mental health services on South Australia's remote Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands finds the majority of children and young people who need support are likely to slip through the cracks under current arrangements.
08/12/2021.author: Leah MacLennan

08/12/2021.headline: Man charged with threatening ABC journalist Mark Willacy and his family
08/12/2021.description: Victoria Police charge a 25-year-old man with making a threat to kill and using a telecommunications device to menace the ABC journalist, who last year won Australian journalism's highest honour for his reporting on alleged war crimes by Australian forces in Afghanistan.
08/12/2021.author: Leah MacLennan

08/12/2021.headline: The Loop: TGA approves Moderna boosters, Rebel Wilson reveals weight loss 'pushback', cracking start to the Ashes
08/12/2021.description: Need a quick catch-up? Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
08/12/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

08/12/2021.headline: What to do if you see an echidna cross the road, like one did at Bathurst?
08/12/2021.description: Drivers at the Bathurst 1000 swerved to avoid hitting an echidna during the race last weekend as they reached speeds over 250kph around the track. But what should the average Aussie do if they're behind the wheel on a public road?
08/12/2021.author: Sarah Motherwell

08/12/2021.headline: 'Disgusted' workers stood down without pay as central Queensland coal mine closes from flooding
08/12/2021.description: The company that operates the mine suspended operations on Thursday, the union has slammed the decision to stand employees down without pay.
08/12/2021.author: Jasmine Hines and Guy Williams

08/12/2021.headline: Man dies after being pinned underneath truck trailer near worksite in Canberra's north
08/12/2021.description: A 43-year-old man is dead after being pinned by the trailer of a truck while working on a construction site in the Canberra suburb of Taylor.
08/12/2021.author: Selby Stewart

08/12/2021.headline: PM's attempt to convince Gladys Berejiklian to switch to federal politics poised to fail
