08/12/2021.description: Multiple sources close to the former NSW premier have told the ABC Gladys Berejiklian is very unlikely to contest Tony Abbott's old seat of Warringah, despite the concerted efforts of the Prime Minister and Treasurer.
08/12/2021.author: Andrew Probyn

08/12/2021.headline: New online crime reporting method put to the test as Canberra church ransacked
08/12/2021.description: A Canberra church was broken into and vandalised yesterday, but in line with a new crime reporting system, ACT Policing didn't attend the scene until this morning.
08/12/2021.author: Charlotte Gore

08/12/2021.headline: Shark head dumped on activist's car as fishing comp ends in gruesome feud
08/12/2021.description: Two sharks were killed during the Jervis Bay competition, leading to ugly scenes as emotions ran high. Warning: This story contains video and images that may distress some readers.
08/12/2021.author: Jessica Clifford and Melinda James

08/12/2021.headline: Humble orange could be used to fight cancer
08/12/2021.description: Rancid oranges could have a part to play in identifying cancer, based on research by the University of Sydney.
08/12/2021.author: Michael Condon

08/12/2021.headline: Test feeding plan in works for starving Florida manatees
08/12/2021.description: With more than 1,000 manatees dying from starvation this year, officials consider a plan to feed lettuce and cabbage in a controlled manner such as via a conveyer belt.
08/12/2021.author: Michael Condon

08/12/2021.headline: In just six days we've learnt plenty about where politics are heading
08/12/2021.description: This year has been dominated by COVID-19 but, as the past six days show, the political landscape has been shifting in all sorts of ways that will shape the coming election, writes David Speers.
08/12/2021.author: David Speers

08/12/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: 44 COVID-19 cases linked to Sydney pub trivia night
08/12/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Anyone who was at a Petersham pub late last month is being urged to urgently get tested as a COVID-19 cluster grows.
08/12/2021.author: David Speers

08/12/2021.headline: 'No customer, no business': This salon will be checking you're double vaxxed
08/12/2021.description: After being "so safe for so long" the message that COVID is coming has been drilled into Tasmanians. So how are businesses gearing up for the influx of visitors when borders reopen next week?
08/12/2021.author: Selina Ross

08/12/2021.headline: Ghislaine Maxwell witness testifies he drove girls to Epstein home
08/12/2021.description: A man has testified at Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal sex abuse trial on Wednesday that he drove teen girls to the Florida mansion of the late financier Jeffrey Epstein and saw them leave with hundred dollar bills.
08/12/2021.author: Selina Ross

08/12/2021.headline: Lucy and Daniel were planning a Tasmanian holiday — then they tried to hire a car
08/12/2021.description: Tasmanian tourism operators are desperate for a post-COVID visitor boom but there are fears a shortage of hire cars will drive them away.
08/12/2021.author: Will Murray

08/12/2021.headline: Project turning landfill waste into fuel 'could save Australia billions'
08/12/2021.description: Polystyrene, tyres, waste plastic, particle board and other solid landfill waste is being turned into "near zero emission", commercial-grade petrol and diesel fuel.
08/12/2021.author: Erin Semmler

08/12/2021.headline: Omicron has made it to Victoria after what experts describe as a 'tremendous' spread around the globe
08/12/2021.description: With the new strain of COVID-19 likely to already be circulating in Victoria, bringing back some minor restrictions would be prudent, an epidemiologist says.
08/12/2021.author: Sian Johnson and Joseph Dunstan

08/12/2021.headline: Not a celebrity? Experts say new anti-trolling laws may not help you
08/12/2021.description: Defamation experts warn the government's attempt to tackle online trolling will offer little protection to ordinary social media users.
08/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

08/12/2021.headline: The brightest comet of 2021 is hanging by a thread. Will it make it to Christmas?
08/12/2021.description: Astronomers are anxiously watching the sky this week to see if a comet streaking through our Solar System will stay together long enough to be seen over Australia at Christmas.
08/12/2021.author: Genelle Weule

08/12/2021.headline: Police have arrested hundreds of suspected drug traffickers in a global sting, now they're going after their trusted insiders
08/12/2021.description: Six months since the AFP revealed how Operation Ironside used an encrypted messaging app to listen in on organised criminals, the investigation has a new target.
08/12/2021.author: Mark Reddie

08/12/2021.headline: 'Despicable': Boris Johnson apologises after video leaks of his staff joking about Christmas party
08/12/2021.description: A "furious" Boris Johnson apologises after video leaked of his staff joking about a Christmas party held at Downing Street last year while the country was under tough COVID-19 restrictions, and announces "Plan-B" measures to take on the Omicron variant
08/12/2021.author: Jack Hawke

08/12/2021.headline: The dodo had no predators in its native Mauritius. That was before the ships came
08/12/2021.description: Has humanity learned its lesson after driving the dodo to extinction? With the environment and biodiversity still at risk, it doesn't seem so.
08/12/2021.author: Nick Baker, Marc Fennell, and Alexandra Spring

08/12/2021.headline: How harsh pandemic rules made these people question whether they really wanted to call Australia home
08/12/2021.description: Permanent residents and visa holders say border closures and separation from family overseas have impacted their mental health and wellbeing, leaving them questioning whether to remain in Australia.
08/12/2021.author: Erin Handley and Joshua Boscaini

08/12/2021.headline: Meet Frank, his job is to scam Australians. And he's done his homework
08/12/2021.description: After two years working in two separate European cybercrime "boiler rooms", Frank tells the ABC how he's scammed Australians.
08/12/2021.author: Amy Bainbridge and Lucy Kent

08/12/2021.headline: Robin Hood's home town was on the brink of ruin. Then it came up with a daring plan to save itself
08/12/2021.description: Nottingham has been home to legendary outlaw Robin Hood and the UK's coal industry. Now it's on track to become one of the first carbon-neutral cities in the world.
08/12/2021.author: Isabella Higgins

08/12/2021.headline: Thai construction tycoon sentenced over killing of rare black leopard
08/12/2021.description: A prominent businessman in Thailand is sentenced to three years and two months jail after being caught in a wildlife park with soup made from a freshly killed rare black leopard in 2018.
08/12/2021.author: Isabella Higgins

08/12/2021.headline: 'Mistaken identity': French authorities admit error in arrest of Saudi man they linked to Jamal Khashoggi's murder
08/12/2021.description: French authorities are forced to admit they made an error and release a Saudi man they arrested over suspected involvement in the killing of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi.
08/12/2021.author: Isabella Higgins

08/12/2021.headline: Elderly woman dies in floodwaters in Brisbane's south-west
08/12/2021.description: A 75-year-old Taringa woman dies in floodwaters in Brisbane's outer-west after her car was washed away on Wednesday afternoon.
08/12/2021.author: Alex Brewster

08/12/2021.headline: Nitram and The Newsreader dominate AACTA Awards
08/12/2021.description: It was a big night for Justin Kurzel's controversial film dramatisation of the Port Arthur Massacre and its perpetrator Martin Bryant, which won eight of the 15 AACTA Awards it was nominated for.
08/12/2021.author: Dee Jefferson

08/12/2021.headline: Rebel Wilson, Taika Waititi, Sarah Snook and more hit the AACTA Awards red carpet
08/12/2021.description: The best and brightest of Australian film and television grace the red carpet for the 2021 AACTA Awards at the Sydney Opera House.
08/12/2021.author: Dee Jefferson

08/12/2021.headline: Reduced size and less impact on water: New plan released for mine extension under Sydney drinking catchment
08/12/2021.description: Mining company South32 has proposed a reduced mine size and less water loss in a new attempt to extend the life of its Dendrobium mine under Sydney's water catchment.
08/12/2021.author: Kelly Fuller

08/12/2021.headline: Olaf Scholz elected as Germany's new Chancellor, replacing Angela Merkel
08/12/2021.description: Olaf Scholz wins a clear majority of 395 votes from politicians in the Bundestag lower house of parliament.
08/12/2021.author: Kelly Fuller

08/12/2021.headline: India's highest-ranked military official dies in helicopter crash
08/12/2021.description: India's air force says the country's military chief General Bipin Rawat, his wife, and 11 others were killed in a helicopter crash in southern Tamil Nadu state.
08/12/2021.author: Kelly Fuller

08/12/2021.headline: Courtney Bruce wins Liz Ellis Diamond award on her birthday
08/12/2021.description: West Coast Fever's Courtney Bruce has received the highest accolade in Australian netball, winning the Liz Ellis Diamond on her 28th birthday.
08/12/2021.author: Kelly Fuller

08/12/2021.headline: On a day of bad omens, England might have set the tone for a difficult Ashes campaign
08/12/2021.description: Entering the first Ashes Test with only two world-class players, England have misfired in the face of a disciplined Australian bowling effort, and the tourists have a difficult task to reverse their downward momentum, writes Russell Jackson.
08/12/2021.author: Russell Jackson

09/12/2021.headline: Boy dies after circumcision in Perth's southern suburbs
09/12/2021.description: A two-year-old boy dies after undergoing a medical procedure — believed to be a circumcision — at a registered medical centre in Perth's southern suburbs.
09/12/2021.author: Lucy Martin

09/12/2021.headline: Court shown footage of man assaulting wife near busy Darwin road hours before fatal bashing
09/12/2021.description: The NT Supreme Court is shown confronting footage of the moment a confessed killer began assaulting his victim in full view of traffic and pedestrians on one of Darwin's busiest streets.
09/12/2021.author: Matt Garrick

09/12/2021.headline: Storms rumble across south-east Queensland, Goondiwindi cops golf-ball-sized hail
09/12/2021.description: Multiple storm warnings are in place as weather systems roll across south-east Queensland, with golf ball-sized hail pelting Goondiwindi.
09/12/2021.author: Elizabeth Cramsie

09/12/2021.headline: Everything you need to know about the NT's Christmas present: quarantine-free travel
09/12/2021.description: Just over a week from now, quarantine for most interstate and international arrivals in the NT will be a thing of the past. Here are all the rules that will be in place from December 20.
09/12/2021.author: Nicholas Hynes

09/12/2021.headline: The Loop: New Zealand's ambitious tobacco bans, Warner misses 100, don't mess with Sam Kerr
09/12/2021.description: Get in The Loop with a quick wrap-up of the news you need to know.
09/12/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

09/12/2021.headline: Noah's backpacker hostel in Bondi locked down due to COVID-19
09/12/2021.description: A backpackers hostel at Bondi Beach in Sydney's east is placed in lockdown due to COVID-19. Police are currently cordoning off the venue.
09/12/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

09/12/2021.headline: Private health insurers warned to share profits from COVID shutdowns with customers
09/12/2021.description: Australia's competition watchdog has put private health insurers on notice, warning they must follow through on a promise to pay back any profits gained on the back of COVID-19 lockdowns and restrictions.
09/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

09/12/2021.headline: NT businesses launch legal bid to overturn 'draconian, racist' vaccination mandate
09/12/2021.description: In the Northern Territory, most workers are required to be vaccinated. But a group of businesses says the mandate has had a devastating impact, and its now seeking to have the rule overturned.
09/12/2021.author: Jano Gibson

09/12/2021.headline: Man charged over alleged Stuart MacGill kidnapping fails in bid to attend uncle's funeral
09/12/2021.description: A magistrate denies Marino Sotiropoulos's request to attend his uncle's funeral after hearing that the accused's sister, who is Stuart MacGill's partner, will also be at the service.
09/12/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

09/12/2021.headline: Retired greyhounds helping prison inmates get lives back on track
09/12/2021.description: For Josh, the harsh realities of prison life are inescapable, except for when a generous ray of sunshine on four legs arrives.
09/12/2021.author: Patrick Martin

09/12/2021.headline: 'Racist attitude': Enraged motorist given six-year sentence for deliberately running over teen cyclist
09/12/2021.description: Jason Reah is found guilty by a Supreme Court jury of causing grievous bodily harm to Hashim Mahmoud after running over the teenager in a Perth shopping centre car park in 2019.
09/12/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

09/12/2021.headline: Rewards worth $600,000 offered to help solve Taskforce Southern murder cases
09/12/2021.description: Rewards totalling $600,000 will be offered for information that leads to the conviction of those responsible for the deaths of three Adelaide men connected to the southern suburbs drug scene.
09/12/2021.author: Eugene Boisvert

09/12/2021.headline: Kassie was in a bad place. Then she entered the grittiest catwalk competition in Australia
09/12/2021.description: Kassie Hunter-Aragu used to be a heavy drug user and at one point tried to take her life. Now she's back on track thanks to a catwalk competition that's about grit, not glamour.
09/12/2021.author: Erin Parke

09/12/2021.headline: 'A doll in the water' actually a baby as navy sailor tells royal commission of distress at sea
09/12/2021.description: A Royal Australian Navy sailor gives harrowing evidence of his time at sea, including seeing asylum seeker bodies in the water and the desperate efforts to save sinking boats.
09/12/2021.author: Erin Parke

09/12/2021.headline: Woman who stole $940,000 from vet to gamble online jailed
09/12/2021.description: The sentencing hearing for a woman who stole $940,000 from her veterinary surgery employer hears character references including one from her new employer, another veterinary practice, which described her as a valued and skilled employee.
09/12/2021.author: Loretta Lohberger

09/12/2021.headline: Trail bike cop denies driving dangerously during moped pursuit on Gold Coast
09/12/2021.description: Sergeant Peter Andrew Venz is facing trial in the Southport Magistrates Court after trying to chase down a pair of moped riders who allegedly threatened to kill one of his colleagues.
09/12/2021.author: Alexandria Utting

09/12/2021.headline: 'You acted out of love': Judge frees son who shot cancer-stricken father in mercy killing
09/12/2021.description: Colin Stratton asked his son to do him a final favour — to pull the trigger on a rifle he was holding to his own head, after the Victorian health system "failed him".
09/12/2021.author: Tyrone Dalton

09/12/2021.headline: South Australia records seven new cases of COVID-19
09/12/2021.description: South Australia records seven new cases of COVID-19, with two linked to the Norwood cluster.
09/12/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin

09/12/2021.headline: Are we raising a nation of squibs? Bluey episode divides parents on party game's rules
09/12/2021.description: An episode of Bluey has divided parents on how to play the party game pass the parcel: do you have a small prize in every layer, or one big one at the end? But experts say don't be so hard on yourself.
09/12/2021.author: Sarah Motherwell

09/12/2021.headline: Paramedics called to inquest of missing Belgian backpacker Theo Hayez to attend family member
09/12/2021.description: A coronial inquest into missing Belgian backpacker Theo Hayez was temporarily adjourned and paramedics called as emotion overcame the missing man's mother.
09/12/2021.author: Leah White and Bruce Mackenzie

09/12/2021.headline: Teen pleads guilty to assaulting soccer player Danny Hodgson as relatives apologise for his behvaiour
09/12/2021.description: Relatives of a teenager who has pleaded guilty to attacking Perth soccer player Danny Hodgson in Perth's CBD have apologised for the 17-year-old's acts in front of court today.
09/12/2021.author: Lucy Martin

09/12/2021.headline: 'Not up to date, complete or accurate' spreadsheets being used to monitor Queensland dam safety, report finds
09/12/2021.description: The Queensland government is warned of a coming crackdown on the safety and compliance processes around the state's dams, with one inspection report more than 14 years overdue.
09/12/2021.author: Rachel Riga

09/12/2021.headline: More than 40 camels disqualified from a beauty pageant over Botox injections
09/12/2021.description: Authorities say breeders were trying to cheat by using hormones and lip fillers to boost the appearance of contestants in the Saudi camel festival.
09/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

09/12/2021.headline: Future generations of New Zealanders to be banned from ever buying tobacco products
09/12/2021.description: Most retailers will lose the ability to sell cigarettes and some Kiwis will never be able to buy tobacco products under proposed legislation to tackle high rates of smoking.
09/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

09/12/2021.headline: The banking royal commission referred potential crimes to ASIC. Almost half didn't make it to court
09/12/2021.description: ASIC launches the last case to emerge from the banking royal commission, closing the door on any more court action for banks that ripped billions of dollars from customers.
09/12/2021.author: Daniel Ziffer

09/12/2021.headline: How Queensland courts are changing as borders reopen
09/12/2021.description: Brisbane's Supreme Court has issued new restrictions for anyone entering a court as the state reopens borders.
09/12/2021.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

09/12/2021.headline: Children will soon be eligible for a COVID-19 vaccine. But what if parents disagree?
09/12/2021.description: Now that children younger than 12 are eligible for a COVID-19 vaccine, some say we could see an increase in Family Court matters. But the courts have already put measures in place to prioritise such disputes, should they arise.
09/12/2021.author: Niki Burnside

09/12/2021.headline: The first rule of doing business in China? Don't get political. Women's tennis ripped up the rule book
09/12/2021.description: One sports organisation is standing up to the rising superpower and refusing to back down, and it's not clear authorities in Beijing know what to do next, writes Carrington Clarke.
09/12/2021.author: Carrington Clarke

09/12/2021.headline: Scientists fear pests could be in full flow after heavy flooding
09/12/2021.description: Following mass flooding in the Central West region, scientists are worried about the spread of invasive species along revitalised rivers.
09/12/2021.author: Carrington Clarke

09/12/2021.headline: 'Intensely upsetting': Parents distraught after horseriding program for disabled children becomes homeless
09/12/2021.description: A Melbourne riding school for people with disabilities suddenly announces it will "cease operations" after 43 years, citing a breakdown in agreement with landowners.
09/12/2021.author: Madi Chwasta

09/12/2021.headline: Tasmania could get an offshore wind farm with capacity to power hundreds of thousands of households
09/12/2021.description: A multi-billion-dollar wind farm that could take up an area as big as Cape Barren Island has been proposed off Tasmania's north-east.
09/12/2021.author: April McLennan

09/12/2021.headline: Their bodies are deteriorating, but these Parkinson’s patients are finding freedom through dance
09/12/2021.description: When they were diagnosed with Parkinson’s disease, these patients never expected their tremors and rigidity would lead them to the dance floor.
09/12/2021.author: Lily Nothling

09/12/2021.headline: Healthcare workers under pressure due to COVID were offered bonuses, but many are still waiting
09/12/2021.description: Multiple health services say payments of up to $300 per week for workers under pressure in the face of Victoria's Delta outbreak are still being sorted out almost two months after being announced.
09/12/2021.author: Kristian Silva

09/12/2021.headline: While Albanese has avoided Morrison's traps, the government has fallen into holes it dug itself
09/12/2021.description: A week after Anthony Albanese announced his climate blueprint, Labor has every reason to believe the most difficult policy it will launch for the coming election has parachuted to a safe landing, writes Michelle Grattan.
09/12/2021.author: Michelle Grattan

09/12/2021.headline: Insomnia at home, falling asleep at the wheel: Former Coles managers tell of overwork and impossible demands
09/12/2021.description: Former Coles managers allege a culture of overwork and underpayment at the supermarket giant as it faces legal action from the Fair Work Ombudsman as well as a class action on behalf of 2,200 workers.
09/12/2021.author: Pat McGrath, Dan Harrison, and Alison McClymont

09/12/2021.headline: China committed genocide against Uyghurs, independent tribunal says
09/12/2021.description: An independent, unofficial body set up by a prominent British barrister to assess evidence on China's alleged rights abuses against the Uyghur people finds the Chinese government committed genocide and crimes against humanity.
09/12/2021.author: Pat McGrath, Dan Harrison, and Alison McClymont

09/12/2021.headline: These students got together to talk about suicide prevention. The results could help others across Australia
09/12/2021.description: There are promising signs a suicide prevention program, being trialled in certain high schools, could help to reduce suicidal thoughts and behaviours of students.
09/12/2021.author: Penny Timms

09/12/2021.headline: Tasmanian health department put interests of alleged paedophile ahead of victims, review finds
09/12/2021.description: Tasmania's health department is accused of putting the interests of alleged paedophile nurse James Griffin ahead of his victims in a scathing review by the state's Ombudsman.
09/12/2021.author: Emily Baker

09/12/2021.headline: Australia dumps troubled European-designed Taipan helicopters for US Black Hawks and Seahawks
09/12/2021.description: The Army will follow the Navy's decision to replace its locally produced Airbus MRH-90s with off-the-shelf Sikorsky-manufactured helicopters, in a move expected to cost billions of dollars.
09/12/2021.author: Andrew Greene

09/12/2021.headline: England 'not on the ropes', Travis Head says despite blistering century
09/12/2021.description: Travis Head's stunning 85-ball century on day two of the first Ashes Test at the Gabba looks to have taken the game away from England, but Australia's centurion says there is still work to be done.
09/12/2021.author: Simon Smale

09/12/2021.headline: How to prove your COVID vaccination status in Tasmanian venues
09/12/2021.description: If you're out drinking and dancing in Tasmania you need to be able to prove you are fully vaccinated — so, how can you do that? And what if you don't have a smartphone?
09/12/2021.author: James Dunlevie

09/12/2021.headline: Face masks help protect us from COVID. But we need to protect the planet from that plastic pollution
09/12/2021.description: Australia has been warned to guard against a massive COVID face mask litter problem that could last generations.
09/12/2021.author: Anna Salleh

09/12/2021.headline: After 20 years, the Cat Empire will disband, but not before a fairytale finish
09/12/2021.description: Their energetic performances have always invited music-lovers to dance and sing along. Now the members of Melbourne's iconic band the Cat Empire say it's time for a change.
09/12/2021.author: Mike Williams

09/12/2021.headline: More companies paid no tax during COVID-19 pandemic
09/12/2021.description: The number of Australian public companies that paid no tax in 2019–20 has risen during COVID-19 lockdowns, according to the Australian Taxation Office's (ATO's) latest transparency data.
09/12/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

09/12/2021.headline: Australia will 'pay the price' for Winter Olympics boycott, China says
09/12/2021.description: Australia, the United States, the United Kingdom and Canada will "pay the price" for a diplomatic boycott of the Beijing 2022 Winter Olympic Games, a spokesperson for the Chinese government says.
09/12/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

09/12/2021.headline: COVID vaccine to be rolled out to children aged five to 11 from early January
09/12/2021.description: The nationwide rollout of COVID-19 vaccines to Australian children aged between 5 and 11 will begin early next year, the federal government says, but there will be key differences to the rollout for adults.
09/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

09/12/2021.headline: Coal-fired power to shut down three times faster than anticipated under new NEM plan
09/12/2021.description: Coal-fired power generators are expected to shut down nearly three times faster than previously anticipated and exit the National Energy Market entirely by 2043, according to an updated plan that follows widespread consultation with the sector.
09/12/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

09/12/2021.headline: Bushland razed, locals flee as fire rages through Margaret River wine region
09/12/2021.description: More than 5,000 hectares of bushland are razed by a massive fire threatening lives and properties in Western Australia's most famous wine and surfing region.
09/12/2021.author: Andrea Mayes and Jacqueline Lynch

09/12/2021.headline: Capitals-Flames WNBL game cancelled due to positive COVID case
09/12/2021.description: The WNBL calls off Sunday's game between the UC Capitals and Sydney Uni Flames in Canberra following a positive COVID-19 result.
09/12/2021.author: Andrea Mayes and Jacqueline Lynch

10/12/2021.headline: 'As bad as it gets': Backlash to NT travel rules
10/12/2021.description: From December 20, arrivals to the Northern Territory cannot travel outside of Alice Springs, Katherine or Greater Darwin for two weeks, even if they are fully vaccinated.
10/12/2021.author: Saskia Mabin, Steve Vivian, and Stewart Brash

10/12/2021.headline: Former SA Labor MP and husband lose fight to have Opposition Leader appear in court
10/12/2021.description: Annabel and Greg Digances, who are accused of blackmailing the SA Opposition Leader, fail in their bid to have the state Opposition Leader appear in court.
10/12/2021.author: Eric Tlozek

10/12/2021.headline: The Loop: SA government hit by cyber attack, Gold Coast's COVID concerns, 'where's Samantha?'
10/12/2021.description: It's Friday and we know you want the latest news in the quickest format possible. Here's your TL;DR for today.
10/12/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

10/12/2021.headline: Hobart to host fifth Ashes Test — making cricket history for Tasmania
10/12/2021.description: Hobart will host its first ever Ashes cricket Test next month after fighting off mainland rivals to be awarded the venue rights to the fifth and final match of the series.
10/12/2021.author: Chris Rowbottom

10/12/2021.headline: Education staffer found not guilty over leak of dire Kimberley school attendance figures
10/12/2021.description: After leaking data revealing school attendance in Halls Creek has slumped to just 8 per cent, Brock Burston is found not guilty after a two-day trial.
10/12/2021.author: Sam Tomlin and Ted O'Connor

10/12/2021.headline: Nicaragua breaks diplomatic ties with Taiwan, hailing Beijing as 'only legitimate government'
10/12/2021.description: Becoming the latest nation to break longstanding diplomatic ties with Taipei, Nicaragua's foreign ministry says Taiwan is "an inalienable part of the Chinese territory".
10/12/2021.author: Sam Tomlin and Ted O'Connor

10/12/2021.headline: Rules change again days out from Tasmania reopening — but no mask mandate
10/12/2021.description: Less than a week out from Tasmania's reopening, authorities again change quarantine requirements for those returning from high risk zones — but hold off introducing a mask mandate.
10/12/2021.author: Monte Bovill

10/12/2021.headline: Denver Broncos Super Bowl winner dies aged 33
10/12/2021.description: Broncos great Demaryius Thomas, who helped the franchise win Super Bowl 50, has been found dead at his home in Georgia.
10/12/2021.author: Monte Bovill

10/12/2021.headline: Global child abuse ring member jailed for 'depraved' crimes of the 'worst kind'
10/12/2021.description: A New South Wales man who was a member of an international child abuse network is sentenced to four-and-a-half years' jail for his "abhorrent"crimes.
10/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

10/12/2021.headline: 'It brings back bad memories': Margaret River community again in the grips of a dangerous bushfire
10/12/2021.description: As the Margaret River community worriedly watches a dangerous fire razing precious Boranup forest, memories of the devastating blaze destroying 39 homes resurface.
10/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke, Anthony Pancia, Jacqueline Lynch, Jackson Worthington, Jessica Warriner, and James Carmody

10/12/2021.headline: Mackay's head of medical services suspended two months after review launched
10/12/2021.description: Mackay Hospital and Health Service announces the suspension of medical services executive director Philip Reasbeck two months after launching an independent review into obstetrics and gynaecology at Mackay Base Hospital.
10/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke, Anthony Pancia, Jacqueline Lynch, Jackson Worthington, Jessica Warriner, and James Carmody

10/12/2021.headline: Two Omicron COVID-19 cases announced in SA, along with changes to quarantine and testing
10/12/2021.description: South Australia records eight new cases of COVID-19, including two from interstate suspected to be the Omicron variant — the first in the state. Close contacts of people infected with the strain will now have to quarantine for 14 days.
10/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke, Anthony Pancia, Jacqueline Lynch, Jackson Worthington, Jessica Warriner, and James Carmody

10/12/2021.headline: The biggest win of Tai Tuivasa's UFC career won't see the pride of western Sydney change his ways
10/12/2021.description: Decking a former NFL All-Star during one of the biggest UFC cards of the year didn't change Tai Tuivasa — and that's just how the big man likes it as he faces his next bout on Sunday.
10/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke, Anthony Pancia, Jacqueline Lynch, Jackson Worthington, Jessica Warriner, and James Carmody

10/12/2021.headline: Major study of PFAS firefighting foam's impact on communities finds limited evidence of disease links
10/12/2021.description: A major study of toxic chemicals that leaked into the groundwater of regional towns near Australian air force bases has found no conclusive evidence they increase the risk of cancer or disease.
10/12/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

10/12/2021.headline: Truck crash kills at least 53 migrants in Mexico, dozens more injured
10/12/2021.description: Photos from the scene showed victims strewn across the pavement and inside the truck's freight compartment.
10/12/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

10/12/2021.headline: 'She must have been in a great deal of terror': Man jailed for setting partner on fire
10/12/2021.description: A Tasmanian man who set his girlfriend on fire in 2017, leaving her with "catastrophic burns" and lifelong injuries, is sentenced to 18 years in prison for his "cruel" actions.
10/12/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

10/12/2021.headline: Waterfront church sells to raise funds for Anglican Church's abuse redress scheme
10/12/2021.description: A waterfront church property in one of Tasmania's most expensive suburbs sells as part of the Anglican Church's drive to raise funds to service the redress scheme for victims of sexual abuse.
10/12/2021.author: Fiona Blackwood

10/12/2021.headline: Mother who allegedly forced daughter to marry man who later killed her will stand trial
10/12/2021.description: Shepparton woman Ruqia Haidari allegedly begged her mother to call off her arranged marriage, but her plea was refused. Six weeks after the wedding, the young bride was dead.
10/12/2021.author: Charmayne Allison

10/12/2021.headline: Former Labor staffer blames technical 'glitch' for watching two child exploitation videos
10/12/2021.description: A court hears a former South Australian Labor Party staffer blames accessing child exploitation material on a technical "glitch".
10/12/2021.author: Gabriella Marchant

10/12/2021.headline: 'Where's Samantha?' Here's how writers explained the big absence in And Just Like That
10/12/2021.description: It took just 44 seconds for the question to come up in the show. Fans say the answer was "lazy writing" and didn't represent the character they loved.
10/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

10/12/2021.headline: Tesla criticised for allowing drivers to play video games while on the road
10/12/2021.description: America's National Highway Transport Safety Authority confirms it is looking into a recently discovered Tesla feature that allows drivers to play video games on the car's dashboard while in motion.
10/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

10/12/2021.headline: Cheerleading for change: NRL club invites men to join its 'dance squad' in 2022
10/12/2021.description: Cheerleaders are a divisive issue among rugby league fans, but one club is making an effort to make the half-time entertainment more inclusive.
10/12/2021.author: Bindi Bryce

10/12/2021.headline: Premier could be among thousands of SA government employees affected by cyber attack
10/12/2021.description: The South Australian government says the personal details of up to 80,000 workers — including potentially the Premier — have been accessed in a cyber attack on an external payroll software provider.
10/12/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin and Eugene Boisvert

10/12/2021.headline: Lionel Rose Google doodle brings new generation to iconic fighter
10/12/2021.description: A whole new generation of Australian sports fans are discovering legendary boxer Lionel Rose after the former world champion was featured as a Google Doodle.
10/12/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin and Eugene Boisvert

10/12/2021.headline: A desperate PM, an old sparring partner and a simple calculation: How Morrison got it wrong
10/12/2021.description: Leveraging Gladys Berejiklian's personal popularity with punters was always politically opportunistic for Scott Morrison, made more interesting by the fact that from many accounts the two could barely stand each other, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.
10/12/2021.author: Brett Worthington

10/12/2021.headline: Are we caught in a game of snakes and ladders with coronavirus variants?
10/12/2021.description: A pattern of borders opening and then closing has become a familiar one over the past 22 months, threatening economic recovery and leaving citizens fatigued. Is it a sign we will always live with restrictions and uncertainty?
10/12/2021.author: Lucia Stein

10/12/2021.headline: An increasing number of Taiwanese people want independence, but they're in no rush
10/12/2021.description: The threat of conflict has raised the question of Taiwan's independence, but it's a complicated issue. So what do Taiwanese Australians think?
10/12/2021.author: Iris Zhao

10/12/2021.headline: A green energy retailer's bleeding customers after a buyout by Shell. Will people power win?
10/12/2021.description: Green energy provider Powershop has likely lost at least 5,000 customers since a takeover announcement by Shell a few weeks ago, according to data collected by the ABC from its competitors.
10/12/2021.author: Emilia Terzon

10/12/2021.headline: Forget plus-ones — COVID takes the cake for awkward wedding RSVP etiquette
10/12/2021.description: Couples racing to get married in the US are now navigating awkward conversations with family and friends about how to stay COVID safe at their weddings.
10/12/2021.author: Emilia Terzon

10/12/2021.headline: Surfing in India is taking off, but locals are on the frontline of the world's plastic pollution crisis
10/12/2021.description: The connection with the ocean that many of India's new surfers are feeling comes with a heightened awareness that many of the country's coastal waters are in troub
10/12/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

10/12/2021.headline: Why we continue to marvel at the wildflowers of the west
10/12/2021.description: Each year, winter rains turn the dusty landscape of WA's Midwest into a rich tapestry of colours, smells and sounds. When the flowers come out, so do the people, who connect with the flowers in their own way.
10/12/2021.author: Chris Lewis and Daniel Franklin

10/12/2021.headline: US government wins appeal in bid to have Julian Assange extradited from UK
10/12/2021.description: The win means Julian Assange is a step closer to being extradited to the US to face charges of conspiring to hack government computers and of violating espionage law.
10/12/2021.author: Jack Hawke

10/12/2021.headline: Ex-casino cruise ship manager with no experience granted six-figure NT government job, court hears
10/12/2021.description: No reference checks were made before the woman was appointed and the former casino worker had recently facilitated a discounted cruise ship holiday for the NT children's commissioner, a court has heard.
10/12/2021.author: Kate Ashton

10/12/2021.headline: 'Moving beyond triage':  Push for women's domestic violence trauma recovery centre grows
10/12/2021.description: State and federal governments are being urged to fund a "one-stop" model of care for women and children who experience trauma from domestic and family violence.
10/12/2021.author: Kelly Fuller

10/12/2021.headline: Solomon Islands lifts curfews and restrictions as political tensions ease
10/12/2021.description: Measures implemented to halt last month's anti-government protests that spiralled into widespread looting are lifted as life slowly returns to normal in the Pacific nation.
10/12/2021.author: Kelly Fuller

10/12/2021.headline: Army refused to provide mental health services to former soldier, royal commission told
10/12/2021.description: A Brisbane mental health unit doctor tried to seek help from the army on behalf of a former soldier, but was knocked back on the grounds the man was no longer on active service, the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide is told.
10/12/2021.author: Stephanie Zillman

10/12/2021.headline: A look at the trail of destruction from the ferocious Margaret River bushfire emergency
10/12/2021.description: A thick layer of ash coats the charred trees inside the fireground, which authorities allowed ABC journalists into.
10/12/2021.author: Jessica Warriner and James Carmody

10/12/2021.headline: Van Egmond stars as Newcastle Jets thrash Wellington Phoenix
10/12/2021.description: Matildas midfielder Emily van Egmond makes an impressive return to Jets colours in their 5-1 A-League Women rout over the Phoenix.
10/12/2021.author: Jessica Warriner and James Carmody

10/12/2021.headline: 'He promised he'd come back really fast': Hayez family agony brings coroner to tears
10/12/2021.description: Heart-rending statements are heard inside and outside Byron Bay court as a coronial inquest into a Belgian backpacker's disappearance adjourns until next year.
10/12/2021.author: Leah White

10/12/2021.headline: Root and Malan have batted England to respectability, but England's fatal flaw lies in store
10/12/2021.description: Joe Root and Dawid Malan helped England to recover to a respectable position with their unbroken 159-run partnership, but the unreliability of the tourists' tail is likely to be exposed, writes Russell Jackson.
10/12/2021.author: Russell Jackson

10/12/2021.headline: Co-op adventure about saving broken marriage wins Game of the Year
10/12/2021.description: It Takes Two has won the top gong at the 2021 Game Awards, a prize that has been previously won by The Last of Us Part II, God of War and The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild.
10/12/2021.author: Sarah Motherwell

10/12/2021.headline: What was once one of Europe's largest coal-fired power stations has been demolished in Scotland
10/12/2021.description: The 183-metre chimney was the largest free-standing structure in Scotland and was considered a regional landmark.
10/12/2021.author: Sarah Motherwell

10/12/2021.headline: 'As bad as it gets': Tourism operators blast NT travel rules
10/12/2021.description: From December 20, arrivals to the Northern Territory cannot travel outside of Alice Springs, Katherine or Greater Darwin for two weeks — even if they are fully vaccinated.
10/12/2021.author: Saskia Mabin, Steve Vivian, and Stewart Brash

11/12/2021.headline: Former Liberal MP Tim Smith's replacement decided ahead of 2022 Victorian election
11/12/2021.description: Jess Wilson, a former staffer for federal Treasurer Josh Frydenberg, has been preselected for the coveted seat of Kew as Victoria heads into an election year.
11/12/2021.author: Richard Willingham

11/12/2021.headline: 'We need to take a cautious approach': WA to tighten border with Queensland on Monday
11/12/2021.description: Western Australia will tighten its border controls with Queensland from Monday following community spread of the virus in the sunshine state.
11/12/2021.author: David Weber

11/12/2021.headline: Treasurer warns states not to 'overreact' to Omicron and to stay open
11/12/2021.description: Ahead of delivering his Mid-Year Economic Fiscal Outlook report, Josh Frydenberg says state borders remaining open will be critical to maintaining Australia's economic recovery.
11/12/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

11/12/2021.headline: NT Police arrest a man who fled from Alice Springs quarantine eight days ago
11/12/2021.description: A man who escaped from a quarantine facility in Alice Springs eight days ago has been arrested, say NT Police.
11/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

11/12/2021.headline: Father, son charged with starting California wildfire plead not guilty
11/12/2021.description: A father and son charged with starting a massive California wildfire in the Lake Tahoe area are pleading not guilty in court.
11/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

11/12/2021.headline: This woman thought she was buying a miniature pet, now she has a 250kg pig
11/12/2021.description: Rosangela dos Santos Lara has been offered more than $3000 for her pig, but she says she'll never sell her.
11/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

11/12/2021.headline: Cricket Australia apologises after power failure upsets Ashes TV broadcast
11/12/2021.description: The television feed of the Gabba Ashes Test has been affected by a power issue, resulting in global embarrassment for Cricket Australia.
11/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

11/12/2021.headline: English optimism gives way to a familiar tune as Australia races to thumping first Test victory
11/12/2021.description: Joe Root and Dawid Malan threatened to make a game of the first Test, but Nathan Lyon’s 400th Test wicket started a collapse that handed Australia a 1-0 lead in the men's Ashes series, writes Russell Jackson.
11/12/2021.author: Russell Jackson

11/12/2021.headline: Groups urge community to 'spot the red flags' of family violence after lengthy sentence for Matthew Davey
11/12/2021.description: A group that supports victims of family violence says the lengthy prison sentence handed to a man convicted of abusing and attempting to kill his partner shows the justice system is evolving, but has also urged the community "to spot the red flags".
11/12/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

11/12/2021.headline: Remote NT community Beswick to enter a three-day lockout, Alice Springs wastewater tests positive to COVID-19
11/12/2021.description: NT Health Minister Natasha Fyles said authorities were concerned by COVID-positive wastewater detected in Beswick, Barunga and Alice Springs.
11/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

11/12/2021.headline: Canberra woman berates her own defence lawyer in court while appearing on aggravated robbery charge
11/12/2021.description: A Canberra woman appears in the ACT Magistrates Court, charged with ram-raiding a coffee shop in an alleged aggravated armed robbery.
11/12/2021.author: Tahlia Roy

11/12/2021.headline: Concerns FIFO will 'devastate' mining town as Glencore shifts to seven-day roster
11/12/2021.description: The new roster is needed to increase productivity, according to multinational company Glencore, but critics say it will have 'ghost-town' consequences for Mount Isa in north-west Queensland.
11/12/2021.author: Tahlia Roy

11/12/2021.headline: Tornado strikes a US nursing home with dozens of residents inside, killing one
11/12/2021.description: Local media are reporting that the Monette Manor nursing home in Arkansas took a direct hit by a large tornado, while emergency services are responding to a warehouse roof collapse in Illinois.
11/12/2021.author: Tahlia Roy

11/12/2021.headline: SA records seven new COVID-19 cases and high risk exposure site in North Adelaide
11/12/2021.description: South Australia has recorded seven new cases of COVID-19 with a North Adelaide bakery named as a 'high risk' exposure site.
11/12/2021.author: Rebecca Opie

11/12/2021.headline: Canberra man charged with rape, accused of having sex with a woman unable to give consent
11/12/2021.description: A 54-year-old Canberra man remains in custody after he allegedly encountered a heavily intoxicated woman in Glebe Park, took her back to his home and had sex with her while she was unable to give her consent.
11/12/2021.author: Tahlia Roy

11/12/2021.headline: Brazil's health ministry website hacked, vaccination information deleted
11/12/2021.description: Brazil's health ministry says the national immunisation program and another system used to issue digital vaccination certificates have been hacked, with the data copied and deleted by the hackers.
11/12/2021.author: Tahlia Roy

11/12/2021.headline: Circus Oz is to close after 44 years. They changed Australian circus, and brought it to the world
11/12/2021.description: Circus Oz took something that was intrinsically Australian and showed it to the world, writes Jo Caust.
11/12/2021.author: Tahlia Roy

11/12/2021.headline: 'Internet's on fire': Users around the world at risk amid the 'most critical vulnerability' in 10 years
11/12/2021.description: Within 12 hours of being disclosed, a bug is "fully weaponised", sparking a race between hackers and the cybersecurity companies trying to head them off.
11/12/2021.author: Tahlia Roy

11/12/2021.headline: Worst over but flood dangers remain as NSW government offers wider disaster assistance
11/12/2021.description: Police formally identify the body of a woman swept from a trapped car as emergency services urge caution as the state's south-east mops up after days of flooding rain.
11/12/2021.author: Fatima Olumee, Vanessa Milton, and Paul West

11/12/2021.headline: Meteor fireball captured on retired scientist's home camera. But where are the meteorites?
11/12/2021.description: Most mornings, retired scientist Derek Poulton gets up and checks a special camera at his home in Victoria. On November 29, he was excited to see a bright meteor. Now he and 15 other scientists are searching for meteorites on the ground, and they need help.
11/12/2021.author: Katherine Smyrk and Matt Dowling

11/12/2021.headline: Lyon's long wait for 400th Test scalp ends
11/12/2021.description: Nathan Lyon finally takes his 400th Test wicket, becoming only the third Australian bowler to achieve the feat.
11/12/2021.author: Katherine Smyrk and Matt Dowling

11/12/2021.headline: One in five Australians in the outer suburbs is struggling during the pandemic
11/12/2021.description: One in five Australians in the outer suburbs is living in "financial survival mode" during the pandemic and are more likely to feel stressed, frustrated and anxious than the national average.
11/12/2021.author: Katherine Smyrk and Matt Dowling

11/12/2021.headline: Julian Assange can be extradited to the US. So what happens now?
11/12/2021.description: Julian Assange is a step closer to being extradited to the United States to face charges that could land him in prison for 175 years. Here's what could happen next
11/12/2021.author: Katherine Smyrk and Matt Dowling

11/12/2021.headline: Three new Omicron infections as NSW cases continue uptick
11/12/2021.description: Three new cases of the COVID-19 Omicron variant are confirmed, with more expected as genomic sequencing testing continues.
11/12/2021.author: Katherine Smyrk and Matt Dowling

11/12/2021.headline: Jan went into a job as a youth justice worker with plenty of life experience. An assault was the 'straw that broke the camel's back'
11/12/2021.description: It's a facility that's supposed to rehabilitate young men caught breaking the law, but instead, former workers say the Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre's hardline approach is causing irreversible physical and mental harm.
11/12/2021.author: Josie Taylor and Shannon Schubert

11/12/2021.headline: Growing backlash to wind farms coming from an unlikely quarter
11/12/2021.description: In the ranges behind Cairns, bushland is being cleared in the name of climate action. It's pitting eco warriors against green energy projects.
11/12/2021.author: Mayeta Clark

11/12/2021.headline: New Caledonians will decide today whether they want to stay with France. Here's why Australians should care
11/12/2021.description: New Caledonians will have their say on whether they want independence from France with the third and final referendum today — only this time, pro-independence supporters aren't planning to show up.
11/12/2021.author: Edwina Seselja

11/12/2021.headline: The drug lords who rule Asia's infamous Golden Triangle and the officers hot on their trail
11/12/2021.description: Deep in the jungle where Myanmar, Laos and Thailand's borders meet lies the Golden Triangle, a trafficking heartland where drug runners and police play a dangerous — and sometimes deadly — game of cat and mouse.
11/12/2021.author: Mazoe Ford and Supattra Vimonsuknopparat

11/12/2021.headline: It's back to the future, again: Close your eyes and you'd think this was the 1980s
11/12/2021.description: Russian troops on the Ukraine border, an Olympics boycott, a "missing" tennis star: What century is this? Close your eyes and it is the 1980s again, writes Stan Grant.
11/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

11/12/2021.headline: 'There's a lot of joy in being single': What Kerri and others have learnt about going solo
11/12/2021.description: There's a perception that if you're not coupled up that you're somehow lesser, and that's something more people should question, says author Kerri Sackville.
11/12/2021.author: Michael Mackenzie and Sophie Kesteven

11/12/2021.headline: Australia is about to be treated to a 'supremely good' meteor shower
11/12/2021.description: Set your clocks and get ready for the Geminids, the best meteor shower in the Southern Hemisphere this year.
11/12/2021.author: Genelle Weule

11/12/2021.headline: In Australian labs, scientists are racing to understand Omicron, the 'most evasive' variant yet
11/12/2021.description: When Sydney's Kirby Institute pitted an Omicron sample against the antibodies of two vaccine doses, they couldn't block it — but there's still much to learn about the newest COVID-19 variant.
11/12/2021.author: Maani Truu and Catherine Taylor

11/12/2021.headline: Up to 100 killed in Kentucky as tornadoes wreak havoc in US
11/12/2021.description: Up to 100 people have been killed in a devastating series of tornadoes that ripped through Kentucky and several other US states, Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear says.
11/12/2021.author: Maani Truu and Catherine Taylor

11/12/2021.headline: Booster access brought forward to slow spread of Omicron COVID-19 variant
11/12/2021.description: Millions of Australians are now able to access a COVID-19 booster shot one month earlier than expected, after a change to the national rollout in response to the Omicron variant.
11/12/2021.author: Henry Belot

11/12/2021.headline: England hit with heavy fine for slow over rate in first Ashes Test
11/12/2021.description: The tourists are fined their entire match fee and docked five World Test Championship points by the ICC, while Australia's Travis Head is fined for making an "audible obscenity".
11/12/2021.author: Henry Belot

11/12/2021.headline: Aussie Piastri wins Formula 2 world title
11/12/2021.description: Young Australian driver Oscar Piastri clinches the Formula 2 world championship, wrapping up the crown on the penultimate day of the season in Abu Dhabi.
11/12/2021.author: Henry Belot

11/12/2021.headline: Three people die in two separate Northern Territory crashes, including a boy, 10
11/12/2021.description: Police confirm three people have died in two separate crashes on Northern Territory roads in the past 24 hours, including a 10-year-old boy.
11/12/2021.author: Ben Gubana

11/12/2021.headline: Man, 19, arrested after police officer struck by car while conducting speed checks
11/12/2021.description: Queensland Police arrest a Marsden man, 19, who allegedly deliberately struck an officer with a stolen vehicle earlier this week.
11/12/2021.author: Ben Gubana

11/12/2021.headline: Ex-Perth psychiatrist allegedly abused children after prescribing them medication, court told
11/12/2021.description: A former Perth psychiatrist is granted bail after he allegedly sexually abused children for whom he had prescribed medication, a court is told.
11/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke

11/12/2021.headline: Siemsen double gives Sky Blues ALW derby win over Wanderers
11/12/2021.description: Remy Siemsen grabs a goal on either side of half-time, as Sydney FC records a 2-0 win over Western Sydney Wanderers.
11/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke

11/12/2021.headline: 'We have to be better': England rues missed opportunities in Ashes Test thrashing
11/12/2021.description: After collapsing in its second innings early on day four, England captain Joe Root concedes his side wasted the chance to set Australia a more difficult victory target at the Gabba.
11/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke

11/12/2021.headline: Police believe Margaret River fire was 'deliberately lit' as threat level downgraded
11/12/2021.description: Police are appealing for information after confirming a fire that ripped through Western Australia's world-famous wine and surfing region was deliberately lit.
11/12/2021.author: Tabarak Al Jrood and Zoe Keenan

12/12/2021.headline: Shaun visited a plant nursery last week. Now he's quarantined in an Adelaide medi-hotel
12/12/2021.description: Shaun Ferguson shares his experience of what happened after he visited a pet and plant store that later became a high-risk COVID-19 exposure site.
12/12/2021.author: Rebecca Opie and Imogen Hayne

12/12/2021.headline: Booster rollout fast-tracked as data reveals Omicron immunity declines from six months
12/12/2021.description: Australians will now be able to receive a Moderna or a Pfizer booster shot five months after their last vaccination after new evidence showing immunity to the Omicron variant waning six months after a second dose.
12/12/2021.author: Henry Belot

12/12/2021.headline: Looking to travel interstate? Here's what restrictions you can expect in each state or territory
12/12/2021.description: As more jurisdictions ease their domestic border restrictions this week, each state and territory's rules and restrictions are different. Here's a guide to what rules are in place around the country.
12/12/2021.author: Henry Belot

12/12/2021.headline: Have policymakers failed workers since the 1990s? Or have they got things right?
12/12/2021.description: Will Australia's inflation-targeting regime need a reboot on the other side of the pandemic?
12/12/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

12/12/2021.headline: Carey staying grounded after stunning Test debut in Australia's win over England
12/12/2021.description: Despite taking eight catches in the opening men's Ashes Test, Australian wicketkeeper Alex Carey says there's still room for improvement in his game behind the stumps.
12/12/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

12/12/2021.headline: 'A different beast': Robert Whittaker to enter Israel Adesanya rematch a changed man
12/12/2021.description: Robert Whittaker will have his chance at revenge with a rematch against Israel Adesanya for the UFC middleweight title, but the former champion has learned the real secret to vengeance is letting go.
12/12/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

12/12/2021.headline: Early season fire takes out mobile phones at Sisters Beach in north-west Tasmania
12/12/2021.description: Mobile phone reception remains cut to a small town in Tasmania's north-west after a bushfire damaged telecommunications infrastructure.
12/12/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

12/12/2021.headline: Boy, 4, among NT's three new local COVID-19 cases, 72-hour mask mandate for Tennant Creek, remote communities
12/12/2021.description: The Northern Territory records three more local COVID-19 cases overnight, including in a four-year-old boy, as a 72-hour mask mandate comes into place in Tennant Creek and five remote communities after positive wastewater results.
12/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

12/12/2021.headline: Who needs booster shots and when can I get one?
12/12/2021.description: From today, booster shots of Pfizer and Moderna are available for anyone who has been fully vaccinated for at least five months. Here's what you need to know about the latest changes.
12/12/2021.author: Melissa Maykin

12/12/2021.headline: Omicron variant among Newcastle nightclub crowd 'likely' as fourth COVID case confirmed
12/12/2021.description: An Omicron case has been confirmed in Newcastle, coinciding with a warning for a local nightclub attended by four "potentially infectious" COVID cases, one of whom is "likely" to have the variant.
12/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

12/12/2021.headline: Thousands again march in Australian cities against vaccine mandates, pandemic restrictions
12/12/2021.description: Thousands-strong crowds gather to protest, many holding signs and chanting slogans against vaccine rules.
12/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

12/12/2021.headline: Man charged with attempted murder after shooting incident in Adelaide
12/12/2021.description: A man has been charged with attempted murder after he allegedly shot at a man known to him at a house in Adelaide's east last night.
12/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

12/12/2021.headline: In this Moroccan mountain village, winter snow means months of isolation
12/12/2021.description: Morocco's Middle Atlas Mountains are usually known for their red-shaded soil. But in the winter, they give way to white snow, which brings with it closed roads and isolation.
12/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

12/12/2021.headline: Woe for Wanderers as Bulls claim ALM win
12/12/2021.description: Macarthur FC defeats Western Sydney 2-0, with Tomislav Uskok and Jake Hollman scoring to keep the Bulls' unbeaten record intact.
12/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

12/12/2021.headline: Businesses call for rethink of COVID-19 cluster naming as connection affects sales
12/12/2021.description: Parafield, Modbury, Thebarton and Norwood are no longer just Adelaide suburbs but the names of COVID-19 clusters, which local business owners say has a major impact on their foot traffic.
12/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

12/12/2021.headline: All smiles as the Melbourne Marathon returns after two years
12/12/2021.description: Milly Clark and Brett Robinson win the women's and men's full marathons respectively, as the race returns for the first time since 2019.
12/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

12/12/2021.headline: Up to 50,000 cars could enter Queensland tomorrow as state prepares for border reopening
12/12/2021.description: Queensland has recorded just one case of COVID-19, as the countdown begins for the much-anticipated border reopening.
12/12/2021.author: Nibir Khan

12/12/2021.headline: First NSW Omicron case in hospital among 10 new infections of the variant
12/12/2021.description: NSW Health reports a person is hospitalised after contracting the Omicron variant — the first since the new strain landed in Australia.
12/12/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

12/12/2021.headline: Deadly tornado tracks for more than 320km across US Midwest
12/12/2021.description: A monstrous tornado, carving a track that could rival the longest on record, rips through the middle of the US in a storm front killing dozens as it tears apart homes and buildings.
12/12/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

12/12/2021.headline: Dramatic night in Premier League as top teams all need late penalties to win
12/12/2021.description: There is no change in the order at the top of the Premier League as the big sides all win — but it takes a bit of luck and a lot of penalties to secure the points for Manchester City, Liverpool, Chelsea and Manchester United.
12/12/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

12/12/2021.headline: Health authorities confirm Omicron COVID variant is in SA
12/12/2021.description: Test results confirm two cases of COVID-19 recorded in South Australia are the Omicron variant.
12/12/2021.author: Rebecca Opie

12/12/2021.headline: Janice fears border reopening may see her rental chances disappear
12/12/2021.description: Experts are calling for more regulation of the short-stay industry, with fears Tasmania's border reopening could make the rental crisis even worse.
12/12/2021.author: Sean Wales

12/12/2021.headline: Gina Rinehart sells two Northern Territory cattle stations for more than $60m
12/12/2021.description: Two of Gina Rinehart's Northern Territory cattle properties sell for a combined total well in excess of $60 million.
12/12/2021.author: Daniel Fitzgerald

12/12/2021.headline: Unconscious bias is not corporate jargon — it's a reality for people like me
12/12/2021.description: Sometimes, a lack of sensitivity towards others can manifest into what is known as 'unconscious bias'. While you might have seen this phrase used as a label for a compulsory training module set by HR, it has real implications for people with disability.
12/12/2021.author: Daniel Fitzgerald

12/12/2021.headline: Are wearable fitness trackers worth the money?
12/12/2021.description: Wearable fitness trackers will be on many Christmas shopping lists this year,  but what does the latest research say about how effective they are?
12/12/2021.author: Daniel Fitzgerald

12/12/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: NSW-Queensland border reopens after five months
12/12/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Police are warning drivers to expect long delays on the New South Wales-Queensland border which reopened in the early hours of this morning.
12/12/2021.author: Daniel Fitzgerald

12/12/2021.headline: 'No-one should have to live next to this': Tip fire in Melbourne's west to burn until May 2022
12/12/2021.description: Residents near the Kealba Landfill are at breaking point as they endure the stench of a burning tip fire for a second year.
12/12/2021.author: Margaret Paul

12/12/2021.headline: Tesla charges ahead in Australian-first deal to provide battery-powered energy
12/12/2021.description: Elon Musk's company has its sights set on central Queensland for an energy generation project and will provide long-term revenue support.
12/12/2021.author: Jasmine Hines

12/12/2021.headline: Travelling to Queensland from interstate? Here's what you need to know
12/12/2021.description: Queensland has kept its borders shut to large chunks of Australia for many months, but that changes today, with the state opening up to travellers from domestic COVID-19 hotspots. Here are the rules around visiting.
12/12/2021.author: Dan Colasimone

12/12/2021.headline: Welcome back: Fortress Queensland ends as border thrown open to interstate arrivals
12/12/2021.description: Air and road routes to Queensland are now open to all interstate travellers who are double vaccinated against COVID-19, however, border checkpoints will remain in place and border passes will still be required.
12/12/2021.author: Allyson Horn

12/12/2021.headline: 'Can't be trusted in society': Janelle was gang raped at 16. She wants life-sentences for perpetrators
12/12/2021.description: Janelle O'Connor was physically assaulted, raped and ordered to dig her own grave. She believes some people are beyond redemption and is lobbying for law reform. WARNING: This story contains descriptions of sexual and physical violence that may cause distress.
12/12/2021.author: Emily Baker

12/12/2021.headline: ‘There's a whole community out there just waiting for you’: Ella’s advice to city teens
12/12/2021.description: The kindness of a regional town helped Ella breathe fresh air to her city community at a crucial time.
12/12/2021.author: Jacqueline Howard

12/12/2021.headline: Early offers to universities are on the rise, and it's not just students who are reaping benefits
12/12/2021.description: The relevance of end-of-year exams such as the HSC is in question, with new data showing a massive explosion in early offers from universities. While they were offered to help deal with disadvantage caused by lockdowns, they are so successful they will likely remain long term.
12/12/2021.author: Jacqueline Howard

12/12/2021.headline: After four years of 'serious allegations', VicForests has been referred to the anti-corruption watchdog
12/12/2021.description: The Victorian government-owned logging agency VicForests and its regulator have been referred to the state's anti-corruption watchdog after a string of allegations reported by the ABC since 2018.
12/12/2021.author: Michael Slezak

12/12/2021.headline: Father time: Pakistan's lonely clock collector
12/12/2021.description: The tick-tock of hundreds of antique clocks fills a small hall in the south-west Pakistan city of Quetta, where collector Gul Kakar swears he will spend all the time he has left caring for them.
12/12/2021.author: Michael Slezak

12/12/2021.headline: Sick of being treated 'like numbers and robots', these Amazon and Starbucks workers are taking on their bosses
12/12/2021.description: American workers who are fed up with long shifts, non-existent breaks, and near constant surveillance at work reached "a tipping point" during the pandemic. Now they want to take on Amazon and Starbucks.
12/12/2021.author: Michael Slezak

12/12/2021.headline: Review launched into who can call themselves a cosmetic surgeon
12/12/2021.description: State and federal governments launch a landmark review aimed at overhauling laws around who can call themselves a cosmetic surgeon, after a Four Corners investigation into the industry.
12/12/2021.author: Lauren Day

12/12/2021.headline: What does a year look like to you? If it's round and fuzzy, you may have time-space synaesthesia
12/12/2021.description: If the past year felt like a bloated mass of time that never seemed to end, you're not alone. But some people always visualise time as a 3D form — pandemic year or not.
12/12/2021.author: Belinda Smith

12/12/2021.headline: New Caledonia votes 'no' to independence for third time
12/12/2021.description: With all ballots counted, 96.49 per cent were against independence, while only 3.51 per cent were in favour, from a turn-out of 43.90 per cent, according to New Caledonia's high commission.
12/12/2021.author: Belinda Smith

12/12/2021.headline: Author of Interview with the Vampire, Anne Rice, dies aged 80
12/12/2021.description: Ms Rice, whose books sold more than 150 million copies, died due to complications from a stroke, her son Christopher Rice announced on Facebook and Twitter.
12/12/2021.author: Belinda Smith

12/12/2021.headline: Controversy reigns as Max Verstappen becomes first Dutchman to be F1 world champion
12/12/2021.description: A late safety car opens the way for Verstappen to win his first world title with a bold overtake on the last lap, denying Hamilton the chance to clinch a record eighth championship.
12/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

12/12/2021.headline: Israel Prime Minister Naftali Bennett announces historic visit to UAE as fears over Iran grow
12/12/2021.description: Mr Bennett is the first Israeli leader to visit the UAE while in office, and follows a visit by the UAE's national security adviser Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan to Tehran.
12/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

12/12/2021.headline: Mariners extend Sky Blues' winless ALM start
12/12/2021.description: Central Coast Mariners score a 2-0 victory at home over Sydney FC, who only has two draws to show from its opening four matches.
12/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

12/12/2021.headline: Victory come from behind to win Melbourne ALW derby, Reds pip Canberra United
12/12/2021.description: The Victory beat cross-town rivals Melbourne City 2-1, while Adelaide United triumph over Canberra United via the same scoreline after finding a winner in injury time.
12/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

12/12/2021.headline: Peña stuns Nunes in UFC 269 upset, Aussie Tuivasa posts fourth straight win
12/12/2021.description: Julianna Peña stops Brazilian legend Amanda Nunes by submission in the second round at UFC 269 in Las Vegas, while Australian heavyweight Tai Tuivasa adds another victory his growing tally.
12/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

12/12/2021.headline: Australia, US and Japan to fund undersea internet cable in Pacific to counter rising Chinese influence
12/12/2021.description: The governments of Australia, the US and Japan say the proposed cable will provide high quality and more reliable internet access to about 100,000 people.
12/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

13/12/2021.headline: The Loop: Why the urea shortage matters, WA's border rules to reopen, Miranda Tapsell's baby news and Peloton responds to that Mr Big scene
13/12/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
13/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

13/12/2021.headline: Children from school south of Adelaide told to quarantine until Christmas after assembly named as exposure site
13/12/2021.description: Children from a school south of Adelaide will be in quarantine until 12:01am on Christmas Day, after the event was identified as a close contact exposure site.
13/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

13/12/2021.headline: 'The hardest part ended up not being the rape, but the way the system responded': Damning report into sexual assault response in the ACT
13/12/2021.description: A damning report released by the ACT government paints a grim picture of the current systems in place to help survivors of sexual assault.
13/12/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

13/12/2021.headline: 'Tying up resources': Calls to scrap Queensland COVID-19 tests
13/12/2021.description: A NSW government MP wants PCR tests for travel into Queensland abolished after waiting times soared at testing clinics on the first day of eased border restrictions.
13/12/2021.author: Lauren Exton and Luisa Rubbo

13/12/2021.headline: Firebite is a TV series about Indigenous vampire hunters in outback Australia
13/12/2021.description: Acclaimed Indigenous filmmaker Warwick Thornton's latest work is a television series that re-imagines the colonisation of Australia.
13/12/2021.author: Angelique Donnellan

13/12/2021.headline: WA to finally open its border on February 5 as Premier Mark McGowan reveals vaccination milestone
13/12/2021.description: February 5 is the long-awaited date Western Australia will open its borders to the rest of the world, Premier Mark McGowan announces, as the state's vaccination rate reaches 80 per cent.
13/12/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

13/12/2021.headline: Spearfisher wins fight for his life against bull shark, 300m from shore
13/12/2021.description: Phillip Brown, 24, was airlifted to hospital after the attack, but not before a desperate and bloody race back to shore.
13/12/2021.author: Mark Rigby

13/12/2021.headline: Proud moments as SA year 12 students receive their results
13/12/2021.description: Eighteen-year-old Shamiama Shahid is one of more than 15,000 students to receive their ATAR score in the state.
13/12/2021.author: Rebecca Opie and Shamsiya Mohammadi

13/12/2021.headline: 'I just didn't care anymore': Victim of historical sex abuse tells court of its impact on her life
13/12/2021.description: A woman who was abused by an older man while she was in her early teens has told a court the perpetrator is "cruel" to continue to deny the offending.
13/12/2021.author: Gabriella Marchant

13/12/2021.headline: Perth mother killed two young daughters because she didn't want to leave them behind, court heard
13/12/2021.description: A Perth woman who killed her two young daughters before attempting to take her own life should not be held criminally responsible for the deaths because she was not of sound mind, a court has heard.
13/12/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

13/12/2021.headline: Weary shop owners clear up after yet another South Coast flood disaster since massive bushfires
13/12/2021.description: Flood clean-up on the NSW south coast has begun, with the Eurobodalla Shire Council declaring its 8th natural disaster event since the Black Summer Bushfires.
13/12/2021.author: Keira Proust and Simon Lauder

13/12/2021.headline: As Christmas deadline looms, opponents of COVID-19 vaccination mandate seek expedited court hearing in NT
13/12/2021.description: Three unvaccinated workers, who face the prospect of losing their jobs on December 25, seek urgent hearing to test the validity of the vaccination mandate. But the NT Chief Health Officer's lawyer says a matter of such significance should not be rushed.
13/12/2021.author: Jano Gibson

13/12/2021.headline: Drivers in one Sydney suburb copped $500,000 in speeding fines in the last year
13/12/2021.description: New data shows mobile speeding camera fines exploded across NSW last year after warning signs were removed by the state government.
13/12/2021.author: Kathleen Ferguson

13/12/2021.headline: Police search for attacker after man assaulted with brick in Adelaide
13/12/2021.description: A man is in a stable condition in hospital after being assaulted with a brick in Adelaide's CBD, police say.
13/12/2021.author: Kathleen Ferguson

13/12/2021.headline: Peloton's stocks plummeted after And Just Like That premiered. Now the company has responded
13/12/2021.description: Share prices in workout equipment company Peloton nose-dived after one of their products appeared in Sex and the City reboot And Just Like that. *WARNING: SPOILERS*
13/12/2021.author: Kathleen Ferguson

13/12/2021.headline: Why the southern US is prone to December tornadoes — and why they're more dangerous at night
13/12/2021.description: An outbreak of powerful tornadoes tore through six US states, taking lives and damaging homes — but why only in the south?
13/12/2021.author: Kathleen Ferguson

13/12/2021.headline: Jetstar flight from Cairns to Gold Coast, Brisbane restaurant identified as COVID exposure sites
13/12/2021.description: Numerous sites have emerged in recent days in Brisbane, the Gold and Sunshine coasts. See the full list.
13/12/2021.author: Kathleen Ferguson

13/12/2021.headline: Daylight execution of Sydney lawyer 'amateurish' and 'shambolic', court told
13/12/2021.description: Two men behind an "inept" plan to recover money from a Sydney solicitor prepare to be sentenced for their crimes almost three years after the 65-year-old's death.
13/12/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

13/12/2021.headline: 'We went car racing', but was it a fair fight for the Formula 1 drivers' championship?
13/12/2021.description: An Australian played a critical part in one of Formula 1's most controversial championship-deciding races in history, and he probably wishes he didn't have to.
13/12/2021.author: Michael Janda

13/12/2021.headline: 'I don't want this to happen to anybody else's family': Mother says son died waiting for an ambulance
13/12/2021.description: Michelle Viney says her 26-year-old son Jayden died while waiting nearly half an hour for an ambulance , but the service says paramedics attended to the case within a targeted time frame.
13/12/2021.author: Leah MacLennan

13/12/2021.headline: Katherine named 'ground zero' for COVID in the NT on day of record case numbers
13/12/2021.description: As the NT's current outbreak increases by 16 cases, the NT's peak Aboriginal health body calls on the NT government to drastically increase its health respon
13/12/2021.author: Steve Vivian

13/12/2021.headline: COVID tests for Newcastle Knights amid possible links to nightclub outbreak
13/12/2021.description: The rugby league team is getting swabbed as authorities, fearful of the spread of the Omicron variant, warn that the holiday period is likely to be impacted.
13/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama and Bindi Bryce

13/12/2021.headline: Man's body found at Fish Hole swimming spot in NT after two-day search
13/12/2021.description: A man has drowned in a swimming hole west of Alice Springs, NT Police says, with his body being recovered more than two days after he vanished.
13/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama and Bindi Bryce

13/12/2021.headline: Epidemiologist sounds warning as WA reopening date announced
13/12/2021.description: A West Australian epidemiologist warns Mark McGowan to reconsider opening the state's border early next year as the Omicron COVID-19 variant continues to spark concern.
13/12/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

13/12/2021.headline: Emerging golfing sensation one of three Australians to secure 2022 LPGA Tour card
13/12/2021.description: Steph Kyriacou, 21, finished the LPGA Q-Series tied for 16th at 11 under, adding a 2022 Tour card to her growing list of career highlights.
13/12/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

13/12/2021.headline: 'The placenta is a fascinating organ': Jane Dahlstrom researches placentas to give families answers following childbirth
13/12/2021.description: A placenta brought two clinician-researches together at Canberra Hospital 15 years ago. Now the pair are encouraging fellow doctors and nurses to take up research opportunities in the field. Warning: This story contains medical images.
13/12/2021.author: Rosie King

13/12/2021.headline: Australia's rivals used COVID border closures to gain ground on key export
13/12/2021.description: International students are heading to Canada, the UK and the US in record numbers despite the pandemic, but Australia and New Zealand continue to experience a dramatic drop in new international students, write Peter Hurley and Melinda Hildebrandt.
13/12/2021.author: Rosie King

13/12/2021.headline: It's legal to buy over-the-counter cannabis in Australia — so why doesn't my chemist sell it?
13/12/2021.description: The sale of low-dose cannabidiol preparations over the counter at Australian pharmacies has been allowed since early this year. But you won't find any at your local chemist and there is a reason for that
13/12/2021.author: Rosie King

13/12/2021.headline: Water restrictions come into force in Hobart today. Here's what you need to know
13/12/2021.description: Despite having the fourth wettest spring on record, you might need to rethink how you keep your garden looking green this summer. Here's what you can and can't do.
13/12/2021.author: Rebecca Hewett

13/12/2021.headline: Hot housing market helps South Australia's books, but not enough to stop an increase in budget deficit
