13/12/2021.description: Extra revenue from property transfers and payroll tax collections haven't been enough to prevent an increase in South Australia's expected budget deficit this financial year.
13/12/2021.author: Rory McClaren

13/12/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: Rail strike could cause overcrowded Sydney carriages, commuters warned
13/12/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: The city's rail network faces another full day of disruption, with train drivers striking again.
13/12/2021.author: Rory McClaren

13/12/2021.headline: Excitement, fear and uncertainty: How Tasmanians are feeling about borders reopening
13/12/2021.description: On the eve of Tasmania's borders reopening to fully vaccinated travellers, emotions are running high. Five locals share what the state's long-awaited reopening means to them.
13/12/2021.author: Selina Ross

13/12/2021.headline: 'I just cannot watch football anymore': the ugly dilemma that fans face when sportspeople behave badly
13/12/2021.description: Deciding what to do when your favourite sportsperson behaves badly might seem simple – stop supporting them. But what to do when your identity is tied to the team you love?
13/12/2021.author: Anna Kelsey-Sugg and Amanda Smith

13/12/2021.headline: 'She said no, do them again': Trinity trained so hard at gymnastics her vertebra broke
13/12/2021.description: Trinity de Lance was hurting and in tears at gymnastics, but says she was told to keep training. She and her mother Stieve, along with other young gymnasts, say their complaints about the sport have fallen on deaf ears.
13/12/2021.author: David Mark

13/12/2021.headline: ‘If people are going to stare, I may as well be my true self’: How a wheelchair helped 18-year-old Mac embrace his identity
13/12/2021.description: When he was younger, all Mac wanted was to blend into the crowd. But when disability forced him into the spotlight, the teenager learned to embrace his true self.
13/12/2021.author: Jacqueline Howard

13/12/2021.headline: Regan has barely seen her fiance for two years. They'll finally be reunited when WA's border reopens
13/12/2021.description: Regan has hardly seen her fiance since taking a job in Melbourne at the start of the pandemic. Now they will finally be reunited when WA's hard border falls on February 5.
13/12/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine, Eliza Laschon, Keane Bourke, Hannah Barry, and Lucy Martin

13/12/2021.headline: Almost 100pc of New Caledonians who voted rejected independence from France — but here's what the numbers aren't telling you
13/12/2021.description: The territory now faces an uncertain future, as pro-independence groups refuse to discuss a future under France's flag.
13/12/2021.author: Prianka Srinivasan

13/12/2021.headline: Teenager detonates bomb at Moscow school, injuring 12
13/12/2021.description: A graduate of an Orthodox School near Moscow detonates a homemade bomb inside the school injuring at least 12 people.
13/12/2021.author: Prianka Srinivasan

13/12/2021.headline: Nicole Kidman, Sarah Snook land Golden Globe nominations
13/12/2021.description: Aussie actors Nicole Kidman and Sarah Snook have picked up Golden Globe nominations, with Netflix movies scoring a leading 17 nods.
13/12/2021.author: Prianka Srinivasan

13/12/2021.headline: Dream clash between Messi and Ronaldo void as UEFA bungles Champions League draw
13/12/2021.description: The stage was set for another battle between Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo until UEFA had to admit they bungled the draw for the tournament's round of 16.
13/12/2021.author: Prianka Srinivasan

13/12/2021.headline: Hong Kong tycoon Jimmy Lai sentenced to 13 months jail for Tiananmen vigil
13/12/2021.description: Hong Kong business tycoon Jimmy Lai is sentenced to 13 months prison but in a powerful letter read by his lawyer says he will happily accept the punishment to commemorate those who died at Tiananmen Square.
13/12/2021.author: Prianka Srinivasan

13/12/2021.headline: Moderna to be first mRNA vaccine made in Australia
13/12/2021.description: The Moderna mRNA vaccine could be manufactured in Australia by the middle of the decade, with plans being put together for a new plant in Victoria capable of producing up to 100 million shots a year.
13/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

13/12/2021.headline: Safety first, confusion second, as Tasmania readies to open up to the world
13/12/2021.description: Tasmania's borders will open to all Australian states and territories this week, but, with the risks posed by the Omicron variant, changes are being made to the rules about testing and quarantine for some travellers.
13/12/2021.author: Loretta Lohberger

13/12/2021.headline: How life will change when WA reconnects with the world on February 5
13/12/2021.description: Things will change dramatically in Western Australia when the "island within an island" finally lowers the drawbridge to interstate and overseas travellers. Here's everything you need to know about the COVID rules and restrictions being introduced.
13/12/2021.author: Jacob Kagi

13/12/2021.headline: Alleged murder victim's injuries were some of the worst paramedics had seen, court hears
13/12/2021.description: An alleged domestic violence murder victim's head injuries were "nothing like" emergency services had ever seen before, a court hears.
13/12/2021.author: Gabriella Marchant

13/12/2021.headline: Judge says he 'agonised' over sentence for teenager who stabbed Thomas Tran to death
13/12/2021.description: Lindim Aliti is sentenced to more than six years in prison for fatally stabbing Thomas Tran through the heart after a violent clash between two groups of young men in Melbourne's outer south-east.
13/12/2021.author: Elise Kinsella

13/12/2021.headline: Vladimir Putin says he moonlighted as a taxi driver in the 1990s
13/12/2021.description: The Russian President laments the collapse of the Soviet Union as the demise of "historical Russia", saying the economic crisis that followed was so bad he was forced to work as a taxi driver.
13/12/2021.author: Elise Kinsella

13/12/2021.headline: 'Her life was ended for her': Inquest into disappearance of mother of six begins
13/12/2021.description: A coronial inquest into the disappearance and likely death of Devonport mother Darlene Geertsema, who was last seen in 1978, begins in Launceston.
13/12/2021.author: April McLennan

13/12/2021.headline: 'A natural moat': Taiwan's defence ministry outlines difficulties if China decides to invade
13/12/2021.description: Taiwan's Defence Ministry outlines the difficulties China would face mounting a full invasion of the island, including problems landing and supplying troops.
13/12/2021.author: April McLennan

14/12/2021.headline: 'Moderate' La Niña's short stay won't threaten big wets of '11 and '74, says BOM
14/12/2021.description: The east coast is sodden, towns have gone under and summer has only just started. But it will take a lot to beat the  wettest summers.
14/12/2021.author: Kate Doyle

14/12/2021.headline: Is Moon Jae-in's visit more about geopolitics or commerce?
14/12/2021.description: Foreign policy experts are divided on whether the South Korean President's trip to Australia is a sign of "quiet alignment" with Australia and the US, or simply a move to secure Australian resources.
14/12/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

14/12/2021.headline: Search for William Tyrrell's remains to end this week
14/12/2021.description: The "painstaking" four-week search for William Tyrrell's remains will end "in coming days", police say. The efforts were sparked by "new information", but have so far turned up nothing of note.
14/12/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

14/12/2021.headline: Former NRL player Brett Finch charged over alleged child abuse material offences
14/12/2021.description: The ex-Parramatta and Sydney Roosters player is on bail charged with five offences after being arrested in southern Sydney this morning.
14/12/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

14/12/2021.headline: This town had been divided by lines on a map, but backlash will see restrictions eased
14/12/2021.description: The Northern Territory government flags that it will soon amend controversial border entry requirements which ban rural Katherine residents from returning home if they travel interstate.
14/12/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

14/12/2021.headline: Names, bank account details, pays, personal information of nearly 80,000 public sector workers accessed in cyber attack
14/12/2021.description: The South Australian Government is rushing to "address all potential areas of exposure" after confirming 80,000 public sector workers' details had been accessed by hackers.
14/12/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

14/12/2021.headline: Hours before she died, this mum was 'calm in the fact' her killer 'need not be a part' of her life
14/12/2021.description: Trefor Kingdon, 65, has pleaded guilty to stabbing his childhood sweetheart Mandy Melzer-Head to death at their remote rural home. On the night she died, the court heard, she texted him to say their relationship was over.
14/12/2021.author: Riordan Davis

14/12/2021.headline: Two Australian veterans receive prestigious US Silver Star award 50 years after being nominated
14/12/2021.description: Two Australian veterans are awarded the third-highest military combat decoration from the United States for their service to the US during the Vietnam War.
14/12/2021.author: Charlotte Gore

14/12/2021.headline: Three truck drivers test positive for COVID-19 after spending time in Western Australia
14/12/2021.description: The McGowan government has published a list of exposure sites as three fully vaccinated truck drivers from South Australia test positive for COVID-19 after leaving Western Australia.
14/12/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

14/12/2021.headline: US military accused of 'absolving itself of accountability' in Kabul strike as troops avoid discipline
14/12/2021.description: US troops will not be disciplined for launching a drone strike that killed 10 civilians, including seven children, in Kabul in August.
14/12/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

14/12/2021.headline: The Loop: TGA issues (another) ivermectin warning, COVID testing gap in remote Australia, Hottest 100 voting open now
14/12/2021.description: Short on time? Catch up on today's news with this quick little wrap.
14/12/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

14/12/2021.headline: What will travelling out of WA look like after the border comes down?
14/12/2021.description: What you need to know about travelling out of WA when the hard border finally falls on February 5, from testing to vaccination to insurance.
14/12/2021.author: Lucy Martin

14/12/2021.headline: Experts attest to Madeley mum's mental impairment when she killed young daughters
14/12/2021.description: Both the defence and the prosecution in Perth mother Milka Djurasovic's trial agree she should not be found guilty of murdering her young girls Tiana and Mia, because she was not of sound mind at the time.
14/12/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

14/12/2021.headline: Carl Williams' prison killer Matthew Johnson seeks to overturn murder conviction
14/12/2021.description: The man jailed for life in 2011 for killing underworld figure Carl Williams in a Victorian prison has filed an appeal against his murder conviction.
14/12/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

14/12/2021.headline: Basketball Australia called out for 'clear racial discrimination'
14/12/2021.description: An apologetic Basketball Australia has been caught out by an outdated rule that has been branded as "clear racial discrimination" by Melbourne Boomer Tiffany Mitchell.
14/12/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

14/12/2021.headline: Travelling 600km for a COVID test 'completely unviable', fed-up mum says
14/12/2021.description: Outback residents say it's absurd that COVID testing is not available anywhere near the SA-NT border, particularly amid a scare at the nearby APY Lands.
14/12/2021.author: Georgia Roberts and Shari Hams

14/12/2021.headline: 'Today is a magnificent day': Construction begins on Aboriginal Arts and Cultures Centre Tarrkarri
14/12/2021.description: Construction has started on Adelaide's new Aboriginal Arts and Cultures Centre, which will be officially named Tarrkarri, and is expected to attract around 700,000 visitors to South Australia each year when it opens in 2025.
14/12/2021.author: Alina Eacott

14/12/2021.headline: It's not Squid Game but 10 people are pitted against each other for cash … and they're teachers
14/12/2021.description: Footage of a "Dash for Cash" promotion, held during a hockey game in the US state of South Dakota, has prompted online outrage and sparked a national debate about school funding.
14/12/2021.author: Alina Eacott

14/12/2021.headline: Lockdowns favoured professionals and managers, while low-income casuals hit hardest
14/12/2021.description: With New South Wales, Victoria and the Australian Capital Territory in lockdown during August, new figures show nearly half the nation literally took their work home with them.
14/12/2021.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

14/12/2021.headline: 'Like a turducken of bin fires': Best political cartoons of 2021 highlight the absurdities of the year that was
14/12/2021.description: In a year where statistical models and predictions were at the forefront of all Australians minds, the Behind the Lines exhibition has set out to showcase all the other — unexpected — things that 2021 had to offer.
14/12/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

14/12/2021.headline: Eddie Obeid's bid to get out of jail in time for Christmas
14/12/2021.description: Lawyers for Eddie Obeid and Ian Macdonald say the former NSW Labor ministers should be released on home detention ahead of an appeal against their conspiracy convictions.
14/12/2021.author: Jamelle Wells

14/12/2021.headline: Two healthcare workers who visited aged care homes in Adelaide test positive to COVID-19
14/12/2021.description: Two healthcare workers who provided care at a number of residential aged care facilities in Adelaide test positive to COVID-19. Authorities are contacting impacted sites.
14/12/2021.author: Jamelle Wells

14/12/2021.headline: NBL ramps up investigation into ugly Melbourne derby melee
14/12/2021.description: The fallout from Sunday's brawl between Melbourne United and South East Melbourne Phoenix continues, with five players and a coach facing the scrutiny of the NBL's game review panel.
14/12/2021.author: Jamelle Wells

14/12/2021.headline: TGA issues warning about counterfeit ivermectin
14/12/2021.description: The national medical regulator warns people not to try and import ivermectin products, while also repeating warnings against using it to prevent or treat COVID-19.
14/12/2021.author: Jamelle Wells

14/12/2021.headline: 'It was a really humiliating experience': Discarded e-scooters a danger for vision impaired
14/12/2021.description: Brendan Donohue is blind and worried about stepping outside his front door after recently tripping over an e-scooter abandoned on a Brisbane footpath. A disability advocate says scooters should only be left in designated docking stations.
14/12/2021.author: Allyson Horn

14/12/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: Passenger tests positive on Newcastle to Brisbane flight
14/12/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Queensland Health identified Virgin flight VA1105 from Newcastle, which landed in Brisbane about 12:03pm on Monday, as an exposure site after a passenger tested positive.
14/12/2021.author: Allyson Horn

14/12/2021.headline: Canegrowers win legal battle against India over sugar subsidies
14/12/2021.description: After three years, the World Trade Organisation has finally reached a ruling on Australia's complaint against India's sugar subsidies.
14/12/2021.author: Allyson Horn

14/12/2021.headline: 'Sense of urgency' as COVID-19 outbreaks loom for Indigenous communities
14/12/2021.description: Indigenous COVID vaccination rates continue to trail behind other parts of the Queensland community, and health experts say the race is now on to prepare for outbreaks following the easing of border rules this week.
14/12/2021.author: Owen Jacques and Julia André

14/12/2021.headline: Omicron will take over London in a matter of hours. Is this a warning for the world?
14/12/2021.description: Doctors warn the strain is so transmissible it will become the dominant variant not just in the UK, but the world, very quickly, and modelling suggests there could be a million cases of Omicron in Britain by the end of the year.
14/12/2021.author: Isabella Higgins

14/12/2021.headline: Tasmania's latest COVID-19 rules and restrictions — everything you need to know
14/12/2021.description: The Apple Isle is open to travellers again, so what are the rules on masks? What is the deal with checking-in? So many questions. We have all the answers here.
14/12/2021.author: James Dunlevie

14/12/2021.headline: 'I think I'm done': How Adam Gilchrist's famous Perth century renewed his love of the game
14/12/2021.description: It has gone down as one of the greatest innings in Ashes history, but Adam Gilchrist has revealed just how close he was to pulling the pin on his career before his famous Perth ton in 2006.
14/12/2021.author: Tom Wildie

14/12/2021.headline: Tasmania's reopening was dependent on its COVID-19 vaccination rate. Here's where it's at
14/12/2021.description: Tasmania vowed to keep its border closed until it was confident every eligible resident had been offered the chance to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Now it's open again, how does its vaccination efforts compare to the rest of the country?
14/12/2021.author: Kate Ainsworth

14/12/2021.headline: International students return to Australia warning of a reputation tarnished abroad
14/12/2021.description: International students and skilled migrants can once again enter Australia without an exemption as the country's tough border policies soften slightly.
14/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

14/12/2021.headline: 'Inclusivity is about proving opportunities': Why we want you to play wheelchair basketball
14/12/2021.description: Providing a sport for people with and without a disability to play together is the goal of many school and club sporting environments, but rarely it is considered that to do this. We should start with the inclusion of those with physical impairments first.
14/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

14/12/2021.headline: Finished Succession? Try these other shows from the same writers
14/12/2021.description: With Succession's third season coming to an exhilarating close, you'd be forgiven for being at a loss on what to watch next. Aside from reliving the drama all over again, check out these other titles from Succession's writers.
14/12/2021.author: Jessica Riga

14/12/2021.headline: Ever heard of neodymium? Chances are it's in the car you drive
14/12/2021.description: Critical minerals are essential to the modern world and, while Australia is rich in them, China controls more than 90 per cent of their processing, prompting the developed world to look for alternatives.
14/12/2021.author: Andrew Greene

14/12/2021.headline: Australian AdBlue manufacturer charters planes ready to fly in emergency urea as diesel additive crisis continues
14/12/2021.description: Australia's biggest local producer of AdBlue races to secure more urea supply or even formulated AdBlue from overseas as the country grapples with a global shortage of a key raw material.
14/12/2021.author: Samuel Yang

14/12/2021.headline: 'Our deepest regret': Major disability service provider apologises for violence, abuse in group homes
14/12/2021.description: One of Australia's biggest disability service providers apologises for incidents of violence, abuse and neglect in two of its group homes, telling a royal commission they "could have done more" to help residents.
14/12/2021.author: Nas Campanella and Celina Edmonds

14/12/2021.headline: It's 'here they come, ready or not' for Tasmania as border opens
14/12/2021.description: After almost two years of living the hermit life, Tasmania is open again to visitors and returning locals, but whether residents of the island state are ready or not for COVID-19 is another matter entirely.
14/12/2021.author: Alexandra Humphries

14/12/2021.headline: NSW health report card reveals true impact of the COVID Delta outbreak
14/12/2021.description: The latest NSW health report card finds the ambulance service and emergency departments hit record performance lows at the height of the Delta outbreak, despite the government claiming the system was coping well under the pressure of the pandemic.
14/12/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

14/12/2021.headline: 'Spreading like wildfire': Nightclub COVID cluster's six days of turbocharged infections
14/12/2021.description: It's taken just six days for the Newcastle nightclub COVID-19 cluster to surpass last year's northern beaches outbreak. This is why it's spreading so quickly.
14/12/2021.author: Catherine Hanrahan

14/12/2021.headline: NSW's unvaccinated 'freedom day' has arrived — these are the COVID-19 rules changing today
14/12/2021.description: A raft of COVID-19 restrictions are being eased in NSW today, and, for the first time since June, unvaccinated people are being given significant freedoms too.
14/12/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen and Catherine Hanrahan

14/12/2021.headline: Australia's connections to British slavery have long been buried. It's time to update the history books
14/12/2021.description: Many Australians are unaware that some prominent early settlers had links to British slavery. Telling these stories provides a better collective sense of the past.
14/12/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen and Catherine Hanrahan

14/12/2021.headline: Stuck in mud, four giant 'thunder birds' died. Some 50,000 years later, their bones tell a painful story
14/12/2021.description: Well-preserved fossils show some individuals in a population of Australia's "thunder birds" were suffering a painful bone disease when they died. But what was the real cause of their eventual extinction?
14/12/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

14/12/2021.headline: Meet Lock: The result of kitten breeding season
14/12/2021.description: A call from a vet clinic led to Nerida taking in three small kittens found in park bushes. There was no sign of mum anywhere and had heard crying for a number of days. The kittens were very skinny, anaemic, and weighed only 200-250 grams.
14/12/2021.author: Emma Myers

14/12/2021.headline: Around 40 people killed in Haiti fuel truck blast as the country weathers economic and political crises
14/12/2021.description: Dozens more people were injured as the truck filled with gasoline exploded in the latest disaster to hit a country whose troubles deepened greatly this year.
14/12/2021.author: Emma Myers

14/12/2021.headline: No more hotel quarantine for arrivals from eight southern African countries into NSW
14/12/2021.description: By scrapping the rules previously affecting arrivals from eight countries of concern over the Omicron COVID-19 variant this morning, NSW Health is bringing all international travellers under the same requirements.
14/12/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

14/12/2021.headline: Nine-year-old killed in US storms, as death toll expected to rise
14/12/2021.description: Primary school student Annistyn Rackley is one of 88 people confirmed dead after severe storms and tornadoes wreaked havoc across the United States, but authorities are expecting the death toll to rise as recovery workers search through debris across five states.
14/12/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

15/12/2021.headline: Ideal weather conditions see locusts become a problem for the first time in a decade
15/12/2021.description: Hundreds of thousands of locusts in multiple swarms are laying eggs across NSW's west, Murray Local Land Services says.
15/12/2021.author: Shannon Corvo and Isadora Bogle

15/12/2021.headline: Grieving relatives left furious after St Basil's managers refuse to speak at inquest into deadly outbreak
15/12/2021.description: Managers of St Basil's aged care home at the centre of Australia's deadliest COVID-19 outbreak refuse to give evidence during an inquest into the tragedy.
15/12/2021.author: Kristian Silva

15/12/2021.headline: Judge rejects Trump bid to stop House committee from seeing his tax returns
15/12/2021.description: A United States judge says former president Donald Trump was "wrong on the law" in seeking to block the House Ways and Means Committee from obtaining his tax returns.
15/12/2021.author: Kristian Silva

15/12/2021.headline: The Loop: More COVID restriction changes, William Tyrrell search ends, News Breakfast reporter's COVID recovery
15/12/2021.description: Short on time? Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
15/12/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

15/12/2021.headline: Energy Australia charged over worker's power station death
15/12/2021.description: WorkSafe has charged Energy Australia with three breaches of the Occupational Health and Safety Act over the 2018 death of Graeme Edwards, who was fatally burnt while working at Yallourn Power Station.
15/12/2021.author: Emma Field

15/12/2021.headline: Alex Braes inquest told the teen's ability to cope with pain from infected toenail made it hard to assess him
15/12/2021.description: The inquest into the death of the Broken Hill teenager Alex Braes, who was turned away from hospital three times before he died, has heard he was conscious and speaking to staff and was "compensating for the sepsis until he couldn't".
15/12/2021.author: Bill Ormonde and Callum Marshall

15/12/2021.headline: China critic forms new political party with young, diverse candidates ahead of federal election
15/12/2021.description: Five people, mostly in their twenties, are part of the "same political movement" and hope to run in the 2022 federal election under the banner of a new political party.
15/12/2021.author: Sally Brooks and Dong Xing

15/12/2021.headline: This could be the first place in Australia where the government legally has to provide tampons
15/12/2021.description: Sanitary products would be accessible across the ACT to anyone who needs them under a new proposal to end period poverty in the territory.
15/12/2021.author: Tahlia Roy

15/12/2021.headline: TGA blocks bid to have MDMA, magic mushrooms as mental health treatments
15/12/2021.description: Australia's medicines regulator rejects call to legalise psychedelic drugs for use in mental health settings, saying changing the rules could lead to the drugs being misused.
15/12/2021.author: Claudia Long

15/12/2021.headline: WA to tighten border with NSW as super-spreader events fuel 'very concerning' rise in COVID cases
15/12/2021.description: On Saturday, Western Australia will reclassify NSW as an 'extreme risk' state, where 25,000 cases of COVID-19 a day is expected by the end of January.
15/12/2021.author: James Carmody

15/12/2021.headline: Patty Mills stars in Brooklyn Nets' overtime win against Toronto Raptors
15/12/2021.description: Called up to start in a depleted Nets line-up, Mills scores a season-high 30 points in a thrilling 131-129 victory over the Raptors in New York.
15/12/2021.author: James Carmody

15/12/2021.headline: Days out from NT's borders reopening, COVID-19 rules change again. Here's what's happening
15/12/2021.description: Can interstate travellers visit Kakadu National Park? Can essential workers return to work in a remote community after visiting family in Queensland? We answer your questions.
15/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

15/12/2021.headline: Easing COVID mask restrictions at odds with NSW Health advice as infections surge
15/12/2021.description: Publicly, it's been a united front for almost two years: NSW's top medico Kerry Chant standing beside a premier, who has proclaimed whatever COVID-19 decision they were making was "based on the health advice". Now, there's been a departure from that script.
15/12/2021.author: Kamin Gock

15/12/2021.headline: 'Simply eating dinner felt like an intense workout': Reporter Charles Brice spent two weeks in hospital with COVID-19
15/12/2021.description: ABC News Breakfast reporter Charles Brice tested positive to COVID-19 and spent two weeks in hospital recovering. Here's what he discovered along the way.
15/12/2021.author: Charles Brice

15/12/2021.headline: Official confirms fireball from overturned petrol tanker kills 75 in Haiti
15/12/2021.description: At least 75 people have died after a petrol tanker overturned and exploded in northern Haiti, unleashing a fireball that swept through homes and businesses.
15/12/2021.author: Charles Brice

15/12/2021.headline: Horticulturists in hot water, regulator finds major breaches to water laws across the state
15/12/2021.description: The New South Wales water regulator takes more than 150 enforcement actions against property owners across the state for a range of breaches to water laws.
15/12/2021.author: Michael Condon and Keely Johnson

15/12/2021.headline: NBL hands down sanctions from Melbourne derby melee
15/12/2021.description: Five players and a coach are sanctioned after the ugly scuffle that broke out in Sunday's game between Melbourne United and South East Melbourne Phoenix.
15/12/2021.author: Michael Condon and Keely Johnson

15/12/2021.headline: Bid to hold urgent court hearing challenging NT's vaccination mandate rejected
15/12/2021.description: Opponents of the Northern Territory's COVID-19 vaccination mandate say "thousands" of people could lose their jobs on Christmas Day after the Supreme Court rejected their bid to hold an expedited hearing challenging the rule.
15/12/2021.author: Jano Gibson

15/12/2021.headline: Coroner in tears at loss of 'beautiful boy' Bailey Mackander as she closes death-in-custody inquest
15/12/2021.description: An emotional deputy State Coroner criticises the young detainee's guards, apologises to his parents and delivers recommendations she says she has no confidence will make any difference.
15/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

15/12/2021.headline: Mass walkout by SA prison guards who don't want to eat food prepared by inmates
15/12/2021.description: A mass walk-out of prison guards over food, pay and conditions leaves a skeleton crew at one of South Australia’s largest prisons.
15/12/2021.author: Leon Georgiou and Sandra Morello

15/12/2021.headline: Changes to Victoria's COVID-19 rules are about to come into effect. Here's what you need to know
15/12/2021.description: Omicron is looming, but some rules about mask-wearing and showing your vaccination status will be relaxed at 11:59pm tonight. In the meantime, authorities say, they are carefully monitoring the new variant.
15/12/2021.author: Sian Johnson

15/12/2021.headline: Citrus foam served in lips and a teaspoon of crab: 'Uniquely bad' restaurant saga takes a new turn
15/12/2021.description: It started with a meal out, and ended with a viral review and a hand-drawn picture of a horse (a tale as old as time, right?).
15/12/2021.author: Bridget Judd

15/12/2021.headline: Injured Telstra linesmen told they must take job against doctors' orders
15/12/2021.description: A group of injured Telstra service technicians claim they are being forced to take unsuitable jobs or resign. Their lawyer is calling for them to be given appropriate work or be medically retired.
15/12/2021.author: Matilda Marozzi

15/12/2021.headline: Remote community residents test positive for COVID-19 at Royal Darwin Hospital as NT outbreak spreads
15/12/2021.description: The Northern Territory has recorded four new COVID-19 cases linked to the current outbreak, including two Timber Creek residents who tested positive at Royal Darwin Hospital.
15/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

15/12/2021.headline: Hunter COVID cases double after superspreader event, majority tipped to be Omicron
15/12/2021.description: NSW Health says more than a third of the 650 people who checked into the Argyle House nightclub last week have now tested positive.
15/12/2021.author: Carly Cook

15/12/2021.headline: Paedophile who abused own family for 29 years avoids four possible life sentences
15/12/2021.description: A Hunter Valley man who pleaded guilty to sexually abusing his sister, daughter, nieces and two other children will not be eligible for parole until he is 71.
15/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

15/12/2021.headline: Denmark's Princess Mary tests positive to COVID-19
15/12/2021.description: The Australian-born royal is isolating in a wing of the Amalienborg Palace in the heart of Copenhagen, the royal court says in a statement.
15/12/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

15/12/2021.headline: 'Very contagious' Omicron strain predicted to peak in Queensland within weeks, not months
15/12/2021.description: The Omicron variant of COVID-19 is likely to be the most dominant strain circulating in Queensland within a month, a leading infectious diseases researcher says.
15/12/2021.author: Nibir Khan

15/12/2021.headline: These three little wise men are finally going home, just in time for Christmas
15/12/2021.description: Josephine Nunn has delivered hundreds of babies as a rural doctor, but nothing could have prepared her for the experience of having her own triplet baby boys.
15/12/2021.author: Nibir Khan

15/12/2021.headline: Former AFP officer acquitted of acts of indecency due to inconsistent evidence
15/12/2021.description: A former Australian Federal Police officer charged with an act of indecency without consent is acquitted in the ACT Magistrates Court due to inconsistencies in the evidence provided by witnesses about events prior to the alleged act.
15/12/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

15/12/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: More Omicron COVID-19 exposure sites in Newcastle
15/12/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Another pub in the Newcastle area is added to the list of sites exposed to COVID-19 and possibly the Omicron variant.
15/12/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

15/12/2021.headline: We calculated the impact of 'long COVID' as Australia opens up. Even without Omicron, we're worried
15/12/2021.description: Long COVID will increasingly drive the burden of COVID illness, even as death rates decline. We looked at how that will affect Australia as we open up, write Martin Hensher and Mary Rose Angeles.
15/12/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

15/12/2021.headline: Meet Hitler's beetle — the species going extinct because of its name
15/12/2021.description: One of Australia's largest groups of flower species is named after a wealthy British slave-trader. And Nazi memorabilia collectors have almost sent "Hitler's beetle" extinct. Is it time for a change, asks Kevin Thiele.
15/12/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

15/12/2021.headline: These students love a game of Uno, but what's happening to older games like euchre?
15/12/2021.description: Card games can be a fun way for people of all ages to spend time with others, but old-fashioned games like euchre don't attract players like they used to.
15/12/2021.author: Loretta Lohberger

15/12/2021.headline: Launceston airport sues agency over lack of PFAS plan
15/12/2021.description: Potentially toxic firefighting chemicals were found in fish pulled from a river near Launceston Airport two years ago. Now the airport is taking legal action to make the government do something about it.
15/12/2021.author: Ellen Coulter

15/12/2021.headline: Modelling predicting 25,000 COVID cases a day by January in NSW was 'very preliminary'
15/12/2021.description: The author of the COVID modelling report used by the NSW Health Minister to urge the community to stay vigilant ahead of a surge in cases backs his findings but says they were very preliminary.
15/12/2021.author: Amy Greenbank

15/12/2021.headline: Ashley is usually the only female carpenter on site — a new $57m program aims to change that
15/12/2021.description: Women tradies, who make up about 2 per cent of workers on construction sites in NSW, welcome an injection of more than $50 million to boost numbers, saying it's a step towards making women on sites the norm.
15/12/2021.author: Maryanne Taouk

15/12/2021.headline: How a cocaine kingpin infiltrated the horseracing industry, and how it could happen again
15/12/2021.description: An ABC investigation reveals how weak regulation allowed cocaine kingpin Damion Flower to help bankroll Australia's richest horse race, even though his horse business was running at a loss.
15/12/2021.author: Dylan Welch and Sean Rubinsztein-Dunlop

15/12/2021.headline: Federal Labor calls for 'failed app' to be ditched after finding just two close contacts in six months
15/12/2021.description: From mid-May to mid-November, when there were major outbreaks and lockdowns across New South Wales and Victoria, just 13 people consented to their data being used for contact tracing.
15/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

15/12/2021.headline: One question everyone asks at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial may never be answered
15/12/2021.description: Ghislaine Maxwell’s trial has given the world a glimpse of her deeply weird and luxurious life with Jeffrey Epstein, but the mystery at the core of this saga may never be solved.
15/12/2021.author: Barbara Miller

15/12/2021.headline: Eating a lobster this Christmas? It may once have had feelings
15/12/2021.description: The UK has recognised decapods and cephalopods as 'sentient beings,' with animal rights advocates saying Australia should follow suit.
15/12/2021.author: Nick Baker

15/12/2021.headline: 'Staggering': UK braces for more COVID-19 cases as it hits new daily record
15/12/2021.description: More than 78,000 new daily cases in the UK are recorded as the head of the UK Health Security Agency warns there could be a "staggering" amount of new COVID-19 cases in the country over the next few days
15/12/2021.author: Jack Hawke

15/12/2021.headline: Derek Chauvin pleads guilty to violating George Floyd's civil rights during arrest
15/12/2021.description: The former Minneapolis police officer enters a federal court plea which will likely extend his period in prison beyond 25 years.
15/12/2021.author: Jack Hawke

15/12/2021.headline: Sir Lewis Hamilton receives his knighthood days after dramatic F1 finale
15/12/2021.description: Just days after coming agonisingly short of winning his eighth championship in the highly controversial Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, Sir Lewis receives his knighthood from Prince Charles.
15/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

15/12/2021.headline: Will our bottom line survive the Omicron variant? The government is hoping so
15/12/2021.description: The federal government will use today's mid-year budget update to spruik upgraded forecasts for job creation over the next four years, as the Opposition says there is little room for complacency after previous turnarounds ended in more lockdowns and a recession.
15/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey and Georgia Hitch

15/12/2021.headline: Search underway for 25 missing Indonesians after boat capsizes off Malaysia coast, killing 11
15/12/2021.description: Fourteen people are reported safe among the estimated 50 aboard the boat, which turned over in adverse weather off southern Johor state around 4:30am local time.
15/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey and Georgia Hitch

15/12/2021.headline: Grandmother accused of killing daughter, other woman during street fight awaits her fate
15/12/2021.description: The jury has retired to consider its verdict after hearing weeks of testimony in the trial of Linda Britton, who allegedly drove her car into the two women during a brawl at Nambucca Heads in 2019.
15/12/2021.author: Alexandra Jones

15/12/2021.headline: Former Labor MP and husband to stand trial, accused of blackmailing Opposition Leader
15/12/2021.description: Former South Australian MP Annabel Digance and her husband, Greg, plead not guilty to blackmailing state Labor leader Peter Malinauskas.
15/12/2021.author: Stacey Lee

15/12/2021.headline: NASA's Parker probe 'touches' the Sun by crossing the corona boundary
15/12/2021.description: Scientists are now able to confirm that in April, the probe dipped below outgoing solar wind into the uneven boundary with the Sun's solar atmosphere known as the corona.
15/12/2021.author: Stacey Lee

15/12/2021.headline: Here is what you need to know about the Log4j software security fault
15/12/2021.description: Security professionals say it is one of the worst computer vulnerabilities they have ever seen as agencies in the United States and Australia sound the alarm on Log4j software.
15/12/2021.author: Stacey Lee

16/12/2021.headline: Restaurateur says Pat Cummins was at the table beside the guy who tested positive
16/12/2021.description: The owner of the restaurant where Australia captain Pat Cummins dined on Wednesday night says he was seated at the table next to a man who found out he was COVID-positive while dining.
16/12/2021.author: Rebecca Opie

16/12/2021.headline: 'There will never be another bell hooks': Feminist thinker dies aged 69
16/12/2021.description: Gloria Jean Watkins, known as bell hooks, is remembered for exploring how race, gender, economics and politics intertwined, which helped shape academic and popular debates over the past 40 years.
16/12/2021.author: Rebecca Opie

16/12/2021.headline: 'To lose a son … is one of the most traumatic losses in life,' Alex Braes' father tells inquest
16/12/2021.description: The final day of witness evidence at an inquest into the death of a Broken Hill teenager hears testimony from his father, who says he was "his ray of sunshine, his everything".
16/12/2021.author: Callum Marshall and Bill Ormonde

16/12/2021.headline: Roxby Downs teenager dies after being hit by jet ski
16/12/2021.description: A teenage boy has died after being struck by a jet ski in South Australia's Riverland today.
16/12/2021.author: Callum Marshall and Bill Ormonde

16/12/2021.headline: 'She wished he was dead': Wife successfully appeals conviction for murdering her husband
16/12/2021.description: A Tasmanian woman who was jailed for plotting to murder her husband because "she wanted him out of her life" has had her conviction quashed by the Court of Criminal Appeal.
16/12/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

16/12/2021.headline: The Loop: Four children killed on jumping castle, COVID cases surge, Cummins out of second Ashes Test
16/12/2021.description: Get up to speed with this quick wrap of today's biggest news.
16/12/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

16/12/2021.headline: How did this happen? Everything we know about the jumping castle tragedy
16/12/2021.description: It was the final day of school and grade 5 and 6 children were celebrating at a "Big Day In" activity day in Devonport, in Tasmania's north-west.
16/12/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

16/12/2021.headline: 'Marked improvement': Queensland budget boosted by property and coal booms
16/12/2021.description: The high price of coal and the property boom have combined to boost Queensland's coffers, but at least some of the benefit is expected to be short-lived.
16/12/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

16/12/2021.headline: WA public sector pay rise, casual workers to get $320 COVID isolation payment
16/12/2021.description: The cap on public sector wage growth in Western Australia will end, and casual workers forced into isolation from COVID-19 will receive a one-off payment of $320, Mark McGowan reveals in his mid-year review.
16/12/2021.author: James Carmody

16/12/2021.headline: Fatigued workers, ambulance ramping rise as public health staff face 'unsustainable' workloads
16/12/2021.description: Queensland's auditor-general questions whether the workload of public hospital employees is "unsustainably high" as they brace for an influx of COVID-19 cases as he reveals paramedics spent more than 111,000 hours ramped outside the state's top public hospitals during 2020-21.
16/12/2021.author: James Carmody

16/12/2021.headline: Alleged vigilante charged with woman's murder denied bail after 'destruction of evidence'
16/12/2021.description: A man charged with the murder of the 22-year-old Townsville motorcyclist Jennifer Broad has been denied bail amid allegations he asked evidence to be destroyed.
16/12/2021.author: Chloe Chomicki

16/12/2021.headline: Billie Eilish says porn 'destroyed my brain' at age 11, so how can parents prevent this?
16/12/2021.description: Parents are being urged to have early conversations with their children about pornography, but it could soon become tougher to access it in Australia.
16/12/2021.author: Isabel Moussalli

16/12/2021.headline: NT records no new cases linked to outbreak as Darwin kept waiting on new exposure site list
16/12/2021.description: The Northern Territory records one new COVID-19 case overnight, a traveller who arrived on a repatriation flight from Johannesburg, as Territorians await an update on key exposure site information after two people who visited Royal Darwin Hospital tested positive on Wednesday.
16/12/2021.author: Steve Vivian

16/12/2021.headline: Man jailed for 14 years over 'horrific' sexual assault of 92yo woman in her Sydney home
16/12/2021.description: Craig Wheatman says he was too drunk to remember sexually assaulting a frail, elderly woman inside her own home in a "horrific and degrading" attack, a court hears.
16/12/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

16/12/2021.headline: How is Australia's COVID recovery going?
16/12/2021.description: The government has offered another glimpse into how it thinks Australia will keep recovering from the pandemic – including facing the challenge of Omicron or any other variant that might come our way. Here's what we learned.
16/12/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

16/12/2021.headline: Fresh blows for WA sport as Perth Glory player contracts COVID and Scorchers lose home games
16/12/2021.description: Professional sport in WA is rocked on two fronts, as a Perth Glory player tests positive for COVID-19 and the Perth Scorchers see their remaining home games moved interstate due to the hard border.
16/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke

16/12/2021.headline: Underperforming super funds named and shamed by regulator
16/12/2021.description: Super fund members are being urged to consider switching funds as the regulator warns the industry they need to lift their game on fees and investment performance, with new data showing more funds are failing to stack up.
16/12/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

16/12/2021.headline: 'Avoid at all costs': Our resident movie critic reveals the worst films of 2021
16/12/2021.description: Zak Hepburn has seen a lot of movies this year. Trust him when he says there are some that just aren't worth watching, but others you should definitely catch.
16/12/2021.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

16/12/2021.headline: Man who killed partner on Darwin's Mindil Beach in 'brutal' attack sentenced to 13 years in prison
16/12/2021.description: Just days before the anniversary of a Northern Territory woman's Christmas Eve death, the man who brutally killed her on a popular beach is sentenced to 13 years behind bars.
16/12/2021.author: Matt Garrick

16/12/2021.headline: Man who claimed he was 'adopting a child' convicted of stealing toddler from Brisbane home
16/12/2021.description: Olando Aleki, 31, is sentenced to three years in jail after pleading guilty to child stealing and entering a dwelling with intent. He is being released from jail after time served, and could now face deportation.
16/12/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

16/12/2021.headline: Encrypted gangster texts lift lid on underworld execution of Pasquale Barbaro
16/12/2021.description: Sydney gangster Pasquale Barbaro was killed in 2016. After three secret trials, the details of his underworld execution can finally be revealed.
16/12/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

16/12/2021.headline: MYEFO is forecasting a long-awaited rise in wages, but it doesn't mean it will happen
16/12/2021.description: It's tough making predictions, especially about the future and even more so during a pandemic. But Josh Frydenberg and Treasury have had another crack in MYEFO, writes Ian Verrender.
16/12/2021.author: Ian Verrender

16/12/2021.headline: Plagued inner west light rail line to run limited services early next year with CBD trams
16/12/2021.description: Some Sydney commuters will be able to ditch replacement buses early next year when services resume on the inner west line which has been sitting empty due to cracked trams.
16/12/2021.author: Harriet Tatham

16/12/2021.headline: Two people in custody after activists shovelled coal off Queensland freight train
16/12/2021.description: One protester has been arrested over the protest, which began yesterday afternoon.
16/12/2021.author: Katrina Beavan

16/12/2021.headline: Stoned and drunk P-plater jailed for killing 'best mate' in crash
16/12/2021.description: Timothy Werps, 19 has been sentenced to more than nine years jail over a car crash that killed 16-year-old Jye Eiffert in Bendigo last year.
16/12/2021.author: Sarah Lawrence

16/12/2021.headline: Charging into the future: This is what it's really like to own an electric car
16/12/2021.description: Only 2 per cent of vehicles on Australian roads are powered by electricity, but they are seen as a crucial part of the transition to a carbon-neutral society. So what is it like to own one?
16/12/2021.author: Emma Wynne

16/12/2021.headline: 'We will be takeaway-only': How Queensland businesses are responding to the COVID vaccine mandate
16/12/2021.description: The COVID vaccine mandate kicks in today with businesses across Queensland putting their compliance plans in place — and some choosing to close their dining areas and revert to takeaway-only to avoid confrontation with unvaccinated patrons.
16/12/2021.author: Jon Daly and Jemima Burt

16/12/2021.headline: Warner and Labuschagne win key battles as Australia takes control of second Ashes Test
16/12/2021.description: David Warner overcame his nemesis Stuart Broad and Marnus Labuschagne dug in for a determined 95 as Australia dominated day one of the Adelaide Test against England, writes Russell Jackson.
16/12/2021.author: Russell Jackson

16/12/2021.headline: Many aspects of day-to-day life are now closed to unvaccinated Queenslanders. Here's what they can and can't do
16/12/2021.description: While life will continue unchanged for those aged 16 and over who are double dosed or can provide evidence of a medical exemption, a raft of restrictions have now been applied to those who are not vaccinated.
16/12/2021.author: Dan Colasimone

16/12/2021.headline: Migration is coming back to Australia, but will it keep wages down?
16/12/2021.description: While inflation is expected to outpace wages growth until mid-next year, real wages are predicted to steadily rise after June 2022.
16/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

16/12/2021.headline: After a decorated rugby union career, David Pocock announces he'll try his luck at federal politics
16/12/2021.description: Former Wallabies captain David Pocock announces he will be making a career change — foraying into politics.
16/12/2021.author: Rosie King and Antoinette Radford

16/12/2021.headline: Like throwing a party and no guests show up, China may be left high and dry this weekend
16/12/2021.description: China's government is cracking down on boycotts ahead of so-called "patriots only" Legislative Council elections in Hong Kong. Authorities are hoping to avoid a low turn-out, which would embarrass Beijing.
16/12/2021.author: Bill Birtles

16/12/2021.headline: 'Long time coming': From today, this major NSW river will be recognised by its Aboriginal name
16/12/2021.description: The Macquarie River in central NSW will now also be recognised as Wambuul, after the state government officially adopted the waterway's Aboriginal name.
16/12/2021.author: Mollie Gorman

16/12/2021.headline: Scott Morrison has a new 'women problem' — and it's one of his own making
16/12/2021.description: Scott Morrison and his government enter the new year with a fresh iteration of their "women problem" — and it bring serious campaign trouble, writes Michelle Grattan.
16/12/2021.author: Michelle Grattan

16/12/2021.headline: Annual leave balances hit record high as pandemic reduces holidays, 'life leave'
16/12/2021.description: After more than 18 months of border closures, disrupted holidays and working from home, some businesses are grappling a big build-up of leave. Lawyers say workers still have the right to challenge unreasonable leave requests.
16/12/2021.author: Stephanie Chalmers

16/12/2021.headline: Australia has lost one of its greatest economists, and a big chunk of economic history with him
16/12/2021.description: One of Australia's greatest economists and closest links to the ideas of John Maynard Keynes is being laid to rest, and with him passes a great deal of our economic history, writes Michael Janda.
16/12/2021.author: Michael Janda

16/12/2021.headline: The school bus has been an anchor of Jake's daily routine for years. But a 'very big' change is coming
16/12/2021.description: Less than half of all adults in Australia with disability are employed, making high school graduation a tough time for parents like Melissa Boyd and her son Jake.
16/12/2021.author: Damian McIver

16/12/2021.headline: 'Worst few moments of my life': Community mourns children who fell from flyaway jumping castle
16/12/2021.description: A small northern Tasmanian community has been left "heartbroken" after five children die when a jumping castle takes off in a gust of wind at an end-of-year primary school event.
16/12/2021.author: Katri Uibu

16/12/2021.headline: COVID-19 cases in NSW reproducing at the highest rate this year
16/12/2021.description: One infected person is on average passing COVID-19 onto another two, with an expert warning at this rate NSW could see case numbers doubling every four days.
16/12/2021.author: Katri Uibu

16/12/2021.headline: Meet the migrant mumpreneurs helping each other to grow their businesses
16/12/2021.description: New to Australia, Oznur started selling handcrafts to friends. Now, a support network for migrant businesswomen has helped her turn her hobby into a fully-fledged business.
16/12/2021.author: Simon Leo Brown and Adelle Mills

16/12/2021.headline: The world's first 'true' millipede has been found down an Australian mine
16/12/2021.description: Ladies and gentlemen, introducing a creature that could empty the wardrobe of Imelda Marcos, our new king of limbs, the princess of poda, boasting 1,306 spectacular stilts. It not only lives up to the name millipede, but walks it out of the park.
16/12/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

16/12/2021.headline: Senior constable convicted of family violence keeps his job, while a majority of officers charged have them withdrawn
16/12/2021.description: Victoria Police still has "a long way to go" in its mission to hold abusers in its ranks to account, police accountability experts say, as new data reveals a senior constable who was recently convicted of several family violence offences remains employed as a frontline officer.
16/12/2021.author: Hayley Gleeson

16/12/2021.headline: Mercedes will not appeal the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix but say safety car 'affected' their world championship dream
16/12/2021.description: The Mercedes Formula 1 team will not appeal against its dismissed protests following the controversial end to last Sunday's Abu Dhabi Grand Prix.
16/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

16/12/2021.headline: Trucks tip over, visibility falls to zero as dust storms hit tornado-devastated western US
16/12/2021.description: Less than a week after a swarm of powerful tornadoes devastated five US states, a freakish wind storm brings "Dust Bowl" conditions and strong gusts to the Great Plains and Midwest.
16/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

16/12/2021.headline: More than 1,000 secret JFK assassination files released
16/12/2021.description: The National Archives releases about 1,500 documents related to the US government's investigation into the 1963 assassination of President John F Kennedy.
16/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

16/12/2021.headline: Stinging defeat for NZ in latest 'farcical' attempt to trademark manuka honey
16/12/2021.description: In striking down the request for a UK trademark, the British Intellectual Property Office found that while "manuka" was originally a Maori word, the term had entered common usage.
16/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

16/12/2021.headline: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews in isolation after COVID-19 exposure
16/12/2021.description: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews is awaiting test results after attending an event with a COVID-19-positive case.
16/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

16/12/2021.headline: NRL mourns death of legendary rugby league talent scout Peter Mulholland
16/12/2021.description: Tributes are flowing following the death of revered NRL recruiter and former first grade coach Peter Mulholland at age 68.
16/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

16/12/2021.headline: Thousands evacuate as Typhoon Rai slams into Philippines as country records first Omicron cases
16/12/2021.description: Tens of thousands of people are crowding in emergency shelters in the southern and central Philippines after evacuating as a powerful typhoon hits the country.
16/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

17/12/2021.headline: Qantas workers will not have their jobs reinstated, Federal Court finds
17/12/2021.description: Qantas workers who lost their jobs due to outsourcing are told they will not be able to get their roles back after the Federal Court ruled in one of the largest reinstatement cases ever heard.
17/12/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

17/12/2021.headline: International arrivals to Victoria, NSW will no longer need to isolate for 72 hours
17/12/2021.description: From Tuesday, New South Wales and Victoria have the same COVID-19 requirements for overseas visitors, with fully vaccinated arrivals required to get a test within 24 hours and isolate until a negative result.
17/12/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

17/12/2021.headline: Patricia Karvelas' love letter to RN Drive listeners
17/12/2021.description: Every weeknight for the past seven years that I've presented RN Drive I have had the privilege of being in your lives at the most intimate and personal times, writes Patricia Karvelas.
17/12/2021.author: Patricia Karvelas

17/12/2021.headline: SA Police release eight clues that could solve cold case murder
17/12/2021.description: Seacliff teenager Susi Schmidt was brutally murdered in 1971 after finishing her shift at the local Burger King. Fifty years on, police hope a DNA breakthrough and fresh appeal will solve the case.
17/12/2021.author: Rebecca Opie

17/12/2021.headline: The Loop: No changes to booster plans, 'five angels' mourned, SA's vaccine mandate challenged
17/12/2021.description: Your quick wrap-up of the news you need to know about.
17/12/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

17/12/2021.headline: Who is Western Australia’s new Health Minister, Amber-Jade Sanderson?
17/12/2021.description: Amber-Jade Sanderson first garnered attention delivering WA’s Voluntary Assisted Dying legislation in 2019, before taking on the climate and environment portfolio after the 2021 WA election. Who is the woman described as Labor's rising star?
17/12/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine and James Carmody

17/12/2021.headline: 'No textbook on grief': Processing jumping castle tragedy will take months, psychologist says
17/12/2021.description: A child psychologist says the tragic deaths of five primary school children in Tasmania's north-west at an end-of-year celebration will be hard for both children and adults to process and urges those impacted not to put a timeline on their healing.
17/12/2021.author: Kate Ainsworth

17/12/2021.headline: Fox News loses bid to dismiss Dominion defamation lawsuit over US election coverage
17/12/2021.description: A judge rules Dominion Voting Systems' $US1.6 billion ($2.23 billion) lawsuit against Fox News Network can go to trial, with the voting-machine company alleging Fox defamed it by amplifying conspiracy theories about its technology.
17/12/2021.author: Kate Ainsworth

17/12/2021.headline: Killer with 'appalling criminal history' jailed for 10 years over fatal stabbing
17/12/2021.description: A man who brought Brisbane's Queen Street Mall to a standstill in a 2013 siege has been convicted of manslaughter over a killing at Murrumba Downs in 2018. Supreme Court Justice Elizabeth Wilson says the family of the victim still feel "real and palpable" grief.
17/12/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

17/12/2021.headline: Jeff Browne confirmed as Collingwood's new president
17/12/2021.description: The former Nine Network boss will take over as the Magpies president following months of in-fighting at the AFL club.
17/12/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

17/12/2021.headline: Moving grandmother's street brawl manslaughter trial to Sydney a 'recipe for disaster,' judge says
17/12/2021.description: The trial of Linda Britton, accused of killing her daughter and another woman in 2019, has been abandoned and the judge says there will "obviously be a problem" getting witnesses to travel to Sydney for the new hearing.
17/12/2021.author: Claudia Jambor

17/12/2021.headline: Japanese shopping district fire kills 27, police suspect arson
17/12/2021.description: At least 27 people are dead after a fire in an eight-storey building in a busy shopping district in the Japanese city of Osaka.
17/12/2021.author: Claudia Jambor

17/12/2021.headline: AFLW Crows player among workers challenging SA's COVID vaccine mandate
17/12/2021.description: A group of four South Australian workers, including sidelined Crows player Deni Varnhagen, challenge the state's vaccine mandates in court.
17/12/2021.author: Eric Tlozek

17/12/2021.headline: No change to booster timeframe of five months after second dose
17/12/2021.description: Health officials decide not to shorten the time between second doses and booster shots, while providing an assurance that two doses of a COVID vaccine do protect people from getting very sick from the Omicron variant.
17/12/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

17/12/2021.headline: Two young men face court over alleged threat to behead WA Premier and his family
17/12/2021.description: Two men are released on bail after facing court over an alleged threat to behead West Australian Premier Mark McGowan and his family.
17/12/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

17/12/2021.headline: When will Omicron become the dominant COVID-19 variant here?
17/12/2021.description: There are questions as to when Omicron cases will peak in Australia and overtake Delta as the dominant strain. Here's what we know.
17/12/2021.author: Alexis Moran

17/12/2021.headline: The club was supposed to give them a secret advantage over other punters. Instead, it destroyed lives
17/12/2021.description: Dazzled by the promise of plum winnings on the racetrack because of a secret mathematical formula, Bill Vlahos's victims opened their bank accounts to him. The result was a disaster.
17/12/2021.author: Danny Tran

17/12/2021.headline: Masks are making a comeback in Queensland. Here's what you need to know
17/12/2021.description: Masks are becoming mandatory again in many outdoor and public locations across Queensland, as COVID-19 cases continue to mount. Here's what you need to know about the new mask mandate.
17/12/2021.author: Danny Tran

17/12/2021.headline: WA tightens border restrictions with Queensland, Tasmania following COVID cases
17/12/2021.description: Travel to Western Australia from every state will be restricted from midnight on Sunday, as Premier Mark McGowan again tightens the state's border rules following COVID cases in Queensland and Tasmania.
17/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke

17/12/2021.headline: Dual Olympic swimming gold medallist Kieren Perkins given the biggest job in Australian sport
17/12/2021.description: One of Australia's most celebrated swimmers and Olympians, Kieren Perkins, will take over the top job in Australian sport with his appointment as CEO of the Australian Sports Commission.
17/12/2021.author: David Mark

17/12/2021.headline: How Zebras on the run for months were finally caught remains a public mystery
17/12/2021.description: Two zebras running loose since escaping a Maryland farm about four months ago have been caught, but the details of how they were finally captured remains a mystery.
17/12/2021.author: David Mark

17/12/2021.headline: The rules and regulations for using jumping castles in Australia
17/12/2021.description: The death of five children in Devonport is not the first time fatal incidents involving jumping castles have happened, but it is one of the deadliest in recent years. These are the standards to which operators are held.
17/12/2021.author: Sean Wales

17/12/2021.headline: Live: Steve Smith looking to put Australia back on top on day two in Adelaide
17/12/2021.description: Three wickets before dinner have given England a foothold in the second Ashes Test in Adelaide, but with Steve Smith at the crease Australia remains confident. Follow the action live.
17/12/2021.author: Simon Smale and Dean Bilton

17/12/2021.headline: Faulty Chinese aluminium adds to Navy boat delays, costing extra $44 million
17/12/2021.description: The Navy expects its new evolved Cape class patrol boats could now be delayed by up to nine months, while an extra $44 million will need to be spent keeping its old fleet in the water, after poor quality aluminium was imported from China.
17/12/2021.author: Andrew Greene

17/12/2021.headline: Victorian logging regulator to get new powers over VicForests after allegations of illegal logging
17/12/2021.description: Victoria's logging regulator will be given additional powers to bring the controversial state government-owned logging company VicForests into line — a move that comes just weeks after an ABC investigation revealed allegations of illegal logging by VicForests and bungled enforcement actions by the regulator.
17/12/2021.author: Michael Slezak

17/12/2021.headline: Russian hackers hit recruiter, release Aussie jobseekers' personal files
17/12/2021.description: A significant data breach of recruitment company Finite Recruitment — that has ties to the Department of Defence, Home Affairs, Coles, Westpac and AMP — exposes personal information, including resumes, criminal history checks, vaccine certificates and salary information, of staff and job applicants.
17/12/2021.author: Simon Elvery, Emily Sakzewski, and Matt Liddy

17/12/2021.headline: The 'Christmas comet' has arrived. Here's how to spot it and snap a photo
17/12/2021.description: Grab a pair of binoculars and find a dark spot and you may catch a glimpse of the "Christmas comet" over the next two weeks. Here's how to spot it and snap a photo.
17/12/2021.author: Genelle Weule

17/12/2021.headline: 'No-one knew we were working for free': Modern slavery in Australia is hidden in plain sight
17/12/2021.description: Wage theft, exploitation and modern slavery are often reported as isolated scandals — but for many new Australians, they're a necessary evil.
17/12/2021.author: Bang Xiao, Jarrod Fankhauser, and Steven Viney

17/12/2021.headline: 'The virus is coursing through society': Why Britain is in the midst of dual variant outbreaks
17/12/2021.description: Throughout the pandemic, the United Kingdom has, at times, been an early indicator to other countries of the dangers posed by new variants. We asked experts to explain why.
17/12/2021.author: Lucia Stein

17/12/2021.headline: One of Australia's most wanted fugitives has eluded authorities for 30 years. What happened to John Bobak?
17/12/2021.description: Fresh details emerge about the ongoing search for one of Australia's most wanted men, who is still being hunted by police 30 years after the murder of a Gold Coast couple that triggered a national manhunt.
17/12/2021.author: Alexandria Utting and Paula Doneman

17/12/2021.headline: Confessions of a Liberal voter show why Morrison is stuck in a self-made trap
17/12/2021.description: The Liberal Party is clearly feeling the threat from independents, many of whom are cashed up and coming for incumbents in what, historically, have been safe seats, writes Brett Worthington.
17/12/2021.author: Brett Worthington

17/12/2021.headline: This nurse was on shift when she found out some of the jumping castle victims 'hadn't made it'
17/12/2021.description: A nurse who responded to the tragedy that saw five primary school kids die when a jumping castle was lifted into the air has described the trauma of attending to the victims.
17/12/2021.author: Brett Worthington

17/12/2021.headline: At least 12 people dead after deadly typhoon hits Philippines
17/12/2021.description: More than 300,000 people fled their homes and beachfront resorts as Typhoon Rai pummelled the southern and central regions of the Philippines, knocking out communications in some areas, tearing roofs off buildings and leaving at least 12 people dead.
17/12/2021.author: Brett Worthington

17/12/2021.headline: Barty, Alcott crowned joint Newcombe Medal winners
17/12/2021.description: After completing stellar 2021 campaigns, Ash Barty and Dylan Alcott are recognised as Tennis Australia's players of the year.
17/12/2021.author: Brett Worthington

17/12/2021.headline: UK Conservatives lose seat held for almost 200 years in stunning defeat
17/12/2021.description: United Kingdom Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Conservative Party has suffered a stunning defeat in a parliamentary by-election that was a de facto referendum on his government, amid weeks of scandal and soaring COVID-19 infections.
17/12/2021.author: Brett Worthington

17/12/2021.headline: 'Scaring it to death': Study finds robot fish are removing invasive species in Australian waters
17/12/2021.description: Researchers at the University of Western Australia built a robot fish in 2018 that they used to scare away one of the world's most invasive species, the mosquitofish.
17/12/2021.author: Brett Worthington

17/12/2021.headline: Hundreds of refugees flee to Thailand to escape fighting between Myanmar army and insurgents
17/12/2021.description: Hundreds of people including children reportedly flee a flare-up in fighting between Myanmar's army and an ethnic minority insurgent group, taking refuge across the border in Thailand.
17/12/2021.author: Brett Worthington

17/12/2021.headline: 'Our worst fears have been realised': Four test positive in major NT service hub
17/12/2021.description: Only one in three people from remote Aboriginal communities in the Barkly region are fully vaccinated. Now, the biggest town in the region has recorded four new COVID-19 cases.
17/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

17/12/2021.headline: Cummins granted approval to return home from Adelaide after being ruled out of Ashes Test
17/12/2021.description: South Australian health authorities allow Pat Cummins to return home to NSW for the rest of his enforced isolation after he was forced out of the second men's Ashes Test.
17/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

17/12/2021.headline: US judge overturns settlement shielding Sackler family from opioid lawsuits
17/12/2021.description: A US federal judge rejected OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma's bankruptcy settlement of lawsuits over the opioid epidemic because of a provision that would protect members of the Sackler family from facing litigation of their own.
17/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

17/12/2021.headline: Meet the new Health Minister as COVID knocks on WA's door
17/12/2021.description: Amber-Jade Sanderson first garnered attention delivering WA’s Voluntary Assisted Dying legislation in 2019, before taking on the climate and environment portfolio after the 2021 WA election. Who is the woman described as Labor's rising star?
17/12/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine and James Carmody

17/12/2021.headline: Best books of 2021: 11 books to escape into this summer
17/12/2021.description: From a British spy thriller to a rollicking Harlem crime saga, a love story narrated by a tree, and tales of trauma, Twitter and translation — these are our favourite books of 2021.
17/12/2021.author: Kate Evans, Claire Nichols, Sarah L'Estrange, and Declan Fry

17/12/2021.headline: Launceston airport and JB HiFi listed as exposures sites after COVID case arrives from NSW
17/12/2021.description: A New South Wales man tests positive for COVID-19 after arriving in Tasmania and spending time at a cafe and JB HiFi.
17/12/2021.author: James Dunlevie

17/12/2021.headline: How Australian women's rugby sevens side went from fifth in Tokyo to winning back-to-back world series titles
17/12/2021.description: The Australian women's rugby sevens team was left devastated after bowing out in the quarter-finals at this year's Tokyo Olympics, but all it's taken is a little tweak to the game plan to get back in the winning circle on the world series.
17/12/2021.author: Tanisha Stanton

17/12/2021.headline: Some relationships won't survive COVID vaccine arguments, experts warn
17/12/2021.description: Relationship counsellors say the increasing need for a COVID-19 vaccination to work, travel and dine out may begin to tear families apart.
17/12/2021.author: Owen Jacques

18/12/2021.headline: Seven sleeps to Christmas! What's the weather going to be like?
18/12/2021.description: The Bureau of Meterology has revealed its Christmas forecasts for the nation, so here's the first look at what you can expect for Christmas lunch.
18/12/2021.author: Kate Doyle

18/12/2021.headline: Steph Curry leads Golden State Warriors to first win over Celtics since 2019
18/12/2021.description: The Golden State Warriors end their five-match NBA losing streak to the Boston Celtics, thanks to another strong performance from Stephen Curry.
18/12/2021.author: Kate Doyle

18/12/2021.headline: Police raid two properties over revenge porn allegations related to Parliament House incident
18/12/2021.description: Police raid properties in Canberra and Queensland over allegations of revenge porn stemming from an incident in Parliament House.
18/12/2021.author: Antoinette Radford and Nour Haydar

18/12/2021.headline: SA records more than 70 new COVID-19 cases, as hospitality businesses look ahead to eased restrictions
18/12/2021.description: South Australia records 73 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, up on yesterday's record numbers.
18/12/2021.author: Alice Dempster and Tom Fedorowytsch

18/12/2021.headline: A US court has allowed Joe Biden's employer vaccine mandate to take effect. Here's what you need to know
18/12/2021.description: Vaccine mandates could soon apply to more than 80 million American workers. Here's what employers would be required to do.
18/12/2021.author: Alice Dempster and Tom Fedorowytsch

18/12/2021.headline: Cameron Murray rises from club junior to captain of the South Sydney Rabbitohs
18/12/2021.description: The Rabbitohs chose former South Sydney junior Cameron Murray to captain the team as coach Jason Demetriou ushers in a new era.
18/12/2021.author: Alice Dempster and Tom Fedorowytsch

18/12/2021.headline: Live: England reeling as Australia finds crucial breakthroughs on day three in Adelaide
18/12/2021.description: The wickets of Joe Root and Dawid Malan have Australia back on the front foot on day three of the second Ashes Test in Adelaide. Follow the action live.
18/12/2021.author: Simon Smale and Dean Bilton

18/12/2021.headline: The Northern Territory's COVID outbreak rises to 101 as one new case is recorded overnight
18/12/2021.description: A Tennant Creek resident is in intensive care at Alice Springs hospital after contracting COVID-19 and a child who tested positive to the virus brings the Territory's outbreak to 101. Member for Barkly Steve Edgington says people are enduring a lockdown in "harsh conditions".
18/12/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

18/12/2021.headline: Barty, Thiem star acts in one-off Sydney tennis tournament
18/12/2021.description: World number one Ash Barty and US Open men's champion Dominic Thiem will headline a new, one-off tennis tournament in Sydney in the lead-up to the Australian Open.
18/12/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

18/12/2021.headline: 'Terrifying moment': Alone in the outback, Sophie's epic camel trek suddenly took a heart-stopping turn
18/12/2021.description: After travelling a gruelling 5,000 kilometres across the continent with five camels, Sophie Matterson reflects on the highs and lows of her epic two-year journey.
18/12/2021.author: Leah White

18/12/2021.headline: Travelling interstate this Christmas? Here's what you need to know about border rules
18/12/2021.description: Do you have Christmas lunch plans with relatives interstate but are confused about the travel rules? Here's what you need to know.
18/12/2021.author: Leah White

18/12/2021.headline: Man who threw plank and fire extinguisher at police gets longest Capitol riot sentence so far
18/12/2021.description: A Capitol rioter is sentenced to more than five years in prison, followed by three years of supervised release, for assaulting police during the January 6 attack on the seat of US government.
18/12/2021.author: Leah White

18/12/2021.headline: Seven members of one family were killed in US tornado
18/12/2021.description: The death toll from a line of tornadoes that tore through the United States increases to 92, with Kentucky authorities finding the body of a missing teenager.
18/12/2021.author: Leah White

18/12/2021.headline: 'It was work, work, work, school': How Jess is navigating her small business success
18/12/2021.description: Just nine months ago, Jess turned a hobby into a business. Since then she's employed someone, navigated burnout and learnt about tax. But she's not in it for the money.
18/12/2021.author: Bec Whetham

18/12/2021.headline: Anger as Indonesian boats surge back into Australian waters, weeks after illegal vessels were torched
18/12/2021.description: The WA government is demanding the Commonwealth "step up" and stop illegal foreign fishermen from harvesting seafood in a pristine marine park.
18/12/2021.author: Erin Parke

18/12/2021.headline: When amputee Neil's 'terrible' leg kept letting him down, he made his own
18/12/2021.description: Neil Greening lost a leg in a motorcycle accident in 1982 and was given a prosthetic of wood, leather and tin. Hating the "relic", what he did next helped change the industry.
18/12/2021.author: Phil Brandel

18/12/2021.headline: Liam Paro promised his friend they would conquer the world, now the Aussie boxer is on the brink of doing it
18/12/2021.description: As Liam Paro prepares for the fight of his life on the Jake Paul and Tyron Woodley undercard, the Aussie boxer says he will have one person on his mind when he steps in the ring.
18/12/2021.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis

18/12/2021.headline: COVID-19 outbreak cancels Christmas for aged care residents in Orange
18/12/2021.description: A dozen residents and staff at an aged care facility in the New South Wales central west have tested positive to COVID-19.
18/12/2021.author: Hamish Cole

18/12/2021.headline: PM announces funding support for those affected by jumping castle tragedy
18/12/2021.description: Scott Morrison describes the jumping castle tragedy in northern Tasmania as a "terribly, terribly awful time for Tasmanians", while announcing support for those affected.
18/12/2021.author: James Dunlevie

18/12/2021.headline: Richmond star Dustin Martin mourns the death of father
18/12/2021.description: Richmond footballer Dustin Martin mourns the death of his father Shane, who passed away in New Zealand.
18/12/2021.author: James Dunlevie

18/12/2021.headline: With WA facing a new COVID challenge, it's hard to see how losing the health portfolio isn't a demotion for Roger Cook
18/12/2021.description: Seven weeks out from WA's border reopening and COVID-19 coming in, its Health Minister is moving on amid a Cabinet reshuffle, and it is difficult to see how it does not represent a demotion, writes Rhiannon Shine.
18/12/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine
