23/12/2021.description: Something unexpected has happened since the start of this century. Young people in Australia, the UK, Nordic countries and North America are drinking significantly less alcohol than their parents' generation. There are four reasons why.
23/12/2021.author: James Dunlevie and Chris Rowbottom

23/12/2021.headline: Making a TV show helps Andie-Rose forget about her ill health
23/12/2021.description: This endearing 12-year-old says being a part of a hospital TV program made by kids for kids has "brightened up her life" and has helped set concerns about her chronic respiratory condition to one side.
23/12/2021.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

23/12/2021.headline: Queenslanders told spread of Omicron is 'necessary' — what does that mean?
23/12/2021.description: Queensland Chief Health Officer John Gerrard is telling people the spread of COVID-19 in the Sunshine State is not only inevitable, but "necessary". What does that mean?
23/12/2021.author: Stephanie Zillman

23/12/2021.headline: A smile and a slice of pizza in a photo brings joyous relief after jumping castle tragedy
23/12/2021.description: Sitting up in hospital with his head half-shaved and eating pizza — it is a simple photo, but one which came as welcome news that one of the children involved in the jumping castle tragedy had made it.
23/12/2021.author: April McLennan

23/12/2021.headline: Scorching, stormy and maybe even a cyclone: Your Christmas Day weather forecast
23/12/2021.description: Extreme heatwave conditions are forecast for Perth which could set a Christmas record — a contrast from other capital cities where rain and milder temperatures are expected.
23/12/2021.author: Kate Doyle

23/12/2021.headline: Respond, don't react: How to cope with Christmas conflict
23/12/2021.description: Family get-togethers can be fun or infuriating. One psychologist says the key is to remember why you're there.
23/12/2021.author: Lucy Stone and Cathie Schnitzerling

23/12/2021.headline: 'Perfect pet': Man on mission to rehome rescued bees and educate next generation of conservationists
23/12/2021.description: A man in Sydney's south has millions of bees in the back of his ute. It's part of a plan to save the species of stingless native bees.
23/12/2021.author: Maryanne Taouk

23/12/2021.headline: As a COVID metric, isolating workers almost as important as ICU admissions, expert says
23/12/2021.description: Consumers should be bracing for less items on supermarket shelves and longer waits for deliveries as isolation laws hit businesses, a leading epidemiologist says.
23/12/2021.author: Amy Greenbank

23/12/2021.headline: Stephen Spielberg's West Side Story is an improvement on the 1961 original but deep flaws remain
23/12/2021.description: The classic Broadway story has long been scrutinised for its lack of nuance in portraying Puerto Rican culture. While issues remain, the latest adaptation is about as good as it gets.
23/12/2021.author: Cassie Tongue

23/12/2021.headline: Five of the greatest catches in modern Ashes history
23/12/2021.description: Over the last 40 years of Ashes contests, there have been no shortage of classic catches that have stunned crowds and changed games. Here are five of the best from Australia and England's greatest flyers and divers.
23/12/2021.author: Cassie Tongue

23/12/2021.headline: Welcome to Pepperkakebyen, the world's largest gingerbread town
23/12/2021.description: There are homes, hotels, museums, castles and boats — almost all made from gingerbread and decorated by the kids of Bergen with sweets and icing.
23/12/2021.author: Toby Mann

23/12/2021.headline: 'Retailers are on alert but not alarmed': Shoppers expected to spend $21b in Boxing Day sales, despite COVID-19 case rise
23/12/2021.description: Australian shoppers are expected to spend $21 billion at retailers across the country during this year's Boxing Day sales, despite the surge in COVID-19 cases and rising concerns about the Omicron strain.
23/12/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

23/12/2021.headline: An outbreak among America's sport stars reveals Omicron’s power. It also shows how it can be contained
23/12/2021.description: Dozens of American athletes have been sidelined amid a spike in coronavirus cases due to Omicron. What happens next could hold clues for handling what's to come.
23/12/2021.author: Jade Macmillan and Joanna Robin

23/12/2021.headline: Meseret fled Ethiopia in fear for her life, but her new home left her in grave danger
23/12/2021.description: This grainy image is one of the last photos of the Tola siblings together in Ethiopia. But the safe haven that protected Meseret from political persecution left her in a very different kind of danger.
23/12/2021.author: Jade Macmillan and Joanna Robin

23/12/2021.headline: What is Christmas like inside one of Australia's biggest women's prisons?
23/12/2021.description: At a Sydney correctional centre, this prison chaplain is helping make the Christmas season as meaningful as possible.
23/12/2021.author: Nick Baker

23/12/2021.headline: 'They have come to us': Putin warns NATO to stay well away from Russia's borders
23/12/2021.description: The Russian President welcomes talks with the US that are set to start in Geneva next month, but warns the discussion focused on Moscow's demand needs to produce quick results.
23/12/2021.author: Nick Baker

23/12/2021.headline: Thai authorities seize $40m of crystal meth hidden in punching bags bound for Australia
23/12/2021.description: Thai authorities seize crystal methamphetamine with a street value of around $40 million stuffed inside boxing equipment bound for Australia.
23/12/2021.author: Nick Baker

23/12/2021.headline: Barrister for WA police officer argues unvaccinated workers have 'the right to be wrong'
23/12/2021.description: A mandate forcing West Australian police to be vaccinated against COVID-19 is a "punishment for dissent", the Supreme Court is told.
23/12/2021.author: David Weber

23/12/2021.headline: COVID exposure sites balloon in SA on eve of Christmas celebrations
23/12/2021.description: Nearly 50 COVID exposure sites at 30 venues have been added to SA's ballooning list on the eve of Christmas celebrations, with all of them deemed close-contact sites — including a shop in one of the state's busiest supermarkets.
23/12/2021.author: David Weber

23/12/2021.headline: The Loop: Mask mandates brought back, 'heartening' news about Omicron, Emily in Paris is back and look who's bin out on the town
23/12/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
23/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

24/12/2021.headline: The Loop: A blow for travellers on Christmas Eve, dozens of 'rogue' planets discovered and your Secret Santa definitely isn't this good
24/12/2021.description: Your quick wrap-up of the news you need to know about.
24/12/2021.author: Bridget Judd

24/12/2021.headline: More Tiananmen Square monuments removed from Hong Kong universities, after Pillar of Shame dismantled
24/12/2021.description: Several depictions of the Goddess of Democracy were removed, which was originally created by Tiananmen protesters as a symbol of their pursuit of democracy in China.
24/12/2021.author: Bridget Judd

24/12/2021.headline: Women's Warrny to write new chapter in 126yo cycling race history book
24/12/2021.description: Australia's longest one-day cycling race is about to have a women's event which organisers hope will be a springboard for international careers.
24/12/2021.author: Riordan Davis

24/12/2021.headline: 'Together, we keep pushing through': Leaders wish Australians a Merry Christmas
24/12/2021.description: Paying tribute to the families of the Devonport tragedy and thanking those working through Christmas, the Prime Minister and Opposition Leader give their Christmas messages.
24/12/2021.author: Riordan Davis

24/12/2021.headline: How will I know when it's time to get my COVID-19 booster shot?
24/12/2021.description: Growing calls to fast-track COVID-19 booster shots have paid off, and soon Australians can get one, after four months from the second dose.
24/12/2021.author: Widia Jalal

24/12/2021.headline: Sydney Airport says 80 flights cancelled as COVID-19 puts strain on airline staff
24/12/2021.description: At least 80 flights are cancelled at Sydney Airport on Christmas Eve as COVID-19 requirements put a strain on airline staff.
24/12/2021.author: Widia Jalal

24/12/2021.headline: 'Pro-choice' WA Police officer wins injunction preventing him from being sacked over COVID jab
24/12/2021.description: WA Police Senior Constable Ben Falconer wins a Supreme Court injunction preventing him from being sacked for refusing a COVID vaccination until a judicial review is held.
24/12/2021.author: David Weber

24/12/2021.headline: With Hazlewood set to miss, Root says England must rise to Boxing Day challenge
24/12/2021.description: With England 0-2 against Australia, Root said his side's challenge was to collectively improve without 'pointing fingers'.
24/12/2021.author: David Weber

24/12/2021.headline: Closest Aboriginal community to Brisbane prepares for the worst of COVID
24/12/2021.description: With COVID infections now spreading quickly through Queensland, the Aboriginal community of Cherbourg is preparing to provide housing and food for people who have to isolate.
24/12/2021.author: Jon Daly

24/12/2021.headline: NT records 10 new COVID-19 cases, Alice Springs mask mandate to lift this afternoon
24/12/2021.description: There have been 10 new cases of COVID-19, including one new local case, recorded in the Northern Territory overnight. It brings the total number of cases linked to the Territory outbreak to 132.
24/12/2021.author: Jon Daly

24/12/2021.headline: Perth records five COVID-19 cases just weeks out of border opening
24/12/2021.description: Five people have tested positive to COVID-19 the day after news broke that a French backpacker tested positive after flying to Perth from Queensland almost two weeks ago.
24/12/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

24/12/2021.headline: Woman's car stolen at knifepoint while stopped at traffic lights
24/12/2021.description: A woman has had her car stolen at knifepoint while stopped at traffic lights on Christmas Eve in Adelaide.
24/12/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

24/12/2021.headline: Hobart cable car proposal kept alive after planning tribunal win
24/12/2021.description: Tasmania's planning tribunal says it will now consider an amended cable car proposal for kunanyi/Mt Wellington that reduces the size of the development, ditching a planned restaurant and other buildings.
24/12/2021.author: Kate Ainsworth

24/12/2021.headline: Boral's Dunmore sand mine expansion approved despite discovery of Indigenous artefacts
24/12/2021.description: Federal Environment Minister Sussan Ley has rejected an application from First Nations leaders to stop a NSW South Coast mine expansion after the discovery of a large number of Indigenous artefacts.
24/12/2021.author: Tim Fernandez

24/12/2021.headline: 'I would do COVID again over this': Woman starts support group for long COVID sufferers
24/12/2021.description: There's research underway to find solutions for long COVID. But until then, people with post-virus symptoms are looking for solidarity.
24/12/2021.author: Liz Farquhar and Bindi Bryce

24/12/2021.headline: Castlemaine COVID cases grow after school cluster outbreak
24/12/2021.description: A school cluster at Castlemaine North Primary School in regional Victoria sends families into isolation over Christmas and continues to spread after students brought the virus to school last week.
24/12/2021.author: Tyrone Dalton

24/12/2021.headline: NBL postpones additional games due to COVID-19 cases among Hawks, Bullets
24/12/2021.description: Another three NBL games have been postponed because of positive COVID-19 cases in the Illawarra Hawks and Brisbane Bullets teams.
24/12/2021.author: Tyrone Dalton

24/12/2021.headline: Answers to your frequently asked COVID-19 questions for the holiday season
24/12/2021.description: You were curious about Omicron, Christmas holiday travel, and booster shots. Let's unpack some of your common COVID-19 questions.
24/12/2021.author: Tyrone Dalton

24/12/2021.headline: South Australia records 688 new COVID-19 cases
24/12/2021.description: South Australia has recorded 688 new cases of COVID-19 today, and eight people in hospital.
24/12/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin and Daniel Keane

24/12/2021.headline: Canberra man awarded $184,000 after inappropriate treatment to remove a corn from his foot left him unable to walk properly
24/12/2021.description: A Canberra man has been awarded more than $184,000 in damages by the ACT Supreme Court, after a treatment to remove a corn from his foot went horribly wrong.
24/12/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

24/12/2021.headline: Cyclone watch issued for Top End, category one storm may cross coast near Darwin on Monday
24/12/2021.description: The weather bureau says a tropical low may intensify into a cyclone offshore on Boxing Day, with damaging winds expected from Point Stuart in the Northern Territory to Kalumburu in WA from tomorrow night.
24/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick and Jacqueline Breen

24/12/2021.headline: Rapid antigen tests finally rolled out in SA amid surge in COVID case numbers
24/12/2021.description: A ban on rapid antigen testing is finally overturned in South Australia, as health authorities work to combat an eruption of COVID-19 cases and community transmission of the virus.
24/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick and Jacqueline Breen

24/12/2021.headline: Mango growers squeezed, but one variety brought sweet relief
24/12/2021.description: Australia's mango crop is down this year amid labour and cost issues, but one crop has bucked the trend and broken records.
24/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick and Jacqueline Breen

24/12/2021.headline: Alfie is blind and he may never walk, talk or feed himself, so his mum is planning a Christmas sensory feast
24/12/2021.description: For most, Christmas day is about a celebration of life, family, feasting and presents. But for baby Alfie, who is blind, this Christmas will be a sensory explosion of singing, feeling and textures.
24/12/2021.author: Jasmine Hines

24/12/2021.headline: Third woman accuses Sex and the City actor Chris Noth of sexual misconduct
24/12/2021.description: Singer-songwriter Lisa Gentile accuses Sex and the City actor Chris Noth of groping her and threatening to ruin her career if she told anyone.
24/12/2021.author: Jasmine Hines

24/12/2021.headline: Top End prepares for potential Boxing Day cyclone
24/12/2021.description: Emergency services have swung into action in the NT's Top End, where residents are bracing for a possible cyclone this Christmas weekend.
24/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

24/12/2021.headline: I'm in isolation for the second Christmas in a row — but this time I likely have COVID
24/12/2021.description: I'm spending Christmas in bed for the second year in a row. It's becoming tradition, but it's no protest. Last year, I was in bedroom jail as a close contact. This year, I have suspected COVID.
24/12/2021.author: Annika Blau

24/12/2021.headline: Arvind Jolly hopes to be reunited with his family for Christmas — testing delays and grounded flights might dash hopes
24/12/2021.description: Australians share the challenges they face getting a COVID-19 test in the lead-up to Christmas, with wait times and accessibility among their key concerns.
24/12/2021.author: Melissa Maykin and Dan Nancarrow

24/12/2021.headline: Our best long reads of 2021 for your summer reading — with no COVID in sight
24/12/2021.description: From insider trading to Japanese princesses, there's plenty of juicy reads to dive into when you finally get to put your feet up.
24/12/2021.author: Virginia Trioli

24/12/2021.headline: South Korea's President Moon pardons disgraced former president Park amid tight presidential race
24/12/2021.description: Amid a tight presidential race, South Korea's President Moon Jae-in grants a pardon to former president Park Geun-hye, who was in prison after being convicted of corruption.
24/12/2021.author: Virginia Trioli

24/12/2021.headline: Suga from BTS tests positive for COVID-19 after return from US
24/12/2021.description: Suga, songwriter and rapper for K-pop sensation BTS, tests positive for the coronavirus after returning from in-person concerts in the United States but is not showing any symptoms.
24/12/2021.author: Virginia Trioli

24/12/2021.headline: Fire erupts on Bangladeshi ferry, killing 39 and injuring 72
24/12/2021.description: A massive fire has swept through an overcrowded river ferry in southern Bangladesh, leaving dozens dead.
24/12/2021.author: Virginia Trioli

24/12/2021.headline: There's still much to learn about Perth's COVID outbreak. Here's what we do know
24/12/2021.description: The severity of Western Australia's emerging COVID-19 outbreak is still to be revealed, but this is what we know so far.
24/12/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

24/12/2021.headline: 'Unauthorised': Goddess of Democracy statue removed from Hong Kong university
24/12/2021.description: Several depictions of the Goddess of Democracy were removed, which was originally created by Tiananmen protesters as a symbol of their pursuit of democracy in China.
24/12/2021.author: Bridget Judd

24/12/2021.headline: Five new cases linked to backpacker party in Perth
24/12/2021.description: Five people have tested positive to COVID-19 the day after news broke that a French backpacker tested positive after flying to Perth from Queensland almost two weeks ago.
24/12/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

24/12/2021.headline: COVID updates: Here's the latest coronavirus news from around Australia and the world
24/12/2021.description: States continue to report record case numbers, but there are less people in intensive care.
24/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

24/12/2021.headline: 'I love him to bits': The pharmacist making rural life less lonely for social butterflies like Marg
24/12/2021.description: Rural pharmacist Dzung Tran is worried about the number of older people dealing with loneliness and isolation. He wants more non-pharmaceutical options to address this.
24/12/2021.author: Felicity James

24/12/2021.headline: Holiday travellers urged to be cautious as mosquitoes and algae threaten waterways
24/12/2021.description: Ross River virus and potentially toxic blue-green algae have been detected across Victoria.
24/12/2021.author: Felicity James

24/12/2021.headline: Queensland records 765 new COVID-19 cases, no-one in intensive care
24/12/2021.description: Health Minister Yvette D'Ath says Queensland has recorded 765  new cases overnight — another daily case record — with 175 cases confirmed as the Omicron strain.
24/12/2021.author: Felicity James

24/12/2021.headline: Rugby league realises potential of netball partnerships
24/12/2021.description: Aussie Rules has had a close-knit relationship with netball for a long time. Now NRL clubs like the Melbourne Storm and Gold Coast Titans have caught on.
24/12/2021.author: Felicity James

24/12/2021.headline: Omicron is here, so it's time to create a COVID preparation kit
24/12/2021.description: Queensland's Chief Health Officer says there will be "thousands of cases" of coronavirus in the state in coming weeks, so the state government is urging you to put together a COVID preparation kit.
24/12/2021.author: Felicity James

25/12/2021.headline: Western Australia records two new local COVID-19 cases as exposure sites list grows
25/12/2021.description: Western Australia has recorded two new cases of COVID-19, taking the total number of locally acquired cases to seven, with all of them linked to a French backpacker.
25/12/2021.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

25/12/2021.headline: SA records 634 new COVID-19 cases as paramedics called to backfill isolated aged care home staff
25/12/2021.description: An aged care home in Adelaide's north-eastern suburbs is urgently seeking staff over the holidays as 22 residents test positive for COVID-19 and paramedics are called in to work at the facility.
25/12/2021.author: Alice Dempster, Sara Tomevska, and Olivia Mason

25/12/2021.headline: The best new movies to watch at cinemas and stream at home between Boxing Day and New Year's
25/12/2021.description: We're spoiled for choice this summer, with awards-contenders, new movies from writer-directors Aaron Sorkin, Joel Coen and Paul Thomas Anderson - and the latest in the Matrix and Ghostbusters sagas.
25/12/2021.author: Annabel Brady-Brown, Luke Goodsell, Cassie Tongue, and Keva York

25/12/2021.headline: French zoo forced to close after nine wolves escape enclosure
25/12/2021.description: French authorities have temporarily shut a zoo where a pack of nine wolves escaped from their enclosure during visiting hours, forcing members of the public to evacuate.
25/12/2021.author: Annabel Brady-Brown, Luke Goodsell, Cassie Tongue, and Keva York

25/12/2021.headline: South African minister calls for auction of Nelson Mandela's cell key to be cancelled
25/12/2021.description: South Africa's Culture Minister says it is "unfathomable" the key to Nelson Mandela's former cell could be sold, arguing it belongs to the people of South Africa and should be in a museum.
25/12/2021.author: Annabel Brady-Brown, Luke Goodsell, Cassie Tongue, and Keva York

25/12/2021.headline: Positive wastewater detected in Nhulunbuy, Royal Darwin Hospital worker among 19 new COVID cases
25/12/2021.description: The Northern Territory has recorded 19 new coronavirus cases, eight linked to the local outbreak.
25/12/2021.author: Annabel Brady-Brown, Luke Goodsell, Cassie Tongue, and Keva York

25/12/2021.headline: YouTubers raising money for charity break music record held by Beatles and Spice Girls
25/12/2021.description: England husband and wife duo Mark and Roxanne Hoyle, going by the name LadBaby, claim their fourth consecutive Christmas number one song — a coveted spot in the UK.
25/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

25/12/2021.headline: Scott Boland to make debut in Ashes Boxing Day Test against England
25/12/2021.description: The Victorian paceman will make his Test debut on his home track after being named in Australia's side for the Boxing Day Test.
25/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

25/12/2021.headline: Joe Biden cops code-word slur during Christmas Eve calls with children
25/12/2021.description: A US parent creates an awkward moment when he calls out an anti-Biden slogan while the President is speaking with children as part of a Christmas Eve tradition.
25/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

25/12/2021.headline: Thousands of flights cancelled around world as Omicron mars Christmas weekend
25/12/2021.description: COVID-19 wreaks havoc on Christmas weekend travel, with commercial airlines around the world cancelling more than 4,300 flights.
25/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

25/12/2021.headline: This is what happens to your online shopping when you return it — it might make you think twice about what you buy
25/12/2021.description: The pandemic's increased our love of online shopping. But brands and sustainability experts are urging people to think before they buy this sales period, warning of the environmental impact.
25/12/2021.author: Emilia Terzon

25/12/2021.headline: Duchess of Cambridge plays piano for Christmas TV special
25/12/2021.description: Catherine hit the keys alongside Tom Walker in a performance for the Together At Christmas television event filmed at Westminster Abbey.
25/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

25/12/2021.headline: A spoiler-free guide to Matrix Resurrections before you plug back into the genre-defining series
25/12/2021.description: Almost 20 years since the groundbreaking Matrix trilogy came to an end, audiences are preparing to go back down the rabbit hole.
25/12/2021.author: Sarah Motherwell

25/12/2021.headline: Why are people buying up real estate that's not, well, 'real'?
25/12/2021.description: The virtual real estate market in the metaverse is on the rise. So what's the appeal of purchasing online land, and what are the concerns about this unregulated financial spa
25/12/2021.author: Dong Xing

25/12/2021.headline: To learn who's who in the zoo, vets study whose glittery poos are whose
25/12/2021.description: It might not seem glamorous, but sampling animal scats can be a job with a whole lot of sparkle.
25/12/2021.author: Dong Xing

25/12/2021.headline: Jack the Ripper was the world's first true crime obsession. But what if we're wrong about the serial killer?
25/12/2021.description: Jack the Ripper was the original cold case and the reason women were warned against leaving their homes after dark. More than 130 years on, though, historians and sleuths are deconstructing the myth surrounding the man — or men.
25/12/2021.author: Rebecca Armitage

25/12/2021.headline: China is 'obsessed' with the fall of the USSR. Here's how they've avoided the same fate — for now
25/12/2021.description: For 30 years, China has studied the fall of the USSR to avoid a similar collapse. They made three key decisions in Beijing to outlive their ideological cousin.
25/12/2021.author: Rebecca Armitage

25/12/2021.headline: 'PM_Scomo' joins TikTok despite previous criticism of controversial Chinese-owned platform
25/12/2021.description: He's been an accidental star of TikTok for months and now Scott Morrison is on the controversial Chinese-owned social media platform, uploading a selfie video with family pet dog Buddy for his debut message.
25/12/2021.author: Andrew Greene

25/12/2021.headline: Queen's Christmas message pays tribute to the late Prince Philip
25/12/2021.description: The Queen pays tribute to her late husband Prince Philip in her annual Christmas day message, saying this year especially, she understands how the holiday can be hard for those who have lost loved ones.
25/12/2021.author: Andrew Greene

25/12/2021.headline: Is it time we let go of Australia's 'big things'?
25/12/2021.description: With regional tourism opening up again after long COVID lockdowns, what do Australia's "big things" mean to the small towns that maintain them — and are they really the best way of putting our regions on the map?
25/12/2021.author: Andrew Greene

25/12/2021.headline: Each Christmas break, I re-read the perfect novel — here's why you should too
25/12/2021.description: When you read this it will be Boxing Day and I will be reading the novel again. What's more I make a point each year of recommending it to, or even buying a copy of it for, someone, writes Stan Grant.
25/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

25/12/2021.headline: Lockdown in all but name: Omicron slays the festive season, as venues shutdown and staff go without pay
25/12/2021.description: Sudden voluntary closures of pubs and clubs are leaving hospitality workers without the festive pay they were relying on, with no current government support because it didn't mandate the lockdown.
25/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

25/12/2021.headline: Cummins angry after missing out on second Ashes Test
25/12/2021.description: The Australian captain says he was angry after he was forced to miss the second test due to being a close contact of a COVID-19 case, but admits there is no-one to blame for his misfortune.
25/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

25/12/2021.headline: Two yachts pull out of Sydney to Hobart due to COVID-19 concerns
25/12/2021.description: Willow and Maverick 49 withdraw from the 2021 Sydney to Hobart due to COVID-19, leaving 91 yachts to contest Sunday's race.
25/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

25/12/2021.headline: In the wake of the Taliban takeover of Kabul, Afghans push through Europe's snowy Alps toward new lives
25/12/2021.description: When suicide attackers and gunmen massacred crowds flocking to Kabul's airport, they also severed the escape route that Ali Rezaie hoped would take him to a new life abroad, far from the Taliban and their suspicions of well-educated, middle-class people who worked with foreigners in Afghanistan.
25/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

25/12/2021.headline: Churches hold socially distanced services as Australia marks second pandemic Christmas
25/12/2021.description: Socially distanced seating in pews and sermons delivered through face masks mark another Christmas, with thousands flocking to church services around the country despite surging COVID-19 cases.
25/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

25/12/2021.headline: 'He comes and listens': Meet the 'flying padre' uniting isolated towns this Christmas
25/12/2021.description: Since 2003, Padre Dave has been flying to some of Australia's most isolated communities to talk and listen to a scattered flock.
25/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

25/12/2021.headline: Police find body of jet ski rider 'violently' thrown into Sydney waters
25/12/2021.description: Police are trying to determine what caused three men to be "catapulted" off a jet ski in south Sydney on Friday, killing the only rider on board who was not wearing a life jacket.
25/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

25/12/2021.headline: Satellite images show Russian military build-up near Ukraine borders
25/12/2021.description: New satellite images show Russia has continued to build up its forces in annexed Crimea and near Ukraine in recent weeks — while pressing the United States for talks over security guarantees.
25/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

25/12/2021.headline: New daily record for COVID cases in Tasmania, but none in ICU
25/12/2021.description: Tasmania records 44 new COVID-19 cases, a new daily high — but no cases are currently being treated in intensive care.
25/12/2021.author: Adam Langenberg

25/12/2021.headline: Why is this famous pop band sending vintage clothes to outback WA?
25/12/2021.description: Aria-award winners Sheppard are giving an outback op shop some serious sparkle, thanks to their wardrobe collected from world tours.
25/12/2021.author: Elsa Silberstein

25/12/2021.headline: Women and children among dozens reported killed in Myanmar Christmas Eve massacre
25/12/2021.description: Myanmar government troops round up villagers, some believed to be women and children, fatally shooting at least 38 and burning the bodies, according to reports.
25/12/2021.author: Elsa Silberstein

25/12/2021.headline: England skittled for 185 on Boxing Day as Aussies start third Test in style
25/12/2021.description: Already leading the series 2-0, Australia bowls England out for 185 to kick off the third Ashes Test at the MCG on Boxing Day.
25/12/2021.author: Dean Bilton and Simon Smale

26/12/2021.headline: Line honours favourite LawConnect leads Sydney to Hobart on day one as fleet heads south
26/12/2021.description: The three favoured supermaxis head the race for line honours in the Sydney to Hobart yacht race, with LawConnect making the most of conditions going into the first evening's run down the NSW coast.
26/12/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

26/12/2021.headline: Archbishop Desmond Tutu, South African anti-apartheid activist and Nobel Peace laureate, dies aged 90
26/12/2021.description: Desmond Tutu, Nobel Peace Prize laureate and veteran of South Africa's struggle against white minority rule, has died.
26/12/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

26/12/2021.headline: WA records one new local case of COVID-19 following Perth Mess Hall rave
26/12/2021.description: Western Australia has recorded one new case of COVID-19 — detected in a person who attended the Perth Mess Hall event and who had also been staying at the Fremantle hostel linked to the cluster.
26/12/2021.author: Kate Christian, Lucy Martin, and Tom Wildie

26/12/2021.headline: Darwin has 'coolest Christmas Day on record', as heavy rainfall and flooding is forecast across the Top End
26/12/2021.description: Heavy rainfall, flash flooding and damaging winds are expected across the Top End over the next two days after Darwin experienced its coolest Christmas Day on record.
26/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

26/12/2021.headline: 'We sincerely apologise': 400 COVID-positive cases wrongly told they are negative by Sydney clinic
26/12/2021.description: Sydney’s St Vincent’s Hospital's pathology service incorrectly messages 400 people to tell them they have tested negative to COVID-19 when they had tested positive.
26/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

26/12/2021.headline: China's local COVID case count spikes, driven by Xi'an outbreak
26/12/2021.description: China reports its highest daily rise in locally acquired COVID-19 cases in 21 months as infections more than double in the locked down hot spot of Xi'an.
26/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

26/12/2021.headline: 'A despicable act': Police investigating brazen theft of five Guide Dogs Victoria vans on Christmas
26/12/2021.description: Five vans used by Guide Dogs Victoria to transport puppies in training and provide services are stolen from Kew overnight.
26/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

26/12/2021.headline: NT records 12 new COVID-19 cases, including four linked to current outbreak
26/12/2021.description: The Northern Territory records 12 new cases of COVID-19, including two local cases in Tennant Creek and two in Katherine.
26/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

26/12/2021.headline: Perth could be in for hottest ever December day after setting new Christmas Day record
26/12/2021.description: After sweltering through the hottest-ever Christmas Day yesterday, Perth could be in for its hottest December day on record today, and there won't be a cool change until Wednesday.
26/12/2021.author: Kate Christian

26/12/2021.headline: 'The best Christmas present': Volcano eruption declared over amid scenes of destruction
26/12/2021.description: After 100 days of activity, the Cumbre Vieja eruption on Spain's La Palma has officially ceased as attention shifts to reconstructing the island.
26/12/2021.author: Kate Christian

26/12/2021.headline: 'Disaster after disaster': SA government under fire as state again sets new COVID caseload record
26/12/2021.description: As South Australia sets another daily record, with 774 new COVID-19 cases, the SA government announces new restrictions for hospitality venues, gyms and home gatherings.
26/12/2021.author: Daniel Keane and Tom Fedorowytsch

26/12/2021.headline: Why not try a 'rainbow diet'? It's good for you
26/12/2021.description: Health experts are urging Australians to add a splash of colour to their diet —  and new, vibrant breeds of vegetables are becoming available to make that task easier.
26/12/2021.author: Jane McNaughton

26/12/2021.headline: 'Power through bullets not ballots': Taliban scrap Afghan election commission
26/12/2021.description: The Taliban dissolve Afghanistan's election commission, a panel that supervised polls during the previous Western-backed administration.
26/12/2021.author: Jane McNaughton

26/12/2021.headline: Shoppers rush in for Boxing Day bargains with record sales figures expected
26/12/2021.description: Australians are expected to splash more than $21 billion during the Boxing Day sales period.
26/12/2021.author: Jane McNaughton

26/12/2021.headline: Line honours contender SHK Scallywag overcomes sail trouble on day one of the Sydney to Hobart, as it happened
26/12/2021.description: One of the three main contenders for Sydney to Hobart line honours, SHK Scallywag, hits early trouble with a sail problem, but it's a close race with LawConnect ahead as the fleet heads south entering night one. Look back on all the action.
26/12/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

26/12/2021.headline: Boxing Day Ashes Test at MCG live scorecard
26/12/2021.description: Follow the live scores and statistics from the third Ashes Test between Australia and England in Melbourne.
26/12/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

26/12/2021.headline: From Yirrkala to university: Remote NT students graduate with ATARs, prepare for first year uni
26/12/2021.description: Kenisha Winunguj is a long way from her home in the remote community of Yirrkala in East Arnhem Land, but she is looking forward to entering her first year of university.
26/12/2021.author: Housnia Shams

26/12/2021.headline: Former England captain Ray Illingworth dies aged 89
26/12/2021.description: Ray Illingworth, who played 61 Test matches, is remembered as a superb, passionate and knowledgeable cricketer.
26/12/2021.author: Housnia Shams

26/12/2021.headline: Police investigate Christmas Day road and water deaths in SA
26/12/2021.description: A pedestrian was killed overnight when she was hit by a car on SA's Yorke Peninsula. SA Police also responded to a drowning at Port Elliot, and a stabbing in Adelaide's north.
26/12/2021.author: Housnia Shams

26/12/2021.headline: Queensland records 714 new COVID-19 cases, but numbers likely to spike in coming days
26/12/2021.description: Queensland records 714 new cases of COVID-19, with the dip in numbers likely due to fewer tests on Christmas Day.  Authorities say numbers are likely to get "substantially higher" in coming days.
26/12/2021.author: Housnia Shams

26/12/2021.headline: In 1983, this man murdered five people at an Uluru motel. In 2022, he could walk free
26/12/2021.description: Douglas Crabbe was found guilty of one of modern Australia's worst mass murders after he rammed into an Alice Springs motel with his Mack truck, killing five people. Now, nearly 40 years later, survivors are rallying against his potential release.
26/12/2021.author: Matt Garrick

26/12/2021.headline: Get too much sun over Christmas? Here's how to ease red and itchy sunburn
26/12/2021.description: Some skin types can burn within 10 minutes of being unprotected in the sun, although prevention is something everyone should do. But what happens when it's too late and you've woken up looking like a lobster?
26/12/2021.author: Sarah Motherwell

26/12/2021.headline: Pauline and Christy's cancelled US trip left them with a $4,500 flight credit they couldn't use
26/12/2021.description: Flight plans disrupted by the pandemic have left hundreds of thousands of Australians with millions of dollars of flight credits — some of which may never be claimed.
26/12/2021.author: Samuel Yang

26/12/2021.headline: QR check-ins and two-metre rule mandatory in NSW from today
26/12/2021.description: Some COVID-19 restrictions return to NSW as soaring infection numbers furlough about 2,000 healthcare workers and the Health Minister warns "we're all going to get Omicron".
26/12/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

26/12/2021.headline: What Australia can learn from Desmond Tutu, a man who defied history
26/12/2021.description: South Africa's flamboyant archbishop was a giant who appealed to our better angels when politicians often catered to our worst and Australia could learn from following his example, writes Stan Grant.
26/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

26/12/2021.headline: From fashion icons to TV trailblazers, we lost some remarkable Australians this year
26/12/2021.description: From a fashion designer to a Holocaust survivor, take a look back at some of the well-known Australians who died in 2021
26/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

26/12/2021.headline: Inside courtroom 318, a jury heard a controversial theory about Ghislaine Maxwell's alleged victims
26/12/2021.description: In the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, the court is examining, for the first time, the nature of incredibly complex and confusing traumatic memories — including hearing from a controversial psychologist.
26/12/2021.author: Stan Grant

26/12/2021.headline: 'The wobbly wheel in the Federation': Will the divides between states continue in a post-COVID Australia?
26/12/2021.description: Australia’s Federation has always been an uneasy alliance, some historians say. After all, the nation was a little over three decades old when Western Australia voted to secede.
26/12/2021.author: Simon Leo Brown and Georgia Power

26/12/2021.headline: How to fight a variant: This might be the hopeful COVID story you are looking for right now
26/12/2021.description: Variant-proof vaccines are the next great goal in efforts to control COVID-19 and while there is a log way to go these Australian scientists are closing in on the answers, with a little help from genetically engineered mice.
26/12/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

26/12/2021.headline: Women in Afghanistan require male chaperone for travel says Taliban
26/12/2021.description: Afghanistan's Taliban authorities say women seeking to travel anything other than short distances should not be offered transport unless they are accompanied by a close male relative and wear a hijab.
26/12/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

26/12/2021.headline: Australia's Ashes dominance is a product of red-ball priorities that England lacks
26/12/2021.description: As Australia continues to dominate the Ashes, its prioritisation of Sheffield Shield performances is proving equally as decisive in England's struggles as the mismatch in batting talent, writes Russell Jackson.
26/12/2021.author: Russell Jackson

26/12/2021.headline: Lives under threat as fire destroys structures in Wooroloo east of Perth
26/12/2021.description: A fire has destroyed multiple structures in Wooroloo east of Perth as the out-of-control blaze continues to threaten lives and homes.
26/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke and Tom Wildie

26/12/2021.headline: Desmond Tutu remembered as South Africa's conscience beyond the apartheid era
26/12/2021.description: Archbishop Emeritus Desmond Tutu described voting in South Africa's first democratic election in 1994 as "like falling in love", a remark that is being remembered after his death at the age of 90.
26/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke and Tom Wildie

26/12/2021.headline: Black Jack leads from line honours favourite LawConnect in Sydney to Hobart as fleet heads south
26/12/2021.description: Black Jack makes the most of challenging conditions down the NSW coast to overtake LawConnect in the battle for line honours and build a handy lead going into the second day of the race.
26/12/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

26/12/2021.headline: WA records one new local case of COVID-19, as doctors warn against early border reopening
26/12/2021.description: Western Australia has recorded one new case of COVID-19 — detected in a person who attended the Perth Mess Hall event and who had also been staying at the Fremantle hostel linked to the cluster.
26/12/2021.author: Kate Christian, Lucy Martin, and Tom Wildie

26/12/2021.headline: 'Every symptom I've had is COVID': 400 cases wrongly told they are negative by Sydney clinic
26/12/2021.description: Sydney’s St Vincent’s Hospital's pathology service incorrectly messages 400 people to tell them they have tested negative to COVID-19 when they had tested positive.
26/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

26/12/2021.headline: Premier League fixtures deliver Boxing Day goalfest as Manchester City extends lead at the top
26/12/2021.description: The Premier League delivers a gift to fans of high-scoring games, with 28 goals from six matches on the Boxing Day fixture list, topped by a nine-goal shootout between Manchester City and Leicester.
26/12/2021.author: Lucy Stone and Melanie Vujkovic

26/12/2021.headline: ACT authorities block access to 'travel tests' as Canberra's COVID-19 clinics are overwhelmed
26/12/2021.description: All of the ACT's testing clinics reached capacity early today despite the government closing its main sites to people seeking interstate travel tests, in a bid to stem demand.
26/12/2021.author: Markus Mannheim

26/12/2021.headline: France, England resist lockdowns despite soaring COVID cases as European neighbours implement curbs
26/12/2021.description: The Dutch government goes further than most European countries and shuts down all non-essential shops, restaurants and bars.
26/12/2021.author: Markus Mannheim

26/12/2021.headline: English support staff and family members test positive as COVID hits Ashes squad, TV commentary team
26/12/2021.description: England's troubled Ashes tour is thrown into more turmoil after positive COVID tests in the tourists' camp, while Channel Seven commentators are being sent into isolation.
26/12/2021.author: Markus Mannheim

26/12/2021.headline: Flurry of late wickets leaves England in deep hole after day two of MCG Ashes Test
26/12/2021.description: Mitchell Starc takes two wickets in two balls to give Australia the perfect start to the second innings before Scott Boland follows up with two in three balls to heap more pain onto the English team.
26/12/2021.author: Dean Bilton and Simon Smale

26/12/2021.headline: Victoria clarifies 'unclear' testing texts sent to COVID contacts as 1,999 new infections recorded
26/12/2021.description: The health department clarifies text messages sent to people who were potentially exposed to COVID-19, confirming they must get a PCR test to clear quarantine requirements.
26/12/2021.author: Dean Bilton and Simon Smale

26/12/2021.headline: First came the bushfires, then the deer. How will these rainforests recover?
26/12/2021.description: With 1 million deer in Victoria and numbers growing, the level of damage to rainforest canopy trees in fire-affected regions is extreme.
26/12/2021.author: Anne Simmons

26/12/2021.headline: 'This was unexpected': Thousands of flights cancelled across globe due to Omicron spread
26/12/2021.description: Around the world, some 7,500 flights were grounded and tens of thousands more delayed from Friday to Sunday — one of the busiest travel periods of the year.
26/12/2021.author: Anne Simmons

26/12/2021.headline: Holiday rush piles pressure on COVID testers as governments faulted for lack of planning
26/12/2021.description: Here's a quick wrap of what's happening in COVID news to get you up to speed fast.
26/12/2021.author: Anne Simmons

26/12/2021.headline: First images emerge of trail of destruction left by bushfire east of Perth
26/12/2021.description: Pictures reveal the scale of devastation caused by a blaze that ripped through Wooroloo east of Perth yesterday, with at least one home and several sheds burnt to the ground.
26/12/2021.author: Lana Taranto, Keane Bourke, and Jacob Kagi

26/12/2021.headline: Young family leaves the rental market rat race for tiny house outside the city
26/12/2021.description: Hoping to save for a house deposit, the Harris family made the decision to leave Canberra altogether and invest in a tiny house for five years. It's a step that's brought them closer together, and one they hope will mean they can one day enter the surging Australian property market.
26/12/2021.author: Niki Burnside

27/12/2021.headline: Waiting six days to learn if you're infected: This is what NSW's COVID testing service looks like under pressure
27/12/2021.description: Once praised for being able to turn around a COVID-19 swab result in hours, NSW pathology services have come under immense criticism for delays and errors as people ask, how did it get so bad?
27/12/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

27/12/2021.headline: Melbourne Victory top A-League Men's as COVID causes chaos
27/12/2021.description: Just two A-League Men's games go ahead over the Christmas period after a number of clubs report positive COVID -19 cases.
27/12/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

27/12/2021.headline: 'It was fear for her safety': US families bring elderly home from facilities amid pandemic
27/12/2021.description: As the pandemic continues in the US, many families are making the decision to take loved ones out of nursing homes, feeling powerless against fierce lockdown measures amid allegations of elder neglect.
27/12/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

27/12/2021.headline: Tributes flow for woman allegedly murdered by ex-husband on Christmas Day
27/12/2021.description: The daughter of a Tasmanian woman who was allegedly murdered by her ex-husband on Christmas Day has posted a tribute on Facebook, telling her mother she loves and misses her.
27/12/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

27/12/2021.headline: Woman, 94, becomes SA's fifth person to die with COVID as state records 842 new cases
27/12/2021.description: The woman becomes the first COVID-positive person to die in South Australia since the death of a man linked to the Ruby Princess cluster in April last year. Meanwhile, the state again sets a daily case record.
27/12/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

27/12/2021.headline: Tasmanian COVID focus shifts away from casual contacts, as 35 new cases identified
27/12/2021.description: Tasmanians are being urged to treat COVID-19 as if it is widespread "in all settings", as changes to contact tracing are announced.
27/12/2021.author: Loretta Lohberger

27/12/2021.headline: Face masks to stay for New Year's Eve in Perth as COVID restrictions extended amid one new case
27/12/2021.description: Perth's mask mandate and hospitality COVID-19 restrictions will remain for another week, with Western Australia recording one new case linked to an infected French backpacker.
27/12/2021.author: Lana Taranto, Jacob Kagi, and Lucy Martin

27/12/2021.headline: Police ferrying injured patients to hospital as paramedics preoccupied with COVID onslaught, union says
27/12/2021.description: South Australia's health system is currently so focused on COVID-19 cases that police officers are being forced to act as paramedics by ferrying patients with head and other injuries to hospital, the ambulance union says.
27/12/2021.author: Lana Taranto, Jacob Kagi, and Lucy Martin

27/12/2021.headline: Manly can't ask for another Trbojevic miracle
27/12/2021.description: It's not fair for Manly to ask Tom Trbojevic for another miracle, but how else can the Sea Eagles compete with the best teams in the NRL?
27/12/2021.author: Lana Taranto, Jacob Kagi, and Lucy Martin

27/12/2021.headline: NT records 12 new COVID-19 cases, two men accused of skipping quarantine fined more than $5000 each
27/12/2021.description: Authorities say they are still investigating the source of infection for one new case in Darwin, with positive cases also confirmed in five interstate arrivals and two people from the Tennant Creek area.
27/12/2021.author: Lana Taranto, Jacob Kagi, and Lucy Martin

27/12/2021.headline: Lockdown not likely, SA Premier insists, as businesses issue compo call amid 'devastating jump back'
27/12/2021.description: As South Australia's peak business body and hotel lobby push for financial support for the hospitality sector amid renewed restrictions, Premier Steven Marshall says there was no "crystal ball" to have foreseen the rapid spread of Omicron.
27/12/2021.author: Lana Taranto, Jacob Kagi, and Lucy Martin

27/12/2021.headline: 'He just wanted to breed a few of them, and it got out of control': Hundreds of parakeets surrendered to US animal shelter
27/12/2021.description: An animal shelter in the US receives an unexpected Christmas present when the son of a bird hoarder brings in hundreds of caged parakeets.
27/12/2021.author: Lana Taranto, Jacob Kagi, and Lucy Martin

27/12/2021.headline: Queensland records 784 new cases of COVID-19, testing capacity to increase in next few days
27/12/2021.description: Queensland records 784 new cases of COVID-19 as the Premier announces testing capacity will increase at Metro North, Metro South, the Gold Coast and Cairns.
27/12/2021.author: Lucy Stone and Melanie Vujkovic

27/12/2021.headline: 'The original Google Street View': Corley photographic collection of Queensland houses needs your help
27/12/2021.description: More than 60,000 of images of Queensland homes are featured online by the State Library of Queensland, but 10,000 properties still need to be identified, with the public encouraged to add locations and their memories to the digital collection.
27/12/2021.author: Sally Eeles

27/12/2021.headline: Meet Eddie the rare white emu who tries to 'buck up' like a poddy calf
27/12/2021.description: Eddie's dad left her for dead. Eight years on, the white emu spends her days swimming, chasing snakes, rolling in mud and hanging out with her best buddies — poddy calves.
27/12/2021.author: Erin Semmler and Paul Culliver

27/12/2021.headline: Hazzard slams 'recalcitrant' Palaszczuk over testing rules for visitors to Queensland
27/12/2021.description: NSW Health Minister Brad Hazzard slams Queensland's requirement for incoming travellers to get tested for COVID-19, saying it's putting unnecessary stress on his state's testing capacity.
27/12/2021.author: Jessica Rendall

27/12/2021.headline: China is on the defensive, but can it win back global opinion?
27/12/2021.description: The Beijing Winter Olympics are only weeks away and China has been forced on the defensive by a diplomatic boycott called by the US, UK, Australia and other western countries, writes Jennifer Y.J. Hsu.
27/12/2021.author: Jessica Rendall

27/12/2021.headline: Kate Perry spent a 'heartbreaking' Christmas without family due to COVID testing delays. She's not alone
27/12/2021.description: Testing delays disrupt holiday plans as some people are left isolating for days with pathology services under strain from increased demand.
27/12/2021.author: Prianka Srinivasan, Oliver Gordon, and Kevin Nguyen

27/12/2021.headline: Black Jack snatches lead as supermaxis do battle off Tasmania's east coast
27/12/2021.description: Supermaxi Black Jack surges ahead to snatch back the lead in the Sydney to Hobart as the first yachts reach Tasmania's east coast.
27/12/2021.author: Alexandra Humphries

27/12/2021.headline: 'Everything screamed positive': Sydney couple caught up in testing bungle fear big spike in cases
27/12/2021.description: Tara and Joven were so doubtful of the negative COVID-19 test result they received from SydPath, they waited seven hours in their car to get retested. They say not everyone would have questioned their result and more cases are inevitable.
27/12/2021.author: Ursula Malone

27/12/2021.headline: 'Cant believe it happened here': Photographer captures twister aftermath on Kentucky hometown
27/12/2021.description: A photographer recounts her visit back home to West Kentucky after a tornado ripped open her hometown full of happy memories.
27/12/2021.author: Ursula Malone

27/12/2021.headline: COVID is airborne and out in the community. Here's how good ventilation can make public spaces safer
27/12/2021.description: Some public places have a higher risk of airborne transmission than others, but there are measures business owners can take to improve the air quality in their premises and lower the risk of customers and staff becoming infected.
27/12/2021.author: Mary Lloyd

27/12/2021.headline: Want to feel good about yourself while making money? Try ethical investing
27/12/2021.description: Australians are piling into what's known as ethical or responsible investing — and it's said to be a trillion-dollar industry. Let's take a look at how it works.
27/12/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

27/12/2021.headline: Echidnas use their beak as a snorkel — and other weird animal facts
27/12/2021.description: Platypuses and echidnas have to take the cake for being the weirdest Australian animals.
27/12/2021.author: Anna Salleh

27/12/2021.headline: Ardern is trying to lock Omicron out, but NZ border policies will be challenged in court
27/12/2021.description: Jacinda Ardern's government is trying to prevent the spread of Omicron to allow time for New Zealand's population to get booster shots, but the border restrictions are about to be challenged in court.
27/12/2021.author: Emily Clark

27/12/2021.headline: In another year of relentless COVID news, here are the top 20 non-pandemic stories you clicked on
27/12/2021.description: It's been another wild, and dare we say unprecedented, year of news. From unspeakable tragedy to unbridled relief and everything in between, here are the year's most-read stories as chosen by you.
27/12/2021.author: Emily Clark

27/12/2021.headline: Mother Teresa's charity in Bengal has bank accounts frozen after protests following Christmas celebrations
27/12/2021.description: The bank accounts of Mother Teresa's Missionaries of Charity in West Bengal are frozen after protests following Christmas celebrations.
27/12/2021.author: Emily Clark

27/12/2021.headline: Queen assassination pledge video under investigation, British police say
27/12/2021.description: A video obtained by The Sun newspaper appears to show a masked person in a dark hoodie holding a crossbow and addressing the camera with a distorted voice, saying they want to "assassinate" the Queen.
27/12/2021.author: Emily Clark

27/12/2021.headline: Somalia's President accused of mounting an 'indirect coup' after suspending the Prime Minister
27/12/2021.description: President Mohamed Abdullahi Mohamed accuses Prime Minister Mohammed Hussein Roble of stealing land owned by the Somali National Army and of interfering with a defence ministry investigation.
27/12/2021.author: Emily Clark

27/12/2021.headline: Nicole Kidman says she was depressed playing Virginia Woolf in The Hours
27/12/2021.description: Nicole Kidman says she was suffering from depression and felt like she was "not in her own body" while playing the role of writer Virginia Woolf.
27/12/2021.author: Emily Clark

27/12/2021.headline: Isolation time slashed for NSW healthcare staff exposed to COVID in bid to address shortages
27/12/2021.description: With about 2,000 healthcare staff off work due to COVID-19, health authorities dramatically reduce the length of time they need to isolate after being exposed to the virus.
27/12/2021.author: Jean Kennedy

27/12/2021.headline: Environmentalists fear for Komodo dragon as Indonesia pushes tourism
27/12/2021.description: Environmentalists and locals fear plans for new tourism hubs will threaten wildlife and the natural beauty that is a major tourism draw for Indonesia's islands.
27/12/2021.author: Jean Kennedy

27/12/2021.headline: Sky Blues held to first ALW season draw by stubborn Wanderers
27/12/2021.description: Ladder-leaders Sydney FC are held to a goalless draw by a struggling Wanderers at Leichhardt Oval despite derby dominance.
27/12/2021.author: Jean Kennedy

27/12/2021.headline: England's James Anderson winds back the clock as England question their future
27/12/2021.description: England collapsed late on the second day of the Boxing Day Test, but the hero of the moment was James Anderson, who wound back the clock with a vintage performance.
27/12/2021.author: Russell Jackson

27/12/2021.headline: Trip to shops ends in heartache for 77-year-old widow as bushfire destroys home and 'all her memories'
27/12/2021.description: A home owned by the same family for almost 40 years is gutted by a bushfire that tore through a semi-rural area on the fringes of Perth, with an emergency warning for the blaze since downgraded.
27/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke

27/12/2021.headline: Dallas Buyers Club director Jean-Marc Vallée dies aged 58
27/12/2021.description: Canadian filmmaker Jean-Marc Vallée, acclaimed for his naturalistic approach in directing stars including Reese Witherspoon, Nicole Kidman, Amy Adams and Jake Gyllenhaal, has died.
27/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke

27/12/2021.headline: Edward O Wilson, biologist known as 'Darwin's heir' and 'ant man,' dead at 92
27/12/2021.description: American biologist Edward O Wilson, a twice Pulitzer Prize-winning author who caused a storm by theorising that sexism, racism and violence were in part genetic, has died.
27/12/2021.author: Melanie Vujkovic and Lucy Stone

27/12/2021.headline: This town wants $10m from a mining company for backflipping on a port-use deal
27/12/2021.description: The small Kimberley town of Derby has sent a bill for $10 million to mining company Kimberley Mineral Sands for changing its mind over a deal to use its port.
27/12/2021.author: Ben Collins

28/12/2021.headline: 'Hopeless situation': Regional health system buckles as COVID-19 PCR test demand soars
28/12/2021.description: From hopeful holidaymakers to close contacts, thousands of people are sleeping in cars and queuing in the pre-dawn dark to get PCR tests across the state.
28/12/2021.author: Claudia Jambor, Alexandra Jones, Emma Rennie, and Alex Hargraves

28/12/2021.headline: Perrottet defends handling of Omicron outbreak despite rising cases and testing chaos
28/12/2021.description: NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet says the state is in a "strong position" despite the Omicron COVID-19 outbreak, standing by his choice to proceed with relaxing restrictions on December 15.
28/12/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

28/12/2021.headline: Seven-year-old girl sexually assaulted at home in Perth after going to bed on Boxing Day night
28/12/2021.description: WA Police appeal for information from the public after a 7-year-old girl is sexually assaulted at her home in Perth's north-east, with a window flyscreen and a pyjama top missing from the house.
28/12/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

28/12/2021.headline: US halves isolation time for asymptomatic COVID cases
28/12/2021.description: United States health officials ease isolation restrictions for Americans with asymptomatic cases of COVID-19 from 10 to five days and shorten time that close contacts need to quarantine.
28/12/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

28/12/2021.headline: England's Ashes humiliation a long time coming
28/12/2021.description: England have not been good enough with the ball, in the field or, most tellingly, with the bat in this Ashes series. But these are not new issues for England.
28/12/2021.author: Simon Smale

28/12/2021.headline: Manchester United blasted after 1-1 draw with Newcastle
28/12/2021.description: Manchester United miss the chance to go to fifth spot in the English Premier League after being held to a 1-1 draw by second-last Newcastle United at St. James' Park.
28/12/2021.author: Simon Smale

28/12/2021.headline: South Australia daily case count hits 995, 'doubling every three to four days'
28/12/2021.description: South Australia has broken its daily COVID-19 case count record for the third day running, with Premier Steven Marshall saying the number is "doubling every three to four days". The number of people in hospital has jumped to 36.
28/12/2021.author: Daniel Keane and Tom Fedorowytsch

28/12/2021.headline: Three NBL games postponed due to COVID-19 outbreak
28/12/2021.description: Another three NBL games have been postponed because of positive COVID-19 cases among Adelaide 36ers and Brisbane Bullets teams.
28/12/2021.author: Daniel Keane and Tom Fedorowytsch

28/12/2021.headline: Police praise young brother and sister for surviving overnight in NSW bushland
28/12/2021.description: A brother and sister from Sydney have been reunited with their family after spending a night in rugged NSW bushland.
28/12/2021.author: Joanna Woodburn

28/12/2021.headline: A-League Women's Wrap: A killer Kiwi, goalkeeper gaps, and derby delight
28/12/2021.description: Two topsy-turvy derbies, the ethics of hair-pulling, and concerns over goalkeeper depth: Samantha Lewis wraps up round four of the A-League Women's competition.
28/12/2021.author: Samantha Lewis

28/12/2021.headline: Details of months-long battle over Victorian contact tracing data made public
28/12/2021.description: The details of a protracted legal battle between the Victorian health department and workplace safety watchdog over citizens' personal contact tracing information are made public after a failed government bid to suppress the proceedings.
28/12/2021.author: Yara Murray-Atfield

28/12/2021.headline: Menulog driver who didn't check in loses discrimination claim against sushi restaurant
28/12/2021.description: An Adelaide food delivery driver's claim that he suffered discrimination at the hands of a sushi bar, after he failed to comply with its QR code check-in requirements, has been knocked back by a South Australian tribunal.
28/12/2021.author: Daniel Keane

28/12/2021.headline: The 24 balls that etched Scott Boland's name in Ashes folklore
28/12/2021.description: In the space of just four incredible overs, Scott Boland created an Ashes memory that will live on through history. This is how the debutant Victorian did it.
28/12/2021.author: Dean Bilton

28/12/2021.headline: WA records no new local COVID cases as doctors raise fears 'unknown quantity' yet to be tested
28/12/2021.description: The number of coronavirus cases stemming from a rave party in Perth remains at 10, but 46 close contacts of the French backpacker who sparked the outbreak are yet to be tested.
28/12/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

28/12/2021.headline: Exposure site classifications change as ACT records 252 new COVID-19 cases
28/12/2021.description: Wait times at testing sites have caused multiple incidents attended by ACT Policing, who are urging Canberrans to be patient while in the long queues as the ACT records 252 new cases of COVID-19, with three people hospitalised with the virus.
28/12/2021.author: Charlotte Gore

28/12/2021.headline: Severe weather lashes the Top End as tropical low moves east
28/12/2021.description: The Bureau of Meteorology NT has warned communities in eastern parts of the Top End to brace for heavy rain, strong winds and high tides as a low moves across the region.
28/12/2021.author: Mitchell Abram

28/12/2021.headline: Scott Boland's journey from one of the least glamorous Victorian club sides to an Ashes hero
28/12/2021.description: Victorian fast bowler Scott Boland took 6-7 to rout England for 68 and secure Australia an unassailable 3-0 lead in the Ashes, but the tourists' batting woes stretch well beyond this Ashes series, writes Russell Jackson.
28/12/2021.author: Russell Jackson

28/12/2021.headline: 'We're not letting COVID rip': Community transmission confirmed in Darwin, health minister defends response
28/12/2021.description: The Northern Territory has recorded 16 new cases of COVID-19, including nine in interstate arrivals and their close contacts, five connected to the ongoing local outbreak and two of unknown origin.
28/12/2021.author: Jacqueline Breen

28/12/2021.headline: France announces new COVID restrictions as UK pledges none for England until 2022
28/12/2021.description: Both the British and French governments resist drastic restrictions ahead of New Year's Eve despite high COVID case numbers.
28/12/2021.author: Jacqueline Breen

28/12/2021.headline: 'The only thing it doesn't do is harvest': Drone-planted sunflower crop could be world's first
28/12/2021.description: Queensland's newest tourism attraction is a sunflower farm south-west of Toowoomba that has been planted using cutting edge technology in what the grower says is a world first.
28/12/2021.author: Georgie Hewson

28/12/2021.headline: Perth endures fourth straight 40C scorcher as power remains off for thousands of homes
28/12/2021.description: Some 2,600 properties remain blacked out as the temperature in Perth hits 40C for a fourth straight day, with the Energy Minister apologising for the outages and ordering a review.
28/12/2021.author: Abby Richards and Kate Christian

28/12/2021.headline: Day five testing requirement scrapped as Queensland records 1,158 new cases
28/12/2021.description: Queensland's Health Minister axes the requirement for travellers to get a PCR test on their fifth day in the state, with anyone currently lining up for the test told they can leave.
28/12/2021.author: Melanie Vujkovic and Lucy Stone

28/12/2021.headline: Queenslanders crowdsource contact tracing as state scales back exposure site listings
28/12/2021.description: As Queensland shifts its approach to publishing contact tracing sites, some residents are making their own contact tracing groups on social media.
28/12/2021.author: Lucy Stone

28/12/2021.headline: Bindi Irwin reveals what helped her cope after loss of her dad
28/12/2021.description: Conservationist and Australian personality Bindi Irwin has given insight into how she has coped since the tragic death of her father, "Crocodile Hunter" Steve Irwin.
28/12/2021.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

28/12/2021.headline: Rachel High lives with Down syndrome and has just earned a bachelor's degree
28/12/2021.description: Flinders University believes Rachel High to be the first person living with Down syndrome to graduate with a university degree in Australia.
28/12/2021.author: Isabel Dayman

28/12/2021.headline: COVID-19 has changed our ethics. Here's how
28/12/2021.description: Over the past two years, our lives have changed in unprecedented ways. In the face of the pandemic, we have been required to obey demanding new rules and accept new risks, making enormous changes to our daily liv
28/12/2021.author: Isabel Dayman

28/12/2021.headline: 'New Year's Eve should be free and fun': The cost of watching Sydney's fireworks from some public parks
28/12/2021.description: While COVID has put an end to the days of crowds packing in around the harbour to watch Sydney's New Year's Eve fireworks, the NSW government's 'pay-to-view' model is accused of profiting off what was once a free event.
28/12/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

28/12/2021.headline: Queensland's COVID-19 testing rules make 'no scientific sense', expert warns, as tourism industry welcomes easing regulations
28/12/2021.description: Queensland's watered-down new COVID-19 testing regime fails to account for the faster infection time of Omicron, warns leading infectious diseases expert Mary-Louise McLaws.
28/12/2021.author: Rory Callinan

28/12/2021.headline: After an imperfect two years for Aussie men's cricket, it took less than 12 days to retain the Ashes
28/12/2021.description: The Ashes should only be halfway over, but Australia has already retained the urn and is going for another clean sweep. It's pretty remarkable, considering the lead-up to the series the team had.
28/12/2021.author: Jon Healy

28/12/2021.headline: Are China-Australia relations in a 'death spiral'? What can we expect in 2022?
28/12/2021.description: Next year will mark 50 years since Australia established diplomatic ties with China, but the relationship has rapidly deteriorated in recent times.
28/12/2021.author: Erin Handley

28/12/2021.headline: Why Tasmanians can expect less, not more government intervention as COVID cases rise
28/12/2021.description: In October, half of Tasmania was sent into a lockdown because of one COVID-19 infected man's incursion into the suburbs. Two months on and the messaging from authorities is very different, writes James Dunlevie.
28/12/2021.author: James Dunlevie

28/12/2021.headline: The baroness, the chartered jet and the daring plan to spirit these judges out of Afghanistan
28/12/2021.description: After the Taliban emptied Afghanistan's prisons, more than 250 judges suddenly found themselves in mortal danger. As the people they put behind bars began enacting their revenge, a daring escape plan was formed.
28/12/2021.author: Steve Cannane

28/12/2021.headline: Will the economic 'roller coaster' continue in 2022? Here's what these experts think
28/12/2021.description: These are the top eight things these five leading economists expect to happen in 2022.
28/12/2021.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

28/12/2021.headline: The last Wailer, a prince and a Charlie's Angel: Here are some of the famous faces we lost this year
28/12/2021.description: From award-wining stars of the big and small screen to a member of the British royal family, we take a look back at the legends and leaders we lost this year.
28/12/2021.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

28/12/2021.headline: 'We gave it everything': Black Jack takes out line honours in retirement-strewn Sydney to Hobart
28/12/2021.description: Supermaxi Black Jack crosses the Sydney to Hobart yacht race finish line early this morning to post in the slowest line honours time since 2004.
28/12/2021.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

28/12/2021.headline: Save the Children staff killed in Myanmar junta massacre
28/12/2021.description: Aid organisation Save the Children confirms that two of its staff were killed in a Christmas Eve massacre blamed on junta troops that left the charred remains of more than 30 people on a highway in eastern Myanmar.
28/12/2021.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

28/12/2021.headline: Russian court shuts down prominent human rights group
28/12/2021.description: Russia's Supreme Court rules that one of the country's oldest and most prominent human rights organisations should be shut down for breaking a law requiring groups to register as foreign agents, capping a year of crackdowns on Kremlin critics unseen since Soviet days.
28/12/2021.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

28/12/2021.headline: Another big name is out as Dominic Thiem withdraws from Australian Open
28/12/2021.description: Former Australian Open finalist Dominic Thiem is out of the first grand slam of 2022.
28/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

28/12/2021.headline: Japan agrees to launch military hotline with China in 2022
28/12/2021.description: Japan's defence minister Nobuo Kishi agrees to launch a military hotline with China in 2022.
28/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

28/12/2021.headline: Gunman kills four people in US shooting spree
28/12/2021.description: A lone gunman fatally shot four people and wounded three others in a Denver-area shooting spree that unfolded at several locations and ended with police killing the suspect, authorities say.
28/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

28/12/2021.headline: Prosecutor seeks reduction in 110-year prison sentence after public outcry
28/12/2021.description: A Colorado prosecutor is making a rare bid to reduce the prison term for a truck driver who has been sentenced to 110 years behind bars for vehicular homicide, stemming from a fiery 2019 crash along a mountain highway that killed four motorists.
28/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

28/12/2021.headline: The Loop: Australia smashes England in the Ashes, COVID cases keep climbing, why people are looking at David Beckham's feet and meet a very special emu
28/12/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
28/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

28/12/2021.headline: Patty Mills stars for Brooklyn Nets in win over LA Clippers
28/12/2021.description: In a resounding win over the Los Angeles Clippers, Patty Mills made six three pointers while teammate James Harden tied his season-high with 39 points to lead Brooklyn Nets to a 124-108 victory.
28/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

28/12/2021.headline: NSW in a 'strong position' despite rising COVID-19 numbers and testing chaos, Perrottet says
28/12/2021.description: NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet says the state is in a "strong position" despite the Omicron COVID-19 outbreak, standing by his choice to proceed with relaxing restrictions on December 15.
28/12/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

28/12/2021.headline: Police release image of 7yo girl's missing pyjama top after sexual assault at her Perth home
28/12/2021.description: WA Police appeal for information from the public after a 7-year-old girl is sexually assaulted at her home in Perth's north-east on Boxing Day night, with a window flyscreen and a pyjama top missing from the house.
28/12/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

28/12/2021.headline: 'It's the biggest nightmare': Darts superstar Michael van Gerwen out of world titles with COVID
28/12/2021.description: The world darts championships in London loses one of its biggest drawcards, as Dutch three-time champion Michael van Gerwen is ruled out of the tournament after testing positive to COVID.
28/12/2021.author: Mim Hook and Madeleine Spencer

28/12/2021.headline: Aged care home in lockdown as Tasmania sets new COVID daily case record
28/12/2021.description: St Ann's aged care home in Hobart is in lockdown as Tasmania posts a daily record of 55 new COVID-19 cases.
28/12/2021.author: Monte Bovill

28/12/2021.headline: China says 'close encounters' with Elon Musk's satellites put astronauts at risk
28/12/2021.description: China accuses the United States of putting astronauts in danger, weeks after complaining to the United Nations about near-collisions in orbit with satellites launched by Elon Musk's SpaceX.
28/12/2021.author: Monte Bovill

29/12/2021.headline: Health staff to keep working while awaiting COVID-19 test results in SA
29/12/2021.description: Close and casual contacts of COVID-19 cases will be allowed to continue working in South Australia's health system, as growing case numbers, hospitalisations and long waits for testing build pressure on the system.
29/12/2021.author: Nick Harmsen and Patrick Martin

29/12/2021.headline: Thursday Island community in shock that COVID has already arrived, as eight new cases detected
29/12/2021.description: Authorities are expecting case numbers to rise after an initial case on the Torres Strait island led to eight more being detected.
29/12/2021.author: Holly Richardson

29/12/2021.headline: The Loop: Queensland dumps PCR testing rule, another national cabinet meeting, Betty White is turning 100 and an Egyptian mummy is 'digitally unwrapped'
29/12/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
29/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

29/12/2021.headline: Leaders seek to alleviate pressure on health system, testing at snap meeting
29/12/2021.description: The nation's leaders will canvas overhauling the definition of a COVID-19 close contact at a snap meeting on Thursday, as they seek to alleviate rising pressure on health and testing systems around the country.
29/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

29/12/2021.headline: Nick Kyrgios to play in Aus Open warm-up tournament
29/12/2021.description: Nick Kyrgios accepts a Sydney Tennis Classic wildcard, taking part in his final warm-up tournament ahead of an Australian Open that could be without a host of top talents.
29/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

29/12/2021.headline: Hong Kong police raid pro-democracy news outlet, arrest six, including senior staff
29/12/2021.description: Hundreds of Hong Kong national security police raid the offices of online pro-democracy media outlet Stand News and arrest six people, including senior staff, for "conspiracy to publish seditious publications".
29/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

29/12/2021.headline: 'My daughter died in my arms': Teenager struck by stray police bullet while taking cover in store change room
29/12/2021.description: The family is calling for justice after a 14-year-old died in her mother's arms when she was struck by a stray bullet shot by a Los Angeles police officer at a US clothing store.
29/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

29/12/2021.headline: Mark McGowan warns some close contacts in WA outbreak may never be found, as two new COVID cases emerge
29/12/2021.description: WA records two new local cases in an outbreak sparked by a backpacker, with the Premier saying it's unclear how one woman contracted the virus and warning 16 close contacts are unlikely to be located.
29/12/2021.author: Jessica Warriner

29/12/2021.headline: Opponents fume as Adani celebrates first coal export from Carmichael Mine
29/12/2021.description: Amid continuing protests, the controversial mine's maiden shipment of coal is ready for export from Bowen, but the company won't say where to.
29/12/2021.author: Katrina Beavan

29/12/2021.headline: Green light for $40 million Rottnest redevelopment, with hotel to be named using Whadjuk Noongar language
29/12/2021.description: A major redevelopment of the Rottnest Island Lodge off the coast of Perth receives approval, with conditions to ensure the significant cultural heritage of the site is acknowledged.
29/12/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

29/12/2021.headline: Three new COVID cases 'under investigation', as Northern Territory government defends continued use of PCR tests
29/12/2021.description: Health authorities are investigating the source of three new COVID-19 cases recorded in the Northern Territory overnight, including one in a nine-year-old girl. It comes as the Territory government continues to stand by PCR testing for interstate arrivals.
29/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

29/12/2021.headline: NFL coaching legend turned broadcaster John Madden, the face of Madden NFL game, dies at 85
