29/12/2021.description: Larger than life Super Bowl-winning coach, popular television NFL analyst and a man known to generations of gamers, John Madden, dies aged 85.
29/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

29/12/2021.headline: ACT records 138 new COVID-19 cases as testing data suggests virus going undetected in Canberra
29/12/2021.description: There are now 1,028 active cases of the virus across Canberra and four people in hospital — none of whom are in the ICU. But testing data over the past few days suggests there is more virus circulating in the territory than has been confirmed.
29/12/2021.author: Charlotte Gore and Markus Mannheim

29/12/2021.headline: Judge in Ghislaine Maxwell trial prods jury to work overtime because of COVID
29/12/2021.description: Judge Alison Nathan has requested the jury in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial work overtime over fears jurors infected with COVID-19 could force a mistrial.
29/12/2021.author: Charlotte Gore and Markus Mannheim

29/12/2021.headline: Almost 60 years of prayers for a new church are answered
29/12/2021.description: Mapoon on western Cape York unveils a new church, the first in the community since the old mission was destroyed under orders of the Queensland government in 1963.
29/12/2021.author: Brendan Mounter

29/12/2021.headline: Police find missing flyscreen after 7-year-old girl sexually assaulted in her Perth home
29/12/2021.description: WA Police find a key piece of evidence as they continue their search for an intruder who sexually assaulted a 7-year-old girl in her own bed in the north-eastern suburb of Ellenbrook.
29/12/2021.author: Abby Richards

29/12/2021.headline: Jeremiah Rivers mystery deepens as family's anguish over missing man grows
29/12/2021.description: A Melbourne man who was last with the missing man has spoken to the ABC, while a baffling pub food order has caught the attention of investigators.
29/12/2021.author: Ted O'Connor

29/12/2021.headline: SA records 1,472 new COVID-19 cases, with 36 people in hospital
29/12/2021.description: Premier Steven Marshall says it will soon be mandatory for frontline healthcare workers to have a booster shot.
29/12/2021.author: Sara Tomevska

29/12/2021.headline: Indonesia detects first locally transmitted Omicron case
29/12/2021.description: The Omicron variant breaches Indonesia's recently hardened border, with a 37-year-old Medan man testing positive after visiting a restaurant in Jakarta's central business district.
29/12/2021.author: Sara Tomevska

29/12/2021.headline: 'They were just grubs': Victim recounts 1982 sexual assault in Melbourne's inner suburbs
29/12/2021.description: Police are still hoping to find four men who dangled a woman out of a high-rise building before sexually assaulting her in Fitzroy nearly 40 years ago.
29/12/2021.author: Sara Tomevska

29/12/2021.headline: 'I hit rock bottom': Former rising star councillor confronts his alcoholism
29/12/2021.description: He was one of the youngest elected councillors in Baw Baw Shire's history and a rising star, but one night changed that.
29/12/2021.author: Mim Hook and Madeleine Spencer

29/12/2021.headline: Trial treatment provides hope for patients with severe anorexia nervosa
29/12/2021.description: A Brisbane trial using deep brain stimulation could offer a new lifeline for people suffering from severe treatment-resistant anorexia nervosa.
29/12/2021.author: Emma Pollard

29/12/2021.headline: Will this fireworks season be a cracker or a damp squib?
29/12/2021.description: Fireworks operators are hoping to see this year out with a bang after COVID lockdowns and increasing costs forced some out of the business.
29/12/2021.author: Alice Walker

29/12/2021.headline: Your chance to snag a cheap airfare may soon be over. Here's why
29/12/2021.description: Next year is looking brighter for the global airline industry. For passengers, though, the chance to travel at low cost again may prove short-lived, writes David Beirman.
29/12/2021.author: Alice Walker

29/12/2021.headline: Why has my home been overrun by pantry moths and how do I get rid of them? An expert explains
29/12/2021.description: Has your home recently been overrun by tiny grey moths, flapping erratically around your kitchen? You're not alone, writes Tanya Latty.
29/12/2021.author: Alice Walker

29/12/2021.headline: This man managed his COVID-19 at home. Here's how it went
29/12/2021.description: Most Tasmanians who catch COVID-19 will manage it from their own homes. Simon Boot was one of the first to test out the government's COVID@home "virtual ward" program and was impressed.
29/12/2021.author: Lucy Shannon

29/12/2021.headline: It's a balancing act reporting on the big wet in drought-ridden outback Queensland
29/12/2021.description: While recent rain in the west won't break the almost 10-year drought, it's taken the pressure off some graziers — but not all of them.
29/12/2021.author: Maddelin McCosker

29/12/2021.headline: COVID-19 rapid antigen tests are less accurate than PCR tests, but experts say they serve a purpose
29/12/2021.description: Rapid antigen tests are more likely to return false negatives than PCR tests, but experts say they are useful for identifying when a person is at their most infectious. So how can they be used in Australia?
29/12/2021.author: Penny Timms

29/12/2021.headline: As Omicron surges, Victorians are getting ready to see in 2022. Here's what's happening around the state
29/12/2021.description: As Victorians prepare to say goodbye to 2021 and celebrate their way into 2022, there's a number of things that might not feel normal. Here's what the day will look like.
29/12/2021.author: Rosanne Maloney

29/12/2021.headline: When will house prices fall? This young couple are hoping it happens soon
29/12/2021.description: Across Australia young families are hoping house prices will drop. Will 2022 see the end of the housing boom?
29/12/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

29/12/2021.headline: 'It's there at the back of my mind all the time': The small town ravaged by bushfire slowly rebuilds
29/12/2021.description: All around Judy Smith's new property are reminders of the devastating bushfire in 2019 that burnt her family home to ashes. But like many residents in the small town of Malua Bay on the NSW South Coast, she is slowly rebuilding her life.
29/12/2021.author: Tim Swanston

29/12/2021.headline: Nikki waited in her car for 26 hours to get a COVID test in NSW — she says it was 'torture'
29/12/2021.description: Nikki Taylor had to make the decision to camp out in her car at a testing facility in order to keep her spot in the line. It was a long night, and finding a bathroom was almost impossible, but she passed the time creatively.
29/12/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

29/12/2021.headline: From Squid Game to sheet masks, Korea is a cultural powerhouse. Here's how a fight with China prompted its rise
29/12/2021.description: Years before Australia's trade war with China, the global superpower's neighbour was learning just how difficult life can be on Beijing's bad side. But South Korea has become one of the most culturally influential nations on earth.
29/12/2021.author: Carrington Clarke

29/12/2021.headline: Darwin rocked by Indonesian earthquake
29/12/2021.description: An earthquake which struck the Barat Daya Islands in Indonesia overnight was felt as far away as Darwin.
29/12/2021.author: Carrington Clarke

29/12/2021.headline: Doctors warn Omicron outbreak will 'accelerate' if national cabinet backs relaxed close contact rules
29/12/2021.description: National cabinet will meet today to consider a more relaxed definition of who is a COVID close contact — but the AMA's president says that could just speed up the rate of Omicron's spread.
29/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

29/12/2021.headline: Drownings have increased during the pandemic. Here's how to stay safe this summer
29/12/2021.description: Australia's rate of drownings has risen by 20 per cent this year. It's more important than ever to heed water safety advice from the experts.
29/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

29/12/2021.headline: An Omicron storm is on the horizon — and this time we don't have an economic life raft
29/12/2021.description: A fundamental building block of any economy at any time is business and consumer confidence. And that's just taken a massive hit, writes David Taylor.
29/12/2021.author: David Taylor

29/12/2021.headline: The bank asked a question they shouldn't have — and my preapproval was withdrawn
29/12/2021.description: This phone call — the one that I've replayed over and over — was the type you have while washing the dishes, microwaving the kids' food and juggling, well, everything.
29/12/2021.author: David Taylor

29/12/2021.headline: Sentencing delayed for Bali bombing suspect Zulkarnaen
29/12/2021.description: Indonesian prosecutors postpone their sentencing demand for a top terror suspect who eluded capture for 18 years and is accused of masterminding deadly attacks and sectarian conflict.
29/12/2021.author: David Taylor

29/12/2021.headline: Novak Djokovic pulls out of ATP Cup amid speculation over vaccination status
29/12/2021.description: World number one men's tennis player Novak Djokovic has pulled out of the Serbian team for the ATP Cup in Sydney, organisers of the event say, amid intense speculation over his participation in the upcoming Australian Open.
29/12/2021.author: David Taylor

29/12/2021.headline: Ben McDermott makes history with the bat after Sean Abbott takes 'the catch of the summer'
29/12/2021.description: Ben McDermott and Sean Abbott have produced two of the highlights of this summer's BBL.
29/12/2021.author: David Taylor

29/12/2021.headline: Sam Stosur announces singles retirement after Australian Open
29/12/2021.description: Former US Open champion Sam Stosur will end her singles career at the Australian Open.
29/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

29/12/2021.headline: 'Fly high little man and remember me': Jumping castle victim Peter Dodt farewelled
29/12/2021.description: Hillcrest Primary School student Peter Dodt has been remembered by family and friends as a "little hero" who tried to save others caught up in the Tasmanian jumping castle tragedy earlier this month which claimed six young lives.
29/12/2021.author: Michael Doyle

29/12/2021.headline: Police hunting for intruder who sexually assaulted girl in Perth home, take man in for questioning
29/12/2021.description: Police investigating the sexual assault of a seven-year-old girl in her Perth home take a man into custody for questioning.
29/12/2021.author: Tom Wildie

29/12/2021.headline: Omicron may protect against Delta COVID-19 variant, research suggests
29/12/2021.description: Since hitting the headlines in November, the Omicron COVID-19 variant has damaged economies, destroyed holidays and blighted the festive season, but scientists say there may be a silver lining to the fast-moving version of the virus.
29/12/2021.author: Mary Lloyd

30/12/2021.headline: Fourth Ashes Test impacted by COVID-19, Big Bash match cancelled
30/12/2021.description: Australian cricket is thrown into chaos, with the fourth Ashes Test and a Big Bash game affected by COVID-19.
30/12/2021.author: Tom Wildie

30/12/2021.headline: Festive season testing demand strains low supply
30/12/2021.description: The race to stay ahead of COVID-19 sees increased demand for testing as systems struggle to cope in both the England and Australia.
30/12/2021.author: Tom Wildie

30/12/2021.headline: COVID cases rise in low-vaccinated Aboriginal community
30/12/2021.description: The Queensland community of Cherbourg has detected its first-ever COVID-19 cases, and authorities are preparing for more. Just under 60 per cent of residents are fully vaccinated, according to federal government figures.
30/12/2021.author: Jon Daly and Georgie Hewson

30/12/2021.headline: Head stomping among trouble as groups of up to 100 teens rampage through tourist town
30/12/2021.description: Upmarket tourist hotspot Noosa is reeling after an outbreak of violence including a "sickening" street brawl in which an unconscious man was brutally attacked.
30/12/2021.author: Jacqui Street and Jessica Lamb

30/12/2021.headline: What is the new definition of a close contact agreed upon by national cabinet?
30/12/2021.description: National cabinet has agreed on what defines a person as a close contact of a COVID-19 case. So, how does that differ from what rules were in place for each state and territory previously?
30/12/2021.author: Alexis Moran

30/12/2021.headline: 850 feral cats removed from Kangaroo Island to protect endangered native species
30/12/2021.description: Environmental groups are using state-of-the-art trapping technology to control feral cats on South Australia's Kangaroo Island.
30/12/2021.author: Megan Hughes

30/12/2021.headline: One more COVID case in Perth cluster as WA delays adopting close contact changes
30/12/2021.description: Another backpacker becomes the latest case of COVID-19 linked to a Perth cluster, with the Premier announcing details while revealing WA will wait to adopt new national close contact guidelines.
30/12/2021.author: Keane Bourke

30/12/2021.headline: Public shame parade: Alleged people-smugglers marched through streets in China for breaking COVID-19 rules
30/12/2021.description: China brings back public shaming, parading four alleged people-smugglers wearing masks and hazmat suits through the streets with placards displaying their photos and names for breaking the country's strict COVID-19 rules.
30/12/2021.author: Iris Zhao and Annika Burgess

30/12/2021.headline: The Denver shooting suspect self-published books naming future victims
30/12/2021.description: A man accused of killing five people in a rampage in Denver is believed to have written fictional books,  self-publishing them online, naming some of his real-life victims and describing similar attacks.
30/12/2021.author: Iris Zhao and Annika Burgess

30/12/2021.headline: COVID-positive baby dies in South Australia, state records 1,374 new cases
30/12/2021.description: SA further relaxes testing requirements as the state's Premier says two-thirds of COVID-19 tests were conducted on people without symptoms.
30/12/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin, Nick Harmsen, and Evelyn Manfield

30/12/2021.headline: National cabinet agrees on federal definition of a close contact — as it happened
30/12/2021.description: From midnight, in five jurisdictions, people who meet the new definition of a close contact will be required to quarantine for seven days, with a rapid antigen test on day six.
30/12/2021.author: Alexis Moran

30/12/2021.headline: Two men taken to hospital after light plane crash
30/12/2021.description: Two men are taken to hospital after a light plane crashes into a hangar in a coastal South Australian town.
30/12/2021.author: Alexis Moran

30/12/2021.headline: George Bailey says 'hard conversations' will be had ahead of SCG Test as Scott Boland fights to keep his spot
30/12/2021.description: Australian selector George Bailey reveals MCG hero Scott Boland may yet miss out on the SCG Test, as another bowler is ready for his debut.
30/12/2021.author: Alexis Moran

30/12/2021.headline: NT sets new daily record of 37 COVID cases after Chief Minister says it is on top of Omicron
30/12/2021.description: New coronavirus cases include a nurse at Royal Darwin Hospital, two US marines and two people who attended the same birthday party as a COVID-positive girl, 9, in Darwin.
30/12/2021.author: Jacqueline Breen, Lauren Roberts, and Eliza Goetze

30/12/2021.headline: Woman swept from rocks along stretch of Victorian coast
30/12/2021.description: Police, lifesavers and paramedics are responding to San Remo, near Victoria's Phillip Island, after receiving reports a woman was swept into the ocean shortly before 11am.
30/12/2021.author: Jacqueline Breen, Lauren Roberts, and Eliza Goetze

30/12/2021.headline: Rapid antigen test price-gougers put on notice by federal government
30/12/2021.description: The federal government warns it will take "strong, clear, swift" action against any price-gouging of rapid antigen-tests, as demand for the kits continues to outstrip supply.
30/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

30/12/2021.headline: Without bulk-billed phone appointments, Joanne is now facing a 4hr drive for breast cancer treatment
30/12/2021.description: An oncologist warns that changes to the telehealth system will "punish" rural and regional Australians.
30/12/2021.author: Joanna Woodburn

30/12/2021.headline: Don't Look Up director says if you don't like his film, it's because you don't get it
30/12/2021.description: Don't Look Up director Adam McKay takes aim at criticisms of his new film, suggesting that if audiences don't like it, it's because they don't get it.
30/12/2021.author: Joanna Woodburn

30/12/2021.headline: In the end, not one of Ghislaine Maxwell's high-flying friends was there to watch her bitter final chapter
30/12/2021.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's jurors were offered no alternative explanation as to why a seemingly endless stream of young women were guests of the wealthy middle-aged financier and his charming girlfriend, writes Barbara Miller.
30/12/2021.author: Barbara Miller

30/12/2021.headline: Old Parliament House set on fire for second time as protests continue
30/12/2021.description: The front entrance of Old Parliament House has been set on fire for the second consecutive week as protests continue outside the building.
30/12/2021.author: Harry Frost, Charlotte Gore, and Markus Mannheim

30/12/2021.headline: Millions of 'poor man's cocaine' pills seized in shipment of oranges in Lebanon
30/12/2021.description: Lebanese authorities have intercepted millions of pills of the recreational drug captagon hidden inside fake oranges in a real fruit shipment.
30/12/2021.author: Harry Frost, Charlotte Gore, and Markus Mannheim

30/12/2021.headline: Police say alleged intruder charged with sexually assaulting 7yo Perth girl was unknown to family
30/12/2021.description: Callum Ferris Davies, 25, faces court accused of attacking a girl in her Ellenbrook home on Boxing Day night, with the charges against him including sexual assault, deprivation of liberty and aggravated home burglary.
30/12/2021.author: Kate Christian and Nicolas Perpitch

30/12/2021.headline: Bunbury train among new exposure sites in Perth outbreak, as WA tightens border with SA and Queensland
30/12/2021.description: Western Australia's South West is exposed to Perth's COVID outbreak, with an alert issued for three Bunbury sites and a beach, as the state moves to reclassify Queensland and South Australia as "extreme risk".
30/12/2021.author: Kate Christian and Nicolas Perpitch

30/12/2021.headline: NZ banned smoking (what?!), and other 2021 health stories buried by the pandemic
30/12/2021.description: COVID dominated headlines in 2021. Here are five big health stories you might have missed.
30/12/2021.author: Olivia Willis

30/12/2021.headline: It's been in the headlines for most of 2021. So where is the ag visa?
30/12/2021.description: The federal government says its new ag visa came into effect in October, but Australian farmers are still waiting for workers.
30/12/2021.author: Matt Brann

30/12/2021.headline: The Loop: Israel approves fourth COVID vaccine dose, NYE celebrations in your city, and it's a ruff day for the Westminster Kennel Club
30/12/2021.description: Your quick wrap-up of the news you need to know.
30/12/2021.author: Bridget Judd

30/12/2021.headline: Concerns for elderly residents' wellbeing as COVID-19 spreads through Queensland's aged care homes
30/12/2021.description: Aged care homes are already bearing the brunt of COVID-19 surge across Queensland, with a major outbreak at one Brisbane facility leaving three residents and five staff infected in the past seven days.
30/12/2021.author: Rory Callinan and Tobias Jurss-Lewis

30/12/2021.headline: GPs report 'massive' spike in patients struggling with COVID-19 anxiety
30/12/2021.description: Anxiety around catching and passing on COVID-19 is well known, but GPs are now warning of alarming levels of fear in the community thanks to the Omicron variant.
30/12/2021.author: David Taylor

30/12/2021.headline: The small town that used a 'socialist' experiment to solve its drinking problem
30/12/2021.description: If you were looking for the origins of progressive, faintly socialist alcohol control policies in Australia, you probably wouldn't look in our biggest wine-growing region.
30/12/2021.author: David Taylor

30/12/2021.headline: ‘Drained and wary of the future’: Why you might feel different about new year’s resolutions this year
30/12/2021.description: If you've got the energy to make new year's resolutions this year, be warned: your chances of success might depend on what's behind your vows to change.
30/12/2021.author: David Taylor

30/12/2021.headline: Infectious diseases expert says the NT must heed Omicron lessons from NSW, eastern states
30/12/2021.description: It's only a matter of time before the Omicron variant spreads across the NT, says an infectious diseases expert. And we should look to NSW and Victoria to see what lies ahead.
30/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

30/12/2021.headline: Interest rate hikes and rising inflation may lead to 'more volatile' market in 2022
30/12/2021.description: It's unlikely that 2021 will be anyone's favourite year, but there were some bright spots — especially for those who invested in shares during lockdown, which have since jumped to record highs. We also spoke with market analysts about their predictions for 2022.
30/12/2021.author: David Chau

30/12/2021.headline: Tesla issues a recall for thousands of Model 3 and Model S electric cars
30/12/2021.description: The US electric vehicle manufacturer is recalling more than 350,000 Model 3 vehicles to address rear-view camera issues and nearly 120,000 Model S vehicles due to front hood problems.
30/12/2021.author: David Chau

30/12/2021.headline: Rally champion Molly Taylor prepares for her toughest test as the first Australian woman to compete at the Dakar Rally
30/12/2021.description: Rallying is in Molly Taylor's blood — now the first female driver to win the Australian rally Championship is set to break new ground in the toughest endurance race of all, the Dakar Rally.
30/12/2021.author: Daniela Intili

30/12/2021.headline: Ashraf Ghani details his escape from Kabul in a BBC interview
30/12/2021.description: The former president of Afghanistan says that an adviser gave him just minutes to decide to abandon the capital, Kabul, and denies leaving the country with a cache of stolen money.
30/12/2021.author: Daniela Intili

30/12/2021.headline: 'Felt a bit dodgy': Sydney woman pays $25 for rapid antigen test after chemist sells multipack individually
30/12/2021.description: Just a couple of weeks ago, a pharmacy in north west Sydney was selling a five-pack rapid antigen test kit for $50. A single test now costs $25. As demand outstrips supplies, there are calls for retailers to be "good humans".
30/12/2021.author: Kathleen Ferguson

30/12/2021.headline: We've made it to the end of 2021. Did the year fly or drag for you?
30/12/2021.description: Has the past year felt a lot longer than just 12 months to you, or does it seem over in a flash? We delve into the science of time perception.
30/12/2021.author: Anna Salleh

30/12/2021.headline: Is there such a thing as too much vaccine? Israel, approving fourth shots, may be about to find out
30/12/2021.description: As health experts warn Israel is days away from a surge in COVID infections, authorities are betting on something no country has tried before: issuing a fourth vaccine dose to the most vulnerable people.
30/12/2021.author: Tom Joyner

30/12/2021.headline: Two years ago today, we heard about a new 'pneumonia' in Wuhan. Now we have plenty of ways to fight it
30/12/2021.description: As we embark on another year overshadowed by SARS-CoV-2, now is a good time to reflect on how far medical science has brought us in treating COVID-19 and where it might take us in 2022.
30/12/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

30/12/2021.headline: Take a look back at the major news stories of 2021
30/12/2021.description: Between ships stuck in the Suez canal, a riot at the US Capitol, and the 2020 Olympic Games in 2021, there were still moments of joy and a realisation that, together, we are stronger.
30/12/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

30/12/2021.headline: Ghislaine Maxwell to appeal conviction for trafficking girls for Jeffrey Epstein
30/12/2021.description: Ghislaine Maxwell will appeal her conviction for setting up teenage girls to be sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein, but experts say she will struggle to clear the high legal bar needed to overturn the verdict.
30/12/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

30/12/2021.headline: Two former Stand News editors charged with sedition in Hong Kong
30/12/2021.description: Following a Hong Kong police crackdown on a pro-democracy media organisation, two former senior editors are arrested and charged with conspiring to publish seditious material, authorities say.
30/12/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

30/12/2021.headline: Arnold Schwarzenegger and Maria Shriver divorce 10 years after breakup
30/12/2021.description: There were virtually no public actions taken in the case between the initial flurry of filings in 2011 and a resumption of court moves in June.
30/12/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

30/12/2021.headline: 'We will have more cases': Health authorities warn relaxed restrictions will have an impact
30/12/2021.description: Australia's Chief Medical Officer warns the country can expect even more COVID-19 cases after the majority of the nation's leaders broadly agreed to relax close contact definitions and isolation requirements.
30/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

30/12/2021.headline: Thousands remember late Chinese doctor who first warned others about COVID-19
30/12/2021.description: Thousands of people left messages on the social media account of the late Chinese COVID-19 whistleblower Li Wenliang on the anniversary of the day he learned of possible pneumonia-causing virus cases in Wuhan and shared the information with fellow doctors.
30/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

30/12/2021.headline: Man killed in head-on collision after police chase with other car on Monaro Highway
30/12/2021.description: Officers say they had just called off the pursuit of a black Commodore when the car crossed to the wrong side of the road and struck a van head-on. The driver of the van was trapped in the vehicle and died at the scene.
30/12/2021.author: Holly Tregenza

30/12/2021.headline: The Loop: New close contact definitions, increased reliance on rapid antigen tests and the James Webb telescope unfurls
30/12/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
30/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

30/12/2021.headline: What's happening on New Year's Eve in your city?
30/12/2021.description: Here's the lowdown on what's happening where and when on New Year's Eve across Australia.
30/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

31/12/2021.headline: The Loop: COVID-19 rules change, again; Tropical Cyclone Seth forms; and Grace Tame's moon boot promise
31/12/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
31/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

31/12/2021.headline: Royal Darwin Hospital staff in isolation, ward closed due to COVID-19 case
31/12/2021.description: The Northern Territory’s largest hospital is forced to close one of its wards and 44 staff members are now isolating at home after a positive case visited the facility.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

31/12/2021.headline: Thousands flee homes in Colorado as wildfires burn
31/12/2021.description: An estimated 580 homes, a hotel and a shopping centre have burned and tens of thousands of people were evacuated in wind fuelled wildfires outside Denver in Colorado, officials say.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

31/12/2021.headline: Omicron, heatwave no hurdle for Australians gearing up for New Year's Eve celebrations
31/12/2021.description: Australians look to ring in the new year and hope for better tidings in 2022.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

31/12/2021.headline: Big Bash NYE match to go ahead, despite four players testing positive to COVID-19
31/12/2021.description: Adelaide's New Year's Eve Big Bash League match will go ahead tonight, despite four players testing positive to COVID-19.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

31/12/2021.headline: One dead, three injured after cliff face collapses at Bells Beach
31/12/2021.description: A man is dead following the collapse of a cliff face in Bells Beach this afternoon.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

31/12/2021.headline: Here's what you need to know about the NT's new COVID-19 rules
31/12/2021.description: Hours out from the start of New Year's Eve celebrations in the Northern Territory, the COVID-19 rules have changed again. Masks are now mandatory while indoors, and there are new definitions for exposure sites and close contacts.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

31/12/2021.headline: Flexibility key for COVID-ravaged A-Leagues to survive
31/12/2021.description: Adelaide's clash with Wellington at Coopers Stadium on Saturday night will be the only A-League Men match this round after several games were postponed due to positive cases.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

31/12/2021.headline: Tropical Cyclone Seth forms off Queensland coast, large swells expected over weekend
31/12/2021.description: Tropical Cyclone Seth forms in the Coral Sea, north-east of Mackay, with large waves expected along the south-east Queensland coastline over the weekend.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

31/12/2021.headline: Rohingya refugees sprayed with disinfectant after being allowed to disembark in Indonesia
31/12/2021.description: The Indonesian navy rescues more than 100 Rohingya, mostly women and children, from a sinking boat after pressure from locals and rights groups.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

31/12/2021.headline: BBC to investigate Alan Dershowitz interview which broke 'editorial standards'
31/12/2021.description: Britain's national broadcaster says it will investigate how a lawyer allegedly connected to Ghislaine Maxwell was allowed to be interviewed on air following the convicted socialite's verdict.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

31/12/2021.headline: Throughout a rollercoaster year, the Matildas gave us something to hope for
31/12/2021.description: Despite their tumultuous year, the Matildas have continued to embody belief and togetherness: A reminder of why they've become Australian icons.
31/12/2021.author: Samantha Lewis

31/12/2021.headline: SA gyms, hospitality businesses to receive cash grants
31/12/2021.description: Grants for gyms, pubs and other businesses affected by South Australia's density restrictions begin next week.
31/12/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin

31/12/2021.headline: Andrew Forrest buys $108m slice of Bega Cheese
31/12/2021.description: The mining billionaire takes a significant share in the dairy company, extending his food empire even further.
31/12/2021.author: David Claughton

31/12/2021.headline: The toilet paper situation all over again? Pharmacists call for calm amid rapid testing shortages
31/12/2021.description: The pressure is easing on PCR testing queues, but the strain has shifted to rapid antigen test supplies say regional Queensland pharmacists.
31/12/2021.author: Jessica Lamb, Jacqui Street, and Kimberley Bernard

31/12/2021.headline: 'It was the right time': Tributes to Hillcrest jumping castle tragedy removed as final victims farewelled
31/12/2021.description: The loved ones of the Hillcrest Primary School jumping castle tragedy victims gather to remove tributes from outside the school as the two last victims are farewelled.
31/12/2021.author: Jessica Lamb, Jacqui Street, and Kimberley Bernard

31/12/2021.headline: Mark McGowan announces more exposure sites after new COVID case emerges in WA outbreak
31/12/2021.description: Western Australia records one new local case of COVID-19, taking the total number of infections in its recent backpacker cluster to 14, with new exposure sites identified in Perth and the South West.
31/12/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch and Isabel Moussalli

31/12/2021.headline: Amid build-up of troops near Ukraine, 'serious' talk between Biden and Putin sets stage for diplomacy
31/12/2021.description: The US and Russian presidents exchange warnings over Ukraine during a 50-minute telephone call, but convey optimism diplomatic talks in January could ease spiralling tensions.
31/12/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch and Isabel Moussalli

31/12/2021.headline: Canberrans encouraged to work from home in January as ACT records 462 new COVID cases
31/12/2021.description: The Chief Minister is asking Canberrans to consider working from home in the new year as the territory records its highest daily tally of cases since the pandemic began.
31/12/2021.author: Elise Pianegonda and Charlotte Gore

31/12/2021.headline: 'The equivalent of 200 school camps': Thousands flock to scout jamboree in face of COVID-19
31/12/2021.description: The Scouts Victoria event has been three years in the making — this pop-up town in the Macedon Ranges has its own medical centre, supermarket, water park and radio station.
31/12/2021.author: Sarah Lawrence

31/12/2021.headline: South Africa says its Omicron outbreak has peaked
31/12/2021.description: The worst COVID-19-hit country in Africa says it has passed the peak of its fourth wave and is easing restrictions after a stark decline in cases.
31/12/2021.author: Sarah Lawrence

31/12/2021.headline: Friday news quiz: It's been one of those years — how much do you remember from 2021?
31/12/2021.description: While COVID-19 dominated the headlines this year (again), we promise this quiz is entirely virus-free.
31/12/2021.author: Sarah Lawrence

31/12/2021.headline: Last minute New Year's Eve mask mandate after new NT record of 60 COVID cases
31/12/2021.description: Masks will be required in indoor settings from 6pm tonight in the face of increased community transmission in Darwin, with new cases also recorded in Katherine and Tennant Creek.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts, Jacqueline Breen, and Samantha Dick

31/12/2021.headline: National cabinet changes isolation rule for COVID cases, a day after announcing new rules
31/12/2021.description: National cabinet already amends its new COVID-19 rules, further relaxing testing arrangements by removing the requirement for confirmed cases in isolation to do a rapid antigen test on the sixth day after being exposed.
31/12/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

31/12/2021.headline: Darwin locals who caught COVID-19 from interstate travellers have accused NT Health of poor messaging
31/12/2021.description: Territorians who caught COVID-19 from interstate travellers have reported mixed messaging and confusing directions from NT Health.
31/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

31/12/2021.headline: A late-night hit and run in Darwin leaves two little girls without their dad. Their mum is desperate for answers.
31/12/2021.description: On a dark street in Darwin's north, just days before Christmas, Justine's partner died when he was hit by a car. Police say the person responsible left the scene without stopping.
31/12/2021.author: Melissa Mackay

31/12/2021.headline: Four months on, Afghanistan's women's national team players return to the pitch
31/12/2021.description: After escaping the collapse of Kabul in August, Afghanistan's women's national team players are finally returning to the pitch.
31/12/2021.author: Samantha Lewis

31/12/2021.headline: Women force change at Indian iPhone plant, sick from bad food and crowded dorms
31/12/2021.description: Women assembling iPhones at a plant in India protest after enduring food sometimes crawling with worms and dorms without flush toilets.
31/12/2021.author: Samantha Lewis

31/12/2021.headline: 'Local businesses are crying out', so why are skilled migrants waiting years for visas?
31/12/2021.description: Huang Yiwen has been waiting for her permanent residency visa for just over two years while she has a job waiting for her in Australia.
31/12/2021.author: Dong Xing

31/12/2021.headline: 'I have to see this through to the end': Ian Chappell reveals his favourite five Ashes moments of the past 40 years
31/12/2021.description: Ian Chappell has been the voice of countless great Ashes moments over the past 40 years, but one of his favourites happened while sitting on his couch in Sydney — and, if not for some advice from his dad, he may have missed the whole thing.
31/12/2021.author: Dong Xing

31/12/2021.headline: 10 days, 291kms and only bat blood to drink: The marathon in the Sahara that turned into a nightmare
31/12/2021.description: When a huge sandstorm spun an ultramarathon runner off-course in the Sahara with meagre supplies, Mauro Prosperi knew there was only one person who could save him from certain death: himself.
31/12/2021.author: Rebecca Armitage

31/12/2021.headline: Images and excerpts that defined Australian politics in 2001, the year the world changed
31/12/2021.description: Confidential cabinet records from one of the most pivotal years in recent memory have been released today, giving a glimpse at how the Howard government grappled with some of the most tumultuous moments in Australia.
31/12/2021.author: James Glenday

31/12/2021.headline: Former PM still holds out hope for democracy in China, as he reflects on release of secret cabinet documents
31/12/2021.description: Australia's second-longest-serving prime minister, John Howard, says there is still hope for democracy in China, although he is disappointed by how it has changed since he was in power.
31/12/2021.author: James Glenday

31/12/2021.headline: 'I could not stand it any longer': Files on 'horror radio' murder opened after 75 years
31/12/2021.description: In 1946, Trevor McKenzie was sentenced to death for murdering a man over his choice of radio station. Archival documents shed new light on this 75-year-old murder.
31/12/2021.author: Simon Leo Brown

31/12/2021.headline: Queensland's COVID spike casts shadow over 2022 as Omicron throws modelling out the window
31/12/2021.description: As Queenslanders looks down the barrel of tens of thousands of cases a day in the coming weeks, the notion of "Fortress Queensland" is long gone.
31/12/2021.author: Kate McKenna

31/12/2021.headline: So you've tested positive to COVID. What happens now?
31/12/2021.description: Receiving a text revealing you have tested positive to COVID is a big moment, filled with uncertainty about what is to come. Yet it’s also oddly anticlimactic: the text arrives … then … nothing. So what should you do next?
31/12/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

31/12/2021.headline: Planning that trip into Queensland? Here is what you need to know before you hit the road
31/12/2021.description: The Queensland government has recently relaxed the rules for entry into the state. Travellers can come from just about anywhere as long as they are fully vaccinated and meet the government's requirements.
31/12/2021.author: Baz Ruddick

31/12/2021.headline: Paxlovid COVID-19 antiviral pill approved for use in Britain
31/12/2021.description: Britain is scrambling to build its defences amid a daily record of new COVID-19 cases as the Omicron variant of the virus spreads quickly.
31/12/2021.author: Baz Ruddick

31/12/2021.headline: South Australians given wrong COVID-19 results in testing bungle
31/12/2021.description: A pathology provider in Adelaide says 11 people have been given the wrong COVID-19 test result, while three prisons have gone into lockdown following outbreaks.
31/12/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin

31/12/2021.headline: Aussies Alex de Minaur and James Duckworth ready for ATP Cup
31/12/2021.description: Australian number one Alex de Minaur will have his hands full in the ATP Cup from Sunday, while James Duckworth hopes to cement his top-50 status
31/12/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin

31/12/2021.headline: Colorado governor slashes truck driver's prison term from 110 years to 10
31/12/2021.description: Colorado's governor shortens the prison sentence of a truck driver responsible for a deadly crash to 10 years, drastically reducing his original 110-year term that had drawn widespread outrage.
31/12/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin

31/12/2021.headline: Reports diver was missing off Margaret River coast, now thought to be wrong
31/12/2021.description: Authorities suspend a search for a diver off the Margaret River coast with new information placing doubt on whether anyone is missing.
31/12/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin

31/12/2021.headline: Thousands flee in Colorado as wildfires burn through hundreds of homes
31/12/2021.description: An estimated 580 homes, a hotel and a shopping centre have burned and tens of thousands of people were evacuated in wind fuelled wildfires outside Denver in Colorado, officials say.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

31/12/2021.headline: Sydney rings in 2022 as New Year's celebrations compete with Omicron and heatwave pressures
31/12/2021.description: Australia's east coast has welcomed 2022, with Sydney putting on a typically spectacular fireworks display over its harbour.
31/12/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

31/12/2021.headline: From Avril to Eminem, here are the albums turning 20 this year
31/12/2021.description: These albums are turning 20 in 2022 and are guaranteed to make you feel old or nostalgic or both.
31/12/2021.author: Matt Neal

31/12/2021.headline: Tasmania records 428 new COVID infections in largest jump in cases yet
31/12/2021.description: Tasmania records 428 new COVID infections, taking the number of active cases in the state to 938 — and authorities say more than 60 per cent of all active cases are aged between 20 and 39.
31/12/2021.author: Matt Neal

31/12/2021.headline: Whoa! Town offers parking spaces for horses so rail-trail riders can stop and stay a while
31/12/2021.description: Riders stop at the Toora pub, but don't let go of the reins. Now, stables built on the edge of town allow riders to park their horses while running errands or meeting for coffee.
31/12/2021.author: Mim Hook

31/12/2021.headline: South-east Queensland beaches closed as Cyclone Seth whips up 'washing machine' surf
31/12/2021.description: Large swells and dangerous surf conditions are expected along the south-east coast throughout the long weekend, with the category one system forecast to strengthen as it tracks south.
31/12/2021.author: Mim Hook

01/01/2022.headline: Teen dies from stab wounds after Cairns birthday party
01/01/2022.description: A 17-year-old boy dies in hospital after he was taken there in a private car and another teen was treated for stab wounds, with police yet to charge anybody over the incident.
01/01/2022.author: Melinda Howells

01/01/2022.headline: NT records 54 COVID-19 cases, source of three infections in Alice Springs under investigation
01/01/2022.description: The Northern Territory reports 54 new COVID-19 cases overnight, including five cases of community transmission in Darwin and one in Katherine.
01/01/2022.author: Melinda Howells

01/01/2022.headline: Child dies in remote desert community after going missing from home
01/01/2022.description: NT Police say the child was found this morning after he was reported missing from a home in a remote community yesterday. No information has been given about the cause of the boy's death.
01/01/2022.author: Melinda Howells

01/01/2022.headline: UK New Year honours list 2022 features COVID-19 leaders, James Bond actor and Spice Girls star
01/01/2022.description: Thousands were honoured in this year's New Year honours list, with the majority being recognised for their work in helping fight the pandemic. Here are some of the more famous names to have made the list.
01/01/2022.author: Melinda Howells

01/01/2022.headline: 'Serious' charges expected after hundreds attend Perth bar NYE party as COVID-19 outbreak grows
01/01/2022.description: Police allege the bar locked its doors, removed check-in posters and hosted several hundred people for a New Years' Eve party, despite ongoing COVID-19 restrictions.
01/01/2022.author: Abby Richards, Keane Bourke, and Tom Wildie

01/01/2022.headline: First COVID cases confirmed in remote town of Nhulunbuy, Darwin's Bagot community
01/01/2022.description: As case numbers in the Northern Territory continue to rise, authorities confirm the virus has spread to reach Nhulunbuy, in north-east Arnhem Land, as well as an Aboriginal community in Darwin for the first time.
01/01/2022.author: Abby Richards, Keane Bourke, and Tom Wildie

01/01/2022.headline: Dean Boxall backs Shayna Jack after impressive return from 'brutal' ban
01/01/2022.description: Shayna Jack's coach Dean Boxall has detailed the depths his banned star, who returned to competition last month, endured during a 901-day absence from the pool.
01/01/2022.author: Abby Richards, Keane Bourke, and Tom Wildie

01/01/2022.headline: SA records 2,108 new COVID cases but peak still 'weeks away', Premier says
01/01/2022.description: For the second day running, South Australia reports more than 2,000 new cases, while the number of COVID-positive patients in hospital almost doubles to 71.
01/01/2022.author: Abby Richards, Keane Bourke, and Tom Wildie

01/01/2022.headline: International jury called to re-examine Sydney to Hobart protests
01/01/2022.description: Protests that resulted in Ichi Ban being awarded handicap honours in the Sydney to Hobart yacht race are to be re-examined by an international jury.
01/01/2022.author: Abby Richards, Keane Bourke, and Tom Wildie

01/01/2022.headline: Mask mandate expanded as Queensland records 2,266 new cases of COVID-19
01/01/2022.description: Starting tomorrow, masks will be required in all indoor settings in Queensland, except the family home, to slow the spread of COVID-19, as the state records 2,266 new cases in just 12 hours.
01/01/2022.author: Emilie Gramenz

01/01/2022.headline: Holiday-makers choose summer 'staycations' as COVID-19 upends travel plans
01/01/2022.description: As travellers face pandemic uncertainty, many are wondering if the best way to unwind is to actually holiday at home.
01/01/2022.author: Ted O'Connor

01/01/2022.headline: Heavy stock losses as fire races through farms and forest in western Victoria
01/01/2022.description: Vet says farmers are destroying thousands of animals caught in flames and smoke after a grassfire that crossed into Victoria from South Australia last night.
01/01/2022.author: Christopher Testa

01/01/2022.headline: Does your child's favourite book actually help them speak?
01/01/2022.description: Speech pathologist Kelly Makepeace is labelling books at her local library with an important purpose for kids.
01/01/2022.author: Kemii Maguire

01/01/2022.headline: Boaties get uncomfortably close look at shark feeding frenzy on whale carcass
01/01/2022.description: Recreational boaters off Eden, on the NSW far south coast, have captured on camera tiger sharks and a great white shark feeding on a sperm whale carcass.
01/01/2022.author: Keira Proust

01/01/2022.headline: When 'bloody hot' Marble Bar is at its face-melting hottest, the locals couldn't be any cooler
01/01/2022.description: The Christmas trees are spinifex and the town's electronic temperature gauge is cooked, but Marble Bar's close-knit community just carries on with life in a furnace.
01/01/2022.author: Ashleigh Davis

01/01/2022.headline: Fast bowling can take a brutal toll on the human body. Just ask Jason Behrendorff
01/01/2022.description: There are few sights more impressive than a fast bowler steaming in to bowl a searing delivery at an opposition batsman. But it's an occupation that carries an inherent risk of injury, and often sees athletes sidelined for extended periods of time.
01/01/2022.author: Tom Wildie

01/01/2022.headline: Vaccine mandate ethics in spotlight as West Australian deadline passes for workers
01/01/2022.description: As the deadline passes for the majority of the West Australian workforce to be at least partially vaccinated, an ethics professor warns penalties must be proportionate.
01/01/2022.author: Rebecca Trigger

01/01/2022.headline: Queensland mask rules toughened as authorities race to stamp out COVID outbreaks in vulnerable settings
01/01/2022.description: Masks are now mandatory in almost every public setting in Queensland, in an attempt to slow the rapid spread of COVID-19 — which has already taken hold in several vulnerable locations.
01/01/2022.author: Emilie Gramenz, Kate McKenna, and Paula Doneman

01/01/2022.headline: Five rounds after everyone else, Perth's WNBL season is finally starting
01/01/2022.description: Two-time WNBA winner Sami Whitcomb has returned to the WNBL and believes Perth Lynx can live up to its championship hype.
01/01/2022.author: Emilie Gramenz, Kate McKenna, and Paula Doneman

01/01/2022.headline: Not sure what to read after Harry Potter? Here's seven book recommendations for children and adults to enjoy
01/01/2022.description: The Harry Potter series remains much loved by children and adults alike, and inspired millions to take up reading. So what books should you pick up when you finish Deathly Hallows?
01/01/2022.author: Emilie Gramenz, Kate McKenna, and Paula Doneman

01/01/2022.headline: How meditation led a former US Army helicopter gunner to become a Buddhist monk
01/01/2022.description: After years of unemployment, violence and addiction, the practice of sitting meditation helped this Vietnam War veteran find peace and an unlikely pathway.
01/01/2022.author: Karen Tong and Meredith Lake

01/01/2022.headline: 'The pressure can be a lot': The program giving new parents a helping hand with mental health
01/01/2022.description: When Darwin mother Amy Hetherington gave birth to her first child, she said the pressure and fear of not living up to being a good mother was overwhelming. But a new program is aiming to ease the mental health pressures new and expecting parents face.
01/01/2022.author: Karen Tong and Meredith Lake

01/01/2022.headline: The underground sperm smuggling ring that helps Palestinian women have their imprisoned husbands' babies
01/01/2022.description: Farhana and Hossam were young, in love and ready to start a family — until he was sentenced to 18 years in prison. With the prospect of a long separation, they joined a growing number of Palestinian families putting their lives on the line to bring new life into the world.
01/01/2022.author: Tom Joyner

01/01/2022.headline: Jamie Mitchell's dream was a baggy green cap, but a cricket tour from hell has left him searching for answers
01/01/2022.description: Jamie Mitchell was a cricketing star on the rise in the 1980s. But since returning home from a tour of India and Sri Lanka, broken in body and mind by his experiences, Mitchell has been searching for answers on what happened.
01/01/2022.author: Russell Jackson

01/01/2022.headline: Worse than predictions:  Australia's big cognitive leap as Omicron surge takes us to new ground
01/01/2022.description: It's tempting to see the testing crisis as evidence of Australia falling at the first hurdle, but in reality the hurdles are gone, the track has changed, writes Leigh Tonkin.
01/01/2022.author: Leigh Tonkin

01/01/2022.headline: 'It was more of an academic exercise': The really old, racist and non-medical origins of the BMI
01/01/2022.description: At one time or another, most people have calculated their Body Mass Index or had it done for them. But despite its widespread use, it can't actually tell you much about your health.
01/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

01/01/2022.headline: The fight that will define the world in 2022
01/01/2022.description: As we look ahead to the coming year, there are many flashpoints set to disrupt the world order. But arguably the biggest threat is what has been called the death of democracy, writes Stan Grant.
01/01/2022.author: Stan Grant

01/01/2022.headline: 'To hurt a woman is to insult God' says Pope Francis in New Year's homily
01/01/2022.description: Pope Francis uses his New Year's message to issue a clarion call for an end to violence against women, saying it is insulting to God.
01/01/2022.author: Stan Grant

01/01/2022.headline: Crowd crush at shrine kills 12, 15 injured in India Kashmir during New Year pilgrimage
01/01/2022.description: A crowd surge at a popular Hindu shrine in Indian-controlled Kashmir kills at least 12 people and injures 15 others on New Year's Day.
01/01/2022.author: Stan Grant

01/01/2022.headline: Archbishop Desmond Tutu remembered at state funeral in South Africa
01/01/2022.description: The state funeral for Archbishop Desmond Tutu, a hero of the struggle against apartheid in South Africa, has been held in Cape Town where he once preached against racial injustice.
01/01/2022.author: Stan Grant

01/01/2022.headline: Reduced isolation for NSW healthcare a 'catch-up' measure to stop system 'collapsing'
01/01/2022.description: As the number of infections in NSW surge, tired and overworked healthcare workers say they were left with no choice but to support reducing the COVID isolation rules that will see close contact asymptomatic staff back at work.
01/01/2022.author: Nakari Thorpe

01/01/2022.headline: Kim Jong Un caps his 10th year in power with a speech focussing on food, not nukes
01/01/2022.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un caps off his 10th year in power with a speech that makes more mention of tractor factories and school uniforms than nuclear weapons or the United States.
01/01/2022.author: Nakari Thorpe

01/01/2022.headline: Khawaja knows he could be back for just one Test, as Aussie squad tests negative
01/01/2022.description: Travis Head's positive COVID result opens the door for Usman Khawaja to return for the fourth Ashes Test, while the rest of Australia's playing squad and support staff test negative.
01/01/2022.author: Nakari Thorpe

01/01/2022.headline: Death toll on Victoria's roads jumps 10 per cent in 2021
01/01/2022.description: Victoria recorded 117 deaths on metropolitan roads in 2021, compared with 84 fatalities in 2020, despite reduced road use during the pandemic this year.
01/01/2022.author: Nakari Thorpe

01/01/2022.headline: 'She managed to grow very old and somehow, not old enough': Actors, comedians and a president pay tribute to Betty White
01/01/2022.description: Fellow actors and comedians, as well as broadcasters and politicians, pay tribute to beloved US television star Betty White on social media following her death on Friday, aged 99.
01/01/2022.author: Nakari Thorpe

01/01/2022.headline: Aussie rider Daniel Sanders takes early Dakar Rally lead
01/01/2022.description: Australian Daniel Sanders, the top motorcycle rookie in last year's Dakar Rally, begins the gruelling 2022 edition by winning the prologue in Saudi Arabia, with Molly Taylor sixth in the SSV class.
01/01/2022.author: Emilie Gramenz

01/01/2022.headline: How we wonder what they are: Queensland scientists to lead world-first Twinkle commercial space telescope mission
01/01/2022.description: The Twinkle telescope will study the atmospheres of planets 300 light-years away. Astrophysicists say the mission will help in the search for life in the galaxy.
01/01/2022.author: Jon Daly

01/01/2022.headline: Coastal holidays dampened as Tropical Cyclone Seth closes beaches across south-east Queensland
01/01/2022.description: In a blow for holiday-makers across south-east Queensland, the majority of beaches on the Gold and Sunshine coasts will remain closed today because of hazardous conditions brought by Tropical Cyclone Seth.
01/01/2022.author: Rebecca Hyam and Kimberley Bernard

01/01/2022.headline: Nearly 1,000 homes destroyed in Colorado wildfire as snow blankets homes still smouldering
01/01/2022.description: Nearly 1,000 homes are destroyed, hundreds more are damaged, and three people are missing in the United States as a wildfire burns through neighbourhoods in the state of Colorado.
01/01/2022.author: Rebecca Hyam and Kimberley Bernard

01/01/2022.headline: Tasmania records 404 new COVID-19 cases
01/01/2022.description: Tasmania records 404 new COVID infections, fewer than the previous day's total. The state now has more than 300 people managing the disease in a home environment.
01/01/2022.author: Rebecca Hyam and Kimberley Bernard

01/01/2022.headline: Aussie Olympic bobsleigh hope nets another World Series podium
01/01/2022.description: Queenslander Breeana Walker continues her fine Monobob World Series form with a fourth podium of the season, finishing second in Latvia.
01/01/2022.author: Simon Smale

01/01/2022.headline: COVID updates: SA vaccination centres sitting with 'spare capacity' as Queenslanders adapt to new mask rules
01/01/2022.description: South Australians are urged to take up booster shots following a dip in the state's vaccination rate and Queensland's updated indoor mask rules take effect. Catch up on the coronavirus news from across the country.
01/01/2022.author: Simon Smale

01/01/2022.headline: Omicron now Victoria's dominant strain as state records 7,172 new COVID-19 cases, three deaths
01/01/2022.description: Community sample testing reveals 76 per cent of COVID cases in Victoria are the Omicron variant.
01/01/2022.author: Simon Smale

01/01/2022.headline: Harmony's two-year-old daughter died after a drowning accident. She wants everyone to learn swim safety
01/01/2022.description: Harmony Starchild turned her daughter's life support off five days after the two-year-old drowned in a dam. It took two years for the swim instructor to brave the pool again.
01/01/2022.author: Karyn J Wilson and Erin Semmler

01/01/2022.headline: Beaten Arsenal bemoan VAR, with Aussie official in the firing line
01/01/2022.description: Australian VAR official Jarred Gillett is at the centre of controversy in the Premier League's New Year's Day show-stopper as Manchester City won 2-1 at Arsenal.
01/01/2022.author: Karyn J Wilson and Erin Semmler

01/01/2022.headline: NSW records 18,278 new COVID-19 cases as number of people in hospital tops 1,000
01/01/2022.description: The number of people being treated for COVID-19 in hospital in NSW tops 1,000 for the first time since October 2 after the state recorded 18,278 new cases.
01/01/2022.author: Karyn J Wilson and Erin Semmler

01/01/2022.headline: The forensic tool that reconstructs road crash scenes while thousands of vehicles drive through it
01/01/2022.description: New technology being deployed in Canberra allows police to build detailed 3D models of collisions without blocking off busy roads.
01/01/2022.author: Harry Frost

01/01/2022.headline: 'We met this old guy called Les': Milestone walk for wilderness regular 'Gandalf'
01/01/2022.description: If you come across a man in the middle of the Tasmanian wilderness wearing a tie and cooking chocolate pudding, it might be Les.
01/01/2022.author: Georgie Burgess

02/01/2022.headline: Sydney charity's plea for 'puny 500' rapid antigen test kits a week goes unanswered
02/01/2022.description: A charity in the inner-west says it has been asking the state government for 500 RAT kits a week, with no response. Its founder sees it as another example of the most vulnerable "left to languish on their own".
02/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao

02/01/2022.headline: Victorian farmers cleaning up after district's worst fire since the 1950s
02/01/2022.description: The 7,000-hectare grassfire broke out on New Year's Eve and has caused the death of thousands of livestock in the West Wimmera and burnt into native forest home to an endangered bird species.
02/01/2022.author: Christopher Testa

02/01/2022.headline: Vaccinated security guard at quarantine hotel becomes latest WA COVID-19 case
02/01/2022.description: A security guard at a Perth quarantine hotel has become Western Australia's latest case of COVID-19, separate from a recent local cluster sparked by a backpacker.
02/01/2022.author: Lucy Martin

02/01/2022.headline: NT sets new daily record of 95 new COVID-19 cases, government refuses to rule out further restrictions
02/01/2022.description: The Northern Territory has recorded 95 new COVID-19 cases overnight, a new daily record, with 14 classed as community transmission and another 28 under investigation.
02/01/2022.author: Lucy Martin

02/01/2022.headline: 1991 NT cabinet documents reveal plans to boost home owner numbers, a ban on riding in the back of utes and the first Arafura Games
02/01/2022.description: The release of cabinet papers from 1991 reveal an NT government striving to address concerns about housing affordability and road deaths and the opening of some of the Territory's most iconic institutions.
02/01/2022.author: Mitchell Abram

02/01/2022.headline: Labor promises $500m for Sydney-Newcastle fast rail
02/01/2022.description: Opposition Leader Anthony Albanese says the money would begin corridor acquisition and planning as a first step towards high-speed rail.
02/01/2022.author: Liz Farquhar

02/01/2022.headline: SA records 2,298 new COVID infections but case load 'within our current capacity', Premier says
02/01/2022.description: The number of COVID patients in hospital in South Australia jumps to 82, including seven people in intensive care, but the SA government insists demand on the health system is "very much within" capacity.
02/01/2022.author: Daniel Keane and Tom Fedorowytsch

02/01/2022.headline: Decades-long tradition of torching cars to ring in the New Year continues in France
02/01/2022.description: Hundreds of empty, parked cars go up in flames in France each New Year's Eve, set afire by young revellers, a much-lamented tradition that appeared in decline this year, which saw only 874 vehicles burned.
02/01/2022.author: Daniel Keane and Tom Fedorowytsch

02/01/2022.headline: Move over Norman Swan, the outback's answer to Coronacast has just scooped an award for news excellence
02/01/2022.description: COVID Report from Fitzroy Crossing's Wangki Radio lands the CBAA Award for Excellence in News and Current Affairs Programming for its daily efforts battling misinformation through the pandemic.
02/01/2022.author: Eddie Williams and Hinako Shiraishi

02/01/2022.headline: Former NRL star Blake Ferguson arrested in Japan
02/01/2022.description: Former NRL star Blake Ferguson was arrested in Japan on December 30, just one week out from the opening game of his rugby union career.
02/01/2022.author: Eddie Williams and Hinako Shiraishi

02/01/2022.headline: Queensland records 3,587 new cases of COVID-19, five in intensive care including two pregnant women
02/01/2022.description: There are currently five patients in intensive care, but none of them are on ventilators.
02/01/2022.author: Emilie Gramenz

02/01/2022.headline: Deema used to think a wheelchair would limit her. Instead, it has 'empowered her'
02/01/2022.description: When Perth mum Deema Audeh started playing powerchair hockey, she discovered an inspirational community and the key to her independence after being diagnosed with a rare degenerative disability.
02/01/2022.author: Emilie Gramenz

02/01/2022.headline: 'It's stuff that formed part of people's childhood': Hundreds of archived 90s photos show Queensland's transformation
02/01/2022.description: The photographs, released by state archives, depict some of the state's most iconic pieces of infrastructure, the people that worked on them, and show how much has changed.
02/01/2022.author: Sally Eeles

02/01/2022.headline: They left a $3b hole. This is how we can get working holidaymakers back
02/01/2022.description: Working holidaymakers bring in $3 billion each year, provide an essential workforce, and tend to spend more and stay longer than other travellers. Australia needs to do more to ensure they return, writes Sarah Gardiner.
02/01/2022.author: Sally Eeles

02/01/2022.headline: Are you approaching a 'milestone' birthday? It might be time for a chat with your doctor
02/01/2022.description: It might be surprising, but general check-ups don't always lead to better health outcomes. Instead, what tests you need should be guided by age and personal risk factors.
02/01/2022.author: Sally Eeles

02/01/2022.headline: Coober Pedy is renowned for its opal— but Andy searches its mines for something far more precious
02/01/2022.description: The remote opal mining town once relied on a relatively rag-tag crew of rescuers to keep safe those searching for its iridescent gemstones — but that crew has morphed into a slick SES response team.
02/01/2022.author: Gabriella Marchant

02/01/2022.headline: 'Prevented from visiting family': Queenslanders kept waiting for COVID-19 test results
02/01/2022.description: Some returning Queenslanders are having family reunions and work disrupted due to long waits for coronavirus test results, but the state government says the situation will soon improve due to the expanded use of rapid antigen tests.
02/01/2022.author: Emilie Gramenz

02/01/2022.headline: 'In Delhi, every newborn baby is a smoker from day one': The human cost of Delhi's toxic air
02/01/2022.description: Months after the Delta variant ravaged India's capital, Delhi, the city's residents are taking refuge indoors once more. This time, they're protecting themselves from the city's toxic air.
02/01/2022.author: Emilie Gramenz

02/01/2022.headline: Is 'finding love' your new year's resolution? It's not just Millennials scrolling through dating apps, Baby Boomers are too
02/01/2022.description: The COVID-19 pandemic challenged how Australian singles date, with stay-at-home orders and social distancing causing more people to move online to connect. As 2022 new year's resolutions are set, many older people are searching for love online.
02/01/2022.author: Nassim Khadem

02/01/2022.headline: Are you a mozzie magnet? Dirty socks, blue cheese and breath may explain why
02/01/2022.description: What makes someone more of a mozzie magnet than others? Scientists have been conducting some interesting experiments to find out. Here's what we know.
02/01/2022.author: Anna Salleh

02/01/2022.headline: New residents breathe life into isolated town on Tasmania's wild West Coast
02/01/2022.description: Queenstown's main street is reminiscent of a bygone era — once the hub of a booming mining town but now with many buildings fallen into disrepair.
02/01/2022.author: Alexandra Humphries

02/01/2022.headline: This couple made it through a year of COVID-19 separation. Now they're marking a romantic milestone
02/01/2022.description: The pandemic has made David and Angelica's long-distance relationship harder. However, after a year apart, they are reuniting and marking a romantic milestone.
02/01/2022.author: Nas Campanella and Celina Edmonds

02/01/2022.headline: The numerical disorder you’ve never heard of that's a 'hidden plague' in schools
02/01/2022.description: Do you use your fingers for simple maths? Find timetables difficult to read? Use a digital clock? You might have dyscalculia.
02/01/2022.author: Gary Nunn

02/01/2022.headline: 50 killed in widespread flooding in Malaysia, evacuations continue
02/01/2022.description: Seven states in Malaysia are hit by floods and thousands of people are evacuated, taking the total affected by heavy rain in the last two weeks to over 125,000.
02/01/2022.author: Gary Nunn

02/01/2022.headline: South Korean man crosses armed DMZ border in rare defection to North Korea
02/01/2022.description: A South Korean has crossed the heavily fortified border in a rare defection to North Korea, South Korea's military has said.
02/01/2022.author: Gary Nunn

02/01/2022.headline: Man arrested in connection to fire at South Africa's parliament building in Cape Town
02/01/2022.description: After fighting the blaze for several hours, firefighters have partially contained the fire, local officials said, with its cause of the fire still unknown.
02/01/2022.author: Gary Nunn

02/01/2022.headline: Police commence 'major investigation' into death of child under five in remote Central Australian community
02/01/2022.description: NT Police have confirmed the boy was found injured but alive in the remote community of Hermannsburg on New Year's Day, but sadly died soon after.
02/01/2022.author: Gary Nunn

02/01/2022.headline: Sad end for 'grand lady' as 99-year-old former Manly ferry sinks in Sydney Harbour
02/01/2022.description: Plans to restore the historic MV Baragoola have been dashed after the much-loved vessel sunk late last night as people lament on social media on another piece of history lost.
02/01/2022.author: Gary Nunn

02/01/2022.headline: Late call-up Max Purcell loses to Jannik Sinner in Australia's ATP Cup opener against Italy
02/01/2022.description: A hip complaint forces James Duckworth to withdraw from Australia's ATP Cup tie against Italy, with replacement Max Purcell going down in straight sets to Italian number two Jannik Sinner.
02/01/2022.author: Gary Nunn

02/01/2022.headline: Charity's plea for 'puny 500' rapid antigen test kits a week goes unanswered
02/01/2022.description: A charity in Sydney's inner-west says it has been asking the state government for 500 RAT kits a week, with no response. Its founder sees it as another example of the most vulnerable "left to languish on their own".
02/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao

02/01/2022.headline: Lionel Messi tests positive for COVID-19
02/01/2022.description: The 34-year-old and seven-time Ballon d'Or winner is one of four Paris Saint-Germain players to test positive for the virus.
02/01/2022.author: Samantha Lewis

02/01/2022.headline: Sudan's Prime Minister resigns as security forces violently disperse protesters
02/01/2022.description: Sudan's Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok's resignation comes amid a heavy security crackdown on protesters denouncing the military's takeover and a subsequent deal that reinstated him and sidelined the pro-democracy movement.
02/01/2022.author: Samantha Lewis

02/01/2022.headline: PM says he won't 'undercut' retailers by funding free rapid antigen tests
02/01/2022.description: Scott Morrison continues to resist pressure to make free rapid antigen tests for COVID-19 widely available, as state testing regimes buckle and rapid tests remain scarce.
02/01/2022.author: Jake Evans

02/01/2022.headline: Tasmania records 466 new COVID cases as businesses shut, people struggle to get a test
02/01/2022.description: Tasmania detects a record 466 new daily COVID infections, as people report struggling to get a COVID test, Public Health switches to automated surveys of confirmed cases and some businesses shut due to a lack of staff.
02/01/2022.author: Kate Ainsworth

03/01/2022.headline: The Loop: Rapid antigen tests won't be free, Evergrande saga takes a new twist and dirty socks and cheese could explain why mosquitoes love you
03/01/2022.description: Your quick wrap-up of the news you need to know about.
03/01/2022.author: Bridget Judd

03/01/2022.headline: Perth security guard may be WA’s first Omicron case as masks set to stay for now
03/01/2022.description: People in Perth and Peel must continue to wear masks in all public indoor settings, while other restrictions on hospitality venues will be lifted tomorrow, as more COVID-19 cases are recorded.
03/01/2022.author: Jessica Warriner

03/01/2022.headline: NT COVID cases drop to 58, reporting period changed due to pressure on contact tracers
03/01/2022.description: NT records 58 new COVID cases, including a health worker at Katherine Hospital who likely picked up the infection from a patient, as the government issues its update via press release rather than hold a media conference.
03/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts

03/01/2022.headline: When should you get a PCR swab instead of a rapid test?
03/01/2022.description: The rapid surge in Omicron across the holiday season has pushed testing capacity in many parts of Australia to the limit — here's who can get a PCR test.
03/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts

03/01/2022.headline: SA Opposition Leader Peter Malinauskas tests positive for COVID
03/01/2022.description: South Australian Labor leader Peter Malinauskas has tested positive for COVID-19, but says he feels well and has "very minor cold-like symptoms".
03/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts

03/01/2022.headline: Omicron is driving case numbers to new highs, but some countries are more worried than others
03/01/2022.description: Early research suggesting the Omicron variant is less deadly is giving hope to some countries, but others fear the sheer number of cases will put additional pressure not only on the health system, but all sectors of society.
03/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts

03/01/2022.headline: Victorian man charged with arson over fire that damaged entrance to Old Parliament House
03/01/2022.description: A fourth person is charged in relation to protests and a fire that was allegedly deliberately lit at Old Parliament House.
03/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

03/01/2022.headline: 'Our insurance policy revolves around two Rottweilers': Premium hikes force residents to forgo cover
03/01/2022.description: The cost of home and contents insurance in WA's Kimberley region ranges between $3,600-$20,000 and increasing 35 per cent a year despite no significant natural disasters since 2011.
03/01/2022.author: Madison Snow

03/01/2022.headline: Josh Giddey makes history as youngest NBA player to record triple-double
03/01/2022.description: At 19 years and 84 days, Australian Josh Giddey overtakes LaMelo Ball to become the youngest player to record a triple-double in NBA history.
03/01/2022.author: Madison Snow

03/01/2022.headline: WA records worst ambulance ramping figures in history as it prepares to let COVID in
03/01/2022.description: New figures reveal ambulance ramping in Western Australia doubled last year, with paramedics spending the equivalent of six years waiting outside hospitals, as the state prepares to open its borders in one month.
03/01/2022.author: Abby Richards

03/01/2022.headline: US Defense Secretary to continue working after testing positive to COVID-19
03/01/2022.description: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin confirms he has COVID-19 and says he last met with President Joe Biden more than a week before he developed symptoms.
03/01/2022.author: Abby Richards

03/01/2022.headline: Man who allegedly swerved into oncoming traffic during police pursuit charged with manslaughter
03/01/2022.description: A 48-year-old Moruya man is charged with manslaughter after he allegedly crashed into an oncoming vehicle and killed the driver, while he was being pursued by police.
03/01/2022.author: Antoinette Radford

03/01/2022.headline: SA reports 2,552 new COVID-19 cases, 94 people in hospital
03/01/2022.description: South Australia has reported 2,552 new cases of COVID-19 and the number of people in hospital has risen to 94.
03/01/2022.author: Sara Garcia

03/01/2022.headline: Evergrande shares placed in trading halt after luxury island demolition order
03/01/2022.description: Troubled Chinese property giant Evergrande's shares have been suspended from trading on the Hong Kong stock exchange. The company did not give a reason for the halt.
03/01/2022.author: Samuel Yang

03/01/2022.headline: A-League Women's Wrap, round 5: Hometown heroes shine as the APL faces more uncertainty
03/01/2022.description: As the APL scrambles to keep the A-Leagues alive, luck is running out for one of the ALW favourites. Samantha Lewis wraps up all the A-League Women's action from round 5.
03/01/2022.author: Samantha Lewis

03/01/2022.headline: 'That was a real dangerous situation': NFL player Jalen Hurts unscathed after fans fall in railing collapse
03/01/2022.description: Philadelphia quarterback Jalen Hurts narrowly avoids being hit by fans as a railing collapses into the players' tunnel after the Eagles' 20-16 NFL win against Washington.
03/01/2022.author: Samantha Lewis

03/01/2022.headline: Jamie Mitchell asks for transparency as historical cricket abuse allegations surface
03/01/2022.description: Former cricketer Jamie Mitchell says he is "relieved" the under-19s 1985 cricket tour is being scrutinised, as Cricket Australia responds to abuse allegations.
03/01/2022.author: Samantha Lewis

03/01/2022.headline: Elderly Queenslanders without booster warned to avoid gatherings as COVID cases hit new high
03/01/2022.description: The death of a Gold Coast man is being investigated as being related to a COVID-19 infection and Queenslanders are warned to assume "all of us are going to be exposed".
03/01/2022.author: Samantha Lewis

03/01/2022.headline: 'Whole thing is just a mess': Frustration builds over COVID-19 testing in Queensland as many spend first days of 2022 waiting for results
03/01/2022.description: After spending six days in isolation waiting for his COVID-19 test result, Brady Watson was told it had been "inadequately labelled", as testing queues balloon across Queensland. Many people are being turned away as health services grapple with the ever-growing demand.
03/01/2022.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis and Jessica Rendall

03/01/2022.headline: Emma didn't reveal her neurodiversity in job interviews, fearing she would be judged
03/01/2022.description: Emma was hesitant to reveal her autism to prospective employers. Now she's speaking up so others know that neurodiversity is no barrier to success — in fact, it may be an asset.
03/01/2022.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

03/01/2022.headline: 'I don't want to sell my son, but I have to': Poverty driving Afghans to do the unthinkable
03/01/2022.description: Many of Afghanistan's growing number of destitute people are resorting to the unthinkable as their nation falls further into poverty.
03/01/2022.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

03/01/2022.headline: We saved an extra $140b during the pandemic — and now some of us are 'revenge spending'
03/01/2022.description: As we emerge from the worst of the pandemic, it seems the right time to reflect on the most important changes in consumer behaviour we've seen, and to make some predictions about COVID-19's lasting and pervasive effects on how we shop.
03/01/2022.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

03/01/2022.headline: Proxy advisers agitating for change in corporate Australia to face new regulations restricting their influence
03/01/2022.description: Superannuation fund investors have been taking company directors to task on key issues, such as chief executive pay and climate change, with the help of proxy advisers. But those advisers' existence is under threat, writes Nassim Khadem.
03/01/2022.author: Nassim Khadem

03/01/2022.headline: Victoria plans to decriminalise all sex work within two years. Here's what that means
03/01/2022.description: Sex work is likely to be fully decriminalised within two years across Victoria. This is what that will mean, and how those within the industry see it.
03/01/2022.author: Judd Boaz

03/01/2022.headline: John wants to donate his brain to science — but the bank is currently full
03/01/2022.description: People with dementia who are hoping to donate their brains to science, like former university lecturer John Thorpe, are being told they can't because SA's brain bank is at capacity.
03/01/2022.author: Sarah Mullins

03/01/2022.headline: Japanese dating app inspired by pandemic encourages office romances
03/01/2022.description: With loneliness at an all-time high due to the pandemic, more than 800 Japanese companies have signed up for an AI-powered Aill goen dating app that guides their employees in courtship etiquette, including the right time to ask for a date.
03/01/2022.author: Jason Dasey

03/01/2022.headline: Ambulance services 'absolutely hammered' by non-urgent COVID calls
