03/01/2022.description: Paramedics are calling for a national awareness campaign about the symptoms of COVID-19 and how to treat them, saying a surge in triple-0 calls for non-essential reasons is taking a toll on the workforce.
03/01/2022.author: Penny Timms and Leonie Thorne

03/01/2022.headline: Epstein deal reveals secret $US500,000 payout to Andrew accuser
03/01/2022.description: The previously confidential document reveals Virginia Giuffre was paid $695,000 to drop her lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein.
03/01/2022.author: Penny Timms and Leonie Thorne

03/01/2022.headline: Should we still be checking in everywhere we go?
03/01/2022.description: Some state and territory governments are no longer listing exposure sites, and COVID is spreading fast. So is there any point of checking in?
03/01/2022.author: Katri Uibu

03/01/2022.headline: 'Nuclear war cannot be won': Russia, China, Britain, US and France say in rare joint statement
03/01/2022.description: The five nuclear states on the UN Security Council agree that a further spread of nuclear arms and a nuclear war should be avoided, amid escalating tensions between the US and Russia.
03/01/2022.author: Katri Uibu

03/01/2022.headline: 'Out of touch with reality': NSW doctor says hospital staff burnt-out, as Premier backs system
03/01/2022.description: A senior doctor at Sydney hospitals says colleagues have quit and retired due to the pressure of COVID-19 — challenging the Premier to spend a week on the frontline.
03/01/2022.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton and Ursula Malone

03/01/2022.headline: Hong Kong's pro-Beijing politicians sworn in, following 'patriots only' election
03/01/2022.description: The city's new Legislative Council does not include any opposition figures, who were disallowed from running in the December election under new rules imposed by Beijing.
03/01/2022.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton and Ursula Malone

03/01/2022.headline: Hail and strong winds damage cars and homes in Canberra as thousands lose power
03/01/2022.description: The northern areas of Belconnen and Gungahlin were the worst hit by the storm, which cut power to 16,000 Canberrans, toppled trees and damaged homes and cars.
03/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

03/01/2022.headline: What is aquamation, Archbishop Tutu's chosen flameless cremation?
03/01/2022.description: Archbishop Desmond Tutu was outspoken about protecting the environment, giving speeches and writing articles about the need to take action to combat climate change, and requested his body be aquamated — here's what that actually is.
03/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

03/01/2022.headline: Finnish company recycles coffee waste into sneakers
03/01/2022.description: A Finnish footwear firm raises over $1 million to produce shoes partly made from used coffee grounds.
03/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

03/01/2022.headline: Blake Ferguson sacked by Japanese rugby union club after drug-related arrest
03/01/2022.description: Former NRL premiership winner Blake Ferguson loses his contract with Japanese rugby club NEC Green Rockets after a drug-related arrest.
03/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

03/01/2022.headline: In a fusion of art and science, 3D-printed artificial reefs are providing a boost for marine life
03/01/2022.description: Alex Goad's work has been used in waters from Sydney to the Maldives and now the National Gallery of Victoria is giving people the chance to see them up close.
03/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

03/01/2022.headline: COVID updates: 84 million rapid antigen tests ordered for close contacts
03/01/2022.description: Here's a quick wrap of what's happening in COVID news across Australia.
03/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

03/01/2022.headline: Jerusalem Post website hacked on assassination anniversary of Iranian general Qassem Soleimani
03/01/2022.description: Instead of displaying its main news page, the website shows an illustration of a bullet-shaped object shooting out of a red ring worn on a finger, an apparent reference to a distinctive ring General Soleimani used to wear.
03/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

03/01/2022.headline: Three-year-old boy who went missing from remote NT died from dog attack, police believe
03/01/2022.description: Northern Territory police believe a young boy from an Indigenous community in Central Australia who died on New Years Day was mauled to death by at least one dog.
03/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

04/01/2022.headline: WA records zero new local COVID-19 cases for the first time in a week
04/01/2022.description: WA has recorded zero new local cases of COVID-19 connected to the Delta cluster as proof of vaccination requirements come into effect in venues and events in the state.
04/01/2022.author: Jessica Warriner

04/01/2022.headline: 'Economic support for genocide': Tesla's Elon Musk asked to close down new Xinjiang showroom
04/01/2022.description: Activists appeal to Tesla chairman Elon Musk to close the car maker's new showroom in China's north-western region of Xinjiang, where Beijing officials are accused of abuses against mostly Muslim ethnic minorities.
04/01/2022.author: Jessica Warriner

04/01/2022.headline: The Loop: COVID price gougers put on notice, Matt Damon's crypto ad under fire and get ready for the Battle of SNOWmicron
04/01/2022.description: Your quick wrap-up of the news you need to know about.
04/01/2022.author: Bridget Judd

04/01/2022.headline: Man who allegedly lit doors of Old Parliament House on fire granted bail
04/01/2022.description: A 30-year-old Victorian man is granted bail in the ACT Magistrates Court over his alleged involvement in a fire at Old Parliament House.
04/01/2022.author: Antoinette Radford

04/01/2022.headline: Exercise apps can't replace in-person training — but don't delete them just yet
04/01/2022.description: Researchers say even a minimal increase in physical activity could have huge impacts on Australia's overall health.
04/01/2022.author: Ellyn Duncan

04/01/2022.headline: Newborn baby survives being abandoned in cardboard box in Alaska
04/01/2022.description: Authorities confirm a newborn baby is in a stable and healthy condition after being left abandoned in a cardboard box in sub-zero temperatures in Alaska.
04/01/2022.author: Ellyn Duncan

04/01/2022.headline: Nick Kyrgios withdraws from Aus Open warm-up tournament with asthma
04/01/2022.description: The Australian withdraws from his first round match at the ATP 250 tournament in Melbourne on Tuesday night due to asthma.
04/01/2022.author: Ellyn Duncan

04/01/2022.headline: Aged care residents in southern Tasmania forced into lockdown as case numbers surge
04/01/2022.description: Aged care facilities in Tasmania are recording their first COVID cases since borders reopened to interstate visitors, with an outbreak at one facility confining residents to their rooms.
04/01/2022.author: Guy Stayner

04/01/2022.headline: Federal minister blames Omicron variant for rapid antigen test shortage
04/01/2022.description: Federal Finance Minister Simon Birmingham blames the emergence of the Omicron variant for a national shortage of rapid antigen tests, as the government faces accusations of being unprepared for a rise in cases.
04/01/2022.author: Jake Evans

04/01/2022.headline: Catalogue of late rocker David Bowie sold to Warner Music
04/01/2022.description: David Bowie's estate sells the late rocker's lifetime of work — including hits like Heroes and Let's Dance — to Warner Music for $250 million, following a deal signed in September.
04/01/2022.author: Jake Evans

04/01/2022.headline: What is 'flurona'? Israel has just documented its first known double-whammy infection
04/01/2022.description: Israeli health authorities have detected a case of what some are calling "flurona" — a double dose of COVID-19 and the flu. It comes as the country is experiencing a spike in influenza cases in recent weeks, sparking fears of a "twindemic".
04/01/2022.author: Jake Evans

04/01/2022.headline: Overwhelmed clinics resort to handing out take-home PCR kits
04/01/2022.description: People are reportedly waiting up to 10 hours for a test at some clinics across south-east Queensland, as the state grapples with an influx of cases and lack of rapid antigen tests.
04/01/2022.author: Tara Cassidy and Alexandria Utting

04/01/2022.headline: Consumer watchdog investigating rapid antigen test price gouging
04/01/2022.description: The consumer watchdog says it is investigating reports that COVID-19 rapid antigen tests are being sold at excessive prices, but it has not yet seen evidence of widespread price gouging.
04/01/2022.author: Jake Evans

04/01/2022.headline: How Elizabeth Holmes went from the cover of Forbes to guilty of fraud
04/01/2022.description: At the end of 2021, the ex-billionaire Elizabeth Holmes faced her toughest sales pitch — unsuccessfully attempting to convince a jury she was innocent.
04/01/2022.author: Jordan Hayne

04/01/2022.headline: 'It's a complete mess': This is how hard it is to get a PCR and rapid antigen test right now
04/01/2022.description: We asked our COVID live blog readers to tell us their stories about how long they spent in a queue waiting to get a PCR test, or how long they've had to wait to get their results.
04/01/2022.author: Jordan Hayne

04/01/2022.headline: 'I don't have a clue': Bucs coach claims he's in the dark about Antonio Brown walkoff
04/01/2022.description: Tampa Bay Buccaneers coach Bruce Arians dispelled the notion NFL star Antonio Brown stormed off the field because of an injury.
04/01/2022.author: Jordan Hayne

04/01/2022.headline: Here's why the 'international star' on I'm A Celebrity… belongs on the show
04/01/2022.description: Joey Essex is a household name in the UK, but some Australian viewers had no clue who he was.
04/01/2022.author: Dannielle Maguire

04/01/2022.headline: NT scraps PCR tests for interstate arrivals, Chief Minister says community transmission is 'holding steady'
04/01/2022.description: Authorities have dropped the requirement for a PCR test to enter the NT effective immediately, telling anyone who is waiting in a queue interstate to leave the line. The NT has today reported 75 new COVID-19 cases, including the first infection in the west Arnhem Land community of Gunbalanya.
04/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts and Samantha Dick

04/01/2022.headline: No sign of RATs for frustrated regional Victorians turned away from testing queues
04/01/2022.description: People are becoming frustrated at the COVID-19 testing regime as they are turned away from screening stations and unable to come by at-home testing kits.
04/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts and Samantha Dick

04/01/2022.headline: SA records 3,246 new COVID-19 cases, 102 people in hospital
04/01/2022.description: South Australia records 3,246 new COVID-19 cases, with 102 people now in hospital with the virus. Twelve of those hospitalised are in intensive care, and one is on a ventilator.
04/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts and Samantha Dick

04/01/2022.headline: Ocean-bottom seismometers helping researchers better understand earthquakes
04/01/2022.description: The biggest earthquake ever recorded in Victoria struck in September, but could the key to recording the next quake lie at the bottom of the ocean?
04/01/2022.author: Peter Somerville

04/01/2022.headline: BBL could move to Melbourne hub amidst COVID-19 crisis
04/01/2022.description: Cricket Australia toys with the idea of a hub in Melbourne to complete the BBL season as multiple clubs deal with COVID-19 infections.
04/01/2022.author: Peter Somerville

04/01/2022.headline: Queen thanks US toddler for 'splendid' Halloween costume
04/01/2022.description: A toddler in Ohio receives a letter from Queen Elizabeth II after dressing up as her for trick-or-treating.
04/01/2022.author: Peter Somerville

04/01/2022.headline: 'This isn't going to be over in two to three weeks': Mildly ill told to 'stay home' as COVID spreads through Queensland
04/01/2022.description: Chief Health Officer John Gerrard stresses that if anyone developed breathlessness, chest pain, severe light-headedness or fainting, they should seek "immediate medical advice or call an ambulance".
04/01/2022.author: Ciara Jones and Tobias Jurss-Lewis

04/01/2022.headline: 'It's just a hill, get over it': How trail running helped Fiona overcome stage four melanoma
04/01/2022.description: Fiona Kilby was heading out on a trail run when she realised she couldn't coordinate her arm to start her watch. A week later she had a 3.5cm lesion removed from her brain.
04/01/2022.author: Penny Travers

04/01/2022.headline: Birdwings, blow-ins and beauty: Why Torres Strait butterflies are Trevor's 'true, true love'
04/01/2022.description: Over 38 years, Queensland entomologist Trevor Lambkin has documented hundreds of butterfly species across the Torres Strait. His work now warns of rising sea levels threatening those insects.
04/01/2022.author: Lucy Stone and Kate O'Toole

04/01/2022.headline: Hot, dry weather drives desperate farmers to sell stock after slow start to wet season
04/01/2022.description: The hopes of farmers in outback Queensland have been dashed, leading to selling even more stock, after missing out on rain from recent weather systems.
04/01/2022.author: Zara Margolis

04/01/2022.headline: Judge sceptical of Prince Andrew attempt to throw out Giuffre lawsuit based on Epstein deal
04/01/2022.description: Prince Andrew's lawyer argued in a virtual hearing that Virginia Giuffre's case should be thrown out, based on a 2009 settlement deal she made with Jeffrey Epstein.
04/01/2022.author: Zara Margolis

04/01/2022.headline: Four plant-based foods to eat every week — and why they’re good for you
04/01/2022.description: As a laureate professor in nutrition and dietetics people often ask — what do you eat? Here are four versatile and tasty plant foods I have on my weekly grocery list, writes Clare Collins.
04/01/2022.author: Zara Margolis

04/01/2022.headline: Do the daily COVID-19 case numbers tell the real story about how widespread the virus is?
04/01/2022.description: Some experts argue there is growing evidence the daily COVID-19 case numbers greatly underestimate the spread of the virus. There are calls for rapid test results to be included in the count.
04/01/2022.author: Tim Callanan and Prianka Srinivasan

04/01/2022.headline: One year after the Capitol riots, a mystery remains unsolved: Who was the masked pipe bomber?
04/01/2022.description: Hundreds of people who stormed the US Capitol on January 6 have been arrested and charged in the year since the brazen attack. However, mystery still surrounds the suspect who planted homemade pipe bombs around the area the night before the violence.
04/01/2022.author: Tim Callanan and Prianka Srinivasan

04/01/2022.headline: Don't like Mondays? Blame the ancient Romans
04/01/2022.description: The seven-day week governs our lives in countless invisible ways but why do we use it?
04/01/2022.author: Nick Baker and Joey Watson

04/01/2022.headline: National cabinet to consider discounted rapid antigen tests for concession card holders
04/01/2022.description: The Prime Minister and state and territory leaders will consider whether people with concession cards should have access discounted rapid antigen tests at a meeting of national cabinet — but community groups fear it will not be enough.
04/01/2022.author: Jake Evans

04/01/2022.headline: COVID changed office work. And workers won't just 'go back'
04/01/2022.description: When work from home took off — forced by COVID — it could have been a blip. But when it's made worker's lives better, it won't be.
04/01/2022.author: Daniel Ziffer

04/01/2022.headline: 'Ten times saltier than seawater': Uncovering the mysteries of Australia's pink lakes
04/01/2022.description: Australia is home to hundreds of lakes that turn the colour of pink bubble gum or cordial, but what do we really know about the cause of their colour?
04/01/2022.author: Anna Salleh

04/01/2022.headline: Second Chinese city locked down, as Xi'an residents struggle to access food, supplies
04/01/2022.description: After the discovery of just three asymptomatic cases, Yuzhou ordered all residents to remain indoors and not to leave town.
04/01/2022.author: Anna Salleh

04/01/2022.headline: When health authorities stopped naming COVID exposure sites, Natalie stepped in
04/01/2022.description: As cases continue to rise and health authorities loosen COVID-19 restrictions and border controls, Tasmanians are taking matters into their own hands to crowdsource information on exposure sites and test
04/01/2022.author: Monte Bovill

04/01/2022.headline: 'People would be mortified if they knew': Exhausted nurses speak out about 'nightmare' working conditions
04/01/2022.description: NSW nurses say they're feeling pressured not to take sick leave, with some turning up for their shift despite not being "fit for work" as the state's rising number of COVID-19 cases put a strain on the health system.
04/01/2022.author: Kevin Nguyen, Alison Xiao, and Kathleen Calderwood

04/01/2022.headline: These women only met last year. Now they’re building a home together
04/01/2022.description: Once the purview of poor students, more adults are making a return to collaborative living in a bid to keep costs down and build communit
04/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

04/01/2022.headline: Thailand reopens beach made famous by Leonardo DiCaprio film
04/01/2022.description: Thailand reopens its famous Maya Bay more than three years after it was closed to allow its ecosystem to recover from the impact of thousands of visitors each day.
04/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

04/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic to play in Australian Open after receiving COVID-19 vaccination exemption
04/01/2022.description: The world number one announces in an Instagram post that he has received an "exemption permission" to head to Australia in order to compete in this month's Australian Open.
04/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

04/01/2022.headline: 'Adored beyond measure': Heartfelt tribute posted for SA toddler who died with COVID
04/01/2022.description: As the devastated parents of a 13-month-old girl who died with COVID-19 in South Australia last week try to "navigate their grief", tributes flow for the toddler who was "adored beyond measure".
04/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

04/01/2022.headline: As one remote community locks itself down, Darwin's largest Aboriginal community calls for further restrictions
04/01/2022.description: As COVID-19 case numbers continue to climb in the Northern Territory, multiple remote communities are grappling with how best to protect their residents.
04/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

04/01/2022.headline: COVID causes sporting chaos as Heat BBL fixture postponed
04/01/2022.description: The Brisbane Heat and Brisbane Broncos are the latest Australian sports teams to confirm players have tested positive to COVID-19, as the Heat outbreak forces the postponement of their BBL fixture.
04/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

04/01/2022.headline: Armed drone attack on US forces foiled in Iraq as Iran marks anniversary of general's death
04/01/2022.description: Two explosive-laden drones are shot down by Iraq's air defences as they approach the Ain al-Asad air base, which hosts US forces, a day after a similar incident near Baghdad airport.
04/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

04/01/2022.headline: 'An enormous loss': Canberra region wineries lose most of their crops in severe thunderstorm
04/01/2022.description: Murrumbateman wineries recovering from two years of poor yields due to bushfire smoke and drought have been severely damaged by a hailstorm that swept through the area on Monday evening.
04/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside and Rosie King

04/01/2022.headline: The national 'rat race' for testing kits
04/01/2022.description: The home testing kits are proving hard to find as COVID-19 case rise across the country.
04/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside and Rosie King

04/01/2022.headline: Thousands were bound for Lorne's Pier to Pub this weekend, so organisers turned it virtual
04/01/2022.description: Organisers of the popular event on Victoria's Surf Coast say many volunteers have either become infected with COVID-19 or are in isolation.
04/01/2022.author: Christopher Testa

05/01/2022.headline: Rare beaked whales wash ashore, aerial operation removes carcasses
05/01/2022.description: Three beaked whales have washed up on a Port Macquarie beach. They are rarely seen and it's thought heavy seas may have played a role in them coming so close to shore.
05/01/2022.author: Emma Siossian and Nick Parmeter

05/01/2022.headline: The Loop: Attempt to ease COVID testing pressure, a rainy Sydney Ashes Test, Nirvana Baby's lawsuit dismissed
05/01/2022.description: Get in The Loop with a quick wrap-up of the news you need to know about.
05/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

05/01/2022.headline: Rookie lifeguard saves kangaroo from rough surf in first ever rescue
05/01/2022.description: Seventeen-year-old lifeguard Lillian Bee Young's first rescue mission involved saving a kangaroo caught in rough surf at a beach in Iluka, NSW.
05/01/2022.author: Joanne Shoebridge, Emma Rennie, and Alexandra Jones

05/01/2022.headline: National cabinet agrees to free RATs for concession card holders, positive RAT results no longer require PCR test
05/01/2022.description: COVID testing requirements are slashed by national cabinet in an effort to ease pressure on the strained testing regime.
05/01/2022.author: Joanne Shoebridge, Emma Rennie, and Alexandra Jones

05/01/2022.headline: Border Force examining 'issue' relating to Djokovic's travel declaration
05/01/2022.description: The Acting Australian Border Force Commissioner is examining an "issue" that has arisen with Novak Djokovic's Australian Travel Declaration for the Australian Open.
05/01/2022.author: Joanne Shoebridge, Emma Rennie, and Alexandra Jones

05/01/2022.headline: COVID surge 'diabolical': Approval sought for close contacts to continue to staff hospitals
05/01/2022.description: One of Tasmania's main hospitals seeks approval for staff who are close contacts to continue working, as Omicron causes dozens of workers to isolate.
05/01/2022.author: Guy Stayner

05/01/2022.headline: There is plenty of good in Novak Djokovic, even though we focus on the bad
05/01/2022.description: While the concerns from Australians are genuine, Novak Djokovic's impending arrival brings with it a complicated relationship with fans, writes Tracey Holmes.
05/01/2022.author: Guy Stayner

05/01/2022.headline: Officials defend decision to quarantine homeless on oval in SA city
05/01/2022.description: SA Health and the Premier say the decision to isolate rough sleepers in tents on a Port Augusta oval was made after consulting the community.
05/01/2022.author: Shari Hams

05/01/2022.headline: 'Benefit of the doubt': Old Parliament House arson suspect granted bail a second time despite breach
05/01/2022.description: A Victorian man who allegedly lit a fire at Old Parliament House and was caught breaching his bail conditions just 15 minutes after leaving jail is granted bail for a second time.
05/01/2022.author: Antoinette Radford

05/01/2022.headline: North Korea fires missile into sea, a week after Kim Jong Un's pledge to boost military
05/01/2022.description: The militaries of South Korea and Japan say the North fired a suspected ballistic missile, its first public weapons launch in two months.
05/01/2022.author: Antoinette Radford

05/01/2022.headline: Could Australia win from Indonesia's shock suspension of coal exports?
05/01/2022.description: A decision by the Indonesian government to suspend some thermal coal exports to guarantee domestic supply could have a flow-on effect for Australian miners locked out of the China market.
05/01/2022.author: Tom Major

05/01/2022.headline: WA 'very different' to rest of the country as five new local COVID-19 cases recorded
05/01/2022.description: The new cases see the state upgrade border restrictions to the ACT and TAS to "extreme" risk, meaning WA's borders will be closed to every state and territory except the Northern Territory.
05/01/2022.author: Briana Shepherd and Gian De Poloni

05/01/2022.headline: Biden pledges to speak 'truth' on Capitol riots anniversary as Trump cancels event over 'total bias and dishonesty'
05/01/2022.description: US President Joe Biden plans to honour law enforcement at an address to mark one year since the deadly January 6 insurrection, while former president Donald Trump pulls the pin on his anniversary press conference.
05/01/2022.author: Briana Shepherd and Gian De Poloni

05/01/2022.headline: Judge dismisses 'Nirvana Baby' lawsuit over naked photo on Nevermind album cover
05/01/2022.description: A federal US judge dismisses Spencer Elden's claim he was sexually exploited in a nude baby picture of him used as the cover of Nirvana's 1991 album, Nevermind.
05/01/2022.author: Briana Shepherd and Gian De Poloni

05/01/2022.headline: In an age of declining regional media, meet the broadcaster fighting back one rock anthem at a time
05/01/2022.description: Alaina Earl says she was born to be a writer, but after falling victim to the decline in regional media offerings, losing her job twice at local papers and magazines, she made the switch to the airwaves.
05/01/2022.author: Jasmine Hines

05/01/2022.headline: NT records 117 new COVID cases, 'significant increase' in community transmission
05/01/2022.description: The Northern Territory sees a new daily record of 117 cases of COVID-19, including a "seriously unwell" baby, says NT Health Minister Natasha Fyles.
05/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts and Samantha Dick

05/01/2022.headline: Former volleyball player leads Bangladesh to landmark Test victory in New Zealand
05/01/2022.description: With only its sixth Test win away from home and its first Test win over a team ranked in the top 5, Bangladesh stuns New Zealand with an eight-wicket victory.
05/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts and Samantha Dick

05/01/2022.headline: SA sets new COVID case record as protester floored by police after Premier's media conference
05/01/2022.description: South Australia has set another daily coronavirus case record, with SA Premier Steven Marshall announcing 3,493 new infections at today's COVID update that concluded dramatically when a man was tackled to the ground.
05/01/2022.author: Stacey Pestrin

05/01/2022.headline: Canada to compensate First Nations children taken from their families
05/01/2022.description: It's estimated that more than 100,000 Indigenous children were taken from their families and raised in the welfare system in an effort to integrate them into Canadian society.
05/01/2022.author: Stacey Pestrin

05/01/2022.headline: Man accused of running drugs to medi-hotel in food delivery bags faces court
05/01/2022.description: An Adelaide man who allegedly tried to deliver heroin and other drugs concealed in food delivery bags to a COVID-19 medi-hotel has appeared in court.
05/01/2022.author: Sarah Mullins

05/01/2022.headline: $100m drug sting: Shipment of 99kg of meth stuffed in pillows intercepted at WA port
05/01/2022.description: Three men will face court after authorities allegedly intercept 99kg of methamphetamine stuffed into a 550kg shipment of latex pillows at Fremantle's port.
05/01/2022.author: Sarah Mullins

05/01/2022.headline: One crucial factor will dictate property prices this year and next
05/01/2022.description: The pandemic has caused a lot of heartache and distress, and it now appears to be creating more problems for first home buyers.
05/01/2022.author: David Taylor

05/01/2022.headline: COVID testing delays to continue for weeks as Australia encounters rapid antigen test 'disaster'
05/01/2022.description: Australians are being warned to expect to see long COVID-19 testing queues and wait times for at least several more weeks, as pathology labs continue to be hit by huge demand and staff shortages around the country.
05/01/2022.author: Penny Timms and Mary Lloyd

05/01/2022.headline: ACT announces new system for classifying COVID-19 exposure as territory records 810 cases
05/01/2022.description: The ACT records 810 new cases of COVID-19 as demand for testing reaches unprecedented levels and health authorities announce a number of changes to how they will manage the ongoing pandemic.
05/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

05/01/2022.headline: Half-a-million RATs arrive in Queensland, new private testing sites open today as COVID numbers rise
05/01/2022.description: Health officials believe there are many more unconfirmed infections in the community that are not picked up by government figures because testing clinics are being swamped by those seeking a PCR test for the virus.
05/01/2022.author: Nibir Khan

05/01/2022.headline: Would the Murray-Darling Basin survive another Millennium drought?
05/01/2022.description: The Millennium drought didn't just expose river beds — it also exposed deep tensions between environmental and economic interests. More than a decade has passed since that drought broke, but is the Murray-Darling Basin better placed to fend off the consequences of another protracted dry spell?
05/01/2022.author: Daniel Keane

05/01/2022.headline: A year on from the deadly Capitol riot, 'the ingredients are still there' for another attack
05/01/2022.description: Twelve months on from one of the most significant assaults on American democracy in living memory, the government is still under attack. It's eroding the country from within, writes Kathryn Diss.
05/01/2022.author: Kathryn Diss

05/01/2022.headline: Chris's family gathering on Christmas Eve resulted in four COVID cases, and his father now in ICU on a ventilator
05/01/2022.description: Days after a small family gathering on Christmas Eve, four out of six of Chris Healy's family were positive for COVID-19, with his father now on a ventilator in intensive care in hospital.
05/01/2022.author: Emilie Gramenz

05/01/2022.headline: Capitol rioters — where are they now?
05/01/2022.description: The unprecedented breach of the US Capitol has been described as one of the most well-documented criminal acts in history. Here's what happened to some of the people in the pictures.
05/01/2022.author: Emilie Gramenz

05/01/2022.headline: He's been 'hammered' during the pandemic and this sewing machine repairer wouldn't have it any other way
05/01/2022.description: From much-loved vintage varieties to the latest makes and models, Stephen Potts' busy workshop is an Aladdin's cave of sewing machines, overlockers, and the parts needed to fix them.
05/01/2022.author: Annie Gaffney

05/01/2022.headline: Diesel exhaust fluid AdBlue surges in price, but is it price-gouging or just supply and demand?
05/01/2022.description: AdBlue prices have surged, despite a government deal to scale-up the local production of its key ingredient, urea. Some suppliers say there’s no price-gouging, but simply a supply and demand issue.
05/01/2022.author: Samuel Yang

05/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic lands in Melbourne but visa doesn't allow for medical exemptions
05/01/2022.description: Novak Djokovic has landed in Melbourne but is still awaiting permission to enter the country to compete at the Australian Open.
05/01/2022.author: Samuel Yang

05/01/2022.headline: Victoria has fewer COVID-19 cases than New South Wales, so why are more people dying?
05/01/2022.description: Experts believe the impact of the Omicron wave in New South Wales might explain why the state is recording tens of thousands of more cases than Victoria, but surprisingly fewer deaths.
05/01/2022.author: Leonie Thorne and Prianka Srinivasan

05/01/2022.headline: One dog saves owner from freezing to death while another raises crash alarm
05/01/2022.description: Croatian rescuers praise a dog that protected its injured owner from freezing to death, keeping him warm overnight in the snow for 13 hours until he could get medical help. On the other side of the world, a smart 1yo dog alerts authorities to crash site.
05/01/2022.author: Leonie Thorne and Prianka Srinivasan

05/01/2022.headline: 'One size never fits all': why hyper-personalisation will change the way you work
05/01/2022.description: Amidst a skills shortage in many industries, employees are increasingly looking for work that works for them.
05/01/2022.author: Monique Ross

05/01/2022.headline: 'I don't think we're ready': Most young children will return to school unvaccinated, experts warn
05/01/2022.description: Children aged five to 11 years have to wait two months from their first dose to get the second one. It takes another couple of weeks for the immune system to respond, meaning many young kids will have to face school without sufficient protection for Omicron.
05/01/2022.author: Katri Uibu

05/01/2022.headline: Will a COVID time bomb blow up Tasmania's chances of hosting the Ashes again?
05/01/2022.description: COVID-19 opened the door to Tasmania hosting its first ever Ashes Test and it may be Omicron that keeps the crowds away, writes Chris Rowbottom.
05/01/2022.author: Chris Rowbottom

05/01/2022.headline: Ash Barty mounts brilliant comeback in her first match in months
05/01/2022.description: Plagued by unforced errors, Ash Barty displays plenty of fight on her return to the WTA Tour to beat American Coco Gauff at the Adelaide International.
05/01/2022.author: Chris Rowbottom

05/01/2022.headline: Purchase limits, transport services cut, meat shortage on Australia Day: COVID-driven staff shortages taking a toll
05/01/2022.description: Coles is introducing purchase limits on its meat products as all industries across NSW are hit with drastic staff shortages, amid a warning the situation will worsen as more people fall ill.
05/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao

05/01/2022.headline: Archibald Prize winner Craig Ruddy dies from COVID-19 complications
05/01/2022.description: The northern NSW-based artist, who won the Archibald Prize for his drawing of David Gulpilil in 2004, tested positive for the virus a few weeks ago.
05/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao

05/01/2022.headline: NT health system 'will collapse' without action amid COVID surge, according to nurses' union
05/01/2022.description: The NT nurses' union warns rising COVID-19 case numbers in the Territory, combined with worsening staff pressures, could lead to the health system crashing unless more restrictions are brought in.
05/01/2022.author: Myles Houlbrook-Walk

05/01/2022.headline: Wild weather warning as floods hit several sites in central Victoria
05/01/2022.description: Victorians are being told to brace for wild weather, with a warning for intense rainfall, large hailstones and damaging winds across most of the state.
05/01/2022.author: Myles Houlbrook-Walk

05/01/2022.headline: Hong Kong to ban flights from Australia, as the city deals with growing COVID-19 infections
05/01/2022.description: Leader Carrie Lam says the travel ban, which also affects Britain, the United States, Canada, Pakistan, Philippines, France and India, will start on Saturday and stay in place for two weeks.
05/01/2022.author: Myles Houlbrook-Walk

05/01/2022.headline: Frustration and farce at the SCG as Test cricket again gets in its own way
05/01/2022.description: Test cricket's inflexibility frustrates as much as the familiar Sydney rain on day one at the SCG, writes Dean Bilton.
05/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

06/01/2022.headline: 'Where's it been?' The Cruel Sea's lost ARIA award found almost 30 years later online for $1
06/01/2022.description: How an award travelled from the 1994 ARIA afterparty to being "found in a bin" remains a mystery, but The Cruel Sea are determined to find out.
06/01/2022.author: Joanne Shoebridge

06/01/2022.headline: 'We have cut the heads off': Taliban orders shops owners to cut off heads of mannequins
06/01/2022.description: The Ministry for the Promotion of Virtue and Prevention of Vice in Herat confirms the order that has gone viral on social media.
06/01/2022.author: Joanne Shoebridge

06/01/2022.headline: Four people taken to hospital after stolen car crashes into two other vehicles
06/01/2022.description: Police have thanked members of the public who chased and held down a man who ran from the scene of a car crash in Adelaide today.
06/01/2022.author: Joanne Shoebridge

06/01/2022.headline: The Loop: Supermarket shelves empty, NT goes into COVID lockout, Khawaja's comeback century
06/01/2022.description: You're reading The Loop, a quick wrap-up of the news you need to know about.
06/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

06/01/2022.headline: Alice Springs pharmacists ban RAT sales to anyone but locals as they field calls from 'far and wide'
06/01/2022.description: In Central Australia, Alice Springs pharmacies are selling rapid antigen tests (RATs) only to locals, and have committed to a fixed price, amid interstate demand.
06/01/2022.author: Samantha Jonscher

06/01/2022.headline: 'It's a dark comedy': Performer Paul McDermott on recovering from COVID-19
06/01/2022.description: Comedian Paul McDermott tested positive to COVID-19 before Christmas and says he and his family were hit hard by the symptoms.
06/01/2022.author: Hannah Sinclair

06/01/2022.headline: Pioneering Indigenous athlete, Commonwealth Games gold medallist Percy Hobson dies aged 79
06/01/2022.description: The first Indigenous person to win a gold medal at a Commonwealth Games and celebrated Bourke local Percy Hobson has died at age 79.
06/01/2022.author: Madeline Austin

06/01/2022.headline: Helicopters, boats helping farmers to finish a long, hard harvest
06/01/2022.description: Months of hard work to strip already damaged crops is continuing as many farms are left battling floodwaters to finally finish harvest.
06/01/2022.author: Lucy Thackray, Lara Webster, and Sally Bryant

06/01/2022.headline: Dozens of acts cancel Sydney Festival performances over $20,000 donation from Israeli embassy
06/01/2022.description: More than 20 acts boycott this year's Sydney Festival because of the board's decision to accept a $20,000 donation from the Israeli embassy to stage a dance performance.
06/01/2022.author: Harriet Tatham

06/01/2022.headline: More wet weather on the way as BOM crunches the 2021 numbers
06/01/2022.description: Heavy rain and flash flooding are on the cards as yet more rain drenches the south east. 2021 saw slightly above-average rain but stubbornly above-average temperatures.
06/01/2022.author: Kate Doyle

06/01/2022.headline: So you're a Victorian and you think you might have COVID. What do you do next?
06/01/2022.description: Under new testing changes, those who test positive on a RAT will be considered "probable" cases and must isolate immediately for seven days and notify their contacts.
06/01/2022.author: Kate Doyle

06/01/2022.headline: 'We've had enough': Hospitality staff hit back at patron bullying as one new local case recorded
06/01/2022.description: Western Australians will be left waiting at least until tomorrow to find out the fate the current mask mandate as the state records one new case of COVID-19.
06/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

06/01/2022.headline: Women's Ashes series brought forward, condensed
06/01/2022.description: COVID-19 restrictions in the lead-up to the women's World Cup in New Zealand have prompted Cricket Australia to bring forward the women's Ashes by a week.
06/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

06/01/2022.headline: Phoenix defeat City in FFA Cup, will face Victory in semi-final
06/01/2022.description: Phoenix goalkeeper Alex Paulsen saves three penalties in a dramatic shoot-out as Wellington qualify for their  first FFA Cup semi-final.
06/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

06/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic the unlikely hostage in petty political saga
06/01/2022.description: Australia's elected representatives are relishing the chance to punch down on the world number one, writes Jack Snape.
06/01/2022.author: Jack Snape

06/01/2022.headline: Why am I seeing references to 'brown rot' in my weather warnings?
06/01/2022.description: While we are used to weather warnings about storms and heatwaves, recent warnings in Victoria have included the term brown rot. Why?
06/01/2022.author: Eden Hynninen

06/01/2022.headline: Supermarkets short of supply as up to half of truck drivers absent due to COVID
06/01/2022.description: Supermarket shelves are empty once again, but retailers say a COVID-induced supply chain crunch is to blame, not panic buying.
06/01/2022.author: Samuel Yang

06/01/2022.headline: Rapid antigen tests will soon be free for millions of Australians — here's who's eligible
06/01/2022.description: National cabinet has agreed to extend the availability of free rapid antigen tests to some Australians — but supply shortages remain a serious issue across Australia.
06/01/2022.author: Samuel Yang

06/01/2022.headline: NT enters snap lockout, as COVID-19 cases more than double overnight
06/01/2022.description: Unvaccinated people in the NT will be subject to tough new lockout rules after the Territory recorded its highest number of COVID-19 cases to date.
06/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts and Samantha Dick

06/01/2022.headline: Brother of gang leader Bassam Hamzy shot dead in 'targeted' daylight attack
06/01/2022.description: Ghassan Amoun, the brother of notorious gang leader Bassam Hamzy, is shot dead in Western Sydney in what police say is a "targeted attack" with "obvious connections to criminal networks".
06/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts and Samantha Dick

06/01/2022.headline: Canberra man dies from COVID-19 as ACT records 992 new cases
06/01/2022.description: The ACT records 992 new cases of coronavirus, as NSW Health confirms a Canberra man in his 20s, who was being treated at St Vincent's Hospital, has died from COVID-19.
06/01/2022.author: Kate Midena

06/01/2022.headline: 'Stop watching the case numbers': As Australia enters the RAT phase some experts say we need to 'move on'
06/01/2022.description: Some medical experts are concerned Australia will no longer be able to provide accurate COVID-19 case numbers following a decision by national cabinet to scrap the requirement for PCR testing. But others aren't as concerned.
06/01/2022.author: Nick Sas and Penny Timms

06/01/2022.headline: Police declare 2020 death of SA woman major crime after receiving 'fresh information'
06/01/2022.description: The death of a woman, which was initially treated as not suspicious, is declared a major crime with South Australian Police saying they believe she was murdered.
06/01/2022.author: Nick Sas and Penny Timms

06/01/2022.headline: Once untouched by the pandemic, dozens of COVID cases recorded on remote King Island
06/01/2022.description: Tasmania's remote King Island records 60 new COVID infections from over 100 tests after managing to stay virus-free until the first case arrived last week.
06/01/2022.author: Nick Sas and Penny Timms

06/01/2022.headline: Live: US marks January 6 anniversary as Biden calls out Trump's 'bruised ego'
06/01/2022.description: US President Joe Biden starts a day of events marking one year since the January 6 attacks on Capitol Hill by attacking his predecessor. Follow live.
06/01/2022.author: Peter Marsh

06/01/2022.headline: Why eating local could spoil your appetite for supermarkets
06/01/2022.description: Do you know how far food travels before it reaches your plate? A collective of like-minded food producers do and they have have joined forces to do something about it.
06/01/2022.author: Brad Marsellos

06/01/2022.headline: 'It isn't sustainable': COVID-19 staff shortages hit Queensland’s tourism and hospitality sectors as cases soar
06/01/2022.description: Queensland's tourist destinations are enjoying "relatively strong" demand this holiday season, but as COVID-19 cases rise, testing requirements and isolation rules are crippling thousands of businesses, industry leaders say.
06/01/2022.author: Ciara Jones and Jessica Lamb

06/01/2022.headline: 'Not a clear plan': Queensland COVID-19 testing data getting 'weaker every day', expert says
06/01/2022.description: Chaos surrounding Queensland's COVID-19 testing systems has an expert worried that data on infection rates during the Omicron wave is so grossly under-reported, it is almost impossible to make predictions about the future impacts on hospitals.
06/01/2022.author: Emilie Gramenz

06/01/2022.headline: HomeBuilder saved the housing industry, but it also left many Australians with massive debts
06/01/2022.description: The HomeBuilder grant was one of the biggest stimulus injections the housing industry had ever seen, with more than 100,000 Australians able to build their dream home. But for those who missed out, it created turmoil.
06/01/2022.author: Nassim Khadem

06/01/2022.headline: Don't 'let it rip', lock it down: How a country of 1.4 billion people is keeping Omicron at bay
06/01/2022.description: For a country of 1.4 billion people, China has managed to keep its reported COVID-19 cases relatively low. But with Lunar New Year and the Winter Olympics coming up, can it stop the spread of Omicron?
06/01/2022.author: Sally Brooks and Dong Xing

06/01/2022.headline: A lack of rapid antigen tests has delayed Troy's 43rd round of chemotherapy
06/01/2022.description: Troy Jefferson was scheduled to receive another round of chemotherapy, but with a shortage of rapid tests, his surgery has been postponed — and health unions are warning it's a trend that will only worsen as COVID cases climb.
06/01/2022.author: Adam Langenberg

06/01/2022.headline: Cycloramas were the IMAX cinemas of their age, but their reign was short and sweet
06/01/2022.description: Before moving pictures existed, the Cyclorama was where you'd go see the latest blockbuster. They're all but forgotten now, but traces of them still exist if you know where to look.
06/01/2022.author: Tim Callanan

06/01/2022.headline: The Golden Globes are on. Here's what you need to know
06/01/2022.description: Here's your guide to what is and is not happening at this year's 79th annual Golden Globes awards ceremony — from no red carpet to celebrity boycott.
06/01/2022.author: Tim Callanan

06/01/2022.headline: How long does it take to recoup the cost of an EV?
06/01/2022.description: Many drivers are champing at the bit to get behind the wheel of an electric vehicle, but the biggest barrier is cost. So how long does it take to recoup the extra cost of an EV?
06/01/2022.author: Michael Slezak

06/01/2022.headline: Severe truck driver shortage hits food distributors, forcing some restaurants to close
06/01/2022.description: With up to half of all truck drivers absent due to COVID, the food supply chain is under pressure, with fears things will only get worse as case numbers mount.
06/01/2022.author: Elise Kinsella

06/01/2022.headline: Aussie 'Bobsled Bree' on the verge of making her Winter Olympic debut in Beijing
06/01/2022.description: Ranking sixth overall in the Monobob World Series standings, Australian Bree Walker is on track to her qualify for her first Winter Olympics at Beijing next month.
06/01/2022.author: Daniela Intili

06/01/2022.headline: Democracy under assault: How the Capitol riot unfolded
06/01/2022.description: It took just an hour for Donald Trump's supporters to overwhelm security at the Capitol and launch an unprecedented assault on America's democracy.
06/01/2022.author: Sarah Motherwell

06/01/2022.headline: Djokovic's father says Morrison 'dared attack Novak to bring Serbia to its knees'
06/01/2022.description: Novak Djokovic's father says the cancelling of his son's visa for Australia was politically motivated and hits out at Scott Morrison, accusing him of trying to bring Serbia "to its knees".
06/01/2022.author: Jack Hawke

06/01/2022.headline: Biden attacks Trump's 'web of lies' in Capitol attack anniversary speech
06/01/2022.description: Joe Biden accuses his predecessor Donald Trump of posing a continuing threat to American democracy in a speech on the anniversary of the deadly US Capitol attack by Trump supporters.
06/01/2022.author: Jack Hawke

06/01/2022.headline: 'We seem a bit left out here': How RAT inequality is affecting the regions
06/01/2022.description: Daniel wanted to make sure he didn’t have COVID-19 to keep his wife safe, but he couldn’t find a rapid test anywhere. The impact of the shortage in the regions is being widely felt.
06/01/2022.author: Sean Wales

06/01/2022.headline: Tens of thousands of elderly are alone and scared — and the tragedy is all too predictable
06/01/2022.description: Today, there are tens of thousands of elderly people sitting alone in their bedrooms in nursing homes — some with COVID, more being tested, others stuck there because of management's well-founded fears, writes Anne Connolly.
06/01/2022.author: Anne Connolly

06/01/2022.headline: Sydney nurse quits in protest over 'chaotic and dangerous' hospital conditions
06/01/2022.description: Registered nurse Amy Halvorsen is resigning from the job she once loved, saying staff shortages due to the escalating pandemic is causing intolerable anxiety.
06/01/2022.author: Ursula Malone

06/01/2022.headline: Would dogs be better off without humans? Maybe so, says this bioethicist
06/01/2022.description: Dogs were domesticated thousands of years ago so if humans disappeared, it could cause some big changes for our furry friends.
06/01/2022.author: Sophie Kesteven

06/01/2022.headline: Officer beheaded, protesters killed in Kazakhstan's worst protests since independence
06/01/2022.description: Demonstrators attempt to storm buildings in the country's largest city and dozens of protesters are "liquidated" as anger turns to the government and former president.
06/01/2022.author: Sophie Kesteven

06/01/2022.headline: Border officials investigate more medical exemptions after Djokovic's visa cancellation
06/01/2022.description: Australian Border Force officials investigate another player and an official granted medical exemptions by Tennis Australia following Novak Djokovic's visa cancellation.
06/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

06/01/2022.headline: Usman Khawaja's long journey complete with his SCG masterpiece
06/01/2022.description: Usman Khawaja has always been his own man, and the same self-assuredness that underpins his late-career brilliance also makes him one of Australian cricket's most beloved figures, writes Dean Bilton.
06/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

06/01/2022.headline: Australia signs 'landmark' security agreement with Japan
06/01/2022.description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison hold a virtual summit to seal a pact that has been in the works for years.
06/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

06/01/2022.headline: NT now in lockout, set to introduce a vaccine pass system. Here's everything you need to know
06/01/2022.description: The NT has been plunged into a lockout as its daily COVID-19 numbers soar to 256. It means unvaccinated people will only be able the leave home for three reasons, and soon there will be a new vaccine pass system. We explain the new rules.
06/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

07/01/2022.headline: Bar manager charged after 'hidden' New Year's Eve party allegedly breached COVID bans
07/01/2022.description: Police say they were confronted with blacked-out windows and locked doors when they tried to get inside the George bar and restaurant in Perth's CBD on New Year's Eve.
07/01/2022.author: Gian De Poloni

07/01/2022.headline: No dancing in nightclubs and some elective surgeries postponed under new ACT public health measures
07/01/2022.description: As of midday on Saturday, all hospitality and licensed venues in the ACT must ensure that patrons are seated while eating and drinking, and some elective surgeries will be postponed up to eight weeks. Dancing at hospitality venues will no longer be allowed, including at nightclubs.
07/01/2022.author: Gian De Poloni

07/01/2022.headline: Tropical low may whip up into cyclone off far north Queensland, BOM says
07/01/2022.description: There is a "moderate to high chance" a tropical low currently forming in the Coral Sea off north Queensland will develop into a tropical cyclone, the Bureau of Meteorology says.
07/01/2022.author: Gian De Poloni

07/01/2022.headline: 'Gay cake' case thrown out of European human rights court
07/01/2022.description: A top European court declines to rule in a high-profile discrimination case centred on an activist's request to have a cake decorated with the Sesame Street characters Bert and Ernie and the words "Support Gay Marriage".
07/01/2022.author: Gian De Poloni

07/01/2022.headline: Shopping centre roof collapses under rainfall as warning issued for storm west of Geelong
07/01/2022.description: BOM warns of damaging, locally destructive winds, large, possibly giant hailstones, and heavy rainfall that may lead to flash flooding around western suburbs of Melbourne
07/01/2022.author: Sarah Lawrence

07/01/2022.headline: Next week's Tamworth Country Music Festival postponed due to COVID-19 concerns
07/01/2022.description: Organisers of the annual Tamworth Country Music Festival postpone next week's event due to COVID-19 uncertainty and reschedule a smaller event for April.
07/01/2022.author: Lani Oataway, Kemii Maguire, and Keira Proust

07/01/2022.headline: Child playing with lighter may have sparked deadly Philadelphia blaze, US officials say
07/01/2022.description: Investigators are looking into whether a five-year-old who was playing with a lighter set a Christmas tree on fire, sparking a blaze that killed 12 family members in a Philadelphia terrace.
07/01/2022.author: Lani Oataway, Kemii Maguire, and Keira Proust

07/01/2022.headline: Nurses call to delay WA border opening as mask mandate to be dropped from this evening
07/01/2022.description: No new COVID-19 cases were recorded in WA through community transmission as the state prepares to lock its borders to every state and territory aside from the NT.
07/01/2022.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

07/01/2022.headline: COVID-19 may derail Women's Ashes, World Cup
07/01/2022.description: Meg Lanning's Australian team will be put on high alert, with any player who catches COVID-19 at the end of the women's Ashes likely to be ruled out of the World Cup.
07/01/2022.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

07/01/2022.headline: Can tattoos really be a cancer risk? Experts say ink bans are necessary but there are shades of grey
07/01/2022.description: An EU law came into force this week banning the use of many popular tattoo inks that contain chemicals regulators say are hazardous, with some linked to cancer. Tattoo artists are up in arms, but experts say Australia should be getting on board.
07/01/2022.author: Annika Burgess

07/01/2022.headline: New details emerge about last few weeks of fugitive's decade on the run
07/01/2022.description: A family tragedy occurred just weeks before wanted man Michael Davidson Tillman surrendered to police after more than a decade on the run, it can be revealed.
07/01/2022.author: Alexandria Utting

07/01/2022.headline: 'They're not our people': Three cars seized, two people arrested as Summernats festival underway in Canberra
07/01/2022.description: Three cars were seized overnight and two people were arrested in two separate incidents overnight, but Summernats co-owner Andy Lopez is clear: "They're not our people".
07/01/2022.author: Kate Midena

07/01/2022.headline: Where to get a free rapid test in Tasmania and how to register a positive result
07/01/2022.description: The Tasmanian government is giving out free rapid antigen tests to people who meet its criteria and PCR swab tests can now be booked online without a lengthy waits on the phone to Public Health.
07/01/2022.author: Kate Ainsworth

07/01/2022.headline: Man who allegedly swapped seats with passenger while driving granted bail
07/01/2022.description: A 41-year-old Canberra man who allegedly attempted to avoid police arrest by driving over a median strip and swapping seats with a passenger while driving is granted bail.
07/01/2022.author: Antoinette Radford

07/01/2022.headline: WHO says Delta is still dominant globally and Omicron is not mild
07/01/2022.description: While the infectious Omicron variant of COVID-19 appears to produce a less severe disease than the globally dominant Delta strain, it should not be categorised as "mild", World Health Organization officials say.
07/01/2022.author: Antoinette Radford

07/01/2022.headline: Premier says NSW faces 'difficult few weeks' as several COVID restrictions return
07/01/2022.description: Singing and dancing in hospitality venues is banned as NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet reintroduces several COVID-19 restrictions to battle the increasing number of cases and hospitalisations.
07/01/2022.author: Kevin Nguyen

07/01/2022.headline: SA records two deaths and 3,707 new COVID-19 cases
07/01/2022.description: Two people die in South Australia with COVID-19 over 48 hours as the state records 3,707 new cases.
07/01/2022.author: Stacey Pestrin and Daniel Keane

07/01/2022.headline: NT records 412 new cases of COVID-19, including 70 of community transmission
07/01/2022.description: The Northern Territory reports 412 new cases of COVID-19 — another daily record. Most of the people who have tested positive are in Darwin and between the ages of 20 and 40.
07/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts and Samantha Dick

07/01/2022.headline: Disaster group to convene as COVID wave hits Queensland, potentially delaying school year
07/01/2022.description: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says Queensland could be looking at a one-to-two week delay to the start of school, with a concrete decision to be made in the coming days, as the state confirms almost 11,000 new COVID-19 cases.
07/01/2022.author: Nibir Khan

07/01/2022.headline: ACT records 1,246 new COVID-19 cases, highest level of hospitalisations
07/01/2022.description: The ACT records its highest number of new daily cases, while 24 people are now in hospital with the virus.
07/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

07/01/2022.headline: Bitcoin miners caught in internet blackout amid bloodshed in Kazakhstan
07/01/2022.description: The global computing power of the bitcoin network drops sharply as Kazakhstan's internet shuts down amid a deadly uprising.
07/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

07/01/2022.headline: The 'AI' phone call that left Skye with more questions than answers after her COVID-positive result
07/01/2022.description: Skye Fellman says the "impersonal" experience of her COVID-19 diagnosis was taken to a different level when she received a surprise phone call from "Billie", introducing themselves as a Queensland Health AI assistant.
07/01/2022.author: Lia Walsh

07/01/2022.headline: Young woman killed after being struck by her car in Adelaide driveway
07/01/2022.description: A 22-year-old Adelaide woman dies fter being hit by her own car, which had rolled back in her driveway.
07/01/2022.author: Lia Walsh

07/01/2022.headline: Why it took John more than 160 calls to book a COVID-19 test
07/01/2022.description: Frustrated Port Lincoln residents make hundreds of calls to the South Australian city's COVID-19 testing clinic in an attempt to book a test, with a medical practice saying it's "increasingly difficult, if not impossible" to do so.
07/01/2022.author: Declan Gooch and Emma Pedler

07/01/2022.headline: Xi'an hospital punished for refusing entry to pregnant woman
07/01/2022.description: Hospital officials in the northern Chinese city of Xi'an have been punished after a pregnant woman — who later miscarried — was refused entry for not having current COVID-19 test results.
07/01/2022.author: Declan Gooch and Emma Pedler

07/01/2022.headline: An isolated WA has prepared for 300 daily COVID cases. It's likely to get more than 3,000
07/01/2022.description: Back in November, WA was bracing for a little over 300 cases a day at the height of an outbreak, but those numbers seem hopelessly out of date with the arrival of Omicron.
07/01/2022.author: Rebecca Trigger

07/01/2022.headline: More than holes in the ground, this geological marvel is a doorway to another world
07/01/2022.description: People travel from all over the world to dive in the middle of roads, on farms and in pine forests along South Australia's the Limestone Coast. Most of us don't know it's there.
07/01/2022.author: Bec Whetham and Daniel Franklin

07/01/2022.headline: 'Grandpa came home': Tears and pride as Gulpilil returns to Arnhem Land
07/01/2022.description: The late Rabbit Proof Fence and Storm Boy actor's body is returned to his grieving family in the remote Northern Territory, less than two months since his passing in South Australia.
07/01/2022.author: Matt Garrick

07/01/2022.headline: Cambodian PM visit to Myanmar legitimises deadly junta rule, says critics
07/01/2022.description: Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Sen met Myanmar's military ruler Min Aung Hlaing amid criticism of the first visit by a head of government since the army seized power from an elected government last year.
07/01/2022.author: Matt Garrick

07/01/2022.headline: Kevin was ready to sign a contract on a $400,000 house. Then he drove around the neighbourhood
07/01/2022.description: Homes built under a troubled affordable housing scheme in Greater Darwin are being put on the market, but one first home buyer says he was left in the dark when he almost purchased one of them.
07/01/2022.author: Jesse Thompson and Jano Gibson

07/01/2022.headline: Get hit in the face by a ball? Think twice before walking it off
07/01/2022.description: Our precious eyes are susceptible to a range of injuries in the warmer months as we spend more time outdoors, like playing backyard cricket, tennis or gardening.
07/01/2022.author: Sarah Motherwell

07/01/2022.headline: Trump has power. Trump has money. Trump is holding packed rallies. Is his run in 2024 inevitable?
07/01/2022.description: A year after the January 6 attacks, Donald Trump is as popular as he's ever been. Here's how he rose from the ashes of the riots that shocked the world.
07/01/2022.author: Peter Marsh

07/01/2022.headline: 2022 marks a decade of Xi Jinping's rule. These signature moves have transformed China forever
07/01/2022.description: This year, President Xi Jinping is set to extend his 10-year rule — and it's unlikely to end for life. From purges, to tightened freedoms, disappearances and rights abuses, we take a look back at how China has dramatically changed under his reign.
07/01/2022.author: Annika Burgess and Jason Fang

07/01/2022.headline: Djokovic thanks fans for their support as he spends second night in immigration detention while legal teams prepare court fight
07/01/2022.description: The world number one tennis player would normally spend Orthodox Christmas at a Serbian church in Melbourne. Instead he's in immigration detention waiting to see whether he will be deported from Australia.
07/01/2022.author: Liam Butterworth

07/01/2022.headline: From RAT-filled vending machines to price caps, here's how other countries are tackling rapid tests
07/01/2022.description: Around the world, a potent combination of the Omicron variant and increased travel over the festive period has resulted in a run on rapid antigen tests. Experts say there are a few things we can do to avoid another mass shortage when the next variant arrives.
07/01/2022.author: Lucy Sweeney

07/01/2022.headline: Academy Award-winning actor Sidney Poitier dies aged 94
07/01/2022.description: The Bahamian Ministry of Foreign Affairs confirms the death of Poitier, who broke racial barriers as the first black winner of the best actor Oscar for his role in Lilies of the Field in 1963 and inspired a generation during the civil rights movement.
07/01/2022.author: Lucy Sweeney

07/01/2022.headline: Our political leaders haven't learnt from past COVID mistakes, they just wait to listen to the mob
07/01/2022.description: Despite everything COVID-19 has thrown at us, it seems our political leaders are incapable of anticipating, of getting proactive. Instead, they wait to find out what the mob thinks, writes Laura Tingle.
07/01/2022.author: Laura Tingle

07/01/2022.headline: The COVID conversation you need to have with your household this weekend
07/01/2022.description: When it comes to a household COVID-19 outbreak, it can pay to be prepared. Here’s what you should have in your isolation survival kit.
07/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

07/01/2022.headline: Richmond open AFLW season with comprehensive win over St Kilda
07/01/2022.description: Richmond kick off their AFLW season in style, with Monique Conti starring in a 38-point win over St Kilda.
07/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

07/01/2022.headline: Kazakhstan's President orders troops to fire on 'terrorists' without warning
07/01/2022.description: Kazakhstan's President authorises security personnel to open fire on "terrorists" and shoot to kill, a move that comes after days of extremely violent protests in the former Soviet nation.
07/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

07/01/2022.headline: Australian Border Force cancels tennis player Renata Voráčová's visa ahead of Australian Open
07/01/2022.description: The female tennis player from the Czech Republic is among three people connected to the Australian Open to have their visas cancelled. She is being detained in the same immigration hotel as Serbian star Novak Djokovic.
07/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

07/01/2022.headline: 'Common symptoms': Federal Treasurer Josh Frydenberg tests positive for COVID-19
07/01/2022.description: Federal Treasurer Josh Frydenberg says he has tested positive for COVID-19 after developing symptoms and is isolating with his family.
07/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

07/01/2022.headline: In the NT, COVID-19 has spread fast since borders re-opened. We ask the experts how worried we should be
07/01/2022.description: The Northern Territory has broken its daily record for new COVID-19 cases for three consecutive days now, as the reproduction rate of the disease reaches 4.5. But according to the health experts, the trend it isn't necessarily cause for alarm.
07/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

07/01/2022.headline: Battered and bruised, Bairstow and England finally discover their fight
07/01/2022.description: With their bodies busted and their team on the ropes, Jonny Bairstow and Ben Stokes finally stared back at Australia and said "enough", writes Dean Bilton.
07/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

07/01/2022.headline: Wary Australians are spending like they are in COVID-19 lockdowns, bank data suggests
07/01/2022.description: No state or territory around the country is in lockdown, but economic data now indicates millions of Australians are behaving as if a nation-wide lockdown is in place.
07/01/2022.author: David Taylor

07/01/2022.headline: The Loop: Dancing bans in two jurisdictions, Novak Djokovic still in detention and Elmo loses his cool over a rock
07/01/2022.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
07/01/2022.author: Dannielle Maguire

07/01/2022.headline: Ash Barty serves up masterclass in Adelaide to beat Sofia Kenin
07/01/2022.description: Australia's Ash Barty produces an excellent match to take care of former world number four Sofia Kenin to reach the semi-finals of the Adelaide International.
07/01/2022.author: Dannielle Maguire

07/01/2022.headline: Organisers of 'hidden' NYE party that drew hundreds during COVID restrictions charged
07/01/2022.description: Police say they were confronted with blacked-out windows and locked doors when they tried to get inside the George bar and restaurant in Perth's CBD on New Year's Eve.
07/01/2022.author: Gian De Poloni

07/01/2022.headline: Police close Darwin business for allegedly breaching vaccine mandate
07/01/2022.description: A Darwin business is shut down for allegedly breaching multiple COVID-19 health directions, including the NT's vaccine mandate.
07/01/2022.author: Myles Houlbrook-Walk

07/01/2022.headline: What these fornicating fairies could mean for their dying population
07/01/2022.description: Researchers have been shocked but gladdened after seeing purple-crowned fairy wrens at a Kimberley sanctuary getting frisky for the second year in a row.
07/01/2022.author: Eddie Williams and Hinako Shiraishi

07/01/2022.headline: Elements of Tasmania's border reopening plans have been either changed or scrapped
07/01/2022.description: While Tasmania hit its vaccination target by the time the border restrictions eased on December 15, some of the other rules and aims the reopening plan was based on have either been changed or scrapped, writes Loretta Lohberger.
07/01/2022.author: Loretta Lohberger

07/01/2022.headline: Tasmania records 2,223 new COVID cases, the state's highest daily figure
07/01/2022.description: Tasmania records 2,223 new cases of COVID, taking the total of active cases in the state to 6,509, as calls for business support grow.
07/01/2022.author: Loretta Lohberger

08/01/2022.headline: Mother, newborn baby missing, sparking urgent plea from WA Police
08/01/2022.description: Police are asking the family and friends of a woman who left a Perth hospital with her premature newborn girl to let them know where she is so they can ensure the baby is being well cared for.
08/01/2022.author: Nicolas Perpitch

08/01/2022.headline: Selection headache? Usman Khawaja's slice of history just made Australia's decision an easy one
08/01/2022.description: When Usman Khawaja passed 50 on day four in Sydney, Australian selectors faced a dilemma. Once he reached 100, the problem was convincingly solved, writes Dean Bilton.
08/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

08/01/2022.headline: South Australian Premier Steven Marshall isolating after daughter tests positive to COVID
08/01/2022.description: South Australia's Premier Steven Marshall is in isolation after his daughter tests positive for COVID-19.
08/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

08/01/2022.headline: Ships use the world's heaviest fuel. This one burns vegetable oil
08/01/2022.description: Bunker oil is thick and black, only a step above tar. But can biofuels replace it to run the world's commercial ships? An Australia-first grain export trial aims to find out.
08/01/2022.author: Angus Mackintosh

08/01/2022.headline: Rescue underway as teen falls off cliff in Barwon Heads
08/01/2022.description: Emergency services are at the scene to rescue a 14-year-old boy who has fallen off a cliff at Barwon Heads.
08/01/2022.author: Angus Mackintosh

08/01/2022.headline: Farmer's fossil discovery opens window to ancient ecosystems
08/01/2022.description: When Nigel McGrath hit heavy rock while ploughing a field on the New South Wales Central Tablelands, little did he realise he was sowing the seeds of a discovery some 15 million years in the making.
08/01/2022.author: Angus Mackintosh

08/01/2022.headline: WA records one COVID-19 case, as prospective travellers hit new stumbling block
08/01/2022.description: It is less than a month before Western Australia opens its borders, but getting approval to enter the jurisdiction after this time is proving difficult, as the state records one new COVID case.
08/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

08/01/2022.headline: BlackBerry's demise shows tech gadgets don't come back once they lose their shine
08/01/2022.description: Once they were all the rage, but now BlackBerry is pulling service for its business smartphones, seeing they have been surpassed by the iPhone.
08/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

08/01/2022.headline: Injured Naomi Osaka withdraws from WTA semi-final
08/01/2022.description: Japanese tennis superstar and Australian Open champion Naomi Osaka has withdrawn from the semi-final of the WTA tournament in Melbourne, with Tennis Australia saying she has an abdominal injury.
08/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

08/01/2022.headline: Pakistan has its first woman on the Supreme Court – so, who is Ayesha Malik?
08/01/2022.description: In its 75-year history since independence from colonial rule, Pakistan has not had a woman judge in its top court. But Ayesha Malik's path to victory has been controversial.
08/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

08/01/2022.headline: 'We black people had done it': Sidney Poitier's trailblazing life in his own words
08/01/2022.description: As a trailblazing actor to generations of black performers in Hollywood, Sidney Poitier often spoke about his larger off-screen role. Here, he describes his life in his own words.
08/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

08/01/2022.headline: World's rarest marsupial persisting on remote islands off WA's south coast
08/01/2022.description: As Australia's wildlife comes under increasing threat, many remote islands are taking on a critical role in conservation — as safe havens for some of our most endangered species.
08/01/2022.author: Emily JB Smith

08/01/2022.headline: As new restrictions begin, ACT records 1,305 cases of COVID-19
08/01/2022.description: The ACT has recorded more than 1,000 cases of COVID-19 for the second day in a row, as new hospitality restrictions begin, prompted by rising cases.
08/01/2022.author: Kate Midena

08/01/2022.headline: Big Bash teams on the move to Melbourne due to COVID-19 outbreaks
08/01/2022.description: In a bid to keep the season alive through COVID-19 outbreaks, Big Bash League teams will move to Melbourne with several games also transferring to Victoria.
08/01/2022.author: Kate Midena

08/01/2022.headline: Two more COVID-related deaths confirmed in Queensland, 11,174 new cases
08/01/2022.description: Chief Health Officer John Gerrard says a man in his 30s died "unexpectedly" at his home on January 5, and confirmed the death of a man on the Gold Coast was also COVID-related.
08/01/2022.author: Kate Midena

08/01/2022.headline: Goal 'scored' by dead footballer celebrated by fans worldwide
08/01/2022.description: A dead Chilean footballer is being celebrated the world over after his former teammates arranged for him to score a goal from his coffin as a farewell tribute to his striking prowess.
08/01/2022.author: Kate Midena

08/01/2022.headline: Questacon founder Professor Michael Gore dies
08/01/2022.description: Professor Michael Gore, the founder of the national science institution Questacon, has died in Canberra at the age of 87.
08/01/2022.author: Kate Midena

08/01/2022.headline: SA records five deaths, 4,274 COVID cases
08/01/2022.description: South Australia reports five deaths from COVID-19, while the number of patients in hospital also rises.
08/01/2022.author: Sara Garcia and Isabel Dayman

08/01/2022.headline: Legend's shock comeback headlines Matildas' Asian Cup squad
08/01/2022.description: Veteran midfielder Aivi Luik will make a surprise return from retirement to try and help the Matildas
08/01/2022.author: Sara Garcia and Isabel Dayman

08/01/2022.headline: COVID 'right across the territory' as Northern Territory records nearly 600 new cases
08/01/2022.description: The Northern Territory reports 594 new cases of COVID-19 — another daily record — as health teams race to stop the virus spreading through a remote community with a low vaccination rate.
08/01/2022.author: Sara Garcia and Isabel Dayman

08/01/2022.headline: Angelica baths her baby in bottled water because she doesn't trust the tap. Experts say it's a good idea
08/01/2022.description: Health authorities and leaders have concerns damaged pipes are contaminating Warburton's tap water despite new, safer water at the source for the remote Aboriginal community.
08/01/2022.author: Amelia Searson

08/01/2022.headline: The Omicron 'curve ball' leaves a major question unanswered — is WA ready to reopen?
08/01/2022.description: With each passing day of record infections across Australia, the confidence that WA can achieve a "soft landing" when it reopens to the rest of the world has given way to anxiety.
08/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

08/01/2022.headline: Is this Australia's most harcore animal?
08/01/2022.description: They may be no match for saltwater crocs or great white sharks, but for their size, our freshwater eels are surprisingly hardcore.
08/01/2022.author: Zoe Kean

08/01/2022.headline: Worried your charity donations get soaked up in admin? Read this
08/01/2022.description: Where do our charity donations actually go? And with bureaucracy and administration costs, can our contributions help the causes — and people — we care about?
08/01/2022.author: Siobhan Marin

08/01/2022.headline: Heavy snowstorm kills 22 people stuck in vehicles overnight as temperatures plummet in Pakistan resort town
08/01/2022.description: At least 22 people, including 10 children, die in a popular mountain resort town in Pakistan after being stuck in their vehicles overnight during a heavy snowstorm as temperatures plummeted.
08/01/2022.author: Siobhan Marin

08/01/2022.headline: Air strike in north-west Tigray camp for displaced people leaves 56 dead, as Ethiopian conflict continues
08/01/2022.description: An air strike in Ethiopia's Tigray region has killed 56 people and injured 30, including children, in a camp for displaced people, according to two aid workers.
08/01/2022.author: Siobhan Marin

08/01/2022.headline: 'Sebby' defied all odds after being given eight months to live. Then he contracted COVID-19
08/01/2022.description: A south-west Sydney boy with a rare genetic condition who "defied predictions" about his life expectancy becomes the youngest person in NSW to die after contracting COVID-19.
08/01/2022.author: Kevin Nguyen

08/01/2022.headline: January 6th: A one-off or an omen?
08/01/2022.description: As the US turns its attention to the 2024 presidential race, experts are asking if the Capitol riots could lead to the successful overthrow of the US government in the future.
08/01/2022.author: Kevin Nguyen

08/01/2022.headline: Peng Shuai has denied claiming she was 'sexually assaulted'. So what did her now-deleted post actually say?
08/01/2022.description: Chinese tennis player Peng Shuai has told a Singaporean media outlet she never claimed to have been "sexually assaulted". So that means she is retracting the claim she made in her quickly deleted social media post, right? Well, turns out it's complicated.
08/01/2022.author: Will Jackson

08/01/2022.headline: 'Buyers are prepared to pay a premium': Popular schools driving up already soaring Brisbane house prices
08/01/2022.description: State schools in Macgregor, Sunnybank Hills, Robertson and at Warrigal Road in Brisbane are major selling points for houses in Sunnybank and real estate agents say there are not enough properties to address the demand.
08/01/2022.author: Jessica Rendall

08/01/2022.headline: Executions, assassinations and hidden babies: The Kims make the Roy family in Succession look devoted
08/01/2022.description: They have ruled North Korea for three generations, but the new Kims have blended more modern approaches to fashion and propaganda, with old family traditions of secret child rearing and bloody purges.
08/01/2022.author: Debra Killalea

08/01/2022.headline: Sometimes I felt like I was becoming the invisible woman — but I found a way to reappear
08/01/2022.description: For years after being diagnosed with my diagnosis, I kept my full self hidden. But I've since realised being me is not negotiable — I refuse to be invisible, writes Kate Stone Matheson.
08/01/2022.author: Debra Killalea

08/01/2022.headline: This is about more than Novak Djokovic — it's about the cornerstone of sovereignty
08/01/2022.description: For many it may well be a stretch that a rich tennis star is a martyr but Djokovic's father is on to something. This is about more than tennis. It is about more than COVID or public safety, writes Stan Grant.
08/01/2022.author: Stan Grant

08/01/2022.headline: Australia likely to hit a million total cases today,  as Omicron rewrites the rules
08/01/2022.description: As we pause after a bumpy ride on this week's COVID wave, it's worth reflecting on the journey and the key questions we wrestled with.
