08/01/2022.author: Catherine Taylor and Leigh Tonkin

08/01/2022.headline: Kazakhstan's ex-security chief arrested for treason amid violent unrest
08/01/2022.description: Kazakhstan's former intelligence chief has been arrested on suspicion of treason, the state security agency says, as the former Soviet republic is roiled by its worst unrest in 30 years.
08/01/2022.author: Catherine Taylor and Leigh Tonkin

08/01/2022.headline: One in 12 test positive: The age group at the top of the Omicron wave
08/01/2022.description: Darcy is one of many of his friends to catch COVID in the past few weeks at a birthday drinks for a friend. Epidemiologists aren't surprised.
08/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

08/01/2022.headline: Czech tennis player Renata Voráčová deported from Australia after visa cancellation
08/01/2022.description: Czech tennis player Renata Voráčová is deported after her visa was cancelled by the Australian Border Force.
08/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

08/01/2022.headline: Fremantle kick off 2022 with AFLW win over West Coast as North Melbourne beat Geelong
08/01/2022.description: The Dockers come home with a bang to take the win against the Eagles, as North Melbourne survive a major scare to beat Geelong.
08/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

08/01/2022.headline: Djokovic had exemption on grounds of recent COVID-19 infection, lawyers say
08/01/2022.description: Lawyers for Novak Djokovic file court submissions as part of his battle to stay in Australia, confirming he received a medical exemption on the grounds he had recently recovered from COVID-19.
08/01/2022.author: Dan Smith

08/01/2022.headline: Teen survives after falling off cliff in Barwon Heads near Geelong
08/01/2022.description: A 14-year-old boy survives after falling off a cliff on to rocks below at Barwon Heads.
08/01/2022.author: Angus Mackintosh

08/01/2022.headline: Education Minister urges parents to vaccinate children as Tasmania records 1,406 new COVID-19 cases
08/01/2022.description: Tasmania records 1,406 COVID cases, as health authorities prepare for the vaccination of children aged five to 11 years.
08/01/2022.author: Simon Smale

08/01/2022.headline: Wide delivery: Outback postie celebrates 260,000km of providing vital service
08/01/2022.description: Bec Climie services iconic pubs, police stations, cattle properties and homes where people would otherwise have to trek hundreds of kilometres for urgent goods and mail.
08/01/2022.author: Zara Margolis and Larissa Waterson

08/01/2022.headline: Barty aims for double glory in Adelaide
08/01/2022.description: Australia's world number one Ash Barty could win both the singles and doubles titles at the Adelaide International on Sunday.
08/01/2022.author: Zara Margolis and Larissa Waterson

08/01/2022.headline: Tiwi Islanders stranded in COVID-hit Darwin as remote travel restrictions come in
08/01/2022.description: A woman from the islands, north of Darwin, says a holiday is turning into a confusing ordeal after travel restrictions intended to stop the spread of COVID-19 to remote areas were brought in.
08/01/2022.author: Housnia Shams

08/01/2022.headline: 'It's disgusting': Illegal net brimming with dead fish found in famous barra river
08/01/2022.description: A gillnet brimming with dead species, including barramundi, has fishers outraged over the banned technique in Western Australia's famous Pentecost River.
08/01/2022.author: Ted O'Connor

08/01/2022.headline: Mozart claimed credit for concertos written by his sister, suggests Darwin academic
08/01/2022.description: A Darwin academic says he has found evidence that suggests one of the greatest composers of all time claimed credit for some of his older sister's work.
08/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

09/01/2022.headline: Critical workers blast 'reckless' decision to allow close contacts back to work
09/01/2022.description: Essential workers say they're worried about the state government's "reckless" decision to allow asymptomatic close contacts to come back to work without isolating.
09/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao

09/01/2022.headline: Ash Barty wins Adelaide International
09/01/2022.description: Australia's world number one Ash Barty has won the Adelaide International for a second time, with a straight-sets win over Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina.
09/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao

09/01/2022.headline: Baby lost in chaos of Taliban takeover finally reunited with his family
09/01/2022.description: After losing him at Kabul airport, baby Sohail's family spent months trying to find him. When they did, it was not easy to get him back.
09/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao

09/01/2022.headline: Rapid antigen tests become legal in Western Australia from Monday, but getting your hands on one won't be easy
09/01/2022.description: West Australians hoping to buy rapid antigen tests from their local pharmacies have been warned they will not be able to, due to a lack of supply.
09/01/2022.author: Kenith Png and Keane Bourke

09/01/2022.headline: Djokovic has been locked up for days, but the men with him have been detained for years
09/01/2022.description: The detention of Serbian tennis star Novak Djokovic at Melbourne's infamous Park Hotel has inadvertently highlighted the plight of refugees and asylum seekers that have been locked away for up to nine years with no end in sight.
09/01/2022.author: Tracey Shelton

09/01/2022.headline: The Duchess of Cambridge, Kate Middleton — ever the reliable royal — turns 40
09/01/2022.description: Britain's Duchess of Cambridge, Kate Middleton, is turning 40 and, to mark the occasion, new royal photos are released.
09/01/2022.author: Tracey Shelton

09/01/2022.headline: 'I will never apologise for living my truth': Reds' Josh Cavallo calls out homophobic abuse
09/01/2022.description: Josh Cavallo says he was targeted with homophobic abuse during Adelaide United's away A-League Mens draw with Melbourne Victory.
09/01/2022.author: Tracey Shelton

09/01/2022.headline: Part of a cliff collapses over a lake in Brazil, killing at least six – 20 people still missing
09/01/2022.description: Pleasure boats carrying dozens of passengers were drifting near a waterfall on Brazil's Furnas Lake when the cliff face above them disintegrated and fell.
09/01/2022.author: Tracey Shelton

09/01/2022.headline: Government's bid to stall Novak Djokovic's case fails as new, mask-less pictures emerge, sparking further controversy
09/01/2022.description: The Department of Home Affairs loses its bid to delay Monday's court appeal by Novak Djokovic to overturn the cancellation of his visa as details emerge of the world number one tennis player's own legal case amid a separate controversy over him appearing without a mask around the time he had COVID-19.
09/01/2022.author: Melissa Maykin

09/01/2022.headline: South Australian Premier still in isolation as state records 4,506 new cases
09/01/2022.description: South Australia records 4,506 new cases of COVID-19, with the number of people in hospital with the virus now sitting at 176.
09/01/2022.author: Melissa Maykin

09/01/2022.headline: 'A tragic event': Body of boatie, 87, found in NSW's Lake Eucumbene
09/01/2022.description: Residents in the NSW Snowy Mountains have described the death of a Victorian man, whose body was found after his boat capsized, as a tragedy.
09/01/2022.author: Adriane Reardon

09/01/2022.headline: Teenager makes Australian baseball history
09/01/2022.description: Teenager Genevieve Beacom makes history, debuting for the Melbourne Aces to become the first female pitcher for an Australian professional baseball team.
09/01/2022.author: Adriane Reardon

09/01/2022.headline: Northern Territory hospital admissions rise as nearly 500 new COVID-19 cases reported
09/01/2022.description: There are now 24 patients with COVID-19 in hospitals across the Northern Territory, up from 17 yesterday, as the jurisdiction records 481 new cases.
09/01/2022.author: Adriane Reardon

09/01/2022.headline: Newcastle humbled by Cambridge in FA Cup
09/01/2022.description: Third-tier Cambridge pull off an FA Cup giant-kill, beating super-wealthy Premier League team Newcastle in a huge third-round shock.
09/01/2022.author: Adriane Reardon

09/01/2022.headline: Queensland's school start delayed by two weeks as state records 18,000 new COVID-19 cases
09/01/2022.description: Queensland records 18,000 new cases of COVID-19, with 402 people in hospital, including 22 people in ICU, with five on ventilators.  Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk also announced changes to the return-to-school date for the state's primary and high school students.
09/01/2022.author: Adriane Reardon

09/01/2022.headline: NASA space telescope's 'golden eye' opens
09/01/2022.description: NASA staff celebrate as the James Webb Space Telescope opens its huge, gold-plated, flower-shaped mirror, the final step in the observatory's dramatic unfurling.
09/01/2022.author: Adriane Reardon

09/01/2022.headline: ACT records 1,039 new COVID-19 cases as positive RAT results no longer require PCR confirmation
09/01/2022.description: The ACT records 1,039 new COVID-19 cases as positive rapid antigen test results are officially accepted as proof of infection in the territory. But pharmacies are warning RATs will be hard to find this week.
09/01/2022.author: Penny Travers

09/01/2022.headline: Could the end be nigh for Turkmenistan's 'Gateway to Hell'?
09/01/2022.description: The president of Turkmenistan calls for an end to one of the country’s most notable but infernal sights — the blazing natural gas crater widely referred to as the "Gateway to Hell".
09/01/2022.author: Penny Travers

09/01/2022.headline: Aussies claim silver medals on snow and ice as Beijing 2022 prep hots up
09/01/2022.description: Australian monobob pilot Bree Walker underlines her Olympic medal chances with another World Series podium finish in Winterberg, while fellow Aussie Jakara Anthony also returns to the moguls podium in Canada.
09/01/2022.author: Simon Smale

09/01/2022.headline: Queensland students won't return to class until February — and some parents aren't happy
09/01/2022.description: The government is delaying the start of the school year to avoid it coinciding with a peak in COVID-19 infections. But some parents say the plan will leave them without child care and create yet more disruption.
09/01/2022.author: Alex Brewster and Lexy Hamilton-Smith

09/01/2022.headline: NSW Deputy Premier Paul Toole tests positive for COVID-19
09/01/2022.description: The Deputy Premier is already in isolation with his family, who tested positive before him.
09/01/2022.author: Alex Brewster and Lexy Hamilton-Smith

09/01/2022.headline: Housing is scarce, but is a high-rise the answer? This beach community says no
09/01/2022.description: This central Queensland coastal community has a minuscule rental vacancy rate of just 0.2 per cent. But most of the residents fear a proposed seven-storey high-rise would ruin the town's "laid-back village atmosphere".
09/01/2022.author: Michelle Gately

09/01/2022.headline: Children can get COVID-19 vaccinations from today — but some parents say they're having trouble booking
09/01/2022.description: Today, when Queensland starts vaccinating children aged 5-11 years, Katie Betts's sons will be among the first in the queue. But other parents say they are having trouble booking an appointment. Here's what you need to know.
09/01/2022.author: Emma Pollard

09/01/2022.headline: Supermarket shortages are different this time — here's how to respond and avoid panic
09/01/2022.description: In 2020 and 2021 empty supermarket shelves were due to spikes in demand. Now it's a different issue, but the solutions are broadly the same.
09/01/2022.author: Emma Pollard

09/01/2022.headline: Kids can get a COVID jab from today. But what if their parents disagree on vaccines?
09/01/2022.description: For many parents, vaccinating their child is a shared decision with both parents agreeing to go ahead — but not in every case. Here's what can happen when parents disagree, writes Nicholas Wood.
09/01/2022.author: Emma Pollard

09/01/2022.headline: Djokovic prepares to defend Australian Open legacy in Melbourne courtroom
09/01/2022.description: The eyes of the world will not descend not on Rod Laver Arena's Centre Court today but instead on the Federal Circuit and Family Court as Novak Djokovic fights to play in the Australian Open.
09/01/2022.author: Judd Boaz

09/01/2022.headline: 'Baby botox' is on the rise among teens and people in their 20s, but does it prevent wrinkles?
09/01/2022.description: In a quest to stop ageing before it starts, Gen Z and millennials are forking out thousands of dollars for botox to prevent wrinkles, despite a lack of scientific evidence it is effective.
09/01/2022.author: Matilda Marozzi

09/01/2022.headline: Live: NSW Now: Train timetables slashed due to falling passengers, isolating staff
09/01/2022.description: MORNING BRIEFING: From today NSW's train system will run on a weekend timetable as commuter and staff levels plummet due to COVID-19.
09/01/2022.author: Matilda Marozzi

09/01/2022.headline: Angus is among the NSW children not getting a jab today as delivery issues hit day one roll out
09/01/2022.description: As the nationwide vaccine rollout for five to 11 year olds gets underway today, parents are uncertain and fearful after many Sydney clinics fail to get their supply of Pfizer COVID-19 doses in time, prompting their children's appointments to be delayed or cancelled.
09/01/2022.author: Danuta Kozaki and Alison Xiao

09/01/2022.headline: For all their 'hi-vis' campaigning, this could be the 'pink-vis' poll for Morrison and Albanese
09/01/2022.description: Young mothers in 20 marginal seats could play a big role in deciding the outcome of the coming election. For all the "high-vis" campaigning, this could turn out to be the "pink-vis" poll, writes David Speers.
09/01/2022.author: David Speers

09/01/2022.headline: Taxpayers will soon learn everything has a price — even printing more money
09/01/2022.description: As the COVID crisis unfolded in 2020, the Reserve Bank announced it was engaging in a money printing program — but everything has a price eventually, it's only a matter of time, writes David Taylor.
09/01/2022.author: David Taylor

09/01/2022.headline: Vaccines alone won't keep kids safe in the classroom. This is what the experts suggest
09/01/2022.description: The vaccination rollout for children aged five to 11, which begins today, is doing little to calm rising concern about how to keep schools safe as Omicron spreads. These are the strategies experts advise will help to keep students and their teachers protected.
09/01/2022.author: Catherine Taylor

09/01/2022.headline: Djokovic did not have guaranteed entry to Australia, government lawyers argue
09/01/2022.description: Novak Djokovic was not given an assurance by the federal government that an exemption he said he had to enter Australia without being vaccinated would be accepted, government lawyers say.
09/01/2022.author: Catherine Taylor

09/01/2022.headline: Abandoned car sparks search for missing man, 26, in WA national park
09/01/2022.description: West Australian Police say they have urgent welfare concerns for a man who is believed to be missing within the Stirling Range National Park in the state's Great Southern region.
09/01/2022.author: Kyle Pauletto

09/01/2022.headline: Governor-General David Hurley tests positive for COVID-19
09/01/2022.description: Australia's Governor-General David Hurley has contracted COVID-19 and is experiencing mild symptoms, a spokesperson says.
09/01/2022.author: Kyle Pauletto

09/01/2022.headline: Cyclone Tiffany gains strength off coast of Far North Queensland
09/01/2022.description: Cyclone Tiffany is gaining strength over the Coral Sea as it approaches Cape York Peninsula, though it's not clear yet when or where the system will make landfall.
09/01/2022.author: Kyle Pauletto

09/01/2022.headline: Australia's desperation and England's defiance deliver another memorable Ashes chapter
09/01/2022.description: Though technically a dead rubber, under fading light and with pulses racing, day five in Sydney felt like the best Test cricket has to offer, writes Dean Bilton.
09/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

09/01/2022.headline: Hospitalisations jump in US children aged under five with COVID-19, CDC data says
09/01/2022.description: Hospital admissions of US children aged under five years with COVID-19 have soared in recent weeks to their highest level since the pandemic began, according to new government data.
09/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

09/01/2022.headline: China rolls out mass testing for 14 million people as Omicron hits another major city
09/01/2022.description: The port city of Tianjin is only about 100 kilometres from the Chinese capital, Beijing, which is hosting the Winter Olympics in February.
09/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

09/01/2022.headline: NSW decision to allow critical workers who are close contacts back to work 'reckless', union says
09/01/2022.description: Essential workers say they're worried about the state government's "reckless" decision to allow asymptomatic close contacts to come back to work without isolating.
09/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao

09/01/2022.headline: Rapid antigen tests are now legal in WA, but getting your hands on one won't be easy
09/01/2022.description: West Australians hoping to buy rapid antigen tests from their local pharmacies have been warned they will not be able to, due to a lack of supply.
09/01/2022.author: Kenith Png and Keane Bourke

09/01/2022.headline: Park Hotel detainees housed alongside Djokovic speak out
09/01/2022.description: The detention of Serbian tennis star Novak Djokovic at Melbourne's infamous Park Hotel has inadvertently highlighted the plight of refugees and asylum seekers that have been locked away for up to nine years with no end in sight.
09/01/2022.author: Tracey Shelton

10/01/2022.headline: COVID-positive abattoir staff told to keep working, as supply chain issues start to bite in SA
10/01/2022.description: An abattoir in South Australia's south-east is being allowed to keep COVID-positive meat processing workers on the job, amid concerns around food security across Australia.
10/01/2022.author: Isabel Dayman

10/01/2022.headline: Pilot saved from plane crash seconds before speeding train ploughs into wreck
10/01/2022.description: Video shows police in Los Angeles tear an injured pilot from his downed plane mere seconds before an oncoming train smashes into it.
10/01/2022.author: Isabel Dayman

10/01/2022.headline: Pathology insider describes unworkable conditions in SydPath PCR labs
10/01/2022.description: A hospital staff member expresses serious concerns about conditions at pathology clinic SydPath, which last month sent out false negative PCR results to around 900 people.
10/01/2022.author: Hagar Cohen and Xanthe Kleinig

10/01/2022.headline: Rotting berries leave sour taste as supermarket, distribution staff shortages eat into orders
10/01/2022.description: A berry-growing cooperative that supplies supermarkets loses 60 per cent of its orders due to the rising number of workers isolating because of COVID, and supply-chain issues.
10/01/2022.author: Eden Hynninen, Jane McNaughton, and David Claughton

10/01/2022.headline: 'It's nearly every supplier': Supermarkets warn COVID supply disruptions will last weeks
10/01/2022.description: Woolworths boss Brad Banducci warns the supply disruptions affecting his company's supermarkets, and most others, will likely last at least another fortnight.
10/01/2022.author: Michael Janda

10/01/2022.headline: Best and fairest winner Bri Davey one of AFLW's two confirmed ACL injuries
10/01/2022.description: Collingwood's AFLW co-captain Bri Davey shared the best and fairest award in 2021, but will miss the remainder of the 2022 season, as will the Bulldogs' Isabel Huntington, because both players have sustained knee injuries.
10/01/2022.author: Michael Janda

10/01/2022.headline: Cyclone watch issued for Top End coastline, potential category three storm on the way
10/01/2022.description: The Bureau of Meteorology issues a cyclone watch for Nhulunbuy, including Groote Eylandt, to the Queensland border as Cyclone Tiffany heads towards the Northern Territory.
10/01/2022.author: Ben Gubana

10/01/2022.headline: Australians win at private Golden Globe awards with no-one there to cheer
10/01/2022.description: Nicole Kidman, Sarah Snook and Kodi Smit-McPhee all win at the Golden Globes, held in private in Hollywood.
10/01/2022.author: Alexis Moran

10/01/2022.headline: Ousted Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi sentenced to four more years in prison
10/01/2022.description: A court in military-ruled Myanmar finds the 76-year-old guilty of several charges, including possessing unlicensed walkie-talkies.
10/01/2022.author: Mazoe Ford

10/01/2022.headline: Two deaths and 4,024 new COVID-19 cases in SA in 'stabilising' of numbers
10/01/2022.description: South Australia records another two COVID-19 deaths and an uptick in hospital admissions, despite a reduction in overall case numbers.
10/01/2022.author: Nick Harmsen and Eugene Boisvert

10/01/2022.headline: Frustrations as parents and GPs scramble for COVID vaccine appointments and doses
10/01/2022.description: An Adelaide father plans to drive more than five hours to get his son vaccinated after failing to get a local appointment, while a GP says his allocated doses have gone missing.
10/01/2022.author: Isabel Dayman, Sara Garcia, and Emma Pollard

10/01/2022.headline: Mark McGowan slams Commonwealth over supplies of vaccines, rapid antigen tests
10/01/2022.description: Premier Mark McGowan says WA has been snubbed by the Commonwealth with supplies of  rapid antigen tests and vaccines as young children become eligible for the jab.
10/01/2022.author: James Carmody and Herlyn Kaur

10/01/2022.headline: Police warn businesses signs are not an alternative for vaccination checks, amid Gold Coast COVID 'surge'
10/01/2022.description: A month into Queensland's vaccine mandate, police are warning businesses to follow health orders and staff to wear masks or more will face fines.
10/01/2022.author: Kimberley Bernard

10/01/2022.headline: 'Making Test cricket look easy': 'Dizzy' heaps praise on Boland, reflects on Indigenous heritage
10/01/2022.description: When he made his Test debut as a 21-year-old tearaway in 1996, Jason Gillespie had no inkling that he was the first Indigenous man to be donning the baggy green.
10/01/2022.author: Kimberley Bernard

10/01/2022.headline: Ash Barty out of Sydney, focusing on the Open
10/01/2022.description: After winning the Adelaide International, world number one Ash Barty pulls out of the Sydney Tennis Classic to focus on her Australian Open preparation.
10/01/2022.author: Kimberley Bernard

10/01/2022.headline: Three families cram into tinny tied to power pole to escape surging floodwaters
10/01/2022.description: Remarkable stories of survival continue to emerge from flood-ravaged areas around Gympie that have received almost a metre of rain in recent days.
10/01/2022.author: Meg Bolton, Jennifer Nichols, and Amy Sheehan

10/01/2022.headline: NT exits lockout, brings in vaccine pass system, as it records 403 COVID-19 cases
10/01/2022.description: Unvaccinated people in the NT will be barred from pubs, clubs and large ticketed events under a vaccine pass system that has come into immediate effect, as the Territory records 403 new COVID-19 cases.
10/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

10/01/2022.headline: Farmers buy back land earmarked for controversial coal mine in $120 million sale
10/01/2022.description: Rich agricultural land owned by mining giant Shenhua has been repurchased by farmers in the Liverpool Plains following moves to prevent the establishment of a coal mine.
10/01/2022.author: Lani Oataway and Haley Craig

10/01/2022.headline: Nicole Kidman, Sarah Snook and Kodi Smit-McPhee score Aussie sweep at 'private' Golden Globes
10/01/2022.description: Australians have won big at the Golden Globes, which have been held with no celebrity audience, red carpet or media due to the organisation coming under fire last year.
10/01/2022.author: Lani Oataway and Haley Craig

10/01/2022.headline: 'I am broken. I am gutted': Comedian Bob Saget dies aged 65
10/01/2022.description: Comedian Bob Saget, who shot to fame in sitcom Full House before cementing his place on American TVs with Funniest Home Videos, dies aged 65.
10/01/2022.author: Lani Oataway and Haley Craig

10/01/2022.headline: Parents urged to try pharmacies for kids' COVID vaccines amid reports of cancelled appointments
10/01/2022.description: The head of the COVID-19 vaccine taskforce calls for parents to be persistent when it comes to vaccinating their children, as parents describe "stressful" experiences as GPs, pharmacies cancel appointments.
10/01/2022.author: Georgia Hitch

10/01/2022.headline: ACT records 938 known new COVID-19 cases as hospital patient numbers remain relatively low
10/01/2022.description: Today was the second consecutive day of fewer cases, though infection numbers are likely to rise as more Canberrans return from holidays in the coming week.
10/01/2022.author: Markus Mannheim

10/01/2022.headline: Deaf community afraid communication breakdown means they don't properly understand the pandemic
10/01/2022.description: Deaf people are living in fear as the COVID-19 pandemic reaches every corner of the state because interpreters are often missing from daily government updates, advocates say.
10/01/2022.author: Carli Willis

10/01/2022.headline: 'Significant' COVID surge on Gold Coast concerns authorities
10/01/2022.description: Queensland records 9,581 new cases of COVID-19, but authorities are waiting on some results from private pathology.
10/01/2022.author: Carli Willis

10/01/2022.headline: 'Now it is too late': Gold Coast COVID outbreak being made worse by the unvaccinated, experts say
10/01/2022.description: A quarter of people hospitalised in Queensland with COVID-19 are on the Gold Coast, and half of the state's ICU patients are in the city. Medical practitioners say they are exhausted by the volume of cases they're facing.
10/01/2022.author: Rachel Riga and Lexy Hamilton-Smith

10/01/2022.headline: Scott Morrison said 'contact your GP' if you get COVID-19. But these doctors say they're swamped
10/01/2022.description: When Todd Cameron heard Prime Minister Scott Morrison tell Australians to contact their GP if they got a positive COVID-19 result from a rapid antigen test, he knew it would not go well.
10/01/2022.author: Mary Lloyd and Penny Timms

10/01/2022.headline: Gold Coast company on track to launch rocket this year that could help detect bushfires
10/01/2022.description: The venture is in talks with space agencies about the deployment of bushfire-detection satellites ahead of a planned rocket launch later this year.
10/01/2022.author: Alexandria Utting

10/01/2022.headline: Deborah's dad built a coal power station. Now she's opened a gallery for the climate emergency
10/01/2022.description: The Melbourne gallerist is one of a number of children of the 'fossil fuel generation' who are turning to art as a way to process complicated parental legacies - and create positive change.
10/01/2022.author: Alexandria Utting

10/01/2022.headline: Families call for an end to 'perpetual quarantine' for international pilots and air crew in Queensland
10/01/2022.description: Under Queensland rules, international air crew must quarantine at home for 14 days – or until their next flight – after they land, putting them into multiple rotations of two weeks in quarantine.
10/01/2022.author: Erin Handley

10/01/2022.headline: Live: NSW Now: 'Serious concerns' for Villawood detainees caught in COVID outbreak
10/01/2022.description: MORNING BRIEFING: A detention centre in Sydney's south-west is the site of a COVID-19 outbreak, with an advocacy group raising concerns.
10/01/2022.author: Erin Handley

10/01/2022.headline: How astronomers spot faraway planets — and look for signs of alien life
10/01/2022.description: From a deep blue gas giant where it rains molten glass to a cannonball world that orbits every eight hours, how do astronomers "see'" these distant exoplanets?
10/01/2022.author: Belinda Smith

10/01/2022.headline: NSW Ambulance apologises after parents of critically ill baby claim wait time was 'terrifying'
10/01/2022.description: NSW Ambulance is reviewing its response to a triple zero call about a newborn baby who wasn't breathing as the service faces "unprecedented" demand and too many non-urgent calls.
10/01/2022.author: Paige Cockburn

10/01/2022.headline: 'It's a terrible position parents are being put in': Natalie travelled 300km for an appointment to get her kids a vaccine
10/01/2022.description: Parents are going to extraordinary lengths to ensure their children are vaccinated before school goes back. But experts have warned one dose may not be enough to fully protect them from COVID-19.
10/01/2022.author: Paige Cockburn

10/01/2022.headline: Secret cures, bioweapons and racism: The centuries-old history of medical conspiracy theories
10/01/2022.description: The history of medical conspiracy theories extends from ancient Rome to today. They all share an innate human need to find answers to difficult questions.
10/01/2022.author: Zoe Ferguson and Anna Kelsey-Sugg

10/01/2022.headline: As Omicron moves into Asia, one expert fears the region could be a breeding ground for the next variant
10/01/2022.description: While Omicron is moving swiftly through Australia, North America and Europe, one part of the world has managed to keep it largely at bay. But Asian leaders know the variant is coming, and their populations could be uniquely vulnerable.
10/01/2022.author: Carrington Clarke

10/01/2022.headline: Pandemic supply shortages hit Norway's military in unexpected fashion
10/01/2022.description: Australia may be dealing with supply issues that have left supermarket shelves bare but in Norway some garments have become so scarce that the military has turned to hand-me-downs.
10/01/2022.author: Carrington Clarke

10/01/2022.headline: Kazakh President says he's defeated a coup attempt, after crushing violent protests with Russia's help
10/01/2022.description: In the aftermath of a week of violent protests, Kazakh President Tokayev says order has been restored and the hunt is on for "terrorists" who plotted the coup.
10/01/2022.author: Carrington Clarke

10/01/2022.headline: Djokovic breaks his silence as his family launch accusations at Australian officials
10/01/2022.description: Novak Djokovic says he is adamant he wants to remain in Australia as his family thanks the judge who presided over his case but stays silent on allegations the tennis star posed maskless with children after being told he had COVID.
10/01/2022.author: Isabella Higgins

10/01/2022.headline: Chaotic scenes outside office of Novak Djokovic's lawyers in Melbourne
10/01/2022.description: Police use pepper spray on fans outside Novak Djokovic's lawyers' office in Melbourne, hours after a Federal Circuit Court judge ordered the Serbian tennis star be freed from Immigration detention.
10/01/2022.author: Isabella Higgins

10/01/2022.headline: Northern Territory children receive their first COVID-19 dose, with authorities confident there is enough supply
10/01/2022.description: Today brothers Lincoln and Max were among the first Northern Territory children aged between five and 11 years to receive their initial dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.
10/01/2022.author: Housnia Shams

10/01/2022.headline: The Loop: Djokovic wins court battle, Saget dies and why you can expect more supply shortages at Woolies
10/01/2022.description: Here's your TL;DR for this evening's news.
10/01/2022.author: Alexis Moran

10/01/2022.headline: 'I tested positive': Nick Kyrgios in doubt for Australian Open after contracting COVID-19
10/01/2022.description: Nick Kyrgios pulls out of the Sydney Tennis Classic hours before his first match after contracting COVID-19.
10/01/2022.author: Alexis Moran

10/01/2022.headline: Klay Thompson reaches career milestones in Warriors return
10/01/2022.description: Golden State's Klay Thompson scores 17 points on his return from two devastating injuries to reach career milestones and help the Warriors beat Cleveland Cavaliers 96-82 in the NBA.
10/01/2022.author: Alexis Moran

10/01/2022.headline: Pilot freed from crashed plane by Los Angeles police seconds before train smashes through it
10/01/2022.description: Video shows police in Los Angeles tear an injured pilot from his downed plane mere seconds before an oncoming train smashes into it.
10/01/2022.author: Isabel Dayman

10/01/2022.headline: Pathology insider describes unworkable conditions in PCR testing labs
10/01/2022.description: A hospital staff member expresses serious concerns about conditions at pathology clinic SydPath, which last month sent out false negative PCR results to around 900 people.
10/01/2022.author: Hagar Cohen and Xanthe Kleinig

11/01/2022.headline: Premier apologises after scalded Adelaide toddler waits 51 minutes for ambulance during COVID-19 surge
11/01/2022.description: Paramedics took almost an hour to arrive to treat a three-year-old boy for burns during high demand for ambulances amid South Australia's COVID-19 outbreak.
11/01/2022.author: Isabel Dayman, Eugene Boisvert, and Emma Rebellato

11/01/2022.headline: Poet Maya Angelou becomes first African-American woman to appear on a US quarter dollar
11/01/2022.description: Maya Angelou, the late civil rights activist and author, is the first African-American woman to appear on the US currency, in a series dedicating to honouring women and their achievements in shaping the nation's history.
11/01/2022.author: Isabel Dayman, Eugene Boisvert, and Emma Rebellato

11/01/2022.headline: Holiday-makers trapped by fire tearing through Western Australia's South-West given chance to escape via convoy
11/01/2022.description: Many holiday-makers and others trapped by a bushfire threatening lives and homes in Western Australia's South-West are being given the chance to leave the area in an escorted convoy.
11/01/2022.author: Georgia Loney

11/01/2022.headline: Aussie men's duo taste defeat, Tomljanovic through to second round in Sydney
11/01/2022.description: Australia's Alexei Popyrin and Chris O'Connell suffer defeat at the Sydney Tennis Classic, while fellow Aussie, Ajla Tomljanovic, books a spot in the second round, with a comfortable win over world number 90 Anna Schmiedlova.
11/01/2022.author: Georgia Loney

11/01/2022.headline: 'Treading water for 10 hours': Horses survive floods after Gympie's wet weekend
11/01/2022.description: Horse owners and farmers around Gympie are counting their losses and celebrating tales of survival after up to 650 millimetres of rain fell across the region.
11/01/2022.author: Jennifer Nichols and Lucy Cooper

11/01/2022.headline: Tomic says he thinks he has COVID amid Australian Open qualifying disaster
11/01/2022.description: Bernard Tomic tells an on-court umpire that he is certain to test positive to COVID-19 as he crashes out of Australian Open qualifying.
11/01/2022.author: Jennifer Nichols and Lucy Cooper

11/01/2022.headline: North Korea fires second suspected missile in a week after vow to bolster military
11/01/2022.description: North Korea's fresh launch of a suspected ballistic missile drew immediate condemnation from Japan and South Korea, with both urging North Korean leader Kim Jong Un to respect international calls for peace and stability in the region.
11/01/2022.author: Jennifer Nichols and Lucy Cooper

11/01/2022.headline: Darwin shooter claims 'no-one cares', launches fresh bid to find new lawyer
11/01/2022.description: Murderer Ben Hoffmann tells the NT Supreme Court he has not been able to secure a new lawyer since firing his counsel in November last year.
11/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts

11/01/2022.headline: Former Yorke Peninsula teacher to stand trial on child sex offences
11/01/2022.description: A man who taught at Kadina Memorial School pleads not guilty to nine counts of maintaining an unlawful sexual relationship with a child and five counts of communicating to make a child amenable to sexual activity.
11/01/2022.author: Claire Campbell

11/01/2022.headline: 'I couldn't breathe': Erin Phillips on AFLW's injury crisis and part-time demands
11/01/2022.description: Erin Phillips is a two-time league best and fairest and she says that full-time professionalisation would allow for better player injury management.
11/01/2022.author: Claire Campbell

11/01/2022.headline: Man charged after allegedly threatening staff at Sydney restaurant with replica gun when bill came out
11/01/2022.description: A man is charged after allegedly threatening staff at a Sydney restaurant with a replica gun when he was asked to pay for his meal.
11/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao

11/01/2022.headline: Questions raised about whether Novak Djokovic lied about his travel history on border entry form
11/01/2022.description: Despite declaring that he had not travelled in the 14 days before arriving in Australia, social media posts and news articles reportedly show that Novak Djokovic travelled to Spain from Serbia within the two-week window.
11/01/2022.author: Georgia Hitch and Stephanie Borys

11/01/2022.headline: NT Gulf residents prepare for the worst as Tiffany regains intensity
11/01/2022.description: Gulf of Carpentaria communities brace for impact as ex-Tropical Cyclone Tiffany tracks towards the Northern Territory coastline.
11/01/2022.author: Matt Garrick and Samantha Dick

11/01/2022.headline: Joyce defends Christensen's 'right' to spread conspiracies in podcast
11/01/2022.description: Barnaby Joyce defends the controversial MP's right to free speech after the backbencher this week launched a podcast on which he promotes debunked ideas about the pandemic.
11/01/2022.author: Tobi Loftus

11/01/2022.headline: Did someone say no KFC? Chicken meat in short supply
11/01/2022.description: Shoppers are warned their favourite cuts of chicken are unlikely to be available in the coming weeks due to COVID-related worker shortages at meat processing plants.
11/01/2022.author: Jane McNaughton

11/01/2022.headline: Leading cancer immunologist referred to corruption watchdog over fabrication of scientific data
11/01/2022.description: A review finds Queensland cancer researcher and immunologist Mark Smyth fabricated scientific data used in support of grant funding applications and human trials, his former employer QIMR Berghoer says.
11/01/2022.author: Jane McNaughton

11/01/2022.headline: Stranded bushman kills kangaroo for food while waiting for rescuers
11/01/2022.description: An elderly couple rescued after their car broke down in remote Western Australia killed a kangaroo for food and found a fresh water supply while they waited for help, a rescuer reveals.
11/01/2022.author: Glenn Barndon and Cecile O'Connor

11/01/2022.headline: As COVID-19 surges, parents are worried about sending their partially-vaccinated children back to classrooms
11/01/2022.description: Parents say a lack of clarity around South Australia's 2022 school year is leaving them feeling nervous as COVID-19 continues to spread throughout the state. But experts warn a lack of face-to-face education will have impacts on vulnerable children.
11/01/2022.author: Evelyn Manfield

11/01/2022.headline: 'Strong possibility' of Omicron spread in community as ServiceWA app launched
11/01/2022.description: Western Australia records four new local cases of COVID-19, including a person suspected of having the Omicron variant who was infectious in the community, as a new 'one-stop shop' app is launched.
11/01/2022.author: Nicolas Perpitch and Kate Christian

11/01/2022.headline: 'It's the vibe, the magic of surfing': Unique exhibition celebrates history of surfboards
11/01/2022.description: An exhibition of surf memorabilia — including 80 boards — opens on the south coast of WA and is thought to be Australia's largest publicly displayed private collection.
11/01/2022.author: John Dobson

11/01/2022.headline: Boom gates stuck closed in Adelaide after copper wiring stolen from train line
11/01/2022.description: Boom gates on Adelaide's Outer Harbor rail line were stuck closed for several hours early this morning, after thieves stole copper cables.
11/01/2022.author: Alina Eacott

11/01/2022.headline: Lost work because you caught COVID or are a close contact? You may be eligible for government help
11/01/2022.description: With nearly 600,000 active COVID-19 cases across Australia, the federal government has again adjusted how people who are forced out of work to isolate can access hardship payments.
11/01/2022.author: Alina Eacott

11/01/2022.headline: Tasmania's health commander tests positive to COVID-19
11/01/2022.description: Tasmania's top health bureaucrat tests positive to COVID-19, a day after Guy Barnett became the first Tasmanian government minister to contract the disease.
11/01/2022.author: Alina Eacott

11/01/2022.headline: Man in his 80s dies with COVID-19 in Canberra as ACT records 1,508 new cases
11/01/2022.description: A man in his 80s has died with COVID-19 in the ACT as the territory records 1,508 new cases of the virus through PCR tests and food supply issues hit Canberra supermarkets.
11/01/2022.author: Kate Midena and Antoinette Radford

11/01/2022.headline: Woman in her 50s dies in SA as state's daily COVID case count drops to 2,921, with 211 in hospital
11/01/2022.description: South Australia records one more death from COVID-19 – a woman in her 50s – as the state's daily case count plunges to 2,921.
11/01/2022.author: Kate Midena and Antoinette Radford

11/01/2022.headline: 'Transition out of COVID': Rising petrol prices hit Queensland motorists as producers take cautious economic approach
11/01/2022.description: Petrol prices in Brisbane and South-East Queensland are rising again, after a brief drop that followed record highs in late November last year, but industry players say it is likely to remain steady for the summer break.
11/01/2022.author: Baz Ruddick

11/01/2022.headline: 'Not what we were expecting at all': Tasmanian devils are fussy eaters, study shows
11/01/2022.description: They are traditionally thought of as carnivorous scavengers, but new research has found Tasmanian devils are selective when it comes to their meals.
11/01/2022.author: Kate Ainsworth

11/01/2022.headline: Queensland's paediatric doctors brace for more child hospital admissions amid COVID-19 Omicron wave
11/01/2022.description: There are 12 children in hospital for COVID-19 in Brisbane, with one in ICU, according to Queensland authorities. But a leading paediatric doctor, who studied the virus in the UK, says there's a treatment for a syndrome that causes the most complications for youngsters with COVID-19.
11/01/2022.author: Kate Ainsworth

11/01/2022.headline: One 13-year-old boy dead, another arrested after fatal stabbing on NSW Central Coast
11/01/2022.description: Police are calling for witnesses to come forward following a teenage boy being fatally stabbed in the stomach overnight.
11/01/2022.author: Kate Ainsworth

11/01/2022.headline: Elderly refuse vital aged care help due to COVID fear, as staff shortages cause chaos
11/01/2022.description: Elderly residents are refusing in-home services of carers who previously helped them to shower, eat and dress, leaving advocates "very concerned about their welfare".
11/01/2022.author: Nicole Dyer and Tara Cassidy

11/01/2022.headline: 'Relentless, endless demand': Regional health workers tell of heavy COVID toll
11/01/2022.description: Nurse Amanda Short is about to resign from a job she's loved for nearly 40 years, saying she's exhausted after two years of COVID wreaking havoc on the struggling regional healthcare system. And she's not alone.
11/01/2022.author: Claudia Jambor, Emma Siossian, and Emma Rennie

11/01/2022.headline: Live: NSW Now: Expert warns children could end up in hospital if school restarts with low COVID-19 vaccination rate
11/01/2022.description: MORNING BRIEFING: A virologist says the sheer number of Omicron cases and the strain's infectiousness could put young children at risk when they return to the classroom.
11/01/2022.author: Claudia Jambor, Emma Siossian, and Emma Rennie

11/01/2022.headline: A group of fairy-wrens is a wrenaissance, true or false? Take our quiz
11/01/2022.description: Fairy-wrens have probably landed a spot in your heart, but how much do you know about these spectacular birds?
11/01/2022.author: Zoe Kean

11/01/2022.headline: 'People are having COVID parties, trying to get infected': Experts warn against Omicron complacency
11/01/2022.description: Although early signs indicate Omicron symptoms are milder, epidemiologists warn people against becoming complacent — and urge them to protect themselves and others by getting their booster shot.
11/01/2022.author: Katri Uibu

11/01/2022.headline: Why you're less likely to get severe COVID during NSW's Omicron surge
11/01/2022.description: Despite COVID-19 hospitalisations in NSW being at their highest point, the risk of severe disease right now is lower than during last year's Delta outbreak, an ABC analysis finds.
11/01/2022.author: Catherine Hanrahan

11/01/2022.headline: Serbian PM says her government will guarantee Djokovic will respect Australian regulations
11/01/2022.description: Serbian PM Prime Minister Ana Brnabić says her government is ready to guarantee the men's tennis world number one will respect local regulations if he is allowed to stay in Melbourne and compete in the Australian Open.
11/01/2022.author: Catherine Hanrahan

11/01/2022.headline: As China locks down a third city, about 20 million people are now confined to their homes
11/01/2022.description: With the massive travelling event of Lunar New Year and the Beijing Winter Games both soon to start, China's officials bring in the broadest lockdowns since the early days of the pandemic.
11/01/2022.author: Catherine Hanrahan

11/01/2022.headline: WHO warns half of Europe's population could suffer from Omicron variant
11/01/2022.description: Fifty out of 53 countries in Europe and central Asia have logged cases of the more infectious variant.
11/01/2022.author: Catherine Hanrahan

11/01/2022.headline: Leading expert says MPs were warned that testing 'wouldn't cope'
11/01/2022.description: A public health specialist says he told a group of parliamentarians, including several Coalition members, back in August that Australia's PCR-testing system was destined to buckle and that the government should immediately start planning for the use of rapid antigen tests.
11/01/2022.author: Elias Clure and Laura Kewley

11/01/2022.headline: Emergency services had 'no urgency' in helping man who died in custody, coroner finds
11/01/2022.description: The inquest into the death of an Indigenous man in Townsville finds police and paramedics need to improve their response to mental health episodes among First Nations patients.
11/01/2022.author: Jade Toomey and Chloe Chomicki

11/01/2022.headline: 'My daughter is gone': Farmers tell of frantic efforts to save father after flood sweeps daughter away
11/01/2022.description: Gympie farmers reveal they used the scope on their rifle to guide rescuers to a Victorian man clinging to a tree, after raging floodwaters swept his 14-year-old daughter away.
11/01/2022.author: Meg Bolton and Jennifer Nichols

11/01/2022.headline: Barty's rival Sabalenka flops again in Adelaide
11/01/2022.description: World number two Aryna Sabalenka will enter the Australian Open without a win in more than two months after successive defeats in Adelaide.
11/01/2022.author: Meg Bolton and Jennifer Nichols

11/01/2022.headline: The Loop: Novak Djokovic's entry form questioned, NSW's de facto 'lockdown' and KFC makes an apology
11/01/2022.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
11/01/2022.author: Alexis Moran

11/01/2022.headline: Poet Maya Angelou becomes first African American woman to appear on a US quarter dollar
11/01/2022.description: Maya Angelou, the late civil rights activist and author, is the first African American woman to appear on the US currency, in a series dedicating to honouring women and their achievements in shaping the nation's history.
11/01/2022.author: Isabel Dayman, Eugene Boisvert, and Emma Rebellato

11/01/2022.headline: Holidaymakers trapped by fire tearing through Western Australia's South West given chance to escape via convoy
11/01/2022.description: Many holidaymakers and others trapped by a bushfire threatening lives and homes in Western Australia's South West are given the chance to leave the area in an escorted convoy.
11/01/2022.author: Georgia Loney

11/01/2022.headline: Tarni's mother was once engaged to five men at the same time. The reason was more complicated than she thought
11/01/2022.description: Tarni found old love letters from her mother's wartime suitors after Merle died. One of them was someone she knew very well.
11/01/2022.author: Sophie Kesteven and Michael Mackenzie

12/01/2022.headline: Retailer shocked to learn her order of RATs will be sent to the federal government instead
12/01/2022.description: Some individuals and retailers are being told their orders of rapid antigen tests have been delayed and the supply is being diverted to meet a federal government mandate.
12/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

12/01/2022.headline: As swimmers flock to beaches in warm weather, more sharks are detected off Adelaide
12/01/2022.description: More sharks than usual have been detected off Adelaide's coastline so far this spring and summer, prompting a warning for beachgoers.
12/01/2022.author: Natasha Thiele

12/01/2022.headline: As some parents face cancelled vaccine appointments, these kids were luckier
12/01/2022.description: Tens of thousands of children have already received a COVID vaccine, and parents say it's a huge relief.
12/01/2022.author: Natasha Thiele

12/01/2022.headline: The Loop: 'Human error' on Djokovic's immigration form, state ambulance service 'on its knees', WA locks pretty much everyone out
12/01/2022.description: Get up to date with today's news the quick way.
12/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

12/01/2022.headline: Retracing Djokovic's steps, from his positive test to touchdown in Melbourne
12/01/2022.description: Novak Djokovic has been forced to clarify the sequence of events between testing positive for COVID in December and arriving in Australia. Here's what we know.
12/01/2022.author: Tracey Holmes

12/01/2022.headline: 'I'm tired of being quiet!': Biden makes fiery speech to push stalled voting rights overhaul
12/01/2022.description: US President Joe Biden makes an impassioned speech on protecting voting rights in America, calling for a rewrite of Senate rules to override opposition to election laws he says are crucial to saving US democracy.
12/01/2022.author: Tracey Holmes

12/01/2022.headline: Police offer $1 million reward for information about bungalow fire death of 'talented artist'
12/01/2022.description: Victoria Police announce a renewed focus on working out the circumstances surrounding the 2015 death of young Melbourne man Connor Tolson.
12/01/2022.author: Elise Kinsella

12/01/2022.headline: COVID hospitalisations in NT now 28 as Territory records 352 cases
12/01/2022.description: Of the 28 people hospitalised with COVID-19 in the NT, one is in ICU and 16 are classified as acute admissions, the NT government says.
12/01/2022.author: Elise Kinsella

12/01/2022.headline: Whether you have to isolate if you're a close contact could be about to change
12/01/2022.description: In a draft advice document from the nation's top health body, services that could be exempt during outbreaks include transport, hospitality, education and childcare, construction and real estate.
12/01/2022.author: Georgia Hitch

12/01/2022.headline: Bar owner to fight charges over ‘unmanageable’ NYE party during COVID dancing ban
12/01/2022.description: Police have indicated they may be seeking a jail term for the owner of The George bar, which hosted a 'hidden' NYE party in breach of COVID-19 restrictions, while he plans to dispute the allegations.
12/01/2022.author: Joanna Menagh

12/01/2022.headline: WA records two new local COVID cases including woman who acquired virus from an 'unknown source'
12/01/2022.description: Western Australia has reported two new local COVID-19 cases as the state prepares to slam shut its border with the Northern Territory.
12/01/2022.author: Kate Christian

12/01/2022.headline: Why did boosters in aged care slow to a trickle over Christmas and New Years?
12/01/2022.description: Aged care providers are casting doubt on the federal government's commitment to finish the booster rollout in aged care by the end of the month, with data revealing the program slowed dramatically over the Christmas-New Years break.
12/01/2022.author: Tom Lowrey

12/01/2022.headline: Driver accused of car chase that left Adelaide journalist with serious injuries faces court
12/01/2022.description: A man accused of evading police and causing a crash that seriously injured an Adelaide journalist has faced court, where he was given new bail conditions, including being banned from firearms possession.
12/01/2022.author: Claire Campbell

12/01/2022.headline: 'On its knees': Queensland paramedics group calls for more resources amid Omicron wave
12/01/2022.description: Queensland's Health Minister dismisses claims that the head of the state's ambulance service is "missing in action", as paramedics warn the service is at breaking point.
12/01/2022.author: Lucy Stone and Kelly Higgins-Devine

12/01/2022.headline: Mitchell Starc 'won't be asking selectors for a rest' for Hobart pink-ball Test
12/01/2022.description: Mitchell Starc says his body is feeling fresh and that he hopes selectors won't look to rest him from Australia's side for the fifth Ashes Test in Hobart.
12/01/2022.author: Lucy Stone and Kelly Higgins-Devine

12/01/2022.headline: Canberrans can now register their positive RAT results online as ACT records 1,078 new cases
12/01/2022.description: The ACT records 1,078 new cases of COVID-19 through PCR tests, as Canberrans are now able to register their positive RAT results online through an ACT government form.
12/01/2022.author: Kate Midena

12/01/2022.headline: Djokovic blames agent's 'administrative mistake' on Australian immigration form about previous travel
12/01/2022.description: The tennis star releases a six-panel post on his Instagram page, saying he wanted to "address the continuing misinformation" about his activity following a positive COVID test in December.
12/01/2022.author: Kate Midena

12/01/2022.headline: So you've had COVID. When should you get a booster or vaccine?
12/01/2022.description: As Omicron cases soar, many people are faced with having to re-book their vaccination appointments. Here are some principles to help you decide when to lock it in, writes Margie Danch
12/01/2022.author: Kate Midena

12/01/2022.headline: SA records highest daily COVID death toll, makes RAT reporting mandatory
12/01/2022.description: South Australia has recorded another seven COVID-linked deaths — the state's highest daily total of reported fatal cases since the start of the pandemic. SA is also set to introduce mandatory reporting requirements for those who return positive rapid antigen test results.
12/01/2022.author: Stacey Pestrin and Alice Dempster

12/01/2022.headline: 'I'm glad that's over': Former Tasmanian MP fined for firearms offences
12/01/2022.description: Former Tasmanian MP Adam Brooks avoids criminal conviction after pleading guilty to firearms and credit card offences in a Queensland court.
12/01/2022.author: Talissa Siganto

12/01/2022.headline: 'Keep schools open': Academics, doctors and community leaders urge politicians to allow face-to-face learning
12/01/2022.description: Thirty-five of Australia's top academics, doctors and community leaders write an open letter to Australian governments, urging them to allow schools to open for face-to-face learning on time.
12/01/2022.author: Talissa Siganto

12/01/2022.headline: How to talk to your kids about getting their COVID vaccine
12/01/2022.description: Promises, lies, subterfuge and restraint are naturally top of a parent's toolkit when it comes to needles. But there may be another option.
12/01/2022.author: Liz Trevaskis and Conor Byrne

12/01/2022.headline: No vax? Pay a tax, Quebec authorities say as Canadian health system struggles
12/01/2022.description: Canada's Quebec province is planning to force adults refusing to get COVID-19 vaccinations to pay a "health contribution".
12/01/2022.author: Liz Trevaskis and Conor Byrne

12/01/2022.headline: Officers 'feeling the pain' as they search for missing police dog
12/01/2022.description: Helicopters, mounted police and families from across Queensland join the search for a beloved police dog who became separated from his handler while chasing an alleged car thief through bushland west of Brisbane.
12/01/2022.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis

12/01/2022.headline: 'Stressed', 'angry' nurses call for mandatory RAT tests for essential workers
12/01/2022.description: There are almost 131,000 active COVID-19 cases in Queensland and the state's Chief Health Officer, John Gerrard, says there is now enough data for patterns to emerge on the types of patients needing hospital care.
12/01/2022.author: Nibir Khan and Lexy Hamilton-Smith

12/01/2022.headline: 'Everybody is tired, everybody is exhausted': Hospital staff claim patient care at an 'all-time low'
12/01/2022.description: A health worker raises concerns about the level of care being provided at a regional hospital grappling with rapidly rising COVID admissions and a depleted workforce.
12/01/2022.author: Tim Fernandez

12/01/2022.headline: 'Restaurants are fighting over us': Owners poach workers, offer incentives for staff referrals to stay afloat
12/01/2022.description: Some restaurants have resorted to poaching workers from rivals with offers of higher pay to keep their businesses running, while other eateries have been forced to shut temporarily for the first time during the pandemic.
12/01/2022.author: Erwin Renaldi

12/01/2022.headline: A broke porn star chases a warped American dream in new movie from The Florida Project director
12/01/2022.description: Simon Rex, an actor and rapper best known for starring in Scary Movie sequels, is given a meaty leading role in the Cannes-nominated Red Rocket by Tangerine director Sean Baker.
12/01/2022.author: Luke Goodsell

12/01/2022.headline: Let 'BookTok' help you keep that New Year's reading resolution
12/01/2022.description: The classic book club has gone to TikTok, complete with viral trends, hilarious memes — and good reads.
12/01/2022.author: Ellyn Duncan

12/01/2022.headline: Your vote on the greatest men's Ashes moment of the past 40 years
12/01/2022.description: We reveal your choice as to the best moment in the past 40 years of men's Ashes cricket.
12/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton and Simon Smale

12/01/2022.headline: BHP, the 'Big Australian', is about to get bigger and more Australian
12/01/2022.description: Twenty years ago, Australia's most valuable company merged with a British firm to make BHP-Billiton. Now, mega-miner BHP is leaving London and coming home to further dominate our stock market.
12/01/2022.author: Daniel Ziffer

12/01/2022.headline: What's a pulse oximeter and why is it handy to have if you have COVID-19?
12/01/2022.description: Pulse oximeters could be a handy tool to monitor COVID-19 symptoms at home, write Stuart Marshall and David A. Story.
12/01/2022.author: Daniel Ziffer

12/01/2022.headline: Don't panic: There are ways to work around empty shelves at the supermarket
12/01/2022.description: Australia does not have a food shortage. Supply has been disrupted in some locations due to staff absences caused by COVID-19, that's all, writes Stephen Bartos.
12/01/2022.author: Daniel Ziffer

12/01/2022.headline: Queensland gas development could increase national emissions by 60 per cent, report says
12/01/2022.description: A leading climate change scientist says proposed gas development in Queensland could increase national emissions by 60 per cent, but the government says emissions targets "are achievable".
12/01/2022.author: Nathan Morris

12/01/2022.headline: Live: NSW Now: Rapid antigen test rules will be difficult to police, minister concedes
12/01/2022.description: MORNING BRIEFING: The man overseeing the rollout of NSW's RAT kit reporting system says the threat of a $1,000 fine is more about the messaging.
12/01/2022.author: Nathan Morris

12/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic is the number one seed in the Australian Open. But will he be here to play in it?
12/01/2022.description: An admission of a wrongful statement on his travel declaration may have put the world number one's grand slam campaign in jeopardy.
12/01/2022.author: Judd Boaz

12/01/2022.headline: Rapid antigen testing regime change kicks in across South Australia. Here's how it will work
12/01/2022.description: South Australia was the second-last state to make rapid antigen tests generally available, but the state government is now looking to expand access to them, and has set up what is expected to be the first of about a dozen hubs. Here's how it will work.
12/01/2022.author: Alina Eacott

12/01/2022.headline: Tasmania's reopening was meant to be good news for businesses. Instead, they're navigating a trading slump
12/01/2022.description: Businesses across Tasmania had been preparing for their busiest season in months after the state's borders reopened in December. But the recent rise in COVID cases has seen retail activity dramatically decline, prompting calls for more financial assistance.
12/01/2022.author: Adam Langenberg

12/01/2022.headline: How does Omicron affect kids? Here's what we know so far
12/01/2022.description: Primary school children will head back into the classroom only partially vaccinated, if at all. So, what are the risks of the now-dominant Omicron variant for kids?
12/01/2022.author: Olivia Willis

12/01/2022.headline: 'We knew this was coming': Inconsistent rules cripple childcare centres and disrupt working parents
12/01/2022.description: Children are being sent home from daycare centres in record numbers, causing major disruption to families. But providers say they have been given little or no guidance on how to manage COVID cases, resulting in a patchwork of responses from closures to excluding kids and test-to-stay options.
12/01/2022.author: Phoebe Bowden

12/01/2022.headline: Frogs to test pregnancy and no ultrasounds. Caroline de Costa has seen a lot in her 50-year career
12/01/2022.description: Nothing was going to stop Caroline De Costa finishing her medical degree. Along the way, she became a single mother, smuggled contraceptives and fought for women's rights.
12/01/2022.author: Anna Kelsey-Sugg and Erica Vowles

12/01/2022.headline: Exploding stars inflated a huge, hot bubble of gas. We're living in it
12/01/2022.description: Some 14 million years ago, a distant star exploded — the first of a handful that would inflate a huge hot bubble of gas in our galaxy. And this is not just any galactic bubble.
12/01/2022.author: Belinda Smith

12/01/2022.headline: Australians head nominations for Screen Actors Guild Awards
12/01/2022.description: Australians in film and television receive nominations for several major awards at the upcoming Screen Actors Guild Awards.
12/01/2022.author: Belinda Smith

12/01/2022.headline: Fifteen years ago, a global risk report warned of a pandemic. Will we listen this time?
12/01/2022.description: Jobs have been lost, people have been isolated, social unrest is rising as we become more politically polarised and global tensions rise. We can't say we weren't warned, writes Stan Grant.
12/01/2022.author: Stan Grant

12/01/2022.headline: He escaped the Taliban for Australia, but this refugee says indefinite detention has left him scarred
12/01/2022.description: The refugee worked with Western forces in Afghanistan and later fled for Australia. His lawyer says he's been abandoned in his hour of need.
12/01/2022.author: Erin Handley

12/01/2022.headline: Civil lawsuit against Prince Andrew to go ahead
12/01/2022.description: Prince Andrew failed to persuade a US judge to dismiss Virginia Giuffre's lawsuit accusing the Duke of York of sexually abusing her when she was underage, and being trafficked by the late financier Jeffrey Epstein.
12/01/2022.author: Erin Handley

12/01/2022.headline: 'I know the rage they feel with me': UK PM apologises to public for Downing Street party but refuses to resign
12/01/2022.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson has apologised after attending a "bring your own booze" party in the garden of Number 10 Downing Street during the May 2020 lockdown.
12/01/2022.author: Jack Hawke

12/01/2022.headline: Kokkinakis stuns another big gun as his summer form resurgence continues
12/01/2022.description: Thanasi Kokkinakis already has a wildcard entry to the Australian Open secured, but an upset, come-from-behind win over John Isner may have put the tournament on warning.
12/01/2022.author: Jack Hawke

12/01/2022.headline: North Korea's Kim Jong Un urges more 'military muscle' after hypersonic missile test
12/01/2022.description: Hypersonic missiles are listed among the "top priority" tasks for strategic weapons development in North Korea's five-year plan.
12/01/2022.author: Jack Hawke

12/01/2022.headline: 'Somebody knows the truth': Family's plea for answers on anniversary of toddler's kidnap
12/01/2022.description: The abduction of Cheryl Grimmer from a NSW beach 52 years ago is now the subject of an international podcast, giving her family fresh hope that the mystery might be solved.
12/01/2022.author: Nick McLaren

13/01/2022.headline: International students allowed to work more hours to help ease COVID worker shortage
13/01/2022.description: The federal government removes working-hour caps on international students, allowing more people to help fill worker shortages caused by the Omicron outbreak.
13/01/2022.author: Joshua Boscaini, Erwin Renaldi, and Natasya Salim

13/01/2022.headline: The Loop: Some iso rules to ease, man admits to Scott Johnson's murder, Djokovic named in Aus Open draw
13/01/2022.description: Get in The Loop with a quick wrap-up of the news you need to know about.
13/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

13/01/2022.headline: Stupidity or something more sinister? Questions linger over three large bushfires in WA
13/01/2022.description: As police probe a third large fire in WA's South West, an uneasy question remains about the cause.
13/01/2022.author: Anthony Pancia

13/01/2022.headline: 'Awkward': Snap lockdown in China traps woman in blind date's apartment
13/01/2022.description: A woman stuck for several days in the home of a man she just met says it's awkward and embarrassing — but at least he's cooking every day.
13/01/2022.author: Annika Burgess and Jason Fang

13/01/2022.headline: Su Oh leads field on first day of maiden WPGA
13/01/2022.description: Aussie Su Oh leads in the first women's PGA to be played alongside the men's championship.
13/01/2022.author: Annika Burgess and Jason Fang

13/01/2022.headline: 'Absolute slap in the face': Hillsong slammed over singing, dancing at camp amid festival cancellations
13/01/2022.description: Days after the cancellation of two Hunter music festivals due to COVID health orders, Hillsong is holding a multi-day "summercamp" with singing and dancing.
13/01/2022.author: Jake Lapham

13/01/2022.headline: Woman charged with sexually abusing daughter refused bail in Adelaide
13/01/2022.description: A woman charged with sexually abusing her own daughter has been refused bail after the court heard she allegedly tried to pressure one of her other children into withdrawing their witness statement.
13/01/2022.author: Candice Prosser

13/01/2022.headline: 'Beautiful' rainbow-like octopus sighted off major Queensland tourist destination
13/01/2022.description: When marine biologist Jacinta Shackleton spotted a rare blanket octopus she couldn't stop "screaming" into her snorkel. It's only the fourth time the octopus has been sighted off Lady Elliot Island on the Great Barrier Reef.
13/01/2022.author: Tobi Loftus, Cristy-Lee Macqueen, and Hannah Walsh

13/01/2022.headline: Watchdog cites COVID-19 response among Australia's most significant human rights issues
13/01/2022.description: A new report assessing human rights across the globe lists "serious human rights issues" within Australia, including COVID restrictions, mistreatment of asylum seekers and disproportionate incarceration of Indigenous people.
13/01/2022.author: Tracey Shelton

13/01/2022.headline: Aerial skier Peel makes Winter Olympic statement with historic World Cup win
13/01/2022.description: Australia's reigning world aerial skiing champion Laura Peel is favourite to take out gold at next month's Winter Olympics after a World Cup win in Deer Valley, USA.
13/01/2022.author: Tracey Shelton

13/01/2022.headline: Scott White admits to murdering Scott Johnson, solving one of Sydney's longest-running gay hate crimes
13/01/2022.description: Scott White is convicted of murder after admitting killing American mathematician Scott Johnson, whose body was found at the bottom of a Sydney cliff more than 30 years ago.
13/01/2022.author: Paige Cockburn

13/01/2022.headline: WA Premier Mark McGowan announces 'broadest proof of vaccination requirements in the nation'
13/01/2022.description: WA Premier Mark McGowan announces an expansion of proof of vaccination requirements as the state records two new local COVID-19 cases overnight, with one linked to the Hyatt Hotel cluster.
13/01/2022.author: Rhiannon Shine

13/01/2022.headline: 'It's ridiculous': WA struggles to find fix for stranded families
13/01/2022.description: Two years into the pandemic, another round of border restrictions has cut off residents along the WA-NT border from food, essential services and work.
13/01/2022.author: Ted O'Connor and Vanessa Mills

13/01/2022.headline: Teachers, truck drivers among those added to list of those who can leave isolation to work
13/01/2022.description: Thousands more people will be allowed to return to work if they are a close contact of a positive COVID-19 case, with national cabinet agreeing to expand which workers should be exempt from isolation rules
13/01/2022.author: Georgia Hitch

13/01/2022.headline: SA Premier announces return to school plan as state records four COVID deaths, 3,669 cases
13/01/2022.description: There are 225 people in hospital across SA, including 16 in intensive care, as the government announces the majority of students will learn from home for the first two weeks of school.
13/01/2022.author: Stacey Pestrin, Daniel Keane, and Alice Dempster

13/01/2022.headline: Queensland's COVID-19 border restrictions are set to be dumped. How will it work?
13/01/2022.description: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk effectively throws open the state's borders to the rest of Australia by lifting the remaining restrictions from this weekend.
13/01/2022.author: Dan Colasimone

13/01/2022.headline: Matilda Alanna Kennedy confident of shoring up defence ahead of Asian Cup title charge
13/01/2022.description: Matildas defender Alanna Kennedy believes Australia is much more prepared for next week's Asian Cup than they were before last year's Tokyo Olympics.
13/01/2022.author: Dan Colasimone

13/01/2022.headline: Nearly $20,000 in wages recovered by Fair Work for Adelaide cleaners
13/01/2022.description: The Fair Work Ombudsman recovers $18,952 for cleaning staff after a probe into 17 commercial contract cleaning businesses around Adelaide.
13/01/2022.author: Dan Colasimone

13/01/2022.headline: Showers forecast for the cricket as parts of Australia swelter or prepare for storms
13/01/2022.description: South-east Australia is expecting storms, the north-west is scorching as the Top End prepares for drenching. It could even be a bit wet for the start of the Test in Hobart tomorrow.
13/01/2022.author: Kate Doyle and Myles Houlbrook-Walk

13/01/2022.headline: How Omicron is shutting down huge swathes of Australia's economy
13/01/2022.description: The rapid spread of the Omicron variant is hitting the heart of the economy as an unprecedented shortage of workers throws the supply of goods and services into chaos.
13/01/2022.author: Sue Lannin

13/01/2022.headline: Aus Open organisers betting Djokovic will play, as world number one included in men's draw
13/01/2022.description: Novak Djokovic is scheduled to play at the Australian Open, despite ongoing concerns about the status of his visa.
13/01/2022.author: Sue Lannin

13/01/2022.headline: Third Rust lawsuit, as armourer sues ammunition supplier over fatal shooting in Baldwin movie
13/01/2022.description: Two other crew members, including one who was injured in the same shooting, have already filed suit against the film's producers and the armourer, who is now suing the ammunition supplier.
13/01/2022.author: Sue Lannin

13/01/2022.headline: Arrests made after protesters allegedly try to enter Parliament House in Canberra
13/01/2022.description: Four people are arrested and police use capsicum spray to disperse protesters after a group of them allegedly tried to enter Parliament House in Canberra.
13/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside and Antoinette Radford

13/01/2022.headline: 'No-one will be giving up': Search expands for Krystal Cain, 14, as floodwaters recede
13/01/2022.description: The family of Krystal Cain say they are "holding onto hope" as police continue their search for the teenager who was swept into floodwaters in the Gympie region on Saturday morning.
13/01/2022.author: Meg Bolton, Jacqui Street, and Owen Jacques

13/01/2022.headline: Small beachside town in WA equals Australia's hottest day on record
13/01/2022.description: Onslow, around 1,400 kilometres north of Perth, joins Oodnadatta in outback South Australia, which hit 50.7C in January 1960.
13/01/2022.author: Laura Birch

13/01/2022.headline: 'Quite overwhelming': Mum and academic calls out COVID trolls for abuse after her 6yo gets vaccine
13/01/2022.description: A Gold Coast registered nurse and academic urges tech companies to do more after she received "hundreds" of abusive comments on a tweet about her daughter getting the jab.
13/01/2022.author: Alexandria Utting

13/01/2022.headline: Live: NSW Now: Man allegedly used wheelie bins to rob luxury store in Sydney's CBD
13/01/2022.description: MORNING BRIEFING: A man is set to face court today after he allegedly stole $460,000 worth of designer goods from a store early on New Year's Day.
13/01/2022.author: Alexandria Utting

13/01/2022.headline: RSPCA renews call to ban 'distressing' rodeo sport of calf roping
13/01/2022.description: Animal welfare groups say the lassoing practice causes calves great distress and fear and should not be seen as entertainment. WARNING: This article contains footage that may distress some viewers.
13/01/2022.author: David Claughton

13/01/2022.headline: When is Brisbane's water going to stop tasting 'bloody disgusting'?
13/01/2022.description: You may have noticed Brisbane's water tastes like dirt right now. So what's causing this and how long will it last?
13/01/2022.author: Dan Colasimone

13/01/2022.headline: 'No visitors' policies in Queensland COVID-19 affected aged care homes may breach industry code
13/01/2022.description: Extreme 'no visitors' policies are being imposed on distressed residents in COVID-19 affected aged care homes in Queensland, with one facility banning visitors from even waving through windows.
13/01/2022.author: Kate McKenna and Rory Callinan

13/01/2022.headline: When will we see the peak of this COVID wave?
13/01/2022.description: We'd all like some answers, but uncertainty over how we count COVID cases is complicating the picture. Here's what to expect in the days and weeks ahead, writes Adrian Esterman.
13/01/2022.author: Kate McKenna and Rory Callinan

13/01/2022.headline: British MPs warned by spy agency MI5 about Chinese agent's 'political interference activities'
13/01/2022.description: A letter to British MPs warns a woman had engaged with members of parliament "on behalf of the Chinese Communist Party", facilitating political donations on behalf of foreig nationals based in Hong Kong and China.
13/01/2022.author: Kate McKenna and Rory Callinan

13/01/2022.headline: Banking task force hears of 'neglect' as leaders vow to make real change
13/01/2022.description: Red Cliffs resident John Bunney says people like him have been neglected by banks.
13/01/2022.author: Richard Crabtree

13/01/2022.headline: Inflation reached its highest point in 40 years in the US. Here's what that could mean for Australia
13/01/2022.description: Everything really is more expensive thanks to inflation and — yep, you guessed it — supply chain issues. Here's what else is causing you to pay more during the pandemic.
13/01/2022.author: Lucia Stein

13/01/2022.headline: 'Because they are dating, logically, it's consensual': Indonesia set to debate long-awaited sexual violence bill
13/01/2022.description: A shocking suicide casts a spotlight on the issue of consent in Indonesia, and has added to the political pressure to pass a long-delayed anti sexual violence bill.
13/01/2022.author: Hellena Souisa

13/01/2022.headline: Will Smith courts accolades as the ambitious father of tennis superstars Serena and Venus Williams
13/01/2022.description: The story of the Williams sisters and their dedicated father is an avenue to explore poignant, bigger narratives about intergenerational trauma, exceptionalism, racism and class.
13/01/2022.author: Annabel Brady-Brown

13/01/2022.headline: Swapping Santiago for Cygnet: Virtual Tasmanian pilgrim walk attracts global audience
13/01/2022.description: Inspired by Spain's famous Camino de Santiago, hundreds of people from around the world are taking part in a virtual Tasmanian Way to St James pilgrim walk beginning this weekend.
13/01/2022.author: Loretta Lohberger

13/01/2022.headline: Waiting game on Novak Djokovic's visa status stretches into a second week
13/01/2022.description: There's still no word on whether Immigration Minister Alex Hawke will cancel Novak Djokovic's visa, as the Serbian star continues his Australian Open preparations apparently undaunted.
13/01/2022.author: Freya Michie

13/01/2022.headline: COVID and rain stay away, Ashes cricket is on today
13/01/2022.description: History will be made in Hobart today when an Ashes Test begins in Tasmania for the first time, but it's hardly been smooth sailing to this point for the little city known for a big boat race, writes Guy Stayner.
13/01/2022.author: Guy Stayner

13/01/2022.headline: Some COVID cases being counted twice in NSW due to teething issues with RAT reporting
13/01/2022.description: A leading epidemiologist says the COVID case numbers are "messy" and making modelling difficult as NSW Health concedes teething problems with the rapid test reporting system mean some people may have been counted twice.
13/01/2022.author: Paige Cockburn

13/01/2022.headline: The system 'let down' Scott Johnson, but his family wouldn't rest until his mystery killer was found
13/01/2022.description: The brother of a PhD student whose naked body was found dashed on rocks in Sydney 33 years ago says his faith in justice "is restored" after the cold case was finally solved.
13/01/2022.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton
