13/01/2022.headline: Ghezal put her kids to bed early the night the Taliban took Kabul. She hoped the bombing would happen while they slept
13/01/2022.description: The Afghan journalist and her family feared for their lives when the Taliban took their city. They spent months in hiding before they escaped the country.
13/01/2022.author: Claudia Taranto

13/01/2022.headline: Australian-made RATs await TGA approval amid rapid antigen test shortage
13/01/2022.description: As Australians struggle to get their hands on mainly imported COVID-19 rapid antigen tests, several Australian companies have been waiting months for local approval to sell their RATs.
13/01/2022.author: Michael Janda

13/01/2022.headline: Australia's journey through Omicron is like the bus tour from hell
13/01/2022.description: Eventually we'll see the back of the boggy ground on this outback track. But in worse shape and at higher cost than the Morrison government was suggesting only weeks ago, writes Michelle Grattan.
13/01/2022.author: Michelle Grattan

13/01/2022.headline: Prince Andrew stripped of his military titles and royal patronages, will no longer use 'HRH'
13/01/2022.description: The Queen has removed all of Prince Andrew's military affiliations and royal patronages as he defends a civil sexual abuse case in the United States. He will also no longer use the title of "His Royal Highness".
13/01/2022.author: Jack Hawke

13/01/2022.headline: 'Playing by his own rules': Stefanos Tsitsipas hits out at Djokovic
13/01/2022.description: Greek tennis star Stefanos Tsitsipas questions why Novak Djokovic seemingly gets to play by his own rules when most other tennis players had to get vaccinated before coming to Australia.
13/01/2022.author: Jack Hawke

13/01/2022.headline: Millions of COVID-19 vaccine doses wasted in poorer countries due to rapid expiry
13/01/2022.description: Poorer nations last month rejected more than 100 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines distributed by the global programme COVAX, mainly due to their rapid expiry date, according to UNICEF.
13/01/2022.author: Jack Hawke

13/01/2022.headline: Tim James wins preselection for Berejiklian's former seat in upset for moderates
13/01/2022.description: Right faction member and former Howard staffer Tim James wins preselection in former premier Gladys Berejiklian's seat of Willoughby in a surprise defeat for moderate Liberals.
13/01/2022.author: Paige Cockburn

13/01/2022.headline: KPMG pays Malaysian government $111 million settlement over 1MDB scandal
13/01/2022.description: Malaysia says it has recovered enough funds linked to scandal-tainted state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) to pay off only the principal amount of the debt still owed by the firm this year.
13/01/2022.author: Paige Cockburn

13/01/2022.headline: NASA begins process of bringing new space telescope into focus
13/01/2022.description: NASA embarks on a months-long, painstaking process of bringing its newly launched James Webb Space Telescope into focus, a task due for completion in time for the revolutionary eye in the sky to begin peering into the cosmos by May.
13/01/2022.author: Paige Cockburn

14/01/2022.headline: The Loop: NSW Police says Hillsong won't be fined, who's exempt from COVID iso, an Oscars hosting dream team?
14/01/2022.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
14/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

14/01/2022.headline: Amanda Spratt returns to cycling after speedy recovery from surgery to address rare condition
14/01/2022.description: Spratt will appear at the Australian event despite having surgery in October for a condition that derailed her Tokyo tilt.
14/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

14/01/2022.headline: Robert F Kennedy's assassin Sirhan Sirhan denied parole for 16th time
14/01/2022.description: California's governor denies parole to the man serving a life prison sentence for assassinating US presidential candidate in 1968, saying he remains a threat to the public.
14/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

14/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic's visa cancelled for second time leaving his Australian Open bid in doubt
14/01/2022.description: Immigration Minister Alex Hawke uses his ministerial powers to personally cancel Novak Djokovic's visa, after the tennis star won a court case earlier this week against the cancellation of his entry visa.
14/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

14/01/2022.headline: After a woman died waiting for an ambulance, her body was left in the sun for hours
14/01/2022.description: The wheelchair-bound woman in her 40s collapsed outside her Townsville home and died on her driveway during the two-and-a-half hours it took for paramedics to reach her. Neighbours say she was left in the sun for four hours while investigations began.
14/01/2022.author: Jade Toomey

14/01/2022.headline: 'People are frantic': GP clinics flooded with vaccine bookings after WA announces strict rules for unvaccinated
14/01/2022.description: GPs across the city are flooded with COVID vaccine bookings following strict new vaccination rules announced yesterday, as WA records one new case, in a child.
14/01/2022.author: James Carmody

14/01/2022.headline: Police remove protesters' tents near Old Parliament House
14/01/2022.description: ACT police officers dismantle tents and remove camping equipment after demonstrators ignored a deadline to leave the area where they were staying without authorisation.
14/01/2022.author: Harry Frost and Antoinette Radford

14/01/2022.headline: Two more tennis players with travel exemptions depart Australia
14/01/2022.description: The ABC learns two more players who flew into Australia for next week's Australian Open in Melbourne, with the same exemption as world number one Novak Djokovic, have left the country of their own accord.
14/01/2022.author: Harry Frost and Antoinette Radford

14/01/2022.headline: Community with no homeless shelter buys a bus instead
14/01/2022.description: Queensland's first sleep bus has arrived to offer emergency beds to homeless people on the Sunshine Coast, as support agencies struggle to help an avalanche of people caught up in the housing crisis.
14/01/2022.author: Jacqui Street

14/01/2022.headline: 'A win would be nice': Tasmanians gather to watch historic Ashes Test in Hobart
14/01/2022.description: Thousands of Tasmanians flock to witness history in the making as the first-ever men's Ashes Test in Hobart gets underway — but some choose to observe from a distance as COVID cases in the state continue to climb.
14/01/2022.author: Liz Gwynn

14/01/2022.headline: Two men facing charges related to Old Parliament House protest granted bail
14/01/2022.description: Two men involved in the ongoing demonstrations at Old Parliament House are granted bail in the ACT Magistrates Court.
14/01/2022.author: Antoinette Radford

14/01/2022.headline: Loved ones of aged care residents are calling for a greater balance between managing COVID-19 risks and mental health
14/01/2022.description: In December, the aged care regulator received 45 complaints referencing lockdowns, isolation of residents or visitor restrictions as the Omicron outbreak hit.
14/01/2022.author: Ellen Coulter and Laura Francis

14/01/2022.headline: Would you buy two-legged carrots or twin tomatoes? Uni friends tackle food waste
14/01/2022.description: Did you know that Australia wastes $20 billion worth of food each year? Josh Ball and Josh Brookes-Duncan are trying to help reduce food waste by sourcing imperfect produce from farmers to sell to consumers.
14/01/2022.author: Eden Hynninen

14/01/2022.headline: Fifth Ashes Test at Bellerive Oval scorecard
14/01/2022.description: Follow all the live scores and stats from the fifth Ashes Test at Bellerive Oval in Hobart.
14/01/2022.author: Eden Hynninen

14/01/2022.headline: North West Regional Hospital suspends some elective surgeries as 90 staff isolate
14/01/2022.description: COVID-induced staff shortages have forced the suspension of some elective surgeries at a major Tasmanian hospital — the same facility that was the site of Australia's first ever COVID outbreak.
14/01/2022.author: Will Murray

14/01/2022.headline: What is still left of royal life for Prince Andrew?
14/01/2022.description: Prince Andrew has been effectively removed from all his connections as a working royal as he faces a civil sexual assault case in the United States.
14/01/2022.author: Sarah Motherwell

14/01/2022.headline: Search for missing police dog PD Quizz escalates as authorities offer reward
14/01/2022.description: Helicopters, drones and about 100 people join the search for a missing Queensland police dog, known as PD Quizz, which disappeared while chasing a suspect through bushland.
14/01/2022.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis

14/01/2022.headline: Northern Territory government admits to significant COVID-19 check-in app failure, records slight rise in hospitalisations
14/01/2022.description: The Northern Territory government says no users of its COVID-19 check-in app were notified if they attended a venue at the same time as a positive case over the past week, because of a significant reporting failure.
14/01/2022.author: Jesse Thompson

14/01/2022.headline: Live: Travis Head reaches 50 in counter-attacking effort on day one of Ashes finale in Hobart
14/01/2022.description: The series may already be decided, but there is still much on the line as Australia and England head to Hobart for an historic fifth Test match. Follow all the action in our live blog.
14/01/2022.author: Simon Smale and Jon Healy

14/01/2022.headline: SA records six COVID-linked deaths, as new modelling shows state is on the cusp of peak cases
14/01/2022.description: South Australia records 5,679 new COVID cases as new modelling predicts peak cases of up to 10,000 per day between January 15 and January 25, the Premier says.
14/01/2022.author: Stacey Pestrin, Daniel Keane, and Nick Harmsen

14/01/2022.headline: From 'healthy masculinity' to crisis housing: How the government wants to end violence against women
14/01/2022.description: The latest plan on how to reduce, and ultimately eliminate, violence against women and children is released, with a focus on improving gender equality and attitudes to prevent it happening in the first place.
14/01/2022.author: Georgia Hitch

14/01/2022.headline: ACT records 1,125 new COVID-19 cases from PCR and rapid tests
14/01/2022.description: In the first combined release of numbers from PCR and RATs, the ACT records 1,125 new COVID-19 cases.
14/01/2022.author: Kate Midena and Charlotte Gore

14/01/2022.headline: Following the success of Spider-Man: No Way Home, could Tom Holland and Zendaya host the Oscars?
14/01/2022.description: There's a web of speculation over who could host the 94th Academy Awards.
14/01/2022.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

14/01/2022.headline: Hillsong avoids fine after hundreds filmed singing and dancing at youth camp
14/01/2022.description: NSW Police say following discussions with the organiser and consultation with NSW Health, the church will not be fined over maskless singing and dancing at the event.
14/01/2022.author: Jake Lapham

14/01/2022.headline: Ghostface terrorises a new group of California teens in the meta-horror sequel Scream 5
14/01/2022.description: Neve Campbell, Courteney Cox and David Arquette pass the torch to a new generation of frightened teenagers fleeing a masked killer in the latest movie in the 25-year-old franchise.
14/01/2022.author: Keva York

14/01/2022.headline: 'I was vomiting the whole time': Leilehua braved lengthy PCR test queues with morning sickness
14/01/2022.description: Until rapid antigen tests are widely available, people like pregnant women, the elderly and people with disability have no choice but to wait in long PCR queues to be tested for COVID-19. While some states prioritise these groups, others are being left to wait hours.
14/01/2022.author: Edwina Seselja

14/01/2022.headline: Feeling the petrol pinch? Your car's fuel consumption isn't what it says on the sticker — but that could soon change
14/01/2022.description: The fuel consumption sticker on your car is the result of a laboratory test, not how it drives in the real world — and its fuel efficiency can be wildly different to what is advertised. But that could soon change, depending on who wins the coming federal election.
14/01/2022.author: Jake Evans

14/01/2022.headline: 'No tennis player is bigger than a tournament': World reacts to Djokovic's cancelled visa ahead of Australian Open
14/01/2022.description: Members of the tennis fraternity react to Novak Djokovic's cancelled visa, with a former coach left to wonder just what the world number one expected.
14/01/2022.author: Jake Evans

14/01/2022.headline: So many of Australia's COVID rules just don't make sense — and anger is rising
14/01/2022.description: Rapid antigen tests have suddenly become the key to society functioning, and the best symbol of how the whole "government getting out of your face" thing seems to have gone so spectacularly awry in the past six weeks, writes Laura Tingle.
14/01/2022.author: Laura Tingle

14/01/2022.headline: It's not just WA: Sydney and Melbourne will see dangerous 50C temperatures soon enough
14/01/2022.description: Extreme heat over 50C is likely to become more common, giving us yet another reason for Australia to act fast on climate change, writes Andrew King.
14/01/2022.author: Laura Tingle

14/01/2022.headline: How Prince Andrew went from the Queen's 'golden boy' to an embattled private citizen
14/01/2022.description: With a New York judge throwing out Prince Andrew's attempt to dismiss a civil lawsuit against him, the Queen's "favourite" son faces a lonely wait for a trial that could spell catastrophe.
14/01/2022.author: Rebecca Armitage and Lucy Sweeney

14/01/2022.headline: With a flash of his bat, Head sends fragile England toppling again
14/01/2022.description: Soon after its brightest spell of this Ashes series, England found itself on the ropes yet again. It was another testament to Australia's creativity and an indictment on the tourists' fragility, writes Dean Bilton.
14/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

14/01/2022.headline: Downing Street apologises to Queen over lockdown parties the night before Prince Philip's funeral
14/01/2022.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson's office has apologised to Queen Elizabeth after it emerged that staff had partied late into the night in Downing Street on the eve of Prince Philip's funeral.
14/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

14/01/2022.headline: Is there really life on Mars? New study of 1980s meteorite debunks proof of Martian presence
14/01/2022.description: Scientists say they've confirmed a meteorite from Mars found in 1984 contains no evidence of ancient Martian life — but the original researchers say they stand by their 1996 observations.
14/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

14/01/2022.headline: Kim puts heat on Oh in two-way WPGA battle, Morgan hailed 'next Greg Norman'
14/01/2022.description: Grace Kim shoots a three-under 68 on Friday to take WPGA Championship lead, while youngster Jed Morgan is hailed "the next Greg Norman".
14/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

14/01/2022.headline: Outdoor learning encouraged as SA Education Department rules out air purifiers for return to school
14/01/2022.description: A day after confirming most year levels would begin the year with a fortnight of "at home learning", the SA government provides more detail about its "hybrid model" of schooling.
14/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

14/01/2022.headline: How one botched decision turned COVID villain into a political victim
14/01/2022.description: In dealing with the Djokovic saga, the federal government managed to turn the vaccine sceptic — a man who tried to skirt around border entry rules for one of the most vaccinated countries in the world — into a victim, writes Brett Worthington.
14/01/2022.author: Brett Worthington

14/01/2022.headline: Woman dies after fire 'completely destroys' unit in southern Tasmania
14/01/2022.description: Tasmania Police are investigating what caused a unit fire to start in Huonville, south of Hobart this afternoon, killing the sole 56-year-old resident.
14/01/2022.author: Kate Ainsworth

14/01/2022.headline: COVID-hit Demons take down Tigers at Punt Road
14/01/2022.description: Melbourne Demons overcome the absence of five players to beat a similarly COVID-affected Richmond side, winning by 16 points on the Tigers' turf.
14/01/2022.author: Kate Ainsworth

14/01/2022.headline: Djokovic set to be detained again as he fights decision to cancel his visa
14/01/2022.description: Serbian tennis star Novak Djokovic is set to be detained by Australian immigration officials again on Saturday as his lawyers urgently prepare to fight the cancellation of his visa for a second time.
14/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

14/01/2022.headline: 'A lot of people are feeling stressed': Parents concerned over SA's 'hybrid model' back-to-school plan
14/01/2022.description: As families prepare for the school year, some parents express their worry over the South Australian education department's plans for a "staggered hybrid model" return to classrooms.
14/01/2022.author: Leah MacLennan and Evelyn Manfield

14/01/2022.headline: One person in ICU as Tasmania records 1,139 new COVID cases
14/01/2022.description: For the first time since borders reopened and restrictions eased, Tasmania has recorded a COVID case in intensive care. It comes as new rules for Tasmanians requiring a free rapid antigen test come into play.
14/01/2022.author: Kate Ainsworth and Will Murray

14/01/2022.headline: 'One of the best therapies I've found': How RSL clubs are changing with the times
14/01/2022.description: For veterans like Joshua Weir, the RSL has been a lifeline. But dwindling membership is forcing their closure in some regional areas, as the organisation aims to find new ways to retain and attract members.
14/01/2022.author: Liz Gwynn

14/01/2022.headline: Live: Novak Djokovic taken to detention following a meeting with his lawyers
14/01/2022.description: Novak Djokovic is appealing against his second visa cancellation after Immigration Minister Alex Hawke last night cancelled it on health and good order grounds. Follow live.
14/01/2022.author: Jordan Hayne

14/01/2022.headline: Kokkinakis out to realise childhood dream
14/01/2022.description: Thanasi Kokkinakis is one win away from achieving his first ATP tournament triumph as he keeps writing the best story in Australian tennis so far this year.
14/01/2022.author: Jordan Hayne

14/01/2022.headline: This Broome batter is posting Ponting-like numbers. Is he WA cricket's next big thing?
14/01/2022.description: When a 12-year-old Ricky Ponting hit four centuries in a week during a junior competition in mid-1980s in Tasmania, it kickstarted one of Australia's most celebrated cricket careers. Fast forward to 2022 and a batter from WA's north is racking up similar numbers.
14/01/2022.author: Eddie Williams

15/01/2022.headline: Two new local COVID-19 cases in WA, both believed to have been infectious in the community
15/01/2022.description: Two women linked to previously-reported COVID-19 cases test positive to the virus, with one new exposure site confirmed so far.
15/01/2022.author: Tom Wildie

15/01/2022.headline: Melbourne Victory handed show cause notice after Josh Cavallo calls out homophobic abuse
15/01/2022.description: Football Australia takes action after Cavallo says he was targeted with homophobic abuse during Adelaide United's away A-League Men match with Melbourne Victory.
15/01/2022.author: Tom Wildie

15/01/2022.headline: US intelligence warns Russia 'laying the groundwork' to invade Ukraine
15/01/2022.description: The White House believes Russia could attack its own forces to create a pretext for invading Ukraine.
15/01/2022.author: Tom Wildie

15/01/2022.headline: Argentine town goes dark to combat beetle invasion
15/01/2022.description: The small Argentine town of Santa Isabel shuts down street and public building lights after being invaded by a large number of beetles.
15/01/2022.author: Tom Wildie

15/01/2022.headline: 'Little bit tired': Rafael Nadal frustrated as Djokovic saga continues to overshadow Australian Open
15/01/2022.description: Rafael Nadal says the Australian Open will still be "great" if Novak Djokovic is forced out of the tournament, admitting he is a "little bit tired" of the controversy surrounding his rival.
15/01/2022.author: Tom Wildie

15/01/2022.headline: Collingwood takes down St Kilda before Cats host Carlton
15/01/2022.description: Collingwood bounces back from the devastating loss of Bri Davey to beat St Kilda by 27 points, ahead of Geelong's clash with Carlton. Follow our live AFLW ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.
15/01/2022.author: Tom Wildie

15/01/2022.headline: Tennis Hall of Famer Chris Evert says she has ovarian cancer
15/01/2022.description: Former tennis star Chris Evert has been diagnosed with an early stage of ovarian cancer and will begin chemotherapy treatments this week.
15/01/2022.author: Tom Wildie

15/01/2022.headline: Vaccinated woman in her 40s the second person to die with COVID in the NT
15/01/2022.description: The Northern Territory has recorded its second COVID-related death, after an Aboriginal woman in her 40s died in Royal Darwin Hospital.
15/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts

15/01/2022.headline: Live: England collapsing in the second session on day two in Hobart
15/01/2022.description: Pat Cummins rolls though England's top order in the second session on day two of the fifth and final Ashes Test in Hobart. Follow live.
15/01/2022.author: Simon Smale and Jon Healy

15/01/2022.headline: Kanye West, now known as Ye, named in a battery report filed in Los Angeles
15/01/2022.description: Kanye West, the rapper officially named Ye, is named in a battery report filed in Los Angeles.
15/01/2022.author: Simon Smale and Jon Healy

15/01/2022.headline: Four COVID-19 deaths in SA but drop in positive cases and hospitalisations
15/01/2022.description: Four more people die from COVID-19 in South Australia, while there have been 4,349 new positive cases. Meanwhile, dozens of people have been sent the wrong test result, SA Pathology says.
15/01/2022.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Eugene Boisvert

15/01/2022.headline: Latest isolation rules for critical workers get the balance right. But that's not the end of the story
15/01/2022.description: Thousands more essential workers will be allowed back to work rather than having to self-isolate for seven days but we need to keep a close eye on how that change influences case numbers at these critical workplaces, writes Catherine Bennett.
15/01/2022.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Eugene Boisvert

15/01/2022.headline: North Korea says it test-launched missiles from train
15/01/2022.description: North Korea says it test-launched ballistic missiles from a train in what was seen as an apparent retaliation against fresh sanctions imposed by the US.
15/01/2022.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Eugene Boisvert

15/01/2022.headline: Maxwell sentencing set for June, as judge weighs request for new trial
15/01/2022.description: The judge in Ghislaine Maxwell's sex abuse trial sets a sentencing date of June 28 but says she is still weighing a request to overturn the British socialite's conviction because of concerns about a juror's conduct.
15/01/2022.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Eugene Boisvert

15/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic's appeal against visa cancellation to be heard by three judges on Sunday morning
15/01/2022.description: Lawyers for Novak Djokovic say the Immigration Minister has erroneously cancelled his visa on the grounds he is seen as a "talisman of a community of anti-vaccine sentiment", as a court battle to determine the tennis star's Australian Open fate looms.
15/01/2022.author: Brad Ryan

15/01/2022.headline: Queensland CHO outlines when to call an ambulance as COVID-19 hospitalisations surge
15/01/2022.description: Health Minister Yvette D'Ath says Queensland has recorded six deaths and 19,709 new COVID cases.
15/01/2022.author: Baz Ruddick

15/01/2022.headline: Desert community bands together to face first COVID outbreak
15/01/2022.description: From food drops, vaccinations and healthcare, Warlpiri people are working to ensure their old, young and chronically ill community members stay safe from the coronavirus.
15/01/2022.author: Eliza Goetze and Samantha Jonscher

15/01/2022.headline: Large-scale search under way for 9yo girl missing in Blue Mountains
15/01/2022.description: Emergency services are involved in a large-scale search in the Blue Mountains for a nine-year-old girl who has not been seen since Thursday.
15/01/2022.author: Mollie Gorman

15/01/2022.headline: This 1930s UK bride saved her wedding day memories in a box. How did it end up in a Perth skip?
15/01/2022.description: Ivory gloves, dried roses, photos of the bride and groom and a wedding dress. It was someone’s life in a box but it nearly ended up as rubbish.
15/01/2022.author: Cheryl Hall

15/01/2022.headline: Can world number two Aryna Sabalenka find her serve for the Australian Open?
15/01/2022.description: On the eve of the season's first major, second seed Aryna Sabalenka has seemingly lost her ability to serve. Cody Atkinson looks at one of the game's most talented players, who is at the crossroads in her career.
15/01/2022.author: Cody Atkinson

15/01/2022.headline: Fijian PM Frank Bainimarama recovering from urgent heart surgery in Australia
15/01/2022.description: Fiji's PM had been in Australia for a scheduled medical examination when his doctor informed him he would require urgent medical treatment.
15/01/2022.author: Cody Atkinson

15/01/2022.headline: Prince Andrew and accuser Virginia Giuffre seek witnesses in sex abuse lawsuit
15/01/2022.description: Recently released documents show that the prince's legal team is seeking witness accounts from accuser Virginia Giuffre's husband, Robert Giuffre, as part of the civil case filed in the US.
15/01/2022.author: Cody Atkinson

15/01/2022.headline: Chris's smart home knows when his children have been watching too much TV
15/01/2022.description: There's a new commercial rush to automate our homes and appliances. Is this how we'll live in the future?
15/01/2022.author: James Purtill

15/01/2022.headline: Xi Jinping has purged his way to power. But have his crackdowns left him vulnerable?
15/01/2022.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping should be retiring this year, but he will do all he can to maintain his grip on power. If he doesn't, he becomes vulnerable.
15/01/2022.author: Bang Xiao

15/01/2022.headline: Omicron can protect you from Delta. But here's what happens when it hits a city chasing herd immunity
15/01/2022.description: With the idea of herd immunity losing favour in India, a study out of South Africa could offer new hope about the highly infectious Omicron variant. Authors suggest Omicron could protect the people it infects against the more-severe Delta variant, which caused catastrophic scenes in India last year.
15/01/2022.author: James Oaten and Som Patidar

15/01/2022.headline: As Hobart puts on a show, the cricket struggles to meet the occasion
15/01/2022.description: Despite the picturesque surroundings, it was a strange and at times sloppy second day in Hobart — and yet the Test sits as beautifully poised as any this series, writes Dean Bilton.
15/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

15/01/2022.headline: 'COVID chasers' in dangerous game of trying to catch Omicron on purpose
15/01/2022.description: As COVID-19 spreads throughout Australia, some people want an infection "over and done with". But experts warn there are potentially severe consequences of trying to catch the virus.
15/01/2022.author: Gary Nunn

15/01/2022.headline: Manchester City continues Premier League dominance with 1-0 win over Chelsea
15/01/2022.description: Manchester City has won 12 straight matches in the Premier League, tightening its grip on the title race.
15/01/2022.author: Michael Doyle

15/01/2022.headline: Djokovic's last ditch effort to play the Australian Open will be heard in court this morning
15/01/2022.description: The Federal Court will sit in Melbourne at 9:30am AEDT to decide if Novak Djokovic is allowed to remain in the country and compete in the Australian Open.
15/01/2022.author: Michael Doyle

15/01/2022.headline: Virat Kohli steps down at India Test cricket captain
15/01/2022.description: Cricket superstar Virat Kohli will no longer be India's Test captain after announcing his departure on social media.
15/01/2022.author: Michael Doyle

15/01/2022.headline: Thanasi Kokkinakis wins maiden ATP title at Adelaide International
15/01/2022.description: The 25-year-old Australian wins his maiden ATP title after defeating Frenchman Arthur Rinderknech in the final of the Adelaide International.
15/01/2022.author: Michael Doyle

15/01/2022.headline: Alligators covered in diesel after New Orleans spill get scrubbed, teeth cleaned
15/01/2022.description: Cleaning a two-metre alligator is no easy feat, requiring eight people to hold the animal down and operate the cleaning equipment.
15/01/2022.author: Michael Doyle

15/01/2022.headline: Tsunami warning issued for Australia and New Zealand after undersea volcano erupts
15/01/2022.description: The Bureau of Meteorology issues marine warnings for eastern Australia, including parts of Queensland, New South Wales, Victoria and Tasmania after Saturday's eruption off Tonga.
15/01/2022.author: Michael Doyle

15/01/2022.headline: Man dies after dinghy carrying 30 migrants capsizes in English Channel
15/01/2022.description: The number of people who capsized in the Calais region of France more than tripled last year.
15/01/2022.author: Michael Doyle

15/01/2022.headline: AFLW live: Blues defeat Cats after Magpies take down Saints
15/01/2022.description: Carlton and Collingwood secure wins on Saturday over Geelong and St Kilda. Our AFLW ScoreCentre has all the scores, stats and results.
15/01/2022.author: Tom Wildie

15/01/2022.headline: Australia takes big lead in final Ashes Test after nasty night session in Hobart
15/01/2022.description: Australia leads England by 152 runs in their second innings in Hobart, with an exciting night session on day two injecting some life into the final men's Ashes contest.
15/01/2022.author: Simon Smale and Jon Healy

15/01/2022.headline: No baby turtles have been spotted in Hyde Park for 15 years and researchers have no idea why
15/01/2022.description: Despite an abundance of fertile females, zero baby turtles have joined the 300-strong colony of native turtles at Perth's popular Hyde Park in more than 15 years — and nobody knows why.
15/01/2022.author: Gian De Poloni

15/01/2022.headline: Western Australia's days of 'watching and waiting' are numbered as judgement day looms
15/01/2022.description: With just three weeks to go until WA's border opening, there are many unanswered questions about how the state will manage COVID, from schools to hospitals to the use of rapid tests.
15/01/2022.author: Rhiannon Shine

16/01/2022.headline: Mask mandate reintroduced in Perth and Peel as five new local COVID-19 cases are revealed
16/01/2022.description: Western Australia reintroduces a mask mandate for all indoor public areas in Perth and the Peel region after Premier Mark McGowan revealed another three new COVID-19 cases had been recorded, bringing the total number of new cases since Saturday to five.
16/01/2022.author: David Weber

16/01/2022.headline: Djokovic faces deportation after Federal Court throws out visa challenge
16/01/2022.description: The Serbian tennis star now faces deportation on the eve of the Australian Open, following a unanimous decision of the full bench of the Federal Court.
16/01/2022.author: Brad Ryan

16/01/2022.headline: Snowboarder Tess Coady claims World Cup victory, as Australia's first Beijing Olympians are named
16/01/2022.description: Snowboarder Tess Coady has claimed the biggest win of her career while curlers Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt have create Australian sporting history.
16/01/2022.author: Brad Ryan

16/01/2022.headline: Novak Djokovic is out of Australian Open
16/01/2022.description: Novak Djokovic will not contest the Australian Open after the Federal Court dismisses his bid to stay in the country.
16/01/2022.author: Brad Ryan

16/01/2022.headline: In images: Tonga's volcanic eruption and the aftermath
16/01/2022.description: Satellite imagery and social media posts capture the moments the underwater volcano off the coast of Tonga erupted, causing shock waves felt worldwide.
16/01/2022.author: Brad Ryan

16/01/2022.headline: 'I can't get a hold of anyone': Tongan Australians unable to contact loved ones after volcanic eruption
16/01/2022.description: Tongan Australians have been desperately trying to contact loved ones on the island nation to offer assistance in the aftermath of an underwater volcanic eruption.
16/01/2022.author: Claudia Jambor

16/01/2022.headline: Hostages safe and hostage-taker dead after stand-off at Texas synagogue
16/01/2022.description: Authorities confirm all hostages are safe and a hostage-taker is dead after a stand-off inside a Dallas-area synagogue, where the man demanded the release of a Pakistani prisoner.
16/01/2022.author: Claudia Jambor

16/01/2022.headline: Search scaled back for missing 'best friend' police dog, lost in Queensland bushland
16/01/2022.description: A mammoth search for a "much-loved" missing police dog known as PD Quizz is being scaled back after he became separated from his handler while tracking a suspect in dense bushland.
16/01/2022.author: Jessica van Vonderen

16/01/2022.headline: Jacinda Ardern says volcano eruption in Tonga 'hugely concerning' as NZ pledges financial support
16/01/2022.description: Ms Ardern says $500,000 was just a "starting figure" and that her government would provide more help to Tonga as was required.
16/01/2022.author: Jessica van Vonderen

16/01/2022.headline: Volunteer firefighter, 19, charged with lighting multiple blazes throughout Perth fringe
16/01/2022.description: A 19-year-old volunteer firefighter is accused of deliberately lighting multiple blazes, including one that sparked a major emergency on the outskirts of Perth on Boxing Day.
16/01/2022.author: Jacob Kagi and David Weber

16/01/2022.headline: Internet connection lost in Tonga as volcano eruption impact felt as far as the US
16/01/2022.description: The tsunami threat around the Pacific from a huge undersea volcanic eruption recedes, but the extent of damage to Tonga remains unclear.
16/01/2022.author: Jacob Kagi and David Weber

16/01/2022.headline: Tonga volcano could erupt again soon, says expert who visited the site
16/01/2022.description: The undersea volcano that erupted near Tonga sending a massive surge of waves rippling through the Pacific Ocean could erupt again within days, but Saturday's blast was likely the biggest, says an expert who visited the volcano.
16/01/2022.author: Tracey Shelton

16/01/2022.headline: Alice Springs to enter lockout, as number of people in NT hospitals with COVID grows
16/01/2022.description: The Northern Territory has recorded another 327 cases of COVID-19. There's now 44 people in hospital with the virus, an increase from 32 on Saturday.
16/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts

16/01/2022.headline: Authorities warn on low check-in rates in WA as number of local COVID cases climbs
16/01/2022.description: Authorities are urging people against complacency about checking in at venues as Western Australia records a spike in the number of positive local cases.
16/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

16/01/2022.headline: Tasmanian cyclist Nicole Frain wins women's road race at nationals
16/01/2022.description: Tasmanian cyclist Nicole Frain wins her first Australian road race title after launching a perfectly-timed solo attack late in the last few kilometres.
16/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

16/01/2022.headline: Live: Australia sets England 271 runs to win final Ashes Test in Hobart after low-scoring second dig
16/01/2022.description: England has one last chance in the series to win its first Test on Australian soil since 2011, chasing 271 to win after Mark Wood's six wickets helped bowl the Aussies out for 155. Follow live.
16/01/2022.author: Simon Smale and Jon Healy

16/01/2022.headline: How the volcano off Tonga erupted and caused tsunami warnings
16/01/2022.description: The eruption of a giant underwater volcano in the Pacific Ocean triggered tsunami warnings in multiple countries — here's what we know about Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai.
16/01/2022.author: Alexis Moran and Tracey Shelton

16/01/2022.headline: Two COVID-19 deaths in SA as positive tests and hospitalisations continue to fall
16/01/2022.description: A man in his 70s and a man in his 80s both die with COVID-19 in South Australia, while case and hospital numbers take another dip.
16/01/2022.author: Eugene Boisvert and Tom Fedorowytsch

16/01/2022.headline: AFLW live: Dockers clash with Giants as Crows, Suns enjoy wins
16/01/2022.description: Fremantle faces GWS in the final AFLW match on Sunday. Earlier, the Suns scored a 13-point win over the Eagles and the Crows defeated the Kangaroos by the same margin. Follow the live scores, stats and results below.
16/01/2022.author: Eugene Boisvert and Tom Fedorowytsch

16/01/2022.headline: Fierce Illawarra storm cell fells trees, damages roofs
16/01/2022.description: A clean-up effort is underway across parts of the Illawarra after a ferocious storm ripped through the region late on Saturday.
16/01/2022.author: Ainslie Drewitt-Smith

16/01/2022.headline: Armed man shot by police after unsuccessful negotiation
16/01/2022.description: Attempts to negotiate with the man to disarm himself were unsuccessful and after he fired at police, he was shot in the shoulder. Tasmania Police Professional Standards Unit will conduct a full investigation.
16/01/2022.author: Lydia Hales

16/01/2022.headline: Three COVID deaths in Queensland, with 670 patients in hospital
16/01/2022.description: Queensland records three COVID-19 deaths in the last day, with 670 patients currently in hospital with the disease and 49 of those in intensive care.
16/01/2022.author: Lydia Hales

16/01/2022.headline: Have we been doing education wrong? These schools are trying a fresh approach
16/01/2022.description: An increasing number of Australian schools are breaking away from traditional teaching methods in a bid to make education more engaging.
16/01/2022.author: Dan Colasimone

16/01/2022.headline: 'Graciously imposing' old coaching inn on the market for the first time since 1829
16/01/2022.description: Kenmore Arms is a window into Tasmania's colonial past, owned be the same family for over 200 years. But it's just hit the market, and it's attracting a huge amount of interest.
16/01/2022.author: Alexandra Alvaro

16/01/2022.headline: Regent honeyeater may not be around to sing for much longer
16/01/2022.description: A critically endangered songbird that used to roam from Rockhampton to Adelaide in large number is estimated to have fewer than 300 remain in the wild.
16/01/2022.author: Xanthe Gregory

16/01/2022.headline: 'Excellent with foie gras': The surprising side of vegan wines
16/01/2022.description: To explain the difference between vegan and non-vegan wines, I first need to walk you through the basics of conventional winemaking. So top up your glass and let's begin, writes Geoff Scollary.
16/01/2022.author: Xanthe Gregory

16/01/2022.headline: The challenges of filming Back Roads in remote Tasmania
16/01/2022.description: Joe O'Brien shares the trials of filming out of range and off the track in Cradle Mountain-Lake St Clair National Park.
16/01/2022.author: Joe O'Brien

16/01/2022.headline: Prince Harry wants to pay for police protection when his family is in the UK, but the government won't let him
16/01/2022.description: The Duke of Sussex's legal representative says Prince Harry wants to bring his children Archie and Lilibet to visit his home country from the US but that is too risky without police protection.
16/01/2022.author: Joe O'Brien

16/01/2022.headline: 'Graciously imposing' 1829 coaching inn on the market for the first time
16/01/2022.description: Kenmore Arms is a window into Tasmania's colonial past, owned be the same family for over 200 years. But it's just hit the market and is attracting a huge amount of interest.
16/01/2022.author: Alexandra Alvaro

16/01/2022.headline: Australian Open is betting on player honesty to keep Omicron at bay. Will it succeed?
16/01/2022.description: As Tennis Australia prepares to host its second pandemic grand slam, it unveils its strategies for keeping Omicron off the court.
16/01/2022.author: Judd Boaz

16/01/2022.headline: The tales of Boland, Ussie and Green that will echo from Australia's triumphant Ashes blitz
16/01/2022.description: Bookended by shattered English stumps, this Ashes series was rarely a gripping contest. But history will ignore the scores and remember the moments that captivated us all, writes Dean Bilton.
16/01/2022.author: Dean Bilton

16/01/2022.headline: Economics ripe for a post-pandemic shake up as COVID kills old assumptions
16/01/2022.description: Economics hasn't had a major shake-up since the 1970s, but the global financial crisis and COVID pandemic have exposed some glaring flaws in the conventional wisdom about how to run an economy.
16/01/2022.author: Michael Janda

16/01/2022.headline: 'Don't blame the public': Emergency workers say COVID-19 patients don't know when to seek help
16/01/2022.description: Patients who don't need urgent medical care for COVID-19 are tying up the health system, with some seeking emergency help for non-life threatening symptoms or calling triple-0 for general health advice.
16/01/2022.author: Jason Om

16/01/2022.headline: Sore armpits after the COVID booster? Here's what's happening
16/01/2022.description: You're much more likely to get swollen or sore lymph nodes following a Pfizer or Moderna booster than after a first or second dose. What's going on?
16/01/2022.author: Belinda Smith

16/01/2022.headline: Sydney's Tongan community face anxious wait after volcanic eruption and tsunami cuts links to home
16/01/2022.description: Families unable to contact loved ones in Tonga after the volcanic eruption attend prayer services to lift their spirits and share information.
16/01/2022.author: Phoebe Bowden

16/01/2022.headline: 'It's no different to someone sitting in a bushfire zone': The creeping danger of living on the coast
16/01/2022.description: For decades Australians have happily paid a premium for their very own piece of coastline. But with up to a metre of sea-level rise all but locked in by the end of the century, will waterfront living remain a viable option?
16/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

16/01/2022.headline: Global opinion divided after Novak Djokovic deportation ahead of Australian Open
16/01/2022.description: With the world's number one tennis player unable to defend his Australian Open crown after losing a legal challenge, social media is split over the federal government's treatment of the unvaccinated Serbian.
16/01/2022.author: Jason Dasey

16/01/2022.headline: Tonga's Olympic flag bearer says he has not spoken to his father after tsunami
16/01/2022.description: The Tongan Olympian, who rose to fame during the 2016 Rio Opening Ceremony, says he has not heard from his father after a tsunami hit the island nation on Saturday following the eruption of an underwater volcano.
16/01/2022.author: Jason Dasey

16/01/2022.headline: Italian menswear designer Nino Cerruti, who gave Giorgio Armani his big break, dies at 91
16/01/2022.description: Nino Cerruti, the Italian fashion designer credited with revolutionising menswear in the 1960s and who gave Giorgio Armani his first fashion break, has died.
16/01/2022.author: Jason Dasey

16/01/2022.headline: More wild weather on its way after Toowoomba slammed with hail, heavy rain
16/01/2022.description: The Bureau of Meteorology warns of further storms for parts of south-east Queensland after hail and heavy rainfall swept across the Toowoomba region overnight.
16/01/2022.author: Ciara Jones

16/01/2022.headline: Djokovic deported from Australia after Federal Court throws out visa challenge
16/01/2022.description: Novak Djokovic boards a plane and leaves Australia after losing after the Federal Court upheld the government's decision to cancel the world number one's visa.
16/01/2022.author: Brad Ryan

17/01/2022.headline: Pregnant COVID patient receives apology from SA Health for 'delays and discomfort'
17/01/2022.description: An expectant young mother diagnosed with COVID-19 expresses frustration at the standard of care, and the supply of meals, before and after her arrival at an Adelaide medi-hotel.
17/01/2022.author: Shari Hams and Evelyn Manfield

17/01/2022.headline: 'Terribly wrong': Serbian players leap to Djokovic's defence after deportation from Australia
17/01/2022.description: Novak Djokovic's countrymen passionately express their support for the men's world number one after he was denied the chance to contest the Australian Open.
17/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

17/01/2022.headline: New national park a win for the critically endangered numbat
17/01/2022.description: The park is created in the heart of Western Australia's Wheatbelt, providing greater security for the future of some of the state's most endangered animals.
17/01/2022.author: Mark Bennett

17/01/2022.headline: Australian billionaires and the world's 10 richest men doubled their fortunes during the pandemic. Is it time for a wealth tax?
17/01/2022.description: Oxfam urges governments to consider a 99 per cent, one-off tax on the COVID-19 wealth gains, as its new report reveals that while 99 per cent of humanity is now worse off, "billionaires have had a terrific pandemic".
17/01/2022.author: Annika Burgess

17/01/2022.headline: The Loop: Crackdown on RAT pricing, RAAF assessing the damage in Tonga, the Aus Open stories you might have missed
17/01/2022.description: Get up to date with The Loop, a quick wrap-up of today's news.
17/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

17/01/2022.headline: Cannibalism, mutilation and murder: The Australia horror stories that rival TV
17/01/2022.description: TV show Yellowjackets' gruesome depiction of cannibalism and privation seems too horrific to be true. Yet several stories from Australia's past show fiction can come perilously close to our own realities, writes Peter Hobbins.
17/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

17/01/2022.headline: Local wildcard Aleksandar Vukic springs Australian Open ambush on 30th seed Lloyd Harris
17/01/2022.description: Aleksandar Vukic's four-set ambush of Lloyd Harris is one of the early highlights of the Australian Open.
17/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

17/01/2022.headline: How Novak Djokovic went from the brink of tennis glory to being deported
17/01/2022.description: World number one men's tennis player Novak Djokovic was chasing sporting history at the Australian Open, instead he found himself booted out and banned from the country hosting 2022's first grand slam event. Here's how these events unfolded.
17/01/2022.author: Sarah Motherwell

17/01/2022.headline: 'Treated worse than animals': Lack of aircon at Pilbara prison 'a form of torture'
17/01/2022.description: The Aboriginal Legal Service of Western Australia says the lack of air conditioning at Roebourne prison could breach international human rights conventions and it is considering a formal complaint.
17/01/2022.author: Laura Birch

17/01/2022.headline: Government told to pull MPs against vaccine mandates into line after Djokovic case
17/01/2022.description: Shadow Affairs Minister Kristina Keneally says Scott Morrison cannot be a "wolf … acting all tough" to Novak Djokovic and then "be a lamb" when it comes to his own party room.
17/01/2022.author: Georgia Hitch

17/01/2022.headline: Nyrstar vows to deal with safety issues in upgrade to 100-year-old smelter
17/01/2022.description: While Nyrstar is promising a $285-million upgrade to its Hobart zinc smelter will address safety and environmental concerns at the century-old site, jobs will be lost, according to the union representing workers.
17/01/2022.author: Alexandra Humphries

17/01/2022.headline: More than 100 aged care facilities currently battling COVID outbreaks in SA
17/01/2022.description: Aged care workers who are considered close contacts will be able to return to South Australian residential care homes earlier, under changes to be announced by the state government.
17/01/2022.author: Rebecca Puddy

17/01/2022.headline: No new COVID cases in WA, but doctors warn stricter restrictions needed to tackle Omicron
17/01/2022.description: The Australian Medical Association calls for coronavirus restrictions to be ramped up amid the apparent spread of the Omicron variant, as the government announces no new cases but says it suspects more are in the community.
17/01/2022.author: James Carmody and Cason Ho

17/01/2022.headline: A-League Women's Wrap round 7: back-up plans kick in as a youngster shoots her shot
17/01/2022.description: How have clubs handled the loss of their biggest stars? Will Victory continue playing whack-a-mole? And what's happened to Canberra United? Samantha Lewis wraps up round 7 of the A-League Women's competition.
17/01/2022.author: Samantha Lewis

17/01/2022.headline: Stunning skies and a golden orb light up Queensland after Tongan volcano
17/01/2022.description: The colourful and constantly changing sky over Queensland had many people reaching for their cameras this morning.
17/01/2022.author: Melissa Maddison

17/01/2022.headline: Paine 'deserved Ashes send-off', angry brother says post-Ashes victory
17/01/2022.description: The brother of former Australian cricket captain Tim Paine lashes cricket officials over their handling of the Tasmanian's treatment following the texting affair, saying he deserved a home town Ashes send-off against England in Hobart.
17/01/2022.author: Will Murray

17/01/2022.headline: A woman in her 50s dies with COVID-19, as the ACT records 1,601 new cases
17/01/2022.description: A woman in her 50s dies with COVID-19 in Canberra Hospital as the territory records 1,601 new cases.
17/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

17/01/2022.headline: 'Beyond outrageous': Rapid COVID test price gougers referred to police
17/01/2022.description: The ACCC refers evidence of significant price hikes on COVID-19 rapid antigen tests to the Australian Federal Police — with some reports claiming kits are selling for up to $70 each.
17/01/2022.author: Sarah Hawke

17/01/2022.headline: No COVID-19 deaths in SA as Premier touts infection 'peak'
17/01/2022.description: South Australia records no new COVID-19-related deaths yesterday, but the number of people being treated in hospital rises to 227.
17/01/2022.author: Leah MacLennan and Rebecca Opie

17/01/2022.headline: East Arnhem Land communities sent into lockdown as NT records 284 new COVID-19 cases
17/01/2022.description: Elcho Island is sent into a seven-day lockdown while Yirrkala has been locked down for 72 hours after a spate of local cases. There are now 39 people in hospital with the virus, including one in ICU.
17/01/2022.author: Steve Vivian

17/01/2022.headline: Osaka, Nadal post wins as Aus Open focus begins shift to on-court action following Djokovic saga
17/01/2022.description: As reaction to Novak Djokovic's deportation continues to dominate headlines, the Australian Open gets underway at Melbourne Park, with Naomi Osaka and Rafael Nadal among the first-round winners.
17/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

17/01/2022.headline: Woolworths suspends meat supply from SA abattoir over COVID safety concerns
17/01/2022.description: Woolworths suspends the sale of meat processed through an SA abattoir where asymptomatic COVID-positive employees were instructed to keep working.
17/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

17/01/2022.headline: Homicide detectives called in as search for missing 9yo girl in Blue Mountains enters fourth day
17/01/2022.description: The mother of missing girl Charlise Mutten is expected to be interviewed by police today as homicide detectives join an extensive search for the nine-year-old in the Blue Mountains.
17/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao and Mark Reddie

17/01/2022.headline: PM leaves door open for Djokovic to return sooner than three-year ban window
17/01/2022.description: While Scott Morrison did not provide any assurances, he noted there was a possibility the tennis star could return sooner "under the right circumstances".
17/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao and Mark Reddie

17/01/2022.headline: Queensland authorities make booster shot plea after seven elderly people die of COVID
17/01/2022.description: The deaths of seven people in their 80s and 90s who were yet to receive a COVID-19 vaccine booster shot prompts a plea from Health Minister Yvette D'Ath for people to get a third dose as soon as possible, as the state confirms 15,122 new cases.
17/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao and Mark Reddie

17/01/2022.headline: Home buyers under flight path should be restricted from making noise complaints, airport says
17/01/2022.description: A planned 855-home development in Brisbane's east falls under the airport's flight paths, prompting concerns from Brisbane Airport about future impacts on plane departures and arrivals.
17/01/2022.author: Lucy Stone

17/01/2022.headline: Australia's collective life expectancy rose in 2020, and researchers say we have lockdowns to thank
17/01/2022.description: The life expectancy of Australians has increased since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, new research from the Australian National University reveals.
17/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

17/01/2022.headline: Pandemic Leave Disaster Payment: Who wants it, how long are they waiting, who is eligible?
17/01/2022.description: Daisy got COVID in early January but it took her 12 days to get government financial relief.
17/01/2022.author: Georgia Roberts

17/01/2022.headline: Manhunt underway after shooting death in Hobart's north
17/01/2022.description: Tasmanian Police are searching for a gunman after a man was shot dead in Hobart's north.
17/01/2022.author: Georgia Roberts

17/01/2022.headline: GPs struggle to deliver COVID-19 booster shots due to 'inconsistent' vaccine supply
17/01/2022.description: On the same day Queensland health authorities have pleaded with people to get booster doses, a prominent Brisbane GP says she has been forced to cancel COVID-19 vaccine appointments because supplies of shots have not arrived.
17/01/2022.author: Baz Ruddick and Lexy Hamilton-Smith

17/01/2022.headline: Tonga's only undersea communication cable could be down for weeks
17/01/2022.description: Tonga's internet could be down for more than two weeks after a violent volcanic eruption cut the kingdom's only undersea communications cable, isolating the country from contact with the outside world.
17/01/2022.author: Tahlea Aualiitia and Edwina Seselja

17/01/2022.headline: The BBC is facing its biggest funding threat yet — and there are parallels to the ABC
17/01/2022.description: As its centenary approaches, the BBC is facing sweeping cuts to its programming — and it could have profound effects on fledgling democracies around the world.
17/01/2022.author: Tahlea Aualiitia and Edwina Seselja

17/01/2022.headline: Vote on your favourite Women's Ashes moment of all time
17/01/2022.description: The Ashes is one of the most storied rivalries in sport, with countless memorable moments from across the decades. What's your favourite from the Women's Ashes?
17/01/2022.author: Johanna McDiarmid, Brittany Carter, and Amanda Shalala

17/01/2022.headline: Childcare centres say they need free rapid antigen tests, more support
17/01/2022.description: The managing director of five early learning centres in Bendigo says access to rapid antigen tests would help keep childcare centres open.
17/01/2022.author: Shannon Schubert

17/01/2022.headline: Watch this space: Farms waiting to see if Elon Musk's Starlink is an internet game changer
17/01/2022.description: Regional and rural residents pin their hopes on SpaceX's constellation of satellites to improve connectivity.
17/01/2022.author: Danielle O'Neal

17/01/2022.headline: Twenty-two dead, hundreds homeless after earthquake hits Afghanistan
17/01/2022.description: Hundreds of houses are left badly damaged after an earthquake hits western Afghanistan, leaving at least 22 people dead and fears the death toll could rise.
17/01/2022.author: Danielle O'Neal

17/01/2022.headline: Carolyn's chronic pain was '90 per cent gone'. A police raid may change that
17/01/2022.description: Tasmania Police have confiscated medication, computers and medical records at Mt Nelson Medical Centre, leaving general practitioner Clive Stack unable to contact his patients, many of whom are vulnerable.
17/01/2022.author: Emily Baker

17/01/2022.headline: With Omicron rapidly spreading, bulk-buying is back, but this time it's different
17/01/2022.description: Disruptions at various points of the supply chain and staff shortages means goods like toilet paper are in low supply on supermarket shelves. But is panic buying also part of the problem?
17/01/2022.author: Belinda Smith

17/01/2022.headline: Fairytale melodrama, bad wigs and a gothic heroine: The shifting story of Princess Diana on screen
17/01/2022.description: A long string of actresses, with replicas of the outfits she wore in (sometimes questionable) fluffed wigs, have charted the "greatest hits" of Diana's royal life. Now Kristen Stewart joins their ranks, writes Giselle Bastin.
17/01/2022.author: Belinda Smith

17/01/2022.headline: British woman confirmed as first known casualty in Tonga
17/01/2022.description: The brother of UK woman Angela Glover confirms her body has been found after she was swept away in the tsunami caused by the eruption of the Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volca
17/01/2022.author: Belinda Smith

17/01/2022.headline: Exercising after COVID-19 can be a struggle. Here's what the experts do and don't recommend
17/01/2022.description: Physical activity post-COVID-19 feels easy for some but can be exhausting and defeating for others. Here's how the experts recommend you rebuild your fitness and how to know if you're pushing your body too hard as it recovers.
17/01/2022.author: Paige Cockburn

17/01/2022.headline: George Orwell took pleasure in roses and a good cup of tea. Rebecca Solnit says we should take his lead
17/01/2022.description: It turns out that George Orwell, the English author of 1984, thought to be stern and practical, planted lots of roses. Learning why offers us a valuable lesson in happiness.
17/01/2022.author: Anna Kelsey-Sugg and Julie Street

17/01/2022.headline: Can you catch COVID twice? Or does it give you greater immunity?
17/01/2022.description: Omicron forced us to confront the reality that recovering from COVID-19 doesn’t mean lifelong immunity to the disease. But there is some good news for people who have recently had the virus.
17/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

17/01/2022.headline: French Open doubts for Novak Djokovic as he arrives home in Serbia
17/01/2022.description: Novak Djokovic arrives home in Serbia to be greeted by fans, hordes of international media, and warnings from France about his participation in the French Open.
17/01/2022.author: Isabella Higgins

17/01/2022.headline: Three killed in suspected Abu Dhabi drone attack, as Yemen Houthis claim responsibility
17/01/2022.description: Police in the United Arab Emirates identified the dead as two Indian nationals and one Pakistani.
17/01/2022.author: Isabella Higgins

17/01/2022.headline: Fears Australian writer Yang Hengjun could die in Chinese prison as medical condition worsens
17/01/2022.description: Friends of an Australian writer detained by China on suspicion of spying fear his deteriorating health could see him eventually die behind bars.
17/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

17/01/2022.headline: Millman through to second round at Melbourne Park in front of 'rowdy' crowd
17/01/2022.description: In front of a boisterous home crowd, John Millman produces a committed performance to beat veteran Spaniard Feliciano Lopez in four sets.
17/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

17/01/2022.headline: Russia demands Facebook unblock page linked to foreign ministry
17/01/2022.description: The Facebook page, which is affiliated to Russia's foreign ministry, was taken down on Friday for publishing "illegal content".
17/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

17/01/2022.headline: Ukraine's former president returns home to face treason charges
17/01/2022.description: Former president Petro Poroshenko is accused of being involved in the sale of large amounts of coal that helped finance Russian-backed separatists in eastern Ukraine in 2014-15 — allegations he says are politically motivated.
17/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

17/01/2022.headline: Tongan volcano's ash cloud went into stratosphere, powerful eruption felt around world
17/01/2022.description: While authorities are still working to fully assess the damage from the eruption of the Hunga Tonga Hunga Ha'apai volcano, it seems many places that felt its effects have been spared widespread damage.
17/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

18/01/2022.headline: Dog and cat refuges to be severely stretched by COVID fallout when WA finally reopens
18/01/2022.description: Volunteer organisations expect to be seriously tested by COVID-19 outbreaks forcing staff into isolation once WA's border reopens on February 5.
18/01/2022.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

18/01/2022.headline: Maddison Inglis goes from cheering for Leylah Fernandez to defeating her at the Australian Open
18/01/2022.description: Just last September, Maddison Inglis was supporting Leylah Fernandez from the stands during the latter's run to the US Open final. Now, she has ended the Canadian's Melbourne Park campaign in the first round.
18/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

18/01/2022.headline: Tongans told to stay indoors to avoid inhaling volcanic ash that may devastate their environment for years, say scientists
18/01/2022.description: Two people are dead and Tonga's government is advising the public to remain indoors after the eruption of the Hunga Tonga Hunga Ha'apai volcano, the World Health Organization says.
18/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

18/01/2022.headline: Political commentator Dean Jaensch remembered as 'shining star' after death at 85
18/01/2022.description: Tributes are being paid to the man remembered for bringing both "wit and wisdom" to political education and electoral analysis in South Australia.
18/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

18/01/2022.headline: 'Bang and they were gone': Tongan volcano eruption cuts short family's video call
18/01/2022.description: As Luluwai Wallace Hunter waits to hear from family in Tonga, she says she'll never forget the "thundering noise" of the volcanic eruption that cut short a video call with them.
18/01/2022.author: Jade Toomey

18/01/2022.headline: Face masks can make you more attractive — especially the surgical variety, study finds
18/01/2022.description: Researchers suggest that the pandemic may be changing our perception of mask-wearers, after finding women perceived men wearing surgical masks to be the most attractive.
18/01/2022.author: Annika Burgess

18/01/2022.headline: Private hospitals on standby to take public patients to ease pressure on health system
18/01/2022.description: Private hospitals remain on standby to take public patients, with a federal government agreement to help ease the pressure on the health system from the COVID-19 outbreaks still in place.
18/01/2022.author: Annika Burgess

18/01/2022.headline: Police drop charges against driver accused of ramming cyclists at North Haven
18/01/2022.description: A man accused of forcing cyclists off the road in Adelaide's north-west last year — including in an incident caught on camera — has had charges against him dropped, with no explanation offered to the court.
18/01/2022.author: Gabriella Marchant

18/01/2022.headline: Indigenous people at risk of missing out on crucial COVID treatment, peak health body says
18/01/2022.description: A health expert has warned that Indigenous people with COVID-19 may not get the treatment they need, as reporting systems struggle to keep up with soaring case numbers.
18/01/2022.author: Ella Archibald-Binge

18/01/2022.headline: The Loop: Pharmacy Guild launching RAT site, 'moronic' COVID-19 test fraud, Victoria's Code Brown
18/01/2022.description: Catch up with The Loop, a quick wrap-up of today's news.
18/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

18/01/2022.headline: Undercooked Kvitova out of Australian Open after 'painful' defeat, Medvedev moves into second round
18/01/2022.description: Two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova exits the Australian Open in the opening round, but last year's men's runner-up Daniil Medvedev cruises through to the next stage.
18/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

18/01/2022.headline: COVID-19 outbreaks may hit half of all aged care homes by end of week, peak body says
18/01/2022.description: There is now a risk that over half of all the aged care homes in Australia could have outbreaks of COVID-19 by the end of the week, according to the peak body that represents Australia's aged care providers.
18/01/2022.author: Annie Guest

18/01/2022.headline: Mooney injured as shock Perry call looms for women's Ashes
18/01/2022.description: Australia's best T20 batter, Beth Mooney, has broken her jaw on the eve of the Ashes, while selectors are considering leaving Ellyse Perry out of the T20 series.
18/01/2022.author: Annie Guest

18/01/2022.headline: Ex-bikie trafficked drugs before Gold Coast murder, alleged killer's lawyer claims
18/01/2022.description: The lawyer for one of the three men charged over the deaths of Shane Ross and Cameron Martin tells a court Mr Ross was moving "significant" quantities of drugs before he died.
18/01/2022.author: Alexandria Utting

18/01/2022.headline: Two new West Australian COVID-19 cases linked to massage parlours, as Skyworks vaccination checks announced
18/01/2022.description: Western Australia records two more COVID-19 cases linked to a worsening cluster involving the Omicron variant and massage parlours, as random proof-of-vaccination checks are announced for Perth's Australia Day Skyworks.
18/01/2022.author: James Carmody

18/01/2022.headline: SA government rejects school term delay as state records two COVID deaths
18/01/2022.description: South Australia records another 3,079 COVID-19 cases and two deaths, but the state government says it will not agree to a union push to delay the start of the school year by a fortnight.
18/01/2022.author: Rebecca Opie

18/01/2022.headline: 'Single source of truth' website to find rapid antigen tests to go live next week
18/01/2022.description: The Pharmacy Guild of Australia will launch its own website to help consumers find rapid antigen tests, as demand outstrips supply and prices at some retailers soar.
18/01/2022.author: Bern Young, Dominic Cansdale, and Nicole Dyer

18/01/2022.headline: NT records 625 COVID cases, a record total, with 43 people in hospital
18/01/2022.description: The Northern Territory has recorded more than 600 new COVID-19 cases for the first time. There are now 43 people in hospital with the virus, a jump on 39 yesterday.
18/01/2022.author: Steve Vivian

18/01/2022.headline: What happens next depends on the Tonga volcano's magma chamber. Here's what we know
18/01/2022.description: The volcanic eruption in Tonga on Saturday was massive. Here's what we know about why it was so big, whether it's going to erupt again soon, and if there are others we should be keeping an eye on.
18/01/2022.author: Nick Kilvert

18/01/2022.headline: Aussie wildcard beats US Open finalist Fernandez in major upset
18/01/2022.description: Ranked 133 in the world, Maddison Inglis causes a massive boilover by beating rising star Leylah Fernandez in straight sets in the first round of the Australian Open.
18/01/2022.author: Nick Kilvert

18/01/2022.headline: Stosur not done yet after completing epic comeback victory at Australian Open
18/01/2022.description: Sam Stosur extends her outstanding singles career by one more match after launching an inspired fightback to beat Robin Anderson in three sets at Melbourne Park.
18/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

18/01/2022.headline: Clinic claims it had to find a refrigeration truck to pick up child vaccines
18/01/2022.description: Doctors at a regional SA clinic say they were forced to source their own refrigerated trucks to collect much needed COVID-19 paediatric vaccines from the nearest pick-up site five hours way.
18/01/2022.author: Selina Green

18/01/2022.headline: Tornado victim's family sues Amazon over warehouse collapse
18/01/2022.description: Amazon is accused of failing to warn employees of dangerous weather or provide safe shelter before a tornado slammed its central Illinois facility in December, killing six people.
18/01/2022.author: Selina Green

18/01/2022.headline: Fog, rain and COVID outbreak hamper search for missing schoolgirl Charlise Mutten
18/01/2022.description: Crews scouring the Blue Mountains for missing nine-year-old Charlise Mutten battle rain and fog, while their numbers are reduced due to a COVID-19 outbreak.
18/01/2022.author: Phoebe Bowden and Mark Reddie

18/01/2022.headline: Australia's RAT issues may worsen as China's Lunar New Year holiday looms
18/01/2022.description: Some logistics companies will temporarily close for the Lunar New Year holiday on February 1, but many manufacturers vow to work through to meet demand.
18/01/2022.author: Dong Xing and Erin Handley

18/01/2022.headline: A doctor shortage is forcing medical clinics to consider closing in some of Melbourne's fastest-growing areas
18/01/2022.description: John Chung's former clinic was so desperate for doctors, he came out of retirement at 75 to serve his community in Melbourne's outer suburbs. The medical clinic's struggle to attract suitable staff represents a broader pattern.
18/01/2022.author: Jordan Fennell

18/01/2022.headline: There's no Victorian lockdown, but Melburnians are choosing to stay home anyway
18/01/2022.description: As a wave of Omicron infections wreaks havoc across workplaces and the healthcare system, the data suggests many Victorians are voting with their feet and staying close to home.
18/01/2022.author: Joseph Dunstan

18/01/2022.headline: Blood donation rules set to change to speed up post-COVID donations
18/01/2022.description: Facing blood shortages, the Red Cross is changing the rules about how quickly you can donate after having COVID-19.
18/01/2022.author: Alexia Attwood and Stephanie Borys

18/01/2022.headline: Olympics boss John Coates urged to raise plight of jailed Australians during Beijing Winter Olympics visit
18/01/2022.description: Human rights advocates demand senior Olympics official John Coates raise the plight of fellow Australians jailed in China when he travels to Beijing later this month for the Winter Games.
18/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

18/01/2022.headline: 'It's so worrying': Tongans in Australia anxiously await news from loved ones after volcanic eruption
18/01/2022.description: Mele Ngauamo is waiting to hear news from her two sisters and brother in Tonga. She last heard from them on Saturday as they were moving to higher ground.
18/01/2022.author: Peter McCutcheon, Laura Francis, and Michael Atkin

18/01/2022.headline: How 15 minutes of your time could lead to 'significant' electricity bill savings
18/01/2022.description: The price of electricity is the cheapest it has been in almost a decade, and average annual household bills are going down. But a new analysis shows many consumers could be paying even less. Here's how.
18/01/2022.author: Amy Bainbridge

18/01/2022.headline: Kristen Stewart stars as 'People's Princess' Diana in portrait of mental and marital breakdown
18/01/2022.description: Repressed emotions and family secrets fester as the actor’s Princess of Wales struggles against the expectations of royal duty in the sinister new movie Spencer from Jackie director Pablo Larraín.
18/01/2022.author: Luke Goodsell

18/01/2022.headline: Tasmania's COVID-19 cases are going down, so has the outbreak reached its peak?
18/01/2022.description: Tasmanians might be wondering whether they're on the cusp of seeing the Omicron wave begin to wane. Unfortunately it might not be that simple, experts say.
18/01/2022.author: Alexandra Alvaro

18/01/2022.headline: A booster will ramp up your protection against Omicron. So which one should you get?
18/01/2022.description: For many Australians, it’s now time for a COVID booster – but which one should you be getting? Read our handy guide to find out.
18/01/2022.author: Olivia Willis

18/01/2022.headline: This was the week that saw COVID-19 cases triple in NSW
18/01/2022.description: New South Wales COVID-19 case numbers tripled between Christmas and New Year’s Day, with infections most rampant in some of the state’s wealthiest areas, new data shows.
18/01/2022.author: Catherine Hanrahan

18/01/2022.headline: Sick of work? Here's five tips for turning your hobby into a career
18/01/2022.description: It's becoming more possible to turn a hobby, passion or side hustle into a job. But the transition can be risky.
18/01/2022.author: Nick Baker

18/01/2022.headline: 'Nowhere is safe': At least eight Australian residents allegedly forced to return to China since 2014
18/01/2022.description: A human rights watchdog says thousands of people including government critics have been forcibly returned to China under the guise of anti-corruption efforts. It says some were even kidnapped.
18/01/2022.author: Max Walden

18/01/2022.headline: Shoppers are having a crisis of confidence as Omicron fears bite
18/01/2022.description: Our fears and anxieties have been captured in some recent bank data — data which points to something of a big risk for the economy, writes David Taylor.
18/01/2022.author: David Taylor

18/01/2022.headline: Emirates suspends flights to US destinations after major airlines warn about 5G. Could this happen in Australia?
18/01/2022.description: Airlines in the United States fear the rollout of 5G this week could ground planes and cause huge disruptions, and Emirates is suspending services. So why aren't Australian airports affected?
18/01/2022.author: James Purtill

18/01/2022.headline: Nuclear subs and military cooperation to dominate Australia–UK talks this week
18/01/2022.description: The British foreign and defence secretaries are due to arrive in Sydney ahead of formal talks with Marise Payne and Peter Dutton.
18/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

18/01/2022.headline: Raducanu survives Stephens test on Australian Open debut, Tsitsipas advances
18/01/2022.description: US Open champion Emma Raducanu needs three sets to get past Sloane Stephens, as 2021 men's semi-finalist Stefanos Tsitsipas also progresses in Melbourne.
18/01/2022.author: Andrew Greene

18/01/2022.headline: 'Unprecedented disaster': Tongan government issue statement as death toll rises
18/01/2022.description: The death toll of the volcanic eruption in Tonga has risen to three people as authorities work to restore order in the island nation.
18/01/2022.author: Caitlyn Davey

18/01/2022.headline: Saudi-led strike on Yemen kills 20, including civilians and Houthi official
18/01/2022.description: A retaliatory strike by Saudi Arabia and the UAE against Yemen's Houthi rebels in the capital of Sana'a kills 20 including some civilians.
18/01/2022.author: Caitlyn Davey

18/01/2022.headline: China tells Australia to stop interfering on behalf of detained writer
18/01/2022.description: China's foreign ministry spokesman says Australia is trying to interfere with its "judicial sovereignty" after Foreign Affairs Minister Marise Payne called for the immediate release of the writer Yang Hengjun.
18/01/2022.author: Michael Doyle

18/01/2022.headline: Kyrgios details COVID battle after romping to first round victory at Melbourne Park
18/01/2022.description: Nick Kyrgios shows few ill effects from recently testing positive to COVID-19, as he books a match-up with world number two Daniil Medvedev at Melbourne Park, while Alex de Minaur also moves through to the second round.
18/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

18/01/2022.headline: PM forced to reprimand George Christensen over 'dangerous' anti-vaccination comments
18/01/2022.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison releases a statement saying he "strongly disagrees" with the Dawson MP's comments urging parents not to vaccinate their children, saying people should disregard Mr Christensen's "dangerous messages in relation to vaccines".
18/01/2022.author: Matthew Doran

18/01/2022.headline: Halting IVF treatments will snatch 'only opportunity to have a child', woman says
18/01/2022.description: At age 45, Melanie Swieconek knows her chances of having a child are slim. She has pinned her final hopes on IVF. But COVID-19 may derail that.
18/01/2022.author: Kristian Silva

18/01/2022.headline: Betty White remembered on her 100th birthday
18/01/2022.description: Tributes continue for Betty White, on what would have been the star's 100th birthday on Tuesday.
18/01/2022.author: Caitlyn Davey

18/01/2022.headline: Andy Murray prevails in marathon five-setter in Melbourne
18/01/2022.description: The five-time Melbourne Park finalist shows his fighting qualities to oust 21st seed Nikoloz Basilashvili and move into the Australian Open second round.
18/01/2022.author: Caitlyn Davey

19/01/2022.headline: Former teacher charged with sexually abusing students granted bail
19/01/2022.description: Brian Napper is facing 13 charges over the alleged sexual abuse of two boys in the 1980s.
19/01/2022.author: Tim Swanston

19/01/2022.headline: George Christensen steps down from parliamentary role after 'dangerous' vaccine comments
19/01/2022.description: Rogue Coalition backbencher George Christensen will quit his lucrative position as the chair of a parliamentary committee, after coming under renewed criticism for his anti-vaccination rhetoric.
19/01/2022.author: Matthew Doran

19/01/2022.headline: The Loop: Man charged with girl's murder, COVID booster changes, Australian Open competitor shocked by rowdy crowd
19/01/2022.description: You're reading The Loop, a quick wrap-up of today's news.
19/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

19/01/2022.headline: Country's biggest backhoe arrives to tackle Townsville's port expansion
19/01/2022.description: The Woomera arrives in Townsville marking the beginning of a two-year dredging phase as part of a project to widen the port's shipping channel.
19/01/2022.author: Jade Toomey

19/01/2022.headline: Why Harmony Tan left the Australian Open in a wheelchair
19/01/2022.description: Harmony Tan's Australian Open campaign has come to a heartbreaking end, with the French player taken from the court in a wheelchair.
19/01/2022.author: Jade Toomey

19/01/2022.headline: 'I believe in science': Two-time Australian Open champion backs vaccine mandate in tennis
19/01/2022.description: With the issue of player vaccination firmly in the spotlight following Novak Djokvovic's deportation from Australia, Victoria Azarenka says she would support the introduction of a mandate in tennis.
19/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

19/01/2022.headline: 'Complex' projects will soon need approval from a third-party engineer
19/01/2022.description: Three years after nine Top End buildings were found to be structurally non-compliant, the Northern Territory government has introduced reforms to avoid a similar building bungle happening again.
19/01/2022.author: Melissa Mackay
