19/01/2022.headline: Rudy Giuliani subpoenaed as part of US Capitol riot investigation
19/01/2022.description: Prominent Donald Trump ally Rudy Giuliani, along with three other members of the former president's legal team, is subpoenaed by the congressional committee investigating the Capitol riot.
19/01/2022.author: Melissa Mackay

19/01/2022.headline: Silly mistakes to blame for Australia's Quad Series draw with England
19/01/2022.description: Fans have been treated to a preview of what's to come in Thursday's Quad Series final during a fierce battle between Australia and England that ended in a 48-all draw.
19/01/2022.author: Brittany Carter

19/01/2022.headline: How to cope well — and what to avoid — if you're isolating at home with COVID
19/01/2022.description: For many of us, catching COVID can be a lonely, scary and distressing experience. Here are some strategies to help you look after your mental health if you get the virus and have to isolate at home, writes Lousie Stone.
19/01/2022.author: Brittany Carter

19/01/2022.headline: What are the symptoms of COVID-19 and when should you seek medical attention?
19/01/2022.description: Health authorities say for most people who are vaccinated against COVID-19, it is a mild illness that can be managed at home and that only people with severe symptoms should call triple-0 or go to hospital.
19/01/2022.author: Brittany Carter

19/01/2022.headline: Still can't find chicken in your supermarket? Here's why
19/01/2022.description: Despite assurances from chicken producers that supplies would remain available at major supermarkets, empty shelves in the poultry section are proving otherwise.
19/01/2022.author: Jane McNaughton

19/01/2022.headline: The isolation period for COVID-positive cases could soon be just five days. It's even shorter elsewhere
19/01/2022.description: With cases continuing to climb around the country, authorities are considering cutting the mandatory isolation for people with COVID-19. Here's what you need to know.
19/01/2022.author: Tom Lowrey

19/01/2022.headline: COVID scare at Perth hospital as one of two new local WA cases attends emergency department
19/01/2022.description: WA records two new local COVID-19 cases, with one attending Fiona Stanley Hospital's emergency department and forcing workers to isolate, as the AMA questions if the Chief Health Officer is being "gagged".
19/01/2022.author: James Carmody

19/01/2022.headline: Will George Christensen's latest controversy hurt the LNP at the polls?
19/01/2022.description: As his retirement looms, George Christensen has again drawn fire over his stance on vaccines.
19/01/2022.author: Tobi Loftus

19/01/2022.headline: Air purifiers, masks rollout for Tasmanian schools, as Premier defends Education Minister's holiday
19/01/2022.description: Tasmanian students aged 12 years and over will have to wear surgical masks and classrooms will be equipped with air purifiers when school goes back next month, the ABC can reveal.
19/01/2022.author: Tobi Loftus

19/01/2022.headline: Extra police, specialist health team flown to remote Aboriginal community in lockdown
19/01/2022.description: As the remote Aboriginal community of Galiwin'ku experiences its second full day in lockdown, the Northern Territory government is flying in a specialist rapid response team in from Darwin to help stem spread of COVID-19.
19/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts

19/01/2022.headline: Changes to Victoria's Federation University amid drop in forecast enrolments
19/01/2022.description: Federation University announces major changes to its regional campuses in Ballarat, Ararat and the Wimmera in a bid to secure its future as student numbers tipped to fall.
19/01/2022.author: Rhiannon Stevens

19/01/2022.headline: 'Community is in deep distress': Bushfire recovery photographic exhibition brings back memories
19/01/2022.description: Harrowing and heartwarming photographs from the 2019/2020 Upper Murray Black Summer fires are on display in a bushfire recovery photographic exhibition.
19/01/2022.author: Shannon Corvo and Sally Bryant

19/01/2022.headline: Speculation mounts regional Victoria could host 2026 Commonwealth Games
19/01/2022.description: Two decades after the last Melbourne Commonwealth Games, Victoria is emerging as a frontrunner to host the 2026 event.
19/01/2022.author: Dana Morse, Kimberley Price, and Charmayne Allison

19/01/2022.headline: Murdered ex-bikie's 'dodgy criminal front' menaced by gunmen, Gold Coast court hears
19/01/2022.description: Ex-bikie Shane Ross was struggling for money and had 10 luxury cars stolen from his business before his death, a court has heard.
19/01/2022.author: Alexandria Utting

19/01/2022.headline: Outback artist fashions metal marvels from scrap material
19/01/2022.description: A travelling cattle musterer has transformed bits of junk into stunning metal artworks that pay tribute to a celebrated Aussie lifestyle.
19/01/2022.author: Alexandra Treloar

19/01/2022.headline: The changing face of triple j's Hottest 100
19/01/2022.description: The national youth broadcaster's 29th countdown of the best songs of the year will once again show just how far the poll has come over the years.
19/01/2022.author: Matt Neal

19/01/2022.headline: Red dirt is set to darken as the BOM forecasts a desert deluge
19/01/2022.description: Tropical moisture is spreading all the way down into South Australia while the west swelters through a severe heatwave.
19/01/2022.author: Kate Doyle

19/01/2022.headline: Posh, privileged and privately educated: England grapples with the source of its poor Ashes performance
19/01/2022.description: Research shows that a white and privately educated man is 34 times more likely to play professional cricket than a British Asian and state-educated man. Is this why they lost the Ashes?
19/01/2022.author: Steve Cannane

19/01/2022.headline: Bradley Cooper and Cate Blanchett lead heavyweight cast in carnival noir Nightmare Alley
19/01/2022.description: Guillermo del Toro's latest doesn't live up to the spark and magic of his best work, despite serviceable performances from stars like Rooney Mara and Willem Dafoe.
19/01/2022.author: Keva York

19/01/2022.headline: Mangrove remediation could cost taxpayers millions, SA senator warns
19/01/2022.description: A South Australian senator says taxpayers could end up footing the bill to fix an environmental disaster caused by hypersalinity at a mangrove site north of Adelaide.
19/01/2022.author: Leah MacLennan

19/01/2022.headline: Essential workers can now be on the job despite COVID exposure. So what are the risks?
19/01/2022.description: A range of essential workers including truck drivers, childcare workers and cleaners are now being put to work despite being directly exposed to COVID. Businesses are welcoming the change, but legal experts say the situation is fraught.
19/01/2022.author: Emilia Terzon

19/01/2022.headline: Tonga worried that COVID is coming with international help following volcano disaster
19/01/2022.description: The head of the World Health Organization office in Tonga says the government is "very cautious" about letting in humanitarian support personnel due to the risk of COVID, given the island has so far avoided an outbreak.
19/01/2022.author: Tahlea Aualiitia and Toby Mann

19/01/2022.headline: Hoons blamed for destroying anti-roadkill system for Tasmanian devils
19/01/2022.description: A program aimed at reducing the number of Tasmanian devils killed on the road has suffered a major setback, with hoons flattening the road markers on which the early warning sensors were to be mounted.
19/01/2022.author: Rebecca Hewett and Monte Bovill

19/01/2022.headline: 'Who is magically going to appear?': Health workers given extra breaks, if they can take them
19/01/2022.description: Frustrated Tasmanian health workers say the department's new policy to give them "additional hydration breaks" demonstrates "a complete lack of understanding" of the workload they are under.
19/01/2022.author: Adam Langenberg

19/01/2022.headline: These next-gen face masks can detect air leaks — and even diagnose COVID
19/01/2022.description: The pandemic has seen a lot of changes, but one thing that's remained the same for the past two years is face mask technology: we're still using old designs. But that might be about to change.
19/01/2022.author: James Purtill

19/01/2022.headline: Vigil held at Charlise Mutten's school as murder probe continues in Sydney
19/01/2022.description: About 100 people gather to grieve at Charlise Mutten's primary school, near the NSW-Queensland border, as a murder investigation continues after the nine-year-old's body was found in a barrel earlier this week.
19/01/2022.author: Alison Xiao and Bruce Mackenzie

19/01/2022.headline: Planning underway for teacher shortages as national cabinet meets to finalise school plan
19/01/2022.description: National cabinet will meet today to finalise a COVID safety plan for schools, as corporate staff in the New South Wales education department are told they could be required to teach classes if there is a teacher shortage.
19/01/2022.author: Stephanie Borys

19/01/2022.headline: From 'Pot-gate' to 2024 rumours, Kamala Harris's first year as Vice-President has been uniquely tricky
19/01/2022.description: A year since she was sworn in as America's first female Vice-President, the shine has decidedly worn off as Kamala Harris contends with an exodus of top aides, a lack of progress and a series of missteps, writes Barbara Miller.
19/01/2022.author: Barbara Miller

19/01/2022.headline: Australia missed an important deadline today – and people are suffering for it
19/01/2022.description: In 2017, Australia made an international commitment to implement a comprehensive inspection system for all places of detention. Four years on, it has failed to do so, and this is simply not good enough, writes Lorraine Finlay.
19/01/2022.author: Barbara Miller

19/01/2022.headline: 'We're not getting tested': Zverev concerned more players could be COVID positive
19/01/2022.description: German star Alexander Zverev says he has placed himself in his own Australian Open bubble due to concerns about testing procedures and the number of players who could be infected.
19/01/2022.author: Barbara Miller

19/01/2022.headline: French actor Gaspard Ulliel dies after skiing accident in French Alps
19/01/2022.description: Award-winning French actor Gaspard Ulliel has died following a skiing accident in the French Alps. The accident took place within 50 kilometres of where F1 great Michael Schumacher crashed in 2013.
19/01/2022.author: Barbara Miller

19/01/2022.headline: 'In the name of God, go': Johnson's own MPs turn on him over lockdown parties
19/01/2022.description: Even as his former Brexit Minister tells him to resign and a Conservative MP defects to Labour, British PM Boris Johnson maintains he will fight any no confidence motion put forward.
19/01/2022.author: Barbara Miller

19/01/2022.headline: Belgian court jails human trafficking ringleader over Essex truck deaths
19/01/2022.description: The Vietnamese head of a human trafficking gang has been sentenced to 15 years in jail by a Belgian court on Wednesday for the manslaughter of 39 compatriots who suffocated in an airtight shipping container smuggled into Britain in 2019.
19/01/2022.author: Barbara Miller

19/01/2022.headline: Glenn Maxwell smashes unbeaten 154 off 64 balls to set new Big Bash record
19/01/2022.description: Glenn Maxwell thumps the highest score in BBL history, whacking an unbeaten 154 as the Melbourne Stars launched an all-out assault on the Hobart Hurricanes.
19/01/2022.author: Barbara Miller

19/01/2022.headline: Millman goes down fighting at Australian Open as Zverev reigns supreme
19/01/2022.description: Popular Australian John Millman produces a typically gutsy performance against Alexander Zverev, but he finds himself outclassed by the world number three in a straight-sets defeat.
19/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

19/01/2022.headline: Porter, lawyer ordered to pay more than $430,000 in legal costs
19/01/2022.description: The former attorney-general and his defamation barrister are ordered to cover the court costs of a friend of the woman who accused him of rape more than 30 years ago.
19/01/2022.author: Matthew Doran

19/01/2022.headline: Osaka goes about her business as Australian Open defence continues
19/01/2022.description: Two-time winner Naomi Osaka shows signs of her best form in a 6-0, 6-4 defeat of American Madison Brengle on Rod Laver Arena.
19/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

19/01/2022.headline: Indonesian militant with links to 2002 Bali bombings jailed for 15 years
19/01/2022.description: Zulkarnaen, a former Jemaah Islamiah military commander, is jailed for aiding and abetting terrorism. The sentencing does not directly relate to the 2002 attack, which killed 202 people.
19/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

19/01/2022.headline: Perth heatwave declared as firefighters contain Karrakatta cemetery bushfire
19/01/2022.description: The fire sent burning embers and smoke around homes in Perth's inner-western suburbs, as a heatwave is declared for multiple forecast days near or above 40 degrees.
19/01/2022.author: Gian De Poloni, James Carmody, and Abby Richards

19/01/2022.headline: Parents reject RAT suggestion for students returning to the classroom
19/01/2022.description: With national cabinet set to decide on a back-to-school plan, parents in New South Wales hope they reject the idea to rapid test students twice a week for COVID.
19/01/2022.author: Madeline Lewis

20/01/2022.headline: 'Breaks my heart': Massive damage bill from Old Parliament House protest fire
20/01/2022.description: The Canberra building's iconic entrance, where political history unfolded last century, may never be the same after last month's alleged arson attack.
20/01/2022.author: Markus Mannheim

20/01/2022.headline: PM's plan to put high schoolers in forklifts fails to get off the ground
20/01/2022.description: Scott Morrison quickly shelved his proposal to allow people younger than 18 to drive forklifts, but experts say it wouldn't have been the solution to the country's supply chain woes anyway.
20/01/2022.author: Angus Mackintosh

20/01/2022.headline: Live: Nick Kyrgios faces Daniil Medvedev in Australian Open blockbuster clash
20/01/2022.description: In what promises to be one of the matches of the tournament, Australia's Nick Kyrgios takes on the men's world number two, Russia's Daniil Medvedev, on Rod Laver Arena in the second round of the Australian Open. Follow our live blog.
20/01/2022.author: Michael Doyle and Luke Pentony

20/01/2022.headline: Man dies trying to rescue daughter at popular Adelaide beach
20/01/2022.description: The man could not be revived despite a brave bystander pulling the pair from the water and paramedics and members of the public performing CPR.
20/01/2022.author: Eric Tlozek

20/01/2022.headline: The Loop: Seven-day iso to stay, heartbreak for Charlise, Sam Stosur farewells singles career
20/01/2022.description: Get up to date with The Loop, a quick wrap-up of today's news.
20/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

20/01/2022.headline: Tasmanian schools are going back as planned — what does it mean for students and teachers?
20/01/2022.description: The Tasmanian government has released its COVID plan to get students back to school next month. Here's what parents, students and teachers need to know.
20/01/2022.author: Rebecca Hewett

20/01/2022.headline: Barnaby Joyce says 'adventurous spirit' will lure overseas workers to Australia, despite travel warnings
20/01/2022.description: The US and EU have placed significant travel warnings on Australia. But the Deputy PM says people's "adventurous spirit" will still bring them here.
20/01/2022.author: Charmayne Allison, Shannon Schubert, and Annie Brown

20/01/2022.headline: Stranger jailed for bashing elderly Perth retiree to death in 'rage' over his treatment of women
20/01/2022.description: Sebastian Ruiz is sentenced to more than 10 years behind bars for the manslaughter of 76-year-old Keith Moylan in his own unit, with the judge condemning it as a "cowardly" and "unjustified" attack".
20/01/2022.author: Joanna Menagh

20/01/2022.headline: Mortgage borrowers could face $100 monthly hit by year's end, based on new rate forecasts from Westpac
20/01/2022.description: Westpac is now expecting the Reserve Bank to start raising official interest rates as early as August, with a peak cash rate that could increase typical mortgage repayments by more than $400 a month.
20/01/2022.author: Michael Janda

20/01/2022.headline: No jail for 25yo involved in fatal botched kidnapping
20/01/2022.description: Bo Valli's car was used by three men who kidnapped and assaulted a 19-year-old in Central Victoria, but a judge found he played a lesser role in the deadly crime.
20/01/2022.author: Shannon Schubert

20/01/2022.headline: Federal Court releases reasons for Novak Djokovic visa decision
20/01/2022.description: The Federal Court releases the reasons why it upheld the federal government's decision to cancel the visa of tennis star Novak Djokovic, five days after he was deported from Australia.
20/01/2022.author: Amy Bainbridge and Kate Ashton

20/01/2022.headline: Australia's Sam Stosur finishes singles career a fighter to the end
20/01/2022.description: For a tennis player who has earned more than $27 million in prize money and won eight grand slam titles in singles and doubles, Sam Stosur has faced more than her share of criticism. Andrew McGarry looks back at her story as she ends her singles career.
20/01/2022.author: Andrew McGarry

20/01/2022.headline: Yirrkala exits lockdown as Territory's COVID-19 hospital cases rise to 54
20/01/2022.description: Yirrkala records four new COVID-19 cases but the lockdown in the community has ended on schedule as the Northern Territory records 459 new cases of the virus.
20/01/2022.author: Andrew McGarry

20/01/2022.headline: 'Extremely unfair' policy which saw Canberra nurses forced to take personal leave ahead of COVID leave overhauled
20/01/2022.description: The ACT government has overhauled a Canberra Health Services policy that required frontline health staff who contracted COVID-19 to use personal leave before they were able to access special leave.
20/01/2022.author: Harry Frost

20/01/2022.headline: Most of us are fully vaccinated but the TGA just approved a new vaccine — here's why
20/01/2022.description: You might be wondering, why do we need another vaccine at all when most of us are fully vaccinated and some have received a booster? Here's what you need to know.
20/01/2022.author: Harry Frost

20/01/2022.headline: Beth Mooney replacement chosen for women's Ashes opener
20/01/2022.description: Brisbane Heat star Grace Harris has been called into Australia's Ashes squad, while a middle-order squeeze could see Ellyse Perry left out.
20/01/2022.author: Harry Frost

20/01/2022.headline: There are fears Europe is the closest it has been to war in decades. What's causing the Russia-Ukraine crisis?
20/01/2022.description: As more than 100,000 Russian troops amass at the Ukranian border and diplomatic talks continue to fail, the West is on edge that Europe is teetering towards its first war in 30 years.
20/01/2022.author: Annika Burgess

20/01/2022.headline: Chris O'Connell scores monster Australian Open upset, Alex de Minaur cruises through
20/01/2022.description: Chris O'Connell, ranked 175th in the world, has pulled off a huge Australian Open upset with victory over 13th seed Diego Schwartzman while Alex de Minaur has cruised through the next round in comprehensive fashion
20/01/2022.author: Annika Burgess

20/01/2022.headline: WA records five new local COVID-19 cases, including one mystery infection
20/01/2022.description: Five new local COVID-19 cases are recorded in Western Australia, including one that is not linked to any known cases and was infectious in the community.
20/01/2022.author: Briana Shepherd and Keane Bourke

20/01/2022.headline: States to go their own ways on return-to-school rules, including COVID-19 testing
20/01/2022.description: There has been no agreement from national cabinet on how schools should reopen, and stay open, amid the continuing Omicron COVID-19 outbreak.
20/01/2022.author: Georgia Hitch

20/01/2022.headline: Striking sunsets as volcanic ash from Tonga hangs above WA, 7,000km away
20/01/2022.description: The ash cloud is expected to clear over the next few days. Authorities say it does not pose a health risk to the people of the Pilbara.
20/01/2022.author: Samantha Goerling

20/01/2022.headline: South Australia records its highest number of COVID-19 deaths
20/01/2022.description: Premier Steven Marshall says the "unusually large" number may be the result of late reporting of some deaths in aged care.
20/01/2022.author: Stacey Pestrin and Patrick Martin

20/01/2022.headline: Black mould '40,000 times greater than the international standard' found in home, as calls for national standard mount
20/01/2022.description: A family's "nightmare" run of illnesses linked to black mould are part of a wider problem that experts say is adding to fears for the vulnerable during the pandemic.
20/01/2022.author: Laura Mayers and Rosanne Maloney

20/01/2022.headline: Volunteer who searched for Charlise Mutten says 'things didn’t stack up' from the beginning
20/01/2022.description: For days Darren Rodrigo combed through dense bushland with the hope of finding nine-year-old Charlise Mutten but when her remains were discovered by police he was more distressed than he expected.
20/01/2022.author: Mark Reddie

20/01/2022.headline: 'They are lying': Government refers claims it redirected RAT supplies to watchdog
20/01/2022.description: The federal government has started reporting claims it diverted rapid antigen test supplies away from companies to its national stockpile to the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission, describing the accusations as "categorically untrue".
20/01/2022.author: Georgia Hitch

20/01/2022.headline: It's banned everywhere else in Australia, but in Canberra feral cats are being released back onto the streets
20/01/2022.description: A controversial method of managing feral cat populations is well underway in the ACT — despite being prohibited in every other Australian jurisdiction.
20/01/2022.author: Antoinette Radford

20/01/2022.headline: New exhibition showcases the breadth and talent of Australians in Hollywood and at home
20/01/2022.description: A new exhibition at the National Film and Sound Archive celebrates iconic cinematic moments and notable stars, while also delving into what it took to create many of our most-loved films.
20/01/2022.author: Niki Burnside

20/01/2022.headline: 'I don't fall into male or female': AFLW player Tori Groves-Little on coming out as non-binary
20/01/2022.description: Ahead of the AFLW's annual pride round, two players — Carlton's Darcy Vescio and Gold Coast Sun Tori Groves-Little — announce they identify as non-binary.
20/01/2022.author: Kate O'Halloran

20/01/2022.headline: Serbia backs out of controversial Rio Tinto lithium mine
20/01/2022.description: Serbia's prime minister abandons plans to build a controversial lithium mine after weeks of protests against the project set to be built by Anglo-Australian firm Rio Tinto.
20/01/2022.author: Kate O'Halloran

20/01/2022.headline: 'Everything just seemed to click': Meg Lanning on her 133 not out in 2019 at Chelmsford
20/01/2022.description: At a ground where England's women cricketers had never been beaten, Meg Lanning smashed 133 to help Australia to an unassailable lead in the 2019 Ashes. The Australian captain still ranks it as one of her most memorable moments.
20/01/2022.author: André Leslie

20/01/2022.headline: Everything you need to know about the triple j Hottest 100
20/01/2022.description: The Hottest Weekend starts today, ahead of the triple j Hottest 100 tomorrow and Double J's countdown on Sunday. Here's the nitty gritty.
20/01/2022.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

20/01/2022.headline: Kids who get COVID can develop a rare but dangerous complication weeks later. Here's how to spot it
20/01/2022.description: Weeks after recovering from COVID-19, a small number of children start coming down with a mysterious illness called MIS-C. As Omicron causes a surge in cases, parents are being encouraged to keep a lookout for symptoms.
20/01/2022.author: Jade Macmillan

20/01/2022.headline: 'It is a big deal': This new play brings a trans love story to the Australian main stage
20/01/2022.description: Two-time Griffin Award winner Glace Chase moved to New York and quit writing for theatre. She now returns to Australian stages with the intimate and revealing semi-autobiographical play Triple X.
20/01/2022.author: Hannah Story

20/01/2022.headline: How to reap the benefits of being in nature without having to set foot outside
20/01/2022.description: We know that contact with nature makes us feel better. But how does it do this, and does virtual contact have the same effect?
20/01/2022.author: Hannah Story

20/01/2022.headline: Ukraine asks Australia for more 'technical assistance' to combat increasing Russian cyber attacks
20/01/2022.description: Ukraine seeks support from allies as fears grow that Russian President Vladimir Putin is on the brink of launching a fresh military invasion.
20/01/2022.author: Hannah Story

20/01/2022.headline: Why well-intentioned donations may hamper aid efforts in Tonga and end up in landfill
20/01/2022.description: Generous and well-intentioned donations of food and other goods may hinder vital aid getting to people in need in Tonga, humanitarian organisations warn.
20/01/2022.author: Edwina Seselja

20/01/2022.headline: 'Low IQ': Medvedev takes aim at Australian Open crowd after defeating Kyrgios
20/01/2022.description: The atmosphere inside Rod Laver Arena for Nick Kyrgios's match with Daniil Medvedev was every bit as electric as the tennis they played but some of the crowd behaviour did not go over well with Russia's world number two player.
20/01/2022.author: Paul Johnson

20/01/2022.headline: Parents, union question Tasmania's back-to-school plan
20/01/2022.description: A parent of a medically compromised child has questioned the wisdom of sending him back to school next month without a mask and while only partially vaccinated.
20/01/2022.author: Adam Langenberg

20/01/2022.headline: How the COVID-19 pandemic created the 'perfect conditions' for an escalation in domestic violence
20/01/2022.description: Two thirds of victims of violence or abuse from their domestic partners reported an escalation of attacks — or were victimised for the first time — during COVID-19 lockdowns, says one of Australia's leading support groups.
20/01/2022.author: Adam Langenberg

20/01/2022.headline: 'My own language is not spoken by my community': The fight to save Indigenous languages
20/01/2022.description: There are more than 250 Indigenous languages in Australia but only about 12 are still spoken regularly across different generations within communities.
20/01/2022.author: Sophie Kesteven

20/01/2022.headline: Even in defeat to Daniil Medvedev, Nick Kyrgios served up box-office entertainment
20/01/2022.description: The Australian Open campaign of Nick Kyrgios ended with a four-set loss to Russia’s Daniil Medvedev, but there was not a dull moment in the Australian’s spirited display.
20/01/2022.author: Russell Jackson

20/01/2022.headline: Giant canyon discovered underneath Antarctic glacier, adding to history of rising sea levels
20/01/2022.description: Australian Antarctic expeditioners have discovered an enormous, two-kilometre-deep canyon underneath a glacier that may make it more vulnerable to warming oceans.
20/01/2022.author: Henry Belot

20/01/2022.headline: As Australia passes its COVID-19 Omicron peak, will the shortage of RATs turn into a glut?
20/01/2022.description: While rapid antigen tests (RATs)  have been very hard to come by since Christmas, there are some signs that the shortage may soon become a glut, as happened with other pandemic products such as hand sanitiser.
20/01/2022.author: Samuel Yang

20/01/2022.headline: A disrupted summer,  ministerial woes and a nation of grumpy voters: Morrison's testing time
20/01/2022.description: It sounded a touch desperate — Prime Minister Scott Morrison imploring backpackers to "come on down" to Australia, as the Omicron crisis escalated, writes Michelle Grattan.
20/01/2022.author: Michelle Grattan

20/01/2022.headline: Pope Benedict accused of failing to act in Munich Church sexual abuse report
20/01/2022.description: Pope Benedict XVI failed to take action against clerics in four cases of alleged sexual abuse in his archdiocese when he was Archbishop of Munich, a report found, compounding a scandal engulfing the Catholic Church.
20/01/2022.author: Michelle Grattan

20/01/2022.headline: Teenager becomes youngest woman to fly solo round the world
20/01/2022.description: Zara Rutherford says she feared for her life at times as at just 19 years old she becomes the youngest woman to fly solo around the globe.
20/01/2022.author: Michelle Grattan

20/01/2022.headline: Murray ponders his Australian Open future as Raducanu crashes out
20/01/2022.description: It was a disastrous night at the Australian Open for Britons, with Emma Raducanu losing in three sets and Andy Murray sent out of the tournament by a qualifier.
20/01/2022.author: Michelle Grattan

20/01/2022.headline: As the Omicron wave spreads, people desperate for treatment are falling through the cracks
20/01/2022.description: A man with large, unexplained cysts on his kidneys and a woman with melanoma are among those falling through the cracks as Victoria's health system strains under a large wave of COVID-19 cases.
20/01/2022.author: Sian Johnson

20/01/2022.headline: WA Premier Mark McGowan says reopening state's border now would be 'reckless and irresponsible'
20/01/2022.description: Premier Mark McGowan's decision to delay the WA border reopening has drawn mixed reactions, with businesses describing it as "devastating", while the AMA says it will give hospitals time to prepare for Omicron.
20/01/2022.author: James Carmody

20/01/2022.headline: Warning downgraded for SA forest fire
20/01/2022.description: A fire burning in South Australia's south-east is downgraded to advice level after earlier sparking an emergency warning.
20/01/2022.author: James Carmody

21/01/2022.headline: Report says government should help Afghans who assisted Australian military
21/01/2022.description: Every effort should be made to aid Australian employees who remain trapped in Afghanistan, while a full review should also be undertaken into the issues around their evacuation, a senate inquiry report finds.
21/01/2022.author: Rory Callinan

21/01/2022.headline: Relief and resentment as WA businesses digest border opening delay
21/01/2022.description: After two years of travel restrictions, there is strong resentment among some businesses that WA's borders will remain shut indefinitely, but others are welcoming the move to limit the spread of COVID-19.
21/01/2022.author: Gian De Poloni, James Carmody, Madison Snow, and Verity Gorman

21/01/2022.headline: Serbia's Kecmanović making the most of 'second chance' in Djokovic's absence
21/01/2022.description: Miomir Kecmanović — who was scheduled to play Novak Djokovic in the Australian Open first round — knows he is benefiting from the world number one's withdrawal.
21/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

21/01/2022.headline: Government to relax COVID testing rules for international travellers headed to Australia
21/01/2022.description: From this weekend, travellers will have the option of taking a rapid antigen test within 24 hours of departure rather than having a PCR test.
21/01/2022.author: Jane Norman

21/01/2022.headline: Mount Gambier couple jailed over depraved 'obsession' with child abuse material
21/01/2022.description: The District Court sentences a young man and woman from regional SA who collected thousands of files of child abuse material.
21/01/2022.author: Candice Prosser

21/01/2022.headline: Opals prepared for any Djokovic-inspired backlash during trip to Serbia
21/01/2022.description: The Opals aren't expecting any major issues during the upcoming trip to Serbia, but say the recent Novak Djokovic saga could inspire "the odd boo" from home fans.
21/01/2022.author: Tracey Holmes

21/01/2022.headline: The Loop: Swimming Australia's apology, reactions to WA backflip, Adele's residency delayed
21/01/2022.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
21/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

21/01/2022.headline: 'It's a black Thursday': 17 killed after explosion caused by truck and motorcycle crash in Ghana
21/01/2022.description: The blast left a huge crater and reduced dozens of buildings to dust-covered piles of wood and metal in Apiate.
21/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

21/01/2022.headline: Hong Kong warns people to stop trying to thwart COVID hamster cull
21/01/2022.description: Thousands of people have offered to adopt unwanted hamsters amid a public outcry against the government and its pandemic advisers who ordered the cull.
21/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

21/01/2022.headline: Melbourne stalwart Jesse Bromwich has signed with the Dolphins. Will he be their first captain?
21/01/2022.description: Almost 25 years ago, the Storm signed an ageing prop to lead their first-ever team. The Dolphins might be looking to do the same with Jesse Bromwich, writes Nick Campton.
21/01/2022.author: Kelsie Iorio

21/01/2022.headline: Closed borders unlikely to stop Omicron spreading in WA, expert says
21/01/2022.description: Epidemiologist Catherine Bennett says community cases already occurring in Perth might mean that the spread of the variant will determine when the state can reopen.
21/01/2022.author: Emma Wynne

21/01/2022.headline: Seven new local COVID cases recorded in WA, including four mystery infections
21/01/2022.description: Western Australia reports seven new local COVID-19 cases less than a day after the Premier delayed the state's border reopening indefinitely, with four of them not yet linked to existing cases.
21/01/2022.author: Briana Shepherd

21/01/2022.headline: 'Overwhelming' support for young livestock truckie who lost both legs after accident
21/01/2022.description: There has been a huge outpouring of support for young south-west Victorian truck driver Michelle Pillar, who lost both her legs after a horrific accident last week.
21/01/2022.author: Angus Verley

21/01/2022.headline: UK, Australia vow to step up defence cooperation amid rise of 'malign actors'
21/01/2022.description: The UK Defence Secretary says British defence assets may be based in Australia in the future as the nations increase their security cooperation.
21/01/2022.author: Stephen Dziedzic

21/01/2022.headline: Queensland tipped to have 'glut' of rapid antigen tests within weeks
21/01/2022.description: Two of Australia's biggest retail groups have flagged pressure on the supply of RATs will ease from next week.
21/01/2022.author: Stephanie Zillman

21/01/2022.headline: Nineteen-year-old pleads not guilty to murdering man in Canberra's city centre
21/01/2022.description: Kenan Dowden-Carlisle from Greenleigh pleads not guilty to murdering a man in broad daylight in Canberra's city centre last month.
21/01/2022.author: Tahlia Roy

21/01/2022.headline: 'Limited evidence' COVID vaccines change women's periods
21/01/2022.description: The national medical regulator says there is "limited evidence" menstrual problems increase after women have COVID-19 vaccines and there is no evidence vaccines affect fertility.
21/01/2022.author: Georgia Hitch

21/01/2022.headline: Life plans dashed and people left homeless as WA border change causes travel chaos
21/01/2022.description: Molly Richter was all set for her new life with her fiance in WA. The decision to delay WA's border reopening indefinitely has disrupted travel arrangements for thousands like her, but has also prompted support from others.
21/01/2022.author: Rebecca Trigger

21/01/2022.headline: Police officer charged with assault over Flinders Street Station arrest captured on video
21/01/2022.description: The senior constable faces charges including recklessly causing injury and unlawful assault over his role in the arrest that unfolded at a major Melbourne public transport hub.
21/01/2022.author: Rebecca Trigger

21/01/2022.headline: Here's the rules on who can leave and enter WA from February 5
21/01/2022.description: Premier Mark McGowan warns further restrictions will be considered as Western Australia reviews the impact on the Omicron COVID-19 variant in the eastern states.
21/01/2022.author: Sarah Motherwell

21/01/2022.headline: Girl, 8, fights off alleged attacker in front yard of home
21/01/2022.description: Northern Territory police are calling for information after an eight-year-old girl fought off an alleged attacker in her Darwin front yard.
21/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts

21/01/2022.headline: Man charged after four die in alleged failed attempt to cross US-Canada border
21/01/2022.description: A Florida man has been charged with human smuggling after the discovery of four bodies, including a baby and a teen, in Canada near the US border.
21/01/2022.author: Lauren Roberts

21/01/2022.headline: Ben Roberts-Smith loses court case against ex-wife by relying on 'possibilities and suspicions'
21/01/2022.description: A judge rules former Victoria Cross recipient Ben Roberts-Smith has no arguable case against his ex-wife as he relied on "ill-founded" assertions that she accessed his emails.
21/01/2022.author: Emily Laurence

21/01/2022.headline: Qantas accused of taking 'the nuclear option' with flight attendants' workplace agreements
21/01/2022.description: Qantas is being accused of "taking advantage" of the pandemic to "blow up" workplace agreements with international flight attendants.
21/01/2022.author: Emilia Terzon

21/01/2022.headline: 'Hit with a sledgehammer': Glory and Wildcats among WA sports teams caught up in border delay
21/01/2022.description: West Australian sports teams are left scrambling following the announcement that the state's planned reopening on February 5 will not go ahead.
21/01/2022.author: Tom Wildie

21/01/2022.headline: After three days of COVID, Morgan's only symptom was fatigue. Four weeks later, he's still feeling it
21/01/2022.description: US researchers are finding patients with mild COVID-19 are developing long COVID, and they suggest "pushing through" the illness — even if it's mild — could be part of the problem.
21/01/2022.author: Michael Slezak

21/01/2022.headline: Qantas isn't making booster shots mandatory for workers, but some states are doing this for them
21/01/2022.description: One of Australia's biggest employers has told its 22,000 workers that – for now – it isn't making it compulsory for them to get a COVID booster shot.
21/01/2022.author: Emilia Terzon

21/01/2022.headline: Government urged to set harsher rules to protect children from 'Wild West' gambling ads
21/01/2022.description: Daryl Watson was cooking dinner at his Adelaide Hills home when he heard a strange sound coming from his son's iPad: It was an advertisement promoting an adult gambling game.
21/01/2022.author: Emilia Terzon

21/01/2022.headline: Celebrating the Local Heroes for the Australian of the Year awards 2022
21/01/2022.description: They volunteer, start social enterprises, work with those in need and create supportive connections across Australia. Meet the nominees for the Australian of the Year Local Hero category.
21/01/2022.author: Carol Rääbus

21/01/2022.headline: High rollers, billionaires and mysterious VIP rooms: Why Beijing punished its 'good kid' Macau
21/01/2022.description: For decades, Macau has pledged its loyalty to Beijing in exchange for a longer leash and a steady influx of cashed-up gamblers. But the dramatic arrest of a high-flying casino owner leaves many wondering what lies in this port city's future.
21/01/2022.author: Wing Kuang

21/01/2022.headline: Red jellyfish swarm Melbourne's beaches in 'unbelievable' numbers
21/01/2022.description: Experts say higher than normal rainfall could be the reason behind the proliferation of lion's mane jellyfish in Port Phillip Bay this summer.
21/01/2022.author: Matilda Marozzi

21/01/2022.headline: 'We really should hang out more': Why is it so hard to make new friends as adults?
21/01/2022.description: Loneliness is harmful to our health and as the COVID-19 pandemic rages on, increasingly common. So how can we get better at making new friends, asks Anastasia Hronis.
21/01/2022.author: Matilda Marozzi

21/01/2022.headline: How the ash cloud from Tonga’s volcano blast smashed through Earth’s weather ceiling
21/01/2022.description: As disaster response teams work to deliver aid, scientists are also scrambling to piece together an unprecedented cascade of events that led to and followed an enormous volcanic eruption in Tonga.
21/01/2022.author: Mark Doman, Alex Palmer, and Katia Shatoba

21/01/2022.headline: Given the option of getting a pig heart or death, this man chose life. But the ethics are complicated
21/01/2022.description: There are loads of ethical questions around the practice of transplanting organs and tissues between species, a technique called xenotransplantation. So what are they, and how it is regulated in Australia?
21/01/2022.author: Belinda Smith

21/01/2022.headline: NSW may have hit its Omicron peak — and that's good news for other states
21/01/2022.description: The evidence is firming up that at least one state — New South Wales — has reached its hospitalisation peak for this wave of the pandemic.
21/01/2022.author: Casey Briggs

21/01/2022.headline: The COVID finishing line has moved on us all again — and that's a problem for Morrison
21/01/2022.description: It would be completely unfair to blame our political leaders for a pandemic that is challenging everyone. It might occasionally help, though, if there was a little bit more honesty and humility on show, writes Laura Tingle.
21/01/2022.author: Laura Tingle

21/01/2022.headline: 'Critical moment': US and Russian diplomats meet for Ukraine crisis talks
21/01/2022.description: The United States and Russia seek to lower the temperature in a heated stand-off over Ukraine, even as they say no breakthrough is imminent in the crisis that has raised fears of a possible Russian invasion.
21/01/2022.author: Laura Tingle

21/01/2022.headline: Nadal repels Khachanov to reach last 16 in Melbourne
21/01/2022.description: Rafael Nadal drops his first set at this year's Australian Open, but still powers through to the fourth round after defeating 28th seed Karen Khachanov on Rod Laver Arena.
21/01/2022.author: Laura Tingle

21/01/2022.headline: Heaven will be 'ringing with rock': Stars remember Meat Loaf following singer's death
21/01/2022.description: Celebrities take to social media to remember music legend Meat Loaf, the flamboyant rock star whose career spanned six decades and sold more than 100 million albums worldwide.
21/01/2022.author: Laura Tingle

21/01/2022.headline: Osaka exits Australian Open in shock loss, Barty through to fourth round
21/01/2022.description: Ash Barty will face Amanda Anisimova in the last 16 after the unseeded American ended Naomi Osaka's Australian Open title defence in a gripping three-set contest.
21/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

21/01/2022.headline: Berrettini prevails against Spanish teenager Alcaraz in five-set tussle
21/01/2022.description: After more than four hours on court, seventh seed Matteo Berrettini edges past 18-year-old Carlos Alcaraz in a nailbiting encounter to reach the last 16.
21/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

21/01/2022.headline: Tongan recounts spending 27 hours at sea after being swept out by tsunami
21/01/2022.description: A 57-year-old Tongan man says he survived 27 hours at sea after being swept into the ocean when last Saturday's tsunami struck his island.
21/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

21/01/2022.headline: Magpies score tight AFLW win over plucky Cats
21/01/2022.description: Collingwood remains unbeaten to start the AFLW season, scoring a hard-fought 35-24 win over Geelong to kick off round three.
21/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

21/01/2022.headline: Rock superstar Meat Loaf dies aged 74
21/01/2022.description: Meat Loaf, the rock superstar loved by millions for his Bat Out of Hell album and for such theatrical, dark-hearted anthems as Paradise by the Dashboard Light and Two Out of Three Ain't Bad, has died aged 74.
21/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

21/01/2022.headline: School will soon resume in the NT. First, parents and students must learn new COVID rules
21/01/2022.description: The Northern Territory government has introduced a suite of new COVID-19 rules that will apply to public schools across the Territory from term one. Here's what you need to know.
21/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

21/01/2022.headline: With WA's reopening shelved indefinitely, there is both relief and resentment from WA businesses
21/01/2022.description: After two years of travel restrictions, there is significant anger among some businesses that WA's borders will remain shut indefinitely, but others welcome the move to limit the spread of COVID-19.
21/01/2022.author: Gian De Poloni, James Carmody, Madison Snow, and Verity Gorman

22/01/2022.headline: Police hopeful of finding missing man after boat capsizes in Sydney as his dog is found alive in a cave
22/01/2022.description: A large-scale land and air search continues to locate a 49-year-old man after a boat capsized overnight in Sydney's north harbour as his dog and another man are found alive.
22/01/2022.author: Mollie Gorman

22/01/2022.headline: Perth smashes heat record, notching up five consecutive days over 40C, with another scorcher forecast for Sunday
22/01/2022.description: Perth records a record five consecutive days of temperatures over 40 degrees Celsius, with little relief in sight until Monday.
22/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

22/01/2022.headline: Democracy campaigner with ties to Australia sentenced to death in Myanmar
22/01/2022.description: Two prominent pro-democracy figures in Myanmar, one of whom has links to Australia, are sentenced to death by the ruling military junta, renewing fears for detained Australian citizen Sean Turnell.
22/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

22/01/2022.headline: Community spirit on tap as tiny town saves local pub with $1m purchase
22/01/2022.description: Faced with the sobering prospect of losing their beloved watering hole, the people of Grong Grong banded together and bought it themselves.
22/01/2022.author: Emily Doak

22/01/2022.headline: The bowls club looks more like the local pool as SA town hit with 160mm of rain
22/01/2022.description: Parts of regional South Australia have again been inundated with torrential downpours, turning tracks into waterways and completely submerging the green of one local bowls club.
22/01/2022.author: Emily Doak

22/01/2022.headline: Drinking water the priority in Tonga after volcano, tsunami with Australian naval ship on the way
22/01/2022.description: Minister for International Development Zed Seselja says Tongan officials and defence personnel are doing an "extraordinary job" in aid and clean-up efforts.
22/01/2022.author: Emily Doak

22/01/2022.headline: Wildcard Inglis's inspiring Australian Open run comes to an end
22/01/2022.description: Australia's Maddison Inglis shows plenty of fight but can't get past Estonian veteran Kaia Kanepi, who wins their third-round match in three sets.
22/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

22/01/2022.headline: Matildas' defeat of Indonesia a reminder that football's lessons aren't always meant for us
22/01/2022.description: Sam Kerr and the Matildas both re-wrote Australian football history on Friday, but their 18-0 thrashing of Indonesia is a reminder that sometimes, the lessons aren't always for us.
22/01/2022.author: Samantha Lewis

22/01/2022.headline: Rain, injury frustrate Aussies in second Women's Ashes T20
22/01/2022.description: The second Women's Ashes T20 international between Australia and England is washed out, while the hosts have another injury concern in Tayla Vlaeminick.
22/01/2022.author: Samantha Lewis

22/01/2022.headline: WA health authorities urge anyone with COVID symptoms to get tested and isolate, as state records seven cases
22/01/2022.description: Anyone in Perth, Peel or WA's South West with COVID symptoms is urged to get tested immediately and isolate until receiving a negative result as the state records seven new local cases.
22/01/2022.author: Abby Richards

22/01/2022.headline: Man dies after going missing at Kambah Rock Pool in Canberra's south
22/01/2022.description: ACT police confirm a man has been found dead after he was seen struggling in the water and disappeared while at Kambah Rock Pool, south of Canberra.
22/01/2022.author: Holly Tregenza

22/01/2022.headline: Zen Buddhist master who rubbed shoulders with Martin Luther King and Oprah dies at 95
22/01/2022.description: Revered Zen Buddhist monk Thich Nhat Hanh, who helped pioneer the concept of mindfulness in the West and socially engaged Buddhism in Asia, dies at 95.
22/01/2022.author: Holly Tregenza

22/01/2022.headline: Lockouts extended and new lockdowns introduced in remote NT communities
22/01/2022.description: A lockout has been extended in Alice Springs, and the remote communities of Amoonguna, Yuendumu and Yuelamu for a further seven days, NT Health Minister Natasha Fyles says.
22/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

22/01/2022.headline: Wall Street posts worst weeks since pandemic started as Netflix's woes deepen slide
22/01/2022.description: Wall Street's main indexes are sharply lower this week, with Netflix shares plunging after a weak earnings report.
22/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

22/01/2022.headline: Child killer Heidi Strbak hospitalised with critical injuries
22/01/2022.description: Strbak pleaded guilty to manslaughter over the 2009 death of her four-year-old son, Tyrell Cobb. The ABC understands she is now in a Gold Coast hospital following an incident early this morning.
22/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

22/01/2022.headline: AFLW live: Tigers play Dockers after Demons, Crows post wins
22/01/2022.description: Richmond faces Fremantle, while Melbourne and Adelaide enjoy convincing victories. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.
22/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

22/01/2022.headline: Shooting victim not intended target, just 'in the wrong place at the wrong time', WA Police believe
22/01/2022.description: A 47-year-old man who died after being shot in Landsdale was not the intended target and was not involved in any activities that would have led to him being murdered, WA Police believe.
22/01/2022.author: Abby Richards

22/01/2022.headline: Kyrgios makes locker room 'fight' claim after winning doubles match with Kokkinakis
22/01/2022.description: Nick Kyrgios claims he and his doubles partner Thanasi Kokkinakis were threatened with violence after beating the top seeds at the Australian Open.
22/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

22/01/2022.headline: Is the Kimberley about to host Australia's largest oil project?
22/01/2022.description: The stakes are high as an Australian company's proposal to frack onshore oil in the Kimberley is considered by Western Australia's environmental watchdog.
22/01/2022.author: Courtney Fowler

22/01/2022.headline: Brian Laundrie confessed to killing Gabby Petito in a notebook entry, FBI says
22/01/2022.description: The boyfriend of slain cross-country traveller Gabby Petito admitted killing her in a notebook discovered near his body in a Florida swamp, the FBI says.
22/01/2022.author: Courtney Fowler

22/01/2022.headline: COVID-19 peak 'could be a few days' away, CHO says, as Queensland records another 10 deaths
22/01/2022.description: Queensland records 10 new COVID-19 deaths and has 884 people in hospital being treated for symptoms, with international borders now open for fully vaccinated travellers to come to into the state without having to quarantine.
22/01/2022.author: Courtney Fowler

22/01/2022.headline: Dredgers spotted off Cambodian naval base where China is funding expansion, says US think tank
22/01/2022.description: Dredgers are spotted off Cambodia's Ream naval base, where China is funding construction work, with deeper port facilities necessary for the docking of larger military ships, a US think tank says.
22/01/2022.author: Courtney Fowler

22/01/2022.headline: Live: Into the pointy end of the Hottest 100 countdown
22/01/2022.description: It's that time of year again! The Hottest 100 is on triple j and we're bringing you all the latest as a perfect listening companion. Follow live.
22/01/2022.author: Jon Healy

22/01/2022.headline: South Australia records another three COVID deaths as case numbers drop significantly
22/01/2022.description: As the number of new COVID cases in SA drops to 2,193 — significantly less than yesterday's figure — businesses hampered by restrictions in Adelaide's CBD are being offered more support.
22/01/2022.author: Jon Healy

22/01/2022.headline: 'I'm not God': Naomi Osaka set to plummet to 84th in the rankings
22/01/2022.description: Naomi Osaka is maintaining a brave face after blowing two match points in a gut-wrenching Australian Open defeat that will send the former world number one spiralling down the rankings.
22/01/2022.author: Jon Healy

22/01/2022.headline: How attending a series of lockdown parties has Boris Johnson's career teetering
22/01/2022.description: Once the most-popular Tory Prime Minister since Margaret Thatcher, Boris Johnson is now facing a potential leadership spill. The next few days could determine his legacy.
22/01/2022.author: Jack Hawke

22/01/2022.headline: Widow claims millions in damages after husband and son drown in lagoon
22/01/2022.description: Jie Tan's 30-year-old husband and five-year-old son drowned at Airlie Beach Lagoon in 2018. Now she's suing the council and the lifeguard service contractor.
22/01/2022.author: Melissa Maddison

22/01/2022.headline: 'Whelan the Wrecker is here': The demolition firm that transformed Melbourne over a century
22/01/2022.description: Some of the city's oldest, and grandest, buildings were among thousands pulled down by one demolition firm that became so well known that its name became part of Melburnians' vocabulary.
22/01/2022.author: Sian Johnson

22/01/2022.headline: Peng Shuai's situation attracted global attention — but what about the others who 'disappear' in China?
22/01/2022.description: Advocacy organisations say thousands more critics and adversaries of China's government continue to be "disappeared" and deserve as much attention as champion tennis player Peng Shuai.
22/01/2022.author: Iris Zhao

22/01/2022.headline: From four men and a beach umbrella to thousands online — the evolution of Indigenous activism
22/01/2022.description: Fifty years ago, the Aboriginal Tent Embassy laid an anchor for decades of protests for Indigenous rights. The battle is now shifting online as First Nations people re-imagine protest and its impact on non-Indigenous Australians.
22/01/2022.author: Shahni Wellington, Kirstie Wellauer, and Bridget Brennan

22/01/2022.headline: They've spent their lives fighting for fairness and these super seniors are still changing the world
22/01/2022.description: The 2022 Senior Australian of the Year candidates all share a vision for equality, respect, honesty and responsibility. These are their remarkable stories.
22/01/2022.author: Conor Byrne

22/01/2022.headline: 'It's like a lockdown': Australian small businesses 'haemorraging' as Omicron spreads
22/01/2022.description: As Omicron spreads around the country, thousands of business like Adam Ellston's are being affected while some public health experts suggest more restrictions are necessary.
22/01/2022.author: Mary Lloyd

22/01/2022.headline: The Hollywood Con Queen lured hundreds into a bizarre scam. But the biggest twist was yet to come
22/01/2022.description: The strange and complicated scam stretched across multiple countries over seven years. But when police arrested the Hollywood Con Queen, her hundreds of victims were shocked.
22/01/2022.author: Anne Barker

22/01/2022.headline: Putin's 'Catherine the Great' move puts the world on notice
22/01/2022.description: Putting a massive build-up of troops on the Ukraine border with the threat of war is Moscow's clear challenge to the global order, writes Stan Grant.
22/01/2022.author: Stan Grant

22/01/2022.headline: The partner who didn't get sick: Why one half of a couple can be spared from COVID
22/01/2022.description: An effective pandemic response requires clear rules and thresholds that tell us how to judge COVID risk. But that doesn't mean the virus always follows the script.
22/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

22/01/2022.headline: Samoa and Kiribati go into lockdown after international arrivals bring COVID-19
22/01/2022.description: The countries enter lockdowns after having avoided the worst of the pandemic for two years.
22/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

22/01/2022.headline: Search for missing lab monkeys after truck carrying 100 primates crashes in the US
22/01/2022.description: Authorities search for at least three of the monkeys that appeared to have escaped after the truck that was carrying them crashed with a garbage truck in Pennsylvania.
22/01/2022.author: Maani Truu

22/01/2022.headline: Former Malaysian PM Mahathir Mohamad admitted to hospital for third time in a month
22/01/2022.description: Malaysia's longest-serving leader, who famously clashed with former prime minister Paul Keating in 1993, is resting in a cardiac care unit in Kuala Lumpur, his spokesperson announces.
22/01/2022.author: Jason Dasey

22/01/2022.headline: De Minaur safely secures first Australian Open fourth-round berth
22/01/2022.description: Alex de Minaur is still standing at Melbourne Park, with the 22-year-old the only Australian remaining in the men's draw after advancing to the last 16 at the season-opening major.
22/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

22/01/2022.headline: The Top 10 songs in triple j's Hottest 100 include The Wiggles, The Kid LAROI and Justin Bieber and Billie Eilish
22/01/2022.description: The Wiggles have made history by taking out the top spot in triple j's Hottest 100. Find out who made the Top 10.
22/01/2022.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

22/01/2022.headline: Scorchers into BBL final after defeating Sixers
22/01/2022.description: The Perth Scorchers are the first team into the 2021-22 BBL final after scoring a 49-run win over the Sydney Sixers at Docklands.
22/01/2022.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

22/01/2022.headline: Aussie O'Connell eliminated at Melbourne Park as Medvedev, Tsitsipas reach last 16
22/01/2022.description: Wildcard Chris O'Connell falls short of reaching the fourth round of the Australian Open, while tournament heavyweights Daniil Medvedev and Stefanos Tsitsipas make it through, but fifth seed Andrey Rublev crashes out.
22/01/2022.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

22/01/2022.headline: NT Police appeal for information about a 'suspicious' death near Uluru
22/01/2022.description: Northern Territory police say they are are investigating the death of a man in Central Australia.
22/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

23/01/2022.headline: Kyrgios, Kokkinakis continue dream doubles run at Australian Open
23/01/2022.description: Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis storm into the quarterfinals of the doubles draw in front of another raucous crowd at Melbourne Park.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

23/01/2022.headline: Shapovalov knocks Zverev out of Australian Open to book clash with Nadal
23/01/2022.description: World number three Alexander Zverev departs the tournament in an upset defeat, as Denis Shapovalov advances to face Rafael Nadal in the quarterfinals.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

23/01/2022.headline: Patrons and horses forced to flee race meeting after car park blaze
23/01/2022.description: No one is reported injured in the blaze, which has been brought under control by firefighters.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

23/01/2022.headline: Vlaeminck out of Ashes and WC with stress fracture
23/01/2022.description: Australia quick bowler Tayla Vlaeminck has suffered a stress fracture in her foot, ruling her out of the remainder of the Ashes and another World Cup.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

23/01/2022.headline: Five arrested after shots fired while cars 'chased each other' in peak-hour Adelaide traffic
23/01/2022.description: Four men and a woman will face court over a shooting spree in Adelaide's north, including in peak-hour traffic on a major road on Friday afternoon, with police seizing firearms including a gel blaster.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

23/01/2022.headline: Tennis Australia defends decision to confiscate 'Where is Peng Shuai?' T-shirt, banner at Australian Open
23/01/2022.description: Tennis Australia says Peng Shuai's safety is its "primary concern", despite police and Melbourne Park security confiscating a T-shirt and banner featuring messages in support of the Chinese tennis player.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

23/01/2022.headline: Three people charged after anti-vaccination rally in North Queensland
23/01/2022.description: An anti-vaccination protester has been charged with seriously assaulting a police officer, while two others have been charged with obstructing police, after a protest in Mackay.
23/01/2022.author: Tobi Loftus

23/01/2022.headline: 'This time the ocean was stronger': 75-year-old French solo Atlantic rower found dead
23/01/2022.description: French adventurer Jean-Jacques Savin, who had previously completed a trans-Atlantic voyage solo, is found dead at sea.
23/01/2022.author: Tobi Loftus

23/01/2022.headline: Omicron can't be 'eliminated' in WA, government concedes, as case numbers jump and COVID breach occurs at major hospital
23/01/2022.description: COVID case numbers jump in WA and the Health Minister concedes the plan of attack is now to suppress and manage the virus, not eliminate it.
23/01/2022.author: Keane Bourke

23/01/2022.headline: Keeping children at home is 'no longer an option'. Here's how Victoria plans to bring them back to schools
23/01/2022.description: Students and staff will be given free RATs to self-test as part of the government's four-week back-to-school strategy.
23/01/2022.author: Judd Boaz

23/01/2022.headline: NT COVID-19 hospitalisations drop to 61 as restrictions continue in several communities
23/01/2022.description: Lockdowns and lockouts remain in several communities across the Northern Territory.
23/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

23/01/2022.headline: Another washout as third Women's Ashes Twenty20 abandoned due to rain
23/01/2022.description: The third Twenty20 between Australia and England in the Women's Ashes series has been washed out by inclement weather.
23/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

23/01/2022.headline: Outback highways flooded and driver swept 80 metres into creek
23/01/2022.description: The weather bureau says parts of SA set new "all-time records" in terms of rainfall, while social media is awash with photos and videos of inundated highways.
23/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

23/01/2022.headline: NT Police arrest man, 18, over fatal stabbing near Uluru
23/01/2022.description: Northern Territory police arrest an 18-year-old man following a fatal stabbing near Uluru in Central Australia on Saturday.
23/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

23/01/2022.headline: New Zealand to impose tougher restrictions after Omicron community spread
23/01/2022.description: New Zealand will impose mask rules and limit gatherings from midnight tonight after nine cases of the COVID-19 Omicron variant were found spread across the North and South islands.
23/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

23/01/2022.headline: Channel Nine criticised for unequal broadcast plans for women's and men's ICC World Cups
23/01/2022.description: The Nine Network — whose broadcast deal with Cricket Australia ended in 2019 — is being criticised for putting popular Australian Women's cricket team games behind Kayo's paywall.
23/01/2022.author: Samantha Dick

23/01/2022.headline: Keys to face Krejčíková in Australian Open quarterfinals
23/01/2022.description: Unseeded Madison Keys — who has been ranked as high as number seven in the world — reaches the last eight in Melbourne for the first time in four years, with French Open champion Barbora Krejčíková her next opponent.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

23/01/2022.headline: Man's body pulled from Perth's Swan River after he disappeared while crabbing with family and friends
23/01/2022.description: A 70-year-old man dies while crabbing with family and friends in the Swan River near Point Walter Reserve on Saturday night.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

23/01/2022.headline: The Wiggles’ Hottest 100 winning track might never have happened
23/01/2022.description: If it was all up to Anthony Field, who wears the blue shirt, The Wiggles' Hottest 100 winning cover of Tame Impala's Elephant might never have happened.
23/01/2022.author: Nicholas McElroy

23/01/2022.headline: North cruise to 27-point AFLW win over GWS
23/01/2022.description: A dominant game from midfielder Ash Riddell helps North Melbourne cruise to a 27-point AFLW win over GWS.
23/01/2022.author: Nicholas McElroy

23/01/2022.headline: Perth Glory defeat struggling Sky Blues in A-League Men
23/01/2022.description: Continuing their West Australian exodus Perth Glory scored a 2-1 win over Sydney FC as the struggling Sky Blues lose more players to Socceroos.
23/01/2022.author: Nicholas McElroy

23/01/2022.headline: Skateboarding Olympians and Olympic hopefuls gather on the Gold Coast ahead of Paris 2024
23/01/2022.description: How the Tokyo Olympics has changed the future of skateboarding in Australia
23/01/2022.author: Heidi Sheehan

23/01/2022.headline: 'You've got to start somewhere': 11yo Eli's pine cone business just the start of his empire
23/01/2022.description: Eli Jones first thought of selling pine cones "like four years ago", as a then six-year-old. Last year he realised his dream and launched Mr Eli Pine Cone.
23/01/2022.author: Bec Whetham

23/01/2022.headline: Queensland to release its COVID plan for schools, but will it include RATs for kids?
23/01/2022.description: Two weeks before the school year starts, the Queensland government is expected to reveal how it plans to reduce the risk of COVID in classrooms. But will it include regular rapid antigen tests for kids?
23/01/2022.author: Emma Pollard

23/01/2022.headline: Live: NSW Now: Man charged with sexual touching of 7yo girl on regional train to Sydney
23/01/2022.description: MORNING BRIEFING: A Sydney man will face court today after he allegedly sexually touched a seven-year-old girl on a regional passenger train from Wagga Wagga to Sydney.
23/01/2022.author: Emma Pollard

23/01/2022.headline: China sends the largest number of fighter jets into Taiwan's air defence identification zone since October
23/01/2022.description: Thirty-four fighter jets, four electronic warfare aircraft and a single bomber fly into an area to the north-east of the Pratas Islands, according Taiwan's defence ministry.
23/01/2022.author: Emma Pollard

23/01/2022.headline: Nightclub fire claims 17 lives in Cameroon as country hosts football tournament
23/01/2022.description: A fire erupted at a popular nightclub in Yaounde, Cameroon's capital, setting off explosions and killing at least 17 people, according to government officials.
23/01/2022.author: Emma Pollard

23/01/2022.headline: Body found at property in Tasmania's north-west
23/01/2022.description: Police investigate a suspicious death at Sprent in Tasmania's north-west.
23/01/2022.author: Emma Pollard

23/01/2022.headline: Should Australia still have an honours system?
23/01/2022.description: The announcement of who gets an Australia Day Honour usually comes with a healthy dose of controversy. But that's nothing new, writes Karen Fox.
23/01/2022.author: Emma Pollard

23/01/2022.headline: We have an Australia Day meat shortage thanks to COVID-19, but it was entirely preventable
23/01/2022.description: Australia Day barbecues are under threat as Omicron infections continue to cripple meat-processing operations, but this was an entirely predictable crisis that employers and government should have seen it coming.
23/01/2022.author: Emma Pollard

23/01/2022.headline: The Victorian government announced its back-to-school plan. Here's how the state reacted
23/01/2022.description: Parents and teachers alike react with excitement to the government's push for kids to return to school, but the union warns the rollout will need to be closely watched.
23/01/2022.author: Emma Pollard

23/01/2022.headline: Nine months pregnant and fearing for her life, Sarah made a risky phone call. A week later, she was dead
23/01/2022.description: For years, allegations of domestic abuse on US military bases have been dealt with by the chain of command. A landmark agreement could change that, but some survivors and families say it's too little, too late.
23/01/2022.author: Joanna Robin

23/01/2022.headline: 'Amazingly strong and articulate': Sexual assault survivor on Grace Tame's legacy
23/01/2022.description: In Grace Tame's home town of Hobart, the Sexual Assault Support Service has seen "one of the biggest increases" in referrals.
23/01/2022.author: Selina Ross

23/01/2022.headline: Anime reimagining of Beauty and the Beast suggests that virtual reality can be a force for good
23/01/2022.description: In Belle, a virtual reality crammed with vibrant life is the playground for Oscar-nominated Japanese director Mamoru Hosoda to explore ideas about the role of technology in people's lives.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Goodsell

23/01/2022.headline: More than a 'transitory' dilemma: What will the RBA do with interest rates if inflation keeps climbing?
23/01/2022.description: The one word that kept interest rates at rock bottom during 2021 has already disappeared in 2022, and that's not great news if you have a big mortgage debt, writes Michael Janda.
23/01/2022.author: Michael Janda

23/01/2022.headline: Forced rapid testing and mask mandates: How US schools are handling Omicron
23/01/2022.description: The United States is now averaging more than 700,000 COVID-19 cases per day and schools are having to find new ways to stay open.
23/01/2022.author: Michael Janda

23/01/2022.headline: 'No chance you're sticking anything up my nose': Self tests an issue for parents ahead of return to school
23/01/2022.description: The reliance on rapid antigen tests (RATs) in the NSW government's back-to-school plan has parents concerned over their accessibility and reliability.
23/01/2022.author: Phoebe Bowden

23/01/2022.headline: China's 'zero tolerance' COVID strategy sees massive testing blitz ahead of Beijing Winter Olympics
23/01/2022.description: People in a Beijing district with some 2 million residents are ordered to undergo mass coronavirus testing following a series of infections as China tightens anti-disease controls ahead of the Winter Olympics.
23/01/2022.author: Phoebe Bowden

23/01/2022.headline: Rapid antigen tests free for concession card holders today, but pharmacies fear they won't have enough
23/01/2022.description: More than 6 million Australians will have access to free rapid antigen tests, but pharmacists fear widespread supply shortages mean they will struggle to meet demand.
23/01/2022.author: Matthew Doran

23/01/2022.headline: Alcott defeats great rival Vink to reach Australian Open semis
23/01/2022.description: Seven-time champion Dylan Alcott begins his farewell appearance at the Australian Open with a come-from-behind performance against Dutch rival Niels Vink.
23/01/2022.author: Matthew Doran

23/01/2022.headline: British MP claims she was fired from ministerial post due to her 'Muslimness'
23/01/2022.description: Deputy Prime Minister Dominic Raab says the claim from Conservative Party colleague Nusrat Ghani that she was sacked as an MP partly due to her Muslim faith should be investigated if a formal complaint is made.
23/01/2022.author: Matthew Doran

23/01/2022.headline: Francis Ngannou retains UFC heavyweight belt
23/01/2022.description: Francis Ngannou ekes out a unanimous decision over previously unbeaten Ciryl Gane to retain his UFC heavyweight title.
23/01/2022.author: Matthew Doran

23/01/2022.headline: Barty advances to last eight at Australian Open
23/01/2022.description: Ash Barty marched into the Australian Open quarterfinals for the fourth straight year after dispensing of American Amanda Anisimova in straight sets.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

23/01/2022.headline: Socceroos coach Arnold positive for COVID, will miss Vietnam qualifier
23/01/2022.description: Socceroos boss Graham Arnold is isolating after testing positive for COVID-19 and will miss the World Cup qualifier against Vietnam.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

23/01/2022.headline: Adelaide Strikers snatch Big Bash thriller over Sydney Thunder to move one step closer to final
23/01/2022.description: The Adelaide Strikers are one win away from a BBL final berth after a six-run win over the Sydney Thunder at the MCG.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony

23/01/2022.headline: Belgian Van Uytvanck tests positive for COVID-19 after Australian Open
23/01/2022.description: Belgian tennis player Alison Van Uytvanck says she tested positive for COVID-19 after playing at the Australian Open.
23/01/2022.author: Luke Pentony
